meaning_english: Identifies the specific reason for something when preceded by "no" forming a relative clause.

meaning_english: A stone, ring, etc. that has power to protect or defend a person or his possessions from dangers.

meaning_english: Beast, said to someone whose behavior is unpleasant or disgusting.

sample_english: I have been feeling always weak and slightly dizzy for a long time; I think I might be anemic.

meaning_english: Anise.

meaning_english: Medication to reduce pain, usually injected.

sample_english: Because of the anesthesia, I didn't feel any pain when I had the extraction done.

meaning_english: Superstitious belief or custom.

meaning_english: The action of being carried away by the flow of a liquid.

meaning_english: Patient enduring to the finish of something especially in a hard situation including being generous, kind and tolerant of others.

sample_english: Abraham waited very patiently and then he obtained what God had promised.

To be long in distance or time.

meaning_english: Identifies a specific grouping of things close to the hearer when preceded by "no".

meaning_english: What are those plural near speaker
What are those plural far.
What are these plural.
The paper wasp.

sample_english: There are a lot of paper wasps in my grandfather's garden.

meaning_english: What are those (far)?

meaning_english: What's that (close to hearer)?

meaning_english: A lizardfish.

meaning_english: The act of quickly withdrawing something from a container or pile.

Black people with curly kinky hair and small in stature from the Malay Peninsula:.

meaning_english: To be wrapped around something.

sample_english: The handle of the old woman's cane has a ribbon wrapped around it.

meaning_english: To wrap around something and squeeze such as the action of a python.
sample_bolinao: Bakeskesan nayan biklat a biktima na.
sample_english: The python squeezes its victims.

meaning_english: A split bamboo crate used for carrying animals to or from the market.
sample_bolinao: Mas madali' mangalsa nin beyek no nikwa sara sa baki.
sample_english: It is much easier to lift up the piglets when they have been put in a crate.

meaning_english: The act of sending someone on a task.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a baki' mon kai ko nagwa'.
sample_english: There are a lot of assignments you have given that I was not able to complete.

meaning_english: A herd of large animals.
sample_bolinao: Sa asyinda mi, main nin sayay bakid nin damulag.
sample_english: On our hacienda, there is a herd of carabao.

meaning_english: A man that dresses and acts as a woman, hermaphrodite, effeminate.
sample_bolinao: Si bakla', pirmi yan mako sa bali.
sample_english: The effeminate is always going to the house.

meaning_english: For an animal, especially a dog, and at times for things or a person, to be mottled with two to four colors, white, black, brown, or red.
sample_bolinao: Baklay yay sayay anak nan aso na ni Ben.
sample_english: One of the offspring of Ben's dog is multicolored.

meaning_english: Backless dress, vide baklas.
sample_bolinao: Si aysing ko, baklis ya.
sample_english: My clothing, it is backless.

meaning_english: An instrument used to remove bamboo peeling so that it will look shiny.
sample_bolinao: Iyasa' man maong abakrosmo pigaw madali' mamakros.
sample_english: Sharpen the instrument to peel the bamboo so that it is easy to do it.

meaning_english: To shave or scrape off the rough surface of bamboo so as to make it smooth and expose the shiny surface inside.
sample_bolinao: Say siir mi, sabtan sileng tabinakrusana kawayan.
sample_english: Our floor is very shiny since the bamboo isshaved.

meaning_english: The act of blazing a trail, usually with an action of cutting away.
sample_bolinao: Baksat sa makubpal nin didikot a dalan lumwa' sa kalsada.
sample_english: The path to get out to the highway is blazed through thick weeds.

meaning_english: To blaze a trail.

Bacteria: Typically one-celled microorganism, They cannot be seen by the naked eyes, but can only be seen with the aid of the microscope. Some bacterias caused diseases, but others are necessary for fermentation for making vinegar and yeast for bread and other fermented foods.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a baktirya sa basurawan.
sample_english: There are many bacteria in a garbage pit.

meaning_english: Bacteriologist - specialist in bacterias and their relations to medicine, industry and agriculture, bacterial life and phenomenon.
sample_bolinao: Makapaka'ngap a adalen nan baktiryulugo.
sample_english: It is interesting to note what abacteriologistis learning.

meaning_english: A vaccine or inoculation that is prepared as a preventative for a disease such as smallpox.
sample_bolinao: Matkap nin kumplitwen a bakuna ran abing.
sample_english: The vaccinations for a baby need to be completed.

meaning_english: To vaccinate or inoculate someone as a protection against diseases.
sample_bolinao: Matkap saran bakunawana a'nak nin kuntra burtong.
sample_english: The children must bevaccinatedagainst smallpox.

meaning_english: A species of a large dragonfly.
sample_bolinao: Lalaki sara tamo' a bakuraw.
sample_english: The bakuraw are only male.

meaning_english: The act of making a trench or ditch in the ground.
sample_bolinao: Bakwal a pangalap luta' no mamulapil.
sample_english: A trench is the way soil is gotten when making dikes.

meaning_english: For something to be larger than normal, especially the extremities.
sample_bolinao: Bana' sa bakway na, annunroy ku'dang na ni  Jose.
sample_english: Because of his larger than normal size, Jose's stride is long.

meaning_english: Wooden sandals, usually used during rainy season.
sample_bolinao: Iyusar mi tamo' a bakya' no tyimpon rapeg.
sample_english: We only use wooden sandals when it is rainy season.

meaning_english: To reciprocate an exchange of activities or do something responsively.
sample_bolinao: Bal'an nakon maglako' ta mangan ako yapo'.
sample_english: He will give me a break from selling since I will go to eat before resuming.

meaning_english: To respond emotively to something done.
sample_bolinao: Bal'enmay surat ko.
sample_english: Reply to my letter.

meaning_english: A projectile from a gun or slingshot.
sample_bolinao: Say palsot matkap abala.
sample_english: A gun needs abullet.

meaning_english: A knife which has a wider blade than abeneng, more like a meat clever.
sample_bolinao: Alaki yay bala'yang man'usaren ran mamater nin baboy.
sample_english: The meat clever they are using for cutting up pork is large.

meaning_english: To check out something to see if it works.
sample_bolinao: Balabalawen tamo' yapo' no umnoy magastos anggan mayadi' yan mag'adal.
sample_english: Just consider first of all what the expense will be to finish the studies.

meaning_english: Wriggle, twist, squirm along the length of the body.
sample_bolinao: Baladbalad yay iruplano sin nagket yan kanyon.
sample_english: The plane wobbled when it was hit by the cannon shell.

meaning_english: Two bamboo laid down to provide a walkway, usually across a fishpond.
sample_bolinao: Ma'get a bali nin magsen a tu'dek tan balagbag.
sample_english: A house that has strong support posts and beams is firm.

meaning_english: Singing competition.
Venus, the morning star.
sample_bolinao: Pirmi yan ma'kit a balais tepe' parbangon sa baytan langit.
sample_english: The morning star can always be seen before daybreak each morning in the eastern sky.

meaning_english: A plan or intention.
sample_bolinao: Kasan balak ko nin duka' kanya' andi' ka manginap.
sample_english: I have no bad intention and so don't you look for one.

meaning_english: To make a plan to do something.
The springing or snapping action of something such as a trigger of a snare.
The delay of an event.
sample_bolinao: Sa balam mo, abaw saraynay tawon nibwat.
sample_english: Because of your delay, there are a lot of people who have left.

meaning_english: Mullet, bigger than burasi. They are caught in Agno and Mabini river during the months of April, May and June and live in the deep seas when full-grown.
sample_bolinao: Main saray balanak sa abaw nin lugar iti sa Pilipinas.
sample_english: There are mullet fish in many places in the Philippines.

meaning_english: The net-like part of a coconut which covers the flower and young shoots at the top and later bursts to allow the coconut to descend.
sample_bolinao: Mamurot nin balanet ta iyusar nin ipamadalit.
sample_english: Pick up the coconut mesh for it will be used for kindling.

meaning_english: To carry something across the neck and over the shoulders.
sample_bolinao: Balanga naya ni tatay na si Ana.
sample_english: Her father carries Ana on his shoulders.

meaning_english: Carry someone on the shoulders, straddling the neck.
sample_bolinao: Balangawenkoyay anak ko.
sample_english: I carry my child on my shoulders.

meaning_english: Hips.
sample_bolinao: Masakit yayna a balangbang ko sa kakaida'.
sample_english: My hips really hurt from lying down.

meaning_english: A prostitute, a woman who gets money for immoral behavior.
sample_bolinao: Say sulot nan aritos ni Mercy, pulos nga'min balangkantis.
sample_english: The jewelry that Mercy is wearing is all fake costume jewelry.

meaning_english: May beetle which is black to dark green in color and comes out at the beginning of rainy season and feeds on leaves and is seen high in trees.
sample_bolinao: Gulpi a balangubang no bulan nin Hunyo.
sample_english: May beetles are abundant during the month of June.

meaning_english: A beetle that is black in color, has stiff wings and a tough body and destroys plants.
sample_bolinao: Nasida' a ungot mi ta kinnan ran balangubang ungot.
sample_english: Our coconut trees were destroyed because the coconut beetle ate on it.

meaning_english: A rebound of something hard off a hard surface.
sample_bolinao: Nasugat ya sa ulo a anak ta nagket yan balanra nan nibasyon kayo.
sample_english: The child was injured in the head since he was hit by the rebound of the wood that was thrown.

meaning_english: Balance.
A sudden whipping movement of a flexible long object such as an animal's tail, or the flick of a marble with the finger.
sample_bolinao: Si manalo sa ikap ket si sangkaday'an a balantik nan dyulin na.
sample_english: The one who will win in the game is the one whose flick of the marble is the farthest.

meaning_english: To flick a long, thin, flexible object hitting someone or triggering something.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma balantiken a ari mo ta bangli' nin magket a mata na.
sample_english: Don't flick things at your younger brother for his eyes might be hit.

meaning_english: An obstacle or problem that causes someone to stumble or trip on the way to some desired goal.
sample_bolinao: Matumba ka no kai mo ma'kit a balaod sa dalan.
sample_english: You will take a tumble if you don't look for stumbling blocks in the pathway.

meaning_english: A hole where big snakes dwell.
meaning_filipino: Lubak; malaking hukay sa lupa; bahay ng ahas.
sample_bolinao: Maidap kumadani sa balon ran ulay ta bangli' makayat raka.
sample_english: It is difficult to come clowe to a snake pit for it might be they would bite you.

meaning_english: Coarse, undrained and uncooked sea salt.
sample_bolinao: Mangwa' saran balara' saPacific Farm.
sample_english: They make sea salt at Pacific Farm.

meaning_english: The place of harvesting sea salt.
A single, unmarried woman.
sample_bolinao: Maganagana ya nin balasang si Carla.
sample_english: Carla is a beautiful young maiden.

meaning_english: A girl in her early teens, lass.
sample_bolinao: Balasitang yayna si Adeling sin iti ya sa ilimintarya ket mading'ey yayna nin mako sa hayskol.
sample_english: Adeling was already a teenager when she was in the elementary school and so she was embarrassed to go to high school.

meaning_english: Duplicity, without integrity, without character, without words of honor.
sample_bolinao: Balasubassara ket say bebey ra bara'mo nin mabang'et nin pantyon nin naabryan.
sample_english: The are dishonest and so their moth is like the smell of death of an open tomb.

meaning_english: A sea cucumber.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a mapurot ninbalatsa taaw nan Bolinao.
sample_english: There are manyseacucumbers that can be picked up from the Bolinao sea.

meaning_english: The act of carrying something heavy on the shoulder usually with a support across the shoulders.
sample_bolinao: Balatay naya ni Pablo a anron kawayan sin nakayat ya nin ulay sa dalan.
sample_english: Pablo was carrying long bamboo when he was bitten by a snake on the path.

meaning_english: To shoulder a responsibility, to bear a burden, blame, etc.
sample_bolinao: No mabyat yay awit, mabistan balatayen ya.
sample_english: When a load is heavy, it is good to carry it on the shoulder.

meaning_english: Money or things that are given away by a winning gambler as goodwill.
sample_bolinao: Abaw li' a balato nin ibi ko komo no manalo ako sa lumba' nin mutor no pista.
sample_english: I will give you a large share of my winnings if I win in the motor boat race during fiesta.

meaning_english: Mung beans, a vine in the legume family with yellow flowers and fuzzy brown pods of small, green seeds.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a balatong nin iluto' ko ta masiba' ya si Pedro.
sample_english: I cook a lot of mung beans since Pedro is a ravenous eater.

meaning_english: To share one's winnings at gambling.
sample_bolinao: Balatwanman tinalo mo.
sample_english: Shareyour winnings with him.

meaning_english: To make someone stumble.
Criticism of something.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a balaw a makasakit tan makasida' nin pikakalamo'.
sample_english: A lot of criticism hurts and destroys fellowship.

meaning_english: To load the bullets or slugs into a gun or slingshot.
sample_bolinao: Balawan ma pay palsot mo.
sample_english: Get your gun loaded.

meaning_english: To criticize or ridicule and express negative thoughts about another's faults, etc.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mobalawena kakapuyan nan sayay tawo.
sample_english: Do not ridicule the weaknesses of other people.

meaning_english: Hawk.
sample_bolinao: Kasabyan nin balawey, itaw a kami'nan sa tatalon.
sample_english: Commonly hawks have their habitat in the forest.

meaning_english: The act of hanging up or draping clothes and blankets out to dry.

sample_english: The blanket was not hung out correctly so it fell off.

meaning_english: A clothes line.
sample_bolinao: Mas madali' kumrang a pini'pian no sa balaybayan ibalaybay.
sample_english: The washing will dry much quicker if it is hung out on the clothesline.

meaning_english: To beat with a club.
sample_bolinao: Sinamsam ray seket na, binalba-balbal raya mi'sa linakwanan rayan mangkamati.
sample_english: They took by force his clothes, beat him then left him dying/on the verge of death.

meaning_english: A club, a stick that is used for hitting.
sample_bolinao: Alaki yay awit-awit nanbalbal.
sample_english: He is carrying a bigclub.

meaning_english: Beat below the head with a long object.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mabalbalena aso ko ta mati ya.
sample_english: Do notbeatmy dog for it might die.

meaning_english: Accumulated exhaustion over time resulting in difficulty of movement.
sample_bolinao: Bana' sa balda na, mabistay elek na.
sample_english: Because of his exhaustion, his sleep is sound.

meaning_english: Disabled, to have a physical disability, particularly one who is unable to walk because of an injury or illness.
sample_bolinao: Baldado saray nikiparada ta anro a linalako ra tan sabtan amot.
sample_english: Those who joined the parade were over fatigued because they walked a long distance and it was extremely hot.

meaning_english: To bring a crippling fatigue on something living.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mo baldawen tuloy a lalaman mo sa trabaho.
sample_english: Don't wear out your body with work.

meaning_english: A bucket or pail used to carry water or other objects.
sample_bolinao: No maryo' yay abing, sayay baldin ranom a mausar.
sample_english: When an infant is bathed, a pail of water is used.

meaning_english: Ceramic tile usually half-foot square for house flooring.
sample_bolinao: Mabistay kulor nan baldusa.
sample_english: The tiles are a nice color.

meaning_english: Heat rash, skin eruptions from heat.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya makapisaet ta main balet na sa lalaman.
sample_english: He can't be still since he has heat rash on his body.

meaning_english: Urinary tract.
sample_bolinao: Barado yay bali'bi' mo kanya' sabtan idap mon mumi'.
sample_english: Your urinary tract is clogged and so it is extremely difficult for you to urinate.

meaning_english: The volleyball game.
sample_bolinao: Kamas tamo' a walop ni Andro sa balibol.
sample_english: Andro's volleyball serve is wicked.

meaning_english: Valedictorian, the highest honor given to a student who obtained the highest grade among the graduates.
sample_bolinao: Maong yan nag'irgo abalidikturyan.
sample_english: Thevaledictorianis a good speaker.

meaning_english: The speech or address of the valedictorian, valedictory address or speech.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a panagbalidikturyo nan balidikturyan.
sample_english: The valedictorian has a goodvaledictoryaddress.

meaning_english: The act of making an utterance, or enunciating well so as to be clearly understood.
sample_bolinao: Say balikas ran ua'nak nin ampag'adal et mag'irgo ket maidap tarusan.
sample_english: The enunciation of children that are still learning to speak is hard to understand.

meaning_english: To be inside out or backwards.
sample_bolinao: Baliktad yan mangisulot nin seket na.
sample_english: His clothing was slipped on inside out.

meaning_english: To turn something inside out.
Molasses candy, a sugar cooked to a thicker consistency in a heavy syrup.
sample_bolinao: Say balikutsa ran ngiwan, miduman yan sa putipot tamo'.

meaning_english: The thing or disturbance which draws the attention away.

sample_english: Pedro had many distractions so he was not immediately able to answer the question.

meaning_english: A village in the southwestern part of Bolinao named after the Balingasay tree.
sample_bolinao: Say balingasay nin kayo nin tumubo' mag'in li' nin alalaki nin kayo.
sample_english: Thebalingasaytree grows to become a very large tree.

meaning_english: To distract one's attention from something.
sample_bolinao: Balingawenmay anak pigaw tumgen yan umakis.
sample_english: Get the child'sattentionso he will stop crying.

meaning_english: Having the neck physiologically twisted so the head is cocked.
sample_bolinao: Balinglingyan lumalako.
sample_english: His head iscockedwhile walking.

meaning_english: Heat rash.
sample_bolinao: Kada-kadaymen yay anak bana' ta abaw a balinsaynget na.
sample_english: The child feels itchy because he has a lot of prickly heat.

meaning_english: To come down with heat rash.
sample_bolinao: Balinsayngeten yay anak ko ta sabtay saynget na.
sample_english: My child came down with heat rash since his sweat was profuse.

meaning_english: One who attempts to deceive another person out of his rights.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma tepren ta duka' a gagara na,balinsuga'ya.
sample_english: Do not believe him for he has bad intentions, he's a deceiver.

meaning_english: To be deceived by another person's good words.
sample_bolinao: Binalinsugaraya ket tinumper ya kanya' abaw a nakalap ra kona.
sample_english: They deceived him and so he believed it and so they got much money from him.

meaning_english: Balintawak a style of native womens' dress which does not use baksa' but a neatly folded large kerchief instead over one shoulder.
sample_bolinao: Balintawaka usaren no dumukdok nin karinyusa.
sample_english: Balintawak is used in dancing the karinyusa.

meaning_english: For things or people to be tipped over or out of the proper position by an outside force.
sample_bolinao: Balintwag kan dinumpa' sa luta' sin nanabo' ka sa undayon.
sample_english: You landed upside down on the ground when you fell out of the hammock.

meaning_english: To reverse the current position of something by turning it over or exposing the hidden part.
sample_bolinao: Balintwagenma a punda ta ardabis ya.
sample_english: Turnthe pillowcaseoutside inbecause it's inside out.

meaning_english: A pointed stake that is driven into a base as a marker of something or a guide.
sample_bolinao: Sitin balisa a paka'kitan mo no pa'no ya kaalawang a luta' ko.
sample_english: This marker is your sign as to how wide my land is.

meaning_english: A switch blade knife with a flippable blade coming out from the handle.
sample_bolinao: Maiyawa' ana sawanin a miga'get ninbalisong.
sample_english: It is prohibited these days to possess a switch blade.

meaning_english: A large and strong growing vine like tree with hanging roots with fearful folkloric implications. If it coils around another tree it will kill it.
sample_bolinao: Makapali'mo a lumabas sa kayonbaliti'.
sample_english: It is fearful to pass by a ficustree.

meaning_english: Gold.
sample_bolinao: Balitok nin talinga a nibi na konan inado' na.
sample_english: It was a gold earring that he gave his fiancée.

meaning_english: To change in its basic appearance or essence.
sample_bolinao: Kurang a baliw nin bag'ong nin tirong kanya' nin masisibulot et.
sample_english: The fermenting change of the salted fingerlings is incomplete so they are still whole.

meaning_english: To be in mourning over the loss of someone.
sample_bolinao: Baliwansaray pamilya na ni miyor ta nati ya a tatay ra.
sample_english: The mayor's family is in mourning because their father died.

meaning_english: Ballet
sample_bolinao: Bula-bula'dongyay mampag'adal baliy; Bula-bula'dong yan mampagsirko.
sample_english: The girl learning ballet dance is somersaulting; He does flips in the circus performances.

meaning_english: To have a bulky, flabby body.
sample_bolinao: Balkakyay babayi.
sample_english: The woman isflabby.

meaning_english: Porch, veranda.
sample_bolinao: Say kasabyan balkon nin bali ket adap sa dalan.
sample_english: The common balcony of a house faces the road.

meaning_english: Large rhythmic rolling waves without whitecaps.
sample_bolinao: Makaulaw aballayonno iti ka sa baluto.
sample_english: Rollingwavesin the sea make one feel dizzy when you're in a boat.

meaning_english: A person whose spouse has died and has not remarried, widow or widower.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a balo nin kasan tingkapan.
sample_english: There are many widows who have no occupation.

meaning_english: Provisions of food or other things for a short trip or work.
sample_bolinao: Nisadya' naynay sarban awit nin nagsikabarang abalontan ikabyay na.
sample_english: He prepared all that he would carry of various food provisions and things needed to live.

meaning_english: The price or value of something.
sample_bolinao: Galaten moybalormo pigaw nin magprugriso a byay mo.
sample_english: Refrain fromspendinglavishly on others so that you will prosper in life.

meaning_english: A hard boiled duck embryo in its eggshell.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a maglako' nin balot no main nin bayli sa plasa.
sample_english: There are a lot of people selling boiled duck eggs when there is a dance in the plaza.

meaning_english: Spend extravagantly.
sample_bolinao: Sabtan baloy nan mangastos no babayi a kalamo' na.
sample_english: His extravagant spending for expenses is extreme if it is a woman he is with.

meaning_english: A bamboo gangplank or walkway to get on a boat that can also be used as a raft.
sample_bolinao: Adamen may balsa na ni Peter ta ruranan tayan mako manguden-kuden.
sample_english: Borrow Peter's raft for we will ride on it to collect sea urchins.

meaning_english: Embalmer.
The act of embalming.
sample_bolinao: Ipalamu'nan a balsamo nan nati no ma'teng ya et nin itabon.
sample_english: Additional embalming fluid is added to the dead if it is still a long time until burial.

meaning_english: To embalm a dead person.
sample_bolinao: Gindat kai sara balsamwen a nati kanya' nin madali' a lamay ra.
sample_english: Formerly they did not embalm the dead so their wake was quick.

meaning_english: Waltz, a slow beautiful dance in 3/4 time.
sample_bolinao: Say tanda' kon bayli ket balsi tamo'.
sample_english: The only dance that I know is the waltz.

meaning_english: Two-man canoe or boat.
sample_bolinao: Ipaltaw ran a'nak a balu-baluto ra sa layos.
sample_english: The children floated their toy boats on the flood waters.

meaning_english: A spongy, net-like brown seaweed growing on rocks on the sea bottom that is good for food and rich in iron.
sample_bolinao: Saybalubalulang, makalap sa baybay.
sample_english: Brownseaweed is gotten in the shore area.

meaning_english: A thin piece of wood or a piece of split bamboo used as a crossbar for windows, doors or gates.
sample_bolinao: Alalaki nin baluet sa giyt a inusar ran tutawo sin nu'nan panaon.
sample_english: In the early times people used a large crossbar latch on the gate.

meaning_english: To lock window, door or gate with bamboo, wooden or iron bar.
sample_bolinao: Sin nu'nan panaon kai ra matkap nin baluetan nin tutawo a sada' ra.
sample_english: In early times, people did not need to use bolts on their doors.

meaning_english: The hard, round, flat seed of thegu'go'vine whose pods are pounded out for shampoo and soap.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a makalap ninbalugosa tatalon.
sample_english: We can get a lot of box bean seeds in the forest.

meaning_english: The act of untangling and so releasing something.
sample_bolinao: Balukas a rimidyo konan natumban naikerker nin baka.
sample_english: The remedy for the tethered cow that toppled over is untangling it.

meaning_english: To be set free from bindings that cannot be tied.
sample_bolinao: Balukasan ma a kanding sa nikaikerker na sa didikot ta magawgaw yayna.
sample_english: Release the goat from his snags in the grass for he is being baked in the sun.

meaning_english: A coil of something such as wire, rope, etc. that is coiled into a stack or spool.
sample_bolinao: Anro a balukay nin rubir nan damulag ko.
sample_english: The coiledof rope for my carabao is long.

meaning_english: To coil something.
sample_bolinao: Balukayenmay alamri.
sample_english: Coilthe wire.

meaning_english: A large basket with an open weave used to transport various products.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka kibulang no say manok mo ket balulang ya.
sample_english: Don't go cock fighting if your chicken is a large speckled cock.

meaning_english: To take food, supplies, etc. to someone from the house.
sample_bolinao: Balunanma si angkay mon Carlos sa gagawa'.
sample_english: Take the food to your brother Carlos in the fields.

meaning_english: To take something such as food or clothing along when leaving so as not to need to return to the house.
sample_bolinao: Nangluto' yan adubo si Marlo nin balunen nan mako magtrabaho.
sample_english: Marlo cooked adobo as his lunch to take to work.

meaning_english: Ballot for voting.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma samaan a balutas mo.
sample_english: Do not get your ballot dirty.

meaning_english: An outrigger boat without motor, sailboat.
sample_bolinao: Nakakalap yan kuna' a eket nin nikatkat sa wanan nan baluto.

sample_english: He returned the money that he found to the owner with nothing removed.

sample_bolinao: No baw'asanmon walo ra a mapulo' nin mangga, main nin rwa ray mabati'.
sample_english: If you subtracteight mangoes from ten, there will be two left.

meaning_english: Forbidden, not allowed.
sample_bolinao: Saray main hayblad, bawal konra a matataba'.
sample_english: It is forbidden for those with high blood to be fat.

meaning_english: Garlic.
sample_bolinao: Matkap abawangno ginisa a iluto'.
sample_english: Garlicis needed when sauteing.

meaning_english: To spice something with garlic.
For a fragrance or taste to diminish in strength and not stimulate.
sample_bolinao: Bawbaw a mangyadi' sa arkuhol no kasan sakeb nan nangwan.
sample_english: Alcohol loses its strength when there is no cap on the container.

meaning_english: A vine whose root is soaked and the mixture is used primarily for stunning or killing fish.
sample_bolinao: Maulaw saray kuna' no usaren a bawet.
sample_english: The fish become disoriented when you use a poisonous root.

meaning_english: To use a mixture from soaked poisonous roots to stun and so capture sea creatures that live in holes or under rocks.
sample_bolinao: Baweten sara yapo' a kuna' pigaw mainum'ay saran dakpen.
sample_english: The fish were drugged first so that they were easy to capture.

meaning_english: The response to a wrong in order to get even.
sample_bolinao: Bawi' yaynan bawi' si Linda sa nibi na koni Sabel sin niaway sara.
sample_english: When they had quarreled, Linda kept taking back what she had given to Sabel.

meaning_english: To take back something.
sample_bolinao: Bawi'nenkoya pay nibi kon riport ta pabistawen koya.
sample_english: May Itake backthe report I submitted because I want to improve it.

meaning_english: To be deviating from the norm in a stressed manner, to bow.
sample_bolinao: Bawing yaynay pakaway nan baluto kanya' nin mali'mo saraynay pasahiro.
sample_english: The outriggers of the boat are bowing so the passengers are frightened.

meaning_english: To baptizing many people.
sample_bolinao: Kasan tegen ran mako nin tutawo kona ket binawti-bawtismwan nasara.
sample_english: Non stop the people were going to him and he was baptizing each of them.

meaning_english: Baptism, a ceremony of confirming a person to Christianity.
sample_bolinao: Matkap a andi' nin yaan-yaanen nin si'numan a bawtismo.
sample_english: It must be that no one would scorn baptism.

meaning_english: To baptize someone with something.
sample_bolinao: Ket sin nipatutuo ray kukasalanan ra, binawtismwan nasara sa Ilog Jordan.
sample_english: And so when they confessed their sins, he baptized them in the River Jordan.

meaning_english: A large sack woven from fan palm strips with handles used for keeping grain.
sample_bolinao: Mangusar kamin bay'ong ta kasa nin langgutsi.
sample_english: We will use a palm strip sack since there are no burlap sacks.

meaning_english: Glowing embers, burning charcoal.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mo nin ga'getan abaya.
sample_english: Do not grasp thehot embers.

meaning_english: Lungs, the breathing organ.

sample_english: The swelling of your wound is now large.

meaning_english: Support usually along a stair case or a bridge, hand rail.

sample_english: Hold tightly to thehandrail so you will not fall.

meaning_english: The payment given for something.
sample_bolinao: Si'no kadi' a pangalapan kon ilamo' sabayadpamaupira koni Gaya?
sample_english: From whom can I get the amount to augment the money to pay for Gaya's operation?

meaning_english: To various needed payments.

sample_english: You be the one to be responsible in paying for those that need to be paid for so that they could have their hair shaved as a sign that they have fulfilled their promises.

meaning_english: To pay for something.

sample_english: How much will I pay for the sugar and coffee?

meaning_english: To be drenched or covered with a liquid.

meaning_english: To drench something with a liquid so as to clean it.

sample_english: Splash water around the porch well so it will be clean.

meaning_english: Rocks that are orange to yellow in color and may be hard or soft.
An aquarium type of fish with many colors and triangular in shape. It lives in the rocky places in the ocean.
sample_bolinao: Mabista saran bantyan nin tumangoy a bayang ta abaw a kulor ra.
sample_english: Batfish are nice to watch when you're swimming because they have many colors.

meaning_english: The triangular end of a house under a roof down to the support beams.
sample_bolinao: Kulor kahil a bayangbayang nan bali ra.
sample_english: The end of the house under the roof is orange.

meaning_english: The strong impact such as strong coffee, a smell or medicine.

meaning_english: The Achilles heel tendon.
sample_bolinao: Nasugat ako sa bayater kanya' ako nin nangaruroy.
sample_english: I was wounded on my Achilles tendon so I cried out in sudden pain.

meaning_english: The poison from the fruit of the blinding eye tree found in mangroves that is pounded and mixed with bait to daze fish.
sample_bolinao: Usaren ran ipangalap kuna' a bayating.
sample_english: They use a blinding eye tree poison to catch fish.

meaning_english: To put poisonous branches of thebayatingtree in the water to stun the fish.
sample_bolinao: Bayatingen a ito' pigaw mainum'ay saran dakpen.
sample_english: The sea catfish are poisoned with a branch so that they are easily captured.

meaning_english: Brother-in-law, the brother or male cousin of one's spouse or the male spouse of one's sister or cousin.

sample_english: We love our brother-in-law for he is part of the family.

meaning_english: Guava.

sample_english: There are nowadays varieties of guavas that have bigger fruit.

meaning_english: The area of water next to the land or the shallow water before the reef.

meaning_english: A long thin scaly saltwater fish whose flesh is full of bones, Hawaiian ten-pounder.

sample_english: The Hawaiian tenpounder is full of bones so it is necessary to debone it well.

meaning_english: The rounded non-symmetrical seed of the box bean vine.
sample_bolinao: Bayekew a bikoy nin maluko kanya' nin kasan laman.
sample_english: The cashew seeds are stunted and so don't have any content.

meaning_english: A bamboo tube two nodes long with a rope handle used for a water container.
sample_bolinao: Intaw, bayengyeng a man'usaren ran manago' ranom.
sample_english: Back then they used a bamboo container to draw water.

meaning_english: Female.
sample_bolinao: ibuktot - Magkamain nin anak a saya bayi nin tawo o ayep sa rarem tyan.
sample_english: The wrapping of the rope was in the form of a spiral.

meaning_english: The act of making a spiral of something such as in a mosquito coil or a spring.

sample_english: The wrapping of the rope was in the form of a spiral.

meaning_english: To coil something.
sample_bolinao: Bayikedkeden yay rubir pigaw nin mairot a balukay na.
sample_english: The rope is to be coiled up so that its coils are tight.

meaning_english: A term of address for a grandmother or mother, aunt or female first cousin of one's parents or of respect to an older woman.
sample_bolinao: Si baying ko koni tatay  ko ket nimama' ya.
sample_english: My grandmother on my father's side chewed betel nut.

meaning_english: Twenty.
A knife that flips open to about twenty nine centimeter.

sample_english: The Principal confiscated the switchblade Budoy was carrying.

meaning_english: A dance.
sample_bolinao: Nanganda' nin bayli ran a'nak.
sample_english: The children's dance was so beautiful.

meaning_english: A female professional dancer.
sample_bolinao: Si sayaybaylirina,matkap mapustura yan pirmi.

meaning_english: To perform a specific kind of dance.

sample_english: The children really like to dance the duck dance.

meaning_english: The act of pounding a food item such as unhusked rice to make it into clean rice.

sample_english: My pounding of food is stronger than your pounding.

sample_english: When we make our fish traps it is the small thick bamboo that we use so that it will be durable.

meaning_english: East, where the sun rises.

sample_english: It was carried to an islandeastofTres Hermanos.

sample_english: There will be a lot of whippings on the back that you will get if you don't speak the truth.

sample_english: I don't know why you slapped me on the back.

meaning_english: Bent or sagging from the force of weight.

sample_english: Shewas bentby the heavy load she was carrying.

meaning_english: To pound food with a pestle.

sample_english: Do not bind the mouth of the cow that is being used for threshing.

meaning_english: The effects of exposure to wind.

meaning_english: A consumable that will be borrowed to be paid back later as the same item such as rice for rice.

sample_english: Anything that isborrowedis to be replaced.

sample_english: Jesus was born inBethlehem.

meaning_english: The nativity scene, a group of figures representing the birth of Jesus usually including a stable, star, shepherds animals, and three Kings.

meaning_english: Any kind of a hanging screen over an opening or a part of the body intended to conceal or protect from something harsh, e.g., wind.

meaning_english: To block the view of something with a cloth or other screening item.

sample_english: The view through the glass of the window is blocked with a blanket.

meaning_english: Slow to respond to a request out of stubbornness or defiance.

sample_english: I am extremely angry that you are defiant about going on the errand.

meaning_english: Anything used to tie something shut, string, cord, elastic, thread, etc.

meaning_english: To tie or bind with some sort of a tie.

meaning_english: To be grumbling under one's breath.

meaning_english: Internal anger, grief or anxiety bringing a feeling of intense turmoil with perhaps a palpitating heart and ill-feeling.

meaning_english: Sorrow.

meaning_english: Beryl, a transparent pale green, blue, or yellow gemstone.

meaning_english: A birthday.

meaning_english: Piglet, newly born pigs.

meaning_english: An animal or person that is stunted and not growing.

meaning_english: Poke the eye with a pointed object.

meaning_english: An interest or stake in something.

sample_english: And before he was taken up to heaven, he repeatedly instructed his chosen apostles through the help of the Spirit of God, concerning what they were to continue to do and to teach.

meaning_english: Advice, counsel or instructions given by a person in authority, either living or dead.

meaning_english: To instruct or advise someone about something.

meaning_english: A dessert made of cooked sweet or regular rice or sweet potato with brown sugar and coconut milk that is baked with heat both above and below.

meaning_english: Bibliography, the history, identification or discription of writings or publications.
Carry something gently in the arms or on the forearm.

meaning_english: The main character in a story, hero.

meaning_english: The name of a female person.

meaning_english: Make with split bamboo.

meaning_english: The concrete wall of a house upon which the protective board that supports the girders are placed.

meaning_english: Have a scar on any part of the body.
To do something brashly without considering what the other person is feeling or understanding.

sample_english: The young people repeatedly make decisions impulsively and so they are always making mistakes.

meaning_english: Vehicle, all kinds of land transportation that moves by means of wheels.

sample_english: We do not use our own vehicle when we go to Balingasay in order to not incur much expense.

meaning_english: A fine noodle.

meaning_english: A variety of bamboo that has a thick wall and a small hollow area inside which may be absent in some cases.

meaning_english: The act of hitting forcefully with the fist.

meaning_english: For the wind to buffet something.

sample_english: Don't clobber people; that's bad.

meaning_english: Strangulation.

meaning_english: For a python to crush a victim.

meaning_english: The pieces of bamboo or lumber that are tied together to form the frame of the roof, rafter.

meaning_english: To victimize someone.

meaning_english: A variety of rice used formerly.
Small seeds.
The action of repeatedly sticking out the tongue.

meaning_english: To repeatedly stick out the tongue as a means of insulting or shaming or quarreling with someone.

meaning_english: To calculate or count out something.

meaning_english: The cost of something related to its value.

meaning_english: To be impressed by or admire something.

meaning_english: A thin edge where two things come together that is sometimes sharp such as the edge of glass, wood, board, etc.

meaning_english: To have a well-defined edge on something.

meaning_english: Turning something from one side to another to examine closely., Has turned from one side to another to examine something carefully.

sample_bolinao: Rumuran ka sabosnin mamuntan Bolinao.
sample_english: You take thebus going to Bolinao.

meaning_english: Boss.
sample_bolinao: Say tawag ra koni Vic Sotto ket Bossing.
sample_english: What they call Vic Sotto is Bossing.

meaning_english: A lack of water in the body that can be felt in the throat.
sample_bolinao: Maaraman koy brang nin lalaman ko kanya' nin minom akon ranom.
sample_english: I am aware of the dryness of my body  so I will drink some water.

meaning_english: A brush.
sample_bolinao: Igna' may bras mi'sa ma ipunas sa pintawan mo.
sample_english: Dip the brush in and ten wipe it over what you are painting.

meaning_english: The upper arm and shoulder.
sample_bolinao: Mali'mo sara kongko no ma'kit ray braso ko.
sample_english: They are afraid of me when they see my upper arm.

meaning_english: Brown.
Diamonds.
sample_bolinao: Pirak, balitok, tanbrilyantis.
sample_english: Silver, gold, anddiamonds.

meaning_english: Weather Almanac, A book that includes information on the expected weather patterns and names that are good for that day based on important people or happenings in the past.
An award given for third place in a competition.
sample_bolinao: Kasabyan nin say kagaw'an sa bali mi, gawa' sa brunsi.
sample_english: In general the materials in our house are works of bronze.

meaning_english: A large paintbrush.
sample_bolinao: Si brutsa nin inusar ko sa kampusanto, silyan yayna ta ma'ran yayna.
sample_english: The brush I used at the cemetery will be changed since it is worn out.

meaning_english: To brush something with a paint brush or steel brush.
sample_bolinao: Brutsawen man pintawan a padil pigaw maringgas yan pastangen.
sample_english: Brush the paint on the wall so it will have a clean appearance.

meaning_english: To intentionally pour something into or onto something.
sample_bolinao: Subray bu'bo' nin gata' sa tukil nin binungey kanya' ya nin nilabwa'.
sample_english: Too much coconut milk was poured into the bamboo section for cooking bamboo rice and so it overflowed.

meaning_english: To pour something onto or into something with a purpose.
sample_bolinao: Bu'buan ran tinimplan siminto a ubot halublak no asintawen ra.
sample_english: They pour a mixture of cement into the holes of the hollow blocks when they lay them.

meaning_english: To pour something into a form making a solid.
sample_bolinao: Bu'buen ray pundasyon nin umnoy gradon bali pigaw nin magsen.
sample_english: They will pour the foundation of the multistory building so it will be strong.

meaning_english: To be spread open and visible.
sample_bolinao: Bu'kas a kurtina sa kwarto ko no yabi ta ma'mot.
sample_english: The curtain in my room is open at night since it is hot.

meaning_english: To open a non-physical thing such as one's thinking so as to expose it to something.
sample_bolinao: Bu'kasan moy nipa'lem mon batag.
sample_english: Bring the stored, ripened bananas out into the open.

meaning_english: The act of  leaning over a precipice.
sample_bolinao: Pakarisgwan nan makanitkit nin anak a bu'nek.
sample_english: That rambunctious child that is leaning over the precipice is taking a risk.

meaning_english: Ringworm.
sample_bolinao: Kasan bu'ni ko kanya' nin kumadani sara kongko.
sample_english: I don't have any ringworm so they can come close to me.

meaning_english: A food, made out of porridge mix in fresh water fish within two or three days,.
sample_bolinao: No maiprito abu'romataway nin kanen.
sample_english: Ifporridgewith fresh water fish is fried it is delicious.

meaning_english: Something to gorge on.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a buag no mako ka kipista.
sample_english: There are a lot of things to gorge on when you go to participate in a feast.

meaning_english: To gorge oneself on food.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mo nin buagen in say pangapunan tamo!
sample_english: Don't wolf down that supper of ours!

meaning_english: Alligator or crocodile.
sample_bolinao: Nginaranan rayan Lolong a sangkaalakyan nin buaya nin nadakep.
sample_english: The very largest crocodile that was caught they named Lolong.

meaning_english: A rocking chair.
sample_bolinao: Si buba'bo, para ya tamo' sa ua'nak.
sample_english: The rocking chair is only for children.

meaning_english: The bride's extended family.
sample_bolinao: Ugali' nin ma'ran a dawaten ran bubbayyan nin pasketan nayan nubyo a nubya no kasal ra.
sample_english: It was a former custom for the bride's family to request the bridegroom to provide the clothing for the bride on their wedding.

meaning_english: A weakness or feeling of something wrong with the body.
sample_bolinao: Say bublay, kasabyan rumate' sa tawo no matuntawo ana.
sample_english: Bodily weaknesses commonly come upon people when they are old.

meaning_english: A white ball of yeast, ginger and cooled boiled rice used to ferment rice wine.
sample_bolinao: Sayay bubod a ikwa ko sa tuloy gatang nin sina'pang.
sample_english: I put three condensed milk cans of boiled rice in one activator ball.

meaning_english: A well.
sample_bolinao: Babato a libed nan bubon.
sample_english: It is stony around the well.

meaning_english: The soft spot on the top of a baby's head.
sample_bolinao: Malumo ya et abubon-bubonno abing et, bale' no alaki yaynay anak, kasaynan makarapas sa tuktok na.
sample_english: Thetopof the head is still soft when he is still a baby, but when he is already a grown child it cannot be felt.

meaning_english: Roof area, the protective covering made of any material at the top part of a structure or vehicle.
sample_bolinao: Nasida' yay bubong ra sin bagyo.
sample_english: Their roof was destroyed during the storm.

meaning_english: The act of sprinkling particles on something using the fingers.
sample_bolinao: Kurang a bubor mo nin asukar sa insimada.
sample_english: Your sprinklings of sugar on the puff cake is lacking.

meaning_english: To ferment boiled rice by putting in the fermenting agent to continue the process of making rice wine.
sample_bolinao: Say ba'yon sa'pang nin byas ket paray'epen yapo' ba'yo nin bubudan.
sample_english: The freshly boiled rice is cooled off first before putting in the fermenting agent.

meaning_english: Young coconuts that are in the stage that is good for makingbukayo,when the husk is just about to darken and the meat is soft.
sample_bolinao: Mako ka mangalap nin ungot abubukayuen.
sample_english: Go and getcoconutsthat are ready to be made intobukayo'.

meaning_english: The galvanized tin that covers the peak of the roof, the intersection of the two slopes of the roof at the peak.
sample_bolinao: Matkap rayan bubungan nin uman a bali ran kabaraybay mi ta sinida' nayan bagyo.
sample_english: They had to reroof our neighbor's house because the typhoon destroyed it.

meaning_english: That which are to be piled up.
sample_bolinao: Dinepen moy sarbanbubungtunenta ibungton ko li'.
sample_english: Gather those that are to bepiledand I will pile them later on.

meaning_english: A breed of chicken with a double or clumped comb, of the same color as a parakeet but larger in size, Sicilian Buttercup chicken.
sample_bolinao: Matalag abubutoknin manok a main kuru-kuruna ra.
sample_english: There are few buttercupchickenswhich have crown-like combs.

meaning_english: Vaudeville, show, personal dancing show.
sample_bolinao: Kai sara miaysing husto amagbudabil.
sample_english: Thevaudevilledancers do not have a complete dress.

meaning_english: Denial, to not reveal something that is true.
sample_bolinao: Sangkainum'ayan nin gawa' nin pibula'-bula' a budi'.
sample_english: Denial is the easiest form of lying.

meaning_english: To do something secretly.
sample_bolinao: Kasa gapo nin nibarita' ko nin budian.
sample_english: There is nothing at all that I have said secretly.

meaning_english: Bodega, warehouse, storage place.
sample_bolinao: Gulpi akinumprako kanya' ika' ko sabudigatapigaw kai masida'.
sample_english: I bought a lot ofgoodsfor my store, and I'll put it in the bodega.

meaning_english: Warehouse caretaker, storage house caretaker.
sample_bolinao: Mapagpyawan yaybudigiro.
sample_english: Thewarehousecaretaker can be trusted.

meaning_english: Heel.
sample_bolinao: Nasurot yay bued ko kanya' nin kai ako makalalako.
sample_english: My heel was punctured so I cannot walk.

meaning_english: A head cold with runny nose, headache and loss of appetite.
sample_bolinao: Say buer, dumpa' sa sayay tawo abirno nin alaki ya.
sample_english: The cold lands on a person even though he is big.

meaning_english: To be affected by a head cold.
sample_bolinao: Bueren ya si Pedro kanya' kai ya sinumrep sa trabaho na.
sample_english: Pedro caught a cold and so he did not go into work.

meaning_english: Little or moderate in degree of intensity or amount.
sample_bolinao: Buga' yaynay rapeg.
sample_english: The rain is just light now.

meaning_english: Little by little.
sample_bolinao: Say suor sa man-gumurak a mangga ket buga'-buga' tan ambo' sa temben mismo pigaw kai makri'.
sample_english: The smoke for the flowering of mangoes is to be little by little and not at its very side so that it will not be dried out.

meaning_english: To just do the minimum to accomplish something.
A season of abundance.
sample_bolinao: Kai masabaan a kuna' no mi'sa no bugabog.
sample_english: In the season of plenty, sometimes the supply of fish can't be exhausted.

meaning_english: A white spot at the pupil of an eye.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' anan mabistay pangikit nan tawo no mainbugagewnin mata na.
sample_english: The eyesight ofaperson who has a white spot in the eye is not good.

meaning_english: Tattletale, cannot keep secret something about someone else.
sample_bolinao: Bugakya, kasan maibudi' na.
sample_english: He's atattletale, there's nothing he can keep secret.

meaning_english: To be loose and easily broken apart.
sample_bolinao: Madali' nin lumwa' a risik nin pasedsed bana' sa bugay nin luta'.
sample_english: The germinated seed that was sown can easily come out because the ground is loose.

meaning_english: The act of using strong blows with the fists by one or more people causing bruising and other damage.

sample_english: His pounding hurts so don't go near him.

meaning_english: To punch something hard with the fists.
sample_bolinao: Mali'mo ako no main nin ma'kit kon bugbugan.
sample_english: I am frightened when I see a fist fight.

meaning_english: To beat or box someone with the fist or foot on any part of the body with the intent of hurting.

sample_english: They would have beaten up the drunk but the police arrived.

meaning_english: Dancing to pop, disco, or rock music.
sample_bolinao: Rabay-rabay kwan bantyan magbaylin bugi si Ric.
sample_english: I really like to watch Ric boogie.

meaning_english: The lack of a recognized identity of a person, company, group, etc.
sample_bolinao: Si laking mi, mangalap yan anti-anting yupa' sa bugkalot.
sample_english: Our grandfather gets amulets by means of an unbaptized child that dies.

meaning_english: A boat paddle.
sample_bolinao: Nangusar yan bugsay si Idong ta na'pusan yan gasulina a mutor na.
sample_english: Idong used the boat paddle since the gasoline in his boat was used up.

meaning_english: The one and only that stands alone and is unique such as a tree in a wide field or a mountain on a plain.
sample_bolinao: Main nin bugtong nin bali sa butlay nin gagawa'.
sample_english: There is one lone house in the middle of the rice field.

meaning_english: A tax made by the government based on some value.
sample_bolinao: Makagwa' yan nagsikabarang nin pruyikto a gubirno mangibwat sabuisran tutawo.
sample_english: Thegovernment is able to do various projects from the taxes of the people.

meaning_english: To pay the tax for something.
sample_bolinao: Buisanmay luta' mo.
sample_english: Paythetaxon your land.

meaning_english: The opening of something that folds open.
sample_bolinao: Si buka' nan purta mas alawang ya dyan si dalanan.
sample_english: The opening of the door is much wider than the path.

meaning_english: Vocabulary, A stock of words used by a people, class or person, a list of words and their meanings.
sample_bolinao: Say pamamasa malamu'nan naybukabularyo.
sample_english: Reading will increase yourvocabulary.

meaning_english: Vocalization, power of vocal articulation when singing, shouting or blowing a musical instrument or blowing pipe.

sample_english: He has a bigvocalizationin speaking.

meaning_english: To open in a spreading motion such as a book, mouth, umbrella, flower or the ground when it dries.

meaning_english: Sorghum, a cereal grass with clustered seeds at the top of the plant.

sample_english: When there is no corn, they feed their chickens sorghum.

meaning_english: Vocal, the third member of the Provincial Board.
sample_bolinao: Si kapi'sa ko, kai ya nakaliwa' nin bukal ta kuripot ya.
sample_english: My cousin was not able to win the seat for the third member of the board since he was stingy in the campaign.

meaning_english: A bubbling upward flow of a liquid.
sample_bolinao: Bukalbukalyay subor ket maksaw a agos na.
sample_english: Thespringhas a rolling flow of water so its flow is strong.

meaning_english: Voice culture. To practice better way of singing.
sample_bolinao: Gimmista a busis na sin nag'adal yanbukalisasyon.
sample_english: His voice was improved after taking upvoice culture.

meaning_english: Extra activity in arts and trade, other than one's job, part time job. Moon lighting.

sample_english: As soon as I arrive home from the office I weave baskets for sale.

meaning_english: Avaricious, gluttonous.
sample_bolinao: Say gawa'bukatotpirmi a tanda' na.
sample_english: What he knows and does is to always take theadvantageof things.

meaning_english: To be a glutton.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka bukaw sa taba' no rabay mon umanro a byay mo.
sample_english: Don't be a glutton with fat if you want to lengthen your life.

meaning_english: A sticky coconut dessert made from scrapped young coconut and cooked with raw sugar and coconut milk.
sample_bolinao: No mangluto' ka nin bukayo', say duta ket buga' tamo'.
sample_english: When you cook the coconut dessert, the flame should be low.

meaning_english: To make adessertfromroasted sesame andgrated partially maturecoconut and cooking it with raw sugar.
sample_bolinao: Mangalawit kan ungot ta bukayuen ko li' no yabina.
sample_english: Go get coconuts down with the hooked pole for I will makeacoconut dessert later this afternoon.

meaning_english: Tooth decay or cavity.

sample_english: The wood weevils dig their houses down into wood.

meaning_english: For teeth to rot, get cavities and break easily.

sample_english: Bamboo will be rickety and break if it is infested with wood bores.

meaning_english: The eyeball.
sample_bolinao: Maliwa' a bukel-mata no nimuslo' a mata.
sample_english: The eyeball protrudes when the eye bulges.

meaning_english: To do something every morning.

sample_english: Each morning go to the seashore in order to heal your cough.

meaning_english: Morning.

sample_english: It is alreadymorningwhen Clara arrives home.

meaning_english: The characteristic of going back on what one says and so has no word of honor and cannot be trusted.

sample_english: He reneges on what he says so people do not believe him.

meaning_english: A knot in general.

meaning_english: To form a knot or a bulge in a rope like item.

sample_english: Knot the thread so the end will not slip through the needle.

meaning_english: Node, a joint where two parts come together such as on a stem or bamboo or bones.
sample_bolinao: Abaw abukonin kawayan.
sample_english: The bamboo has manynodes.

meaning_english: Alone and thus lonely.

sample_english: I will do it by myself.

meaning_english: A swelling on the body such as a tumor or abscess.

sample_english: The child has a bump on his forehead since he fell on his face.

meaning_english: The situation of a person whose shoulders slump because of a bent back, hunched.

sample_english: The old man ishunchedover.

meaning_english: The throat in general, the passage from the mouth to the stomach or lungs.

sample_english: Mythroathurts because I have a cold.

meaning_english: Boxer, fist fighter.
sample_bolinao: Saray buksingiro, makubpal a marukmok ra.
sample_english: Boxershave thick upper lips.

meaning_english: A non-commercial, small, short, fresh water shrimp with a large head found in rainy season.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a bukto sa matab'ang a ranom.
sample_english: There are a lot of shrimp in the fresh water.

meaning_english: An unborn child that is still in the womb.
sample_bolinao: Si buktot na ni Maricar, ikapiton anak nayayna.
sample_english: The child in Maricar is her seventh child.

meaning_english: To impregnate something.
sample_bolinao: Matkap a buktuten nayan baka ni Pedro a baka ko ta pinggat umabaw a baka ko.
sample_english: I need Pedro's bull to impregnate my cow so as to increase my cattle.

meaning_english: All alone, without any companion.
sample_bolinao: Bukod-bukodnan akulaw a mampangan ta mampa'lek sara et a kabbali na.
sample_english: The old woman is eatingalonebecause those in the house with her are still asleep.

meaning_english: To do something alone or to be alone with someone.
sample_bolinao: Mabista nobukudana trabaho pigaw ma'kit a mababa' mo.
sample_english: It's better if work is donealoneso your ability can be seen.

meaning_english: A disease of small boil like bumps on animals or humans, usually on a child and usually on the forehead.
sample_bolinao: Say lupis nin bungan atis, main bukul-bukol.
sample_english: The skin of the custard apple has many bumps.

meaning_english: Spinal column, a series of joint vertebrae forming the axial support of the skeleton.
sample_bolinao: Matiko' yay bukungurot na ta nablo' ya.
sample_english: Hisspinalcolumn is not straight because it was dislocated.

meaning_english: A squarish, boxlike, clear jellyfish that has long tentacles that can sting and can be dangerous to people causing vomiting, weakness and even death.
sample_bolinao: Malaney a bukya.
sample_english: The box jellyfish is soft and flexible.

meaning_english: To fracture a bone intentionally.
sample_bolinao: Binlo' koya.
sample_english: I broke his bone.

meaning_english: To not control something that can hurt someone.
sample_bolinao: Bul'isan main si beneng ta masugat ka.
sample_english: You with the bolo, put it down; you might get cut.

meaning_english: A drawing or raffle.
sample_bolinao: Maiyakay saran miikap nin bula a lumba-lumba'.
sample_english: Whales can be taught how to play with balls.

meaning_english: Small ball shaped foods such as meatballs or fish balls.
sample_bolinao: Gustu-gusto kon kanen abula-bulankarni.
sample_english: I like very much to eatmeat balls.

meaning_english: A lie or false statement.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a bula' na kanya' nin kai raya tepren.
sample_english: He's told a lot of lies, so they don't believe him.

meaning_english: A pack of lies, intensified lying.
sample_bolinao: Bula'-bula' kasabyan a kwinto ran nabok.
sample_english: Commonly the stories of a drunkard are a pack of lies.

meaning_english: The action of a thing being toppled over by a strong force such as a car going end over end and landing on its top in an accident.
sample_bolinao: Bula'dong na ni Pedro sin nanalo ya sa lumba'.
sample_english: Pedro did a somersault when he won the race.

meaning_english: To make something flip over or somersault.
To lie to someone so as to deceive them.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mosara nin bulaen a matua mo.
sample_english: Do not lie to your parents.

meaning_english: To be totally blind.
sample_bolinao: Si tanda' ko tamo' ket bulag akon gindat, bale' maka'kit akoyna sawanin.
sample_english: The only thing that I know is that I was formerly blind, but now I can see.

meaning_english: To totally blind something.
sample_bolinao: Magwa' yan bulagen nin abaw nin bulati na a sayay anak.
sample_english: Having a lot of worms could cause a child to be blind.

meaning_english: For the eyes to be gray which was thought to be related to blindness.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' yan Pilipino a tatay ni Krisha kanya' bulagew a mata na.
sample_english: The father of Krisha is not Filipino so her eyes are gray.

meaning_english: A pinworm, a small, white intestinal worm about the length of a staple and lives for the most part within the rectum.
sample_bolinao: Maglat nin tambar a bulagi nin tawo.
sample_english: Medicine can remove pinworms from people.

meaning_english: A toy top.
sample_bolinao: Patbeyen ma pay bulak mo, Andoy?
sample_english: Will you spin your top, my son?

meaning_english: Lazy, a man who does not work.
sample_bolinao: Bulakbol ya in a tawo kanya' kasan magagap mo kona.
sample_english: That person is lazy and so you will gain nothing from him.

meaning_english: Month, one of the twelve divisions of the calendar.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya nin ma'kita bulan sawanin a yabi ta delem!
sample_english: Themoon is not visible tonight for it is a last quarter moon!

meaning_english: A recurring small defect in the thought process, moonstruck.
sample_bolinao: Bulan-bulanen ya a busat ran buridek ni nanay ko.
sample_english: The youngest sibling of my mother has a monthly mental sickness.

meaning_english: A round-leaf fountain palm with plaited leaf lades. This is the Philippine national leaf.
sample_bolinao: Bulanday a sinara pigaw ikarapyaw no tyimpo nin rapeg pigaw kai malbet.
sample_english: Fountain palm leaves are woven in order to give protection when it is rainy season so one does not get wet.

meaning_english: A cockfight.
sample_bolinao: Say bulang sa Bolinao sawanin ket itaw ana sa bulangan sa Liwaliwa.
sample_english: Cockfighting these days in Bolinao is at the cockpit in Liwaliwa.

meaning_english: The place or building where cockfighting is held.
sample_bolinao: Tepe' Linggo, abaw saray tutawo sabulangan.
sample_english: Every Sunday there are many people in thecockpit arena.

meaning_english: For a fowl to attack another with the beak.
sample_bolinao: Mambulangennayan mabayanin biring a sayayTexasnin biring.
sample_english: The bold rooster is attacking a Texas cock.

meaning_english: A person who goes to gamble on a cock fight.
sample_bolinao: Abaw saraybulangiroiti sa Bolinao.
sample_english: There are manycockfighters here in Bolinao.

meaning_english: Nomadic, To have no definite place to stay.
sample_bolinao: Si tawo itaw komi, bulanti ya ta kasan bali na.
sample_english: The person there with us is nomadic since he does not have a house.

meaning_english: A worm, intestinal or earthworm.
sample_bolinao: Ba'yo kami nako nin namilwit, nangali kamin bulati para papan mi.
sample_english: Before we went fishing, we dug up earthworms for our bait.

meaning_english: To become infected with worms.
sample_bolinao: Awaan rasaran mangamal kuna' a a'nak ta bulatyen sara kano.
sample_english: They prohibit the children from from eating only fish for its said they will get worms.

meaning_english: Pubic hair.
sample_bolinao: Si mais nin kiri' anay bulbol a gaw'en nin bini' para imula.
sample_english: The seed of corn whose hairs are now dry is used for planting.

meaning_english: To have an eye that has no vision.
sample_bolinao: Si Pedro, bulding ya kanya' nin kai na ma'kit tuloy a dalan na.
sample_english: Pedro has one eye that is blind so he cannot see his way well.

meaning_english: To blind an eye of someone or thing.
sample_bolinao: Niriklamo ya si Carlos ta ginagara nan buldingen ya si Andres sin niaway sara.
sample_english: Carlos was sued since he intentionally partially blinded Andres when they were quarreling.

meaning_english: Bulky, stout and big.
sample_bolinao: Si Pedro si tawag ra kona ket buldog ta alaki ya.
sample_english: Peter, the name they call him by is bulldog since he is big.

meaning_english: Bulldozer, a tracked machine with a large shovel like blade on the front for pushing earth.
sample_bolinao: Si bulduser, mamatag yan dalan.
sample_english: The bulldozer flattens the road.

meaning_english: To have bulldozed something.
sample_bolinao: Pison a iyusar ra no kayadi' ran binulduser a luta'.
sample_english: A steam roller is what they use when they finish bulldozing the land.

meaning_english: A hand or bunch of fruit that grows in a cluster.

sample_english: The bunch of coconuts is still immature so don't get it yet.

meaning_english: To be bunched together.
sample_bolinao: Maluto' anay buley-buley nin lansunis.
sample_english: The bunches of lanzones are now ripe.

meaning_english: To be exposed usually in an indecent or embarrassing manner.

sample_english: When he goes to town, that he is carrying a gun is in plain sight.

meaning_english: To do something indecent in plain sight.
A very tall, straight and beautiful tree.
meaning_filipino: Puno kung saan kinuha ang pangalan ng Bolinao.
sample_bolinao: Kasaynan buli-bulinaw sawanin ta pinukan rayna.
sample_english: There are now no buli-bulinaw trees since they have now been chopped down.

meaning_english: Vulva, the opening to the vagina.
sample_bolinao: No nabaya' anay buli' ran baboy ket magwa' saraynan ipaasawa.
sample_english: If the pigs vulva is swollen they can be bred.

meaning_english: A sea anemone that is used for food and is normally attached to rocks and coal and are reddish in color under water and have longer tentacles thantumbu-tumbong.
sample_bolinao: Mataway a buli'rayat no igisa sa kamatis.
sample_english: The sea anemone is delicious when cooked with tomatoes.

meaning_english: To say or write something in the language of Bolinao.
sample_bolinao: Bulinawen ma ta maong yan Bolinao mataman no san'ili ya.
sample_english: Speak to him in the Bolinao language for he is good in speaking in Bolinao even if he is a foreigner.

meaning_english: A marble.
Small metal balls in bearings.
sample_bolinao: Matkap nin silyan a bulitas nan bisiklita ko.
sample_english: The ball bearings in my bicycle need to be changed.

meaning_english: Volcano.
sample_bolinao: No bulkan a tumrak ipugso nan iliwa' a baya, tupa' a ma'mot tan abunsyang.
sample_english: If a volcano bursts, it opens suddenly by exploding mud that is hot and full of ashes.

meaning_english: To curve or shape something like bamboo or wood.
sample_bolinao: Mamlok ako nin kawayan nin gaw'en babalataynan.
sample_english: I shaped the bamboo making a yoke.

meaning_english: An uncastrated goat, bull or carabao.

sample_english: This bull of mine is uncastrated so it is aggressive.

meaning_english: To malfunction, be useless.
sample_bolinao: Bulok a usaren ran mamakurba nin pasingkol nin pakaway.
sample_english: It is by heating that they make the curved supports for the outriggers.

meaning_english: To be in the mood and eager to do a certain thing.

sample_english: The wind was favorable for the boat so it moved fast.

meaning_english: A leaf or a portion of something similar to a leaf.
sample_bolinao: Mansumilyaw a bulong nintutanamanta kurang sa ranom o subo'.
sample_english: The leaves of plants are becoming pale because of the lack of water or watering.

meaning_english: To be unbound.
sample_bolinao: Bulos yay aso ko.
sample_english: My dog is out and around.

meaning_english: A ball point pen.
sample_bolinao: Adamen koya paybulpinmo.
sample_english: May I please borrow your ball pen.

meaning_english: A pocket.
sample_bolinao: Si bulsa ko, napno' yan kwarta.
sample_english: My pocket is full of money.

meaning_english: A piece of something flexible (e.g., rope, string, thread, wire, etc.) that has snapped or been severed.
sample_bolinao: Si bulsot nin balaybayan, pisuldungen ya ta pigaw nin mausar ya anaet.
sample_english: Join both ends of the severed clothesline so it will be usable again.

meaning_english: To sever, split or snap a flexible object such as elastic or chain.

sample_english: The child really likes to snap the elastic apart.

meaning_english: The voltage or electromotive force of electricity.

sample_english: The voltage of the electricity is strong.

meaning_english: A pack, bundle or piece of baggage that is a single unit of several things.

sample_english: How many bundles of camote do you have to ship?

meaning_english: To do something, especially buying and selling, in bulk or large quantities.
sample_bolinao: Bultuwan no manaliw kami nin batag ta mas mamuda dyan sa'sa-sa'sa.
sample_english: We buy bananas wholesale for it is much cheaper than piece by piece.

meaning_english: To pack in bundles.
sample_bolinao: Bultwenmoy awit mo.
sample_english: Packyour things.

meaning_english: A stud, a male goat, cow, carabao.
Something made up of many leaves.
Voluntary, to do something without being forced but from one's own will.

sample_english: He works voluntarily without anybody urging him on.

meaning_english: To be volunteering for something.

sample_english: The people that helped put out the fire were volunteering.

meaning_english: To set loose or free from containment into something.

sample_english: Releasethe dog so it can stretch its body.

meaning_english: The act of a portion of the hand being bent backwards out of position causing an injury.
sample_bolinao: Bulyad a nangibwatan nan bulo' ko sa tamudo'.
sample_english: My hand being bent backwards was what put my index finger out of joint.

meaning_english: A bomb or explosive rocket.

sample_english: May I borrow your bicyclepump?

meaning_english: A water spout that lifts water into the air by a swirling wind.

sample_english: During rainy season thetornadoesthat can be seen out at sea are strong.

meaning_english: To bomb something with explosives.

sample_english: Pump the deep well pump so water will come out.

meaning_english: Bombay, a city in western part of India.
meaning_filipino: Bombay; syudad sa parting kanluran ng India.
sample_bolinao: Saray taga India ngaranan nasaranBombay.
sample_english: The people from India are called Bombay.

meaning_english: Electric light bulb.
sample_bolinao: Maslag a bumbilya sa plasa.
sample_english: The light bulbs in the plaza are strong.

meaning_english: Fireman, one who fights fire.
sample_bolinao: Madali' saran rinmate' abumbirokanya' nin nasebseban ray puor sa bali.
sample_english: Thefiremenarrived quickly so they were able to put out the house fire.

meaning_english: Contusion on the head as a result of being hit.

sample_english: They medicated the lump on the child's head with garlic chives.

meaning_english: The betel palm.
sample_bolinao: Abaw abunga nanpapayas mi.
sample_english: Our papaya tree has plenty of fruit.

meaning_english: A variety of banana.
A grey mangrove tree that normally grows along the river banks and fishponds with small mango shaped fruit.
sample_bolinao: Mabista no abaw a bungalon sa rigrig nin tanggal.
sample_english: It is good if there are many grey mangrove trees along the edges of a fishpond.

meaning_english: An opening in a round hollow object such as in a pipe, cave or volcano.

sample_english: There are many bats at the mouth of the cave.

sample_english: Your cooking time was too short so the bamboo rice is raw.

sample_english: It must be purely sweet rice used in cooking in the bamboo tubes so it will be soft.

meaning_english: Bungalow.
sample_bolinao: Itaw ya mampiikap sa ba'yon bunggalo.
sample_english: It is there that he lives in the new bungalow.

meaning_english: To be knock-kneed usually with the butt sticking out.

sample_english: Emily is knock-kneed

meaning_english: To be harelipped or have a cleft palate.

sample_english: It is difficult to understand his speech since he has a harelip.

meaning_english: A type of sticky rice that has a round grain and an aroma when cooked..
A moldy smell of damp things in an enclosed area.

meaning_english: A pile of something that is in the shape of a mound.

sample_english: The mound of sand they got from the well they are digging is really big.

meaning_english: To pile up earth against something.

meaning_english: Bonnet.

meaning_english: To completely empty out something from a container.

sample_english: If its not needed anymore, that water in the bucket is to be thrown out.

meaning_english: Sluggish in doing something or slow moving.

sample_english: Petra is always late getting to work because she is sluggish.

meaning_english: Something thrown into a purchase as an extra bonus.

meaning_english: Bubbles that are on the surface of something such as may come out of the mouth or something that is boiling or suds from soap.

meaning_english: Kite.

sample_english: I'll fly mykitetomorrow.

meaning_english: Flower.

meaning_english: Coral.

meaning_english: To shell off or knock off something from a rooted base such as corn.

meaning_english: Grey mullet.

meaning_english: To erase, to rub out that which is written.

meaning_english: Embroiderer.
Embroidered.

meaning_english: Cabbage Palm, a palm that is used in making mats. The leaves have a long petiole terminating in a fan of numerous leaflets. Once they flower, they die.

sample_english: Commonly the cabbage palm grows along the edge of waterways.

meaning_english: The youngest sibling or offspring.

meaning_english: Mottled, spotted mixed colors, especially on chickens or shells.

meaning_english: Combined or spotted; mottled.
Naturally small in size, dwarf.

meaning_english: A secret that could ruin a reputation.

meaning_english: Fire that has a strong, high flame.

meaning_english: Mold or mildew.

meaning_english: To become moldy.
Smallpox.

sample_english: Your smallpox will be exposed if you go to the market.

meaning_english: For flesh to rot and come to have a bad smell.
To be consumed by zeal to accomplish something.

meaning_english: To be done as a whole or in great number such as in the bursting open of a bag of grain.

meaning_english: The first planting after having cleared the land.

sample_english: The spurting of the water discarded from the drum was strong.

meaning_english: A shout with anger or joy at something.

sample_english: If there is sweetenedpoppedcereal, it's tasty to eat.

meaning_english: To be open in one's expression of things.

meaning_english: A bit or bridle used on a horse.

meaning_english: A harsh reference to the eyes.

sample_english: Your eyeballs are big.

meaning_english: Boiling producing bubbles and steam.

sample_english: The water is bubbling so you can now bathe.

meaning_english: Sibling.

meaning_english: For a cereal, such as rice, corn or sorghum, as specified, that has been puffed.

sample_english: I really like puffed corn.

meaning_english: Waterfall or the flow of a liquid over an edge.

meaning_english: To be cascading down from the top of something.

meaning_english: The act of pouring something that flows such as a liquid or wet cement out of a container.

meaning_english: In the midst of something not concrete such as the very core of one's feelings or condition.

sample_english: There in the middle of the ocean is where they fish.

meaning_english: Trumpet.

meaning_english: The quality of the tone of one's voice.

sample_english: The voice of the one teaching was strong.

meaning_english: To be turned inside out.

meaning_english: To turn something inside out such as a pocket.

sample_english: Edong's works at making his eyelids turn inside-out and so they become red.

meaning_english: To spill out.

sample_english: The plastic bag was not sturdy and so what he carried spilled out.

meaning_english: Tuna fish.

sample_english: It was a big tuna they got going out on the ocean.

meaning_english: The act of speaking out about or expressing something.

sample_english: The expression of hurt feelings can lighten the feelings.

meaning_english: The fullness or satisfaction from hunger.

meaning_english: Nails, shoe nails.

sample_english: In the former times we used shoe nails but now we don't.

meaning_english: To swim underwater and loosen a caught net.
The event of something spreading open.

sample_english: The beauty of a flower can be seen when it's opening is full.

meaning_english: To spread something open or fold it out.

sample_english: Openthe umbrella.

meaning_english: A bone.

sample_english: Lucing's hip bone was broken so she was taken to the hospital.

meaning_english: A lot of bones or bone material such as the shards from butchering.
Umbilical or Inguinal Hernia.
For the navel of a child to expand when he cries perhaps because of a previous infection or the umbilical cord being cut longer than it should have been.
Sofa, or rocking chair, easy chair, any chair that swings.
sample_bolinao: Itaw sa bali sa Arnedo, main butaka ni ari ko.

sample_english: I answered him saying, <Lord , I think they will believe for they well know that before I would enter and enter into the synagogues and arrest and arrest and persecute and persecute those who believe in you .
