sample_bolinao: Sawanin matalag anay dalayap ta abaw anay kalamansi.
sample_english: Nowadays limes are scarce for there are now many kalamansi.

meaning_english: The act of sucking in order to extract something such as the meat from a shell.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a dalepdep ko konan suso' bale' kai ya makalap a laman na.
sample_english: I made many slurps of the snail but did not get the meat.

meaning_english: To think deeply and seriously, trying to analyze something, To give it deep thought, to study the matter, concentrate, contemplate and come to an awareness of the matter.
sample_bolinao: Dalepdepen moyon pirmi nin kasan tegen a say maabig tan say manepeg a sukat nin marayo.
sample_english: Consider always without stopping that which is excellent and that which is proper to glory-over/be praise-worthy.

meaning_english: A prod to go at something aggressively.
sample_bolinao: Napal'isan nan buksingiro a dali nan kalaban kanya' nin kasan rira na.
sample_english: The boxer was able to avoid the onslaught of his opponent and so he had no injuries.

meaning_english: Punish, to be hit in several different ways.
To speed things up, hurry.
sample_bolinao: Pinasyan dali' nan maryo' ni Pedro.
sample_english: Pedro bathes extremely quickly.

meaning_english: To hasten the doing of something.
sample_bolinao: Dali'-dalien moy lumalako ta ma'mot ana.
sample_english: Speed up your walking for the sun is already hot.

meaning_english: The act of dropping by someplace on the way to someplace.
sample_bolinao: Bana' sa dalikdik ko sa iskilawan, nalakwanan akon bas.
sample_english: Because of my stopping by the school on the way, I was left behind by the bus.

meaning_english: A type of glutinous rice, it is soft when cooked and used in making specialty dishes, both sweet and savory.
sample_bolinao: Say byas mi, bara'mon daliket sa lumo.
sample_english: Our rice, it is like sticky rice in its softness.

meaning_english: The substance that is used to stick two things together, glue.
sample_bolinao: Ma'get a dalit nan swilas nan sapatos ko kanya' nin kai ya maglat.
sample_english: The glue for the sole of my shoes is tough so it does not come apart.

meaning_english: Pinning ceremony, during the wedding reception the newly weds dance and the sponsors, relatives and friends pin money on their clothes as their gift to them for starting their married life.
sample_bolinao: Pibayliwen saray nikasal no dalit-dalit no kasal ra.
sample_english: The couple that were married will be made to dance when the pinning ceremony is when they are married.

meaning_english: To glue something onto something.
sample_bolinao: Dalitan yan burak-burak nin papil a ringring pigaw gumista ya.
sample_english: Flowered paper is glued onto the wall in order to make it beautiful.

meaning_english: To glue things together.
sample_bolinao: Mandalitenkoyay yawong.
sample_english: I amgluingthe bowl together.

meaning_english: For hair to have waves in it.
sample_bolinao: Rabay-rabay nan kiten nin anak a dalu-daluyon sa ranom sa batya.
sample_english: The child really likes to watch the ripples of water in the basin.

meaning_english: The palm of the hand.
sample_bolinao: Maimpis a dalukap nan balasang.
sample_english: The young ladies palms are thin.

meaning_english: For the condition of something to be slippery.
sample_bolinao: Palna-palna' ka ta sabtan dalunot sali' mikundaros ka.
sample_english: Walk slowly; the floor is slippery and you might slide.

meaning_english: Ponyfish, a small slimy-bodied silvery colored fish without scales.
sample_bolinao: No bagyo abaw a makalap nindalunutanta rumigrig sara.
sample_english: When it's stormy weather many ponyfish are caught because they come to the shore.

meaning_english: For something that should be orderly to be scattered over an area.
sample_bolinao: Linakwanan ray daluog nin nanganan ran malago'.
sample_english: The youngsters left the food they were eating scattered around.

meaning_english: Wily slipmouth fish.
sample_bolinao: Matalag anan main lako' nin dalupani' sa palingki.
sample_english: It is rare now that there are wily slipmouth sold in the market.

meaning_english: A small thin shiny yellowish-white fish that is thin and roundish and without scales.
sample_bolinao: Say makalap ko no mako ako manyo' nin kuna', dalupitpit.
sample_english: What I catch when I go spotlight fishing is ponyfish.

meaning_english: The gentle rhythmic waves of the sea.
sample_bolinao: Alalaki a daluyon ta main nin bagyo.
sample_english: The waves are big when there is a storm.

meaning_english: The slipperiness of something.
sample_bolinao: Main kai marabay mangna' pising nin saluyot bana' sa daluyudoy.
sample_english: There are those that like to eat the vegetable okra because of its slipperiness.

meaning_english: To act in an extremely violent manner, usually involving beating someone or thing.
sample_bolinao: Dalyen rayan pirmi si Pedro nin angkay na ta matib'ey a ulo na.
sample_english: Pedro's older siblings are always beating him since he is hard headed.

meaning_english: A game using rocks or coins on a board similar to chess or checkers. Also the playing board and pieces fordama.
sample_bolinao: Miikap kamin dama no kuntis ana.
sample_english: When there is a contest we play native checkers.

meaning_english: Hopscotch.
sample_bolinao: Dama-dama tamo' a ikap mi sin kasa et silpon.
sample_english: We just played hopscotch when there were as yet no cellphones.

meaning_english: A sweetheart, either boy or girl.
sample_bolinao: Bana' sa damag na niDennis, napauryan nay pag'aadal na.
sample_english: Because of Dennis' infatuation, he neglected his studies.

meaning_english: To understand and share the feelings of another.
sample_bolinao: Saray tutawon mangkabyatan sa mandalanan ran idap, matkap ray damay.
sample_english: The people that are being weighted down going through difficulties need someone to empathize with them.

meaning_english: An enticement, something that convince on to do something.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw adambakongko.
sample_english: Theattractionfor me is very strong.

meaning_english: In the vicinity around a certain place.
sample_bolinao: Nakaka'lek saraynay tawodtaw sa dalan, itawdamirkonri Esar.
sample_english: The people beside the road near Esar's place were asleep.

meaning_english: Short nose with the nostrils exposed.
sample_bolinao: Dampak nin maimpis yay bibingka' tapong.
sample_english: The rice flour dessert has a thin flat shape.

meaning_english: Shoreline purslane, a plant that grows in damp or swampy areas and is rich in protein and minerals.
sample_bolinao: Mako kamin mangalap nin dampalit ta ipanaang mi.
sample_english: We go to collect shoreline purslane since we use it to make sinigang.

meaning_english: Lopsided or unbalanced or out of normal proportion, thick on one side but thin on the other.
sample_bolinao: Dampig ya sa gurot a ulo nan anak.
sample_english: The head of the child is flat on the back.

meaning_english: Sapanwood, false sandalwood.
sample_bolinao: Say usaren ni tatay, dampol no mangulor yan taba'.
sample_english: What my father used if he was coloring a board was false sandalwood.

meaning_english: Carabao, water buffalo.
sample_bolinao: Mamparyo' yaydamulag sa luong.
sample_english: Thecarabaois bathing in the wallow.

meaning_english: Things that are scattered everywhere.
sample_bolinao: Unon damuyak moyon nangibu'bo' kamuti sa luta' kanya' nin idap min maninep.
sample_english: The camote you have dumped out is scattered all over the ground and so it is difficult for us to gather them up.

meaning_english: Mispronounce something.
sample_bolinao: Kai ko natarusan a wana ta dan'et yan mag'irgo.
sample_english: I could not understand what he said for he speaks brokenly.

meaning_english: For something to nearly happen or to be about to happen but not have yet happened.
sample_bolinao: Dandaniya nin nanabo' sa bubon a anak.
sample_english: The childnearlyfell into the well.

meaning_english: A bruise on fruit,vegetables that results in spoilage or a person's bodyfrom rough or violent handling.
sample_bolinao: Kai ra rabay nin saliwen a mangga nin main daner.
sample_english: They don't like to buy mangoes that have a bruise.

meaning_english: Unit of measure from tip of thumb to tip of middle finger stretched.
sample_bolinao: Limandangana kaalawangan nan apay.
sample_english: The mat is fivefingerstretches wide.

meaning_english: To measure using thumb to middle finger spread.
sample_bolinao: Danganenmay apay.
sample_english: Measurethe mat using afinger-stretch.

meaning_english: Respect.
sample_bolinao: Ibi mo pirmi a mabistan dangar konran bubisita tamo.
sample_english: Always give good respect to our visitors.

meaning_english: A device used to stripburileaves so that the strips are all the same width.
sample_bolinao: Kasan dangka' a kabibyay na.
sample_english: There are no boundaries in his life.

meaning_english: To restrain and discipline one's actions.
sample_bolinao: Si sayay babayi, matkap adangkaannay kikadani sa sayay lalaki.
sample_english: A woman shouldput boundaries onher closeness to a man.

meaning_english: The location near something, beside.
sample_bolinao: Dilikado a bubali nin iti sa dani nin ilog no layos.
sample_english: It is dangerous for houses that are close to a river when there is a flood.

meaning_english: A sharp slapping sound made by a broad flat object such as the hand.
sample_bolinao: No manabar ya, danipak nin pasag a ipanagdag nan kuna' sa eket.
sample_english: When he fishes with a gill net, the slapping with a bamboo pole is what he uses to drive fish into the net.

meaning_english: A flat or smooth surface.
meaning_filipino: Kapatagan; lugar o bagay na pantay.
sample_bolinao: Mabistay magmaniho sa dantar nin lugar.
sample_english: It is nice to drive in a level place.

meaning_english: A heavy roaring sound that can shake a person such as the noise of war, vehicles passing, thunder or the roaring of waves.
sample_bolinao: Napukaw akon danurdor nan bulduser nin linmabas.
sample_english: Theroaringsound of the bulldozer passing by woke me up.

meaning_english: Big boats used during the ancient times. In the Bible Noah's ark.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a naikarga konandaongni Noe.
sample_english: Many were carried in thearkof Noah.

meaning_english: Sole of the foot.
sample_bolinao: Nasurot yan pasak a dapa na ni Arnel kanya' nin kai ya makalalako.
sample_english: The sole of Arnel's foot was pierced by a nail so he is not able to walk.

meaning_english: To be lying flat on a supporting surface, normally face down on the stomach.
sample_bolinao: Dapa' yay puon mangga.
sample_english: The mango tree is flat on the ground.

meaning_english: Barefooted, without anything on the feet.

sample_english: Pedro plows barefooted.

meaning_english: A heavy slapping sound such as a step on a cement surface.
sample_bolinao: Misusunor a dapakpak nin sanet a narnge' mi.
sample_english: The slapping sound of the whip we heard was one right after the other.

meaning_english: A thing such as a plant or tree that is not erect but is almost parallel to the ground.
sample_bolinao: Mainum'ay a mamuti nin mangga no dapdap ya a puon.
sample_english: It is easy to harvest the mangoes if the tree is parallel to the ground.

meaning_english: To hide close to the ground.
sample_bolinao: Dapdapan may manok no dakpen ma.
sample_english: Hide from the chicken staying close to the ground if you want to catch it.

meaning_english: An inaccurate blow or glancing blow such as an ax that does not hit squarely on target.
To graze something with a glancing blow or a near miss.
sample_bolinao: Nagket akon bala bale' daplis tamo'.
sample_english: I was hit by the bullet but it was only a grazing shot.

meaning_english: Dapple, the colors of light brown and gray mixed.
sample_bolinao: Sarba ran manok ko dapol sara.
sample_english: All of my chickens have mixed light brown and grey colors.

meaning_english: Depending upon or provided that, used as a stipulation.
sample_bolinao: Mayi ya komo nin mamantay sini si Ella dapot no mayi yan lamang si Ren.
sample_english: Ella will go with you to see a movie provided that Ren will go as well.

meaning_english: To be wide and shallow like a platter.

sample_english: The keel of my boat is broad and flat and so it is not fast.

meaning_english: To lay something out in an exposed area such as to dry rice.

sample_english: The rice they are drying is laid out on an exposed area since it was rained on.

meaning_english: A grazing bump on a body or thing in passing.
To brush against something.

sample_english: The touch-me-not sleeps if it is brushed against.

meaning_english: The thing that is adjacent to something else.

sample_english: The portion adjacent to my land they fenced in.

meaning_english: To be careless, without paying attention.
sample_bolinao: Naspak a plato tadarakudakyan mangimey.
sample_english: The plate was broken due to hercarelessmovements.

meaning_english: A small native orange whose rind is green or yellowish green when ripe.
sample_bolinao: Pirmi kamin manaliw nin daranghita ta mamuda.
sample_english: We always buy native oranges because they are cheap.

meaning_english: Steam that rises from hot ground when rain strikes it. Ground fog, radiation fog.
sample_bolinao: No kayadi' rapeg, si darangluta' a maangot mo.
sample_english: After a rain the ground fog can be smelled.

meaning_english: The rate of movement or progress of an action or something.

sample_english: The flight of an airplane is at a very high speed.

meaning_english: To speed something up.

sample_english: Get a move on so that you won't be late for your class.

meaning_english: To do something in an unmannerly or discourteous way.

sample_english: Do not enter unmannerly into a place where there are many people.

meaning_english: A fence made up of posts and the slat fencing between.
sample_bolinao: Atata'gay a darekdek nin nika' ra sa libed bali mi.
sample_english: The fence posts they put around our house were taller than normal.

meaning_english: Fence something in an area.
sample_bolinao: Pigaw kasan manabo', darekdeken yay libed nan bubon.
sample_english: So that no one will fall in, fence in the area around the well.

meaning_english: Twilight, the time when light is fading.

sample_english: It was already dusk when we were able to go home because there were no available rides.

meaning_english: To be bare, to have no decoration or covering. Used generally of things.

sample_english: The Lord wasbarewhen they took away his clothes.

meaning_english: A cork for a bottle.
sample_bolinao: Mampangusar kamin dariwdiw no mangwa' kamin taba'.
sample_english: We use the cork tree when we make lard.

meaning_english: A complaint or unfavorable report brought before a person in authority such as a parent or boss.

sample_english: The child's complaint made to his parents was wrong.

meaning_english: A drizzle or light rain.

meaning_english: To have a snub-nose or flat-nose.

sample_english: Hisnose is flat.

meaning_english: A late crop resulting in immature fruit, or vegetables.

sample_english: There are a lot of late mangoes but they are sour.

meaning_english: Sliding downward in a crouched position.

sample_english: You are sliding coming down the mountain.

meaning_english: Prayer, speaking to God.

sample_english: God listens to the prayer of one that has a humble inner being.

meaning_english: To pray for something.
sample_bolinao: Kasan rarumandasalanno kai si Dios.
sample_english: There is no one else to pray for something to except God.

meaning_english: To pray a particular prayer.
sample_bolinao: Pasal nayayna nin dasalen ni Keziah a Ama Mi taman no limay taon na tamo'.
sample_english: Keziah has now mastered praying the Our Father even though she is only five years old.

meaning_english: Something that is easily done because of being familiar with it.
sample_bolinao: Dasdasyay dalan a mamunta konan bali.
sample_english: The path that leads to the house is just a trail.

meaning_english: To pound the unhusked rice so the husk is partially removed.

sample_english: When rice is being pounded, it is partial pounded and then winnowed before it is again pounded.

meaning_english: For rice to be hard from not being thoroughly cooked.
sample_bolinao: Sabtan dase' nin sina'pang kanya' nin nisyang kon uman.
sample_english: The rice was very hard and so I put it back on the stove again.

meaning_english: A  design or pattern of round spots or dots on a surface such as cloth, a wall or other object.

sample_english: My dog has a dark spotted pattern.

meaning_english: An orderly line, row or column, that is formed so that each item is visible.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a datig, bale' siti a sangkaanrwan.
sample_english: There are many lines but this is the longest.

meaning_english: To do something in an orderly succession, one after another.
sample_bolinao: Si maistra,dinatignasaray iskwila na.
sample_english: The teacherformedthelineof her pupils.

meaning_english: Chieftain.
sample_bolinao: Main sayay dato tan saray kabaranggay.
sample_english: There was one chieftain and his barrio mates.

meaning_english: A disarray of things being scattered around disorderly.
sample_bolinao: Masager yay tatay sin narate' nay dausag sa salas ra sin ibat ya nagtrabaho.
sample_english: When father arrived from work to the disarray in the living room, he was angry.

meaning_english: Socially indecent and disgusting actions.
sample_bolinao: Balawen ya siUgongbana' sa dawal pag'iirgo na.
sample_english: Ugong is to be criticized for his disgusting speech.

meaning_english: To express disapproval of an action that is socially unacceptable and so considered indecent.

sample_english: The majority consider it indecent to go to church in a very short dress.

meaning_english: A request.

sample_english: Don's request was immediately given.

meaning_english: To request or ask for something.
sample_bolinao: Ibi raynan a'nak a sarban dawaten ran matuntawo anan matua ra.
sample_english: The children will give their elderly parents whatever they request.

meaning_english: For an item to be salable or in demand.

sample_english: The attractiveness of the bait is lacking when the fish are full.

meaning_english: Almost, nearly.
meaning_filipino: Halos; malapit na; kamuntik na; muntik na.
sample_bolinao: Dawitdawita nagket ya.
sample_english: He was nearly hit.

meaning_english: Blood.
sample_bolinao: Mali'mo yan maka'kit nindaya' si Joy.
sample_english: Joy is afraid of seeing blood.

meaning_english: To be laid out or hung out to dry.
sample_bolinao: Dayaday anay barangen sa pangawgawan.
sample_english: The rabbitfish is laid out on the drying rack.

meaning_english: The long rice stalk cut with anagodwith the rice and leaves.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' mabistan miikap saray a'nak sa dayami ta magate'.
sample_english: It is not good for the children to play in the rice straw since it is itchy.

meaning_english: Diaper.
The act of diving.
sample_bolinao: Gulpin dayb a ginwa' ko sin naryo' ako sa baybay.
sample_english: I made many dives when I bathed at the seashore.

meaning_english: To dive for something.
To spread something out.
sample_bolinao: Kasan awro sawanin kanya' dayday ma tana sa siri pinggaw kumrang ya.
sample_english: There is no sun today so just spread it out in the wind so that it will dry.

meaning_english: To spread open bamboo so that when it is split it can be opened out flat and used for such things as walling for a house. This can also be done to dry meat.
Stranger, outsider.
sample_bolinao: Abaw saraydayon mangnguna' iti sa Bolinao.
sample_english: There are manystrangerswho are fishermen here in Bolinao.

meaning_english: A distance or separation between two things.
sample_bolinao: Si dayo' nan Anda sa Bolinao ket masurok dusi kilometro.
sample_english: The distance between Anda and Bolinao exceeds twelve kilometer.

meaning_english: A game which uses dice.
sample_bolinao: Usaren yay days no magmano no miikap nin dama.
sample_english: The dice is used to know who is first in playing game of dama.

meaning_english: A steep incline of a roof, hill or mountain such that one could slide on.
sample_bolinao: Dayusdos yan maong a bubong nan bali ni Arthur.
sample_english: The slope of the roof on Arthur's house is very step.

meaning_english: An interjection expressing derision, «You got what you deserved, good!».
sample_bolinao: Dede' mo ta kai ka nin ampangrenge' kongko.
sample_english: You'll get what's coming to you for you are not listening to me.

meaning_english: The state of darkness of the soul or unenlightened to what is good.
sample_bolinao: Sabtan dedlem nin yabi tepe' ba'yon bulan.
sample_english: The night is extremely dark each time it is new moon.

meaning_english: The characteristic of a person being reserved, quiet, serious and thoughtful.
sample_bolinao: Sabtan deen na niTomasno iti ya sa klasi.
sample_english: Tomas is extremely quite and reserved when he is here in class.

meaning_english: To move cautiously toward a situation that is dangerous.
sample_bolinao: Kali'mo rayan tawo nindegdegana bali nin mandumta.
sample_english: The peoplearefearful moving close to the burning house.

meaning_english: To intentionally hit or come against something forcefully usually with an object.
sample_bolinao: Degten man palo a bula ta pigaw nin mako ya sa adayo'.
sample_english: Hit the ball with the bat so that it will go far.

meaning_english: The act of pounding or crushing of cooked or roasted pieces of corn, rice, bananas, camote, etc.
sample_bolinao: Matkap kustwen a dekdek nin kamutin kayo pigaw nin maku'net.
sample_english: The crushing of the cassava needs to be done just right so that it will be rubbery.

meaning_english: To make into a pounded or crushed dessert using bananas, camote, corn, etc.
sample_bolinao: Matrabaho nin dekdekan a sinanglay nin mais.
sample_english: It's intensive work to make roasted corn into a crushed dessert.

meaning_english: An unexpected good thing that happens, a stroke of luck.
sample_bolinao: Si deket na, iti sa puso' kanya' ya nin nati.
sample_english: His hit (stab/gun shot ) was in the heart and so he died.

meaning_english: Ten (or 4) days when the moon is small or not visible for long periods of time.
sample_bolinao: No delem, abaw a makalap ran kuna' nin mannunyo'.
sample_english: If it is moonless the spotlight fishermen catch a lot of fish.

meaning_english: A special cord or wire for a musical instruments.
sample_bolinao: Lima ray deles nan byulin.
sample_english: Aviolin has five strings.

meaning_english: For something hot to cool down slowly.
sample_bolinao: Depdep a mangrep bukod sa uring.
sample_english: The cooling down of charcoal by itself is a slow decrease.

meaning_english: To reduce a fire or power to a low flame.
sample_bolinao: Depdepanmoy apoy ta madta ana.
sample_english: Reduce the fire for it is already big.

meaning_english: The softness of something because of deterioration, overcooking or bruising.
sample_bolinao: Durdor yaynay kuna' kanya' kasan manaliw.
sample_english: The fish were deteriorating and mushy and so there was no one buying them.

meaning_english: A post that is in a fence along the line of the fence, not a major support at the corner.
sample_bolinao: Marumok a darekdek no pirmin madutak a luta' nin kami'nan.
sample_english: The fence posts will rot if the ground they are in is always wet.

meaning_english: A decimeter (dm), one tenth of a meter, 3.94 inches.
sample_bolinao: Mas anro yay sayay desimetro dyan sayay purgada.
sample_english: A decimeter is longer than an inch.

meaning_english: A black or red blemish that can be found anywhere on the body.

sample_english: The appearance of my white blouse is ruined since it has a rust stain.

meaning_english: Multiple spots or stains on something.
A person who has gone to a college or university and has earned a degree.
sample_bolinao: Di-adal yanDoctor of Philosophya prinsipal mi.
sample_english: The principal of our school has a degree of Doctor of Philosophy.

meaning_english: To be armed with a weapon.

meaning_english: Embezzlement, theft or misappropriation of funds belonging to one's employer.

meaning_english: Slow and careful movement.

sample_english: Walk slowly; don't go fast.

meaning_english: A female sales person.

meaning_english: Message sent and delivered.

sample_english: Amessagehas arrived that they must go to Manila for their daugther has arrived from the US.

meaning_english: Farewell party.

meaning_english: To excuse the fault of someone.

meaning_english: The eve of of a special occasion.

sample_english: The children caroled on Christmas eve.

meaning_english: The ability to make a decision and act in an appropriate way in times of crisis, presence of mind.

sample_english: If you lose your presence of mind when your child's life is being rescued from imminent death, you will not be able to to take the right measures.

meaning_english: Distance.
sample_bolinao: Adayo' a distansya no mikuntis kami.
sample_english: The distance is long when we have a contest.

meaning_english: Distillery, a place where wine is made.

sample_english: The San MiguelBreweryis a distillery.

meaning_english: Destination, place where one is bound for.

sample_english: I amboundfor Manila.

meaning_english: Destiny, fate.

meaning_english: District, a division of a city, school or town or other organization.

sample_english: There are nine towns in the first district of Pangasinan.

meaning_english: The act of forcing something open.

sample_english: The method the thieves used to be able to get in for their thievery was forced entry.

meaning_english: Exile, referring to the authority ordering the exile.

meaning_english: Desert, a place with little vegetation and water. Deserted place, uninhabited place, a place where no person dwells.

meaning_english: A largetreethat is easily worked and is used to make wooden shoes and is a treatment for malaria.

sample_english: The snakevenomcan kill.

meaning_english: Determination, deciding, settling beforehand.

meaning_english: Deterioration.

sample_english: My head isspinning.

sample_english: My head isspinning.

meaning_english: Spines on the surface of a fish or its bones.

meaning_english: A term of address to someone who has had an important position in government or is an estate owner.

sample_english: Don, you gave me five million, and so here it is and here is also the five million it gained.

meaning_english: Two, commonly used with time or money.

sample_english: It is just two pesos that are left over of my money.

meaning_english: A dragon, a fire breathing animal of enormous size.

sample_english: There was there a large red dragon with seven heads and ten horns.

sample_english: Arnel pours buckets of water into the drum in order to fill it.

meaning_english: Drama, a theatrical production portraying life or a character or a story.

sample_english: His driving is slow when we are there in the zig-zag.

meaning_english: A driver of a vehicle.

sample_english: The driver of the car when I go on a trip is Pedro.

meaning_english: An illegal habit-forming drug such as marijuana, methamphetamine, cocaine, etc.

meaning_english: A drawing.

meaning_english: Dampness.

meaning_english: To look down on something.

meaning_english: To collide into something.

meaning_english: To be double in value or size.

meaning_english: Doubtfulness, to not be sure.

meaning_english: A brown grasshopper.

meaning_english: A warning to scare someone from doing something bad.

meaning_english: A window.

sample_english: There are many[three] boats at the anchorage.

sample_english: Coco has no restraint when he spends lavishly.

meaning_english: Fool, foolish.

meaning_english: Owlfish or stout blacksmelt.

sample_english: Juan knocked down the papaya using a fence slat.

meaning_english: Northeasterly direction.

meaning_english: The characteristic of a person who is dirty and untidy in his body, clothing, place or surroundings.

sample_english: He is unhygienic in his cooking.

meaning_english: To have ugly or bad visible features.

sample_english: There is bad news about Joyce.

meaning_english: To make something ugly.

meaning_english: A place for dancing. Dance hall.
To dance a certain, especially traditional, dance.

meaning_english: The action of a sudden and furious rushing at something.

sample_english: King Herod persecuted some of the believers.

meaning_english: A medical doctor.

sample_english: A person needs to go to the doctor if he has a sickness.

meaning_english: A document.

meaning_english: To be ducking down with head tucked and body slightly bent.

meaning_english: Slight vomit or spit up from a baby in small amounts after eating.

meaning_english: Bald, to have nothing on top such as on a head or mountain.

meaning_english: To make bald.
To be cross-eyed or the eyes not track together.

meaning_english: Dirt, stained spots on something.

meaning_english: A sweet food used generally for dessert.

sample_english: Santol fruit can be made into sweets.

meaning_english: For a strong wind to blow something.

meaning_english: To be a refined person, gentleman.
To be unique, different and good.

sample_english: It is special when you are in your own house since there is no danger for you to avoid.

meaning_english: To step on or in something.

meaning_english: To call for entrance or to let the person in the house know you want their attention.

meaning_english: To lack the desire to eat.

meaning_english: To remain unwavering in a belief, conviction or vocation even when opposed.

meaning_english: To become small or less.

meaning_english: To decrease or become smaller or fewer.

meaning_english: To go into a crawl on the hands and knees with the body low down.

sample_english: Crawl under a table if there is an earthquake.

meaning_english: To experience something.

meaning_english: To start an action that is negative to oneself or others.

meaning_english: To drop by someplace for a purpose on the way to someplace else.
To become soft and sticky.

meaning_english: To stick to something especially if something is sticky.

meaning_english: For something such as water or hair to flow in waves.

meaning_english: To become slippery.
To become wavy.
To sympathize with others.

sample_english: Hesympathizes withthose who are needy.

meaning_english: Resembling something or someone.

meaning_english: To make a roaring vibrating sound such as of a large engine.

meaning_english: For an object to come to rest on a surface from an upright or high position.

meaning_english: To make a loud, continuous slapping sound of footsteps as when two or more people are running without shoes.

sample_english: The slippers of the children that are running hard make a slapping noise.

meaning_english: To refrain from doing something because of a bad experience.

sample_english: I now avoid going into debt with interest.

meaning_english: A young female domesticated fowl such as a chicken ready to begin laying eggs.

sample_english: The chicken I bought was a pullet and so it was nearly ready to lay eggs.

meaning_english: To begin to move something rapidly by applying a force.

sample_english: The wind was blowing favorably and so the boat moved swiftly.

meaning_english: To tell to an elder or one who is concerned what wrong was done.
sample_bolinao: Dumaromya anta syay main nin abaw kasalanan.
sample_english: He makescomplaintsbut the fact is that he is the one that has so many faults.

meaning_english: To begin to drizzle.
To begin on a downward slope.
To pray.

sample_english: They will pray for the sick.

meaning_english: To increase sales by advertisement or special offers to draw in people.

sample_english: Various fish will be attracted to the bait when pole fishing.

meaning_english: To menstruate, discharging of blood, secretions and tissue from the uterus.

meaning_english: To go to a place out of the home area for a purpose.

sample_english: Many from Bolinao go to Bani to cockfight.

meaning_english: To slide down a slope.

meaning_english: For one's thoughts and impulses to become evil and so commit an evil action.

meaning_english: To challenge or threaten someone.

sample_english: Do notmove nearerto him; he might have a gun.

meaning_english: To make small talk.
sample_bolinao: Si u'nan dumiga sa tung'it man'angan-anganen nan syay manalo.

meaning_english: To stick out the tongue in defiance.

sample_english: The child stuck out his tongue at his fellow children as a way of fighting with them.

meaning_english: The dominance or over ruling factor in a situation.

sample_english: Because of the predominance of ones figure in the contest, Rosita won.

meaning_english: To feel shame.
sample_bolinao: Duming'eyyan kumikit kona bana' sa lingo na.
sample_english: Because of his mistakes he wasashamedto look at him.

meaning_english: To defend, usually oneself, either physically or in argument.
sample_bolinao: Dumipinsa saray sundalo' nan sayay nasyon no main nin mangungkista konra.
sample_english: A nations's soldiers will come to its defense if there is another that tries to conquer them.

meaning_english: To go directly someplace.
sample_bolinao: Basta mayadi' a klasi, dumiritso yan tampor sa bali ra si Mae.
sample_english: As soon as school is finished, Mae will immediately go directly to their house.

meaning_english: For the stomach to become bloated and painful from gas or over eating.
sample_bolinao: Dumiseldisel yay tyan ko ta abaw a na'kan kon mais.
sample_english: My gut became bloated since I had eaten so much corn.

meaning_english: To going a distance.
sample_bolinao: Gawa' nin dumistansya sayay tawo o bagay o say pako sa sakalakon lugar.
sample_english: The process of going far from someone or something.

meaning_english: For a thing to suddenly hit, bump or brush something with force.
sample_bolinao: No sumpak yay granada, abaw a lumiwa' nin dumket sa tawo.
sample_english: When a grenade explodes there are many pieces that will fly out hitting people.

meaning_english: For the eyes to be glaring and sharp in appearance such as a cats.
sample_bolinao: Dumlag a mata ran aso sa madedlem.
sample_english: The dog's eyes glow in the dark.

meaning_english: To feel out of place, unadjusted, uneasy, uncomfortable.
In the direction of or towards a certain place.
sample_bolinao: Si plasa sa Binabalian itaw ya dumna' sa pantalan.
sample_english: The plaza in Binabalian is towards the wharf.

meaning_english: The thing purposely searched out or desiring to discover.
sample_bolinao: Ani kanoy dumog na, ambale' nin nako yadti?
sample_english: What reportedly is he is looking for; why has he come here?

meaning_english: For a normally flying object to land or alight on a surface.
sample_bolinao: Dumpa'yaynay agila sa luta' ta nabari' a pakpak na.
sample_english: The eagle will now land on the ground since his wing was broken.

meaning_english: Careless in appearance, habits, work, etc.
sample_bolinao: Na'met a raruman agamiren ni Juan bana' ta dumrak ya.
sample_english: Some of Juan's tools were lost for he is careless with things.

meaning_english: To blaze up or produce a flame in something combustible.
sample_bolinao: Kainin dumta a kayo mi ta nalbet.
sample_english: Our wood will not blaze up because it is wet.

meaning_english: To become damp
To make a visit in order to assess a situation.
sample_bolinao: Mali'mo akon dumu'ngap sa nati nin iti sa lungon.
sample_english: I am afraid to look down upon the dead in a coffin.

meaning_english: To collide with force against something.
sample_bolinao: Mali'mo saran dumu'pag si Boboy konran nangamat konra ta abaw sara.
sample_english: Boboy's group is afraid to take on those who are pursuing them since they are so many.

meaning_english: For something to become double.
sample_bolinao: Dumubli a bili nin kuna' tepe' nin abaw saray bakasyunista.
sample_english: The price of fish doubles every time there are a lot of vacationers.

meaning_english: A professional dancer.
To go on a quest or search focusing on the process.
sample_bolinao: Dumugenmoyon mu'na-mu'na a kapangyadian nan Dios.
sample_english: Searchfirst of all for the kingdom of God.

meaning_english: To become evil.
sample_bolinao: Dumuka' ana edet a bakas no mapalabasan a mipabista.
sample_english: If one overdoes their makeup the resulting effect becomes ugly.

meaning_english: To dance a traditional group dance in unison with music.
sample_bolinao: Maong yan dumukdok nin LaJotasi Mrs. Villanueva.
sample_english: La Jota and Mrs. Villanueva are good at folk dancing.

meaning_english: To forcefully move toward something.
sample_bolinao: Napipi'sa saran dimmuklos sa lamisawan.
sample_english: They suddenlysteppedforward as one to the table.

meaning_english: To stoop down as if to pick something up.
sample_bolinao: Dumukot no main nin puruten.
sample_english: One stoops when there is something to pickup.

meaning_english: To become cross-eyed.
sample_bolinao: Dumuling akoyna nin mamasa sa subran kadidiklengan nin surat mo.
sample_english: I became cross-eyed reading your excessively small writing.

meaning_english: For the wind to blow strongly in a particular direction.
sample_bolinao: Mag'in madaras yay baluto no dumulok yay siri.
sample_english: When the wind is blowing strongly, the movement of the boat becomes fast.

meaning_english: To look out of a window.
sample_bolinao: Tepe' mimata ya no buklas siPacita, dumungaw ya.
sample_english: Each time Pacita wakes up in the morning she looks out the window.

meaning_english: For the heads of grain or fruit to bend over from being ripe and full.
sample_bolinao: Ma'kit nay bakas nan sayay tawo no dumungdong ya sa ranom.
sample_english: A person can see his reflection when he bends his head down toward the water.

meaning_english: To gather together for a purpose and fellowship at a table and eat.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya mako dumungon mangan si Abe no kai ya kayaban.
sample_english: Abe will not go to the fellowship meal if he is not called to it.

meaning_english: To anchor or moor a ship, boat, etc.
sample_bolinao: No main nin bagyo, itaw nin dumuong a sarban mutor sa Guiguiwanen.
sample_english: When there is a typhoon, motor boats are moored inGuiguiwanen.

meaning_english: To attack forcefully with the fists.
To become moist.
sample_bolinao: Dumutak a asukar no matunaw.
sample_english: When it melts away, sugar becomes wet.

meaning_english: To uproot or extract.
sample_bolinao: Ket wanan ni'bat nin Uunuren, <<Mataman no say pagmamatalek moyo ket bilang nin kaalaki sa sangkadaitean a bikoy, magwa' moyon ibarita' konan sitin alakin kayo a dumutdot ya tan mako yadtaw nin paimula sa taaw, ket tumulok ya.
sample_english: And then the Lord answered, <<Even if your trust is as big as the smallest seed, you will be able to tell this big tree to pull out/uproot itself and to go plant itself in the sea, and then it will obey.

meaning_english: For something to settle out of a medium.
sample_bolinao: Kai nin dumyek a nikasama' sa ranom no makimbor.
sample_english: The dirty particles will not settle out when it becomes agitated.

meaning_english: A donation of something.
sample_bolinao: Duna naya ni laking a nama'dengan nin iskilawan.
sample_english: Grandfather's donation was the construction of the school.

meaning_english: Donation, something you give as a benefit to someone else or something else, usually a large amount when you are a major contributor.
sample_bolinao: Gulpin dunasyon ran Amerikano sin bagyo nin Yolanda.
sample_english: The American donations were massive when typhoon Yolanda hit.

meaning_english: A payment to regain possession of something.
sample_bolinao: Syaydundonnin sarban tawo.
sample_english: He is theredemptionfor all mankind.

meaning_english: To regain possession of something in exchange for payment of damages or debt, such as a carabao that got into a neighbors garden.
sample_bolinao: Saray Amirikano, saraynanundonkonran Pilipino sin susuyot a gira.
sample_english: The Americans were the one whoredeemedof the Filipinos during the last World War.

meaning_english: To be continually or repeatedly looking out a window.
sample_bolinao: Si babayi nin itaw sa rubari' nin bali, dungaw yaynan dungaw.
sample_english: The woman in the house on the other side keeps looking out of the window.

meaning_english: The position of having the head bowed, looking down or down to the side.

sample_english: The dog with rabies walks with its head bent down.

meaning_english: To look down upon something.
sample_bolinao: Dungdungan naya ni Bryan si angkay na ta ata'gay ya dyan sya.
sample_english: Bryan looks down on his older sibling since he is taller than him.

meaning_english: Any blemish or fault to someone's character.

sample_english: The mother wiped the dirt from her child's face with a wet cloth.

meaning_english: A burn on the skin from a hot liquid.

sample_english: The burns on my skin from the boiling water you spilled on me is shooting with pain.

meaning_english: Fellowship around a meal.

sample_english: The mother and daughter had a wonderful time around a meal.

meaning_english: The dry material kept on hand for building a fire.
sample_bolinao: Kurang a para dungot min kayo kanya' ako nin nangalap iti.
sample_english: Our stack of wood for building a fire is lacking and so I took  from here.

meaning_english: Reconciliation or resolution to a conflict by coming to an understanding.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mo nin irangas a dunong mo ta pinggat kai ka masida'.
sample_english: Don't flaunt your intelligence so that you won't be put down.

meaning_english: A place where boats are secured, an anchorage or mooring.
sample_bolinao: Awro et a duong ran maninilay ta mapres.
sample_english: The arrival of the fishermen will still be another day since it is windy.

meaning_english: Being careless in dress, appearance, habits.

sample_english: Cita is careless in the way she dresses.

meaning_english: A measure of the length of the outstretched arms.

meaning_english: The event of the landing of a flying object on a landing site.
sample_bolinao: Mapalna' a dupa' nan iruplano.
sample_english: The landing of the airplane was soft.

meaning_english: For something negative to happen to someone.

sample_english: The birds especially like to land on leafy branches.

meaning_english: A group of people that gather together for a specific purpose.

sample_english: Pediong is the one who is the head of the group of elderly men.

meaning_english: To have a crippled or twisted foot causing one to walk on the side of the foot with the bottom facing backward.
sample_bolinao: Dupri'yan lumalakoy tawo.
sample_english: The person walkson the side of his foot.

meaning_english: A kind of fish taken in the deep sea of Bolinao which is painted with yellow gold at some part of the body.
sample_bolinao: Mataway a laman randurado.
sample_english: Theduradofish is tasty.

meaning_english: Dormitory.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a bakasdurmituryosa Manila.
sample_english: There are many kinds ofdormitoryin Manila.

meaning_english: Awkward movements, wild actions, not well-mannered, uncouth.

sample_english: He is not refined in his actions that why nobody likes to go with him.

meaning_english: Punishment for a wrong.
sample_bolinao: Anaod pinasyan byat li' nin dusa nan Dios konra.
sample_english: Indeed God's punishment of them will be very heavy.

meaning_english: A blow with the end of a long heavy object such as a pestle.

sample_english: The mortar developed a hole from the strength of Carlo's pounding.

sample_english: The two that are pounding in a mortar alternate their blows.

meaning_english: To punish someone physically or in some other way for a wrong done.

sample_english: God will punish me if what I am saying is not true.

meaning_english: The lack of care of one's possessions or things in one's control, sloppiness.
sample_bolinao: Saydusay, ambo' mabistan pigagawa' nan sayay babayi.
sample_english: Sloppiness is not a good characteristic of a woman.

meaning_english: Twelve, commonly used with time.
sample_bolinao: Sin sain, dandani alas dusi ana nin ugtiawro.
sample_english: At that time, it was almost twelve o'clock noon.

meaning_english: Dozen.
sample_bolinao: Say disipulo na ni Cristo, saya dusina.
sample_english: The disciple of Christ were one dozen.

meaning_english: A swinging blow with the fists to some part of the face.

sample_english: Your swing was wrong and so I was able to avoid it.

meaning_english: To strongly hit someone in the face with the fist.

sample_english: When he tried tohitme in the face, immediately my friend blocked him.

meaning_english: Resurrection lily, a plant whose root is used as a medicine for gas pains and stomach ache..

sample_english: The resurrection lily is able to cure me.

meaning_english: A flame or the blaze of the fire.

sample_english: The flame of the lamp is dim.

meaning_english: Moisture.
sample_bolinao: Kurang et a dutak nin luta' nin pamalakayan.
sample_english: The ground in the seed bed is still lacking moisture.

meaning_english: To make something a little moist.
The act of extracting or pulling out from a retraining item.

sample_english: There was only one extraction by Puroy of the peanut plant, every bit of it came along.

meaning_english: To pull out or extract something by the roots such as plants or to unplug a cord.
sample_bolinao: Dutduten a animan nin naisaksak sa kuryinti no mibwat sa bali.
sample_english: Unplug anything that is plugged into the current when you leave the house.

meaning_english: To anchor or moor someplace.

sample_english: It is at Guiguiwanen that the boats from Binabalian Loob anchor when there is a storm.

meaning_english: The leaves or fronds of nipa which are used for making the sides or roof of a house but have not been tied together.

sample_english: Our field hut has a thatched roof and so it will be changed.

meaning_english: Leaves, straw and grass gathered by animals for where their little ones are cared for.

meaning_english: The end point of a thing or the point of two lines meeting such as at a corner of something like a street, building, paper or rope.

meaning_english: Guidance given for correction.

meaning_english: The feeling of not being sure of something.

meaning_english: To be doubtful of something.

meaning_english: Small but powerful spirit, elves, dwarfs, goblin.

meaning_english: An affliction or suffering or struggling through something that causes harm.

meaning_english: To be an evil trickster.

meaning_english: Deaconess.

sample_english: Usually the deaconesses are beautiful.

meaning_english: Deacon.

meaning_english: A discussion.

sample_english: I don't understand the discussion of these that are meeting today.

meaning_english: Diamond, the hardest mineral and a precious stone used for jewelry that sparkles.

sample_english: He has adiamondring since he is rich.

meaning_english: Than, to introduce the second element in a comparison.

sample_english: It is better to not speakthanto keep talking so that there will be no trouble.

meaning_english: Small droplets of water produced during transpiration of a plant or the dew that forms in the early morning.

meaning_english: Janitor, one who takes care of a building, apartment, house.

meaning_english: Daily newspaper.

meaning_english: Sediment, the small particles that settle to the bottom of a liquid.

meaning_english: Gelatin.
Gin, an alcoholic beverage.
Jeepney, a vehicle for carrying passengers based off the jeeps of WWII.
sample_bolinao: Si sayay dyip ginuroy nayay kapada nan dyip.
sample_english: A certain jeep pulled a fellow jeep.

meaning_english: Ten used with money.

meaning_english: Diet, Regulated nutrition to avoid bulky body.

meaning_english: Shade, the effect of blocking the sun rays by foliage or some object.

meaning_english: A marble.

meaning_english: Two or more things striking and wrecking each other.

meaning_english: Duet.
sample_bolinao: Dwito a panalwan mi sa kuntis nin mangansyon.

meaning_english: An attention particle indicating certainty and confidence, it's a fact.

sample_english: It is indeed this: As for Christ, he died so that our sins can be forgiven.

meaning_english: A sneeze.

meaning_english: The thinness or shape of a person, animal, or thing, usually indicating an unhealthiness.

meaning_english: The slowness of development or rate of progress of something.

meaning_english: The erect position of people and things.

meaning_english: To stand firm in one's statement, view or character.

sample_english: Persist in living a life that is worthy of God.

meaning_english: Consequently, marks a response that is a conclusion to a previous statement or event and moves the thought along.

sample_english: Where consequently is the vehicle that we will go in?

meaning_english: The bumping of one's head on something.

sample_english: The floor of the hut is to be raised a bit so as to avoid hitting the head on it.

meaning_english: Durability of things, the ability to last.

meaning_english: Generally a long fishing net.

meaning_english: To repeatedly tie something into a net formation.
To form something into a net.

meaning_english: A protective covering, normally the surface used for locomotion of a shell which also acts as a protective door and is very tough.

meaning_english: Eyelid edge where the eyelashes grow.

meaning_english: The crease where the leg bends in relation to the hip on the front of the body.

sample_english: I will lift my pants up to the groin so that I will not get wet.

meaning_english: Sleep.
sample_bolinao: Si tatay na, mapagal yayna anaod ket kasa et gaponelekna.
sample_english: Her father was indeed tired and yet there was no sleep for himat all.

meaning_english: A place for a person or animal to sleep.

sample_english: The bamboo bed is broken so I have no place to sleep.

meaning_english: The act of mulling over hidden negative feelings.

meaning_english: The masticating of something in the mouth without swallowing but keeping it in the mouth to relish it.

sample_english: The mouth relishes things.

meaning_english: For things to spill or leak out of a container.

sample_english: Corazon has no more jewelry to wear since she keeps losing it.

meaning_english: January.

sample_english: All of us will go to our farm to work in the month of January.

meaning_english: England.
sample_bolinao: Sin saytaw sa sayay kungrigasyon sa Englatera, napuuran yayrectorya kamainan nanriktora kasan raruma no kai si Juan Wesley.
sample_english: Way back when in one of the congregations in England, the rectory which was residence of none other than John Wesley was burned.

meaning_english: A soothing covering for protection and comfort.
sample_bolinao: Say ep'ep, mabista konran siwsiw no maray'ep.
sample_english: The covering (by the hen) is good for the chick when it is cold.

meaning_english: To repress or hid one's feelings.

sample_english: The mother hencoversher chicks.

meaning_english: To comfort or soothe something by covering it to remove the irritation.

meaning_english: The characteristic of wetting the bed or oneself involuntarily.

meaning_english: A slit or cut made with a sharp object into the skin.

sample_english: The slit in the chicken was big so it died quickly.

meaning_english: To cut the body, usually the neck of an animal, with a drawing action using a knife, rope or similar instrument.

sample_english: When slaughtering a pig, they first hit it over the head and then they slice its throat.

meaning_english: The area between the eyebrows.
sample_bolinao: Mangisit yayerekko ta nitugtog ako sa purta.
sample_english: The area between my eyes is blackish since I bumped into the door.

meaning_english: For an activity such as the burning of fire or the flow of water to be stopped.
sample_bolinao: Erep a apoy sa bali sin rinmate' ako nayabi.
sample_english: The lights were out last night when I arrived.

meaning_english: To extinguish or shut off the fire or power related to something.
sample_bolinao: Erpan moy sina'pang.
sample_english: Shut the flame off on the pot of rice.

meaning_english: To act in a manner that shows you are feeling uncomfortable because of a wrong or your lack of status.
sample_bolinao: No mako ya sa bali, erpeerpes ya bana' ta kai na nakalap a rabay na.
sample_english: When he goes to the house, he feels awkward because he did not get what he wanted.

meaning_english: To shut off a motor or other power source.
sample_bolinao: Mangrep yan apoy a siri.
sample_english: The wind will put out the fire.

meaning_english: The settling of food after eating or other things in a container.
sample_bolinao: Ma'teng a es'es ko ta mabyat a kinan ko.
sample_english: It took a long time for my food to settle since what I ate was heavy.

meaning_english: The act of whining or whimpering.
sample_bolinao: Makapaaburido a ese' nan anak.
sample_english: The child's whine was worrisome.

meaning_english: An awl for puncturing holes in something.
sample_bolinao: Ipuor miyay esed pinggat mabutbutan mi a abab.
sample_english: We put the awl in the fire in order to be able to make holes in the coconut shell.

meaning_english: To make a hole in or puncture something with a pointed object.
sample_bolinao: Mas mabista a ubot sa kayo no esedan ya.
sample_english: A hole in the wood made with an awl is much better.

meaning_english: Emerald, a precious bright green gemstone.
Further, a marker for comparative continuation or addition in time, number or activity.
sample_bolinao: Itaw yaetsa bali moyo.
sample_english: He isstillat your house.

meaning_english: The small chewed places on something.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a et'et ran ibot sa seket ko.
sample_english: There are a lot of places on my clothing where the rats had gnawed.

meaning_english: For a person or an animal, like mice, to gnaw something with their teeth.
sample_bolinao: Et'eten ran aso a but'ol ta matib'ey.
sample_english: The dogs gnawed on the bone since it was tough.

meaning_english: The act of humming, lips are closed and words are not spoken.
sample_bolinao: Eteetnan pirmi taman nin ani a man-gaw'en na.
sample_english: She keeps on humming no matter what she is doing.

meaning_english: Humming a song.
sample_bolinao: Kai naya tanda' a sarita' nan kansyon kanya' eteeten naya.
sample_english: He does not know the words to the song so he hums it.

meaning_english: A throbbing, stinging or smarting pain.
sample_bolinao: Grabi a etek'etek no maninep yan lana' a kuyapes.
sample_english: The stinging pain is severe when pus builds up in a boil.

meaning_english: A duration or length of time.
sample_bolinao: Sabtanetengkoynan mantuma'gan komo!
sample_english: I've been waiting for solongfor you!

meaning_english: To be slow about doing something or in movement.
sample_bolinao: Andi' moy na eteng-etengan nin lumalako ta bangli' mabati' ka.
sample_english: Don't doddle when walking for you might be left behind.

meaning_english: To extended the time of something.
sample_bolinao: Duka' nin etengen a pamaryo' sa abing.
sample_english: It is bad to prolong the bathing of a baby.

meaning_english: Lightheadedness or faintness.
sample_bolinao: Mangan kan maong ta siin a puon ninewermo.
sample_english: Eat better for that is the cause of your lightheadedness.

meaning_english: Huh, gives emphasis and weight to a statement.
sample_bolinao: Ani li' ey a rabay mo?
sample_english: What will you really want?

meaning_english: A wound from chafing made by a soft instrument with a back and forth action such as a rope.
sample_bolinao: Ararem a ey'ey nin rubir sa liey nan baboy.
sample_english: The chafing on the neck of the pig from the rope is deep.

meaning_english: To cut a soft object with something having a sharp edge using a back and forth action.
sample_bolinao: Ey'eyen nin maimpis a karni nin iprito.
sample_english: Cut the meat for frying thin.

meaning_english: The action of lightly shaking something back and forth.
sample_bolinao: Sa kasaw eyeg nan kayo, maragrag saray balangubang.
sample_english: From the strong shaking of the tree, the May beetles are falling out.

meaning_english: To shake something forcefully such as a tree.
sample_bolinao: Manabo' a maluto' nin maluko no eyegen a sanga.
sample_english: The ripe cashews will fall when its branches are shaken.

meaning_english: Asthma.
sample_bolinao: Maidap no main eyek ta maidap nin minawa.
sample_english: It is difficult having asthma for it is difficult to breathe.

meaning_english: To suffer from asthma.
sample_bolinao: Alalaki asang'apna ta eyeken ya.
sample_english: Her gasps are bigsinceshe is short of breath.

meaning_english: The action of sipping a liquid, usually used of a soup or broth without a spoon.
sample_bolinao: Pinasyan eyep na nin sabaw nin dinaang ko.
sample_english: His sip of my vinegar soup was extreme.

meaning_english: To sip or suck in a liquid, often used for a hot substance like soup from a bowl.
sample_bolinao: Mataway nin eyepen a animan nin sabaw no ma'mot et.
sample_english: Whatever the broth, it is tasty to sip when it is hot.

meaning_english: The act of spreading something out or distributing things around unevenly or for a benefit to someone.
sample_bolinao: Kapresan tayak nin rigalo konran a'nak sa iskilawan.
sample_english: Currently there is a distribution of gifts to the children at school.

meaning_english: The firm manner in which something is held in the hand.
sample_bolinao: Ga'get naya nin anak a gading-gading na.
sample_english: The child is holding her doll securely.

meaning_english: To take charge of something, assuming control, responsibility or custody.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma ninga'getana palansa ta ma'mot ya.
sample_english: Do not touch the flat iron for it is hot.

meaning_english: To obtain what is aimed for or desired.
sample_bolinao: No maseseg ka,manga'morkan gun-guna.
sample_english: If you work hard you willreceive areward.

meaning_english: The extent or distance of reaching with one's arms extended.
sample_bolinao: Anted a ga'wat na ni Estong ta daite' ya nin tawo.
sample_english: Estong's extent of reach is limited because he is a short person.

meaning_english: To reach for something by exerting effort like stretching the arm or going up on tip toe.
sample_bolinao: Ga'waten may bayawas ta kai kwa maga'wat.
sample_english: Stretch up for the guava since I cant reach it.

meaning_english: Gabardine, a type of tightly woven cloth.
sample_bolinao: Si gabardin, magwa' yan iyules no maray'ep.
sample_english: Gabardine cloth can be used for a blanket when it is cold.

meaning_english: Taro plant.
sample_bolinao: Sinigang nin baboy nin main gabi a kuna' mi.
sample_english: Our main dish is sour pork soup with taro.

meaning_english: Brown sediment, soil which has been eroded and carried by water and settles in low areas and is very fine in texture.
sample_bolinao: Si gabon nan siti si mula ket abaw bale' makapoy a luta'.
sample_english: This plant has a lot of sediment but the soil is lacking nutrients.

meaning_english: A doll (cute is implied), generally female.
sample_bolinao: Gading-gading pirmi a ikap ran bubbayin a'nak.
sample_english: Dolls are always toys of little girls.

meaning_english: A device, a nondescript accessory, normally electronic such as a phone or television.
sample_bolinao: Bawal saran mangusar gadyit a iskwila no mampangyakay a maistra.
sample_english: It's prohibited for students to use devices when the teacher is teaching.

meaning_english: To safeguard from danger.
sample_bolinao: No tanda' mo nin kasan anggaw'en mo nin duka', gaga mo a lalaman mo.
sample_english: If you know you are not doing anything wrong, safeguard yourself.

meaning_english: That part of a thing which is made to be have the hand on when holding.
sample_bolinao: Naspak yaygaga'getannan tasa.
sample_english: Thehandleof the cup was broken.

meaning_english: A medium to large round or square loose weave basket which is carried on the back or hips and made from the inner strips of bamboo.
sample_bolinao: Sa ka'bwan ra nin kuna' mangyusar kamin gagaban nin pangwan mi.
sample_english: For the majority of fish we use the large hip carried basket as our container.

meaning_english: The intent to do evil because of a grudge.
sample_bolinao: Masager yan maong kona; rabay nayan gagaem taw si kaaway na.
sample_english: He is very angry at him; he wants to harm that enemy of his.

meaning_english: The kind of person that doesn't do anything unless told to.
sample_bolinao: Si tawon gagan-ganen bilang yan pasak a matkap nin martilyuwen.
sample_english: The person that doesn't do anything unless told is like a nail that needs to be hit with a hammer.

meaning_english: A person's intention or purpose for something.
sample_bolinao: Nako yadti ta main nin gagara na.
sample_english: He came here since he has a specific intention.

meaning_english: To do something intentionally or on purpose.
sample_bolinao: Gagarawen na nin lumwa' pigaw makapiikap ya sa liwa'.
sample_english: He intends to go out so that he can play with others outside.

meaning_english: For something unmade to be made into something.
sample_bolinao: Gagaw'enya in si kayo nin baluto.
sample_english: The use of that tree is for making boats.

meaning_english: A thing used to produce something, specifically a field used primarily for wetland farming of rice and other crops.
sample_bolinao: Say kangkong nin tumubo' sagagawa', malambot.
sample_english: Swamp cabbage that grows in rice fields is lush.

meaning_english: One who can't understand things or usually misinterprets things. Normally its sound is stretched outgaaago'oo, dull, stupid, idiot.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka mag'irgo nin gago no kasan pruwiba mo.
sample_english: Don't say stupid if you don't have any proof.

meaning_english: Tar plaster, calking, wax.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a galagala iyusar ko no mangidalit ako.
sample_english: I use a lot of tar plaster when I am gluing things together.

meaning_english: The act to covet a part of land that meets one's land, land grabbing.
sample_bolinao: Saygalamgamsyay pigagawa' a ambo' matunong sa Dios.
sample_english: Land grabbing is a habit which not right before God.

meaning_english: To desire greatly (without the sense of greed).
sample_bolinao: Si tawon main butang, mas ata'gay et nin butang a plano nan galamgamen.
sample_english: The person that has a position, the plan that he further covets is for a much higher position.

meaning_english: Esteem.
sample_bolinao: Paalakyen saray a'nak nin main galang sa raruma.
sample_english: The children are brought up with respect for others.

meaning_english: To respect deeply or honor someone greatly.
sample_bolinao: Galangen kosaray mangatua ko.
sample_english: I will honor my parents.

meaning_english: To be without something in an expected place or situation.
sample_bolinao: Galat anay sapatos na sin rinmate' ya sa bali.
sample_english: He was no longer wearing his shoes [His shoes weren't there] when he arrived at the house.

meaning_english: To divest or strip someone of their authority or rights.
sample_bolinao: Galatan mon kanit a byas ba'yo mo nin isa'pang.
sample_english: Remove the red ants from the rice before you boil it.

meaning_english: For a woman to be lacking in seriousness or to be fickle-minded.
sample_bolinao: Siin a babayi anggan sawanin, galawgaw ya et.
sample_english: Until now that woman is still fickle-minded.

meaning_english: Slight damage to something.
sample_bolinao: Main galdi nan tasa sa tumbong.
sample_english: There's a chip out of the bottom of the cup.

meaning_english: A mixture of ashes and sugar used to patch a broken jar.
sample_bolinao: Saray nu'nan tawodti sa Bolinao sin saytaw, iyator ray masam'it sa alaki nin pasig a martabana a ginalem sa bebey para sa tyimpon rapeg.
sample_english: The Bolinao folks in the past, preserved their sugar in a very big jar patched with a mixture of ash and sugar. This is reserved for the rainy season, when they could not go out in the sea to fish.

meaning_english: To seal something with a patch.
sample_bolinao: Galemen koyay pasig a nangwan masam'it.
sample_english: I will seal the jar that had sugar put in it.

meaning_english: What a person longs for or dreams to acquire by all means.
To acquire something.
sample_bolinao: Rabay kongalemgemena ata'gay a adal.
sample_english: Iwanttoacquirehigher education.

meaning_english: The link that joins something to something.
sample_bolinao: Mairot a galet nan anak sa takyay nan nanay na.
sample_english: The child's grip on his mother's arm was tight.

meaning_english: To fasten two things together.
sample_bolinao: Galetan may gamet ko no madalunot.
sample_english: Cling to my hand if it is slippery.

meaning_english: The noisy chomping or gnawing on something as when a dog chews a bone.
sample_bolinao: Naragrag ya sa raranom a but'ol nin galgal nan aso.
sample_english: The bone that the dog had gnawed on slipped away and plummeted into the water.

meaning_english: To chomp on something with an open mouth breaking it up like a pig continually does.
sample_bolinao: Galgalen nan baka a tinaker nin dayami.
sample_english: The cow is chewing  the rice straw that has been tied together.

meaning_english: A large plastic or glass container which holds one or more gallons of liquid.
sample_bolinao: Saya galon nin mantika' a sinaliw ko.
sample_english: It was a a gallon of lard that I bought.

meaning_english: A binding or latch.
sample_bolinao: Nakaliwa' saray kanding ta kasan galot nan purta.
sample_english: The goats were able to get out since there was no latch on the door.

meaning_english: To remove or expel something.
sample_bolinao: Galten may kupya' mo no iti ka sa rarem bali.
sample_english: Remove your hat when you are inside the house.

meaning_english: The act of tenderly caring for a person.
sample_bolinao: Mailiw saray matuntawoynan matua sa galugalo ran a'nak ra.
sample_english: The elderly long for the tender care of their children.

meaning_english: A big-bodied round scad.
sample_bolinao: Pinirito koy galunggong.
sample_english: I fried the scad.

meaning_english: To put a binding or tie on something to hold it shut.
sample_bolinao: Galutan man istro a sako pigaw kai ma'met a byas.
sample_english: Tie the sack with the straw so that the rice will not spill out.

meaning_english: To bind shut an opening
sample_bolinao: Galuten may bebey nan sako pigaw kai ma'met a irik.
sample_english: Bind up the mouth of the sack so that the rice does not spill out.

meaning_english: A kind of flat round bread with three holes at the center.
sample_bolinao: Saray akukulaw sin saytaw isayet raygalyitassa kapi no kanen ra.
sample_english: The old women before when they eat thecrackerbread they dipped it into the cup of coffee.

meaning_english: The interwoven joint of things such as ropes.
sample_bolinao: Gama a iyusar mi no mangwa' kamin pasabing.
sample_english: Interweaving is what we use when we make a fish corral.

meaning_english: The act of mashing food and other things with the hands.
sample_bolinao: Kai kumon mangyadi' in iti sa bali, si gama'gama' sa ma'kan.
sample_english: The mashing of food with the hands should not happen here in the house.

meaning_english: To touch repeatedly, especially food, with the fingers thought of as being unhygienic and rendering the food unappetizing to eat.
sample_bolinao: Andi' monin gama'gamaena sina'pang ta main et nin mangan.
sample_english: Do notkeep touchingthe rice with your fingers for there are still people who will eat.

meaning_english: For neighbors to help each other doing harvesting or in other activities without pay.
sample_bolinao: Ipa'kit nin gamal a mabistan uksoy ran tutawo.
sample_english: The communal activities show the good harmony of the people.

meaning_english: To splice, unravel a rope and then weave it back together so it cannot easily be seen.
sample_bolinao: Gamawen may namutulan konan rubir pigaw kai ya mabagbag.
sample_english: Splice the cut in the rope so that it won't come undone.

meaning_english: A tentacle such as of jellyfish or octopus.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a gamay nin bukya.
sample_english: A jellyfish has many tentacles.

meaning_english: A safeguard against something.
sample_bolinao: Mag'adal maong ta siin a gamer nan sayan tawo nin kai ra gapon matakaw nin raruma.
sample_english: Study well since that is a safeguard for a person from being robbed by others.

meaning_english: Hand, the part below the wrist.
sample_bolinao: Ita'gay maygametmo no tanda' may ubat.
sample_english: Raise yourhandif you know the answer.

meaning_english: To handle or do something to something with the bare hand.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' nin mabista a gameten tamo' a ma'kan.
sample_english: It is not nice to just handle your food with your hands.

meaning_english: Things gotten greedily.
sample_bolinao: Gamgam in say luta' nin man'ilako' na.
sample_english: That land he is selling was gotten illegally.

meaning_english: To appropriate someone's property or possession for oneself illegally.
sample_bolinao: Kasalanan a mangamgam nin luta' ran main luta'.
sample_english: To grab the land from the owner is a sin.

meaning_english: Witch craft, superstition, spirit.
A hand-held moon-shaped knife used for harvesting grain.
sample_bolinao: Iyusar ray gamrang no mangyatab ana.
sample_english: They use a hand sickle when they harvest.

meaning_english: The act of snatching with the fingers and hanging on to it.
sample_bolinao: Duka' a pigagawa' in si gamrot anan gamrot nin ambo' ikon.
sample_english: The  behavior of grabbing things that aren't yours is bad.

meaning_english: To forcefully grab, or snatch something from another person who is not being careful and clutching it close to you.
sample_bolinao: Andi' magamrutena gina'getan nan anak ta umakis ya.
sample_english: Do notsnatchwhat the child is holding, he will start crying.

meaning_english: Small blood sucking horseflies.
sample_bolinao: Saray gamugamo nin dumpa' konran damulag, manepsep saran daya'.
sample_english: The horseflies that land on the carabao suck blood.

meaning_english: Commands or rules.
sample_bolinao: Sumunor atamo sa gan-gan ran matua.
sample_english: We follow the rules of our parents.

meaning_english: To command someone to do something.
sample_bolinao: Mangan-gan kan mangluto' konran mibubsat.
sample_english: Order the siblings to cook.

meaning_english: An enthusiasm or appetite for something such as eating.
sample_bolinao: Say gana ra kanon main nin ristauran, dubli.
sample_english: It's said that the gain of restaurant owners is twice their capital.

meaning_english: To be eager or enthusiastic or in the mood or inspired to do something.
sample_bolinao: Ganado akon manubo' nin sina'pang no mangan ako yapo' nin kalamansi'.
sample_english: I am eager to stuff my mouth with boiled rice if I have first eaten kalamansi.

meaning_english: Organic fertilizer from compost, manure or decayed materials.
sample_bolinao: Say ganagan nan luta' a namalambot sa sayti say mula ko.
sample_english: It is the composted soil that is making these plants of mine lush.

meaning_english: An improvement making something nice or good.
sample_bolinao: Kai ko nin malingwanan a ganagana na.
sample_english: I cannot forget her attractiveness.

meaning_english: The financial profit from an investment.
sample_bolinao: Say ganansya ra no maglako' sara nin kahil, dubli.
sample_english: Their profit if they sell Sunkist oranges is 100%.

meaning_english: Sound of swift flow of water over rapids.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a ganasgas nan karayan.
sample_english: Thesound oftheflowof the brook is loud.

meaning_english: The feeling of the need to hurry a process along.
sample_bolinao: Ganat a pangagod sa pari mi ta bangli' maabutan nan bagyo.
sample_english: The harvesting of our rice is urgent since the storm might catch us.

meaning_english: Joyful countenance.
sample_bolinao: Ganaygay na sin na'kit nay nanay nan ibat nag'ubra sa adayo'.
sample_english: He was exuberant when he saw his mother back from working far away.

meaning_english: To be soft and slippery.
sample_bolinao: Sitin byas lutu'nen yan maong anggan ganeygey yayna.
sample_english: This rice is cooked so thoroughly that it is soft and slippery.

meaning_english: The angry snarl of dogs as when they bare their teeth, ready to attack.
sample_bolinao: Ganggangnan aso konran lumabas a tutawo.
sample_english: The dogsnarls angrilyat the people passing by.

meaning_english: A deep bruise to the muscle or bone of a person normally from a blow or abuse to the body.
sample_bolinao: Main ganor nan tuod na ta nigket ya sa bato.
sample_english: He has a bone bruise on his knee since it was bumped against a stone.

meaning_english: The dark orange color of chicken feet.
sample_bolinao: Binyan yan midalyan gansa' si Tonton sin naggradwit ya sa hay iskol.
sample_english: Tonton was given a bronze medal when he graduated from high school.

meaning_english: A crochet hook.
sample_bolinao: Say gansilyo, abaw a kulor nin pamilian.
sample_english: There are many colors of crochet hooks to choose from.

meaning_english: To crochet something.
sample_bolinao: Nagsikabarang a kulor nin suy'ot a gansilyuwen nan kubrikama ni angkay Bebing.
sample_english: Various colors of thread were used to crochet the bed cover of big sister Bebing.

meaning_english: Goose.
sample_bolinao: Saray ganso' ko, nati sara sin bagyo.
sample_english: My geese died during the typhoon.

meaning_english: Playfulness in a frisky way.
sample_bolinao: Pirmi yan madisgrasya si Paolo bana' sa gantil na.
sample_english: Because of his fooling around, Paolo is always having an accident.

meaning_english: To excite or stir up, usually done by a child to get someone to respond.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma gantilen a ari mo ta mampet ya li' no ma'lek ya.
sample_english: Don't get your younger sibling all worked up for he will wet his bed later when he is asleep.

meaning_english: To bruise something.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma ganuren a papayas ta duka' ana li' a taway na.
sample_english: Don't bruise the papaya for their flavor will later be bad.

meaning_english: A short handled larger paddle.
sample_bolinao: Say gaod, iyusar mi ta pinggat kai ra marnge' nin kuna' a makina.
sample_english: We use a large paddle so that the fish don't hear an engine.

meaning_english: A woven bamboo basket used as a container for salt, about 1 meter in diameter and 1.5 meter height.
sample_bolinao: Iyusar mi a gapa ta pinggat a maglat a ranom nan asin.
sample_english: We use a salt basket in order to remove the water from the salt.

meaning_english: At all, an emphatic used with a negative limiting the degree.
sample_bolinao: Kai yagaponin nangimey.
sample_english: He did not moveat all.

meaning_english: Digits or fingers.
The sound of the stomach growling from movement in the intestines.
meaning_filipino: Tunog ng tiyan kapag nagugutom na.
sample_bolinao: Kai ako nangan, garadugod naynan tyan ko sa bitil.
sample_english: I have not eaten; my stomach is now growling from hunger.

meaning_english: A garage.
sample_bolinao: Abaw saray dyip itaw konan garahi nan mammainang nin ruran.
sample_english: There are many jeepneys there in the vehicle welder's garage.

meaning_english: A loud coarse laugh.
sample_bolinao: Garakgak yaynan garakgak ket marnge' anggan rubari'.
sample_english: He hoots and hoots and so he can be heard clear to the other side.

meaning_english: Finger or toe.
sample_bolinao: Anenented a garamay nin ayi niDagul.
sample_english: Dagul's toes are short.

meaning_english: This is a description of a woman who is drawn from one thing to another, being imprudent and flighty.
sample_bolinao: Bana' ta garanggandyang ya si Flora, na'pos a kayamanan na sa bisyo.
sample_english: Because Flora is flighty, she consumed her wealth on vices.

meaning_english: Small bottles.
sample_bolinao: Main saray manaliw ningarapaa kasaynan laman.
sample_english: There are those who buybottleswhich do not contain anything.

meaning_english: Tick.
sample_bolinao: Main garapata nan aso.
sample_english: The dog has ticks.

meaning_english: A small bottle.
sample_bolinao: Dinepen moyoygarapitata main makodti manaliw no Sabado.
sample_english: Collect all thesmallbottles, and a man will come to buy on Saturday.

meaning_english: Fun making.
sample_bolinao: Makapaka'lisa bakas nan garasyuso.
sample_english: The appearance of the clown is humorous.

meaning_english: The words and actions that make others laugh by a joke or a prank that is play on someone.
sample_bolinao: Mamaka'lis ya yupa' sagarawna.
sample_english: He makes one laugh by his pranks.

meaning_english: Joking around and not being serious, generally in a manner of making fun of someone.
sample_bolinao: Garaw-garawtamo' a nibarita' ko, ambo' nin pasyawan.
sample_english: What I said was just joking around, it is not true.

meaning_english: To playfully tease repetitively and kid around with someone, at times making fun of them.
sample_bolinao: Garaw-garawen kwa tamo' ket inmakis ya.
sample_english: I teased him only until he cried.

meaning_english: The extremities of the body of animals having six or eight legs such as crabs and spiders.
sample_bolinao: Walo ray garawagaw nan gigang.
sample_english: The spider has eight legs.

meaning_english: To tease or pull a prank on someone by making them the butt of the joke or tempt them into something.
sample_bolinao: Pirmi nayan garawen ni Pedro si Juan no lumabas ya.
sample_english: Pedro always teases Juan when he passes by.

meaning_english: An enclosed garden usually of flowers or vegetables.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a burak sa gardin.
sample_english: There are many flowers in the garden.

meaning_english: The quality of food of being crispy, tough or stringy and at times brittle.

sample_english: The crispiness of cassava is extreme when it has been rained on several times and then dug up.

meaning_english: A loud noise disturbing others around.
sample_bolinao: Sabtay gargar ran a'nak nin mampiikap.
sample_english: The children that were playing were very noisy.

meaning_english: The things you have in a bag or container.
sample_bolinao: No rumate' ya, abaw a klasin gargaret a irate' na.
sample_english: When he arrives there are a lot of kinds of bagged things that he will bring with.

meaning_english: A stroller, a carriage in which a baby or young child can be pushed along.
sample_bolinao: Gari-gariton yay usaren ni Miguel nin maningkap ikabyay ra sa inawru-awro.
sample_english: Its a pushcart that Miguel uses everyday to make a living.

meaning_english: A gray-black ant with a slender body and long legs that moves rapidly.
sample_bolinao: Saray garigari rabay-rabay ray masam'it.
sample_english: The small black ants like sweets.

meaning_english: Giggling.

sample_english: Her chuckling could be heard on the other side of the room.

meaning_english: A long band or strip, typically of uniform width, differing from the surface on either side.

sample_english: You can recognize my boat when it arrives by its stripe.

meaning_english: Small store with a variety of the daily needs, sari-sari store.
sample_bolinao: Manaliw kadtaw sa garita no main matkap mo.
sample_english: Buy what you need there at the house-store.

meaning_english: A grating or sharp scraping sound.

meaning_english: Two wheel cart used for carrying heavy loads and pulled by animals.

sample_english: We use an ox cart when we are collecting rice in order to do it quickly.

meaning_english: String, something to tie with, hobble, training rope.

sample_english: Hobbles are only used on horses.

meaning_english: An elastic band, soft rope or strap which holds something in place or is used in a slingshot or to secure a cover on something.

sample_english: Mars is being exposed by his trousers slipping down since his elastic is ruined.

meaning_english: A mark or injury caused by scraping or abrasion.
