sample_english: His scrape on the knee became infected.

meaning_english: A chainsaw.

sample_english: If you have no ox cart, use a sledge.

meaning_english: The act of whipping someone with a stick out of anger.

meaning_english: To strike with a long solid object such as a piece of wood or bamboo.

sample_english: Don'thitwith a stick since that's bad.

meaning_english: Kerosene.
The wick for the kerosene light.

sample_english: It needs gauze since it is a large wound.

meaning_english: The grade of coarseness of an object  such as sand paper.that will be used for removing excess material.

meaning_english: Gasoline, a fuel used in certain spark ignition engines.

meaning_english: Milk.

meaning_english: An itch or prickly feeling.

meaning_english: The act of chewing and crushing or grinding with the teeth.

sample_english: If there is a certain member in that meeting, there is someone that wants to give approval to him.

meaning_english: To have someone rub something on.
sample_bolinao: Ni kai ma nin nipaaprusan mataman nin ladak a ulo ko bale' sya, banglo et a niyapros na sa ayi ko.
sample_english: Neither did you have my head rubbed with oil but she, it is even perfume that she has rubbed on my feet.

meaning_english: To give a kiss to someone.
To have something emulated or copied by someone.
sample_bolinao: Sa sarba nin panaon, nipa'kit kon nipaarig komoyo a matkap a tulungan tamo saray mampagkakurang mangibwat sa wanin a ginwa' ko nin pammaturo' kon saynget.
sample_english: At all times, I showed you what to emulate that we must help those who are lacking by what I did in working up a sweat.

meaning_english: To have someone make a settlement on something.
sample_bolinao: Ipaariglomoyna kona ni Eddie a swildo na ni Jose.
sample_english: Have Eddie mediate regarding the settlement of the salary of Jose.

meaning_english: To have someone become a servant of someone else.
sample_bolinao: Nipaaripen nayay anak nin Sam sa sayay adi' sa Israel.
sample_english: Sam had his child go to be a servant to a king in Israel.

meaning_english: To have an animal bred.
To give care to something.
sample_bolinao: Kayadi', niruran naya konan asno na mi'sa naya niyater sa sayay balin pagtuluyan tan nipaasikaso naya.
sample_english: Right afterwards, he put him on his donkey then he took him to a boarding house and had him taken care of.

meaning_english: To have a roof put on a house.
To have someone deliver something someplace.
sample_bolinao: Ipaater na ni Edoy a kwarta konan anak na konan amigo na.
sample_english: Edoy had his child deliver the money to his friend.

meaning_english: To have something delivered to someplace.
To have someone put protective restrictions on something.
sample_bolinao: Ipaawa' mo pa Juan konan gwardya ko sa asyinda a ubas mi konran manikas nin tawon lumabas.
sample_english: Have Juan have my guard at our grape orchard prohibit those people passing by from pilfering it.

meaning_english: To drop, throw down, or put down with a heavy force.
sample_bolinao: Nipababnaknayay sayay barkot a kayo.
sample_english: Hedroppedthe big bundle of fire wood heavily.

meaning_english: To have something placed on a surface.
sample_bolinao: Mangipababo kan rarek sa binagkal.
sample_english: Put the curd on top of the rice delicacy.

meaning_english: To have someone send another on an errand.
sample_bolinao: Ipabaki' ma koni Juan a kasingin mo nin mamalingki ya sa babali dilap.
sample_english: Have Juan send your twin into town to do the marketing tomorrow.

meaning_english: To be given a vaccination.
sample_bolinao: Gulpin nipabakuna sa lugar mi sin taon nin 2021.
sample_english: There were a lot of people that were vaccinated in our place in 2021.

meaning_english: To make something such as a big task someone's full responsibility.
sample_bolinao: Ket pinasuet rayan nipabalatay kona a kudos nin mambalatayen na ni Jesus.
sample_english: And so they forced him to carry the cross Jesus was carrying.

meaning_english: To place something across the primary shape of an object.
To tell somebody to ask the other person to watch or to look after somebody or anything. Request someone to keep an eye on something.
meaning_filipino: Sabihin ng isang tao na pakitingnan.
sample_bolinao: Ipabantayanmay ari mo koni Maria.
sample_english: Let Maria watch your sister.

meaning_english: To put through baptism.
sample_bolinao: ta bara'mo kamon naikitabon kona ni Jesu-Cristo sin nipabawtismo kamo, tan bara'mo kamo et a lamang nin naikalamo' nin sinmubli' nin mabyay kona ni Cristo.
sample_english: for it is as though you were buried with Jesus Christ when you were put through the process of baptism, and as though you further also were made a companion in the returning alive of Christ.

meaning_english: To had someone baptized into something.
sample_bolinao: Konan siin, nipabawtismwan nasara ni Pedro sa ngaran na ni Jesu-Cristo.
sample_english: At that, Pedro had them be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ.

meaning_english: To cause a payment to be made for something.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' rabay na ninipabayadan.
sample_english: Therefore he wants to get the payment.

meaning_english: To have something put through the pounding or milling process.
sample_bolinao: Kurang a gawgaw nin nipabbayo nan irik kanya' nin narekrek.
sample_english: The rice that was pounded lacked enough exposure to the sun and so it shattered.

meaning_english: To wick a liquid slowly from one place to another.
To have a religious official give a blessing to some place of thing.
sample_bolinao: Ipabindisyunan rayay bali ra no Linggo.
sample_english: They will have their house blessed on Sunday.

meaning_english: The one requesting somebody to perform a baptism.
sample_bolinao: Nipabinyagan naya anak na sa Romano Katuliko.
sample_english: He had his son baptized in the Roman Catholic Church.

meaning_english: Lend something to someone.
sample_bolinao: Nipable'nay kwarta na ket anggan sawanin kai ra et binayadan.
sample_english: Helenthis money but until now they have not yet paid him.

meaning_english: One to ask somebody to strike the person for him.
sample_bolinao: Ipabugbognayay tawon nangluko kona.
sample_english: He is telling somebody tobeatthe person who had done him wrong.

meaning_english: To force one's way through grass, water, or other things.
sample_bolinao: Nipabusaksak naya ni Jose a mutursiklo na sa layos.
sample_english: Jose forced his motorcycle through the flood.

meaning_english: To have someone use an object to discern from the spirits what needs to be done to solve the problem they have.
To point out the equivalence of something with something else so that it is understood to be the same.
sample_bolinao: Ipada katamo konran a'nak a mampiikap sa plasa.
sample_english: I equate you to children that are playing in the plaza.

meaning_english: To give a slap to something with an object.
sample_bolinao: Say gawa' nin ipadadpak yay dalukap o bislak sa kupey nan sayay tawo laloynay anak nin panunusa kona.
sample_english: The actions of slapping the bottom of a person, especially a child, with an open hand or stick for discipline.

meaning_english: To subject something to something.
sample_bolinao: a mantaga'nan nan sarba ran kukalaban na ket ipadaeg nasaran liso nin Dios kona.
sample_english: waiting for all of his enemies to be fully subjugated to him by God.

meaning_english: Have someone arrested.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' nin rabay rayayna kumon nin ipadakep nin tampor si Jesus bale' mali'mo sara konran tutawo.
sample_english: Therefore they wanted to have Jesus arrested at once but they were afraid of the people.

meaning_english: To do by means of something.
sample_bolinao: Mangipadalan nin pasagad sa inadado pigaw mapatag a luta'.
sample_english: The harrow was passed over the plowed ground so as to smooth it out.

meaning_english: To have actions taken to prevent the worsening of a sickness.
sample_bolinao: Si sayay tawo nin mampagmasakit,ipadalato'ya sa duktor pigaw tambaren naya.
sample_english: The person that is sick is sent as a precaution to the doctor so that he can be treated.

meaning_english: To cause someone to consider something.
sample_bolinao: Ipadalepdep ko konra a gugan-gan ko.
sample_english: I will cause them to contemplate my commands.

meaning_english: To have something done aggressively.
To slip on something.
To have someone fall down flat.
To bring something out into the open and put it on display.
sample_bolinao: Man'ipadarna konran tutawo a katutu'wan nin mangyadi'.
sample_english: He isexposingto the people the truth of what happened.

meaning_english: To give movement to something.
To donate or grant a request .
sample_bolinao: Ipadawatkoyayna a payong konan a akulaw ta kasan kwarta na.
sample_english: I will donate the umbrella to the old woman since she has no money.

meaning_english: To have something put out to dry.
To press or use force or weight steadily against something.
meaning_filipino: Pagwersa; pagpresyon; pagpigipit; Idiin; diinan; ididiin; Panggigipit; ginipit.
sample_bolinao: Ipadetmay lamisawan sa ringring pigaw madaer ya.
sample_english: Pressthe table against the wall so that it will not be moved.

meaning_english: To put things off till tomorrow, to leave things for tomorrow.
sample_bolinao: Andi' moynaipadilapa gaw'en mo sawanin.
sample_english: Do notputfor tomorrow what you can do today.

meaning_english: To give over to God.
sample_bolinao: IpaDios moyoynay panunusa konra bana' sa sager na ta wanan Dios a mabasa sa Masanton Kasuratan.
sample_english: Give over to God the punishment of them because of his anger since God says that which can be read in the Holy Scriptures.

meaning_english: To pair up and become a couple.
To give a prophesy or foretell something.
sample_bolinao: Nipadles rayna sin saytaw et a maipa'ka' sa sain nin paka'kitan nin kamaungan nan Dios komoyo.
sample_english: Even in the past they prophesied about that which is evidence of God's kindness to you.

meaning_english: To convey something along in the flow.
sample_bolinao: Si agos, ipadpad nan abaw a dikot.
sample_english: The current, it carries along a lot of trash.

meaning_english: To take a problem for treatment to a doctor.
sample_bolinao: Masurnang a ngipen nin abas a linya no ipaduktor sa dintista.
sample_english: Teeth that are misaligned will be straightened when taken to a dentist for treatment.

meaning_english: To provided food on the table.
To serve food to someone while eating together.
sample_bolinao: Kanen tan inumen moyoy animan a ipadungo ra komoyo, bana' ta si sayay mampagtrabaho, manepeg a tubaleen ya.
sample_english: Eat and drink whatever they serve you , because the one who works, it is proper that he be recompensed.

meaning_english: To measure by length of extended arms.
To be punished.
sample_bolinao: Ginwa' na in sin nipadusa ya nin say manepeg kumon nin dusa mi sin nati ya sa kudos.
sample_english: He did that when he caused himself to be punished with the punishment which was rightly ours when he died on the cross.

meaning_english: To go through the process of formal studies.
sample_bolinao: Si mampag'adal anamaet ambo' yan mas ata'gay dyan si maistro na, bale' si sayan nakuston maong a nipag'adal na, makakipada ya konan maistro na.
sample_english: The one who is learning also is not better than his teacher, but the one whose learning is fully complete, he can parallel his teacher.

meaning_english: The kingship of someone.
sample_bolinao: Binindisyunan naynan Dios a pag'aadi' na nin bilang sa nipag'adi' na ni puon tamon si David sin saytaw!
sample_english: God has blessed his reigning like the reigning of our ancestor David in the past!

meaning_english: To put something down on a support to take the brunt of something such as a chopping block.
To experience some kind of difficulty.
To make something become something.
sample_bolinao: Say nipag'in nin wanin ket gawa' nan Catawan.
sample_english: It turning out like that is the work of the Divine .

meaning_english: To governing.
sample_bolinao: Bana' sa pagmamatalek ra, main konra a nakadaeg nin pupag'adian, main konra a matunong a nipag'uray ra, main saray nakarisibi nin nipangako' nan Dios konra, tan main sara anamaet a kai ra nin napa'no nin leon ta napikmi' ray bebey ra.
sample_english: Because of their trust, there were those among them that suppressed kingdoms, there were those among them that their governing was right according to standard, there were those that were able to receive what God had promised to them, and there were those as well who where not injured by lions since they closed their mouths.

meaning_english: To ask somebody to hold something.
sample_bolinao: Ipaga'getma pa yapo' sa anak kona ni Ana.
sample_english: Will you initially let Anaholdthe child.

meaning_english: To lease out something.
sample_bolinao: Ipaga'getankoya pay ti si anak ta kalapen koya li' lamang.
sample_english: Will you pleasetake holdof this child and I'll take her just the same later on.

meaning_english: To grant a request or a reward.
sample_bolinao: tan mataman no kidawat kamo konan Catawan kai nan lamang ipaga'mor komoyo ta say duka' a gagara moyon kidawat, rabay moyo tamo' a makadumog nin karigawan.
sample_english: and even if you request of the Divine, he doesn't give it to you anyway for your request has evil purpose/motives, you only want to be able to discover pleasure.

meaning_english: To bestow/give something to be received.
sample_bolinao: Saytin kamaungan na, nigagara naynan gindat nin ipaga'muran kontamo sin saytaw et sin ba'yo nin tinmarana' a sarba yupa' sa gaw'en na nin Cristo a si Jesus.
sample_english: This goodness of his, he purposed to bestow upon us in the past even before everything began by means of what Christ who is Jesus would do.

meaning_english: To give something or some responsibility over to someone else's authority.
sample_bolinao: Sanribo a ipagamet na ni Mario konra ni Juan tan Ella ta ba'yon kasal sara.
sample_english: Mario gave a thousand peso to Juan and Ella for they newlyweds.

meaning_english: To have something drug over a rough surface.
To give someone something to do.
sample_bolinao: Si sayay aripen, nasadya' tan tumulok ya sa ipagawa' kona.
sample_english: A slave is prepared and obeys what he is given to do.

meaning_english: Caused to be put in the sunshine.
sample_bolinao: No benged yay anak,nipagawgawnasaray anak ra.
sample_english: If the child is lazy, they will make him stay in the hot sunshine.

meaning_english: Caused to be removed.
sample_bolinao: Nipaglatannayay ulo ni Santiago.
sample_english: Heremovedthe head of James.

meaning_english: To be proud of, thinking too well of oneself.
sample_bolinao: Andi'ipagmamalakia kabistawan byay sawanin ta kai tanda' sa suyot a awro.
sample_english: Don'tbeproud of the good situation you have now for you don't know what is to come.

meaning_english: To drive a spike where the rope of the animal is tied on a grassy field. (focus is on the object.)
sample_bolinao: Mako maipagoda damulag sa gagawa'.
sample_english: Go anddrivethespikeof the rope of thecarabaoin the field.

meaning_english: For the wind to carry something away from the current direction such as in pouring out grain so that the wind will carry away the chaff.
To shake solid things out or off of something.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket mangipagpag ya yapo' nin ta'pok nan sapatos na sa liwa' bali, ba'yo ya nin sumrep sa bali na.
sample_english: Juan knocks the dust off his shoes outside first before he enters his house.

meaning_english: To give service to something.
sample_bolinao: Main nga'min kona a pakayadi' nan si u'nan makapali'mon ayep tan man'usaren nayti nin ipagsirbi kona.
sample_english: He had in him every one of the powers of the first terrifying animal and he was using these in service to him.

meaning_english: To be used in working.
sample_bolinao: Ket madali' rayan mabasa nin si'numan a tawo nin maka'kit sa mabistan bunga nin nipagtrabaho mi komoyo.
sample_english: And so it is easily read by any person who sees the good fruit of the way we worked for you.

meaning_english: To place someone someplace to stay for a limited time.
sample_bolinao: Ipagtuluyan na ni Sam a anak na nin rway awro konan busat na.
sample_english: Sam place his child with his brother for two days.

meaning_english: To place a guard on something.
sample_bolinao: Tinimbryan rayay sada' nan pantyon tan nipagwardyawan raya ta pigaw nin masigurado ran kasa gapon makatege' kona.
sample_english: They put a seal on the stone closing the tomb and they placed a guard on it so that they could be sure there would be no one at all who would be able to disturb it.

meaning_english: To laid many things down.
sample_bolinao: Ket adtiman a kami'nan na ni Jesus, sa bubabali man, o sa bubaryo o sa lulugar a basta main nin bubali, saray main nin masakit ket ipai-paida' rasara nin tutawo sa puplasa, tan ipainganga'do ra kona a mataman no ipakudit na tana konran main nin masakit a saroy nin seket na.
sample_english: And wherever place Jesus was, either in towns or villages or places as long as there were houses, those with sickness, the people laid them down in the plazas, and they would plead with him that he might just let them even touch the edge of his clothes.

meaning_english: To have something brought someplace.
sample_bolinao: Kinayaban nako nin si priso nin si Pablo tan nipai'ras nayadti ti nin tumububa'yo ta main kano nin ibarita' na komoyo.
sample_english: I was summoned by Pablo, the prisoner, and he had me bring this young man here for he has something to say to you .

meaning_english: To have somebody tell something to another person.
sample_bolinao: Ipaibarita' mo koni Juan nin mag'adal yan maong a ari na sa iskol.
sample_english: Let Juan know that his younger sibling is studying well in school.

meaning_english: To lay a person down.
sample_bolinao: Nipaidaraya.
sample_english: Theylaidher down.

meaning_english: To have something offered as a sacrifice.
sample_bolinao: Ket ipaida'ton ra konan padi' a say matkap para sa ritwal sa pakaparinggas.
sample_english: And-so they went to-have-offered by the priest that which was necessary for the ritual of cleansing.

meaning_english: To have something go directly someplace.
sample_bolinao: Ipadiritso mayna pay ruran sa bali pinggat kai atayna nin lumalako.
sample_english: Have the vehicle go directly to the house so that we won't have to walk.

meaning_english: To have someone entertain someone.
sample_bolinao: Mamibi akon anak a daikleng no ipaikap koya.
sample_english: I carry a small child in my arms when I take him to play with him.

meaning_english: To given ownership.
sample_bolinao: Si Dios, pinili' nasara a pubri iti sa mundo nin mag'in nin mayaman sa pammemper, ket ipaikon naya konra a Pag'adian na nin nipangako' na konran saray mangado' kona.
sample_english: God chose those who are poor here in the world to become rich in faith and so he will give to them ownership of his Kingdom which he promised to those who love him.

meaning_english: To have someone medically massage the body or set a bone.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka mamaksir no ipailot may bulo' mo.
sample_english: Don't stiffen up when you are having your dislocated bone massaged into place..

meaning_english: To publish.
sample_bolinao: Sarban mampangyadi' sa Manilaipaimprintara sa periodiko.
sample_english: All events in Manila are printed in the newspaper.

meaning_english: To weld something.
sample_bolinao: Ipainang yay tubo ta nabari' ya.
sample_english: The tube should be welded because it is broken.

meaning_english: To relax or take a rest.
sample_bolinao: Si Dios ket nipainawa yayna ta nakumplito nayna a gawa' na.
sample_english: God rested since his work was completed.

meaning_english: To plead for mercy.
sample_bolinao: Ket adtiman a kami'nan na ni Jesus, sa bubabali man, o sa bubaryo o sa lulugar a basta main nin bubali, saray main nin masakit ket ipai-paida' rasara nin tutawo sa puplasa, tan ipainganga'do ra kona a mataman no ipakudit na tana konran main nin masakit a saroy nin seket na.
sample_english: And wherever place Jesus was, either in towns or villages or places as long as there were houses, those with sickness, the people laid them down by in the plazas, and they would plead with him that he might just let them even touch the edge of his clothes.

meaning_english: To motivate or prompt someone or to expresses to someone by means of something.
sample_bolinao: Ipaingar tamoy pangawa'nan tamo konran a'nak tamo.
sample_english: Our love for our children motivates us.

meaning_english: To make someone drink something.
sample_bolinao: No pa'no kabayani a arak nin nipainom na konran raruman tawo, dubli li' sa bayani a ipainom kona.
sample_english: To the extent of the strength/fierceness of the wine that she made other people drink, she will be made to drink double the strength/fierceness of that.

meaning_english: To move something a small distance.
sample_bolinao: Ipainunor ma padti in si basyada sa dani ko.
sample_english: Please push the serving bowl a bit closer to me.

meaning_english: To have something nailed.
sample_bolinao: Ket ka'kit ran pupangulo ran pupadi' tan saray gwardya sa Timplo kona ni Jesus, niburyaw ra, <<Ipaipasak ma in sa kudos!
sample_english: And then at the first sight the leaders of the priests and the Temple guards had of Jesus, they shouted, <<Have him nailed to a cross!

meaning_english: To make someone undergo suffering.
sample_bolinao: Andi' tamoyna nin ipairangep a idap nin byay konran ua'nak.
sample_english: Let us not cause difficulty in life for the children.

meaning_english: To place something on a slant.
To cook meat or fish wrapped in banana leaves over a fire.
sample_bolinao: Ipaismoy bulongSanta Mariaba'yo mo iyapros sa lalaman.
sample_english: Cookover the fire the wrapped leaves of St. Mary then rub over the body.

meaning_english: To have something tested or tried.
sample_bolinao: Ipaisari'ma pa tanayti si aysing koni Meriam?
sample_english: Would you have Miriamtrythis dress on?

meaning_english: To put under something.
sample_bolinao: Bana' ta sarayti ket sayan-saya a gagara ra, ipaisirong ray pakayadi' tan pakauray ra konan makapali'mon ayep.
sample_english: Because these have one purpose, they will place their power and authority under the terrifying animal.

meaning_english: To have something returned.
sample_bolinao: Ipaisubli' nayadti li' a lamang kainsanan.
sample_english: He will cause to be returned it here just the same later today.

meaning_english: To have something bonded.
To dictate or have something be written.
sample_bolinao: Si laking Jose ket ipaisurat na sa anak na a rabay nan surat sa gubirno.
sample_english: Grandfather Jose dictated to his child what he wanted to write to the governor.

meaning_english: To have something put up high.
sample_bolinao: Ipaita'gay ma pa koni Sam a sayay lata nin ranom sa pluring ta pigaw kai naya maabot nin aso.
sample_english: Have Sam put the can of water up on the flooring so that the dog cannot get it.

meaning_english: To bring someone through a hardship that needs to be persevered.
To have something to be delivered or escorted safely someplace.
sample_bolinao: Ket say sinmunor, nipaiyater naya ni Anas si Jesus nin nabaror et a gamet na, kona ni Caifas a syay Sangkata'gayan nin Padi'.
sample_english: And then what follow, Anas had Jesus escorted still hand bound, to Caifas who it was was the Highest Priest.

meaning_english: Surprise.
sample_bolinao: Ket si tatay na, sabtan tuloynipaka'ngapna.
sample_english: And his father was very muchsurprisedby it.

meaning_english: To make something bald.
sample_bolinao: Ipakalbo kway ulo ko tepe' ma'mot a panaon.
sample_english: I have my head shaved bald each hot season.

meaning_english: To give something for food.
sample_bolinao: Aburido sara no aniipa'kanra koni Juan.
sample_english: They worried about what they wouldfeedJuan.

meaning_english: To display an expected response based on one's ability or character.
sample_bolinao: Ipakana'nay sager na sin parsawan rayan maistra na.
sample_english: Hedisplayedanger when he was blamed by his teachers.

meaning_english: To report something to the captain.
sample_bolinao: Hali, ipakapitan rakamo ta nanakaw kamon batag!
sample_english: Beware/Watch out, they are going to file charges to the Barangay Captain against you for having stole bananas.

meaning_english: To have someone frisk someone.
sample_bolinao: Ipakapkap nan pulis konan tanod a sulot ran kriminal nin nadakep ra.
sample_english: The police had the watchman frisk the clothing of the criminals they had captured.

meaning_english: To have someone frisk a certain person.
sample_bolinao: Ipakapkapan nan amo mi gwardya a sumrep nin tawo sa budiga mi.
sample_english: Our boss has the guard frisk the person that enters our bodega at work.

meaning_english: To have a search made for a physical item.
sample_bolinao: Nipakrap naya ni Herodes bale' kai raya nin nadumog.
sample_english: Herodes put out a search for him but they did not find him.

meaning_english: To given the responsibility of something.
sample_bolinao: Pagawan moyoy lalaman moyon diri tan saray sarba ran tutawo na nin Dios nin nipakargo nan Ispirito na komoyo a mammaga rakamon saray tutawo nan Dios nin nipurok na yupa' sa nipamaturo' nan daya' nan diri nin Anak na.
sample_english: Take care of your own selves and all the people of God whom the Spirit has put you in charge of to be a caregiver of those people God whom he had set apart by means of the shedding of the blood of his own Child.

meaning_english: To give someone to be married.
sample_bolinao: Bara'mo kamon birhin nin balasang a nitarato kon ipakasal konan sayan-saya tamo' nin lalaki, si Cristo, tan apes kon iyagwang katamo kona nin kasa gapon mansa.
sample_english: It is as though you are a teenage virgin which I have agreed to give in marriage to only one certain man, Christ, and I desire to hand you over to him without any stain/clean.

meaning_english: To sin attributed to som.
sample_bolinao: ta la'wanen raya awa' a magkabiso' ya sa pag'iirgo na ket main nin ipakasalanan ra kona.
sample_english: since they would possibly snare/trap him perhaps into making a mistake in his words/speech and so there could be a fault that could be brought against him.

meaning_english: To use or show one's ability or knowledge.
sample_bolinao: Ipakatmoyna sawanin a kaungan mo nin magdiskurso.

sample_bolinao: Ket narate' rayan natulin anaytaw si baton nipanada' konan nanabunan.
sample_english: And so they came upon that stone for covering the tomb having already been rolled away.

meaning_english: To be used to sharpen something.
To do in preparation for something.
sample_bolinao: Sayti say niluto' ko ket ipanadya' ko sa bisita ko.
sample_english: This that I have cooked I am preparing for my visitors.

meaning_english: Slats of bamboo on the ridge of roof to press cogon roofing into position.
sample_bolinao: Siti si mantawagen nin Kabalikasan nan Dios, main nin lumiwa' sa bebey na nin ispada a pinasyan tadem nin ipanaeg na sa sarba nin nasyon, ket mairot nin pag'urayan na.
sample_english: This one that is called the Expression of God, there is coming out of his mouth a sword that is extremely sharp with which he subdues all nations, and so his governing will be strict.

meaning_english: Scarecrow in the fields.
sample_bolinao: Sitawu-tawosa butlay gagawa' kinwan rayay lata pigaw no main manok manok a mako sa pari, guroyen raya ket tumnoy ya ket lumpad sara.
sample_english: Thescarecrowthat stands on the fields has a can with a string attached to it; when the crows will come, the string is pulled and gives a «klang» sound so that the birds are frightened and fly away.

meaning_english: Fetch water for somebody.
sample_bolinao: Sin sain, wana nin babayi, <<Ser, ararem yayti si bubon ket kasa anamaet nin ipanago' mo.>>
sample_english: At that the woman said, <<Sir, this well is deep and then you as well don't have anything to draw with.>>

meaning_english: To invite or persuade by some means.
sample_bolinao: Bana' anaod sa sain, si'kamo bubsat nin ikon nan Dios bana' ta makakirama' kamo sa nipanagyat na mangibwat sa langit, adalen moyoy maipa'ka' konan si man'ipatandaan tamon Sangkata'gayan nin Padi' tan Ibabaki'.
sample_english: Because of that indeed, you siblings who belong to God because you are participating in having been invited/persuaded by him from heaven, study concerning the one whom we are proclaiming as Highest Priest and the Messenger.

meaning_english: Things used to put a point on something.
sample_bolinao: Main awit na nin ipanahar konan lapis na.
sample_english: He brought something to sharpen his pencil with.

meaning_english: To put as a covering.
To cover over something.
sample_bolinao: Mangawit kan panyo' nin ipanakeb sa bebey mo no miku'ko' ka.
sample_english: Bring a handkerchief to cover your mouth with if you cough.

meaning_english: To be used for catching.or arresting someone or something.
sample_bolinao: Tapigo a ipanakep ko nin kuna' sa pasabing.
sample_english: I catch fish in the fish corral with a small framed net..

meaning_english: To use something to secure something in place.
To use something to net fish with a scooping up action.
sample_bolinao: Say tapigo,ipanakyodkonran kuna' sa pasabing.
sample_english: The framed net is used to scoop fish out of the fish trap.

meaning_english: To put a lock on something.
sample_bolinao: Tumbok a ipanalak purta.
sample_english: A key is used for locking the door.

meaning_english: To use for trapping of fish.
To attack something violently.
sample_bolinao: Marnge' a pararpak na sa gurot nan kalaban na ta maksaw a nipanali na.
sample_english: The crack of his opponent's back was heard because of his violent attack.

meaning_english: To use for protection.
sample_bolinao: Abel nin makubpal a ipanalimbeng lalaman.
sample_english: A thick cloth that is used to protect the body.

meaning_english: To fasten something with a substance used to stick things together such as glue.
sample_bolinao: Mainipanalitmon ritrato sa albom?
sample_english: Do you have aglueto paste your pictures in your album?

meaning_english: To give something in purchasing something.
sample_bolinao: IpanaliwnakonCoke.
sample_english: Buya Cokeforme.

meaning_english: Used for threshing rice.
sample_bolinao: A'lo a usaren ko nin ipanaltag irik sa a'song
sample_english: A pestle is what I use for threshing rice in a mortar.

meaning_english: To use something to medicate.
sample_bolinao: Manaliw kamo et a lamang kongko nin ipanambar sa pag'in moyo nin bulag ta pigaw nin ma'kit moyo a katutu'wan.
sample_english: Buy further from me also medicine for what made you blind in order that you would be able to see the truth.

meaning_english: To prepare something to present to a visitor.
sample_bolinao: Nibati' koy alalakin mangga pigaw main nin ipanan'ili ko no lumpos.
sample_english: I left some large mangoes so that there will be something to use to welcome my guests at the feast.

meaning_english: To bring injury on or torture someone.
sample_bolinao: Say pakababa' ran mangmati nin saraytin kabayo ket sa bebey ra tan sa ikoy ra ta say ikoy ra ket bara'mon ulay nin main nin ulo nin usaren ran ipananakit nin tutawo.
sample_english: The ability of these horses to kill was in their mouths and in their tails since their tails were like a snake with a head they used to torture people.

meaning_english: To use to block a hit.
To put down for flooring.
sample_bolinao: Alalaki nin kayo a ginarugadi' nin maimpis a gaw'en tapi' bali; agaba' nin kayo a maimpis a nipangarugadi' a ipanapi' bali.
sample_english: Lumber.

meaning_english: To use something for wiping something.
sample_bolinao: Dimpo a ipanarapo na sa rupa na.
sample_english: A face cloth is what I use for wiping my face.

meaning_english: To administer severe pain by some means
sample_bolinao: Ipanasakit ni Juan a gemgem na no manaso ya.
sample_english: Jaun packs quite a wallop with his fist when he throws a punch.

meaning_english: Use to punch with.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mo usaren a gamet mo nin ipanaso sa kapada mon tawo.
sample_english: Don't use you hands for punching your fellow man.

meaning_english: To call by the use of something.
sample_bolinao: Ket no wanin, mayin edet a Uunuren a nipanawag na ni David kona sa nipaninreg nan Ispirito nan Dios?
sample_english: And so , if that's it, well then why is it that David by the motivation of the Spirit of God called him by the word Lord?

meaning_english: Quench a fire with water.
sample_bolinao: Manago' kan ranom nin ipanebseb sa uring pigaw kai mapungpong.
sample_english: Get water to quench the fire in the charcoal so that it burned up.

meaning_english: To use something for sucking.
A tool or materials used in opening.
sample_bolinao: Abridor a ipangabri ko nin butilya.
sample_english: What I use to open a bottle is a bottle opener.

meaning_english: To use for plowing.
sample_bolinao: Keen kosara nin sarien nin ipangadado.
sample_english: I will go to try them at plowing.

meaning_english: To use something to scrape up something.
An instrument or object used for shaving or trimming.
sample_bolinao: Matkap matadem yay ipangahit moyon sabot nan pinati moyo baboy ta pigaw nin kasan malabasan.
sample_english: The instrument you use in shaving the hair of the pig you butchered should be sharp so that you will miss nothing.

meaning_english: Things used for making a barricade.
Give a promise or swear to something.
sample_bolinao: Ipangako'ko komo a si'ka tamo' a kawa'nanen ko.
sample_english: Ipromiseyou that you will be the only one I will love.

meaning_english: To use something for fencing.
To take someone's place or substitute for them.
sample_bolinao: Ipangalap ma nin inumen na a anak.
sample_english: Get a drink for the child with it.

meaning_english: Use something for digging up something.
sample_bolinao: Main awit ko nin barita nin magwa' ipangali nin ubi.
sample_english: I brought a bar that can be used for digging up the purple yam.

meaning_english: To acknowledge something.
sample_bolinao: Usaren kway mata ko nin ipangalilbi' konan bakas na.
sample_english: I use my eyes to give him acknowledgment of his being there.

meaning_english: To use to bind something.
Use to give a sour flavor.
sample_bolinao: Say pigagawa' nan sitin bungan kayo bara'mon bakas nin lukban bale' dudaite' ya tan kai ma'kan a laman na no kai ipangalsem tamo' a sabaw na, pespesan para kuna'.
sample_english: A citrus fruit like kalamansi' which is used in bagoong. It's sour, a bit bigger than kalamansi', green, and shaped like pomelo on the inside.

meaning_english: To use something for whipping.
sample_bolinao: Mampaidapen moy lalaman mon diri no wanin ta bara'mo kan sayay kabayo nin mansipawen nayay maserey nin man'ipangambak kona.
sample_english: You make it difficult for your own self if it is like that because you are like a horse that kicks the pointed stick for whipping him.

meaning_english: Food which is given to be eaten with rice.
sample_bolinao: Kasanipanganmi; kalla sina'pang tamo'.
sample_english: We do not haveanything to eat;its only boiled rice that we have.

meaning_english: Give name.
sample_bolinao: Ipangaranmo kona, Jesus.
sample_english: You willnamehim Jesus.

meaning_english: To load something with something.
To put under arrest.
sample_bolinao: Adi a nipangaristo kona ni Ninoy.
sample_english: Ninoy's arrest was in secret.

meaning_english: To be used for decoration.
To use something to cut with a scissor action.
sample_bolinao: Main indam ko nin ipangartib nin dikot.
sample_english: There was a cutting tool I borrowed to cut the grass.

meaning_english: To use something for beating someone.
A sharpening tool such as a grinding wheel.
sample_bolinao: Manaliw kan ipangasa' beneng no mako ka sa babali.
sample_english: Buy something for sharpening the bolo when you go to town.

meaning_english: The process done of getting married.
To use something as a whip.
sample_bolinao: Namurot yan bislak nin ipangaspok ta masager ya.
sample_english: He picked up a bamboo slate to use as a whip since was angry.

meaning_english: Things used for flogging.
To cook fish in a stew of vinegar, sugar, salt, ginger and pepper with a small amount of water.
sample_bolinao: Ipangat moyti say tiblon.
sample_english: Stew this milkfish.

meaning_english: To be used to feed milk.
sample_bolinao: Si sepsepen sa parpar nan butilya a ipangatas sa anak.
sample_english: The thing used for sucking at the top of the bottle used to feed milk to a child.

meaning_english: To use for roofing.
Something used for carving.
Something that is used for biting.
To move something someplace for safe keeping.
To proudly rely on something and vaunt it.
sample_bolinao: Ket si'kamo anamaet nin kapada kon Judio, man'ipangaya moyon pinili' nakamon Dios nin tutawo na.
sample_english: And so you my fellow Jews as well, you are vaunting that God has chosen you to be his people.

meaning_english: To use for summoning someone or thing.
To use something to attract somebody or something.
sample_bolinao: Pa'no bale'nipangayatni Pablo a nag'in Apostoles adalan ni Jesus.
sample_english: How was Paulattractedto become the Apostle of Jesus.

meaning_english: To use something for grating strips.
sample_bolinao: Ma'get yay kayos mi no ipangayos yan ungot ta gawa' ya sa pasak.
sample_english: Our grated which we use for grating coconuts is durable for it is made of steel.

meaning_english: To use something to mend nets.
That which is used for putting something in a mailbox.
sample_bolinao: Pitsawanmoy surat mo sa awro nin ipangibuson mo.
sample_english: Dateyour letter with the day you put it into the mail box.

meaning_english: To use something to glue something together.
sample_bolinao: Juan, ipangidalit nako pa nin dikurasyon nin papil sa padir.
sample_english: Juan, could you glue the paper with the directions to the property wall for me.

meaning_english: To debone something.
sample_bolinao: Kada mangan akon kuna', ipangimlat nako ni nanay.
sample_english: Each time I eat fish mother debones it for me.

meaning_english: Everyday use such as dress, shoes, etc.
sample_bolinao: Kai matkapipanginawru-awroa yunipurmi.
sample_english: Uniform should not be foreveryday use.

meaning_english: To use something for putting pressure on something.
sample_bolinao: Tangan a ipanginerner na ni Juan nin tamtaks sa tapi'.
sample_english: It was the thumb that Juan used to push the thumbtacks into the board.

meaning_english: The things used for nailing.
sample_bolinao: Sa raruman lugar sin nu'nan panaon, inusar a kudos sa panunusa konran kriminal tan duka' a tutawo yupa' sa nipangipasak konra.
sample_english: In other places in former times a cross was used for the punishment of those criminals and evil people by means of nailing them to it.

meaning_english: To lean something against anything that is strong to support.
sample_bolinao: Nipangirig rayay aydan sa ringring.
sample_english: Theyleanedthe ladder against the wall.

meaning_english: The item used for threshing rice from the stalk.
sample_bolinao: Ayi a ipangirik nin pari si saytaw sin nu'nan panaon.
sample_english: Feet were used to thresh rice during the early times.

meaning_english: To strip lengthwise.
sample_bolinao: Matadem a lansita a ipangisa' nin silag a apayen; blid a nibali sa kayo a ipangisa' nin silag a apayen; panautan konan silag yupa' sa sayay matadem a agamiren pigaw masadya' nin apayen.
sample_english: The mechanism used to strip buri leaves. To tear an item lengthwise.; To cut.

meaning_english: To use something abrasive for scrubbing.
sample_bolinao: Iskrin a ipangisgis ko sa kardiro no mauring.
sample_english: Its a screen I use to scrub the kettle when it black with soot.

meaning_english: Razor, tool or materials used for shaving short hair such as hair of the head, of the legs, animal hair like pig, carabao, etc.
sample_bolinao: Bliyd a usaren ran ipangiskis nin pinatin ayep bilang sa baboy, kanding o aso.
sample_english: Razor blade is what they use for shaving the hair of butchered animals such as pig, goat or dog.

meaning_english: To use something for stirring.
sample_bolinao: Sagirap a ipangiwar ko nin pansit no mangluto' ako.
sample_english: Its a soup ladle that I use to stir the pancit when I am cooking it.

meaning_english: To use something to bring about a settlement.
sample_bolinao: Nami saran kwarta nin ipangiyariglo ra konan nadisgrasya ra.
sample_english: They gave some money to bring about the settlement of their accident.

meaning_english: hitter, used for hitting.
sample_bolinao: Nangalap yan bato nin ipangket na konran kaaway na.
sample_english: He got a stone to hit his adversary with.

meaning_english: To use something for seeing.
To used for oiling.
sample_bolinao: Usaren ti no ladakan yay makina; ipangladak.
sample_english: Oiler; oil can.

meaning_english: Things used for whipping.
To use something to remove something else.
To use something freely.
sample_bolinao: Say kapagkapag nin kwarta ko, ma'pos et ninipanglibri.
sample_english: The only money I have; it will be consumed being used freely/treating friends with food, etc.

meaning_english: To used to deceive someone.
sample_bolinao: tan mangusar yan sarbayna nin klasin kadukaan nin ipanglingo na konran saray sidaen li'.
sample_english: and he will employ all forms of evil in order to deceive those who will be destroyed.

meaning_english: To use something to clean.
sample_bolinao: Klasin alkuhol a usaren ran saray nangabing nin iyapros ran ipanglinis nin lalaman ra.
sample_english: Pure refined alcohol specially used as disinfectant by woman who had just given birth.

meaning_english: To use something to form a straight line.
sample_bolinao: Itiko' ma a rubir nin man'ipanglinya nin darekdek no mirate' ya sa duyo.
sample_english: Turn or bend the rope being used to align the fence posts when it reaches the corner.

meaning_english: Anything that is used to make somebody happy.

sample_english: I give these flowers to give you comfort.

meaning_english: To use something as a tool in opening bottles, canned goods, removing lids, etc.
sample_bolinao: Maabilidad saray Filipino; mausar ray animan nin ipangluat nin bagay-bagay.
sample_english: Filipinos have various ingenuities; they are able to use whatever in opening various things.

meaning_english: To use something for peeling.
sample_bolinao: Mangawit kan kutsilyo nin ipanglupis nan mangga.
sample_english: Carry a knife to use for peeling a mango.

meaning_english: To use something for fuel for cooking.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a matkap nin kayo nin ipangluto' nin binungey.
sample_english: A lot of wood is needed for cooking tube rice.

meaning_english: To used for marking on something.
sample_bolinao: Kaaram, main nin na'kit kon saya et nin anghil a mampuli' nangibwat sa baytan a awit naya a ipangmarka nan si sibibyay a Dios.
sample_english: Subsequently, there was still another angel that I saw ascending from the east who was carrying that used for placing the markof the living God.

meaning_english: To put something to death.
sample_bolinao: Main klasi ipangmatin mikrubyo, main anamaet nin puuran nin mamin amot uno pressure, tan main anamaet nin usaren sa makapabok inumen.
sample_english: Alcohol, as ethyl or isoprophyl alcohol for disinfectant, denatured alcohol that is burnt as fuel, and the kind that is used in intoxicating drinks.

meaning_english: To used to crush.
sample_bolinao: Pinalimpek a anron kayo nin main dinmaite' a gaga'getan sa butlay nin usaren yan ipambayo, ipangrekrek uno ipangmek sa a'song uno ipanaltag sa bilog.
sample_english: A rounded piece of wood about five inches in diameter and six feet long used to pound or grind substances as in a mortar or used for threshing rice in a threshing mortar.

meaning_english: Search blindly with the hands for something.
sample_bolinao: Talmak a ipangrap ra nin byatbyat sa ruru'mot.
sample_english: Cockles are trampled on in searching for them in the muddy areas

meaning_english: To give something in worship.
sample_bolinao: Wami sa surat: Andi' sara nin mangan nin naida'ton nin nipangrayo sa dios-dios, tan andi' sara nin mangna' nin daya' tan nin karni nin pinatin ayep a kai nin pinadaya', tan andi' ra nin sama'-samaen a lalaman ra yupa' sa ambo' nin manepeg a pirararay.
sample_english: We said in the letter: They must not eat that which has been offered to gods, and they must not eat blood and not eat meat of slaughtered animals which were not bled, and they must not dirty themselves by means of improper sexual relations.

meaning_english: To be used to fragment something.
sample_bolinao: Almiris a ipangrekrek ko nin paminta.
sample_english: I use a small brass mortar when I crush black pepper.

meaning_english: Receive hearing.
sample_bolinao: Saray main tutulyan ninipangrenge'rumnge' sara.
sample_english: Those who have ears that can hear, they listen.

meaning_english: To use something for seasoning.
sample_bolinao: Manaliw kan ipangrikado ta sa minudo.
sample_english: Buy what we will use for seasoning the mixed pork dish.

meaning_english: That which is used to rivet or nail something.
To use something for cleaning.

sample_english: I bought the dish-washing soap.

meaning_english: To use for walling.

sample_english: Woven bamboo is what I will use for walling on my hut.

meaning_english: To use for an attack or for aggression against another.
To use something for taking a picture.

sample_english: It is used for taking a picture if it is desired to get the form of a place or face of a person.

meaning_english: To act pompously and cruelly.
sample_bolinao: Marumi'ya sa busat na.
sample_english: He iscruelto her brothers and sisters.

meaning_english: To slash with something.
Used for scraping or smoothing something.

sample_english: That is what you are to use for scrapping the cassava.

meaning_english: To use something for making a hole for planting a seed in.
sample_bolinao: Mamaserey akon kayo nin ipangsad no mama'sek.
sample_english: I have a stick sharpened to use for making the planting hole when doing dry-land farming.

meaning_english: Anything use to scratch - fingernails, cloth, etc.

sample_english: Seed of the gu'go' tree. It is a big tree that grows in the forest and its pods are pounded out for shampoo and soap.

meaning_english: That which is used to surround and capture fish.

sample_english: We use screen to capture screen.

meaning_english: To use something to form an enclosure.

sample_english: I use fence slats to make and enclosure for the goats.

meaning_english: Something used to scrape with.
To have someone push the head of something.

sample_english: Get the one who caught it to push the head of the eel in so that it won't be able to bite.

meaning_english: To use something to make something disoriented, confused.
sample_bolinao: Wakay udino kukayo a kalapen sa tatalon usaren ran ipangulaw kuna' pigaw maulaw sara ket mainum'ay saran madakep.
sample_english: A type of food or poison for getting fish. It causes the fish to become disoriented.

meaning_english: To give authoritative leadership over someone.
sample_bolinao: Saray sundalo' nin taga Roma a nipangulo nan kapitan ra, dinakep raya si Jesus.
sample_english: The Roman soldiers lead by their captain arrested Jesus.

meaning_english: Use to color something.
sample_bolinao: Kampitsi a usaren ko nin ipangulor nin silag.
sample_english: I use a dye to color the wicker.

meaning_english: To leading to a goal.

sample_english: He also teaches Tito what must be the customs of the various members and how Tito is to lead and teach them.

meaning_english: To arrange something.
sample_bolinao: Marimpes a nipangunong ran agamiren.
sample_english: Their utensils arefitlyarranged.

meaning_english: To use in opposition to something.

sample_english: He explained why he did not follow/push through on his plan to visit them and why he has written so harshly about the accusations and the opposition against him of those in their group.

meaning_english: To use something in the process of cooking.

meaning_english: To use something to form a line.
Grater, a person or thing that grates.

sample_english: Galvanized iron is made into agraterused to grate coconuts.

meaning_english: To use to comb something.

sample_english: I use a comb to comb my hair.

meaning_english: To making an examination of something.

sample_english: But in my interrogating him I found nothing he did that he ought to be punished by death.

meaning_english: To use something for washing something.
sample_bolinao: Ranom a ipanguyas ko sa byas no mana'pang ako.
sample_english: It is water that I use to wash rice when I boil it.

meaning_english: To use a hand tool to dig out a hole.
To have something done or made for someone.

sample_english: Will youplease makefor me a ladle for rice and one for vegetables.

meaning_english: To be in the function of giving a value to something.
To hide something from someone.

sample_english: Tiago always hides food for his dog from the food of his masters.

meaning_english: To use to bring something to completion.
sample_bolinao: Matkap ko et a kwarta nin ipangyadi' ko konan bali ko.
sample_english: I still need some money to use for finishing my house.

meaning_english: To use as a tool for harvesting.
sample_bolinao: Gamrang a gindat nin ipangyatab.
sample_english: Thegamrangis a tool formerly used for harvesting.

meaning_english: To put something such as money, etc. in a safe place for someone.

meaning_english: To keep or put away something for or on behalf of someone.

sample_english: Please put away for me my things that are on the table.

meaning_english: To use for clamping.
To use something as a slated surface.
sample_bolinao: Kawayan a ipaniir ko konan dalagan ko.
sample_english: Bamboo is what I use for slated surface of my settee.

meaning_english: To put a spell on.

sample_english: The people there, they led astray the people in the world by putting a spell on them.

meaning_english: That which is mixed together with something else.
Things used to knock something down from a high place.
To use something to gather things together.
To get earnings from something.

sample_english: The tricycle is what they use when they are earning a living working an assigned route.

meaning_english: To use something for slicing.

sample_english: A knife is what I use to slice the seasoning with.

meaning_english: To use something to cover over or protect something.

sample_english: The porch of our house was covered over with honeycombed nipa leaves.

meaning_english: An intentional violation of some standard.

sample_english: Fortunate is the person whose violations, they are forgiven and forgotten by God.

meaning_english: To put something to the test.

sample_english: Don't make a way to put to the test the Lord who is your God.

meaning_english: To use something for pointing.
To play music using something.

sample_english: I am not so interested in this kind of instrument because it is played with the mouth.

meaning_english: To use to measure, tape measure.

meaning_english: To place or fit over a protruding object.
To used to fathom or measure the depth.

sample_english: Boatpole; A bamboo pole for poling a boat. It is also used to test the depths of the water while underway.

meaning_english: To use a point object to puncture something.

sample_english: Juan uses a pointed bolo to puncture the neck of the pig when he butchers.

meaning_english: To bring persecution on someone.

sample_english: That Saulo, how he persecuted the believers there!

meaning_english: To splice something.

sample_english: A fibre used to weave a mat. Its striped away from the center of the leaf of thesilagtree; wicker.

meaning_english: Ear cleaner, stick with soft brush or cotton at one end used for ear cleaning.

sample_english: Do not use any kind of stick for cleaning yourearfor there is one there for you to use.

meaning_english: To use something to help.

meaning_english: To used for stringing something into a form.
sample_bolinao: Madidintek nin naylon a ipanuloy ko nin palay.
sample_english: It is the small nylon string that I use for threading the shells.

meaning_english: The material used to start a fire, kindling and igniters.
To use the hands to feed someone.

sample_english: Maria feed her child meat and rice with her hands.

meaning_english: Fuel - wood, coal, etc. which is used for building a fire.
Heat up something.

sample_english: This betel chew they apply to skin disease that they say is caused by spirit beings.

meaning_english: Use to write with.

sample_english: It is nice to write with a ball pen for it moves smoothly.

meaning_english: To use something to capture or move into an enclosure.
To use something for piercing.

meaning_english: To punishment with something.

sample_english: A club; a stick that is used for hitting.

meaning_english: All that is need to support something or someone.
To use something to extract something.

sample_english: There is an instrument the dentist use to extract teeth.

meaning_english: The authorization and appointment of someone for some activity.

sample_english: Yes, today, I have confirmed my  authorization of you.

meaning_english: To shines, puts forth light.
sample_bolinao: Mapalaway nin ipanyo' a asag.
sample_english: Petromax shines brightly.

meaning_english: To have something constructed.

sample_english: And then he had Pablo guarded there in the palace which King Herodes had constructed before.

meaning_english: The owner of the land will allow somebody to build a building on his land.
sample_bolinao: Ipapa'dengan koyay luta' ko nin bali.
sample_english: I will have somebody build a house on my land.

meaning_english: To have someone show something.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' nin man'ipa'kit na nga'min kongko a man-gaw'en na tan main et li' nin gawa' nin ipapa'kit na kongko nin mas makapaka'ngap et dyan say ginwa' ko, ket peteg a maka'ngap kamo li'.
sample_english: Therefore he is showing every single thing to me that he is doing and there are still more works that he will cause me to show that will still be much more amazing than what I have done, and so it is certainly true that you will be amazed.

meaning_english: To let one's kaingin land out to be planted by another person.
sample_bolinao: Ipapa'sekankoyay bangkag ko koni angkay ko.
sample_english: I will have my land beplantedwith rice to my elder brother.

meaning_english: To put somebody to shame.
sample_bolinao: Man'ipading'eyannasaray mangatua nan siin a anak.
sample_english: That child isputtinghis parents t shame.

meaning_english: To have the welder weld a broken item.

sample_english: May I let this broken bar be welded.

meaning_english: To have the function or appearance of something repaired.

sample_english: I will have my watchrepairedsince it is now giving the wrong time.

meaning_english: To explain something making it plain and clear.
sample_bolinao: Ipapalawaymon maong a liksyon pigaw nin mataros mi.
sample_english: Explainthe lesson very well so that we can understand it.

meaning_english: To put something out for bait.

sample_english: Formerly if there were no hermit crabs, what we used for for bait were snails.

meaning_english: To remind a person of something.

sample_english: Will you pleaseremindMaria about the books she borrowed from the school.

meaning_english: To satisfy, or succumb to something.

sample_english: I'llsatisfymy longings.

meaning_english: To cause someone bear a burden or carry a responsibility.

sample_english: Joseph of Arimathea was asked to carry the cross of Jesus.

meaning_english: To shut off all the lights or machines.

meaning_english: To stuff food into the mouth.
sample_bolinao: Ta pigaw nin kai ya ma'pusan nin kanen, si Abian, ipapel nayti.
sample_english: In order that he would not runout of food, Abian stuffed this food into his mouth.

meaning_english: To give clothes to be washed by a laundry person.

meaning_english: To force or compel someone to do something.

sample_english: Jesus wascompelledto carry the cross.

meaning_english: To bring about forgiveness.

sample_english: I willhaveDelia cook the eggplant together with bitter melon for the vegetable..

meaning_english: To put into or out of the heart.
To bring something to the end of a task.
To have something cut.
To discover something.
To place a bet.

meaning_english: To have something place within something.

meaning_english: To compare something as the same, making it equal with something.

meaning_english: To give to someone to settle something.

meaning_english: Flick the ear with the forefinger.

meaning_english: Pass, transfer, give - a ball.

To throw something.

meaning_english: To boast about a certain thing.

meaning_english: To have something replaced with something.

meaning_english: To plead mercy for someone.

meaning_english: To make change.

meaning_english: To pass judgment on someone.

meaning_english: To show off possessions, abilities, etc. to others to gain praise.

meaning_english: To have something put in the wind.
To request mercy for someone.

meaning_english: Drain, to let something wet stand without squeezing until the water is gone.

meaning_english: Anything that brings irritation to a person or leads his mind to get angry.

meaning_english: Looked.

meaning_english: To have something returned.

sample_english: Tennis; a game played either by two or four players using a racket to hit a rubber ball which is volleyed across the net to the opposing player and vice versa.

To have someone remove the effects ofgamod.
To give something to be followed.

meaning_english: To had something written.

meaning_english: To spread something out flat.

meaning_english: To have someone plant something.
