sample_english: The coconuts fall when they use a hook to get them off.

meaning_english: To give something even if it's not yours to someone, to implicate or to involve someone in a situation, usually good.
sample_bolinao: Surat koyayti komoyo nin nirama' nan Dios sa pagmamatalek a parihoy kaalagawan komoyo tan komi.
sample_english: This is my letter to you whom God has drawn into a trusting that is in the same way valuable for you and for us.

meaning_english: To put two things together so as to consider them as one.
To boil in sugar cane water.
Proudly boasting of something that one has or seems true. This is bad to do.
sample_bolinao: Irangas ray kwarta ran mayayaman.
sample_english: The rich brag of their money.

meaning_english: To undergo something, normally a difficulty.
sample_bolinao: Say idap nin irangep nan sayay tawo nan Dios ket nigagaran mangipatunong kona.
sample_english: The hardships that a person of God undergoes are intended for his correction.

meaning_english: To undergo bodily suffering.
sample_bolinao: Irangepen moyoyna a idap byay bana' ta kai kamo nag'adal tan nagnigusyo.
sample_english: You suffer through hardship in life now because you did not get an education and take up a business.

meaning_english: To put something close to the heat.
sample_bolinao: Irangrang moy kayon nalbet ta makusep nin isungroy.
sample_english: Move the wet wood into the heat for it would squelch the firewood.

meaning_english: To include someone or thing in something so that they are intimately involved.
sample_bolinao: Andi' rako iranod sa away moyo.
sample_english: Don't involve me in your quarrel.

meaning_english: To produce water or to make something a liquid by adding water.
sample_bolinao: Tumab'ang a sinigang no abaw a iranom.
sample_english: The sour fish dish losses its flavor when to much water is added.

meaning_english: To make a joke about something but in reality it is probable that it will come true.
For things to have been scattered around in a disorderly fashion.
sample_bolinao: Nirarangsawa agamiren mi.
sample_english: Our tools are scattered all over.

meaning_english: The arrival at a place or of a situation.
sample_bolinao: Hunyo a irarate' nin bagyo sa Pilipinas.
sample_english: The arrival of storms in Baguio is June.

meaning_english: To give a reason for something.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mo nin irason nin adayo' yay bali moyo kanya' pirmi ka masuyot nin rumate'.
sample_english: Don't make the excuse that your house is far away and so therefore you are always late to arrive.

meaning_english: To arrive bringing something or some word.
sample_bolinao: Irate' naya ni Tatay mainsan no yabi a sinaliw nan ba'yon tilibisyon.
sample_english: Father will arrive tonight with the new television set he bought.

meaning_english: For the whole of something to be in a slanting or leaning position.
sample_bolinao: Iray yaynay ba'lag ta ma'ran yayna.
sample_english: The hut is nearly falling over for it is old.

meaning_english: To exert physical energy to force something out of the body, usually with grunts and pain.
sample_bolinao: Iray'es mayti si anak mo ta pinggat madali' yan lumwa'.
sample_english: Push out this child of yours so that he will quickly come out.

meaning_english: To boast about something.
sample_bolinao: No napapteg ya bana' sa maong a gugawa' na, puon in kumon a nirayo ya si Abraham.
sample_english: If he became righteous because of his good works, that should be the source for Abraham's boasting.

meaning_english: To appreciate and give praise.
sample_bolinao: Man'irayu-rayorakan pirmi a Dios sa kaungan mo.
sample_english: Wecontinually praiseyou Oh God for your goodness.

meaning_english: To put something under a liquid.
sample_bolinao: No mi'sa ket irebreb nakon mangiyakay nin tumangoy.
sample_english: Sometimes he would submerge me to teach me to swim.

meaning_english: The communication or conversations of a person.
sample_bolinao: Sin karate' kodti, Tagalog airgoko.
sample_english: When I arrived here, myspeechwas Tagalog.

meaning_english: To speak about something.
sample_bolinao: Makataros akon daikleng bale' kai ko tanda' ninirgwen.
sample_english: I understand a little but I don't know how tospeakit.

meaning_english: The inheritor of something.
sample_bolinao: Si'koy iridiro nan luta' no mati yay ama ko.
sample_english: I am his heir to the land when my father dies.

meaning_english: To be in a position of leaning against something.
sample_bolinao: Madlaw a irig ko sa tinekrean ko.
sample_english: It is clear that I lean on my seat.

meaning_english: To give something as a gift.
sample_bolinao: Nirigalo nayti kona sin nipasbot naya konan Cristo a si Jesus.
sample_english: He gave this as a gift to him when he redeemed him by the Christ who is Jesus.

meaning_english: Lean against.
sample_bolinao: Para irigan ya a gurot nin tekrean.
sample_english: The back of a chair is for leaning against.

meaning_english: Harvested rice, unhusked and without the straw.
sample_bolinao: Binabayo ra airiksa a'song.
sample_english: They pounded theunhusked ricein the mortar.

meaning_english: To thresh, to separate the grain or seed from the stalk, usually by trampling or pounding.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma nin berberen a bebey nan baka a man'usaren nin mangirik.
sample_english: Do not tie the mouth of the cow which is being used in threshing.

meaning_english: To file a legal complaint against someone about something.
sample_bolinao: Iriklamo moyo a nanakaw nin ruran moyo.
sample_english: File a complaint for your stolen vehicle.

meaning_english: To bring someone or something out from within something.
sample_bolinao: Ket anaod, tinabin naya ni Jesus a bulag nin nirikor naya sa babali.
sample_english: And so indeed, Jesus led the blind man by the hand taking him outside the town.

meaning_english: To transcribe something.
sample_bolinao: Irikordmoyo nga'min a sarban gastos.
sample_english: Writedown all the expenses.

meaning_english: To recommend a person for work or a position.
sample_bolinao: Irikumindakoyay ti pa si balasang a magtrabaho sa upisina mo?
sample_english: May Irecommendthis lady to work in your office?

meaning_english: To find means to solve a problem.
sample_bolinao: Matkap nin irimidyo kon makabayad yan twisyon na dilap si Ella.
sample_english: I need to find a means for Ella to be able to pay her tuition tomorrow.

meaning_english: To arrange beautifully.
sample_bolinao: Irimpes moyna nga'min a gawa' mo.
sample_english: Put all of your work in order.

meaning_english: To remit money or something to the one that has a right to it.
sample_bolinao: Irindi nayna ni Ebing a nayadi' nan sinuloy nin kurtinan sigay.
sample_english: Ebing remits the finished threaded shell curtain to the cosigner.

meaning_english: To put something up for a wall.
For someone (=um=) toferrysomeone or something (i=)across a wide area(=en), generally the sea.
sample_bolinao: Itangoy takaniripayitaw sa alakin isla.
sample_english: I willferryyou across to that big island by swimming.

meaning_english: To represent something.
sample_bolinao: Si sikritaryo ni Mayor a mangiriprisinta nin kablyan ran upisyal nan babali sa lumpos sa sayay baryo.
sample_english: The secretary of the Mayor is the one to represent the honorable town officials at a barrio's feast.

meaning_english: To remove something negative.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a iris ko sa iksamin mi.
sample_english: There was a lot I erased on our exam.

meaning_english: To not follow through on a commitment.
sample_bolinao: Si prisidinti nin asusasyon ket mangirisata yan miting dilap ta maksaw yay bagyo.
sample_english: The president of the association postponed the meeting tomorrow since the storm is strong.

meaning_english: To recite something.
sample_bolinao: Imimurya moyay puym ta irisayt moya li' dilap.
sample_english: Memorize the poem for you are going to recite it tomorrow.

meaning_english: To reserve something and so keep back for use later.
sample_bolinao: Mangirisirbaka nin kwarta a pasahi mon sumubli'.
sample_english: Reservemoney for your return fare.

meaning_english: To give a medical prescription.
sample_bolinao: Mamaanda nin masakit a tambar nin nirisita ran duktor.
sample_english: Medicines prescribed doctors heal sicknesses.

meaning_english: To be irresponsible.
sample_bolinao: Irispunsabli ya ta pinuryan nay pamilya na.
sample_english: He is irresponsible for he has neglected is family.

meaning_english: Complaining and resentment from unfairness.
sample_bolinao: Sa irit ko, naka'kit akon mu'dit.
sample_english: By my complaining, I saw red (was scolded unjustly).

meaning_english: To symbolize or illustrate something by using something else.
sample_bolinao: Say alawang a taaw,iritratoa alaki nin ado' nan Dios kontamo.
sample_english: The vast oceansymbolizes tous the great love of God.

meaning_english: An aircon.
sample_bolinao: Mamutbot akon padir nin pangwan irkon.
sample_english: I'll put a hole in the wall to put an aircon in.

meaning_english: Small Catholic church usually in the barrio.
sample_bolinao: Mididinep sara sa irmita a akukulaw nin Katuliko tepe' yabina nin Biyernes.
sample_english: The Catholic old women gather together in the chapel every Friday afternoon.

meaning_english: Hermit, a person who lives by himself in a lonely or secluded spot.
sample_bolinao: Sarayirmitanyo,kasayna konra a minumundon pigagawa'.
sample_english: Thehermitsdon't have earthly pleasures.

meaning_english: To do something at the same time as something else.
sample_bolinao: Irngan moyna sa traysikel a awit mo pinggat kai ka maidapan mangawit.
sample_english: Coordinate your baggage with a tricycle so that you will not be burdened carrying it.

meaning_english: Resentment or a grudge.
sample_bolinao: Say irod ko, no kai nako itudo' sa klasi.
sample_english: My resentment is over your not choosing me in class.

meaning_english: To be tight.
sample_bolinao: Pinasyan irot nin pikakalamo' ran mammemper.
sample_english: The fellowship of the believers was extremely tight.

meaning_english: For the house entry ladder to be lifted up.
sample_bolinao: Kasa sara sa bali ra ta iroy yay aydan ra.
sample_english: There is no one home since their ladder is up.

meaning_english: To bend down a flexible item or part of a plant with a force from above.
sample_bolinao: Irpaymay sanga pigaw maabot a bunga na.
sample_english: Benddown the branch of the tree so that its fruit can be reached.

meaning_english: An airport.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a ma'kit nin iruplano sa irport.
sample_english: There are many airplanes that can be seen at an airport.

meaning_english: To suddenly and forcefully push through someplace.
To transfer, or move from one place to another place opposite of it.
sample_bolinao: Irubari' mo sa baldi a laman nan batya ta matkap kwa.
sample_english: Move the contents of the laundry tub to the bucket since I am needing it.

meaning_english: To use for or make something into a rope.
sample_bolinao: Mangirubir ka nin abel gaw'en nin pabilo nin lampadawan.
sample_english: Make a rope of the cloth for a wick in the lamp.

meaning_english: Airplane.
sample_bolinao: Adti makasaliw nin tikit sairuplano?
sample_english: Where can you buy anairplaneticket?

meaning_english: To put something on a vehicle in general.
sample_bolinao: Niruran naya konan asno na mi'sa naya niyater sa sayay balin pagtuluyan.
sample_english: He put him on his donkey then he took him to a boarding house.

meaning_english: To do something without restraint.
Tighten the binding on something.
sample_bolinao: Irutan ma et a taker nan baboy sa leey ta malukak ya.
sample_english: Tighten the tether around the pigs neck a bit more since it is slack.

meaning_english: To tighten something.
sample_bolinao: Iruten man maong a ruskas nan bisiklita mo.
sample_english: Tighten the screws on your bicycle well.

meaning_english: To bathe using something.
sample_bolinao: Niryo'nay ma'mot a ranom.
sample_english: Hebathedwith hot water.

meaning_english: To tie an animal or bird with a restraint.
sample_bolinao: Is'er man maong a baboy pigaw kai ya makabulos.
sample_english: Tie the pig well so that it won't get loose.

meaning_english: The act of hauling up something.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' maidap a isa no main muton no mangalin bubon.
sample_english: It is not difficult to haul out things when you are digging a well if there is a windlass.

meaning_english: To place something on some kind of a hook.
sample_bolinao: Isa'bit na ni Juan a baskit sa dani nin namasakan nin gubida.
sample_english: Juan hung the basket close to where the ceiling was nailed.

meaning_english: To drape something over neck or shoulder such as a neck cloth or shawl.
sample_bolinao: Isa'lay yay panyo' sa abaya.
sample_english: Wrap the shawl over your shoulder.

meaning_english: To insert something between other things.
sample_bolinao: Isa'le'moy papil isen sa libro.
sample_english: Insertthe papers in the book.

meaning_english: To take the whole or a large amount of something into a wide open mouth.
sample_bolinao: Isa'melmayti si sankutsara' a kanen-kanen.
sample_english: Take this spoonful of delicacy in your mouth.

meaning_english: To put rice, root crops, corn or bananas on to boil.
sample_bolinao: Isa'pang moynay mais ta ika' ta ilako'.
sample_english: Boil the corn now for we'll take it to sell.

meaning_english: To determine that something will happen.
sample_bolinao: Nisaad kona a sya ket magpastor ya.
sample_english: He was predestined to be a pastor.

meaning_english: To hide something in clothing or in a pocket unnoticed.
sample_bolinao: Maimot ya in nin anak kanya' no main ma'kan na, isabaka na pinggaw kasan kidawat.
sample_english: That child is stingy and so if there is something he could eat, he puts it in a pocket so that no one will ask for it.

meaning_english: To put something in a position that would hinder or interfere with movement.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma isabar sa danin purta a bisiklita mo ta madaragos rayan lumabas.
sample_english: Don't put your bicycle where it interferes with the door for those passing by could brush it.

meaning_english: To scatter things out evenly such as in broadcast seeding.
sample_bolinao: Main ranom nan gagawa' kanya' isabwag ko tanay gwano.
sample_english: The field has water and so I'll just spread the fertilizer.

meaning_english: To close something to make it inaccessible.
sample_bolinao: Isada' moyan pirmi a purta ta sali' serpen rayan raruman tawo a bali moyo.
sample_english: Always close your door since perchance other people might enter your house.

meaning_english: To bring a boat into shallow water, place it on a stand, moor, dry dock.
sample_bolinao: Bale' itaw main nin na'kit ran bunganga' nin ranom a bubuyangin ya kanya' nin naisip ra nin isadsad rayadtaw a bapor no magwa'.
sample_english: But there they saw a mouth of water which was sandy that's why they thought of bringing aground the ship there if possible.

meaning_english: To make preparations for something.
sample_bolinao: Isadya'moyna a seket mon para pista tamo.
sample_english: Prepareyour clothes for our fiesta.

meaning_english: To prepare something for.
sample_bolinao: Anamaet, isadyaan rako pa nin mapagtuluyan kodsen ta mampilalo ako nin iyaburoy na nin Dios a makasubli' akodsen komoyo bana' sa kadadasal moyo.
sample_english: Please also, prepare a place for me to stay there for I am hoping that God will allow that I will be able to return to you there because of your prayers.

meaning_english: To persuaded to do something.
sample_bolinao: Malayo akon rat'en koyay peteng, ta pigaw nin maga'muran ko a primyo nin nisadya' nan si Cristo a si Jesus, nin man'isagyat na nin Dios nin pangita'gay na kontamo.
sample_english: I run until the finish line, in order that I might acquire the prize prepared by the Christ who is Jesus for which God is now inviting us as his way/act of exalting us.

meaning_english: To exchange reusable items such as empty pop bottles with the supplier for resalable items.
sample_bolinao: Matkap ana nin isakada a basyo nin supdringk.
sample_english: A cases of empty soft drink bottles needs to be exchanged with the supplier.

meaning_english: To move to s/t different.
sample_bolinao: Naribang a atinsyon; nadisturbo; isakalakoy kaisipan; birngen a kaisipan.
sample_english: The thing which gets the attention; attention getter; a disturbance that draws the attention away.

meaning_english: To use something in making a mess over an area.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket mangisakanta' yan kayo sa tatalon pigaw kai nin madali' makasrep a raruman tawo.
sample_english: Juan is scattering wood around the forest so that other people will not be able to enter it easily.

meaning_english: To place a covering over something.
sample_bolinao: Isakbong mayti si ules pigaw makaka'lek ka abir mapalaway.
sample_english: Place this blanket over it so that you can sleep even if it is light out.

meaning_english: To put a cover on something.
sample_bolinao: Isakeb man maong a garapon nan asukar.
sample_english: Close the sugar jar tightly.

meaning_english: To put something on board a vehicle to cross water.
sample_bolinao: Mangisaki saran nalabas nin pasairo a mutor no yabinayna.
sample_english: They will board the excess passengers for the motorboat crossing in the afternoon.

meaning_english: To make something bump against something tripping someone.
sample_bolinao: Gagarawnen naya nin isakin a ayi na pigaw matumba ya sa kutson.
sample_english: He intentionally stubbed his foot so that he would fall on the mattress.

meaning_english: To defend or fight for someone out of protective concern.
sample_bolinao: Isakitnayay busat na.
sample_english: Hedefendshis brother.

meaning_english: Put something in a straddling position.
To spread something open to insert something between.
To sack up something.
sample_bolinao: Bale' main nin tutawo nin tinmulong kongko a nisako' rako tan niuy'oy rako nin mamaliwa' sa dudungawan sa padil kanya' nin nalibri ako.
sample_english: But there were people who helped me by sacking me up and lowered me out through a window in the wall therefore I was freed.

meaning_english: To accomplish.
To include in the area, to add those who are not. To include for the meal, to have a reservation for another person to dine with.
sample_bolinao: bale' andi' moyna nin isakop a rikor nan masanton lugar bana' ta naipudir anayti konran tutawon kai nin mangalilbi' konan Dios.
sample_english: but don't include outside the holy place because this has been put under the jurisdiction of the people who do not recognize God.

meaning_english: To present a sacrifice.
Insert an object into something such as plug in an electric cord.
sample_bolinao: Isaksak may kurdon nan tilibisyon ta mamantay ata.
sample_english: Plug in the cord for the television so that we can watch.

meaning_english: To put something as an obstruction to passage or viewing.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma isalaban a gamet mo sa purta tamapitpitya.
sample_english: Do not to obstruct the door with your hand, it might bepinched.

meaning_english: To mention something as a reference.
sample_bolinao: Para komoyo, pirmi miyan mampakisalamatan a Dios tan isalambit kamon pirmi tepe' nin dumasal kami.
sample_english: On your behalf, we are always thanking God and mention you always every time we pray.

meaning_english: To catch something from falling.
sample_bolinao: Isalampad na sa teken a taba' na no ibat yayna sa taaw.
sample_english: Coming in from the sea, he caught his seine net from falling with the boat pole.

meaning_english: To drape over something such as the shoulder or rest on the shoulder an item like a towel, handbag, bundle of wood.
sample_bolinao: Isalapdaymay ules sa balaybayan.
sample_english: Hang the blanket on the line.

meaning_english: To related something to someone.
sample_bolinao: Abaw et a nisala-salaysay na ni Pedro ta pigaw nin patutu'wan nay nibari-barita' na.
sample_english: There were still many things Pedro related to prove true what he said.

meaning_english: To rescue or save out from something.
sample_bolinao: Nisalbaratamon Amerikano sa pammaidap ran Kastila'.
sample_english: The Americanssavedus from the abuse of the Spaniards.

meaning_english: To shoot at someone.
sample_bolinao: Apo pulis, isalbawan nako pan mi'sa a.
sample_english: Mister Policeman, if ever, please give me a warning shot, okay.

meaning_english: To put something up in order to shelter or screen an area to be protected.
sample_bolinao: Kupya' a isalimbeng ko sa ulo ko no darumadim.
sample_english: I protect my head with a cap when it drizzles.

meaning_english: To place something for a protection for something.
sample_bolinao: Juan, isalipne' may turda sa dudungawan pigaw kai sumrep a ranom no maksaw sumaprir a rapeg.
sample_english: Juan, put the canvas down over the window so that the water won't come in when the rain is blowing strongly.

meaning_english: To use money to buy something.
sample_bolinao: Nisaliwkoyay kwarta ko.
sample_english: Iboughtit with my money.

meaning_english: To buy something for someone.
sample_bolinao: Isaliwan moko pa nin munyika ko?
sample_english: Will you please buy a doll for me?

meaning_english: To place a container for the collection of something that is flowing out.
sample_bolinao: Isalod may baldi no kumsaw yay rapeg.
sample_english: Put the pail under to collect the water if the rain becomes strong.

meaning_english: To hit.
To throw down abruptly or cast down something heavily and strongly.
sample_bolinao: No sabtan sager naisalteknay awit na sa luta'.
sample_english: When she is very angry shethrowsdown heavily the things she is carrying.

meaning_english: To put a curse on someone.
sample_bolinao: Si'kon si Dios, isamba koyti ket kasan sapo nin mangyadi'.
sample_english: It is I who am God, I make this oath and-so without exception it will happen.

meaning_english: To mix things together.
To take an advantage of something in order to meet a deadline or goal.
sample_bolinao: Dali'-dalien main si nibi kon gawa' mo taisambotya in dilap.
sample_english: Hurry up that which I gave you to do in order to meet the deadline tomorrow.

meaning_english: To exchange or substitute something for something that is lost or no longer available.
sample_bolinao: Isandi koyayti konan lapis a na'met ko.
sample_english: I will substitute this for the pencil that I lost.

meaning_english: To throw something with a whipping action (to the side and down).;
sample_bolinao: Mabisbis yay putol kawayan no isanet ya sa alakin bato.
sample_english: A cut bamboo will split up when whipped against a large stone.

meaning_english: Defend, block with raised arms. To fend or parry, to ward off a blow with one's arm or with something (e.g., stick, etc.).
sample_bolinao: Isangga nay gamet na no saneten raya.
sample_english: He raised his hand when they were going to whip him.

meaning_english: To place a wedge so as to block something.
sample_bolinao: Mangisangke' akon dudungawan no mamurwang ako no buklas.
sample_english: I wedge the window open when I open it in the morning.

meaning_english: To place something on to parboil but to not fully cook or season for eating.
sample_bolinao: Isangkutsamoyay karnin manok pigaw kai ya masida'.
sample_english: Boilthe chicken with water and salt so that it will not be spoiled.

meaning_english: Roasted rice.
sample_bolinao: Isanglaykoy mani.
sample_english: I will roast the peanuts.

meaning_english: To pawn or risk something and put it under someone else's control.
sample_bolinao: Isanla'koya pay ti si singsing ko ta byan mokon sanyasot a pisos?
sample_english: May Imortgagemy ring for one hundred pesos?

meaning_english: Pass inspection.
sample_bolinao: Isapatmoyay plato tepe' mayadi' mangan.
sample_english: Washthe plates and put everything in good order after every meal.

meaning_english: To place a pad on the back of an animal.
sample_bolinao: Nisapin ray kapa ra kona, ket rinmuran ya si Jesus.
sample_english: They spread their cloaks on it and and then Jesus mounted and rode on it.

meaning_english: To take something up onto a high place.
sample_bolinao: Isapwat moy tekrean sa trak.
sample_english: Put the chair up on the truck.

meaning_english: To weave something into a weaving.
sample_bolinao: Isara na ni Maria a kulor birdi nin silag sa mansarawen nan hanbag nin silag.
sample_english: Maria is weaving a green colored fiber into the fiber handbag she is weaving.

meaning_english: To close a barrier.
sample_bolinao: Nisarado rayay purta kanya' kai sara makalabas.
sample_english: They had closed the door and so they were unable to leave.

meaning_english: To scoop something with a fine net.
sample_bolinao: Main awit ko nin magwa' isarap konran aramang.
sample_english: I have brought something that can be used to scoop up the small shrimp.

meaning_english: To give something to be tried out to see if it is experientially correct.
sample_bolinao: Isari' may aysing ko sali' lumbot ya komo.
sample_english: Try my dress on for perhaps it will fit you well.

meaning_english: To speak something.
To scoop up small items with something.
To probe or pound something with a long blunt object.
Caecum, the pouch at the beginning of the large intestine next to the appendix.
sample_bolinao: Kai ko mampangan isaw ta ata'gay daya' ko.
sample_english: I cannot eat the pouch of the intestine dish since I have high blood pressure.

meaning_english: To dunk something into a sticky liquid, solid or under water and lift it quickly.
sample_bolinao: Isawitnayay tinapay sa katiba.
sample_english: Hedips his bread into the coconut butter.

meaning_english: To include something as an ingredient in a dish to be cooked or prepared.
sample_bolinao: Bagay nin isawog sa pansit a agtay nin manok.
sample_english: It is desirable to mix chicken liver with pancit.

sample_english: However as he was pondering this, he dreamed and in his dream an angel of God appeared and said to him, <<Jose, offspring of David, don't waver about marrying Maria.

meaning_english: To throw liquid around, to splash.

meaning_english: Myths.

meaning_english: To spank with a whip like object.
sample_bolinao: Barkes a iyaspok ni tatay komi sin a'nak kami.
sample_english: It was a belt that father spanked us with when we were children.

meaning_english: To move something upward.
To dedicate something to the spirits or the dead.

sample_english: Eat whatever he serves you; don't ask if that had been offered to idols.

meaning_english: To put up a covering or roof.
sample_bolinao: Mangalap akon rabot nin iyatep ko sa ba'lag ko.
sample_english: I'll get the cogan grass to roof my hut with.

meaning_english: To protectively convey or deliver something or someone to its proper place.
sample_bolinao: Main nin tutawon nangiyater kona nin sayay lalakin telek tan umel.
sample_english: There were some people who brought to him a man who was deaf and mute.

meaning_english: To put away something for safekeeping or for future use or for oneself.
sample_bolinao: Iyator man maong a kwarta mo pigaw kai ya ma'met.
sample_english: Store your money carefully so that it is not lost.

meaning_english: To set the time or date for an event to a later time.

sample_english: The teacher told the pupils to move their seats backward.

meaning_english: To store something someplace.
To prohibit or forbid something so as to protect from something.

sample_english: The mother hen will rush at somebody in order to protect her chicks.

meaning_english: To threatening action of hitting something or somebody.
sample_bolinao: Iyawad nayay gamet kongko sin masager ya.
sample_english: He raises his hand to hit me when he is angry.

meaning_english: To take something home.
sample_bolinao: Nitepet na kongko no magwa' naya kanon iyawid a libro.
sample_english: He asked me if it was permissible for him to take the book home.

meaning_english: To implore, request with earnestness or beg for something.
sample_bolinao: Saray mangkapaidap nin trabahador iyay'ay ra konran amo ra a ita'gay ray swildo ra.
sample_english: The hard up workers implored their masters to raise their salary.

meaning_english: To bring something to completion.
sample_bolinao: Say iyayadi' nan mag'adal sa kulihyo nin sayay anak, puon nin ririket ran matua.
sample_english: The finishing of a child's studies in college is a source of joy to the parents.

meaning_english: To include something with something.
sample_bolinao: Iyayi may ari mo no mako ka sa tindawan.
sample_english: Take your younger brother along when you go to the store.

meaning_english: To put on a piece of clothing.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma yapo' isulot a ba'yo mo ta iyaysing ma li' no pista.
sample_english: Do not put on your dress that is new yet for you are going to wear it on the fiesta.

meaning_english: Scrub something with something rough.
sample_bolinao: Iyedyed may lupot pigaw maglat a sama' nan siminto.
sample_english: Scrub the cement floor with a rough rag so as to get the dirt off.

meaning_english: To draw one's legs and arms in close to one's body in order to make oneself as small as possible. Generally it is used when one is ashamed or frustrated and may try to hide oneself. To draw oneself into a small shape.
sample_bolinao: Iyekemmo pigaw kai raka ma'kit.
sample_english: Curl upso they won't see you.

meaning_english: To use a sharp object in a sawing motion to cut something.
To lie down on, to lay one's body, to have one's body in flat position.

sample_english: Justlay yourselfdown on the grasses because there's no bed.

meaning_english: To protect from harm by putting up a barrier against it.
sample_bolinao: Iyilagmay sugat mo sa ayi.
sample_english: Protectthe wound on your foot.

meaning_english: To conceive and become pregnant.
sample_bolinao: Si anak na konan aripen, niinaw tan niyanak ya nin kapadan nikaiyanak ran a'nak nin ka'bawan, bale' si anak na konan ambo' nin aripen, nagkamain ya nin nikatukid nin pangako' nan Dios kona ni Abraham.
sample_english: The child of the servant was conceived and born in the same way as common children of people were born, but the child of the one who was not a servant came to be as the fulfillment of God' promise to Abraham.

meaning_english: To demonstrate or prepare something by moving into position such as a knife, bat or bolo in a backstroke preparing to strike.

sample_english: Will youdemonstrateto us how gracefully he danced.

meaning_english: To begin, enter into some activity.

sample_english: Let usbeginto work early if possible.

meaning_english: To turn over responsibility to someone.

sample_english: His boss will turn over to him the attention/care of his fellow servants and the distribution of their daily ration of subsistence.

meaning_english: To move something slightly.
To put ointment on something.

sample_english: Heusespomade on hishair; I want ointment on my hair.

sample_english: Sometimes it is difficult to communicate to a person what is in your mind especially if what you'll say will hurt him.

meaning_english: To move something back and forth.
Shark.

sample_english: The shark there at the Balingasay river will bite if you bother him.

meaning_english: To precede, to go before.
sample_bolinao: Iyu'na ma konra nga'min ta syay sangkadaitean.
sample_english: Putherin frontof all of them because she is the shortest.

meaning_english: To place something into a hole.
meaning_filipino: Ilusot; ilagay sa butas o hukay.

sample_english: Putthe grains wellintotheholeso that the chicken will not see/eat them.

meaning_english: To go to work using something.
sample_bolinao: Iyubra koyay ba'yon beneng ko.
sample_english: I will do the work with my new bolo.

meaning_english: To take something home or to a locale or habitation.

sample_english: It was necessary that he be taken to the hospital and so they took him to the locale.

meaning_english: Eucharist, The sacrament of the Lord's Supper.
sample_bolinao: Saray mammemper iti sa Bolinao, pirmi saran umatindi sa Iyukaristiko.

meaning_english: To cover with a blanket.
sample_bolinao: Mangkit ako sa kabinit nin magwa' ko nin iyules.
sample_english: I saw in the cabinet what I could use to blanket it.

meaning_english: To bringing up into.

meaning_english: To carry something up into a higher place.

sample_english: I am memorizing the names of the people in our baranggay.

meaning_english: Eulogy, Speech or writing in praise of a person, high praise.
meaning_filipino: Mataas na papuri sa namatay; Parangal sa namatay.

sample_english: Our pastor read his eulogy resulting in his message about the dead.

meaning_english: To swing, to rock the hammock, to move the hammock back and forth.

sample_english: Rock/Swing the hammock of the baby.

meaning_english: To cause someone to fall down head or face first.
Eunuch, employed as chamberlain in a palace.
sample_bolinao: Si adi' nibarita' na konaniyunikoa basawen nay gan-gan konran tutawo.
sample_english: The king told theeunuchas the chamberlain to read the laws for the people.

meaning_english: To offer something.

sample_english: Institutions now days offer a variety of kinds of courses.

meaning_english: To put in to bake with fire or heat both above and below the thing being cooked,
sample_bolinao: Iyurno koyay bibingka'.
sample_english: I put the bibingka in to bake.

meaning_english: To use something in doing something.

meaning_english: The event of coming home.

meaning_english: Jesus Christ.

meaning_english: This is an assumed character in many folktales and probably tends to trigger the idea of fiction. He does not need introductions.

meaning_english: derogatory.

meaning_english: Jew, a person descended or regarded as descended from the ancient Hebrew of biblical times, this is commonly thought of as a insulting name.
The individual you as grammatical subject.

meaning_english: The quantity or largeness of extent.

meaning_english: The things that need action taken on.
To see something briefly.

meaning_english: Identifies the specific time referred when preceded by "no" forming a relative clause.

meaning_english: To have just consumed.

meaning_english: The state of having consumed something.

meaning_english: How old something is and its condition of having been used.

meaning_english: The old place, the place where the house was built first.
meaning_filipino: Lumang pinagtayuan ng bahay; dating tinitirhan.

meaning_english: Eventually, for something to be delayed for a long period of time.

meaning_english: Length of time.

sample_english: Howlongis the trip to Baguio?

meaning_english: A long period of time of an event.

meaning_english: Someone who is living together with someone as her husband or his wife without the benefit of marriage, common law wife or husband.
The advancement or development of something.

meaning_english: The characteristic of the event of reopening an incident that has happened in the past and has been kept secret, or even forgotten. The going through something rigorously.

sample_english: They found the missing ring from their act ofrigorously inspectingthe clothes in the closet.

meaning_english: The advancing or progressing of something.

meaning_english: Perseverance, endurance.

sample_english: Dan's endurance of the heat from a fire can be seen in his movements when he is cooking rice in bamboo.

meaning_english: The movement of leaving from someplace.
Fermenting or making something sour.
The functioning or flow of something.
Refusal of something.

meaning_english: Act of crying loudly with the mouth open.

meaning_english: Roosting place especially in relation to fowl.
The event of groaning.

meaning_english: The activity of storing something to preserve it.

meaning_english: A request made with earnestness and perseverance for something.

meaning_english: The shallowness of the sea, a hole, a basket, etc..

meaning_english: A person that is along side.

meaning_english: Goodness.

meaning_english: The size of something

meaning_english: A large shallow pan used for cooking sugar or salt.
sample_bolinao: Sankawa'a sina'pang sin kasal.
sample_english: It was one largepanof cooked rice for the wedding.

meaning_english: Beloved, the one which one loves.
sample_bolinao: Kawa'nan koya si Jacob, bale' si Esau, pauryan koya.
sample_english: I love Jacob, but, Esau, I will ignore him.

meaning_english: To be committed to and thus do loving things, especially in a close relationship such as a parent-child.
sample_bolinao: Ipangako' ko komo akawa'nanentakayna.
sample_english: I promise you I will love you with actions.

meaning_english: To avoid wasting or throwing something that is still edible or has value.
sample_bolinao: Dandani na masida' a mangga, kanen moyo takawaen.
sample_english: The mangoes are almost rotten, eat them in orderto avoid waste.

meaning_english: A wok or large pan for frying food in oil.
sample_bolinao: Manguyas kankawali'.
sample_english: Wash thefryingpan.

meaning_english: Sufficiency, having over and above what is needed resulting in ease, comfort and convenience.
Nonsense.
sample_bolinao: O, si'kan Bwaya, pinasyan kawawengan mo,».
sample_english: When he was at the top he called out, he said,«Ha, ha, ha, ha. Hey, you Crocodile, you're an extreme simpleton.».

meaning_english: Bamboo.
sample_bolinao: Saykawayan,saya sa sangkausaran nin mula.
sample_english: The bamboois one of the most useful plants.

meaning_english: To use the hands and arms to grasp something tightly such as in wrestling.
sample_bolinao: Saray mibuksing ket kawel saraynan kawel no mi'sa.
sample_english: Sometimes, those that are boxing will repeatedly clutch one another.

meaning_english: To be bent over on the end in a hooked shape such as a finger deformed by arthritis, a curved pod, a blade, etc.
sample_bolinao: Si gamet na ket kawet ya bana' sa masakit.
sample_english: His hand is hooked because of pain.

meaning_english: To hook something around something else.
sample_bolinao: Kawewet yaynan kawewet a anak nin daikleng konan ama na.
sample_english: The small child is continually wrapping his arms around his father.

meaning_english: A downward and inward motion of the hand to call or encourage someone to come nearer or follow or stop a vehicle, usually large movements.
sample_bolinao: Kai ko nin na'kit kawey na kanya' nin kai ako kinmadani.
sample_english: I did not see his beckoning and so I did not come near.

meaning_english: To beckon, to give a signal to a person who is far with the hand or head to come.
sample_bolinao: Mangkaweyannakon sitaw si amigo ko, mako ko yapo' itaw.
sample_english: My friend over there isbeckoningme to come, I will go there first.

meaning_english: A simple long hand-line with normally one hook used to fish in the deep sea.
sample_bolinao: Say kawil main numiro ket no linmabas ka sa numiro ket mabulsot ya.
sample_english: The line has a number and so if you go beyond the rating of that number it will snap.

meaning_english: To be in a state of being linked together solidly like two umbrella handles.
sample_bolinao: Umirot a kawing ran rway taga' no piguruyan sara.
sample_english: A tangle of two things that are hooked together becomes tighter if they are pulled on.

meaning_english: To have all of the facilities to be able to do something.
sample_bolinao: Kaya ko in sarba nin iksamin.
sample_english: I can do all of that exam.

meaning_english: A call or summon using the voice, a motion or a person.
sample_bolinao: Antaga'nan koyaykayabni Edwin.
sample_english: I am waiting for Edwin'scall.

meaning_english: Summon, to call for someone to come.
sample_bolinao: Kayaban mosaray mampagtrabaho sa uubas ko tan ibi moy upa' ra.
sample_english: Summon those that are working in my vineyard and pay them their salary.

meaning_english: Being benighted.
Immediately after the finishing something.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka nin malayo nokayadi'mo nin nangan.
sample_english: Don't run right after you finished eating.

meaning_english: Acquired possessions such as personal belongings, property, lands, money.
sample_bolinao: Naglako' sarayna edet nin sayaykayadianra.
sample_english: They subsequently sold one of theirpossessions.

meaning_english: The one being embraced.
sample_bolinao: Kayakapnayan pirmi a asawa na.
sample_english: The one heembracesis always his wife.

meaning_english: A very large, shallow water net that is dragged through the water and made of a consistently fine mesh with lead weight on the bottom and floats on the top to collect everything there. At times, fish are driven into it. It is illegal.
sample_bolinao: Iyawa' raynay kayakas sawanin a panaon.
sample_english: They prohibit the use of the seine net nowadays.

meaning_english: The flow of a liquid or fire over an area.
sample_bolinao: Palna-palna' a kayam nan anak.
sample_english: The child's crawl is slow.

meaning_english: To climb and spread on something.
sample_bolinao: Nangwa' ya si Elmer nin palapala nin kayaman mula nan ubas.
sample_english: Elmer made a trellis for the grape plant to climb on.

meaning_english: Wealth in a mass or general sense.
sample_bolinao: Iyintriga koy sarban kapiknga' nin luta' tan nagsikabarang akayamananko.
sample_english: I turn over to you half of all my land and my variousriches.

meaning_english: Tendrils, a thread like growth of a climbing plant.
sample_bolinao: Abaw anaykayamkamnan kalubasa.
sample_english: The squash has many tendrils.

meaning_english: The covering of a boat which protects the passengers from the sun or rain usually made of canvas or nipa.
sample_bolinao: Nipa' akayannan baluto mi.
sample_english: The shade on our boat is made of nipa shingles.

meaning_english: Hibiscus, an evergreen shrub with glossy leaves that bears odorless 5 petaled trumpet shaped flowers of various colors.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a klasi ninkayanga, main gumurak mu'dit, maputi' tan di-rusas.
sample_english: There are many kinds of hibiscus, There are those that bear flowers that are red, white and pink.

meaning_english: To go from place to place intentionally and seldom working.
sample_bolinao: Kayap ya si Idoy no manaba' yan kuna' sa baybay kanya' gulpin makalap na.
sample_english: Idoy proceeds from place to place on the seashore when he casts his net so he catches large amounts of fish.

meaning_english: To move from place to place.
sample_bolinao: Niplano ran mibabarkada no adti a kayapen ra dilap ta kasan mag'adal.
sample_english: The friends planed to just hangout around wherever tomorrow since there is no studying.

meaning_english: The act of shaving off the projections on bamboo or wood in order to smoothen it.
sample_bolinao: Si kawayan, mabistay kayas na.
sample_english: The shaving of the bamboo was done nicely.

meaning_english: To strip off pieces of something, commonly bamboo, to prepare it for something.
sample_bolinao: Mampangayas akon pamikol bali mi.
sample_english: I am stripping pieces of bamboo to use to hold nipa shingles of our house roofing.

meaning_english: A bite or sting that normally punctures.
sample_bolinao: Say kayat nan siti si aso ko ket ararem.
sample_english: The bite of my dog is deep.

meaning_english: To seize, bite or cut something soft with something that punctures such as the teeth.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka malayo takayatenkan aso.
sample_english: Do not run; the dog willbiteyou.

meaning_english: A person that roams around.
sample_bolinao: Si anak ko, kayaw ya kanya' nakarate' ya sa raruman lugar.
sample_english: My child was a roamer and so he happened to end up in another place.

meaning_english: To roam around searching for something.
meaning_filipino: Pumunta sa ibàt ibang lugar para maghanap.
sample_bolinao: Mampisantu-santos kamo ta kayawen moyay intiron mundo sa tanay main nin masagyat moyon mayi sa pammemper moyo, ket si masagyat moyo gaw'en moyan masakit-sakit dyan si'kamo.
sample_english: You are pretending to be holy since you roam around searching throughout the whole world for even someone to entice to come into your faith, and then the one you entice you make him much harsher/worse than you.

meaning_english: The sprouts or tips of vines that cling to things.
sample_bolinao: Mabistay kayawkaw nin kamuti a nasaliw ko.
sample_english: The camote vine sprouts that I bought are nice.

meaning_english: Dwarfs or elves, spirit beings in the form of a small person who steal rice and live in termite mounds and can bring on skin diseases if they are offended. They are visible only to some people.
sample_bolinao: Say kaybaan itaw komi ket mabayani ya.
sample_english: The spirits there in our place are aggressive.

meaning_english: A kink, a short tight twist or curl caused by a doubling or winding of something upon itself.
sample_bolinao: Kaalaki nin bira'mon plato a kayedked nan silag kon maputi'.
sample_english: The roll of my white wicker palm is the size of a plate.

meaning_english: To roll asilagleaf to straighten and stretch it for use in making mats because it tends to curl when dried.
sample_bolinao: Kayedkeden na ni Dan a bulong silag nin nigawgaw na naon.
sample_english: Dan will roll up the cabbage palm leaves he put out preciously to sun dry.

meaning_english: The act of shivering or trembling.
sample_bolinao: Ma'kit a kayegkeg na ni Dan sin rway udas naynan nalbet sa rapeg.
sample_english: Dan's shivering could be seen after he had been all wet out in the rain for two hours.

meaning_english: The curvature or non-flatness of something.
sample_bolinao: Kayemkem anay bulong batag ta kiri' ana.
sample_english: The banana leaf has curled up since it is now dry.

meaning_english: Wrinkled or twisted skin.
sample_bolinao: Si akulaw, kayetket yayna kanya' ya nin mipulbos.
sample_english: The old lady has wrinkled skin and so he powders herself.

meaning_english: Fleas.
sample_bolinao: Gu'go' anan gu'go' a main nin kayew.
sample_english: The one that has fleas scratches and scratches.

meaning_english: An instrument like a stiff broom used to rake.
sample_bolinao: Mabista yay kaykay na ta main gaga'getan na.
sample_english: His rake is nice since it has a handle.

meaning_english: To sweep or rake an area for cleaning.
sample_bolinao: Kaykayen ko a bulong mangga a nanabo' sa sirong mangga.
sample_english: I'll rake up the mango leaves that fell under the mango tree.

meaning_english: Wood, the part of a tree or plant that is used for lumber or firewood.
sample_bolinao: Sikayoata'gay ya.
sample_english: Thetreeis tall.

meaning_english: A large grater or scraper.
sample_bolinao: Matkap kasisyawan tamo' a kaalakyan nin kayod mo sa malago' nin ungot.
sample_english: Only a moderate sized grater is needed for the young coconut.

meaning_english: A tool used for grating something in thin strips.
sample_bolinao: Ma'get yay kayos mi no ipangayos yan ungot ta gawa' ya sa pasak.
sample_english: Our strip grater which we use for grating coconuts is durable for it is made of steel.

meaning_english: The lowness of something.
sample_bolinao: Sabtan kaypaan nan nakalap kon grado sa iksamin.
sample_english: I got a very low grade in the exam.

meaning_english: To scrape something pulling it toward you.
For the back to be bent with the arms or hands pressed against chest or abdomen usually because of pain in that area.
sample_bolinao: Nakakukot tankayungkongya ta masakit yay tyan na.
sample_english: He pressed his arms against his chest and his legs and feet close togetherbecausehe has a stomach ache.

meaning_english: To be weak.
To grate something deliberately and in strips.
To grate something into strips.
sample_bolinao: Mangayos yan laman nin malago' ungot si Juan ta ika' na sa salad.
sample_english: Juan grated the young coconut meat into strips so as to put it in a salad.

meaning_english: For something to persist or continue to function over an unexpected long period of time.
sample_bolinao: Ya, ke'ran na et nintransistor radiomo!
sample_english: Woo, your transistor radio is still around!

meaning_english: Someone who holds his money and will not use it even for necessities.
sample_bolinao: Si tawo nin kebeng, kasa nin amigo na.
sample_english: The person that is a tightwad has no friends.

meaning_english: For a harvest to be over dry and perhaps ruined.
sample_bolinao: Keber a niluto' ra ta nalingatan raya.
sample_english: What they cooked was burnt since they neglected it.

meaning_english: For the male genitals to be retracted because of cold or fear.
sample_bolinao: Madlaw a kebet nin katat mo ta nabarbar kaynan maong.
sample_english: The wrinkles in your skin are distinct since you have had it under water so long.

meaning_english: The dense growth of something, especially plants.
sample_bolinao: Sabtan anda' keder a tanem kon pari mataman limay linggo tamo'.
sample_english: Even though it is only five weeks the thick growth of my rice is extremely good.

meaning_english: Fruit that has ripened and is drying up with wrinkly skin.
sample_bolinao: Kedes a sarban pasas nin nilawok sa salad.
sample_english: All of the raisins that have been mixed into the salad are wrinkled up.

meaning_english: To go someplace with a purpose.
sample_bolinao: Adtikeenmoyo?
sample_english: Where are yougoing?

meaning_english: The ticklish spot of a person.
sample_bolinao: Sa kilikili a kekerete'nan ni Juan.
sample_english: Under the arm is Juan's ticklish spot.

meaning_english: Testis, Male sex organ.
sample_bolinao: Si keleng na ni Pedro alaki ya.
sample_english: The testicles of Peter are big.

meaning_english: A boat that is on the verge of sinking because of being overloaded.
sample_bolinao: Kenepkenepyay baluto ta kargado ya.
sample_english: The boat is about to sink because it is over loaded.

meaning_english: A wrinkle in something.
sample_bolinao: Madlaw yay kenes nin pulo mo ta kai ya napalansa.
sample_english: The wrinkle in your shirt stands out for it has not been ironed.

meaning_english: To crease or wrinkle cloth or paper.
sample_bolinao: Mayin bale'kinenesmay aysing ko?
sample_english: Why did you wrinkle my dress?

meaning_english: Shivers from being cold.
sample_bolinao: Kengegkeg a pirat'anan mo no maryo' ka sa baybay.
sample_english: You will be caught by the shivers if you bathe in the sea.

meaning_english: The act of ducking or squatting down in order to get under something.
sample_bolinao: Kepe' ka no sumrep ka konan siin a kwiba, ta pinggat makasrep ka.
sample_english: Duck down when you pass into that cave so that you can enter it.

meaning_english: The head and body slumped so as to clear something or not be noticed.
sample_bolinao: Kepe'-kepe' yan lumalako sa sirong bali si Edoy pigaw kai ya mi'dol.
sample_english: Edoy walked slumped down under the house so that he would not bump his head.

meaning_english: A clump or compressed handful of something.
sample_bolinao: Sayay kepel tamo' a nisa'pang ko.
sample_english: It was only a handful of rice that I put in to boil.

meaning_english: To be lacking in substance such as a fruit lacking water or a tire lacking air.
sample_bolinao: Kepes a bungan pari bana' ta kasan rapeg tan masiri.
sample_english: The grains of the rice plants were shriveled since there was no rain and it was windy.

meaning_english: The enfolding and clinging to something such as the enfolding of the arms or wings around something, usually to warm or comfort.
sample_bolinao: Say kepkep ran manok sa siwsiw ra, mabista no maray'ep.
sample_english: The gathering under the wings by the hen of the chicks is good when it is cold.

meaning_english: To enfold a person in an embrace or hug them tightly in your arms to express affection and sometimes to comfort.
sample_bolinao: Si upa a mangepkep konran siwsiw na no ma'lek sara no yabi.
sample_english: The hen shelters over her chicks when they sleep at night.

meaning_english: The act of running as fast as one can.
sample_bolinao: Say kered ko, unon daras no mali'mwan ako.
sample_english: My sprinting is extremely fast if I am scared.

meaning_english: To run as fast as one can out of competitiveness, urgency or fear.
sample_bolinao: Kereden nan sayay minutos a limanyasot nin metro ni Jose.
sample_english: Jose ran the 100 meters in one minute.

meaning_english: The sound of cackling of chickens or made when calling them.
sample_bolinao: No maray'ep saray manok, kereketek a tunoy ra.
sample_english: When chickens are cold they make a cackling sound.

meaning_english: The act of strumming such as a guitar or on the table.
sample_bolinao: Si kereng nan instruminto ko, marnge' ya anggan rubari'.
sample_english: The strumming of my instrument can be heard across the street.

meaning_english: To strum a guitar, banjo, etc.
sample_bolinao: Andi' makerengenanan kerengen pirmi in si gitara ta sali' mabulsot a deles na.
sample_english: Don't always be strumming and strumming that guitar, it may break its strings.

meaning_english: The chest of a person or animal.
sample_bolinao: Matib'ey a kerep ran lulaki.
sample_english: Men's chests are firm.

meaning_english: To be afflicted with chest pain.
sample_bolinao: Kerepen ya si Mars no malayo yan ma'teng.
sample_english: Mars has chest pain if he runs for a long time.

meaning_english: The result of making the neck short and the shoulders high, perhaps from being cold.
sample_bolinao: Kerere'ya ta anted yay leey na tan ata'gay a nigmang abaya na.
sample_english: He isshortnecked since his neck is short with matching high shoulders.

meaning_english: Ticklishness.
sample_bolinao: Saray a'nak, ababo a kerete' ra kanya' gusto-gusto nasaran ikapen.
sample_english: The children are easily tickled and so he likes to play with them.

meaning_english: To tickle someone.
sample_bolinao: Andi' kamangarete'dapa ko ta makarete' ako.
sample_english: Do notticklethe palm of my feet because I am ticklish.

meaning_english: Convoluted thought pattern. A person who is very inquisitive and is not satisfied with an answer until he clearly understands.
sample_bolinao: Si kerker nan rubir nan damulag ko, maidap yan galaten ta madiwi.
sample_english: The tangles of my carabao's rope are difficult to get out since it is weedy here.

meaning_english: The object on which the rope or thread is wound.
sample_bolinao: Kerkeran yan rubir damulag a alakin sanga nan mangga no isirong yay damulag sa sirong mangga.
sample_english: The rope of the carabao gets wrapped around the big branches of the mango tree when it goes under it.

meaning_english: Knit cloth.
sample_bolinao: No mako ka sa bayli ambo' kese'-kese' a seket mo.
sample_english: When you go to a dance, your clothing is not knit cloth.

meaning_english: The wraps of a long object such as thread around something.
sample_bolinao: Say keskes nan siti si rubir, miabot ya anggan rubari' bali.
sample_english: The wraps of this rope will reach to the other side of the house.

meaning_english: To wrap cloth or similar material onto something to support it or perhaps protect it.
sample_bolinao: Paspas yan mangeskes nin rubir burador si Dan no ba'yo ya rumate' a arubuob.
sample_english: Dan wrapped up the kite's rope fast before the gusty storm started.

meaning_english: An optional marker that may be used at points of grammatical inversion for emphasis.
sample_bolinao: Kinawa'nan natamon Dios ket mikawa'nanan atamo anamaet.
sample_english: God has loved us and so we love one another.

meaning_english: The act of shaving an object including the trimmedoffpieces and the cut out design usually using something like a bolo.
sample_bolinao: Si kete' nan kya' ko ket mabista yan kikiten.
sample_english: My whittling with my knife is nice to look at.

meaning_english: To remove small pieces from something by pinching, chipping, chopping or whittling.
sample_bolinao: Mangete' ya si Juan nin bungan agayap nin usar nay tamudo' tan tangan.
sample_english: Juan is pinching off small bits of the beans using his thumb and fore finger.

meaning_english: The boundary of land.
sample_bolinao: Si keteg nan byay na ket iti konan duktor na.
sample_english: The restrictions on his life are from his doctor.

meaning_english: The border between two things such as the boundary line between land properties or the determination of something.
meaning_filipino: Patuto; lindero; balantay; muhon; hangganan ng nasasakupan.; Taningan.
sample_bolinao: Siketegannan luta' mi, sya si alakin kayo.
sample_english: Theboundaryline of our land is the big tree.

meaning_english: Plucking of stringed instruments - guitar, bass, etc.
sample_bolinao: Main marnge' konketengketenggitara.
sample_english: I can hear thepluckingof the guitar.

meaning_english: To pluck the strings of a stringed instrument.
meaning_filipino: Kutingtingin.; Gawin ng kamay ng paunti-unti.
sample_bolinao: Ketengketengenmay gitara.
sample_english: Pluckthe guitar.

meaning_english: The sound these owls make.
sample_bolinao: Si kewew ket tumnoy ya pirmi no buklas.
sample_english: The owl is always voicing out in the morning.

meaning_english: To answer someone back in argumentation.
sample_bolinao: Ki'batan ya si Sam konran amigo na ta masager yayna.
sample_english: Sam shot back at his friends since he was angry.

meaning_english: To ask favor to somebody to borrow something.
sample_bolinao: Ki'damako pan beneng moyo?
sample_english: May I borrowyour bolo?

meaning_english: An emotional shock from a sudden fright or unexpected action usually with a physical reaction.
sample_bolinao: Alaki a ki'ded ni Mark sin bigra' nin pinaltik rayay tutulyan na.
sample_english: It was a big shock to Mark when they suddenly flick his ear.

meaning_english: To see and meet with each other.
sample_bolinao: Bada'nan na ni Alex nin mako sa babali ta ki'kit ya konan damag na.
sample_english: Alex makes excuses to go to town in order to meet with the one he was infatuated with.

meaning_english: To see or meet someone.
sample_bolinao: Ket mataman nin binyan nakon Dios nin alakin pagkanawa-nawa nin ipatanda' koyadtaw a Mabistan Patanda' nin maipa'ka' kona ni Cristo, pinatanid ako konran bubsat itaw tan tinmaros akodti sa Macedonia ta pigaw nin ki'kitan ako kona.
sample_english: And so even though God had given me a great opportunity to proclaim there the Good News concerning Christ, I said goodbye to the brethren there and I proceeded here to Macedonia in order to meet with him.

meaning_english: A skip, a short one legged jump.
sample_bolinao: Anted a ki'ting ko ta anted a bisit ko.
sample_english: My skips are short because I am short-legged.

meaning_english: Hopscotch.
sample_bolinao: Ki'ting-dapak a ikap mi sin a'nak kami.
sample_english: Our game when we were children was hopscotch.

meaning_english: To move from side to side over the length of the body like a worm.
To be living with a live-in spouse.
sample_bolinao: Si Rose ket ki'yan ya koni Ron ta makwarta ya si Ron.
sample_english: Rose is living-in with Ron since Ron is monied.

meaning_english: To study with someone.
To come before and face someone, possibly in conflict.
sample_bolinao: Kiadapka no kiirgo ka ta saya ya in nin pangigalang sa kapadan tawo.
sample_english: Facethe person with whom you talk for that is respectful to a fellowman.

meaning_english: To go from house to house to ask for a Christmas gift.
sample_bolinao: Gindat, iti sa isla, abaw saray mako kiaginaldo nin mangansyon no dispiras nin Abidad.
sample_english: In former times, here on the island, many go caroling asking for Christmas gifts on Christmas Eve.

meaning_english: To eat together with someone from a common bowl.
sample_bolinao: Kialemka konan ari mo ta kasaynan plato para komo.
sample_english: Youeattogether from the same plate with your younger sister because we do not have anymore plates.

meaning_english: To escort or journey together as a support with someone on the same route to a common destination or purpose.
sample_bolinao: Kialuyonako komo anggan istasyon pigaw main kalamo' ko.
sample_english: I wouldgo withyou until the station so that I have a companion.

meaning_english: To be friends with someone.
sample_bolinao: Gindat kasan magwa' tamo ta pigaw nin kiamigo atamo konan Dios.
sample_english: Previously there was nothing we could do in order to be friends with God.

meaning_english: To be in a boss - worker relationship.
sample_bolinao: Maidap akiamokonran matapubri.
sample_english: It's hard to have a boss who belittles the poor.

meaning_english: To come alongside someone for companionship.
sample_bolinao: Kiampad kan lumalako koni baying.
sample_english: Go walk alongside grandma.

meaning_english: To take side with someone.
sample_bolinao: Andi' tamo ninkiampisa kadukaan.
sample_english: Let us not be inalliancewith wickedness.

meaning_english: For a grown up to play or fight or quarrel with or like a child.
meaning_filipino: Makipaglaro sa bata; patulan ang bata.
sample_bolinao: Kianak-anakya anta masiken yayna.
sample_english: He acts childish despite being an old man.

meaning_english: To lengthen a discussion, argument or quarrel.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka kianru-anro kona ni Jose ta anted a pakaabot na.
sample_english: Don't engage in an long discussions with Jose for he is narrow minded.

meaning_english: To duplicate and imitate.
Settle a dispute with someone especially in a court setting.
sample_bolinao: No main nin mangidimanda komo, mako kan tampor nin kiariglo kona mintras nin iti kamo et sa dalan.
sample_english: If there is one that sues you, go immediately to settle the problem with him while you are still on the way.

meaning_english: For a woman to marry.
meaning_filipino: Makipag-isang dibdib; makipag-asawa ang isang babae.
sample_bolinao: Kiasawakayna, Naning, ta matuntawo kayna.
sample_english: My daughter, it's time for you toget marriedbecause you are getting older now.

meaning_english: To fight or quarrel over something, usually in anger.

sample_english: They are always badgering Pedro with the wrongs he has done.

meaning_english: The youth or early stages of development.
sample_bolinao: Say mabistan gaw'en ninbukosalad ket say ungot nin kustoy lago'.
sample_english: What is good for makingbukosalad is coconut that is at the right stage of early development.

meaning_english: The sudden force on something.
sample_bolinao: Lagsot a nipamira ra kanya' nabigra' ako.
sample_english: Their taking up the slack was sudden and forceful and so I was caught off guard.

meaning_english: To grab something and forcefully take it from another person, steal, snatch.
sample_bolinao: Lagsuten yay rubir nan damulag ta kanen nay pari.
sample_english: Yank back the rope of the carabao for he is eating the rice plants.

meaning_english: An open area of a building such as a garden, courtyard or porch.

sample_english: Go to the house since it has a wide porch.

meaning_english: A lock.
Achiote tree with encapsulated fruit containing red-pulped seeds that yield food-coloring and dye.
sample_bolinao: Kai nakri' maong a niyator ra nin bikoy laka' kanya' nin naburtabot.
sample_english: They did not dry well the achiote seeds that they stored and so they were moldy.

meaning_english: To remove a large piece of something that is fastened to something else with a bar.
sample_bolinao: Lakaben ray playwed nin inusar ran purma sin nangwa' saran pusti nin siminto.
sample_english: They pried off the plywood they used as a form when they made the cement posts.

meaning_english: Disembark or take cargo down out of a vehicle.
sample_bolinao: Lakasenmay baskit mangibwat sa traysikel.
sample_english: Takethe basketoffthe tricycle.

meaning_english: Very big size of banana whose color is orange-red when ripe.
Big fin reef squid.
sample_bolinao: Main iyusar mi nin urang-urang no mangalap kami nin laki'.
sample_english: There are small shrimp that we used when we catch squid.

meaning_english: An expression of loss and something being done in vain, Rats!
sample_bolinao: Tabinen tamoya si laking Isar ta dandani nayna kai ma'kit a dalan na.
sample_english: We lead Grandfather Isar by the hand since he almost can't see where he is going.

meaning_english: An item forsale.
sample_bolinao: Si akulaw, mainlako'nan salay.
sample_english: The old woman has eggs forsale.

meaning_english: The joint or attachment of two pieces.
sample_bolinao: Main laktip nan sanribon pisos nin kard a nipa'wit na ni May kongko.
sample_english: There was an attachment of 1000 pesos in the card that May sent to me.

meaning_english: To seal something shut to protect the contents.
sample_bolinao: Laktipan na ni Juan nin liman ribo a ipa'wit nan sayan karton nin aysing nin ipa'wit na sa pamilya na sa kasalakon lugar.
sample_english: Juan included five thousand peso that he sent in a carton of clothing that he sent to his family in another place.

meaning_english: Merchandise for sale.
sample_bolinao: Kasabyan ma'kan a laku'-lako' itaw sa ba'yon abri nin tindawan sa baryo.
sample_english: Usually things for sale in the newly opened store in the barrio are edible.

meaning_english: To sell something to a buyer.
sample_bolinao: Laku'nanman sabon si Dina.
sample_english: SellDina the soap.

meaning_english: To thoroughly trample s/t.
For a person or animal to tread on something causing damage, such as carabao in a rice field or children in a vegetable garden.
To be loose fitting because of being too large.
sample_bolinao: Lakuylakoyyan lumalako.
sample_english: His walking is unstable.

meaning_english: The act of leaving someplace.
sample_bolinao: Lakwan yaynan lakwan sa pwisto na si Marta kanya' nin kasan malako' na.
sample_english: Marta keeps leaving her stall so she doesn't have any sales.

meaning_english: To abandon, leave something in the place where it is and normally not come back.
sample_bolinao: Nangibwat sinlinakwanannaya ni Edwin, ket pirmi yan umakis.
sample_english: From the time Edwinlefther she has been constantly crying.

meaning_english: Truancy, staying away from school, work, employment in the form of truancy.
sample_bolinao: Lakwatsaa pirmin gawa' na kai ya et pa et patanid.
sample_english: He isalways going everywherewithout asking permission.

meaning_english: A fish net which is cast out from the boat.
sample_bolinao: Lala a iyusar na ni tatay no mako ya manguna'.
sample_english: What father uses when he goes fishing is a casting net.

meaning_english: The act of passing by something.
A male person or animal.
sample_bolinao: Sin saytaw, abaw saray lullaki a maong sa istuki.
sample_english: During the olden times there were many men who were good at stick fighting.

meaning_english: The operation or condition of something such as a business.
sample_bolinao: Mapalna' a lalako nan masiken.
sample_english: The old man's walk is careful/slow.

meaning_english: A walkway.
sample_bolinao: Lalakwan ran a'nak a gagawa' a main mulan kamuti.
sample_english: The children are walking in the field that has the camote planted in it.

meaning_english: To walk going someplace.
sample_bolinao: Rway kilumitro a lalakwen mangibwat sa babali anggan Liwaliwa.
sample_english: It is two kilometers to walk from the town to Liwaliwa.

meaning_english: For a woman to engage a man in illicit relations with her.
The physical body.
sample_bolinao: Mitutulong a nagsikabarang nin puparti nanlalaman.
sample_english: The various parts of thebody help one another.

meaning_english: To come alongside and assist someone in a common purpose such as protection, decision making, etc.
sample_bolinao: Lalamu'nenmay ari mo nin mako sa palingki.
sample_english: Assistyour younger sister in going to the market.

meaning_english: A low grassy land where no trees grow and is vacant of buildings.
sample_bolinao: Say lalawak itaw komi, magwa' yan piikapan.
sample_english: The grassy land at our place can be used for a playground.

meaning_english: Thud, the sound of a heavy object falling.
sample_bolinao: Main nin narnge' nin tunoy lalbog sa yupa'.
sample_english: I heard the sound of a thud below.

meaning_english: Cracking sound.
sample_bolinao: Lalpak a tunoy na no mabari' ya.
sample_english: When it breaks it goes crack.

meaning_english: A hard bump of the body against something..
sample_bolinao: Kanitkit ka kanya' siin laltog a nangyadi' komo.
sample_english: You are out of control and so that hard bump is what happened to you.

meaning_english: A moderate sweetness.
The flesh of an animal, the softer substance of the body that covers the bones under the skin.
sample_bolinao: Kasayna nin laman nan kuden.
sample_english: There is nothing now in the pot.

meaning_english: To give content to something.
sample_bolinao: Lamanen man mabista in si surat mo pinggaw maririket saray mamasa.
sample_english: Give that writing of yours some beautiful content for the enjoyment of the reader.

meaning_english: Ungratefulness, not responding with good to those that have been good to you.
sample_bolinao: Ilalwan nayay sayay bagay a rumate' bale' kai ninlamang.
sample_english: He is hoping that a certain thing will arrive but nevertheless it won't.

meaning_english: To take advantage of someone that was in a close relationship.
The vigil during a wake at night.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a tawo nin mako no suyot awron lamay ba'yo ya itabon a nati.
sample_english: There are many people that will go on the last day of the wake before the burial of the dead.

meaning_english: To stay awake and keep watch over the dead.
sample_bolinao: Lamayenrayay nati nin a'nem a yabi.
sample_english: Theykeepwatch over the dead for six nights.

meaning_english: Palm wine.
sample_bolinao: Sa Batangas, say inumen ra ket lambanog, ambo' nin arak nin ibat sa butilya.
sample_english: In Batangas what they drink is palm wine not the wine from a bottle.

meaning_english: Exaggeration.
sample_bolinao: Unon lambong mo kanya' ka aburido sa sayay bagay.
sample_english: Your exaggeration is known and so you worry about certain things.

meaning_english: Luxuriant growth or lushness of the growth of a plant.
sample_bolinao: Say lambot nan siti si mula ko, ipa'kit a pirmin madu'mel a luta'.
sample_english: The lushness of this plant of mine shows that the ground is always damp.

meaning_english: A table which is of the height at which chairs could be used.
sample_bolinao: Saray aso sa sirong nin lamisawan ket kanen ray pasi' ran a'nak.
sample_english: The dogs under the table eat the crumbs of the children.

meaning_english: A small table.
sample_bolinao: Main sarming na sa babo nin lamisita ra ni Ren.
sample_english: There is a glass top on the side table of Ren.

meaning_english: To fill or put something in something.
sample_bolinao: Lamnanmoyaynaet a pasig ta kasaynan ranom na.
sample_english: Refillthe earthen jar with water because it's empty.

meaning_english: Anything that is added to something, supplement.
sample_bolinao: Si lamo' nan siti si kwarta ko ket ibat ya koni Pedro.
sample_english: The supplement to this money of mine is from Peter.

meaning_english: A lamp which uses carbide to produce the light.
sample_bolinao: No pingkiwen maylampatampor kumalaway mataman ani nan dedlem ta maslag tan anro yay apoy na.
sample_english: When thelamp flintis struck by the thumb it will at once produce light no matter how dark since its fire is bright and long lasting.

meaning_english: A kerosene lamp.
sample_bolinao: Sin kasa et nin kuryinti sa isla, lampadawana tyo' nin bubali.
sample_english: When there was no electricity yet on the island, kerosene lamps were what provide light to the houses.

meaning_english: Floor mop.
sample_bolinao: Matalag anay mangusar nin lampaso sawanin ta kasabyan natayls anay pluring.
sample_english: The coconut husk is now rarely used since nowadays the floors are commonly tiled.

meaning_english: To scrub a floor or wall with a brush, rag or coconut husk with or without water.
sample_bolinao: Lampaswenmoy siir pigaw no maringgas.
sample_english: Mopthe floor so that it will be clean.

meaning_english: To move unsteadily and clumsily and so easily trip or fall to the ground.
sample_bolinao: Si anak mi ket lampayot yan lumalako.
sample_english: The walking of our child is unsteady.

meaning_english: Pieces of cloth used to wrap newborn babies in. Later they are used for diapers.
sample_bolinao: No mangabing yaytaw si anak ko, dawaten nay lamping sa ka'nakan na.
sample_english: When that child of mine gives birth, she will request diapers from her nephew.

meaning_english: One or two masted boat, with outrigger.
sample_bolinao: Sin nu'na nin panaon, abaw lampitaw pangiruranan pari.
sample_english: In the early times many large outriggers were used to haul rice.

meaning_english: A pale, almost transparent but touchable spirit being that may be smelled or make various sounds, likely in the form of a dead person but not specifically a person and is terrifying.
sample_bolinao: Say lampong, manglili'mo sara konran anak mi.
sample_english: The ghosts are frightening to our children.

meaning_english: To add something additional to something.
sample_bolinao: Manlamu'nannay ibi nan ibayad.
sample_english: She isaddingsome to the payments.

meaning_english: Wool, the cloth made from the animal hair.
sample_bolinao: Mabistan misulot nin aysing a lana no maray'ep a panaon.
sample_english: Its nice to wear clothing made from wool in cold season.

meaning_english: Pus, a thick yellowish white fluid found in sores and infected wounds.
sample_bolinao: Naglat a pangetek-etek nan kuyapes ni Carlo sin napespes a lana' na.
sample_english: The throbbing pain of Carlo's boil stopped when the pus was squeezed from it.

meaning_english: For more of something than what is good to be someplace.
sample_bolinao: Mati a papayas bana' sa lanak.
sample_english: Papayas die because of root rot.

meaning_english: Lackadaisical, to lack enthusiasm.
sample_bolinao: No napuyat ya, lanatlanat trabaho na.
sample_english: If he lacks sleep his work is lackadaisical.

meaning_english: To do something halfheartedly.
sample_bolinao: Lanatlanatanyan magtrabaho ta napuyat ya nayabi.
sample_english: He workslazilybecause he lost his sleep last night.

meaning_english: To show difficulty in working due to lost sleep or tiredness.
A landing barge.
sample_bolinao: Main saki nanlandingnin tulo ray ruran mamuntan isla.
sample_english: There is space the landing barge for two vehicles going to the island.

meaning_english: To be withered because of lack of water.
sample_bolinao: Lanes a pirat'anan nin dinutdot nin tanaman.
sample_english: A plant that has been dug up will become withered.

meaning_english: The characteristic of being malleable or soft and often slippery.
sample_bolinao: Paka'kitan nin maray'ep anay niluto' nin gulaman a laney.
sample_english: What shows that cooked gelatin has been cooled is its malleability.

meaning_english: The act of not doing something at times like skip eating, going to school, etc.
sample_bolinao: Kasan langan mo no mangan ka.
sample_english: There is nothing you skip when you eat.

meaning_english: Fellowship, the quality of being together and mixing together in friendship.
sample_bolinao: Mabistay langenlangen ko konran tawo kanya' rabay-rabay rako.
sample_english: I am a good mixer with people and so they all like me.

meaning_english: A burlap sack.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a langgutsi a ilako' ra sa tindawan.
sample_english: There are many burlap sacks that are sold at the stores.

meaning_english: To sack something up.
sample_bolinao: Linangutsi a uring nin ilako'.
sample_english: Charcoal that is sold is sacked.

meaning_english: Machine oil to be used as a lubricant.
