sample_english: Juan loosens the plug on the engine of his motorcycle when he changes the oil.

meaning_english: To lubricate something.
sample_bolinao: Langisan na ni Sam nin mirwa sa sayay bulan a kadina nan mutursiklo na.
sample_english: Sam lubricates the chain on his motorcycle twice a month.

meaning_english: The dwelling place of God and the people that follow God, heaven.
sample_bolinao: Mapalaway a langit no kasan gunem.
sample_english: The sky is clear when there are no clouds.

meaning_english: Jackfruit.
sample_bolinao: Si langka', kai raya rabay ta matab'ang ya.
sample_english: They don't like the jackfruit since it is tasteless.

meaning_english: Housefly.
sample_bolinao: Pal'isan may lango ta awit nay mikrubyo.
sample_english: Beware of the houseflyfor it carries germs.

meaning_english: Five leaved chaste tree, a tree reaching a max. height of 5 m. with bark, leaves and fruit used to kill leeches.
sample_bolinao: Mampi'kan langra nin ipanuor mon ilek.
sample_english: Breaksome leaves off the five leaved chaste tree to burn to fumigate for mosquitoes.

meaning_english: The unpleasant odor of fish or blood.
sample_bolinao: Barkuten man papil a kuna' mi'sa ma ika' sa supot pinggat kai maangot a langsi na.
sample_english: Wrap the fish with paper before you put it in the bag so that its fishy odor will not be smelt.

meaning_english: To deceive someone.
sample_bolinao: Linangtawnakaynaet.
sample_english: He deceived you again.

meaning_english: For flies to land on something and cover it.
sample_bolinao: Langwen raynay ma'kan sa lamisawan no kai kamo et dumungo.
sample_english: If you don't get together and start eating, the flies will be landing all over the food on the table.

meaning_english: Commotion, the act of making massive disturbing noises.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a lanibog sa kwarto no miaway saray mitrakalamo'.
sample_english: The commotion in the room is loud when the couple is fighting.

meaning_english: A deep flood, for water from a storm to be deep over an area of ground.
sample_bolinao: Lanip sa alog nin pirmi no marapeg.
sample_english: It is always flooding in the low areas when it is rainy.

meaning_english: To collect or flood an area with water perhaps from excessive rain.
sample_bolinao: Kasabyan lanipen nin ranom sa baybay a bubali sa Arosan no ararem.
sample_english: Commonly the shore water floods the town of Arosan when it is high tide.

meaning_english: For something to be greasy.
sample_bolinao: Say kuna', lanit no mamirito ka.
sample_english: Fish are greasy when they are fried.

meaning_english: Greasy, smeared with something sticky or oily and so not clean.
sample_bolinao: Lanit-lanitananay plato; matkap sabunen a maong.
sample_english: The plates are verygreasy; they'll have to be soaped and washed well.

meaning_english: Thin fibers of some woody plants and of the midribs of palm leaves from such plants as fan palms and maguey.
sample_bolinao: Man-gumitin ya sa rubir nin gawa' salanot.
sample_english: He is hanging from a rope made from fan palm fibers.

meaning_english: Falling a waste matter in the form of light from the stars.
meaning_filipino: Ilaw na pumatak galing sa bituin makita sa gabi.
sample_bolinao: No maka'kit ninlanoykano no yabi main kanon rumate' a swirti.
sample_english: When some one sees afallingstar at night it is said that good luck will soon come.

meaning_english: A .folding knife, pocket knife.
sample_bolinao: Matalag ana a mangusar nin lansita sawanin ta main ana nin kutsilyo.
sample_english: There are few that use the penknife nowadays since there are now kitchen knives.

meaning_english: Lanzones.
sample_bolinao: Maluto' anay buley-buley nin lansunis.
sample_english: The bunches of lanzones are now ripe.

meaning_english: Dull or lacking severely in one's mental or physical abilities, not mentally sharp.
sample_bolinao: Lantot akon mangwinta.
sample_english: I am slow in computation.

meaning_english: A person or thing that has had his or its day or which belongs to the past and no longer has any influence.
sample_bolinao: Laos anaytin pantalon sawanin.
sample_english: These pants are now out of date.

meaning_english: All universally, applicable in all cases without exception.
sample_bolinao: Lapag nin tutawo ket rabay a tinapay.
sample_english: Bread is universally liked by people.

meaning_english: The inside part of bamboo which is left after removing the strips for baskets. It is used only in making fences.
sample_bolinao: Usaren mo in saylapatnin kawayan nin ipangalabat sa gardin.
sample_english: Use thestripsof the inside part of bamboo to make a fence around the garden.

meaning_english: A gravestone with an inscription or memorial.
sample_bolinao: Salapida, naisurat a maipa'ka' konan nati.
sample_english: On the headstone, things are written about the dead person.

meaning_english: To not be quite completely severed from the main part and continue to swing back and forth.
sample_bolinao: No nasugat ka ket laping ya, mas maong nin galaten ma.
sample_english: If your wound is dangling it is much better to remove it.

meaning_english: Pencil.
sample_bolinao: Si lapis ko, na'met ya kanya' nin sinilyan ya.
sample_english: My pencil was lost so it was replaced.

meaning_english: An evenly sliced off steak of meat or fish.
sample_bolinao: Makubpal a laplap mo kanya' maku'net ya no naluto'.
sample_english: Your slices are thick and so it is tough when it is cooked.

meaning_english: Repeated scraping action such as to remove the bark from a tree or the skin from a cow.
To violently grab away such as clothes from one's body or paper from another person.
The act of yanking something from the place it is secured.
sample_bolinao: Lapnit a panglat konan rubir nin naisungat sa diwi.
sample_english: The snagged thorn in the rope was removed with a yank.

meaning_english: To get a thing with strength and force from its place.
sample_bolinao: Linapnitnayay baskit sa gamet ko.
sample_english: Hetookthe basketby forcefrom my hand.

meaning_english: Matured coconut which does not have oil.
sample_bolinao: Lapogyay ungot ta kasan ladak nan laman na.
sample_english: The coconut meat has no oil.

meaning_english: The cloudiness of a liquid due to sediment and other deposits in it being churned up.
sample_bolinao: Kasisyawan a lapot na nin ranom baybay sawanin.
sample_english: The cloudiness of the water at the seashore is moderate today.

meaning_english: The act of a sudden forceful pull on something
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket lapsot yaynan lapsot sa rubir no mangayuma ya.
sample_english: Juan repeatedly yanks on the rope when mending the nets.

meaning_english: To use force to detach or disconnect something such as to take things or people away from someplace by force.
The action of flowing over from a wide area.
sample_bolinao: Lapwas anan mangudas a ranom sa gagawa' sa alog ta maksaw a rapeg.
sample_english: The water overflowed from the field in the valley for about an hour because of the hard rain.

meaning_english: Binoculars.
sample_bolinao: Sa largabista ko, marate' anggan babali a ma'kit.
sample_english: My binoculars are good for seeing as far as the town.

meaning_english: A type of fine mud that is formed into bricks and holds water better than cement.
sample_bolinao: Sin ginwa' miyaytaw si dipusito nin ranom mi nangusar kamin Largamasa ta pinggat kai ya tumuro'.
sample_english: When we made the water trough we used largamasa so that it would not leak.

meaning_english: To go directly someplace.
sample_bolinao: Largo yay ruran ko anggan Arnedo.
sample_english: My vehicle went directly to Arnedo.

meaning_english: The white fighting cock with black markings.
The journey through something such as life, wind, water, usually with difficulty.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' mabistay lasat na sa byay.
sample_english: His journey through life has not been good.

meaning_english: To ferry through something.
sample_bolinao: Ma'kit sa pangingitpel mi, sa linasat-lasat mi nin kaidapan, kaberengan, tan pitipitan nin kapapa'sar.
sample_english: It is seen by means of our act of enduring, of our coming through difficulties, sorrows, and tight situations.

meaning_english: To passed through difficulties.
sample_bolinao: Sa pirmi nin pako ko sa raruma nin lugar, abaw anay piligro nin linasat ko sa kariripay ko sa uilog, sa nikasna' ko nin tulisan, sa gawa' ran kapada ko nin Judio tan ran ambo' nin Judio nin kuntra kongko.
sample_english: In my constant journeying to other places, there were a lot of dangers I passed through in my crossing over rivers, in my meeting robbers, in what my fellow Jews and the non Jews did against me.

meaning_english: Rice broth, rice water that is boiling.
sample_bolinao: Saylasawsina'pang ket mataway no mapalet.
sample_english: Thericebroth is tasty when its fluid is thick.

meaning_english: That which is scraped off from something.
sample_bolinao: Gulpin laslas a nangyadi' sa pinanglinis ran anuon.
sample_english: There was a lot of scraping off that happened in the cleaning of the fence posts.

meaning_english: To removed something in a shaving or trimming manner with a bolo.
sample_bolinao: Laslasen may buko nan kawayan.
sample_english: Shave the nodes off the bamboo with the bolo.

meaning_english: A bow made with a ribbon that is commonly placed in the hair or on clothing.
sample_bolinao: Main nin laso sa ulo ko.
sample_english: There is aribbonon my head.

meaning_english: The second rider or the act of hitching a ride with someone.
sample_bolinao: Mabyat a lason ko kanya' dandani ya nin kai makaalis a mutor ko.
sample_english: My rider was heavy and so my motorcycle could hardly move.

meaning_english: Rope, belt ormageyused for whipping.
meaning_filipino: Patpat na pangpalù sa anak kung may kasalanan.
sample_bolinao: Say lasot na ni tatay ket masakit.
sample_english: Father's whip hurts.

meaning_english: A part that was torn or removed forcibly from a whole.
sample_bolinao: Si lasping nan siti si batag, itaw ya sa basurawan.
sample_english: The portion removed from this banana is in the garbage.

meaning_english: To remove or strip off from the whole one portion or item.
sample_bolinao: Laspingan ma nin bulong a puon batag.
sample_english: Strip some of the leaves off from the banana stalk.

meaning_english: To remove an item off from a bunch such as a banana or to tear a piece off from or out of something that is easily torn such as a page from a book.
sample_bolinao: Laspingen yay sayay batag sa sayay sapar.
sample_english: Take one banana from the bunch.

meaning_english: Stylishness.
sample_bolinao: Si laspot mo, andi' mo kapagawan.
sample_english: Don't be concerned about your being stylish.

meaning_english: To follow a fad.
Elastic or stretchable material.
sample_bolinao: Si lastiko nan tirador ko, mabista ya.
sample_english: The rubber of my slingshot is good.

meaning_english: To exaggerate about something.
sample_bolinao: Lastog yaynan lastog si Mars no miisturyawan saran amigo na maipa'ka' sa swildo na sa trabaho na.
sample_english: Mars repeatedly exaggerates when telling stories to his friends about his wages at work.

meaning_english: Small red onion.
sample_bolinao: Kai ako mangan lasuna ta mabayani.
sample_english: I don't eat shallots because they are strong.

meaning_english: To whip severely and harshly with a long flexible object such as a rope.
sample_bolinao: Sa mabanta-bantayan nin paliwa', lasuten rasara anabungat nin amo a aripen ra.
sample_english: In the show that was being watched the boss whipped his servant for no reason at all.

meaning_english: An unobstructed view or place of passage.
sample_bolinao: Sa lasway iti, ma'kit anggan babali.
sample_english: From the unobstructed view here one can see to the town.

meaning_english: A tin can or container, usually an empty two kilogram biscuit can but the size depends on its use.

sample_english: The snake skin is old.

meaning_english: To lay tile to encase a well pipe or use as a drainage pipe, etc.
meaning_filipino: Lagyan ng alkantarilyaanggilid ng balon, imburnal at iba pa.
sample_bolinao: Si bubon ra,linusobmangibwat sa rarem anggan ta'gay.
sample_english: Theirwell has been surrounded with a casing from bottom to top.

meaning_english: To pierce through something and so make a hole.
sample_bolinao: Linsok nayan pana' a ringring nan baluto.
sample_english: The fish gun's arrow pierced the side of the boat..

meaning_english: Cosmetic lotion.
A piece of land that is defined or owned for a specific purpose.
sample_bolinao: Nadumog raya a baboy nin nakaida' saluta'.
sample_english: They discovered a pig lying on theground.

meaning_english: A crack in the ground, concrete, lips, etc. because of lack of moisture.
sample_bolinao: Alaki alutaksa luta'!
sample_english: Thecracksin the ground are big!

meaning_english: Fractured in pieces.
To be buoyant and afloat in a liquid.
sample_bolinao: Sa lutaw nan baluto ko, abaw makarga na.
sample_english: Because of the buoyancy of my boat it can carry a lot of cargo.

meaning_english: A lot or small parcel of ground.
sample_bolinao: Napadilyay luti.
sample_english: The lot isenclosedwithwalls.

meaning_english: Mud that has been churned up and rutted from rain and being trampled in.
sample_bolinao: Lutlot yay dalan nin mako sa baybay ta kai ya nin siniminto.
sample_english: The road going to the seashore is all churned up mud since it is not cemented.

meaning_english: To cause to become muddy, to make the place muddy.
sample_bolinao: Linutlotran damulag a dalan.
sample_english: The carabao made the way muddy.

meaning_english: The stage of ripening.
sample_bolinao: Mataway a luto' mo.
sample_english: Your cooking is delicious.

meaning_english: Gas pain or flatulence.
sample_bolinao: Lutog ya si Juan sawanin ta ambo' mabistay panunaw nan tyan na ta naray'epan ya.
sample_english: Juan has gas pain now for his stomach is not digesting well since he was chilled.

meaning_english: A competitive bid for something at an event put on as a benefit for someone or thing.
sample_bolinao: Kasan lutsa mo kongko ta abaw kwarta ko.
sample_english: You have nothing to bid against me for I have a lot of money.

meaning_english: To bid, to offer a price for something at an auction or benefit.
To cook food using heat.
sample_bolinao: Lutuenmoyon maong a karni pigaw lumumo.
sample_english: Cookthe meat very well so that it will become soft.

meaning_english: The internal organs in the main cavity of the body, especially those in the abdomen (e.g., the intestines).
sample_bolinao: Niluto' mi a luub-luob nan pinati mi nin baboy.
sample_english: We cooked the intestines of the pig we slaughtered.

meaning_english: To entering someplace.
sample_bolinao: Sa adtiman a bali nin luuban moyo, wamoyo yapo', <Sapa kumon ta say bindisyon nan Dios ket magkamain konran mampiikap iti.>
sample_english: To whatever house you go into, say first, <May those who live here come to have the blessings of God.>

meaning_english: To go inside someplace or thing.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya magwa' nin luuben a upisina nan prinsipal nin kasan patanid konan sikritarya na.
sample_english: It is not possible to go into the office of the principal without asking permission from his secretary.

meaning_english: For a person to keep on doing things which he is not supposed to do.
sample_bolinao: Luuden nay gumargar no ima'nwen ya.
sample_english: He puts up a fuss and gets noisier when he is told no.

meaning_english: To fit loosely.
sample_bolinao: Sabtan luway nan pantalon ko kanya' koya niparitubar.
sample_english: My pants were hanging extremely loosely so I had them sewn up.

meaning_english: A pepper plant or fruit, either spicy or sweet.
sample_bolinao: Main luya nin maagas tan ambo' sa lako' ra.
sample_english: There are peppers that are spicy and those that are not that they sell.

meaning_english: For fruit or similar things to be slimy or watery and smeared from being crushed.
sample_bolinao: Luyak ana a mangga sa sirong nan kayo ta nada'daan nin damulag tan baka.
sample_english: The mangoes under the tree were mush since the carabao and cattle had trampled on them.

meaning_english: To make something mushy.
A long red pepper.
sample_bolinao: Abaw anay mu'dit a bunga nin luyan-anro a mula ni tatay ko.
sample_english: There are a lot of the long red pepper fruit that my father planted that are now red.

meaning_english: A sweet bell pepper.
sample_bolinao: Na'pos a lako' ran luyan-kargador sa babali.
sample_english: The red bell peppers for sale in town are sold out.

meaning_english: A small variety of green or red spicy peppers.
sample_bolinao: Ibarbar aluyan-urandissa suka' mi'sa panawsawan nin binaya.
sample_english: Soak the smallhot peppersin vinegar and then dip into it what was roasted.

meaning_english: For something to be hanging down loosely or unevenly, often of skin or the edge of a cloth.
A call to a carabao to stop.
sample_bolinao: Lwa! wana kanya' tinumgen yay damulag.
sample_english: Whoa! he said and so the carabao came to a stop.

meaning_english: Tears that flow from the eyes.
sample_bolinao: Say lwa' na no umakis ya, umakrebey.
sample_english: When he cries, his tears flow profusely.

meaning_english: To tear up over something.
sample_bolinao: Lwa'-lwaanyay anak sin kasa yay ina na.
sample_english: The child teared up when his mother was not there.

meaning_english: A ladle, a large spoonlike utensil used to scoop out things from a pot.
sample_bolinao: Say lwag nin kayo, matalag anan iyusar ta main anan plastik.
sample_english: The wooden ladles are now rarely used since there are now plastic.

meaning_english: To take food from the cooking pot with a ladle usually to put it in a serving bowl.
sample_bolinao: Lwagenmoy sina'pang sa plato.
sample_english: Scoop out the rice onto the plates.

meaning_english: A word said when trying to stop a carabao.
meaning_filipino: Ho; salitang ginagamit kung gustong pahintuin ang kalabaw.
sample_bolinao: Lwawenmay damulag pigaw painawa ya.
sample_english: Stopthe carabao so that it can rest.

meaning_english: A pipe wrench.
sample_bolinao: Mangusar kami nin lyabi no kai mi maglat a ruskas.
sample_english: We use a pipe wrench if we cannot remove a bolt.

meaning_english: The one destined to win, especially in gambling and some competitions.
sample_bolinao: Mamusta ya si Sam sa lyamado nin manok no bulang.
sample_english: When there's a cockfight, Sam places his bet on the expected winner.

meaning_english: You (sing) and him/her.
sample_bolinao: Kayabanma.
sample_english: Callher/him.

meaning_english: The moo of a cow or carabao.
sample_bolinao: No tumunoy yan damulag, ma' wana.
sample_english: If the carabao makes a sound, he say moo.

meaning_english: For something to be able to be answered.
sample_bolinao: Kai ko ma'batan a tepet na kongko.
sample_english: I am not able to answer his question to me.

meaning_english: Thin of body, lean.
sample_bolinao: Ma'bengyay amigo ko.
sample_english: My friend isthin.

meaning_english: To be able to be borrowed.
sample_bolinao: Main ma'dam kwarta ko no matkap mo.
sample_english: I have money you can borrow if you need it.

meaning_english: Happened to hit the head against something above it.
sample_bolinao: Na'dolnayay baskit ket nanabo' ya.
sample_english: His head hit the basket and it fell down.

meaning_english: To be sturdy and durable as of objects or steadfast as in love.
sample_bolinao: Ma'geta sapatos ko.
sample_english: My shoes aredurable.

meaning_english: To be able to go someplace with a purpose.
sample_bolinao: Ma'ka' nay iskilawan abir rapeg ta rabay nay mag'adal.
sample_english: He will go to school even though there is rain for he likes to study.

meaning_english: To be able to have something for eating.
sample_bolinao: Ma'kan anay rimas no maluto' ana.
sample_english: Bread fruit can be eaten when it is cooked.

meaning_english: For something to be in the state of having been removed from its function or place of attachment.
sample_bolinao: Ma'kas a binalaybay no maksaw a siri.
sample_english: The hung out clothes will be blown off when the wind is strong.

meaning_english: To be able to be seen.
sample_bolinao: Ma'kit yay hapislip na ni madam Lydia.
sample_english: Madam Lydia's half slip is showing.

meaning_english: Income, that which comes to be seen as a result of an event.
sample_bolinao: Abaw ana'kitanra sa pagkumirsyon kuna'.
sample_english: Theyearnedmuch by selling fish.

meaning_english: To be knocked out cold.
sample_bolinao: Ma'lek akoyna pigaw masakbay akon mimata.
sample_english: I will go to sleep now so that I will awake early.

meaning_english: For something to spill out of a container.
sample_bolinao: Iyator mo in say kwarta mo pigaw kai nin ma'met.
sample_english: Put that money of yours in a safe place so that it will not be lost.

meaning_english: For someone to be spilled on by something.
sample_bolinao: Umakis ya no ma'metan yan ikap.
sample_english: He cries when he has lost a toy.

meaning_english: For a restricting element to be large enough to hold or accommodate something.
sample_bolinao: Ma'minkamo nga'min sa dyip.
sample_english: The jeep canaccommodateall you.

meaning_english: For an activity to be intense or exciting or have ardor.
sample_bolinao: Ma'mot a kaldiro no sumbo ana a man'iluto'.
sample_english: The kettle is hot when what is being cooked boils.

meaning_english: To be burned, singed or scaled.
sample_bolinao: Igawgaw moy pinalig sa ma'mutan pigaw nin makri'.
sample_english: Sun dry the dried fish in the heat of the sun so that it will be dry.

meaning_english: For someone to have eaten a lot of meat or fish at a meal.
sample_bolinao: Ma'nan akon mangan nin kuna' no gulpi a makalap nan pasabing mi.
sample_english: I eat a lot of fish when there is a lot that we get from our fish coral.

meaning_english: To be consumed, eaten or used up.
sample_bolinao: Dandani ana ma'pos a byas kanya' manaliw kayna.
sample_english: The rice is almost gone so buy some.

meaning_english: Stifled or lacking for air and struggling to breath.
sample_bolinao: Ma'pusanyan ladak a lampadawan kanya' pirmin manadya'.
sample_english: The lamp willrunout of oil so always be prepared for it.

meaning_english: For something to be old and out of date focusing on length of time.
sample_bolinao: Ma'ran yaynay seket ko kanya' koya silyan.
sample_english: My set of clothing is old and worn out and so I will replace it.

meaning_english: For something to end suddenly, such as a social movement.
sample_bolinao: Mapres ket sali'ma'repyay apoy.
sample_english: It's windy, so the light mightgo out.

meaning_english: To be able to put out a light or to extinguish a burning fire.
meaning_filipino: Mapatay ang apuy; maaring mapatay ang apuy.
sample_bolinao: Ma'repanyay apoy no sakban yan ules a nalbet.
sample_english: The fire canbequenched when a wet blanket is spread over it.

meaning_english: To be greedy, an inordinate desire for wealth or possessions for oneself.
sample_bolinao: Ma'samya sa kayamanan.
sample_english: He isgreedyfor riches.

meaning_english: The taste of something when much salt is put on.
sample_bolinao: Ma'sin a ranom sa baybay.
sample_english: Sea water is salty.

meaning_english: Smoky.
sample_bolinao: Ma'sokyay deta nan apoy ta madutak a dungot.
sample_english: The fire issmokybecause the fuel is wet.

meaning_english: To be engulfed in smoke.
sample_bolinao: Matkap ma'sukan a bikoy mais a susuuran.
sample_english: The corn seeds that are at the kitchen ceiling need to be smoked.

meaning_english: For something to be in the state of taking a long time.
sample_bolinao: Na'tengkami nin tinuma'gan.
sample_english: We waited along time.

meaning_english: To be sexually active.
sample_bolinao: Ma'toy sara kano a kuniho nin ayep.
sample_english: It is said that rabbits are sexually active animals.

meaning_english: To be dried up, having the water removed from something with a remnant or residue left such as amarshin dry season or a pan left on the fire.
sample_bolinao: Ma'tyan a gulpin gagawa' no Oktubre.
sample_english: Many of the rice fields are dry in October.

meaning_english: For an area or container of water to dried up or be absorbed such as during cooking.
sample_bolinao: Ma'tyananyay bubon no tepe' Abril tan Mayo.
sample_english: The well dries up duringApriland May.

meaning_english: For a covering to happen to be ripped open and be flapping around.
sample_bolinao: Madali' ma'wap a ulo nan bali ni Istong ta maksaw anay bagyo sawanin.
sample_english: The top of Istong's house was quickly ripped off for the storm today was intense.

meaning_english: To feel dizzy and faint.
sample_bolinao: Noma'werka, matkap moy painawa.
sample_english: If you arefaint, you need to rest.

meaning_english: To be able to persuade or move them to your side of the argument.
sample_bolinao: Abirno tulo kamo,ma'witko.
sample_english: Even if you are three, I can carry you.

meaning_english: To feel sorry for or to regret the loss of someone or something.
sample_bolinao: Naabagayraya ni Pedro tan Juan a pilay ket immanda' ya.
sample_english: Peter and Johnsympathizedwith the lame man, so he was cured.

meaning_english: To be delayed or hindered from making progress in what one is doing.
sample_bolinao: Naabara'a byahi min mako sa Manila ta nasida' yay ruran mi.
sample_english: Our trip to Manila wasdelayedbecause our ride broke down.

meaning_english: To be wrong.
sample_bolinao: Maabaska sa ubat mo no mamper ka kona ni Juan.
sample_english: Your answer will bewrong if you listen to Juan.

meaning_english: To be goodor beneficial.
sample_bolinao: Gumawa' kamonmaabigkonran kapada moyon tawo.
sample_english: Dogoodto your fellowmen.

meaning_english: The characteristic of a person who is good at giving alibis to evade responsibility, etc.
sample_bolinao: Si tawon maabilidad, kai ya gapo nin mabitilan.
sample_english: A resourceful person will never go hungry.

meaning_english: To be able to overtake someone or something.
sample_bolinao: Maabot nan damulag ni Pablo a mula nan kamuti ni Pipik.
sample_english: Pipik's sweet potato plants are within reach of Pablo's carabao.

meaning_english: To have been embraced.
sample_bolinao: Maabrasa nasaray san'ili ra nin mako sara sa bali ra.
sample_english: He embraces their guests that come to their house.

meaning_english: To bring up again an incident that happened in the past and has been settled or even forgotten.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a maabrigwar ran prublima kada mako saradti.
sample_english: They reopen a lot of problems every time they go here.

meaning_english: For a specific thing to be open.
sample_bolinao: Nili'mwan ako ta bigra' anaabryanyay purta.
sample_english: I was frightened because the door was suddenly opened.

meaning_english: Acquitted, for a person to be declared not guilty of something.
sample_bolinao: Mampilalo ya si Juan a maabswilto ya sa dimanda kona ta kasan mabyat nin ibidinsya kuntra kona.
sample_english: Juan is hoping he will be acquitted from the law suit against him for lack of strong evidence against him.

meaning_english: Someone is worrying about something.
sample_bolinao: Mipaayupa' kamon italek moyo konan Dios a sarba nin mangkaaburidwan moyo bana' ta si Dios, mampagawan nakamo.
sample_english: Humble yourselves entrusting to God all of your current worries because God, he is caring for you.

meaning_english: For something to be allowed.
sample_bolinao: Maaburuyan saran kikalamo' sa pangrarayo.
sample_english: They were allowed to participate in worship.

meaning_english: To be abused.
sample_bolinao: No maabuso ran tawo a pangusar sa taaw, kasayna li' kuna'.
sample_english: If people are abusing the use of the ocean, there will later on be no fish.

meaning_english: To be overtaken by something.
sample_bolinao: Naabutan saran arubuob sa taaw si Pablo kanya' nin linumdeg yay mutor ra.
sample_english: The gust overtook Pablo in the sea and so their motorized boat sank.

meaning_english: To be plowed.
sample_bolinao: Maadado nin mainum'ay a luta' sa gagawa' no malumo a luta'.
sample_english: The ground in the field is easily plowed when it is a soft loam soil.

meaning_english: For someone to happen to learn something.
sample_bolinao: Naadal koyna a mag'in nin mapda' sa animan a kapapa'sar ko.
sample_english: I have learned to become satisfied in whatever my situation is.

meaning_english: To be inculcated or having learned from an event or person.
sample_bolinao: Maadalan saran mamasa tan manurat a a'nak sa iskilawan.
sample_english: The children will be able to study reading and writing in school.

meaning_english: Close to one's affection, interests, etc.
sample_bolinao: Maadaniya sa maidap a byay.
sample_english: He issympatheticto those who are hard up in life.

meaning_english: To have the opportunity to pay attention to something.
sample_bolinao: Maadap ko tamo' a mami'pi' tepe' Sabado.
sample_english: I can only get at the laundry each Saturday.

meaning_english: The bitter acrid taste of bamboo shoots without blanching, eggplant that lacked water, etc.
sample_bolinao: Maadat a tarom ta kasaynan rapeg.
sample_english: The eggplant tastes acrid for there is no rain now.

meaning_english: Not open to view.
sample_bolinao: Maadi a bunga nan mangga ta mabulong tan masanga ya.
sample_english: The mangoes are hidden since the tree is full of leaves and branches.

meaning_english: Progressive, prosperous.
sample_bolinao: Sain nin maadilanta nin byay ko sin nu'na, sain a lamang ket nibilang koynan kasan sirbi.
sample_english: That prosperous life of mine before, that same life nonetheless I now consider useless.

meaning_english: To be loving and caring.
sample_bolinao: Si Dios amaado',iti ya kongko.
sample_english: ThelovingGod is within me.

meaning_english: To be hidden from something.
sample_bolinao: Naadyan yan ulay sa kabinit ta nakaabri ya.
sample_english: The snake was hidden in the cabinet since it had been left open.

meaning_english: To be shredded.
sample_bolinao: Si Maria ket mana'da' yan naagap nin karot sa rigrig baybay.
sample_english: Maria is stepping on the yams on the seashore shredding them.

meaning_english: To be hot or peppery to the taste.
sample_bolinao: Mataway bale'maagas.
sample_english: It's delicious butpeppery.

meaning_english: To be burned by something spicy or peppery by it coming in contact with the eyes, lips, etc.
sample_bolinao: Maagasan akon buga' no mangan akon ginataan nin luya.
sample_english: I get burned a bit when I eat peppered coconut milk.

meaning_english: To be diligent and prompt in accomplishing a task.
sample_bolinao: Maagawa ya sa pangwa' nan trabaho na si Osing.
sample_english: Osing is diligent in doing his work.

meaning_english: To be cut for harvesting with a reaping hook.
sample_bolinao: Main anan maagod nin parin konan sitin bulan.
sample_english: There is rice that can be cut this month.

meaning_english: Greedy or covetous, desiring to get everything for yourself, even if it belongs to someone else.
sample_bolinao: No maagom atamo, say kayamanan tamoynay mampag'in nin dios tamo.
sample_english: If we are greedy, that which is our riches is becoming our God.

meaning_english: To be suffering from being taken advantage of.
sample_bolinao: Saray trabahador, kai ra rabay amaagrabyado.
sample_english: The workers don't want to be takenadvantageof.

meaning_english: To be able to reach by extending the hand and so obtain something.
sample_bolinao: Naagwang nan pusa' a kuna' a man'ipakri' sa nikatin nin birawo.
sample_english: The cat was able to reach the fish that was being dried in a hanging winnowing basket.

meaning_english: Be able to endure, bear, or withstand under something heavy.
sample_bolinao: Kai ko maagwantawan a amot nan inamot sa kapi ko sawanin.
sample_english: I cannot endure the heat of the hot water in my coffee today.

meaning_english: To be taught about something.
sample_bolinao: Maakayan kwan mangitara a ari ko ta gulpin gitara mi.
sample_english: I could teach my younger sibling to play the guitar since we have a lot of them.

meaning_english: Prone to crying.
sample_bolinao: No maakis ya kano a anak no daite' ya et madunong ya li' no umalaki ya.
sample_english: Supposedly if a child is prone to crying when he is still little, he will be well behaved when he is grown up.

meaning_english: Worthy to be accepted or acceptable.
sample_bolinao: Naako'nay kakisidan ko a mag'in manuyang na.
sample_english: He hasacceptedmy low state in becoming his child-in-law.

meaning_english: To happen to have an accident.
sample_bolinao: Palna-palna' kan magmaniho pigaw kai ka maaksidinti.
sample_english: Take it easy driving so that you don't happen to have an accident.

meaning_english: To be accused of something.
sample_bolinao: Maakusa ya ta nangmati ya.
sample_english: He will be accused for he killed someone.

meaning_english: To accuse someone of something.
sample_bolinao: Andi' kayna mako yapo' sa pista ra ta bangli' si'kay maakusawan ran nangulo itaw.
sample_english: Don't go right now to their feast since you will likely be accused by them of making a disturbance there.

meaning_english: To be of value or important.
sample_bolinao: Masmaalagaa pigagawa' nan sayay tawo dyan say kabistawan nin rupa na.
sample_english: The character of a person is morevaluablethan his appearance.

meaning_english: For an area to be fenced in with wire.
sample_bolinao: Naalamriyaynay babatag.
sample_english: The banana plantation is nowsurroundedwith barbedwire.

meaning_english: To be feeling nauseated from an excess of fatty food or smelling a strong unpleasant odor.
sample_bolinao: Maalaw'aw ako no mi'sa bana' sa angtol nin sungayan.
sample_english: I sometimes am nauseated because of the smell of horned fish.

meaning_english: To be in a straight line.
sample_bolinao: Maalay a nipangmula ran kamutin kayo.
sample_english: Their planting of the cassava was straight.

meaning_english: Very little wave, ripple.
sample_bolinao: Naalen'alena kulet a sabot na.
sample_english: His curly hair flows in waves or ripples.

meaning_english: For the coconut fruit to have not matured properly since it had fallen prematurely or the plant had been damaged.
sample_bolinao: Maaley kasabyan a bunga nin ungot ta main masakit nin puon.
sample_english: Normally it is because of sickness in the trunk of a coconut that the fruit is bad.

meaning_english: Vigor, full of vigor a blooming or flourishing condition, said of plants growing thick and or when flowering, or a girl growing to a young woman.
Prosperous, successful, flourishing.
sample_bolinao: Maaligwas anay byay sawanin ta gulpin magwa' paningkapan.
sample_english: Life is progressing now days since there are many ways to make a living.

meaning_english: To be cared for.
sample_bolinao: Nipatanid ya nin kai sumrep sa trabaho pigaw maalila' nayay abing na.
sample_english: She took leave so that she wouldn't come into work so that she could be caring for her baby.

meaning_english: To happen to be able to recognize or acknowledge something.
sample_bolinao: Maalilbi' kwa si tatay abir nakagurot ya.
sample_english: I can recognize father even though he has his back to me.

meaning_english: For the winds to be swirling.
sample_bolinao: Maalimbusabos no mi'sa nin pinasyan kasaw nin bagyo.
sample_english: Sometimes when there is an extremely strong storm it is filled with twisters.

meaning_english: To happen to cast a shadow on something.
sample_bolinao: Maalinawan nako no lumabas kami sa main tyo'.
sample_english: You cast a shadow on me when we pass a place that has a light.

meaning_english: To be neat.
sample_bolinao: Maalinya ya sa lalaman.
sample_english: She is always neat and well groomed.

meaning_english: To have chickenpox.
sample_bolinao: Saray ua'nak amaalipatoumata'gay a amot ra.
sample_english: Children who are sick withchickenpoxhave a high fever.

meaning_english: To be nervous and agitated.
sample_bolinao: Maalipudas ako no kasan kwarta ko.
sample_english: I get agitated when I don't have any money.

meaning_english: Have had athletes foot.
sample_bolinao: Naalipungaya ta pirmi yan dumada' sa raranom.
sample_english: He hasathletes footbecause he is always stepping in water.

meaning_english: To be moved from one place or thing to another.
sample_bolinao: Maalis ya in si dalagan ta kai nin nikali a ayi na.
sample_english: That bamboo settee moves around since its feet were not dug in.

meaning_english: To be able to be moved from one place to another.
sample_bolinao: Main anan ba'yon bali nin magwa' ran maalisan sa Baguio.
sample_english: There is a new house they can move to in Baguio.

meaning_english: To be prosperous.
sample_bolinao: Maalkansaynaa byay na.
sample_english: His life is nowprosperous.

meaning_english: To be able to lift up from below.

sample_bolinao: Abaw a mangga ninnabangorsa dalan ta ma'mot sa ruran.

meaning_english: For large waves to be coming in one right after another, usually in three's.
sample_bolinao: Mabanlayon ana sa baybay no maksaw a siri tan no bagyo.
sample_english: There are sets of large waves on the seashore when it is windy and there's a storm.

meaning_english: To be careless and unconcerned in doing something.
sample_bolinao: Masida' a sapatos abir kapanaliw ta mabanos yan mangusar.
sample_english: The shoes get ruined even when they have just been purchased since he is indifferent about how they are used.

meaning_english: Coincidence, to happen to come upon something.
sample_bolinao: Mangawit kan payong ta sali' mabansagan moy rapeg.
sample_english: Take along an umbrella for you might perchance be caught in some rain.

meaning_english: To observing something with a purpose.
sample_bolinao: Mabantayan kwan mag'adal anak ko sa iskilawan.
sample_english: I keep an eye on my child's study progress in school.

meaning_english: To be unsteady, especially of a rotating or repeating motion.
sample_bolinao: Mabarag a tursi nan bulak sa siminto.
sample_english: The spinning of the top on the cement is wobbly.

meaning_english: For a persons thinking process to not be right as seen in his actions.
sample_bolinao: Nabarangya ket napunta nay kadukaan.
sample_english: Hewent astrayand so headed into evil ways.

meaning_english: To be indwelt by thebarasspirit.
sample_bolinao: No mabaras yay saya tawo, maka'deng ya sa pwit kawayan.
sample_english: If a person is indwelt by the small spirit people, he can stand on the end of a bamboo.

meaning_english: For the flow to be stopped such as the nose to be plugged up or a toilet to be plugged up.
sample_bolinao: Mabarawan a kanal bana' sa silupin tan raruma et nin dikot.
sample_english: The channel was blocked because of the cellophane and other trash.

meaning_english: To be soaked in a liquid.
sample_bolinao: Nabarbar yan na'teng a karni kanya' ya malumo.
sample_english: The beef was soaked a long time and so it was tender.

meaning_english: To have reddish blotches on the skin from swelling or a whipping or something being too tight.
sample_bolinao: Mabarer a awak mo no siin a isulot mo ta mairot yay in.
sample_english: You will have blotches on your waist if what you are wearing is too tight.

meaning_english: To have a welt or an imprint on the skin from a whipping.
sample_bolinao: Mabareransa katat no magket nin ambak.
sample_english: There is an imprint on the skin when whipped.

meaning_english: For an event or person to be rushing through something.
For a long object to be broken.
sample_bolinao: Madali' nin mabari' a kawayan no binukbok.
sample_english: Bamboo that has been eaten by wood weevil is easily broken.

meaning_english: To be bandaged or wrapped securely.
sample_bolinao: Nabarkot ya nin gunem tan main nin kabunlalakaw sa ulo na.
sample_english: He was wrapped with clouds and there was a rainbow on his head.

meaning_english: For something to be varnished.
sample_bolinao: Gumista a tekrean no mabarnisan.
sample_english: The chair will look nice when it is varnished.

meaning_english: For the hands or feet to be bound.
sample_bolinao: Mabaror yan naylon a ayi nan manuk-manok no mala'wan ya.
sample_english: The feet of a bird are bound with a nylon rope when it is snared.

meaning_english: For something to be able to be read such as a book or actions.
sample_bolinao: Ani saray irgo amabasamo?
sample_english: What languages do youread?

meaning_english: For a part of the body to be inflamed and swollen, often with obvious pus.
sample_bolinao: Mabasel yay tangan ayi ni Juan ta nasugat ya tan nalbet ya.
sample_english: Juan's big toe is swollen and inflamed since he cut it and got wet.

meaning_english: To be collected in a narrow mesh net.
sample_bolinao: Sa angan ko abaw a mabasnig ran tirong ta malinak yay baybay.
sample_english: In my opinion there are a lot of fingerlings they have been able to bag since the shallows are calm.

meaning_english: Scold.
To be crooked, misaligned or cocked to one side.
sample_bolinao: No sumibi' yay anak, mabaswing yay bebey na.
sample_english: When the child pouts his mouth is cocked to one side.

meaning_english: To be sunburned.
sample_bolinao: Mabatad yaynay damulag sa amot.
sample_english: The carabao was sunburned in the heat.

meaning_english: To be caught in a net or trip line in the path.
sample_bolinao: Nabatengyay baboy talon sa eket nin la'wan.
sample_english: The pig was trapped in the snare.

meaning_english: To be late.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a bungan mangga anabati'sa ta'gay.
sample_english: There are many mangoesleftup in the mango tree.

meaning_english: To be left behind someplace such as the tip of an arrow being left inside a wound.
sample_bolinao: Mabatian nin duwi no mi'sa no masurot nin paka'lek.
sample_english: Sometimes when poked by a touch-me-not a thorn gets left in you.

meaning_english: Have a sudden headache or stomachache caused by a visitor, witchcraft.
sample_bolinao: Mabato a dalan mamunta komi.
sample_english: The path we heading on is stony.

meaning_english: For something to be removed or deducted from something.
sample_bolinao: Kasan mabaw'as sa swildo abir piso.
sample_english: There was nothing, not even a peso, taken from the salary.

meaning_english: For something to be reduced by some amount.
sample_bolinao: Nabaw'asanyay sayay baskit nin mangga.
sample_english: One of the baskets had mangoesremoved from it.

meaning_english: To be garlicky.
sample_bolinao: Mabawang nin sinanglay nin mani a rabay ko.
sample_english: Its garlicky roasted peanuts that I like.

meaning_english: To be disoriented because of poison.
sample_bolinao: Mangika' saran samal pigaw mabawet saray kuna'.
sample_english: They put poison in the water in order to disorient the fish.

meaning_english: To have something gotten back.
sample_bolinao: Mabawi' koynay puunan ko.
sample_english: I am going now to get back my investment.

meaning_english: For a non-physical thing, such as the mind, to take a different direction.
sample_bolinao: Mabawing yay linya.
sample_english: The line is bowing.

meaning_english: For someone to be baptized.
sample_bolinao: Kayadi' na nin nabawtismwan ni Jesus, nako yaynan tampor sa rigrig.
sample_english: Right after Jesus was baptized, he went immediately to the shore.

meaning_english: To be swollen such as a sore or in pregnancy.
sample_bolinao: Mabaya' yay pispis no main nin tili'tili'.
sample_english: The cheek is swelled if there is mumps.

meaning_english: For something to be paid for.
sample_bolinao: Mabayadan kwaynay utang ko no Linggo.
sample_english: I will have paid my debt on Sunday.

meaning_english: For a large area to be splashed with water such as in cleaning something.
sample_bolinao: Mabayak yay luob bali no rapeg ta butbot yay bubong na.
sample_english: The inside of the house gets drenched when it rains since the roof has a hole in it.

meaning_english: To be intense and distinctive or irritating in relation to the character of a thing.
sample_bolinao: Mabayani yay aso ko.
sample_english: My dog is ferocious.

meaning_english: To be a mouthy or talkative person.
sample_bolinao: Duka' a babayinmabebey.
sample_english: It is not good for a woman to betalkative.

meaning_english: To have been exposed to the wind for a prolonged period of time, such as on a trip, resulting in sickness.
sample_bolinao: Sakbungan may abing pigaw kai ya nin mabegbeg.
sample_english: Cover the baby so that he does not get sick from wind exposure.

meaning_english: To have something such as a fish bone caught in the throat.
sample_bolinao: Pakanda' kan mangna' kuna' tamabelbelankan duwi.
sample_english: Be careful in eating fish, you might happen to get a bone caught in your throat.

meaning_english: For something to be wrapped and tied together.
sample_bolinao: Kai ko maberber a sabot na sa subra nin kubpal.
sample_english: I do not tie her hair with something very thick.

meaning_english: To be sorrowful because of a situation that is sad such as being lonely or a bad happening.
sample_bolinao: Mabereng ya ta mailiw ya konran matua na.
sample_english: He is sad since he is missing his parents.

meaning_english: To be frequent or often in occurrence.
sample_bolinao: Mabetbeta kappika' na sa Isla Santiago ta itaw saray pamilya na.
sample_english: Her trips to Santiago Island are frequent because her family is there.

meaning_english: To be getting involved in other peoples affairs where you don't belong.
sample_bolinao: Mabiang saray kabaraybay mi.
sample_english: Our neighbors tend to meddle.

meaning_english: To to be crushed by a python.
To be in a state of despair.
sample_bolinao: No si Catawan a pagtalkan tamo, kai tamo gapo mabigo'.
sample_english: If we are trusting the Lord Divine, we do not at all despair.

meaning_english: Shocked, to be startled deeply by a sudden realization.
sample_bolinao: Nabigra'yay saya konra sin na'kit nayay bangkay.
sample_english: One of them was shocked when he saw the body.

meaning_english: To be choked or strangled and so not be able to breath properly.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma irutan tuloy a taker na sa liey nan baboy sali' mabikkel ya.
sample_english: Don't tighten the tether on the neck of you pig to tight, it might chock it.

meaning_english: To be victimized by something.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka pakayabi sa liwa' no kai mo rabay mabiktima nin duka' nin tutawo.
sample_english: Don't be out late at night unless you want to be victimized by evil people.

meaning_english: To be countable or able to be counted.
sample_bolinao: Ultimo et a say sabot moyo sa ulo ket nabilang nan Dios.
sample_english: Further it is to such an extent that God has counted the hairs on your heads.

meaning_english: To be suddenly inflected with a stomachache and blotting by someone staring at them.
sample_bolinao: Palawaw ka no mabiltikan raka.
sample_english: Someone has used saliva on you when they curse you with a stomachache.

meaning_english: To happen to hook something, usually a fish.
sample_bolinao: Sa bebey nan mu'na mon mabilwit ket main nin ma'kit mon platan kwarta.
sample_english: In the mouth of the first one that you hook there you will see a coin.

meaning_english: For a state of sickness or unease such as flu to be extended out after seemingly getting better.
sample_bolinao: Mabinat koya tamo' buga' a tirador mo ta bana' ta alaki tan makubpal ya.
sample_english: I can only stretch the rubber of your slingshot a little because it is big and thick.

meaning_english: To bless someone or something specific with something.
sample_bolinao: Mabindisyunan kamoyna kumon nin anak.
sample_english: You should give your blessing to the child.

meaning_english: To have much property.
sample_bolinao: Mabinis ya si DonLeopoldo.
sample_english: Don Leopoldo has a large estate.

meaning_english: A detailed explanation.
To be baptized or initiated into something, usually with the application of water and sometimes given a new name.
sample_bolinao: Matuntawo ya si Cristo sin mabinyagan ya.
sample_english: Christ was a mature man when he was baptized.

meaning_english: For things or events to be forcefully moved against an opposing force.
sample_bolinao: Nisungat ya sa bato a pundo kanya' kai ya mabira.
sample_english: The anchor caught on a stone and so it could not be forced up.

meaning_english: To be harsh or rude in speech or actions.
sample_bolinao: Mabirngas yan mag'irgo sa kapada nan tawo.
sample_english: He speaks brashly to his fellowman.

meaning_english: For cloth or a thin object to be torn.
sample_bolinao: Madali' yan mabisang a papil lalo no lebet ana.
sample_english: It is easy for a piece of paper to be ripped especially if it is wet.

meaning_english: To be torn off something thin.
To be split off into strips such as with stripping bamboo.
sample_bolinao: Mainum'ay yan mabisbis a bayog no matadem yay beneng.
sample_english: Thick bamboo is easily stripped when the bolo is sharp.

meaning_english: For a person's body to have strong physical features or form.
sample_bolinao: Mangalsa yan mabyat kanya' mabiskeg a lalaman na.
sample_english: He lifts heavy things and so his body is burly.

meaning_english: To be good relating to a desired result, displaying the beauty that fits the situation such as gracious, respectful, well dressed, etc.
sample_bolinao: Wanan amo kona, <Mabistay ginwa' mo!>>
sample_english: The boss said to him, <You have done well!>>

meaning_english: To be elegantly dressed and pleasing to the eye.
sample_bolinao: Mabisti ya si Maria sin na'kit kwa.
sample_english: Maria was dressed elegantly when I saw her.

meaning_english: For a secret to become known.
sample_bolinao: Andi' kayna mibula'-bula' tanabistokayna.
sample_english: Don't be telling lies for you have been discovered in your duplicity.

meaning_english: To be burdened down with vices.
sample_bolinao: Nagmasakit ya ta mabisyo ya.
sample_english: He is sickly since he is loaded with vices.

meaning_english: To be laden with vices.
sample_bolinao: Mabisyuso ya si Clara kanya' ma'teng yan umasinso.
sample_english: Clara is burdened with vices and so it takes him a long time to progress.

meaning_english: To be rich in vitamins.
sample_bolinao: Mabitamina a prutas, pising tan kuna'.
sample_english: Fruit, vegetables and fish are full of vitamins

meaning_english: To be able to be carried by hand or a handle or strap and so portable.
sample_bolinao: Matkap koy makinilya ninmabitbit.
sample_english: I need a typewriter that is portable.

meaning_english: To be hungry.
sample_bolinao: Mabitilakoynan tuloy; byan nako pan kanen ko?
sample_english: I am veryhungry; will you please give me something to eat?

meaning_english: To be suffering from hunger because of something.
sample_bolinao: Mabitilana tawo no magbyahi a mako sa Manila ta adayo'.
sample_english: One getshungrywhen traveling to Manila because it's very far.

meaning_english: To be in a misshapen state.
sample_bolinao: Mabiwag yaynay bikoy nan bisiklita.
sample_english: The tire of the bicycle is bent.

meaning_english: For a limb to be achy, weary or numb to the extend of it being difficult to move out of a position.
sample_bolinao: Sinmablaysarayna, nitgen raya.
sample_english: When they were now achy, they stopped.

meaning_english: Precious, relationships or situations that are of great importance or esteem.
sample_bolinao: Mabliyayti si kwintas ko.
sample_english: This necklace isexpensive.

meaning_english: For a bone to be dislocated or fractured.
sample_bolinao: Sali' mablo' yay anak no manabo' ya sa bayawas.
sample_english: Perhaps the child will fracture a bone if he falls out of the guava tree.

meaning_english: For a material to have been formed by heating it.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket mablok nay kawayan a kawayan a midyo malago'.
sample_english: Juan is able to shape a bamboo that is fairly young by heating it.

meaning_english: Leafy.
sample_bolinao: Mablong a kayu-kayo no tyimpon rapeg.
sample_english: The bushes are full of leaves when it is rainy season.

meaning_english: To be drunk.
sample_bolinao: Abaw saray mabok tepe' Linggo.
sample_english: Each Sunday there are many that are drunk.

meaning_english: For a plant or the throat to be dry from lack of water or for the throat to be irritated from a tonsil problem.
sample_bolinao: Mabranganako; byan moko pan ranom?
sample_english: Iam dried out, will you please give me a some water?

meaning_english: To be turned from one position or direction to another.
sample_bolinao: Si ugit a daikleng tamo' nin parti ra,mabringnayay barko.
sample_english: The rudder is only a small part of the whole andturnsthe ship.

meaning_english: To be at the point of death.
sample_bolinao: Nomabsatanyaynay tawo nakapa'nat ya tana.
sample_english: When a person is about to die his body is just flat.

meaning_english: To be sated, full and no longer hungry for food.
sample_bolinao: Ket nakapangan sara nga'min a tutawo tan nabsoy sara.
sample_english: And all of the people had eaten and were filled.

meaning_english: To be granted a position or a share in something such as in employment or a responsibility.
For something to have something poured onto or into it.
sample_bolinao: Kumadayo' ka sa trak ta sali' mabu'buan kan buyangin.
sample_english: Get away from the truck for you might have the sand dumped on you.

meaning_english: To have the mind or attitude open to different ideas and be able to evaluate them.
sample_bolinao: Takeren may punggos nan nipa'lem nin batag pigaw kai ya mabu'kasan.
sample_english: Tie the wrappings for the ripening of the bananas so that they will not happen to be exposed.

meaning_english: To be eating in a gorging, voracious, animallike manner. It is derogatory and brings shame.
sample_bolinao: Andi' moyobuagenin say niyator kon mangga.
sample_english: Don'teatthe mangoes I've set aside.

meaning_english: To be unhealthy or sickly.
sample_bolinao: Mabublay ka ta say mangkanen mo ket ambo' nin masustansya.
sample_english: Your body is weak since what you are eating regularly is not nutritious.

meaning_english: To be a drunkard, a person who is always drunk.
sample_bolinao: Magkamain nin sakit sa baya' a tawo nin mabubok.
sample_english: A person that is a drunkard comes to have a lung disease.

meaning_english: To deny the reality of something.
sample_bolinao: Kai na nin mabudi' ni Gracia a mabuktot ya ta alaki yaynay tyan na.
sample_english: Gracia cannot be in denial that she is pregnant since her tummy is already big.

meaning_english: To be keeping the truth from someone.
sample_bolinao: Kai sara nin mabudian a a'nak.
sample_english: Children cannot keep a secret.

meaning_english: To have a cold.
sample_bolinao: Mabuerya si Deb.
sample_english: Deb has acold.

meaning_english: To be able to accomplish something little by little.
sample_bolinao: Kai raya mabuga'-buga'nin erpana balin mandumta ta mapres yay siri.
sample_english: They cannot make progress on the house fire to quench it because the wind is strong.

meaning_english: To be in a time of abundance of fish and sea products and for a business to be productive.
sample_bolinao: Mabugabog komi no bulan nin Hunyo anggan Setyembre ta gulpin makalap ran mampamasabing.
sample_english: We are in a time of abundance from June to September since there is a lot they are getting from the fish ponds.

meaning_english: For rice or other things to not stick together in your fingers.
sample_bolinao: Mabugay a sina'pang ta kurang a ranom.
sample_english: The rice does not stick together because it did not have enough water.

meaning_english: To have the taxes paid.
sample_bolinao: Nabuisankoyna nga'min a luta' ko.
sample_english: I have paid all the taxes on my land.

meaning_english: For teeth to be decayed.
sample_bolinao: Nabukbok ana a tekrean.
sample_english: The chair is infested with wood bores

meaning_english: For something to have knots in it.
sample_bolinao: Mabuknol kway rubir nan damulag no iyapeget kwa.
sample_english: I have the carabao's rope knotted-up when I limit his movement.

meaning_english: To have a lump.
sample_bolinao: Nabukolyay ulo kon nagket nan kalaban.
sample_english: My head which was hit by my enemy has a lump.

meaning_english: For the fruit of a plant to be growing bigger after pollination or budding.
sample_bolinao: Mabuktotyay aso mi.
sample_english: Our dog ispregnant.

meaning_english: To happen to be released or dislodged from something that was holding it.
sample_bolinao: Pakanda' ka ta bangli'mabul'isanmay baso.
sample_english: Be careful for you might happen todropthe drinking glass.

meaning_english: To be not telling the truth about something.
sample_bolinao: Main saray mamparsawan rakamin mabula', bale' tutuo tamo' a man'ibarita' mi.
sample_english: There are those who are accusing us of lying, but it is only the truth that we are speaking.

meaning_english: For something to be toppled over.
To be blind.
sample_bolinao: Dandani ya mabulag sin naaksidinti ya.
sample_english: He was almost blinded when he had the accident.

meaning_english: To be blind to something and so not notice.
sample_bolinao: Mabulagan ya si Juan sa kalsada no madeblem et no parbangon.
sample_english: Juan is blind on the road when it is dark or early morning.

meaning_english: To be blind in one eye.
sample_bolinao: Mabulding yay biring no magket yan sakal a saya mata na.
sample_english: The cock will be blind in one eye if he is hit with the spike in on of his eyes.

meaning_english: To be exposed to the public.
sample_bolinao: Mabulgar a man'iyatur-ator ra ni Jasmin tan si Jesica.
sample_english: The secrets Jasmin and Jesica have been hiding are exposed.

meaning_english: Persimmons or ebony, a tree, or its fruit, with hard dark-colored heart wood and reddish flossy fruit that is edible.
sample_bolinao: Ata'gay yan kayo amabulo.
sample_english: Ebonyis a tall tree.

meaning_english: To be liberal with what one has, especially money.
sample_bolinao: Mabulos ya sa kwarta kanya' kasan madinep na.
sample_english: He is free with his money and so there is nothing that he is collecting.

meaning_english: For something such as a rope or speech to have a sudden break or a stoppage of a function.
sample_bolinao: Alamri yay ginwa' kon balaybayan pigaw kai ya mabulsot.
sample_english: I made the clothesline of wire so that it would not happen to be snapped.

meaning_english: For a length of something specific to be severed.
sample_bolinao: No si nangabing kano ket mabulsutan yan kiwir, dumaya' yaynan dumaya' ket kasan tegen na nin dumaya' alaki a pusibilidad nin mati ya.
sample_english: It is said that if the connecting vein of the one that has given birth is severed, she will continually bleed without stopping and it is a high possibility that she will die.

meaning_english: To be let loose or released.
sample_bolinao: Nabulusannayay burador na.
sample_english: He/She accidentally letloosehis/her kite.

meaning_english: For something to bend or fold backwards out of position such as of a sail or umbrella.
sample_bolinao: Mabulyad no mi'sa a pangalap kon bula nin balibol.
sample_english: Sometimes I am bent way back to get the volleyball.

meaning_english: To have a contusion or lump from a blow, especially on the forehead.
sample_bolinao: Nabunelako sa ulo ta nitugtog ako sa padir.
sample_english: My head isswollenbecause I bumped it on the wall.

meaning_english: For something to have been blasted by dynamite.
sample_bolinao: Masida' a burak bato no mabungbong ran mangnguna'.
sample_english: The corral is destroyed when fishermen fish with dynamite.

meaning_english: To be decayed and rotten or spoiled such as rotted fruit or wet grains that have not been cooked.
sample_bolinao: Nabungsotana in say mangga; andi' moyoyna kanen.
sample_english: Those mangoes are rotten; don't eat them.

meaning_english: A mounded of a large quantity of something.
sample_bolinao: Sapaten moynay plato pigaw kai ana mabungton.
sample_english: Wash the dishes so that they don't get piled up.

meaning_english: For something to be mounded up and overwhelming.
sample_bolinao: Mami'pi' kaynan aysing pigaw kai ka mabungtunan.
sample_english: Wash the clothing so that you are not overwhelmed.

meaning_english: To have been chosen by drawing lots.
sample_bolinao: Pirmi yan mabunot a ngaran ko kanya' pirmi ako nin manalo.
sample_english: My name is always being drawn in the drawings so I am always winning.

meaning_english: For something to have a steep incline to it.
sample_bolinao: Mabuos yay bubong ra.
sample_english: Their roof has a steep incline.

meaning_english: To be bubbly.
sample_bolinao: Mabura' yay sabon nin usar ko.
sample_english: The soap I use is bubbly.

meaning_english: For a plant to be in flower or in bloom and have many flowers.
sample_bolinao: Nalibed yan maburak nin adilpa a ugsuran mi.
sample_english: Our backyard is surrounded by oleanders in bloom.

meaning_english: For a place to be bursting with waves especially the edge of a reef in a storm.
sample_bolinao: Maburakan a bengbeng no main bagyo.
sample_english: The reef area bursts forth in waves when there is a storm.

meaning_english: To happen to be toppled over so that the bottom is exposed.
sample_bolinao: Naburang'ityay pasig ta nadaragos nayan damulag.
sample_english: The jar was toppled over for it was bumped by the carabao.

meaning_english: Faded.
sample_bolinao: Maburarog yaynay yunipurmi kon pantalon.
sample_english: My uniform pants are faded.

meaning_english: Shelled, for the kernels to be removed.
sample_bolinao: Nagawgaw anay mais kanya' madali' anan maburas.
sample_english: The corn has been sun dried and so it will be easy to shell.

meaning_english: For a person, sack or cargo container to have been stabbed and ripped open.
sample_bolinao: Kasayna sawanin nin maburayrayan ta mali'mo sarayna.
sample_english: There will be no more people who are brave torip openthe stomach because they are afraid.

meaning_english: For something to be embroidered.
sample_bolinao: Maburda yay kupya' ko kanya' nanganda' nan kikiten.
sample_english: My hat is embroidered and so it is beautiful to see.

meaning_english: To be embroider with a design on fabric.

sample_english: There are a lot of weeds that have been piled at the trunk of the coconut.

meaning_english: To be embroidered.

sample_english: I want to have this embroidered on my dress.

meaning_english: To have moved something to an open position.

sample_english: They have opened his door for they have removed its lock.

meaning_english: To have a liquid dumped over something.
To be able to express something.

sample_english: He started crying thereby showing his hurt feelings.

meaning_english: To have given life.
To happen to stomp on something.
sample_bolinao: Kai ko nin maida'da' sa ranom a ayi ko ta napagal nin linmalako.
sample_english: I am not stepping in the water with my foot since I am exhausted from the walk.

meaning_english: To be put into the state of being offered.

sample_english: I have given my life as an offering to the service of God the Divine.

meaning_english: To be hasty in doing something.
sample_bolinao: Maidadali'ya sa pagdisisyon na.
sample_english: He ishastyin his decision making.

meaning_english: To do one after another.
sample_bolinao: Maidadandan no mangan kami ta pinggat mi'sa-mi'say sapat.
sample_english: We eat one after the other so that we can each have washed dishes.

meaning_english: To be glued to something.
sample_bolinao: Maidalit yanRugbea linumkang nin swilas sapatos.
sample_english: The soles of my shoes that have come off will be glued on with Rugbe.

meaning_english: To be in a hard and difficult situation.
sample_bolinao: Maidapanay maningkap nin raruman pag'ubrawan.
sample_english: It'shardto look for another place to work.

meaning_english: To happen to have made fall face down.
To be being caused difficult by something.

sample_english: She is having difficulty with her bag since it is heavy.

meaning_english: To have bumped or brushed against something.

sample_english: Take special precautions with your broken arm for you might happen to bump it against something.

meaning_english: Accused or, charged someone of some offense.
sample_bolinao: Si Jesus,naidaromya bale' kasan katutu'wan.
sample_english: Jesus wascharged, but there was no truth to it.

meaning_english: To be dedicated to something.
sample_bolinao: Simbot sara ta pigaw nin maipurok sara konra nin tutawo, tan naididika sara konan Dios tan konan Karniro nin bilang a say u'nan yatab ket ibi konan Dios.
sample_english: They were redeemed in order that they would be set aside from the people, and they have been dedicated to God and to the Sheep like the first harvest is given to God.

meaning_english: To be embarrassed or feel shame caused by s/t.

sample_english: He seldom goes out of their house because he is shy.

meaning_english: To be accident prone or to have bad luck.

sample_english: Juan is unlucky for he is always having an accident.

meaning_english: For a complaint to be filed.

meaning_english: For something to be gathered together in one place.

meaning_english: To have something put as a defense against something.

meaning_english: To have a decision made.

sample_english: When the decision was made that we would be sailing going to Italy, Pablo and the rest of the prisoners were handed over to one of the officers of the group of soldiers.

meaning_english: To have something in a unique, incomparable way.

sample_english: You are verydifferentfrom all the other girls.

meaning_english: To have a boat brought to anchor or be moored to land.

sample_english: The boat could not be brought up on land since it was low tide.

meaning_english: To be joined with an assembly or a purposeful group.

sample_english: We should be joined to Christian groups.

meaning_english: To be sensing a situation or changing condition.

meaning_english: To be grasping onto something.

meaning_english: To be sliced across the grain of the meat.

meaning_english: To be intended for a purpose.

sample_english: Even though that is however indeed the case, it doesn't mean that our bodies we can use them as instruments for improper sexual acts, but rather, it was purposed/the purpose that we use our bodies in service to the Lord , and it is the right of the Lord to to govern our bodies.

meaning_english: To give respect.

sample_english: The elders must be honor for that is proper.

meaning_english: To fasten onto something with the hands or another part of the body.

meaning_english: To be bound to something.

sample_english: Slippers are bound to the feet so that they do not come off.

meaning_english: To persistent, steadfast, pasted.

meaning_english: To have been scratched by something..
sample_bolinao: Maigasgas kwa a ruran mo no idalan kwa sa tatalon.

meaning_english: To have been put into action.
To have offered or put something in reach of someone.

meaning_english: To be able to expose something to the heat of the sun.
To be disorderly scattered around.
Happened to strike against something quickly and with force.

meaning_english: To be in contact with a surface.

meaning_english: To be touching or pressing something quickly.

meaning_english: To have been placed on a hanger.

meaning_english: To be taken to someplace.

For a boat to be moved through the water with a paddled.

To have possession or have come into ownership of something.

To be able to laugh easily.
