sample_english: There is a lot of foods that can be cooked from the ten kilos of pork.

meaning_english: To be chafed, to have a rash in an area where parts of the body rub together.
sample_bolinao: Maima' a el'el no panayngetan nin manlumalako.
sample_english: When sweating from walking, the groin will be chafed.

meaning_english: To be disappointed because one's expectations weren't satisfied.
sample_bolinao: Si si'numan a magmatalek kona, kai ya gapo nin maimaima.
sample_english: Whoever trusts in him, he will not at all be disappointed.

meaning_english: To be observant.
sample_bolinao: Si sayay ina, matkap amaimatonya konran ua'nak na.
sample_english: A mother must beobservant ofher children.

meaning_english: To be watched carefully in order to note something as significant.
sample_bolinao: Maimatunan kwan pinirmi nin mampa'lek sa trabaho.
sample_english: I observed him always sleeping on the job.

meaning_english: To seize property or forfeit the rights to property.
sample_bolinao: Maimbargo yay luta' no kai ya tampor mabayadan.
sample_english: The land will be seized if it is not paid for immediately.

meaning_english: To be envious and resentful, have hard feelings toward someone because of something they have or their achievements.
sample_bolinao: Maimbel ya ta main nin ba'yon ikap nan kaklasi na.
sample_english: He is envious because his classmate has a new toy.

meaning_english: To have invited someone in general.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya maimbita nin mako sa bali ta abaw gawa' na.
sample_english: He was not invited to go to the house since he has a lot to do.

meaning_english: To have been specifically invited to something.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a naimbitawan ran bubisita para sa kasal ra.
sample_english: There were many that they gave invitations to for their wedding.

meaning_english: To be smiling.
sample_bolinao: Maimis yay ba'yon maistra mi.
sample_english: Our new teacher smiles.

meaning_english: To have been deboned.
sample_bolinao: Subuan kwan kuna' nin naimlat a daikleng nin anak
sample_english: I filled the mouth of the small child with fish that had been deboned.

meaning_english: To be jealous and possessive or suspicious of someone whom they are in a close relationship with.
sample_bolinao: Maimon ya si Carl sa busat na.
sample_english: Carl is jealous of his brother.

meaning_english: To be stingy.
sample_bolinao: Kai kosara rabay a tawon maimot.
sample_english: I don't like people that are stingy.

meaning_english: To have an infection in the body.
sample_bolinao: Tambaren may sugat mo pigaw kai ya maimpiksyon.
sample_english: Treat your wound so that is will not be infected.

meaning_english: To be in a state of being thin like the thinness of cloth, paper, wood and thus flimsy.
sample_bolinao: Maimpis nin aysing a isulot na no ma'mot.
sample_english: The clothes that he puts on when it is hot are thin.

meaning_english: To have influence over someone.
sample_bolinao: Maimpluwinsya ya si Rony sa lugar ra.
sample_english: Rony has influence in their area.

meaning_english: To be influenced to take a particular course of action.
sample_bolinao: Maimpluwinsyawan rakon amigo ko nin mamasa nin libro.
sample_english: I am influenced by my friends to read books.

meaning_english: The condition of snoring.
sample_bolinao: Maimrek ya si tatay.
sample_english: Father snores.

meaning_english: For the eyes to open wide.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket mimudikat ya sindo buklas no kaimata na.
sample_english: Juan's eyes open wide each morning when he just wakes up.

meaning_english: To have planted something.
sample_bolinao: Matkap maimula nin tampor a palakay pigaw kai nin malanes.
sample_english: Seedling must be planted immediately so that they don't wither.

meaning_english: To recover one's senses from a period of abnormalcy and so be relieved and without worry.
sample_bolinao: Naimunawanyay naulaw a akulaw sin pinaypaypayan ya.
sample_english: The old woman who faintedrecoveredwhen she was fanned.

meaning_english: To be of the world.
sample_bolinao: Liningu-lingo atamo tan nibarang atamo nin ambo' nin kuston akay tan inaripen atamo nin nagsikabarang nin bakas nin kadukaan tan riga nin naimundwan.
sample_english: We were confused and led astray by incorrect teachings, and the different kinds of evil and worldly pleasures enslaved us.

meaning_english: For a surface to be smooth, shiny and free from defect.
sample_bolinao: Maimyasa bisit na.
sample_english: Here leg is smooth and perfect.

meaning_english: To have enough possessions to live well.
meaning_filipino: Mariwasa; maykaya sa buhay; nakariwasang pamilya; mayaman; mapera.
sample_bolinao: Maidap konanmainana sumrep sa pag'adian nan Dios.
sample_english: It is difficult for therichto enter the kingdom of God.

meaning_english: To be examining people and so being suspicious of them.
sample_bolinao: Mainap ya a kapatas ran karpintiro; kai nasara pyawen tuloy a tawo na.
sample_english: The foreman of the carpenters is a suspicious person, he does not trust his people very much.

meaning_english: To be able to find relief from something.
sample_bolinao: Mainawnan akon mag'adal ta maong yan mangyakay a maistra ko.
sample_english: My studies were a relief since my teacher was good at teaching.

meaning_english: To be pressed into something.
sample_bolinao: Kurang a siri nan bikoy kanya' mainerner ya.
sample_english: The air in the tire is low and so it has been made concaved.

meaning_english: To be merciful.
sample_bolinao: Si Catawan tamo ket mainganga'do ya sa sarba.
sample_english: Our Lord Divine is merciful to all.

meaning_english: To be able to hear something.
sample_bolinao: Kasa ninnaingarnan anak.
sample_english: The child couldfeelnothing.

meaning_english: To have been shaped to fit together properly.
sample_bolinao: Bawing yay sada' nan aparador kanya' nin kai ya maingarep.
sample_english: The cabinet door is bowing and so it is not fitting correctly.

meaning_english: To enchanted by something.
sample_bolinao: Naingkantoyay puso' ko nin kabistawan mo.
sample_english: My heart wasenchantedwith your beauty.

meaning_english: To stumble hitting the nose or forehead.
sample_bolinao: Naingudngodyay a'rong na sa bato.
sample_english: His nosebumped againstthe stone.

meaning_english: The state of being able to drink something, usually in large quantities or frequently.
sample_bolinao: Mainom yay in si ranom nan bubon moyo?
sample_english: Can that water in your well be drunk?

meaning_english: To be conservative in the use of things, not wasteful. Generally this is good.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket mainot ya sa kuna' no mangan ya.
sample_english: When Juan eats it is a small amount of the non-rice.

meaning_english: To be a gossip-monger.
By and by, after a short time following something.
sample_bolinao: Mangluto' akon adubo mainsan li' no yabina.
sample_english: I'll cook adobo a little later on when it is afternoon.

meaning_english: Later after the passing of time and after something else happens.
sample_bolinao: Nainsanan nin buga', nako ya nin tinmekre' si Jesus sa temben nan pangnanabuan nin kwartan da'ton sa Timplo.
sample_english: After a little while, Jesus went to sit opposite/across from the treasury in the Temple.

meaning_english: To be easy, not involving great difficulty.
sample_bolinao: Mainum'ay saran mi'dol a atata'gay nin tawo.
sample_english: Tall people easily bump their heads.

meaning_english: To be easily done.
sample_bolinao: Nainum'ayan koy nipagwa' ra, ambo' arig sa raruman gawa' nin maidap.
sample_english: It was an easy thing I gave them to do, not a pattern of other difficult work.

meaning_english: To put something up, construct or build something.
sample_bolinao: Kai raya maipa'deng a masiken ta masakit a tuod na.
sample_english: They cannot get the old man to stand upright since his knees are bad.

meaning_english: With respect to something, about.
sample_bolinao: Si isturya na,maipa'ka'ya sa sayay babayin balo.
sample_english: His story isabouta widow.

meaning_english: To be able to show or demonstrate something to someone.
sample_bolinao: Rabay nan anak nin maipa'kit a druwing na kona ni tatay na.
sample_english: The child wants to be able to show his drawing to his father.

meaning_english: To have been pressed into something.
sample_bolinao: No mama'leg nin pasabing ket gulpin maipa'nek nin anuon sa taaw.
sample_english: When the snare of the fish corral is being constructed there are a lot of support posts stuck into the ocean.

meaning_english: To be able to send something by an agent.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya maipa'wit a surat saPost Officeno kasan silyo.
sample_english: A letter cannot be sent through the post office without a stamp.

meaning_english: For something to be absorbed.
sample_bolinao: Maipaalep'epkumon sa byay tamo a masanton akay nan Catawan.
sample_english: Allow the spiritual teaching of the Lord to beabsorbedin our lives.

meaning_english: To be laid upon someone's shoulders or given the responsibility of something.
sample_bolinao: Si pangingipatanda' ko konan Mabistan Patanda' ket kai ya magwa' anaod nin rason a ipasirayo ko, bana' ta sitin trabaho ket naipabalatay ya kongko tan kado' akoyna no kai ko nin gaw'en!
sample_english: My act of preaching the Good News could not indeed be a reason for me to boast, for this work has been laid upon me and woe is to me if I do not do it!

meaning_english: To have been put across a long stretch of something such as a cross piece of a ladder or a bridge across a river.
sample_bolinao: Naipabanlagyay kawayan sa butlay dalan.
sample_english: The bamboo is laidacrossthe road.

meaning_english: To be equated in some aspect with something.
sample_bolinao: Si dila' maipada ya sa puor. Syay piikapan nin kadukaan.
sample_english: The tongue can be equated to fire. It is the play-ground of evil.

meaning_english: To have someone arrested.
sample_bolinao: Ket tinma'gan sara sa pagkanawanawa ran maipadakep ya si Jesus.
sample_english: And so , they waited for an opportunity to have Jesus arrested.

meaning_english: To by means of or through the use of something.
sample_bolinao: Nikiirgo yay Dios kontamo nin naipadalan na konan si saya a kapadan-kapada na.
sample_english: God has spoken to us through the one who is his very equivalence.

meaning_english: To be slipping on something.
To happen to have been made to fall flat on the stomach.
sample_bolinao: Naipadapa' ya sa subran daras nan malayo.
sample_english: He fell flat on his stomach in his running too fast.

meaning_english: To be able to bring out from one place to another and so reveal it.
sample_bolinao: Sarban bubagay a adi sawanin ket maipadar li'.
sample_english: All things that are hidden now will be exposed.

meaning_english: To be able to give speed to something.
sample_bolinao: Maipadaras anay ba'yon galet nin bikoy nin bisiklita.
sample_english: The tread of my new bicycle tire gives it speed.

meaning_english: To be held by force against an immovable object.
sample_bolinao: Nituror nako etnaipadetako sa padil.
sample_english: He pushed me and furtherpressedagainst the wall.

meaning_english: To be paired up with another.
sample_bolinao: Maipadis yay paluka' ko sa komo ta pada saran bakas.
sample_english: My slippers might be paired up with yours for they are the same in appearance.

meaning_english: To have s/t foretold or prophesied.
sample_bolinao: Maipadles kumon no si'non tawo a mas makapangyadian sawanin.
sample_english: It should be prophesied as to who the person is that is much more powerful today.

meaning_english: To be carried on the current, drifting away on the wind or water.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a maipadpad nin bubagay sa rigrig baybay no main bagyo.
sample_english: There are a lot of things that get drifted onto shore when there is a storm.

meaning_english: Happen to be made to fall face down.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' ya nin maipadugpa' yay saya tawo ta bana' ta nisakin yay ayi na.
sample_english: Therefore the person happened to fall on his face because he tripped.

meaning_english: To set food for a meal.
sample_bolinao: Ket kasan maipadungo ko kona.
sample_english: And so I have nothing to set for a meal for him.

meaning_english: To bestow something on someone.
sample_bolinao: Wanin ta masulit akoynan makapika' isen komoyo nin maipaga'muran ko komoyo no ani a main mangibwat konan Ispirito nan Dios ta pigaw nin mapa'get a pagmamatalek moyo kona.
sample_english: That's the case since I am eager to go there to you to be able to impart to you what there is that comes from the Spirit of God in order that your trust in him might be strengthened.

meaning_english: To be put into the hands of someone and so under their control.
sample_bolinao: Si'kon anak ket maipagamet ako sa maistra ko sa luob nin iskol.
sample_english: I, a child, am put in the care of my teacher while in the school.

meaning_english: To happen to be drug over a rough surface.
For something to be staked in the ground.
For something to be carried off course by the wind.
sample_bolinao: Maipagor a bungan dikot.
sample_english: The grass seeds are carried by the wind.

meaning_english: To be given something to do.
sample_bolinao: I'pos moy mababaan tan panaon mo sa pangngawa' nin sain ta pigaw nin ma'kit nin sarba a man'umadilanta ka sa naipagwa' komo.
sample_english: Spend your talent and time in doing that so that everybody will see that you are progressing in the work you were assigned.

meaning_english: Fallen flat on the back.
sample_bolinao: Nanabo' yan ibat sa ta'gay kayo ketnaipaida'ya sa luta' a say gamet na nakapa'nat.
sample_english: He fell from the top of the tree andlay flaton the ground with arms outstretched.

meaning_english: To be forced to drink something.
sample_bolinao: Nispaknayay bason napno' arak sin kai naya maipainom.
sample_english: Hebrokethe glass full of wine when he was not able to convince him to drink.

meaning_english: Able to have something delivered someplace protectively.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' nin nigan-gan kon iti ya et nin priso anggan maipaiyater koyayna konan Impirador.
sample_english: Therefore, I ordered that he remain here as a prisoner until I would be able to have him escorted to the Emperor.

meaning_english: To be do something as fitting one's character.
sample_bolinao: Maipakana' a ibi kon pinyes nin manok sa bertdi nan amigo ko.
sample_english: It is fitting for me to give a roasted chicken on my friend's birthday.

meaning_english: To be repaired.
sample_bolinao: Napakanda' rayna a tilibisyon mi kanya' makabantay akoyna uman.
sample_english: They had our television repaired and so I can again watch it.

meaning_english: To be able to accuse someone of sin or a wrong.
sample_bolinao: Kasan naipakasalanan ra kona mangibwat sa ni'bat na sa adapan ran tutawo.
sample_english: They had nothing to accuse him of having done wrong from his answer before the people.

meaning_english: To be in position for use.
To have been made to go down.
To happen to have been caused to bump the chin.
To be wrapped around something.
To shaving of the hair.
sample_bolinao: Si'kaynay umbat sa bayad-bayadan ra ta pigaw nin maipakiskisan ray ulo ra nin paka'kitan a natukid raynay pangako' ra.
sample_english: You be the one to be responsible in paying for those that need to be paid for so that they could have their hair shaved as a sign that they have fulfilled their promises.

meaning_english: To be moved away from conflict or danger.
sample_bolinao: Idasal moyo et a maipal'is kami kumon konran maraet tan duka' a tutawo.
sample_english: Pray also that we might be delivered from wicked and evil people.

meaning_english: For a boat to be forced out of the proper orientation or backward by the wind or current causing large waves to hit the side of the boat.
sample_bolinao: Maipalakyaynay baluto.
sample_english: The boat isloosing ground.

meaning_english: To manage something.
sample_bolinao: tan mapatulok rasara a a'nak ra tan maipalalako ra nin mabista a pammali ra.
sample_english: and be able to command obedience of their children, and be able to manage their households well.

meaning_english: To be able to place something in an appropriate place.
sample_bolinao: Anro yan tuloy a sursor ko kanya' kai ko maipalasta.
sample_english: My fruit stick is too long and so I cannot put it in a good place.

meaning_english: To be being put through an opening.
To have happened to cause something to clog up.
For a something to be overturned.
sample_bolinao: Naipalkeb yay mutor taoverloadedya.
sample_english: The motorized boat capsized because it was overloaded.

meaning_english: To have been learned by rote and so burned into the memory.
sample_bolinao: Naipaltep nayna a gawa' na kanya' kai yayna umabas.
sample_english: What he does is burned into his memory and so does not make a mistake.

meaning_english: To have happened to fall prostrate or be face down.
sample_bolinao: Maipalukob ka bana' sa main kasalanan mo.
sample_english: You will fall flat because of the faults you have.

meaning_english: To have been put inside something.
To slander or portray as evil.
sample_bolinao: Say susarita' mo ket matkap a peteg nin kusto a kasa gapo nin makapamalaw a sayti ket abas, ta pigaw nin saray mampanguntra kontamo ket duming'ey sara ta kasan maibarita' ran maipamaduka' kontamo.
sample_english: Your your words must be truly correct that no one will be able to criticize this at all as wrong, so that those who are against us will be ashamed since no one is able to say anything evil of us.

meaning_english: To be reminded of something.
sample_bolinao: Maipanemtem ko komo a bertdi ko no Lunes.
sample_english: I'm reminding you that it is my birthday on Monday.

meaning_english: Promised.
sample_bolinao: Naipangako'ko sa lalaman kon diri a kai akoyna gapo ma'lek.
sample_english: Ipromisedmyself that I would not sleep at all.

meaning_english: To use one's assets (physical strength, money, connections, etc.) in a bad or arrogant manner.
sample_bolinao: Kai na nin maipangayani Roel nin busat naya si Miyor ta mali'mo ya kona.
sample_english: Roel does not use his brother the Mayor to his advantage since he is afraid of him.

meaning_english: To be giving mercy.
To explain clearly.
sample_bolinao: Naipapalawaymo kasin maong koni Doming a pamalalako kodti?
sample_english: You did, didn't you,explainclearly to Doming my principles here?

meaning_english: To brought back to memory.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' nin gaw'en ko a sarba nin mababa' ko a, mataman li' nin nati akoyna ket, maipapanemtem in et nin niyakay komoyo.
sample_english: Therefore, I will make every effort that, even though I will be dead , that which was taught to you will still be able to be brought back to memory.

meaning_english: To satisfactorily express something.
sample_bolinao: Kai na maipapas a sager na kanya' mamatib'ey ya.
sample_english: She cannot express her anger so she makes herself stiff.

meaning_english: To have something killed.
sample_bolinao: Ket mampaningkap sarayna nin padalan no pa'no raya nin maipapati ta ikali'mo raya si Jesus ta mangkaayat nay nakem ran tutawo sa akay na.
sample_english: And so they looked for a way they could have him killed for they were afraid of Jesus since he was persuading the minds of the people by his teaching.

meaning_english: To be sunk deep into something.
sample_bolinao: Maipararem ket maidap anan makaalis sa tutupa' ta maru'mot.
sample_english: It is sunk down deep and so it is really difficult to be able to move it out of the mud since it is deep soft mud.

meaning_english: To be communicating something to someone.
sample_bolinao: Mangyadi' in ta pigaw nin magkamain kamo nin pagkanawa-nawan maiparate' moyo konra a maipa'ka' kongko.
sample_english: These will happen in order that you will have an opportunity to let them know what is concerning me.

meaning_english: For something to have been cooled off.
To be able to boast.
sample_bolinao: Awiten na sarba a lapis na sa iskilawan pigaw maiparayo na.
sample_english: He carries all his pencils to school so that he can boast about them.

meaning_english: To lean sideways.
sample_bolinao: Natumba nin naipariking ket mibangon a pilay-pilayan sa riking; ari-aringking yan lumalako ta nablo' yay sayay bisit na.
sample_english: To fall sideways and get up, limping with lame foot on that side.

meaning_english: To be received by someone.
sample_bolinao: Ket no nayadi' koynayti li' nin gawa' ko tan naiparisibi koyna li' a kwartan tulong konradtaw sa Jerusalem, mako akoyna li' sa Espanya tan dumalan akodsen komoyo.
sample_english: And so when I have finished this job of mine and have had the money for help received by them in Jerusalem, I will go to Espanya and pass through there where you are.

meaning_english: Have done something repeatedly so that one becomes proficient or habitual in doing it such as exercise or training.
sample_bolinao: Say gesen lalon magsen nomaiparmaw.
sample_english: Strength can be improved iftrained.

meaning_english: To be accused of something.
sample_bolinao: Ket ma'kit a a'nak nakamon Dios nin kasa anaod nin maiparsan duka' komoyo abirno iti kamo sa busel ran ambo' nin matunong tan maraet nin tutawo.
sample_english: And so it will be seen that you are children of God who indeed cannot be accused of anything evil even though you are in the midst of crooked and depraved people.

meaning_english: To be put into and become a part of something.
sample_bolinao: Bibilin ran mangatua ket maipas'ep kumon konran a'nak.
sample_english: The instructions of the parents should be remembered by the children.

meaning_english: To be passed and put into effect.
sample_bolinao: Si Prisidinti, mamirma ya pinggat maipasa yay layi.
sample_english: The President signs a law so that it can be passed.

meaning_english: To be fastened with nails.
sample_bolinao: Dandani kai maipasak a kayon tangili' sa tib'ey na.
sample_english: Mahogany for its toughness can hardly be nailed.

meaning_english: To have be made skillful through experience.
sample_bolinao: Kiranod ka nin mangirangep nin abaw a dya'dya' bilang sayay naipasal a sundalo' nan Cristo a si Jesus.
sample_english: Be involved in enduring severe-suffering as a skilled soldier of the Cristo who is Jesus.

meaning_english: To be made one or united.
sample_bolinao: Maipasayatamo li' itaw konran nu'naynan naisalba.
sample_english: We will beunitedwith those who were previously saved.

meaning_english: To pleaded for mercy.
sample_bolinao: Naipasinga'dokoya.
sample_english: Iaskedfor mercy for him.

meaning_english: To be able to give praise because of something.
sample_bolinao: Anaod si'kamon peteg a maipasirayo tan ririket mi.
sample_english: Indeed truly you are whom we can be proud of and our joy.

meaning_english: To put something under something.
sample_bolinao: Ket, no naipasirong nayna li' nin Anak a sarba sa pag'uuray na, ket say sarba iti ana sa sirong nin pag'uuray na, pati say kadiryan na ipagamet nayna li' sa sirong nin pag'uuray nan Ama na ta pigaw nin si Dios ket page' nin liso a syay Dios sa sarba nga'min nin bagay tan nin sarba nga'min.
sample_english: And so, when the Child has subjected everything under his governing, everything that is here under his ruling, including himself he will hand over to be under the governing of his Father in order that God will fully 'n truly be God of every single thing and of every single one.

meaning_english: For something to have entered into something.
sample_bolinao: Ba'yo in et sin sain, naipasrep naynan Dimunyo sa kaisipan na ni Judas nin anak na ni Simon Iscariote a pagtraiduran nayan ipagamet si Jesus konran pupangulo.
sample_english: Previous to that, the Devil had put into the mind of Judas child of Simon Iscariot to betray Jesus into the hands of the leaders.

meaning_english: To be persisting in causing something to come about.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket maipasuet nan mako sa kapilya mataman nin bagyo.
sample_english: Juan is the one insisting that they go to church even if there is a storm.

meaning_english: To be able to put something on the head.
sample_bolinao: Tulungan nako pan maipasus'on ta kai kwa maipasus'on nin bukod?
sample_english: Will you please help me put the load on my head since I am not able to put it on by myself?

meaning_english: Lifted up by someone else, exalt.
sample_bolinao: Naipata'gay ya si Jesus sa patiti na.
sample_english: Jesus is Raised up/ Exalted in his Death.

meaning_english: To be drifting out to the deep part of the sea.
sample_bolinao: Itaker may balsa pigaw kai ya maipataaw.
sample_english: Tether the raft so that it won't happen to drift out to sea.

meaning_english: To sprinkled on something.
sample_bolinao: Naipatak-patak a ranom sin nanago' ako ta butbot yay lata.
sample_english: The water sprinkled out of the can when I bathed since it had hole in it.

meaning_english: To be lying face up.
sample_bolinao: Naipatalindata' ya si Pedro sa elek na ta nali'mwan ya sa ginmuryaw.
sample_english: Pedro is lying face up to sleep since he was terrified by the angry yell.

meaning_english: To be made known widely.
sample_bolinao: Maipatanda' na kongko a kapapa'sar moyo.
sample_english: He will be able to make known to me your situation.

meaning_english: To make known something specific to someone.
sample_bolinao: Idasal moyo a ibi na kumon nin Dios a pagkanawa-nawa komi ket maipatandaan mi a maipa'ka' kona ni Cristo nin gindat ket kai nin nipadar.

sample_english: It will be good if Pedro fits into this size clothing that we bought so that what fits him will be known.

meaning_english: To be able to place something in a hole that was made.
sample_bolinao: Maisukit kwa a bikoy nin agayap sa gagawa'.
sample_english: I will place the bean seeds in the holes that were made in the field.

meaning_english: To be patterned after something else.
sample_bolinao: Say byay tamo,naisukogsa byay ni Cristo.
sample_english: Our life ispatternedafter the life of Christ.

meaning_english: For something to be connected to something for a purpose.
sample_bolinao: Mangkit kan kawayan nin maisuldong pigaw makalawit tay malago'.
sample_english: Find a bamboo that can be connected so that we will be able to hook the young coconut.

meaning_english: To have been able to put clothing or jewelry on the body.
sample_bolinao: Kai koyamaisulota sapatos ko ta maslet ya.
sample_english: Ican'tput on my shoes because they are tight.

meaning_english: To be momentarily caught or snagged on something.
sample_bolinao: Ibuntok may pundo pigaw maisungat yayna sa bato.
sample_english: Toss out the anchor so that it will snag on a stone.

meaning_english: To happen to be written.
sample_bolinao: Aninaisuratmo sa irgon Bolinao?
sample_english: What have youwrittenin Bolinao?

meaning_english: To be set aside for a specific purpose.
sample_bolinao: Sarban kayamanan anaisuyo'a tawiren.
sample_english: All of the riches have beendesignatedas an inheritance.

meaning_english: For something like a boat to happen to scrape over a surface.
sample_bolinao: Maisyad ana sa luta' a bungan mangga.
sample_english: The mangoes might happen to scrape the ground.

meaning_english: To be separated from something.
sample_bolinao: Sin anak akon daite', kai ko rabay amaisyaykoni inay ko.
sample_english: When I was a little child I did not like tobeseparated from my mother.

meaning_english: To be raised up.
sample_bolinao: Kai naya maita'gay a gamet na ta nablo' ya.
sample_english: He cannot raise his hand since it is broken.

meaning_english: To resting on top of something.
sample_bolinao: Bale' main li' nin awro a mayba' in, ket kasayna li' gapo ni sayan bato nin isen a ma'kit nin naita'len et konan saya.
sample_english: But there will be a day when those will fall down, and so there will at all a single stone there that could be seen left on top still of another.

meaning_english: To be bandaged onto something.
sample_bolinao: Maita'pal na ni Rose a bulong kusay sa parti nin bukol na sa ulo.
sample_english: Rose bandaged a garlic leaf over the lump on her head.

meaning_english: To be swinging something.
sample_bolinao: Makapalili'nek a maita'was sa undayon.
sample_english: To be swung hard in a hammock can be dreadful.

meaning_english: To happen to shout out something.
sample_bolinao: Kai nayna maita'way a riga na sa ikap ta paek yayna.
sample_english: He will not be able to shout out his joy in the game since he is hoarse.

meaning_english: To be swinging a hammock.
sample_bolinao: Maita'yon naya ni Sam a ari nan nakaundayon.
sample_english: Sam was swinging his younger brother who was in the hammock.

meaning_english: To have something buried.
sample_bolinao: Sin rinmate' saradtaw sa Betania si Jesus, natandaan na nin a'pat a awro naynan naitabon ni Lazaro.
sample_english: When Jesus arrived in Bethany, he came to know that it was already four days now that Lazaro had been buried.

meaning_english: To happen to strike a cutting blow to something.
sample_bolinao: Kumamol a beneng no maitaga' sa matib'ey maong nin kayo.
sample_english: A bolo becomes dull when it happens to strike really tough wood.

meaning_english: To have someone follow after something.
sample_bolinao: Mangkibagayan koy sarban klasin tutawo ta pigaw nin main nin maitagad kon maisalba nan Dios.
sample_english: I am being suitable to all kinds of people in order that I might be able to lead them to be saved by God.

meaning_english: To be tethered with something.
sample_bolinao: Maitakerya kumon a baboy pigaw kai ya manida'.
sample_english: The pig should be tethered so that it doesn't destroy something.

meaning_english: Set aside for a specific use.
sample_bolinao: Naitalagaa byay ko nin magsirbi sa Dios.
sample_english: My life isdedicatedto serve God.

meaning_english: For something to be entrusted to someones responsibility.
sample_bolinao: Naitaleknan Dios kontamo a sarban iti sa sa mundo.
sample_english: Godentrustedall things in this world to us.

meaning_english: To happen to trample on something.
To be deposited forming an embankment.
To refer to something, bringing a side topic into a conversation which has a bearing on the main topic.
meaning_filipino: Banggit; banggitin: sabi; sabihin: tukoy; tukuyin.
sample_bolinao: Maitambaykoyaytaw si kai nadti sa byay.
sample_english: Irememberthe one who has gone from this life.

meaning_english: To fling something away with no intention to recover it.
sample_bolinao: Naitampal kwan maong a pengpeng sin manaboy akon damulag.
sample_english: I flung the stick hard when I was driving the carabao away.

meaning_english: To establish, or set something as fixed such as a time or occasion.
To be lifted up or exalted or praised highly.
meaning_filipino: Gabayan; pumuri; purihin; itanghal; magtanghal; pagtataas.
sample_bolinao: Pinaayupa' koy lalaman kon diri ta pigaw nin maitandudo' kamo sa adapan nan Dios.
sample_english: I humbled myself in order that you might be exalted before God.

meaning_english: For something to be tilted up.
sample_bolinao: Kai kwa maitangar a ulo ko ta masakit yay liey ko.
sample_english: I am not able to tilt my head up for my neck hurts.

meaning_english: To have placed a blockage to prevent movement.
sample_bolinao: Maitangil yay bato sa dalanan tan paradawan nan dyip.
sample_english: In the line up of jeeps and along the way a stone is used to block them from rolling.

meaning_english: For something to happen to be delayed by something.
sample_bolinao: Maitantan na a pananem ni Juan ta pirmin marges maong a rapeg ket subran maong a ranom sa gagawa'.
sample_english: Juan's planting was delayed since there was always a strong downpour of rain and so the water in the field was very over flooded.

meaning_english: To be dipping into something.
sample_bolinao: Maitapsaw naya sa taaw a gamet na no iti ya sa baluto.
sample_english: If he is here in the boat his hands can dip into the ocean.

meaning_english: For something to be splattered or dispersed or exploded all over.
sample_bolinao: No mi'sa, maitapuryang a sabaw nin dinaang no sumbo anan maksaw sa syang.
sample_english: Sometimes the broth of the fish soup will splatter all over when it is boiled to strongly on the stove.

meaning_english: To be put in a rigid or upright position such as a soldier.
sample_bolinao: Maong tanaitarakadkoy gamet ko, naigket ya kumon a ulo ko.
sample_english: It's good I braced with my hands, I might have hit my head.

meaning_english: To have something started.
sample_bolinao: Alas syiti ana maitarana' a miting dilap.
sample_english: The meeting tomorrow is to start at seven o'clock.

meaning_english: To be bound in an agreement to something.
sample_bolinao: Wanti ey isturya nin nikaiyanak na ni Jesus a syay Cristo: Si Maria a syay ina na, naitarato.
sample_english: It was like this that the story of the birth of Jesus who is the Christ was: Maria who was his mother, she was bound in agreement.

meaning_english: To straighten something into the vertical position.
sample_bolinao: Nipababo na ni Jesus a gamet na konan si babayi ket, sin sain, tampor nin naitarindeg nay lalaman na kanya' nin rinayu-rayo nayay Dios.
sample_english: Jesus placed his hands on the woman and then all at once she was able to straighten her body hence she praised God.

meaning_english: To be ferried away, or wander off and so be lost.
sample_bolinao: Maitawtaw yay beneng nin indam na ni Dan ta na'teng yaynan kai nisubli'.
sample_english: The bolo Dan borrowed went astray since it had been a long time that he had not returned it.

meaning_english: To be scattered or spread over a wide area.
sample_bolinao: Isubli' sa nangalapan a ikap pigaw kai nin maitayak.
sample_english: Put the toys back that were taken out so that they don't get scattered.

meaning_english: For things such as gifts, relief goods and other things to be given out.
sample_bolinao: Naitayak-tayak a umi' ran aso.
sample_english: The urine from the dogs is scattered all over.

meaning_english: To be sewn onto something.
sample_bolinao: Si Rose ket maitayi' nay butunis nin yunipurmi na sa iskol.
sample_english: For the upcoming Christmas time the old hymn <<Hark the Herald>> is being adjusted to be able to fit a new song.

meaning_english: For someone or thing to be adjusted so that they are fitted, or appropriate for the other.
sample_bolinao: Say ma'ran nin kansyon nin <<Hark the Herald>> ket maitekep ya sa makaba'yon kanta ta no Abidad.
sample_english: For the upcoming Christmas time the old hymn <<Hark the Herald>> is being adjusted to be able to fit a new song.

meaning_english: Midnight mass.
sample_bolinao: No abidad mainmaitinissa kapiknga' nin yabi anggaynan buklas.
sample_english: During Christmas Eve atmidnightthere is amassuntil morning breaks.

meaning_english: To be able to endure a difficulty.
sample_bolinao: Maitpel ko a kai mangan nin sayan pangan no mi'sa.
sample_english: I can endure not eating a meal occasionally.

meaning_english: To be able to reciprocate or repay somebody for what he has done, to pay back.
sample_bolinao: Animaitubale'ko komo sa tulong mo kongko?
sample_english: How canrepayyou for what you have done for me?

meaning_english: To be able to point out to something verbally or physically.
sample_bolinao: Kai na maitudo' no si'noy nangaway kona ta mali'mo ya.
sample_english: He was not able to point out who fought with him since he was scared.

meaning_english: For something to be handed over to someone.
To happen to solidly bump or thump against something, usually causing some kind of harm or sound.
sample_bolinao: Maitugtog ako no mi'sa sa luob nin traysikel.
sample_english: Sometimes I get bumped around inside a tricycle.

meaning_english: For something to have been placed upon something.
sample_bolinao: Lebet yay lamisawan kanya' kai ko maitukdo' a bag ko.
sample_english: The table is wet and so I will not be able to put my bag on it.

meaning_english: To be in accord with some standard.
sample_bolinao: Si Cristo, nati ya ta pigaw nin mapirduna a kukasalanan tamo nin maitukoy sa nipaisurat nan Dios.
sample_english: Christ died so that our sins can be forgiven in accordance with what God caused-to-be-written.

meaning_english: To be able to give a kick at a target in a downward or backward motion.
To be rolled from someplace.
sample_bolinao: Bale' sin kinmikit saradtaw sa nanabunan, na'kit ran si bato ket naitulin yayna.
sample_english: But when they looked there at the burial place, they saw that the stone has been rolled away.

meaning_english: To respond in obedience to something.
sample_bolinao: Maipa'ka' konan siin, saray Judio kai ra gapo nin maitulok a nakem ra, tan kakalawakawan anamaet tamo' konran ambo' nin Judio.
sample_english: Concerning that, theJewsthey are not able obey/accept it in their inmost beings, and it is just foolishness as well for the nonJews.

meaning_english: To be able to give help.
sample_bolinao: Ania maitulongko komoyo?
sample_english: Whathelpcan I give you?

meaning_english: To be continuing on, usually after some stoppage or doubt or something happening.
sample_bolinao: Dilap yayna maituloy a iksamin ta kasaynan udas sawanin.
sample_english: Tomorrow the exam will be continued since there is no time left today.

meaning_english: To topple something.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' anaod nin si'tamo, matkap tamon galten a sarban makabyat sa pallayo tamo laloynay kasalanan a maitumba atamo.
sample_english: Therefore indeed we, we must remove all that weighs down in our race especially sin which can topple us.

meaning_english: To follow after someone with something.
sample_bolinao: Maitumbok na ni Rose a mirindal na ni Juan sa gagawa' nin mantamnan ra.
sample_english: Rose followed with Juan's merienda to the field where they were transplanting.

meaning_english: To be able to be reconciled.
sample_bolinao: Karabayan na et a bana' sa gaw'en nan Anak na ket, maituno konan diri nin Ama a sarba mataman no iti sara sa luta' o itaw sara sa langit.
sample_english: It was further his will that because of what his Child would do, all would be reconciled with the Father himself whether they are here on the earth or there in heaven.

meaning_english: To be hit or slapped hard, attempting to send something to another place.
To have something pushed on or pressure put on.
sample_bolinao: Maituror yay purta sa bali mataman maslet ya.
sample_english: The door to the house can be pushed open even though it is a snug fit.

meaning_english: To be able to be twisted or turned or moved in a different direction.
For something to be sliced.
For something to be expanded.
To be using something in a careless manner.
sample_bolinao: Maiwagnawagnak na ni Juan a kupya' na ta no adti-adti na ikwa sa bali na.
sample_english: Juan is careless with his hat for he just puts it wherever in his house.

meaning_english: To complete, or accomplish something with the feeling of relief that it brings. Everything is finished at last.
sample_bolinao: Naiwakasana, salamat sa Dios.
sample_english: Thank God it'sover.

meaning_english: For an intangible such as gossip or fame to be being spread.
To shake out something.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya maiwas gapo ta main nakatangil.
sample_english: It cannot be moved because there is an obstruction.

meaning_english: To be able to advance something toward a goal.
To have been put out of the proper state.
To be carried along to the shore or edge of something.
sample_bolinao: Maiyabay yay balsa no ararem.
sample_english: If it is high tide the raft will be carried to shore.

meaning_english: For a person or animal to give birth.
sample_bolinao: Inupirawan raya si Alegra ta kai nasara nin maiyabing sa nurmal nin padalan a triplit nin a'nak na.
sample_english: Alegra was operated on because she was not able to deliver her triplets the normal way.

meaning_english: To be able to reach some point.
sample_bolinao: No mapagal yaynay damulag nin mangadado, pa'watan ya ta pinggat maiyabot ya anggan yabina.
sample_english: When the carabao is exhausted plowing, give him a break in order that he will be able to last until the afternoon.

meaning_english: To happen to open something.
sample_bolinao: Naiyabri ko yay purta sin main tumuktok.
sample_english: I happened to open the door when someone knocked.

meaning_english: To approve something.
sample_bolinao: Mandawaten ran amigo ko nin maiyaburuyan rakon makaayi sa pidudupong.
sample_english: My friends are requesting to be allowed to come with me to the meeting.

meaning_english: To be brought before someone with authority normally because of some fault.
sample_bolinao: Naiyadap ya si Jesus nin usisaen nan gubirnador a si Pilato.
sample_english: Jesus was brought before the governor who was Pilato to be examined.

meaning_english: To be able to be hidden.
sample_bolinao: Kasaynaod nin maiyadi nin animan konan Dios, nin si'numan.
sample_english: There is indeed no one that can hide anything from God, whoever they are.

meaning_english: To be able to finish something especially in relation to a time or event.
sample_bolinao: Maiyadi' na ni Juan a pammantay nan TV no rway udas ana.
sample_english: Juan finishes his watching of TV when two hours have passed.

meaning_english: To make something prosperous.
sample_bolinao: Si'kamo bale', matkap a say mu'na-mu'na nin iti sa kanakman moyo ket say maiyadilanta a maipa'ka' sa pag'aadi' nan Dios tan say pangngawa' moyo nin say mapteg para kona, ket ibi nayti nga'min nin matkap moyo.
sample_english: You however, it must be that foremost in your mind is the advancement of that which is concerning the reigning of God and your doing of that which is upright for the benefit of him, and then he will give all that you need.

meaning_english: To have been made to flow.
sample_bolinao: Maiyagos a naragrag nin bulong no maksaw a rapeg.
sample_english: The fallen leaves are carried in the flow when it rains heavily.

meaning_english: To be taught something.
sample_bolinao: Maiyakay yaynan manurat abir anak ya et.
sample_english: He is able to be taught to write even though he is still a child.

meaning_english: To be fitted tightly together.
sample_bolinao: Naiyalep saran maong a rway kayo.
sample_english: The two pieces of wood fit snugly together.

meaning_english: To be able to give an example of something.
sample_bolinao: Say byay nin tawo ketmaiyalimbawa'sa gunem a paipadar ba'yo makasa.
sample_english: The life of mancan be likenedto clouds that appear and then vanish away.

meaning_english: To be able to move something.
sample_bolinao: Maiyalis li' in say palakay no rapeg.
sample_english: Those seedlings will be moved later when there is rain.

meaning_english: To have been put alongside.
Someone or thing gives birth to something.
sample_bolinao: Naiyanak yaynay kaka na konan sitin bulan.
sample_english: His older sibling was born in this month.

meaning_english: To be moved and ended up in something.
sample_bolinao: Si kaso naiyangga ya sa Kurti Suprima.
sample_english: The case has reached the Supreme Court.

meaning_english: To be adrift.
sample_bolinao: Maiyanor na ni Juan a balsa nin mamunta konan kaaluyon nan manaba' sa rigrig baybay.
sample_english: Juan let the raft drift along with the seine net along the seashore.

meaning_english: To be able to make something long.
sample_bolinao: Siin a anggawan nan lastiko, kai yayna nin maiyanro.
sample_english: That is the end of the elastic, it cannot be made longer.

meaning_english: To be moving away from a position.
For something to be rubbed onto something.
To draw something to something.
sample_bolinao: Anaod, ginlat ana a panumbukan sa nikapadi' ran puri na ni Levi bana' ta kai nin maiyarak a tutawo konan Dios.
sample_english: Indeed, the regulations of the priesthood of the offspring of Levi have been removed because they are not able to draw people to God.

meaning_english: To be modeled in something and so is comparable.
sample_bolinao: Say byay nin tawo,maiyarigsa tanaman a tumubo'.
sample_english: The life of a personcan be likenedto a plant that grows.

meaning_english: For a settlement to be made for something.
sample_bolinao: Wanin ta, no sin mangkuntrawen tamoya a Dios ket naiyariglo atamo kona nin say nikapati nan Anak na, ket sawanin, ta amigo natamoyna, mas laloyna edet nin maipal'is atamo li' sa panunusa na nin Dios bana' ta mangkabyay ya a Anak na.
sample_english: That's the case since, if when we were opposing God a settlement was made for us with him by the putting to death of his Son, now/today, since we are now his friend, it is then much more sure that we will be delivered from God' punishment because his Son is living.

meaning_english: To be decorated with something.
sample_bolinao: Bulong anahaw a raruman maiyarkos ra sa plasa.
sample_english: Some of the things the plaza was decorated with were leaves of the round-leaf palm.

meaning_english: An upward movement.
For something to be protectively delivered someplace.
To be put in storage or save someplace for later.
sample_bolinao: Talagan rwampulo' a pisos amaiyatorta sa sayay bulan.
sample_english: We can onlysavetwenty pesos a month.

meaning_english: For an action to be prohibited.
sample_bolinao: Maiyawa'a basta lumuob sa ugsuran ran main bali.
sample_english: It is prohibited to just enter the yard of a house.

meaning_english: To come off as petals of flowers in the wind.
sample_bolinao: Maiyayi kamo konra ta timper moyoy nibarita' mi komoyo maipa'ka' kona.
sample_english: You will be included with them since you believed what we told you concerning him.

meaning_english: To rub something.
sample_bolinao: No nanga'get kan luya ba'yo mo nin naiyedyed a gamet sa mata mo, maagasan.
sample_english: If you held pepper and then you happen to rub your eyes with your hand, your eyes will feel hot.

meaning_english: To give protection.
sample_bolinao: Kai ako nin sumawa' nin umanen ko anamanaet nin isurat komoyo a nibarita' koyna intaw, ta no reng'en moyoyti anaod ket maiyilag kamo.
sample_english: I am not fed up with once again writing to you that which I told you formerly, for certainly if you listen to this it will protect you.

meaning_english: Conceive.
sample_bolinao: Naiyinawyaynay anak.
sample_english: The child has been conceived.

meaning_english: To fully remit something which the other person has a right to and can force you to pay, surrender, submit.
sample_bolinao: Matkap aiyintrigaa byay sa Dios.
sample_english: It is necessary tosurrenderour lives to God.

meaning_english: For something to be communicated to somebody.
sample_bolinao: Maiyirgo mo tana li' pa koni angkay nin kai ako makapika' sawanin.
sample_english: Please find opportunity to tell the older sibling that I will not be able to go there today.

meaning_english: To have printed something.
sample_bolinao: Kai ra mapasal nin tutawo a mamasan irgo ran diri no kasan naiymprintan babasawen sa sitin irgo ra.
sample_english: People do not get accustomed to reading their own language if there are no printed reading materials in their language.

meaning_english: To be passing urine.
To happen to fall flat.
To be able to be put to use.
sample_bolinao: Maiyusar yay kwarta sa panaliw nin pintura para sa iskilawan.
sample_english: The money will be able to be put to use for the painting of the school.

meaning_english: To be able to reply to something.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya maka'bat sa tepet nan maistra na.
sample_english: He was not able to give a response to the question of his teacher.

meaning_english: To be able to be in a standing position.
sample_bolinao: Maka'deng akoyna na ta inmanda' yaynay pilay ko sa ayi.
sample_english: I am now able to stand since the crippling in my foot has been restored to health.

meaning_english: To pity someone.
sample_bolinao: Maka'dwan yan tuloy konra ta bara'mo saran karniro nin kasan mangipastor konra.
sample_english: He pity on them for they were like sheep that have no shepherd.

meaning_english: To happen or be able to put something in the mouth to eat.
sample_bolinao: Gumate' a lalaman na no maka'kan yan urang.
sample_english: His body gets itchy whe he happens to eat shrimp.

meaning_english: To discover or come to realize a benefit from something.
sample_bolinao: Bulag akon gindat, bale' maka'kit akoyna sawanin.
sample_english: I was formerly blind, but now I can see.

meaning_english: For something to happen to be spilled.
sample_bolinao: Mamayad no maka'met nin libro nan iskilawan.
sample_english: When a book from school is lost it is paid for.

meaning_english: To be able to warm something.
To be astonished by something that was not expected and not understandable.
sample_bolinao: Naka'ngapako sin narisibi koyay surat a main kwarta na.
sample_english: I was bewildered when I received a letter with money inside.

meaning_english: To be a time when something can happen.
sample_bolinao: Maka'no ya li' mangapon si Juan ket alas utso anan yabi.
sample_english: The time that Juan will be able eat supper is eight o'clock in the evening.

meaning_english: The state of whenever, any time or forever.
sample_bolinao: Tandaan moyo a si'ko, kalamo' moyokon pirmi anggan maka'numan.
sample_english: Know this that it is me that is your permanent companion until whatever time.

meaning_english: To be able to consume.
sample_bolinao: Si Dan ket maka'pos yan sayan litro nin supdringk sa sayan awro.
sample_english: Dan is able to consume a liter of soft drinks a day.

meaning_english: To be low tide.
sample_bolinao: Maka'tiana; mako ko manakep kuna' sa baybay.
sample_english: It'slowtide; I'll go to the shore and catch some fish.

meaning_english: To be able to pass digestive gas.
sample_bolinao: No paset-paset yay tyan makatulong no maka'tot o tumir'ab ka.
sample_english: When there's a feeling of heaviness and tightness in your stomach to flatulate and to belch help.

meaning_english: To be able to advance to someplace.
For something to be able to delay or interrupt.
sample_bolinao: Abaw amakaabara'kanya' nin kai mayadi' a trabaho sa kuston udas.
sample_english: There are many things that cause an interruption, that's why work cannot be completed at the right time.

meaning_english: To be able to come to shore or to the edge of something.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya makaabay a baluto ta maka'ti.
sample_english: He was not able to beach the boat at low tide.

meaning_english: For someone to be able to attain or reach to something.
sample_bolinao: Makaabot yan bagay nin itaw sa ata'gay nin lugar siBoyta pinasyan kata'gayan na.
sample_english: Boy is able to reach things in high places since he is very tall.

meaning_english: To be able to be holding arm in arm.
sample_bolinao: Nakaabrasyiti ya si Juan koni Pedro sin rumate' ako sa dani ra.
sample_english: As I got close to them Juan had his arm locked tight in Pedro's.

meaning_english: To happen to be open.
sample_bolinao: Anaod, main nin purta sa langit nin nakaabri.
sample_english: So indeed, there was a door in heaven that was open.

meaning_english: For someone to be able to learn or study something.
sample_bolinao: Makaadal ako sa iskol no pirmi akon mangrenge' sa maistra ko.
sample_english: I am able to learn in school if I always listen to my teacher.

meaning_english: To facing something.
sample_bolinao: Mariga yan tuloy si Adi' Herodes sin na'kit naya si Jesus ta na'teng nayaynan rabay nin makaadap.
sample_english: King Herodes was very happy when he saw Jesus for he had long been wanting to come to see him face to face.

meaning_english: To be habit forming.
sample_bolinao: Say mantawagen nin druga magwa' a bagay nin inumen, sepsepen, anguten bilang marijuana, upyom, shabu, ragbi, tan raruman tambar a makaadik kanya' nin iyawa' a pangngusar nin sayti.
sample_english: A remedy; a service; a deed to make something good; The readiness of a person to help someone he care for that's in a difficult position. Habit forming drug such as marijuana, shabu, cocaine, etc. thus the use of this is prohibited.

meaning_english: To be able to receive something.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya nin nakaagwang nin nakakatin nin bula si Nonong ta ayupa' ya.
sample_english: Nonong was not able to reach the ball that was hung since he is short.

meaning_english: To able to endure something, bear, withstand., To be able to endure, bear, suffer or withstand.
sample_bolinao: Makarma' tan maririket yay tawon makaagwanta nin panunubok ta no nasubok anay pammemper na, makaga'mor yan kurunan kasan raruma no kai say byay a nipangako' nan Catawan konran mangado' kona.
sample_english: Fortunate and joyous is the man who is able to suffer through testings for if/when his faith is able to be proved, he will be able to get a crown which is none other than the life which the Divine promised to those who love him.

meaning_english: To be made to cry.
sample_bolinao: Makaakis ako no masager yay maistra ko kongko.
sample_english: When the teacher is angry at me, it makes me cry.

meaning_english: To able to accept something.
sample_bolinao: Si tawon makaako' konan siti nin akay, akuen na.
sample_english: The person who is able to accept this teaching, he is to accept it.

meaning_english: To be able to make something larger.
sample_bolinao: Makaalaki nin mula a gwano.
sample_english: Fertilizer makes a plant grow.

meaning_english: To be able to be supported or sustained in a condition.
sample_bolinao: Makaalalay yaynay anak konan baying na no rumipay sara sa dalan.
sample_english: The child is held up by his grandmother when they travel on the road.

meaning_english: To be able to recognize or acknowledge something.
sample_bolinao: Kai yayna makaalilbi' si baying no kasan antyuhos na.
sample_english: Grandmother is not able to recognize things if she doesn't have eyeglasses.

meaning_english: To have the hair up in a knot of some sort to hole it in place.
sample_bolinao: Saray bubalasang sin saytawnakaalipugosara, sawanin ka'bawan anay ipakulet ray sabot ra.
sample_english: During the olden times single ladies hadchignonedhair, now most of them have their hair curled.

meaning_english: To be able to be transmitted, especially of a sickness.
sample_bolinao: Kai koyna makaalis sa subran ka'bawan ran ruran.
sample_english: I cannot get away from all or the masses of vehicles.

meaning_english: To be able to accompany someone in going something.
sample_bolinao: Si Dan a makaaluyon na ni Rose no mako sa iskol.
sample_english: Dan is the one that is able to be Rose's escort going to school.

meaning_english: To be able to swallow something.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya tanton makaamil ta masakit ya a bukraw na bana' sa buer.
sample_english: He is not able to swallow much since his throat is sore because of a cold.

meaning_english: To be able to have a child.
sample_bolinao: Ket mataman no kai yayna kumon nin makaanak si Abraham bana' ta masiken yaynan tuloy, syay puon ran namuyek-muyek nin tutawo a kapada ka'baw nin bituen tan kai nin mabilang a kapadan buyangin.
sample_english: And so even tho Abraham should not have been able to have a child because he was already so very old, he it is that is the ancestor of multitudes of people who are characterized by the abundance of the stars and uncountable as characterized by the sand.

meaning_english: To be able to refuse something.
Happen or to be able to smell.
sample_bolinao: Kai ko rabay makaangot nin asok nin sigarilyo.
sample_english: I so not like to smell cigarette smoke.

meaning_english: Able to put up with something or someone.
sample_bolinao: Makaanos ako nin mag'adal sa ilimintarya mataman maidap no mi'sa.
sample_english: I was able to endure the studies in elementary school even though it was difficult at times.

meaning_english: Able to affect something, normally negatively.
sample_bolinao: Makaapikto sa karigsawan nan sayay tawo a paninigarilyo.
sample_english: Cigarette smoking can affect the health of a person.

meaning_english: For someone to be able to draw near or approach someone either physically or not.
sample_bolinao: Saray nalayon magnubyo kai sara nin makaarak konran matua nan babayi ta pinasyan sager ra.
sample_english: The sweethearts that eloped cannot approach the parents of the girl for they are very angry.

meaning_english: To happen to perceive or notice something.
sample_bolinao: Kai koyna makaaram no mabistay elek ko.
sample_english: I am not able to be aware of anything if my sleep is good.

meaning_english: To be able to inseminate or produce offspring.
To come up out from within something such as water or a boat onto the surface.
meaning_filipino: Lumabas galing sa ilalim ng dagat.
sample_bolinao: Sin nakaarawas sarayna, saray tutawodtaw, naalilbi' rayan tampor si Jesus.
sample_english: When they had gotten out of the boat, as for the people there, they recognized Jesus at once.

meaning_english: To be able to come up out onto a surface from within something such as water or a boat.
sample_bolinao: Nakaarwasyayna sa raranom taaw.
sample_english: Hegot outof the sea water.

meaning_english: Able to take a spouse.
sample_bolinao: Abaw saray lullakin dayo sa sayay lugar a makaasawa anadtaw.
sample_english: There are many men who are strangers in a place that marry/get a wife from there.

meaning_english: To be able to store something out of sight.
sample_bolinao: Nakaator kona a sarban matandaan tamo maipa'ka' sa kanakman tan kadunungan nan Dios.
sample_english: Stored up in him is all that we can know concerning the mind/conscience and wisdom of God.

meaning_english: To be able to be attracted to something.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' yay kadiryan na a makaatrak, si piuugali' a rabay ko kona.
sample_english: I'm not attracted with his looks but his attitudes.

meaning_english: To be able to move backwards.
To be able to prohibit something.
To be able to go home.
sample_bolinao: Daremdem ana sin nakaawid kami ta kasan maruranan mi.
sample_english: It was already dusk when we were able to get home because there were no available rides for us.

meaning_english: To be able to persuade.
sample_bolinao: Makaayat a bakas na nin mampangan mangga.
sample_english: The appearance of a mango entices one to eat it.

meaning_english: To be able to be included.
sample_bolinao: Masakbay yan nimata pigaw makaayi ya sa babali.
sample_english: He woke up early so that he could come along to town.

meaning_english: To be capable or having the capacity to do something.
sample_bolinao: Sa sarba ran mibubsat, sya tamo' amakababa'.
sample_english: Among all his brother and sisters, he is the onlyonecapable.

meaning_english: To be happen to cause an allergic or negative reaction and so a hindrance to following through with the action.
sample_bolinao: Makabada' a kai na pangiyaburoy nin inay na ni Clara sa keen na sa Ibali.
sample_english: The reason Clara could give for not going to Manila was that her mother does not allow her to go.

meaning_english: To carry something over the shoulders, usually with a yoke.
sample_bolinao: Makabalatay ya si Juan nin rway lata nin ranom.
sample_english: Juan can carry two cans of water on a yoke on his shoulders.

meaning_english: To be able to bring about criticism.
sample_bolinao: Say man-gaw'en mon duka' a makabalaw sa pitatawo mo.
sample_english: The bad things you are doing are bringing criticism to your character.

meaning_english: To be able to respond to something.
sample_bolinao: Makabale' atamo sa matua no ipa'kit tamo nin kawa'nan tamo sara.
sample_english: We are able to respond to our parents for their contribution when we show our love for them.

meaning_english: To be able to express something.
For a person to have been mistaken as another person.
sample_bolinao: Say wana no sya si Maria antanakabalo'ya.
sample_english: He thought she was Maria, but he happened tohave mistook her.

meaning_english: To be able to block or dam up something.
To happen to crash into something.
sample_bolinao: Si Dan ket magmaniho ya namana ket makabangga' yan  ruran sa adapan na.
sample_english: Dan was driving again and so he crashed into the vehicle in front of him.

meaning_english: Able to rise up to a sitting or standing position.
sample_bolinao: Dandani ako nin kai makabangon no matrangkaso ako.
sample_english: I can hardly get up when I am fluish.

meaning_english: To able to watch something.
sample_bolinao: Edet, nipata-patanda' ray nabantayan ra nin saraytaw saray tutawo nin nakabantay nin tinawag naya ni Jesus si Lazaro nin lumiwa' sa nanabunan kona sin pinasubli' nayan mabyay.
sample_english: So then, those who had observed Jesus call Lazaro to come out from where he was buried when he returned him to life were proclaiming around what they had observed.

meaning_english: To be able to be broken.
sample_bolinao: Makabari' nin but'ol a pildit.
sample_english: A bone that is pinched between two objects could be broken.

meaning_english: To be able to read.
sample_bolinao: Rabay moymakabasatan makasurat?
sample_english: Would you like toreadand write?

meaning_english: To be able to use a can.
sample_bolinao: Makabaston ya si Juan mataman gulpin sugat nin gamet tan ayi na.
sample_english: Juan is able to use a cane even tho his hands and feet have a myriad of sores.

meaning_english: For someone to be eager or bold in getting into things or to be involved in doing something, especially that he has no experience in or knowledge of.
sample_bolinao: Makabat yan talaga si Juan.
sample_english: Juan is really daring in getting into things.

meaning_english: To be able to poison the air or water for animals and insects.
sample_bolinao: Makabawet a samal nin pangmati nin manida' nin burak mangga.
sample_english: The poison for killing the bugs that destroy the mango flowers can suffocate someone.

meaning_english: To able to pay.
sample_bolinao: Talipupusan koyna nga'min a utang ko anggan Mayo ta nakabayad akoyna.
sample_english: I will pay all my installments on my debt up to May since I can pay it now..

meaning_english: For something to be able to make someone choke.
sample_bolinao: Palna-palna kan mangan ta makabelbel in say kuna'.
sample_english: Eat carefully for that fish could make you choke.

meaning_english: To be tied to something.
sample_bolinao: Kaaram, nangwa ya nin ranom sa planggana, ba'yo na nin tinaranaan nin inuyasan a ayi ran tumutumbok na, mi'sa pinunasan na nin twalyan nakaberber sa awak na.
sample_english: Next, he put water in a basin, subsequently he began washing the feet of his disciples, then wiped them with the towel tied around his waist.

meaning_english: To be able or happen to poke the eye.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka manga'get nin makabi'sok.
sample_english: Do not handle objects that might poke the eye.

meaning_english: To be able to affect something.
To be able to give another person a stomachache.
sample_bolinao: Makabiltik a sayay tawon mapagal o masager.
sample_english: A person that is exhausted or angry can give another person a stomachache.

meaning_english: Surrounding with concrete walls.
sample_bolinao: Nakabitiyay libed nan Jerusalem.
sample_english: Jerusalem is surrounded by concrete walls.

meaning_english: To be able to be hanging from something.
Feeble.
sample_bolinao: Si'ko a syaymakabosa busat moyo.
sample_english: I am yourfeeblebrother.

meaning_english: To be able to turn to a new position.
sample_bolinao: Madali' akon makabring no kasan kararay kon ma'lek.
sample_english: I turn over quickly when there is no one sleeping beside me.

meaning_english: Climbing and spreading creeper vine whose stem contains a bitter substance used for medical purposes.
sample_bolinao: Sabtay pait nin sabaw makabuhay.
sample_english: The sap of the Heavenly Elixir is extremely bitter.

meaning_english: To be able to put a lean or a right to possess on something  in order to assure a debt.
sample_bolinao: Nakabuis sarban bali na pinggat kai raya ikulong.
sample_english: A seizure order was placed on his entire house so that he would not be confined to prison.

meaning_english: To happen to be released from something that it is joined to.
sample_bolinao: Guma'get kan maong pigaw kai ka nin makabul'is.
sample_english: Hang on tight so that you don't happen to get get lost (freed from a safe connection).

meaning_english: To happen to make someone blind.
sample_bolinao: Makabulag a asido no maika' sa mata.
sample_english: Acid if it gets in the eyes can make one blind.

meaning_english: To blind someone.
sample_bolinao: Tanda' moya a akay et a wana, Si nakabulding nin kapada nan tawo, buldingen ya anamaet.
sample_english: You further know the teaching that says, The person who has blinded his fellowman, he should be blinded also.

meaning_english: To be able to get free.
sample_bolinao: Makabulos saray manok sa kurungan.
sample_english: The chickens escaped from the hen house.

meaning_english: To be able to bear fruit or produce a result.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya makabunga a ungot no sida' yaynay busel na.
sample_english: A coconut cannot produce fruit if its core is bad.

meaning_english: To knock out someone's teeth or pieces that are removed from a base such as corn or teeth.
sample_bolinao: Si Dan ket makaburas yan bikoy mais nin imula na.
sample_english: Dan shelled of the corn seeds to that he would plant.

meaning_english: To be able to be opened.
sample_bolinao: Mangka'kit kon nakaburwang a langit tan sitaw si Pinaitawo ket naka'deng ya sa wanan nan Dios!
sample_english: I am seeing the heavens open and that one conceived as a Person standing at the right hand/side of God!

meaning_english: To be able to express something.
To happen to make a hole in something.
sample_bolinao: Pasak nin di-dos a nakabutbot sa bikoy nan mutor ni Juan.
sample_english: A two inch nail happened to pierce the tire of Juan's motorcycle.

meaning_english: To happen to be a burden.
sample_bolinao: Nagtrabaho kamin awro tan yabi ta pigaw nin kai kami nin makabyat komoyo leg'an miyan nipatanda' komoyo a Mabistan Patanda' a inako' mi konan Dios.
sample_english: We worked day and night in order that we may not be a burden to you while we were bringing you the Good News which we received from God.

meaning_english: To happen to step on something.
sample_bolinao: Masugat a ayi no makada'da' nin talaba.
sample_english: The foot will be injured if it happens to step on an oyster.

meaning_english: To have been overcome by something.
To be able to make an animal or person move by using some thing or the voice.
sample_bolinao: Makadagdag ya nin ayep a alalakin busis ni Dan sa mula na sa gagawa'.
sample_english: The loud voice of Dan was able to scare the animal from his plants in the field.

meaning_english: To be able to catch something that is living or moving.
sample_bolinao: Makadakepako kumon nin manuk-manok.
sample_english: I would like to be able to catch birds.

meaning_english: To be able to pass through a place.
sample_bolinao: Kai makadalan a ruran ta man-gaw'en yay taytay.
sample_english: A vehicle is not able to pass over the bridge since it is being worked on.

meaning_english: Realized.
To be able to get close to something.
sample_bolinao: Mabayani yay aso kanya' kai ya nin makadanyan.
sample_english: The dog was vicious and so he could not be approached.

meaning_english: To fall into a lying position with one's face down on the ground.
sample_bolinao: Makadapa' yan paspas sa luta' si Juan no mag'ihirsisyo ya.
sample_english: Juan goes into a prostrate position quickly when he exercises.

meaning_english: To lay something out in an exposed area.
To happen to brush against something.
sample_bolinao: Paduksaan ra kano a makadaragos tan mana'da' pungso.
sample_english: It is said that those who brush against and step on a termite mound will be tormented.

meaning_english: To be able to move.
sample_bolinao: Kai makadaras a ruran no kasan gasulina.
sample_english: A vehicle is not able to move if there is no fuel.

meaning_english: To be able to pray.
sample_bolinao: Mabista no makadasal yapo' no buklas mi'sa tumarana' nin mag'adal.
sample_english: It is good if you are able to first pray in the morning before the start of studies.

meaning_english: Happen to be in an orderly line.
To wander aimlessly or for the enjoyment of it or without a purpose.
sample_bolinao: Makadaw ya si Edwin ta no adti ya nin maku-mako.
sample_english: Edwin wanders aimlessly since he goes here and there.

meaning_english: To be able to make something dark.
sample_bolinao: Makadedlem nin libed a abaw nin gunem.
sample_english: The many clouds made it dark all around.

meaning_english: To be able to do some daring thing by moving closer to a danger.
sample_bolinao: Kai ako makadegdeg sa ugsuran ran kaaway ko.
sample_english: I don't dare to go into the yard of the ones I have a quarrel with.

meaning_english: To be able to perfectly hit something.
sample_bolinao: Makadegten ya si Juan sa bilyar nin man'ikapen ra.
sample_english: Juan is able to make the shot in the billiards game they were playing.

meaning_english: To be able to gather tings together such as to save money.
sample_bolinao: Rabay kon makadinep nin kwarta.
sample_english: I like to save money.

meaning_english: Godly, to be devoted to God.
sample_bolinao: Iyakay saray a'nak nin mag'in nin makadios
sample_english: The children are to be taught to become godly.

meaning_english: To be able to sense something as real.
sample_bolinao: Makadlaw akon kawa'nan rakon mumaistra ko.
sample_english: The love of my teachers of me is obvious to me.

meaning_english: To be able to land or alight on.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya makadpa' a kalapati ta kai et nin inumlep a lanip.
sample_english: The dove was not able to land since the flood had not yet been absorbed.

meaning_english: To happen to do something bad.
sample_bolinao: Kasan iyakay ran makaduka' nin  mangatua sa a'nak ra.
sample_english: There are no parents that teach their children to do evil.

meaning_english: To be able to stoop over.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya makadukot si baying ta masakit yay balangbang na.
sample_english: Grandmother was not able to stoop over since her hips were hurting.

meaning_english: To be able to discover something.
sample_bolinao: Makadumog akon limay pisos sa teben no mi'sa.
sample_english: Sometimes I am able to find a five peso coin under the house.

meaning_english: To happen to bump something lightly.
sample_bolinao: Makadumpar yan tawo si Juan sa palingki no anro a pila.
sample_english: When there is a long line in the market, Juan bumps into people.

meaning_english: To be able to bend the head down.
sample_bolinao: Masakit yay teen ko kanya' kai ako nin makadungdong.
sample_english: The nape of my neck is sore and so I cannot bend my head down.

meaning_english: To be able to dine with someone.
sample_bolinao: Rabay kwan makadungo si Jack.
sample_english: I want to be able to dine with Jack.

meaning_english: To be able to moor or secure a water vehicle in place.
sample_bolinao: Makaduong a barko sa Binabalian Loob.
sample_english: A schooner is able to dock at Binabalian Loob.

meaning_english: To happen to be blocking the sunlight from something.
sample_bolinao: Makadyong nin pari a atata'gay nin kawayan sa danin gagawa'.
sample_english: The very tall bamboo close to the field is shading the rice.

meaning_english: To be able to grasp something.
sample_bolinao: Lumnok a gamet no makaga'get nin baya.
sample_english: The hand will blister if an ember happens to be grasped.

meaning_english: Earn, win, benefit, receive, get.
sample_bolinao: Ket, kiririket saray mangmumula nin minsahi nan Dios konran mangyayatab ta iyator rayna a yinatab ra a saray nakaga'mor nin anggan-angga nin byay a iti konan Dios.
sample_english: And so , the planters of the message of God will rejoice together with the harvesters since they are now taking in to store their harvest of those that have been able to obtain eternal life in God.

meaning_english: To be able to fasten on something.
sample_bolinao: Makagalet yay tiki' sa gubida.
sample_english: The house lizard is able to fasten itself to the ceiling.

meaning_english: To be able to make a profit.
To happen to scratch something.
sample_bolinao: Mamayad ka no makagasgas ka nin raruman ruran.
sample_english: You will pay if you happen to scratch another vehicle.

meaning_english: Able to cause itchiness.
sample_bolinao: Makagate'a bulong ukra.
sample_english: The leaves of okracan causeitchiness.

meaning_english: To be able to meet or reach the requirements to qualify for something.
sample_bolinao: Makaagwang akon bungan bayawas sa ugsuran nin bali mi.
sample_english: I am able to reach up and get guavas in the yard of our house.

meaning_english: To be able to be hit.
sample_bolinao: Saymasaor,kai nin makagket.
sample_english: One who isdeviouscannot be hit.

meaning_english: To be able to remove.
sample_bolinao: Madali' nin makaglat nin sama' sa aysing a sabon.
sample_english: Soap takes dirt out of clothing quickly.

meaning_english: To be able to graduate from something.
sample_bolinao: Main irigalo ko komo no makagradwit ka.
sample_english: I have a gift for you if you are able to graduate.

meaning_english: To be able to do something by applying all one's effort.
sample_bolinao: Kai komakagulapaytana mako mangalap inumen ko.
sample_english: I cannot even with all my effort move a little to go get a drink.

meaning_english: To be able to create a disturbance.
sample_bolinao: Makagulo ya si Arnel sa ikap mi.
sample_english: Arnel is disturbing our play.

meaning_english: To be able to get a lot of something.
To be able to do or make something.
sample_bolinao: Makagawa' ya nin mas et nin adayo' dyan sa maisip tamo o sa madawat tamo.
sample_english: He is able to do much more by far than we are able to think or able to request.

meaning_english: To be a honeycomb structure that looks like a network of small boxes.
To be able to make sufficient or correct in some way.
To able to express something.
sample_bolinao: Saytin ririket, kasa gapo nin kapada tan kasan sarita' nin makaibalikas no pa'no.
sample_english: This joy, it has no comparison and there is no word that is able to express the extent.

meaning_english: To be able to be aroused, establish awareness and get up.
sample_bolinao: Mabistay kaingaran no buklas kanya' makaibangon nin marigsa.
sample_english: It's a good feeling in the morning and so there is the ability to get up in good health.

meaning_english: To be able to speak about something.
sample_bolinao: Makaibarita' akon kwarta nin rabay kon adamen koni Juan.
sample_english: I can speak to Juan about the money I want to borrow.

meaning_english: Able to leave.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya makaibwat mamuntan Ibali ta nagmasakit ya.
sample_english: He is not able to leave going to Manila since he is sick.

meaning_english: To be lying down on a surface.
sample_bolinao: Nadumog raya a baboy anakaida'sa luta'.
sample_english: They discovered the piglyingon the ground.

meaning_english: To have been able to be conveyed someplace.
To be able to interact with someone, playmate.
sample_bolinao: Abaw siraymakaikapmo.
sample_english: You have manyplaymates.

meaning_english: An affiliation by marriage to another family, in-laws, .
sample_bolinao: Mako kami mamasyar nin matua ko konran makaikapetan ko.
sample_english: We will go visit the parents of my in-laws.

meaning_english: To be hooked to something.
To able to posses something.
sample_bolinao: Abir nin sitin amigo nan nubyo ket ambo' yay makaikon konan nubya, alakin lamang a ririket na ta mangkarnge' nay pakapariga nan nubyo.
sample_english: Even this friend of the bridegroom, he is not able to possess the bride, but even so he has great joy since he is hearing / experiencing the celebration of the bridegroom.

meaning_english: To be able to place something someplace.
sample_bolinao: Sayti ket gawa' sa waks nin main nakaikwa nin markan upisyal.
sample_english: This was made with wax in which there was placed the mark of an official.

meaning_english: To able to bring out something.
sample_bolinao: Sin nakailiwa' saraynan plata, wana ni Jesus konra, <<Si'no ya in rupa tan ngaran si isen konan plata?>>
sample_english: When they had brought out the coin, Jesus said to them, <<Whose face and name are these that on that coin?>>

meaning_english: Happen to awake.
sample_bolinao: Makaimata yay abing no magargar sa libed.
sample_english: The baby wakes up when it is noise around her.

meaning_english: To be able to be observe a situation.
sample_bolinao: Makaimaton ya nin mampangansyon.
sample_english: He was able to observe the concert.

meaning_english: To be able to smile.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya makaimis ta mabereng ya.
sample_english: He cannot smile since he is sorrowful.

meaning_english: To be able to influence something.
sample_bolinao: Makaimpluwinsya sa ugali' na a man'iyakay ra sa iskilawan.
sample_english: What they are teaching in school is able to influence his behaviors.

meaning_english: To be able to breathe.
sample_bolinao: Dumali yay asma na kanya' kai ya makainawa.
sample_english: His asthma is attacking and so he can not breath.

meaning_english: To be able to hear.
sample_bolinao: Makaingar yan sakit sa tyan na.
sample_english: He is feeling sick to the stomachache.

meaning_english: To be thirsty and so able to drink.
sample_bolinao: Mapriskwan a kaingaran no makainom nin sarsaparila.
sample_english: You feel fresh and satisfied when you are able to drink sarsaparilla.

meaning_english: To able to have been erected.
sample_bolinao: Si Uunuren moyo, maiyarig yaynamaet sa sayay mabyay nin ma'get a bato nin nakaipa'dengan nan sayay bali.
sample_english: Your Lord , he is modeled as well by a firm living stone on which is a house is erected.

meaning_english: To be able to extend the time of something.
To happen to be wakened suddenly from deep sleepby something.
meaning_filipino: Gumising sa gaabi na madali at matulog na naman; maalimpungatan.
sample_bolinao: Alas dos a parbangon nomakaipaknaako ba'yo ma'lek akoynaet.
sample_english: I happened to wake up at two o'clock in the morning, then I slept again.

meaning_english: To customarily be able to do something.
sample_bolinao: Nakaiparmaw nayna a magra'mos mi'sa ya ma'lek.
sample_english: He made it his practice to wash his face before he slept.

meaning_english: To happen to be accustomed to something.
sample_bolinao: Kai nayna maglat in ninkaugalianna ta nakaiparmawan na.
sample_english: Herhabitcannot be changed anymore because she is already accustomed to that behavior.

meaning_english: To have been able to be made one with something., The one who was used to make something one with something.
sample_bolinao: Dawaten ko komoyo, Euodia tan Sintique, midunong kamo kumon nin katutulok moyo konan Uunuren a nakaipasayawan moyo.
sample_english: I request of you, Euodia and Sintique, might you come to an understanding in obedience to Lord who has made you both one.

meaning_english: To be able to base or found something on something.
sample_bolinao: Panemtemen no ani a nakaipatukduan nin tutuon pammemper tamo.
sample_english: Remember what it was that our true faith was founded on.

meaning_english: To have given the responsibility to look after things.
sample_bolinao: Si kakan anak, syaynakaipudiransarban main.
sample_english: The oldest child wasgiventheauthoritytolook afterall the possessions.

meaning_english: To able to be staked someplace.
sample_bolinao: Usbagen moya sa nakaipugedan na tan i'ras moyadti kongko.
sample_english: Loose it from where it is staked and bring it here to me.

meaning_english: To be able to restrain or prevent something.
sample_bolinao: Kasanmakaipukpokkongko ta siin a rabay kon gaw'en.
sample_english: No one canstopme because that is what I want to do.

meaning_english: To be able to confine something someplace.
To distinguish or discern something.
sample_bolinao: Mainmakaipurokno main subor nan sayay lugar.
sample_english: There is something that candetectif there is a spring in a certain place.

meaning_english: To able to undergo suffering.
