sample_bolinao: ...si'kan babayi nin kai manganak ket kai et nin nakairangep nin irab nin mangabing.
sample_english: ...you woman who does not give birth and so has not yet undergone the pain of childbirth.

meaning_english: To able to implicate.
sample_bolinao: Kasa gapo nin nakairanudan na sa gawa'-gawa' nin tutawon makasalanan.
sample_english: There is nothing at all that has implicated him with the deeds of people that sin.

meaning_english: To be leaning but in a self supported position.
To be able to speak.
sample_bolinao: Makairgokan Inglis?
sample_english: You canspeakEnglish?

meaning_english: To be able to lean up against something.
sample_bolinao: Makairig ako konan puon kayo no sumirong ako.
sample_english: I lean up against the tree when I go under its shade.

meaning_english: To able to save.
sample_bolinao: Sain say Sarita' nan Dios a makaisalba komoyo.
sample_english: That Word of God is what is able to save you .

meaning_english: For a person to adorn the body regally with beautiful clothing and accessories.
To happen to make a disturbance.
sample_bolinao: Makadisturbo saray mampiikap nin a'nak konran mampag'adal.
sample_english: The children that are playing happen to be disturbing those studying.

meaning_english: To be able to write something on something.
sample_bolinao: Main nin libro o layi nin makaisuratan nin disiplina sa tutawo.
sample_english: There are books or laws that can be written about the orderly living together of people.

meaning_english: To be able to separate.
sample_bolinao: Makaisyay konan nanay a kikalamo' sa nubyo o inado'.
sample_english: The coming together with the groom or fiancee will separate one from the mother.

meaning_english: To be able to swallow the food down the throat.
sample_bolinao: Kai ako makaitlen nin tambar ta sabtay pait.
sample_english: I can't swallow the medicine since it is so bitter.

meaning_english: To be able to endure through pain and hardship courageously.
sample_bolinao: Matalag saray makaitpel nin mamalaw konan lider ra.
sample_english: There are few that are brave enough to actually criticize their leader.

meaning_english: To be able to teach.
sample_bolinao: Mangatua a makaiyakay konran a'nak nin mabistan ugali'.
sample_english: It is the parents that are able to teach the children good habits.

meaning_english: To be able to give a prohibition of something.
sample_bolinao: Si gwardya a makaiyawa' sa a'nak nin lumwa' sa iskilawan.
sample_english: The guard is able to prohibit the children from going out of the school.

meaning_english: To be able to sleep
sample_bolinao: Mangitungge' saraynan mantuma'gan angga sin nakaka'lek sara.
sample_english: Their heads-were-nodding as they were waiting until finally they fell asleep.

meaning_english: For someone to happen to laugh at something.
sample_bolinao: Makaka'lis yaynay anak nin man'umakis ta na'kit naya si nanay na.
sample_english: The child that was crying is now laughing since he saw his mother.

meaning_english: To seated on a horse.
sample_bolinao: Nibarita' kongko no umno ray nakakabayo a sundalo' ra; rwanyasot a milyon sara.
sample_english: It was told to me how many soldiers there were on horse back; they were two hundred million.

meaning_english: Able to get near to someone or something or to God.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' nin nikiletletan ya konran tutawo anggan nakakadani ya sa gurot na ni Jesus ket kinudit nayay aysing na.
sample_english: And so she pushed her away through the people until she was able to get near to the back of Jesus and then she touched his clothing.

meaning_english: To able to go far.
sample_bolinao: Apurawen moy lumalako pigaw makakadayo' kan tampor.
sample_english: Hurry up you walking so that you will get far away immediately.

meaning_english: To chained.
sample_bolinao: Bana' sa pagmamatalek ko sa nipangako' nan Dios kontamon puri na ni Israel a peteg nin rason a nakakadina ako.
sample_english: Because of my trust in the promise of God to us decendants of Israel is the real reason why I am in chains.

meaning_english: Able to get or obtain.
sample_bolinao: Makakalapkan ata'gay a grado no maadal ka.
sample_english: You canobtainhigh grades if you study hard.

meaning_english: To be able to hook something to accomplish aomething.
sample_bolinao: Asirtawen moyoy pamisuldong nin kawayan pigaw makakalawit tamo nin nin ungot.
sample_english: Pay careful attention to how you splice the bamboo so that we will be able to hook off the coconut.

meaning_english: To be able to gather shells from the sea bottom.
sample_bolinao: Man'umtabyay baybay, kai na makakarang.
sample_english: The sea is coming high, we cannot pick up shell anymore.

meaning_english: To be able to be loaded or contain something.
To happen to be fortunate.
sample_bolinao: Makakarma' ako nin uysa.
sample_english: I might have the fate of coming across a deer.

meaning_english: To happen to hang or be suspended by something.
sample_bolinao: Dinusa nayan Dios a si'numan nin nati a nakakatin sa kayo.
sample_english: God punished anyone who died hanging on a tree.

meaning_english: To be able to crawl and spread.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a klasi nin insikto tan ayep a makakayam.
sample_english: There are a lot of animals and insects that are able to crawl.

meaning_english: To be able to bite.
sample_bolinao: Ningirsi' yay aso sin kai ya makakayat.
sample_english: The dog curled up his lips when he was not able to bite.

meaning_english: To be able to be lowered.
To happen to make a loud thump or bang.
sample_bolinao: Nakakdor yay purta bana' sa turor nin maksaw.
sample_english: The door made a loud thump because of being pushed hard.

meaning_english: To jerk suddenly from being frightened.
sample_bolinao: Nakaki'ded ako sin bigra' a main kudor.
sample_english: Ijumpedwhen it suddenly thundered.

meaning_english: To able to come face to face.
sample_bolinao: Ket no wanin, makakiadap kamo li' kongko a si'kon si Pinaitawo.
sample_english: And so when that's the case, you will be able to come face to face with me the One Conceived as a Person.

meaning_english: To parallel or match someone in some way.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya nin makakiampad a ruran ran pulis konan ruran ran huldaper ta mampalsuten rasara.
sample_english: The vehicle of the police cannot come alongside the vehicle of the robbers because they are being shot at by them.

meaning_english: Able to be compared to.
sample_bolinao: Kasan makakiarig sa kaungan nan magdruwing sa klasi na ni Renan.
sample_english: No one compares to Renan's skill in drawing in his class.

meaning_english: To be able to go with someone for a particular purpose.
To able to shoulder with.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' nin matkap a si'tamo nin mammemper ket tulungan tamo sara ta pigaw nin makakibalatay atamo sa gawa' ran pangingipatanda' nin katutu'wan a nangibwat konan Dios.
sample_english: And so we believers must help them so that we could have a share in carrying the load of their work of proclaiming/make known the the truth that comes from God.

meaning_english: To have a concerned involvement in something.
sample_bolinao: Makakibiang yay nanay no magbertdi yay anak na.
sample_english: The mother will have a concerned involvement in the birthday of her child.

meaning_english: To look at something with displeasure.
sample_bolinao: Makakibit ya si Maria koni Dan ta gura' nayayna ta gulpi anay utang na ni Dan.
sample_english: Maria looks at Dan with displeasure since she despises him for Dan's debt is great.

meaning_english: To able to come close with someone.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' nin bana' sa ginwa' na ni Cristo, si'tamon rway klasin tawo, Judio tan ambo' nin Judio, makakidani atamoyna konan Dios a syay Ama tamo sa tulong nan sayan-sayay Ispirito na.
sample_english: Therefore, because of what Christ did, we two kinds of people,Jewsand nonJews, are able to come close to God who is our Father by the help of his one and only Spirit.

meaning_english: To happen to be in the same line.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket makakidatig ya konran nakalinya nin mamutos sa iskol.
sample_english: Juan got in line with those that had formed a line at school to vote.

meaning_english: To be able to dine together in fellowship.
sample_bolinao: Tepeten ma no rabay nan makakidungo kontamo.
sample_english: Ask him if he would like to fellowship with us over a meal.

meaning_english: To get into trouble with someone.
sample_bolinao: Si Sam ket makakigulo ya konran kaaluyon nan nabok.
sample_english: Sam got into a fight with those he got drunk with.

meaning_english: To be able to play together with other people.
sample_bolinao: Rumate' yan ibat sa abrod; makakiikap yayna konran pamilya na.
sample_english: He is arriving from abroad; he'll be able to live with his family now.

meaning_english: To be able to feel and hear someones feelings or have compassion with them.
sample_bolinao: Anaod, matkap a maong kamo sa saya tan saya, tan makakiingar kamo sa saya tan saya, tan pirdunawen moyoy saya tan saya mangibwat sa pangangado' a kapadan nipamirduna nan Dios komoyo bana' kona ni Cristo.
sample_english: Indeed, you must be good to one another, and be able to feel / hear one another, and forgive one another out of love in conformity with how God has forgiven you because of Christ.

meaning_english: To have the privilege, opportunity or chance of speaking with someone.
sample_bolinao: Kasa tanan udas konmakakiirgokomo abirno nin rabay ko.
sample_english: I just don't have time to be able to converse with you even if I want to.

meaning_english: To able to buddy with and fellowship together.
sample_bolinao: Rabay kon makakikalamo' konran maong mag'adal.
sample_english: I like to be able to be with those who are good at studying.

meaning_english: Able to meet together.
sample_bolinao: Kai ko makakikumpirinsya sawanin.
sample_english: I am not able to be at the conference with you today.

meaning_english: To able to successfully oppose someone.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' anaod, bubsat, nin kwinta isulot moyoyna a kumplito nin pinakaarmas a man'ibi nan Dios komoyo pigaw nin, sa udas a atakyen nakamon duka' a kalaban tamo, ket makakilaban kamon magsen anggan nayadi' ana li' a laban ket nasadya' kamo et a lamang sa raruma ana et.
sample_english: Therefore indeed, siblings, reckon that you put on the complete thing that serves as armament which God is giving you in order that, at the hour our evil enemy attacks, you will be able to fight strongly until the fight is finished and then you will moreover still be prepared for yet another.

meaning_english: To be able to churn up the water.
sample_bolinao: Say ilisi nin bapor, makakimbor nin ranom sa taaw.
sample_english: The ship's propeller churns up the sea water.

meaning_english: Able to move.
sample_bolinao: Nabaror yay aso kanya' kai na nin makakimey.
sample_english: The dog is bound up and so he cannot move.

meaning_english: To be able to be grouped with or put in the same status with another.
sample_bolinao: Kasan makakipada sa kaungan ni Ferdinand Marcos Sr. nin lider.
sample_english: No leader can be compared with the expertise of Fercinand Marcos Sr.

meaning_english: To be able to govern with someone.
sample_bolinao: ta pigaw nin makakipag'uray sara komo sa luta'.
sample_english: in order that they might govern with you on the earth.

meaning_english: To be able to participate in a meal at an occasion.
sample_bolinao: Masakbay ako nin agawid pinggat makakipangan ako sa punsya.
sample_english: I left early to go home so that I would be able to participate in the reception.

meaning_english: To be able to look at something in the face.
sample_bolinao: Say pakadlawan mo kona no mampibula'-bula' ya ket kai ya makakipastang.
sample_english: Your making clear to him his lying makes it so he can't stand to look at it.

meaning_english: Able to participate in.
sample_bolinao: Si'kamo tamo' isen sa dupong nin mammemper a naranod sa gastos tan nakakirama' sa bunga nin sain nin nipangipatanda' ko.
sample_english: You alone there in the assembly of the believers were involved with the expenses and participated in the fruit of my preaching.

meaning_english: To able to give thanks to someone.
sample_bolinao: Anaod, pa'no miya kadi' nin makakisalamatan nin sumadag a Dios bana' komoyo?
sample_english: Indeed, how can we thank God enough because of you?

meaning_english: Able to taste with someone.
sample_bolinao: Main sayay akulaw anakakitawaykonan sitaw a uysa.
sample_english: There was an old woman who was able to taste that deer.

meaning_english: To have the opportunity or ability to be brought into harmony.
sample_bolinao: Makakituno ako sa ba'yon iskwilawan ko ta main rispito ra kongko.
sample_english: I am in sync with my new school for they have respect for me.

meaning_english: Screeching sound, said of the sound of steel grating against steel or concrete.
meaning_filipino: Pagsasalarawan sa tunog ng bakal na naikikiskis sa kapwa bakal o sa simiento.
sample_bolinao: Nakakkrit a bikoy nan trin sa rilis sin niprino nayan bigra' nin drayber.
sample_english: The wheels of the train screeched as the driver suddenly applied the brakes.

meaning_english: To keep quiet, stop talking or crying.
meaning_filipino: Walang imik; tumahimik; walang ingay; tahimik; walang kalatis.
sample_bolinao: Makaklekka ta makaka'lek ya ari mo.
sample_english: Keep quiet, your sister is asleep.

meaning_english: A sharp sound like coins clinking or a scream.
For something to be dropped directly into a hole without hindrance.
meaning_filipino: Nahulog sa butas na walang hadlang.
sample_bolinao: Nakaklongyay alakin bula sin nanabo' ya sa ubot.
sample_english: The big ballfelldirectly into the hole.

meaning_english: To be able to fold closed such as as lips or flowers or umbrellas or wings.
To be able to dart off.
sample_bolinao: Main mabaya'-baya' nan ayi ko kanya' kai ko makakred.
sample_english: I have bad swelling in my foot and so I can't just dart off someplace.

meaning_english: To be able to dart into hiding.
To be able to take a step after having not been able.
sample_bolinao: Makaku'dangyaynay anak.
sample_english: Thechildis nowable to take a step.

meaning_english: To be able to touch.
sample_bolinao: Ket sarba ran nakakudit kona, inmanda' sara.
sample_english: And all those who were able to touch him, they were healed.

meaning_english: To press arms and legs against one's side, curling up.
sample_bolinao: Nakakukot tan kayungkong ya ta masakit yay tyan na.
sample_english: He had pressed his arms against his chest and his legs and feet close together because he had a stomach ache.

meaning_english: To be able to move after being drained of energy.
sample_bolinao: kai makakulakol.
sample_english: Can hardly move because of exhaustion.

meaning_english: To be able to protect, or hide oneself behind a cloth from something such as rain by bending down behind it or to protect something by covering it such as a house when the windows are covered.
To able to be crowned.
sample_bolinao: tan nakakuruna ya nin abaw.
sample_english: and he is crowned with many crowns.

meaning_english: To be able to appease someone.
sample_bolinao: Si minsahi ni Maistro ket makakuyong nin sumubli' konan magmatalek.
sample_english: The message of the Master was soothing the return of trusting.

meaning_english: To be snared or caught such as by using a noose or hook.
sample_bolinao: Gulpi nin ulmog nan nakal'ot kon manok a biring.
sample_english: There were masses of fleas ensnared on my fighting cock.

meaning_english: To have the skills to compete in an opposing situation.
sample_bolinao: Nag'adal yan maong kanya' makalaban ya sa kuntis.
sample_english: He studied well and so he is able to compete in the contest.

meaning_english: Happen to pass by going somewhere else, not intending to stop.
sample_bolinao: Kai ako makalabas sa purta ta letletan a tawo.
sample_english: I cannot pass through the door since it is jammed full of people.

meaning_english: To be able to be sufficient.
To be able to be sold.
sample_bolinao: Mamibi ana sawanin a mais kanya' makalako' anan mais no sumunor a bulan.
sample_english: The corn is now currently bearing ears and so corn will be able to be sold in the following month.

meaning_english: To be able to get away from something.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya makalakwan si nanay ta nanganak yay baboy mi.
sample_english: Mother was not able to leave since our pig had given birth.

meaning_english: To be able to walk.
sample_bolinao: Saray dios-dios, kai sara nin maka'kit, kai nin makarnge' tan kai nin makalalako.
sample_english: The idols, they cannot see, cannot hear and cannot walk.

meaning_english: To be able to contain something.
sample_bolinao: Makalaman a barang saya nin pasig nin rwampulo' anggan tulumpulo' a galon.
sample_english: Each jar was able to hold twenty to thirty gallons.

meaning_english: To be with someone.
sample_bolinao: Talagannakalamo'koya si Eva.
sample_english: Truly I was with Eva.

meaning_english: To have gotten something.
sample_bolinao: Pa'yu-pa'yukan rasaray tutawo ta pigaw nin makalap ray rabay ra.
sample_english: They flatter people in order to be-able-to-get what they want.

meaning_english: To taken from someplace.
sample_bolinao: Nakalapanyan abaw a agamiren.
sample_english: Many tools were taken.

meaning_english: To be able to escape from something that is holding something.
sample_bolinao: Kai yamakalapsotsa nakaibaruran na.
sample_english: He cannotget awayfrom where he is bound.

meaning_english: For something such as rice or money to be dispersed or consumed lavishly for the benefit of many.
sample_bolinao: Makalas a byas komi ta abaw kamin mangan.
sample_english: Our rice is dispersed quickly since there are a lot of us that will eat.

meaning_english: To be able to pass through or overcome difficulties and hardships and get to the other side of them.
sample_bolinao: Salamat sa Dios tanakalasatsa abaw a idap.
sample_english: Thank God we were able to overcome many difficulties.

meaning_english: To be able to hook something with a pole.
sample_bolinao: Mangkit kan kawayan nin maisuldong pigaw makalawit tay malago'.
sample_english: Find a bamboo that can be connected so that we will be able to hook the young coconut.

meaning_english: To be able to escape, such as a man from police.
To be able to climb on something.
To happen to get something wet.
sample_bolinao: Siin a warsik mo nin ranom, makalbet ya.
sample_english: That water which you splashed happened to get him wet.

meaning_english: To be bald.
sample_bolinao: Makalbo a raruman lullaki no sumiken ana.
sample_english: Some men are bald when they are getting old.

meaning_english: To be able to slam against something.
To be able to crowd into an area.
sample_bolinao: Makaletlet sa dyip no makiseksek ka sa tekrean.
sample_english: A jeep can be crowded into if you each shove over on the seat.

meaning_english: To be dug up.
sample_bolinao: Makali anay laman nin kamuti no mamalabas a tuloy bulan.
sample_english: The camote tubers can be dug up when three months have been allowed to pass.

meaning_english: To be able to free from the results of something.
sample_bolinao: Makalibri ya sa pasahi ta amigo nayay drayber.
sample_english: She get a free fare since the driver is her friend.

meaning_english: To be able to evade some danger.
sample_bolinao: Maong tanakalikidya sin natumba ya kayo.
sample_english: Its' good he was able toget awaywhen the tree fell.

meaning_english: To be able to confuse or deceive a person.
sample_bolinao: Makalingo a pariho nin apilyido ran pulitiko no mamutos.
sample_english: Politicians having the same family name can be confusing when voting.

meaning_english: To be able to list something.
sample_bolinao: Ba'yo ya et nin naparsa a mundo, nakalista anay ngaran ra sa libro nan Karniro nin pinatin nisakripisyo.
sample_english: Before the world was yet created, their names were already listed in the book of the Sheep that was killed as a sacrifice.

meaning_english: To have the opportunity to be accepted as qualified for a position.
sample_bolinao: Ala singko sa yabina sarayna makaliwa' a a'nak sa iskilawan.
sample_english: Five o'clock in the afternoon the children are allowed to leave school.

meaning_english: To be able to encourage someone.
A contemporary.
sample_bolinao: Si tatay,nakallamo'nasara niMabini.
sample_english: My father was acontemporaryof Mabini.

meaning_english: To be able to fly.
sample_bolinao: Makalpad saray manuk-manok no tumubo' anay pakpak ra.
sample_english: Birds are able to fly when their wings grow out.

meaning_english: To pass through a tight place.
sample_bolinao: Abaw et lamang makalusot nin kriminal sa Pilipinas.
sample_english: There are a lot of criminals in the Philippines that are able to escape.

meaning_english: To have chock placed to stop movement.
To be able to enter into something.
sample_bolinao: Makaluob yayna sa trabaho no Lunes.
sample_english: He starts a job on Monday.

meaning_english: Anything that makes something more serious.
sample_bolinao: Say maasin nin ma'kanmakaluodalta prisyon.
sample_english: Salty food makes blood pressurehigher.

meaning_english: To get naked or remove clothing that should properly be covering something.
sample_bolinao: Nakalus'ok ya ta ginlat nayay aysing na.
sample_english: She got naked for she removed her dress.

meaning_english: To be able to escape from a restriction, such as a fish to escape from a line.
To be able to cook something.
sample_bolinao: Makaluto' akoynan kuna'.
sample_english: I am able to cook fish.

meaning_english: To be wandering around.
sample_bolinao: Makamang ya si Juan sa lugar na ta mako ya tamo' nin kiikap.
sample_english: Juan wanders around his place for he only goes out to play.

meaning_english: To be outrunning or overtaking someone by running.
sample_bolinao: Makamat nakon aso ni Juan mataman nin malayo akon paspas.
sample_english: Juan's dog outruns me even though I am a fast runner.

meaning_english: Fatal, coming death, cause of death, end of life.
sample_bolinao: Say aksidinti syaymakamatisa main byay.
sample_english: Accidents can causes death of something that has life.

meaning_english: The place or spot where a person died.
sample_bolinao: Itaw sacrosssa Kalbaryo anakamatyanni Jesus.
sample_english: It was there on the cross at Calvary that Jesus died.

meaning_english: To be able to forcefully open the eyes.
Staring vacantly without attention or understanding.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket nakamulagat ya sa rarem baybay mataman nin kasan antipara na.
sample_english: Juan is able to be under the water of the seashore with eyes open without goggles.

meaning_english: To happen to be staring at something without comprehension.
sample_bolinao: Si'kamon kapada kon Israelita, ambale' nin naka'ngap kamon tuloy tan ambale' nin nakamulite' kamo komi?
sample_english: You my fellow Israelites, why are you so surprised/amazed and why are you staring at us ?

meaning_english: To do as the world.
sample_bolinao: O' tutuo a mas masirib saray makamundo dyan saray makaDios.
sample_english: Yes, it is true that those who are worldly are more cunning than those who are for/pro God.

meaning_english: To happen to scowl..
sample_bolinao: Nakamurngotpirmi a rupa na.
sample_english: Her face always has a scowl on it.

meaning_english: To ride on a motor boat or motorcycle.
sample_bolinao: Main nin tawonakamutorket kinalap nako.
sample_english: There was a man who happened to beboatingand he got me.

meaning_english: Acceptable, that which is fitting and proper for a situation.
sample_bolinao: Say pangrarayo sa Dios syaymakana'nin gawa' nan sayay tawo.
sample_english: To praise God is what a personoughtto do.

meaning_english: To be able to be dropped.
For the sky to be cloudless.
sample_bolinao: No makanarang yay langit, maray'ep yay tyimpo.
sample_english: If the sky is cloudless the weather is cold.

meaning_english: To be lockable.
sample_bolinao: Iyator moy alahas mo sa makandadwan nin aparador ta pigaw nin kai matakaw.
sample_english: Keep your jewelry in the lockable cabinet so that they cannot be stolen.

meaning_english: To drop the jaw and open the mouth involuntarily.
sample_bolinao: Nakangangayan manrumnge' sa kanta ta sabtan anda'.
sample_english: Hedropped his jawas he listened to the song for it was tremendously beautiful.

meaning_english: To be able to remove a tooth either by force or overtime such as with candy.
sample_bolinao: Makangibel nin ngipen no mi'sa a kipuniti konran maksaw a taso.
sample_english: A boxing opponent can sometimes knock out a tooth with strong punches.

meaning_english: To be unresponsive to directions given by someone but rather just do what one wants.
sample_bolinao: Nanabo' yay anak nin makanitkit.
sample_english: The child that was being rebellious fell.

meaning_english: For fruit to be full of hairlike fibers.
To be able to wear something away.
To happen to come from a particular source.
Happened to be extended out straight..
sample_bolinao: Makapa'nat tamo nin gurot no ma'lek.
sample_english: We can be flat on our back when we are asleep.

meaning_english: To be able to make something light headed.
sample_bolinao: Makapa'wer a angot nin bangar no gumurak ana.
sample_english: The smell of the wild almond tree when it is flowering can cause lightheadedness.

meaning_english: To be able to benefit someone with good.
sample_bolinao: Makapaabig sa byay ko no paakay akon maong sa maistra ko.
sample_english: If I am taught well by my teacher it is able to benefit my life.

meaning_english: Something that causes or brings worry.
sample_bolinao: Makapaaburidoa gira sa Kuwait.
sample_english: The war in Kuwait causesworry.

meaning_english: Anything that makes somebody cry or is moved to tears.
sample_bolinao: Makapaakisyay isturyan no pa'no ya nin nakapag'adal sa kulihyo si Michael.
sample_english: The story on how Michael was able to go to college is moving.

meaning_english: To able to bring about progress.
sample_bolinao: Imbis nin nakapaed ti kumon sa pakaipatanda' nan Mabistan Patanda' maipa'ka' kona ni Jesu-Cristo, ket mas nakapaaligwas ana edet.
sample_english: Instead of it possibly being a hindrance to the proclaiming of the Good News concerning Jesus Christ, it has certainly brought much more progress.

meaning_english: To be able to make someone efficient or quick at accomplishing something.
sample_bolinao: No pirmi nin mamasa nin libro ket makapaalisto nin mag'adal.
sample_english: If one is always reading books, studying is a breeze.

meaning_english: To be able to have someone healed.
sample_bolinao: Sin sayay awro anaet, mampangyakay ya si Jesus tan iti kona a pakayadi' nan Dios a makapaanda' yan main nin masakit.
sample_english: Again on another day, Jesus was teaching and in him was the power of God' to heal the sick.

meaning_english: To be unwilling or to reject something.
To happen to be caused to sob emotionally.
sample_bolinao: Makapaangak nin a'nak a panutil ran nag'in kaaway ra.
sample_english: The teasing that came from their opponents caused the children to sob.

meaning_english: Something bringing about promptness or quickness or making or doing something faster.
sample_bolinao: Makapaapura nin mayadi' a trabaho a makina.
sample_english: Machines speeds things up for completing a jobs.

meaning_english: Winsome, charming, attractive, pleasing.
sample_bolinao: Makapaayatyan talagan anak si Bonita.
sample_english: Bonita is really acharmingchild.

meaning_english: To able to be made sad.
sample_bolinao: Sin sinurat nayayti ni Pablo say kapapa'sar sa dupong ran mammemper ket makapabereng.
sample_english: When Pablo wrote this, the situation of the assembly of believers was saddening.

meaning_english: To be able to make something nice and beautiful.
Anything that makes one hungry.
sample_bolinao: Makapabitila makaangot mabistan luto'.
sample_english: It's makes one hungry to smell a sweet savor of recipe.

meaning_english: To be intoxicating.
sample_bolinao: Matkap a kai yaynaod nin minom nin arak o animan nin makapabok.
sample_english: It must be that he indeed would not drink wine or anything intoxicating.

meaning_english: To be able to satisfy a hunger.
sample_bolinao: Tegnan moy pananaliw nin ma'kan nin kai nin makapabsoy.
sample_english: Stop the buying of food that is not able to satisfy.

meaning_english: To able to refresh or enliven something.
sample_bolinao: Saray mangkasida', say pakaangot ra sa pangingipatanda' mi ket mabang'et nin makapati ta miugot sara sa duka' a panganggawan; saray mangkaisalba anamaet, say pakaangot ra sa pangingipatanda' mi ket mabanglon makapabyay bana' ta maika' sara sa mabistan byay a iti konan Dios.
sample_english: Those who are being destroyed, their smelling of our proclamation is a deadly nasty smell since they are going home to a bad end; those who are being saved on the other hand, their smelling of our proclamation is a refreshing fragrance since they will be taken to beautiful life here in God.

meaning_english: To be made gun-shy or reluctant to be involved.
sample_bolinao: Inawro-awro a piaaway ran mibubsat kanya' makapadara' ana.
sample_english: The siblings are fighting day in and day out and so it cause people to be reluctant.

meaning_english: To be able to have something darkened.
sample_bolinao: Makapadedlem yay kurtina nin nikwa mo iti sa kwarto.
sample_english: The curtain that you put in the room is able to darken it.

meaning_english: To be able to see just a little.
sample_bolinao: Mabulag ka nin kai ka gapo yapo' nin makapadi'rap.
sample_english: You will become blind that you totally could not see even just a little for a while.

meaning_english: To be able to bring shame on someone to face others.
sample_bolinao: Makapading'eya tawon matamlad.
sample_english: A lazy person causesshame.

meaning_english: To be able to be ignited.
sample_bolinao: Matkap a bara'mo kamon saray ualila' nin nakasili tan nakapadta a lampadawan nin.
sample_english: It is necessary that you are like those servants who have changed their clothes and have lit the lamps.

meaning_english: To be able to cause cruel torment.
sample_bolinao: Sin nu'nan panaon say pungso ket makapaduksa', bale' sawanin no kalyen ma say laman na ket anag.
sample_english: In the early times the dirt mounds were terrifying bur now if you dig it up it contains termites.

meaning_english: Able to hinder, stop or prevent.
sample_bolinao: Imbis nin nakapaed ti kumon sa pakaipatanda' nan Mabistan Patanda' maipa'ka' kona ni Jesu-Cristo, ket mas nakapaaligwas ana edet.
sample_english: Instead of it possibly being a hindrance to the proclaiming of the Good News concerning Jesus Christ, it has certainly brought much more progress.

meaning_english: To be able to speak fluently.
sample_bolinao: Matarusan kon buga', bale' kai konmakapag'irgo.
sample_english: I can understand a little, but I do not know how tospeak.

meaning_english: To be able to get work.
sample_bolinao: Matkap abir pa'nomakapag'ubrako.
sample_english: No matter how, I need tofind work.

meaning_english: Tedious, tiresome, exhausting.
sample_bolinao: Makapagalti sa mambayo.
sample_english: It istediousto pound rice.

meaning_english: Able to repent, able to go through the process of relenting from something.
sample_bolinao: Nomakapagbabawi'ka sa kasalanan mo mailigyas ka sa patitin kasan anggawan.
sample_english: If you areableto repent from your sin you will be saved from eternal death.

meaning_english: To be able to live in a certain manner.
sample_bolinao: Wanin ta, bana' sa pakayadi' na ni Jesus ta Dios ya, nibi nayna kontamo a sarba nin matkap tamo ta pigaw nin mabyay atamo tan makapagkabyay atamo nin makapaririket nin tuloy kona.
sample_english: That's the case since, because of the power of Jesus since he is God, he has given to us all that we need in order that we might live and be able to live in a manner that is able to make him very joyful.

meaning_english: To able to sell.
sample_bolinao: Ket si si'numan a kai mamarkawan nin ngaran nan u'nan makapali'mon ayep o say numiro nin ngaran na, kai ya makapaglako' o makapanaliw.
sample_english: And then whoever it was that was not marked with the name of the first terrifying animal or the number of his name, he was not able to sell or buy.

meaning_english: To be boasting about something..
sample_bolinao: Si Dan ket makapagmamalaki ya sa pamilya na ta makwarta ya.
sample_english: Dan boasts to his family since he has money.

meaning_english: To able to do miracles.
sample_bolinao: Kai para a pinaanda' misaray nasrepan nin duka' a uispirito tan nakapagmilagro kami et sa pakayadi' mo?
sample_english: Have we not healed those who had been entered by evil spirits and were further able to do miracles in your power?

meaning_english: To able to strengthen something.
sample_bolinao: Makapagsen nin nakem tamo a bibilin ran maistra tamo.
sample_english: The instruction of our teachers strengthens who we are.

meaning_english: To able to serve.
sample_bolinao: Makapagsirbi ya nin tuloy taon a kapitan nan baranggay.
sample_english: The baranggay captain is able to serve for three years.

meaning_english: Able to do work.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya makapagtrabaho ta main masakit na.
sample_english: He is not able to work since he has a sickness.

meaning_english: To betray.
sample_bolinao: Kasanmakapagtraidorkonan Dios ta tanda' na nga'min a duka' a kaisipan.
sample_english: Nobodycan betrayGod because He knows everything in all thoughts and deeds.

meaning_english: To be able to cause havoc.
To able to pretend something.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' nin andi' atamo nin maka'ngap no pati saray tutawon mantumulok kona ni Satanas ket makapagwadi'-wadi' sara nin mangingitandudo' nin no ani a mapteg.
sample_english: Therefore we should not be surprised if even those people who obey Satanas it is that they are able to pretend to be upholders of what is righteous.

meaning_english: To cause difficulty.
sample_bolinao: Makapaidap nin mangwa' no kasan agamiren nin matkap.
sample_english: It is difficult to do something if the needed tool is not there.

meaning_english: To be able to rest.
sample_bolinao: Mako ako sa kwarto ko pigaw makapainawa ako.
sample_english: I go to my room so I can get some rest.

meaning_english: To be able to make someone laugh, humorous.
sample_bolinao: Makapaka'lisa bakas nan mamaka'lis.
sample_english: The appearance of the clown is humorous.

meaning_english: To bring amazement to someone.
sample_bolinao: Saya amakapaka'ngapkongko a no mayin saray bawbituen, kai manabo'.
sample_english: One thing that is amazing to me is why it is that the stars don't fall.

meaning_english: To be able to cause weakness.
sample_bolinao: Makapakapoya pirmin mangna' nin karnin baboy.
sample_english: Always eating pork makes one fell weak.

meaning_english: To be able to make nonexistent.
sample_bolinao: Makapakasa nin gana a karni anan karni a ipangan.
sample_english: If it is meat upon meat that is being feed, the enthusiasm to eat is lost.

meaning_english: To have the opportunity to go or journey someplace.
sample_bolinao: Makapakoka dilap sa Anda?
sample_english: Canyougoto Anda tomorrow?

meaning_english: To be able to get something dry.
sample_bolinao: Lelem pinirmi kanya' kai ko makapakrang pini'pian.
sample_english: It is always overcast and misty so I am not able to get the laundry dry.

meaning_english: To be able to strengthen something.
sample_bolinao: Makapangirgo yan makapaksaw nakem si Juan konran ua'nak na.
sample_english: Juan is able to speak encouraging words to his children.

meaning_english: To to happen to be caused to have weak muscles.
To be able to escape.
sample_bolinao: Makapal'is ya no dakpen rayan kaikap na.
sample_english: He is able to escape when his playmates would catch him.

meaning_english: To able to cast out.
sample_bolinao: Ket sayti a pupaka'kitan a magkamain konran magmatalek kongko: Makapalakwan saran uispiriton duka' yupa' sa pakayadi' ko.
sample_english: And so this are the signs that will come to be in/to those who trust in me: They are able to cast out evil spirits by means of my power.

meaning_english: To escape, to be able to run away from something.
sample_bolinao: Nakapalayoyay priso sa pamukpukan.
sample_english: The prisoner ran away from the jail.

meaning_english: Able to cause fear.
sample_bolinao: Makapali'mo anay kasaw nin bagyo sawanin nin panaon.
sample_english: The strong typhoons now in this season are firghtening.

meaning_english: To be able to cause dread or terror because of a dangerous situation.
sample_bolinao: Makapalili'nek yan kikiten a anak sa ta'gay nin istar'apel.
sample_english: It is terrifying to see a child at the top of a star-apple tree.

meaning_english: For sour items or certain sounds to cause pain at the tooth edge.
sample_bolinao: Makapalinew a mangan nin pirmi nin salumagi.
sample_english: Always eating tamarind can cause tooth pain.

meaning_english: Can cause error.
sample_bolinao: Makapalingo in say gawa' mo.
sample_english: That which you have had done might cause a mistake.

meaning_english: To be able to make something sturdy.
sample_bolinao: Makapama'get ngipen a sipilyo.
sample_english: A tooth brush makes teeth last.

meaning_english: To be able to harm.
sample_bolinao: Andi' moyo sara nin ikali'mo a makapangmati konan sitin lalaman bale' kai nin makapama'no konan kararwa moyo, no kai si Dios a ikali'mo moyo a syay makapangmati nin lalaman tan kararwa moyo itaw sa impyirno.
sample_english: Don't be frightened of those who are able to kill this body but are not able to harm your soul, rather fear God who is the One who is able to kill the body and your soul there in hell.

meaning_english: To able to bring good.
sample_bolinao: no kai edet, gaw'en tamoy no ani a makapamaririket tan makapamaabig konran kapada tamon mammemper ta pigaw nin mapa'get a pammemper ra.
sample_english: but rather, we are to do what is able to bring joy and good to our fellow believers in order that their faith will be made firm.

meaning_english: To able to heal someone.
sample_bolinao: , bale' kasan si'numan a makapamaanda' kona.
sample_english: , but there was no one who was able to heal her.

meaning_english: To able to give life to something.
sample_bolinao: Bale', nangyadi' taw komi ta pigaw nin maadal mi a andi' nin magpya sa lalaman mi no kai edet, kona nin Dios a makapamabyay abirno konran nati ana.
sample_english: However, that happened to us in order that we would learn not to trust in ourselves but rather in God who is able to give life even to those who are already dead.

meaning_english: To use hair ointment.
sample_bolinao: Pirmi yannakapamadaa sabot na.
sample_english: He always usepomadein his hair.

meaning_english: To be able to persecute someone.
To able to make strong.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' nin say panunumbok tamo sa ibarita' nin Gugan-gan maipa'ka' sa pangangan a makapamagsen kontamo, ta kasa anamaet nin naitulong nin sain konran saraytaw saray nanumbu-tumbok ana.
sample_english: It is not our following of what the Law says concerning eating that is able to make us strong, since there is as well no help which that brought to those that have repeatedly followed it.

meaning_english: Producer, one that produces.
sample_bolinao: Si Dios tamo' a bukod,makapamainnin animan a bagay.
sample_english: God alone is the only one who canproduceand create anything.

meaning_english: To able to reconstruct something to make it whole.
sample_bolinao: Si Jesus tamo' a makapamakanda' nin byay tamo, bana' ta iti sa intiron sangkamundwan, kasaynan si'numan nin raruma et a nibi nan Dios nin makapangisalba kontamo.
sample_english: Jesus is the only one who can make beautiful our life, because here in the entire world/universe, there is no one else whom God sent who can save us .

meaning_english: To be able to make into nothing.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' yay si magtrabaho para sa pakapapteg na, no kai edet, si sayay magmatalek kona nin Dios a sya a makapamakasa nin kasalanan ran saray sikakasalanan.
sample_english: It is not the one who works for his being made upright, but rather it is the one who trusts in God who he it is who can make to be without sin the ones who are sinful.

meaning_english: To able to make something leave.
sample_bolinao: Bale' main nin Pariseo nin itaw ket wanra, <<i uunuren ran uispiriton duka' binyan naya in nin pakayadi' kanya' nin makapamalakwan yan ispiriton duka'.
sample_english: The lord of the evil spirits has given him that power therefore he is able to make leave the evil spirits.

meaning_english: To able to criticize.
sample_bolinao: Say susarita' mo ket matkap a peteg nin kusto a kasa gapo nin makapamalaw a sayti ket abas, ta pigaw nin saray mampanguntra kontamo ket duming'ey sara ta kasan maibarita' ran maipamaduka' kontamo.
sample_english: Your your words must be truly correct that no one will be able to criticize this at all as wrong, so that those who are against us will be ashamed since no one is able to say anything evil of us.

meaning_english: To able to make someone upright.
sample_bolinao: Sa kaaandi' ran akuen yay sya a makapamapteg kumon konra a sya si Cristo, bara'mo sara nin tutawon nipadugpa' nin nisakin konan si bato.
sample_english: In their refusal to accept him who would have been able to make them upright who is Christ, it's as though they are people who have fallen flat on their face having tripped over the stone.

meaning_english: To able to bring joy.
sample_bolinao: Matkap a pirmi kamo et nin mangwa' nin maabig yupa' sa panunulong moyo sa saya tan saya, bana' ta say pangwa' moyon wanin ket pinakada'ton moyo nin makapamaririket konan Dios.
sample_english: You must always further be doing good by helping one another, because your doing like that it is like your offering/sacrifice which is able to bring joy to God.

meaning_english: To able to be saying something.
sample_bolinao: Makapamarita' yan prublima na konan amigo na.
sample_english: He is able to tell his friend his problems.

meaning_english: To able to make something return.
sample_bolinao: Makapamasubli' nin kasaw ran mitakli' a kanen tan ranom.
sample_english: Food and water brings back the strength of those that have diarrhea.

meaning_english: To able to make obey.
sample_bolinao: bale' kasan si'numan a makapamatulok konan dila' na.
sample_english: There is no one however who is able to make his tongue obedient.

meaning_english: To be able to guide someone into the right channels.
sample_bolinao: Wamoyo et a si'kamoy makapamatunong konran saray abas a pinanakem tan mangyakay konran saray kurang et a pakatanda' konan Dios.
sample_english: You further say/think that you are the ones that are able to correct through guidance those whose mind set is wrong and teach those whose knowledge of God is defective/lacking.

meaning_english: To able to give testimony.
sample_bolinao: Si'kamo nin mismo a makapamatutuo, wanin yaynamaet a Dios, no pa'no kamin nagkabyay isen komoyo nin mammemper konan Cristo.
sample_english: You yourselves can be the witnesses, likewise as well with God, of how we lived a life there among you believers in Christ.

meaning_english: To be able to give something.
sample_bolinao: Makapami yaynan kwarta si angkay ta main anan trabaho na.
sample_english: Older brother was able to be giving some money since he now has a job.

meaning_english: Able to officiate baptism.
sample_bolinao: Si Pastor Untalanmakapaminyagyayna.
sample_english: Pastor Untalan is able toofficiatebaptism.

meaning_english: To be able to forgive.
sample_bolinao: Anta si Dios tamo' nin bukod a makapamirdunan kukasalanan!
sample_english: Since it is God alone who can forgive sins?

meaning_english: To be able to be separating a relationship.
sample_bolinao: Kasa gaponmakapamisyaykontamo sa ado' nan Dios.
sample_english: Nothingcan separateus from the love of God.

meaning_english: To able to process harmony among someone.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' nin say ipamuspusan tamoynan gaw'en ket saytaw say makapamitutuno kontamo tan say makapama'get nin pammemper nin barang saya tan saya.
sample_english: Therefore what we are to strive to do is that of the harmony between us and the firming up of the faith of each and everyone.

meaning_english: To be able to arouse or inspire.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket makapamukaw yan mangka'lek nin kabali na no ipaksaw nay tunoy nan radyo na.
sample_english: If I can cook early, you and I can be eating breakfast together.

meaning_english: To be able to be having breakfasts.
sample_bolinao: Makapamuklas ata no masakbay akon makaluto'.
sample_english: If I can cook early, you and I can be eating breakfast together.

meaning_english: To be able to buy.
sample_bolinao: Ket si si'numan a kai mamarkawan nin ngaran nan u'nan makapali'mon ayep o say numiro nin ngaran na, kai ya makapaglako' o makapanaliw.
sample_english: And then whoever it was that was not marked with the name of the first terrifying animal or the number of his name, he was not able to sell or buy.

meaning_english: To able to snatch something.
sample_bolinao: O', kai sara gapo nin maisyay konan Dios, tan kasa gapo nin makapanamsam konra kongko.
sample_english: Yes, they will not at all be separated from God, and there are none at all that are able to grab them from me.

meaning_english: To be able to remember something.
sample_bolinao: Agawid ya tamo' no makapanemtem ya.
sample_english: He only goes home when he happens to think about it.

meaning_english: To be able to be taking charge of an operation.
sample_bolinao: Makapanga'get yan gulpin nigusyo si Juan ta di-adal yan manidyer.
sample_english: Juan is able to be in charge of many businesses since he is educated is a manager.

meaning_english: To able to open something.
sample_bolinao: No abryan koyay purta ta pigaw nin makasrep yay sayay tawo sa pag'adian ko, kasa gapon si'numan a makapangisada', tan no main nin sadaan ko sa rikor, kasa gapon si'numan nin makapangabri.
sample_english: If I open the door in order that a person can enter my kingdom, there is no one at all that is able to shut it, and if there is someone I shut outside, there is no one at all that is able to open.

meaning_english: To be able to eat something in general.
sample_bolinao: Makapangan yan abaw no mataway a kuna'.
sample_english: He is able to eat a lot if the fish is tasty.

meaning_english: Able to eat supper.
sample_bolinao: Kai kayna anaodnin makapangapon, kai ka et nin makapisili.
sample_english: You indeed will not be able to eat supper, since you have not yet changed your clothes.

meaning_english: To be able to make the hair on the skin to stand up.
sample_bolinao: No magmaniho yan kutsi si Sam ket makapangarimbutong ta paspas yan maong.
sample_english: If Sam is driving the car, it'll make your hair stand on end for it is really fast.

meaning_english: To be able to solemnize marriage.
sample_bolinao: Makapangasalyay padi'.
sample_english: The priest cansolemnizemarriage.

meaning_english: Able to persuade.
sample_bolinao: Makapangayatyan tawo.
sample_english: He's a persuasive person.

meaning_english: To able to communicate something.

meaning_english: To be able to observe something.

meaning_english: To be taken captive by someone

meaning_english: Chinese people.

meaning_english: To be convinced of something.

sample_english: Every Day of Worship to God, Pablo would go to the synagogue to join the discussion there because it was his purpose to convince them all to believe in Christ those their fellowJewsand those who are nonJews.

meaning_english: To be competitive.
For something to be completed.

sample_english: He now rested since his work was now complete.

meaning_english: Bought something.

meaning_english: Pointed and prominent nose.

sample_english: The people that are for him, they enter into his joy but those that aren't they are condemned.

sample_english: Mario got a guilty conscience when he stole the bell and so he has now returned it.

meaning_english: To consent to or sanction something.

sample_english: But as for Pablo, he could not go along with these members for he had given the believers a warning.

meaning_english: To be consumed.

meaning_english: To be content.

meaning_english: To be able to oppose something.

sample_english: Like one who serves as God's soldier, use all of what serves as armament which God is giving you in order that you might oppose the tactics of the Dimunyo.

meaning_english: To be in control.

meaning_english: For something to be copied.

meaning_english: To be able to be deducted from something.

meaning_english: For a road to be curvy.

meaning_english: For something to be grated.

meaning_english: For something to have been dug out by hand.

sample_english: Give the toy to the child so that hiscrying will be appeased.

meaning_english: For a part of a whole to be gashed or ripped open often with a a part flapping loose .

meaning_english: For something to be put in or on something in particular.

meaning_english: For something to be snared.

sample_bolinao: Sa susuyot nin parti nan sitin surat, main anamaet nin maadal tamo maipa'ka' sa nibi nan Dios konran mammemper ta pigaw nin malabanan ray tutaktika na ni Satanas.
sample_english: At the end part of this letter, there is also something we can learn regarding what God has given to the believers in order that they will be able to oppose the tactics of Satanas.

meaning_english: To be in greater amount than is needed, excessive.

meaning_english: To be excessive or elaborate.

meaning_english: To be young.

sample_english: He gave this in order that we would participate in what makes him him and we would leave behind the evil life styles that come from our desires which can quickly destroy us here in this world.

sample_english: A lot of money/big amounts are what the rich people dropped.

sample_english: He woke them up and said to Pedro, <<You're not at all able to support me without falling asleep even for one hour?>>

meaning_english: A dull sound from something falling, a thud on the roof, a sound of "og".

meaning_english: To have something brought down.

meaning_english: Happen to be made drunk.

meaning_english: To demonstrate a favorable disposition toward someone.

meaning_english: To be favored with something.

meaning_english: For something to have been made to be easily ignited.

meaning_english: To be exposed.

meaning_english: To balance out something that was done.
sample_bolinao: Mag'adal nin maong pigaw mapadmangan a sakripisyo ran mangatua.
sample_english: Study well so as to reciprocate the sacrifice of the parents.

meaning_english: To happen to be forced someplace being carried by the movement of something else such as wind currents or tide.
sample_bolinao: Gulpin mapadpad nin Hapon sa Bolinao.
sample_english: There are many Japanese that have drifted into Bolinao.

meaning_english: To happen to be made evil or ugly.
sample_bolinao: Mapaduka' a iskol no kai maringgas a libed-libed na.
sample_english: The school will be an eye-sore if it's environment is not cleaned up.

meaning_english: To have had an affliction placed on a person, sometimes because of spirits.
sample_bolinao: Si Sam ket mapaduksaan ya no gulwen nay bali nin anag.
sample_english: Sam will undergo torture if he disturbs the termite house.

meaning_english: Made to suffer hardship, pain, trials.
sample_bolinao: Bale' sapa kumon ta no mapadya'dya' kamo ket ambo' nin bana' ta nangwa' kamo nin duka'.
sample_english: But it should be that if you are made to suffer it is not because you have done evil.

meaning_english: For a goal to be prevented or hindered.
sample_bolinao: Maidap mapaed a rabay ran maistra no main ibaki' ran mangwa' nin sayay gawa'.
sample_english: It is difficult to interfere with what the teachers want when they send someone to do a certain thing.

meaning_english: For the voice to break up and be hoarse and rough.
sample_bolinao: Mapaek ya si Clara no mi'sa ta pirmi yan mangansyon.
sample_english: Occasionally Clara's voice breaks since she is always singing.

meaning_english: To be settled down or digested.
To have happened to have someone educated.
sample_bolinao: Mataman no kasan inadal ra ni Carlos tan Clarita, napag'adal rasara nga'min sa kulihyo a a'nak ra.
sample_english: Even though Carlos and Clarita are not educated they have sent all of their children to college.

meaning_english: To talking together.
sample_bolinao: Saray matua ran nubya tan nubyo ket mapag'iirgo sara ta pigaw nin mipapagketan sara no ka'no a kasal ran a'nak ra.
sample_english: The parents of the bride and the groom are talking in order that they will agree on when is the wedding of their children.

meaning_english: To process of speaking about something to someone.
sample_bolinao: Mapag'iirgwan moyo a maipa'ka' sa sayti tan pipanemtem moyo anamaet.
sample_english: You are speaking about these to others and you are continually thinking about them as well.

meaning_english: To be able to make something become something.
sample_bolinao: Mapag'in yan matib'ey a ranom no ika' ya sa ripridyiritor.
sample_english: Water can become hard when it is put in a refrigerator (freezer).

meaning_english: To come to be able to speak.
sample_bolinao: Mapag'irgo kwa a tistigos sa krimin ta kai yayna nin mali'mo.
sample_english: I am able to converse with the witness to the crime since he is not afraid.

meaning_english: To speak against something especially when angry.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a napag'irgwan mi maipa'ka' sa kapapa'sar ran tutawo sa Bolinao.
sample_english: We discussed many things regarding the situation of the people of Bolinao.

meaning_english: To governed by something.
sample_bolinao: Anaod kai kamoyna nin mapag'urayan nin kasalanan ta ambo' anay panunumbok moyo sa Gugan-gan a puon nin pakaisalba moyo no kai edet, say kamaungan na nin Dios komoyo.
sample_english: Indeed you are no longer governed by sin since it is not your following of the Law that is the cause/source of your salvation but rather, the goodness of God to you.

meaning_english: To be concerned about something for which you are responsible.
sample_bolinao: Mapagaya sa pananarita' na.
sample_english: She iscarefulabout how she says something.

meaning_english: For one's physical energy to be exhausted.
sample_bolinao: Sinmapagalyayna, tinumgen ya sa sirong kayo.
sample_english: When he was weary, he stopped under a tree.

meaning_english: To be given respect.
sample_bolinao: Impurtanti a prisinsya ni Mayor sa lumpos ket mapagalang sa sarban tawo.
sample_english: The Mayors presentation of his thoughts at the feast is important and so all the people are respecting it.

meaning_english: To be giving someone honor.
sample_bolinao: Mapagalangan a maistra no ibarita' tamon maabig a buklas madam.
sample_english: We honor our teacher when we say good morning madam.

meaning_english: To be handed something over to someone.
To be hoarse or have lost one's voice.
sample_bolinao: Mapagas saray raruman gumuer.
sample_english: Some of those who get a cold lose their voice.

meaning_english: To happen to be able to repent.
sample_bolinao: ...ta kasayna gapon magwa' nin rimidyo ta pigaw nin mapagbabawi' sara anamanaet a saray wanti e:.
sample_english: ...since there is no remedy at all that can be made in order that those who are like this here would happen to repent again:.

meaning_english: To be able to control.
sample_bolinao: Matkap a igagalang ya, maong yan mangisip tan mapagdangka' ya sa lalaman nan diri.
sample_english: He must be respectable, be sensible and able to restrain himself.

meaning_english: To be doubting.
To doubt.
sample_bolinao: Magdwadwaya no mika' ya sa keen udino kai.
sample_english: He isdoubtfulwhether he can go or not.

meaning_english: To be able to graduate from a program.
sample_bolinao: Marere'ya ta sali' no kai ya mapaggradwit saHigh School.
sample_english: He is depressed since perchance he will not be able to graduate from High School.

meaning_english: For the edge of something in the water to be visible, especially of a shell.
sample_bolinao: Mapagiriw a talaba no maka'ti tan no ambo' nin mapres a panaon.
sample_english: The top edge of the oysters can be seen when it is low tide and it is not a windy time.

meaning_english: To be condemned as having a sin or fault.
sample_bolinao: Si Dan nin ama a mapagkasalanan no ambale' nin maidap a byay ran pamilya ta masugal yan maong.
sample_english: Dan the father is the one that is at fault when there is a reason the family is having difficulties in life since he is into gambling.

meaning_english: For specific items to be sold.
sample_bolinao: Limay taon naynan mangngarusip ni Juan ket gulpi a mapaglakuan na.
sample_english: Juan has been a sea grape harvester for five years now and so it has been massive amounts that he has sold.

meaning_english: To be able to be trusted and relied on.
sample_bolinao: Mapagmatalkan a maistra ko maipa'ka' sa prublima ko nin pirsunal.
sample_english: I entrusted the things concerning my personal problem to my teacher

meaning_english: To be dislodged or knocked off from someplace.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a mapagpag nin bungan lumboy no mapres.
sample_english: There are a lot of black plums that are dislodged when it is breezy.

meaning_english: To be dependable, trustworthy.
sample_bolinao: Syay tinudo' ran trisuriro sa klasi ra tamapagpyawanya sa panga'get kwarta.
sample_english: He was chosen as their class treasurer because he istrustworthyin holding money.

meaning_english: To be strengthen something.
sample_bolinao: Main nin kakanaan nin pangimarmaw tamon ihirsisyuwen a lalaman tamo ta mapagsen ya.
sample_english: There is value in disciplining our bodies with exercise to strengthen them.

meaning_english: To be serving someone.
sample_bolinao: Rabay kosara nin mapagsirbyan a mangatua ko no matuntawo sarayna.
sample_english: I prefer that those who will be serving my parents will be older people.

meaning_english: To be trustworthy.
To happen to have a temporary place to stay.

sample_english: When I study in Alaminos a rent a house to stay at.

meaning_english: To have been fully satisfied, gratified or pleased.

sample_english: The one to whom I want to please, it is God.

meaning_english: To have been made to do something.
sample_bolinao: Mapagwa' na ni Manny sa sayay taon nin magkamain yan palasyo ta bilyunaryo ya.
sample_english: Manny was able to have a palace made in one year since he is a billionaire.

meaning_english: To have someone sent away.

sample_english: I will follow my older sibling when I am able to send the visitors away.

meaning_english: To be caused to be distressed or persecuted by something.

sample_english: Ride the bicycle so that you will not be troubled by walking when your destination is far off.

meaning_english: To have been sliced into thin slices.
sample_bolinao: Mapaimpis nan kutsilyo a tinapay nin makubpal.
sample_english: He can cut thinner slices of the thick bread with the knife.

meaning_english: To be merciful.
sample_bolinao: Tawo yanmapainga'do.
sample_english: He is amercifulperson.

meaning_english: To be merciful, loving, and concerned for others.
sample_bolinao: Mapainganga'do yay Dios.
sample_english: God ismerciful.

meaning_english: To be bitter.
sample_bolinao: Mapaita taway.
sample_english: The taste is bitter.

meaning_english: Able to have caused someone to be amazed.
sample_bolinao: Napaka'ngap na sira yupa' sa panalumangka na.
sample_english: He amazed them by his divination.

meaning_english: For something to be negated or rejected.

sample_english: He is rejecting a debt/loan for you since it has no visible support.

meaning_english: For something to be fixed, put in order.
sample_bolinao: Mapakanda' ran mikaniko a nasida' nin mutursiklo.
sample_english: The mechanics repaired the damaged motorcycle.

meaning_english: To be overcome with weakness.
sample_bolinao: Balda nin lalaman ko a mamakapoy nin kaingaran ko.
sample_english: The feeling of weakness that has overcome me makes me feel exhausted.

meaning_english: To have been able to make something go to a lower position.

sample_english: You must be able to get a monkey down in order to catch him.

meaning_english: To be made firm or intense.

meaning_english: To be in a state of being corrected.
To escape or keep away from a difficulty.

meaning_english: To be shown clearly.

meaning_english: To be caught up in something and letting it get out of control.
sample_bolinao: No mapala'wanan mo a minom sali' kai ka makaawid komoyo.
sample_english: If you get caught up in drinking, perhaps you will not be able to get home.

meaning_english: To pass by someplace with some motivation.

sample_english: Afterseveral weeks passed, he returned here.

meaning_english: To be over doing something.
sample_bolinao: Mapalabasan no mi'sa a pag'insayo nin baskitbol kanya' sumakit a lalaman.
sample_english: Sometimes demonstrating the plays of basketball are over-stressing and so the body hurts.

meaning_english: To be driven out from someplace.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a duka' a ispirito anapalakwankonran tawtawo.
sample_english: Many evil spirits werecastout of the people.

meaning_english: For clothing to be ironed.
sample_bolinao: Nagisa'-gisa' yay aysing ko nin nako sa bayli ta kai koya naplantsa.
sample_english: My dress was all wrinkled going to the dance since I had not ironed it.

meaning_english: For something to be clear and understandable.
sample_bolinao: Mapalawayyay awro.
sample_english: The sun isbright.

meaning_english: To be shined upon or enlightened.
sample_bolinao: No main nin animan a itaw sa dedlem ket mapalawayan ya, ma'kit a tutuon bakas na.
sample_english: If there is anything that is in the darkness and then it is illuminated, its true form is able to be seen.

meaning_english: To be able to operate or function.
sample_bolinao: Adayo' anay mapalayo nan mutor mo abir saya litro tamo' a gasulina mo.
sample_english: Your motorcycle can operate for a long distance even if you have just one liter of gasoline.

meaning_english: To be making a blasting sound.
sample_bolinao: No ba'yon taon ket mapalbang na ni Juan a sayan pakiti nin labintador.
sample_english: At New Years, Juan sets off a packet of fireworks.

meaning_english: To be sunk or submerged under water by something.

sample_english: The American marines have sunk a large Japanese warship.

meaning_english: To be a thick, pourable liquid and usually sticky.

sample_english: Your blood isthick.

meaning_english: To be obstructed or clogged.
meaning_filipino: Barado; may bara; nasarhan; may nakabara.
sample_bolinao: Napaletpetanyay tubo.
sample_english: The pipe isclogged.

meaning_english: For something to be surrounded by something.

sample_english: Pedro's house is surrounded with a fence.

meaning_english: To be sliced thinly horizontally.
To be healed.
sample_bolinao: Edet, bana' sa nikasugat na, napalimpyo kamo.
sample_english: Consequently, because of his being wounded, you have been healed.

meaning_english: To have something be in the position of outside of an enclosure.
sample_bolinao: Sin napaliwa' sarayna nga'min a itaw, linmuob ya si Jesus sa kwarton kami'nan nan anak.
sample_english: When all who were there had been put out, Jesus went into the room where the child stayed.

meaning_english: To convince a person into something with flattering words.
sample_bolinao: Napalmingako sa mabistan pananarita' na.
sample_english: I wasconvincewith hisflattering words.

meaning_english: The doing of something in a slow, deliberate and gentle manner.
sample_bolinao: Mapalna' a kauuli' na sa aydan.
sample_english: His climb up the stairs was slow and careful.

meaning_english: To be snapped or hit with an elastic object.

sample_english: All that is snapped by a player, that becomes his.

meaning_english: To have a rash from sap or juice.

sample_english: The mouth gets a blister when the sap of these fruit gets on it.

meaning_english: For something to have been done excessively.
To be overcooked.
sample_bolinao: Mapalumo yay matib'ey a tinapay no isawsaw ya sa ma'mot nin kapi.
sample_english: Hard bread is softened when it is dunked in hot coffee.

meaning_english: To have been brought in from something.
Barbaric, referring mainly to dangers as a result of people such as robbers or killers.
sample_bolinao: Mapalyonyay lugar ta abaw anay napati-pati radtaw.
sample_english: That place is barbaric for there have been many that they have killed there.

meaning_english: To make available or come into being.
sample_bolinao: Bana' ta wanin, si nipangako' nan Dios nin mapamain no magmatalek kona ni Jesu-Cristo ket konran si'numan a mamper yayti nin mapamain.
sample_english: Because of that, what God promised to be come to be when one trusts in Jesus Cristo, to anyone who believes this it will come to be.

meaning_english: Generosity, the attitude of giving.
sample_bolinao: Mapamami a gawa' ni Mayor kanya' manalo ya sa iliksyon.
sample_english: The Mayor's actions were generous and so he won the election.

meaning_english: To be forbearing and patient.
To be ignoring something.

sample_english: Juan is ignoring his body and so he is always getting sick.

meaning_english: To be generous and giving things to other people.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket mapamayabor ya konran kabaranggayan na nangibwat sin milyunaryo ya.
sample_english: Juan has been generous to his baranggay mates from the time he was a millionaire.

meaning_english: To be generous, a giving person.
sample_bolinao: No mapami atamo, si Dios paadilantawen nay byay tamo.
sample_english: If we are givers, God will prosper our lives.

meaning_english: Wasteful, not thrifty.
sample_bolinao: Mapammirdi sara nin ranom a raruman a'nak.
sample_english: Some children are wasteful of water.

meaning_english: To make someone believe something.

sample_english: Juan is really sly; he was able to make his teacher believe his alibi.

meaning_english: To happen to spear something.
sample_bolinao: Mapana' kwa a alakin kuna' sa baybay.
sample_english: The big fish in the ocean shallows, I spear.

meaning_english: To have been struck by a fishing spear or arrow.

meaning_english: To have happened to have gone through the process of winning something.

meaning_english: To be striving or hurrying to meet a time related goal.

meaning_english: To be hospitable.

meaning_english: To be perceptive and tactful in a situation.

meaning_english: To be remembering or recalling something.

meaning_english: To be in a state of being angry or annoyed.

meaning_english: To have a prominent jaw.

sample_english: Sam has a prominent jaw since face is long.

meaning_english: To be reaching out in sympathy.

meaning_english: To studying of something.

sample_english: Their speech is flowery and they are flattering and so they are just deceiving the people who are not able to think things through.

meaning_english: To be showing love.
sample_bolinao: Mapangado' yay ama ni Pedro dyan si ina na.
sample_english: Pedro's father is more loving that his mother.

meaning_english: For a person to bear difficult situations and come through.

sample_english: Appelation-Binay, she is forbearing in enduring hardships and exhaustion in working/her work as a Barangay Health Worker.

meaning_english: With large jaws, one who has big jaw bones.

sample_english: There arepeoplewho say that a person who has a big lower jaw is ferocious and it is evil that he is about.

meaning_english: Opportunistic.

sample_english: Simon is anopportunist.

meaning_english: Happened to be named.

meaning_english: To be attending to someones needs.

To keep something someplace.

sample_english: What I wonder would be the good thing for me to do for I have no more place to keep the rest of my harvest?

meaning_english: Kind.

sample_english: You are veryloyalto the school.

meaning_english: That from which something is coming.
meaning_filipino: Saan galing; Asal; pinanggalingan; pinagmulan; pamulaan; pinagbuhatan.

meaning_english: To be being observant of something.

meaning_english: To be merciful, sympathetic with and compassionate.

sample_english: God ismerciful.

meaning_english: To be in thought about something.

sample_english: Because of your story you have made a person think bad things.

meaning_english: For something to be made black.

sample_english: The kettle gets black when I heat it with wood that is flaming up..

meaning_english: Enduring.
sample_bolinao: Mapangawa'nan ka, mapangitpel ka tan mapangabot ka.

meaning_english: To be giving love.
sample_bolinao: ituluy-tuloy ray magmatalek kona, tan mapanglabi sara sa kapada ran tawo, tan magkabyay saran manepeg sa adapan nan Dios nin mapagdangka' sara.
sample_english: them if they continue trusting in him, and they are loving to their fellowmen, and they live properly in the presence of God with self control.

meaning_english: To encourage someone.

sample_english: The apostles called him Barnabas which this name means One who encourages.

meaning_english: To act scornfully doing things that degrade someone.

sample_english: Do not bescornfulof people older than you.

meaning_english: To make to hear.

sample_english: Even the deaf he can cause them to be able to hear and as for the mute he can cause them to be able to speak.

meaning_english: To happen to take the anger against something out on something else.

sample_english: Don't go near him when he is angry for he might take it out on you.

meaning_english: Sympathetic in one's actions.

meaning_english: To honor someone through obedience.

sample_english: Through the help of the Spirit of God, their faith grew stronger and they continued to live a life of honoring obedience to God.

meaning_english: To happen to make something happen or occur.

sample_english: There is nothing that you would not be able to make happen.

meaning_english: To be destructive of things.

sample_english: They do not want Mars to be a leader since he has been destroyed by other politicians.

meaning_english: To be in the process of gathering things.
To be generous with an open hand.
sample_bolinao: Mapanudolyan tawo.
sample_english: He/She is agenerousperson.

meaning_english: To be compliant or submissive to authority, law or instructions.

sample_english: Juan is compliant with the regulations of his school.

meaning_english: To have been made agreeable to something and say yes.
To last long along time since it is durable.

sample_english: Your dress is really durable it's six years since you bought it and is not yet torn.

meaning_english: A flat or nearly flat roof or covering.
