sample_english: Juan's house has a nearly flat roof.

meaning_english: To have something clarified.
sample_bolinao: Saka-sakalakoy ita'way ran i'bat nin tutawo ket bana' sa kyawkyawan, kai na nin mapapalawayan nin Kumander no anin talagay nangyadi', kanya' nin nigan-gan na konran sundalo' na nin i'ras raya si Pablo sa kampo.
sample_english: The people's responses which they shouted were different from each other and because of the noise/uproar, the Commander could not figure out what really had happened, that's why he ordered his soldiers to take Pablo to the barracks.

meaning_english: To be able to lure something to it.
To be playing a deceitful role in order to gain an advantage.
sample_bolinao: Mapapilya kanya' kai raya tepren.
sample_english: He is deceitful that's why they don't believe him.

meaning_english: For something to be dropped down.
To have been made upright, perfect or righteous.
sample_bolinao: Ma'kit moyo edet a si sayay tawo ket mapapteg ya bana' sa gawa' na tan ambo' tamo' bana' sa pammemper na.
sample_english: You do see then that a man is made righteous because of his deeds and not only because of his belief.

meaning_english: To be stopped.
To be desirous.
sample_bolinao: Ayaten yay si'numan maparabay, lalo no sa sayay babayi a mangari-gari sa sayay lalakin mainan ta panggepen nayan tukswen.
sample_english: Anyone that is desirous of something is enticed, especially by a woman who works like an ant on well to do man since she is intentionally tempting him.

meaning_english: To be paralyzed.
sample_bolinao: Naparalitiko ya ket mangkapaidap yan maong.
sample_english: He is paralyzed and undergoing severe hardship.

meaning_english: Something that is easily seen, visible.
sample_bolinao: Si munuminto itya samaparanga lugar.
sample_english: The monument is in avisibleplace.

meaning_english: For something to feel coarse or gritty.
sample_bolinao: Maparasapas a raruman pinintawan ni Mario sa mutor sa baybay.
sample_english: Some of what Mario painted on the boat at the beach feels gritty.

meaning_english: To be overcome by something, usually unexpectedly.
sample_bolinao: Manyimpo ako yapo' ba'yo ko mibwat a mako sa taaw manaba' sali' maparat'anan akon bigra' nin bagyo.
sample_english: I will first take the opportunity to observe the weather before I leave to go to the ocean to pen up fish if perchance I might be suddenly overcome by a storm.

meaning_english: To cool something.
sample_bolinao: Ibaki' ma pa si Lazaro nin ilbet nayay tamudo' na sa ranom ket turuan nayan maparay'epan a dila' ko ta dya'dya' koynan tuloy iti sa apoy.
sample_english: Please send Lazaro to dip the end of his index finger into the water and then drip some to cool my tongue for I am tormented severely here in the fire.

meaning_english: To be bundled.
sample_bolinao: Pangikitan byat sa napardo nin magey.
sample_english: ‎‎A measure of weight equal to 140 pounds. An instrument for weighing.

meaning_english: To bring celebration.
To be made robust.
sample_bolinao: Mampamayabor yan saytin pupakababa' kontamo ta pigaw nin isadya' natamon makapagsirbi konran tutawo na para kona tan ta pigaw nin si'tamon pinakalalaman na ni Cristo ket maparigsa atamo.
sample_english: He is giving as gifts these abilities to us in order that he might prepare us to be able to serve his people for him and in order that we who serve as the body of Christ would be robust.

meaning_english: Purify, to make something clean and pure.
sample_bolinao: Naparinggas anay byay moyo sin tinmulok kamo sa katutu'wan nin nangibwat konan Dios ket, main ana nin tutuo nin pangangawa'nan moyo konran bubsat moyo sa pammemper.
sample_english: Your lives have been cleansed when you obeyed the truth from God and so, you now have genuine love for your siblings in the faith.

meaning_english: To be made happy or joyful.
sample_bolinao: Mapaririket ko a mangatua ko no mag'adal akon maong.
sample_english: I make my parents happy when I study well.

meaning_english: To be pleased by something.
sample_bolinao: Bale', no gurutan nako, kai ako nin mapaririktan kona.
sample_english: But, if he turns his back on me, I will not be pleased with him.

meaning_english: For something to be the routine or customary.
sample_bolinao: Maparmaw akon dumasal ba'yo nin mangan.
sample_english: I routinely pray before eating.

meaning_english: To have a formed habit or practice.
sample_bolinao: Naparmawanmin sangkapamilyawan a dumasal adapen mangan tan ma'lek.
sample_english: To pray before going to bed and before eating is formed as ahabitfor our whole family.

meaning_english: Fade, vanish, for something to be easily uprooted or moved.
sample_bolinao: Say gunem,maparota madali' no mapres.
sample_english: The clouds will vanish quickly if it's windy.

meaning_english: To be of the characteristic of being accusatory or always accusing without a basis for the accusation.
sample_bolinao: Maparsa nan Dios li' a ba'yon luta' ta makapangyadian ya.
sample_english: God will in the future create a new earth since he is able to accomplish that.

meaning_english: For someone to be accused of a wrong but as yet it is unproven.
sample_bolinao: Maparsawan ya si Juan nin nangalap nin pitaka ni Maria ta kadani naya.
sample_english: Juan is being accused of taking Maria's purse since he was close.

meaning_english: To be taken over to something.
To be idling life away being absent-minded and not doing anything.
meaning_filipino: Pagkalingat; Nakupò na walang gawa; sayangin ang oras.
sample_bolinao: Maparyengya kanya' kasan prugriso nin byay na.
sample_english: She idles her time away that's why she does not progress in life.

meaning_english: To be bathed.
sample_bolinao: Makubpal a dulingat na ta kai ya nin maparyo'.
sample_english: His dirty spots are think since he has not been a bathed.

meaning_english: To be able to carry something on the shoulder.
sample_bolinao: Mapas'an ko a sayay sako' nin irik.
sample_english: I can carry a sack of unhusked rice on my shoulder.

meaning_english: To experience, what happens to a person, to suffer.
sample_bolinao: No magawa' kumon saray ua'nak sawanin, kai rayna kumonmapasaa idap a dinalan sa leleg giran linmabas.
sample_english: If possible the children today will not have topassthrough the hardship gone through during the past wars.

meaning_english: For someplace to be dragged and smoothened.
sample_bolinao: Matkap nin mapasagadan a luta' mayadi' ya nin adadwen.
sample_english: The ground needs to be dragged after it is plowed.

meaning_english: To happen to be made angry.
sample_bolinao: Mapasager moyay maistra moyo no pirmi kamon kai sumunor kona.
sample_english: You will make your teacher angry if you continuously do not follow his lead.

meaning_english: For something to be nailed together.
sample_bolinao: Main nika' ka nin panaeg nin kayo pigaw mapasak rayan maong a ayi nan tekrean.
sample_english: There was a restraining piece of wood that they put on the chair so that the feet would be nailed solid.

meaning_english: To be easily hurt or overcome.
To be accustomed to or trained at doing something.
sample_bolinao: Mapasal ko a dumasal yapo' ba'yo mangan.
sample_english: I am accustomed to praying first before eating.

meaning_english: To be honored as holy.
sample_bolinao: Mapasanto a ngaran mo.
sample_english: May your name be honored as holy.

meaning_english: To be so satiated with something such as food that it becomes obnoxious.
United, to be made one with something.
sample_bolinao: Mapasaya ako konran grupo ran manguna' no mako ako sa baybay.
sample_english: I am accepted as part of a group of fishermen when I go to the seashore.

meaning_english: For something to be boiled.
sample_bolinao: Mibuka' a byatbyat no mapasbo nin maong.
sample_english: Shells open up wide when they are boiled well.

meaning_english: To have had something sharpened to a point.
sample_bolinao: Mapaserey na ni Juan a kawayan nin gaw'en nan anuon nin pasabing na.
sample_english: Juan had a point put on the bamboo to be made for a support post for his fish corral.

meaning_english: To have caused someone to become resentful.
sample_bolinao: Mapases'ew na ni Sam a kakan anak na ta pirmi nayan kasagran.
sample_english: Sam is making his oldest child resentful and moody since he is always scolding him.

meaning_english: To be brought into a state of wholeness.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' nin ma'kit moyon mampialuyon a pammemper na tan gawa' na ket napasibulot a pammemper na bana' sa gawa' na.
sample_english: And so you see that his belief and his deeds are going along side and so his belief is made whole because of his deeds.

meaning_english: For food to become undesirable because of an over abundance although the person is not yet satisfied.
sample_bolinao: Mapasingla' saray bisita sa karni anan karni a ipangan.
sample_english: Being feed meat upon meat has made it undesirable to the visitors.

meaning_english: To have change made for a larger bill of money.
sample_bolinao: Napasinsilyuwan nayna ni Pedro a sanyasot pisos nin kwarta na.
sample_english: Pedro had his hundred peso bill changed

meaning_english: To be patient.
sample_bolinao: Mapasinsya ya et lamang abir masnep yayna.
sample_english: He is still nevertheless being patient even though he is irritated.

meaning_english: To shade the eyes from bright light.
Showy, boastful.
meaning_filipino: Pagpupuri sa sarili; mapamuri sa sarili.
sample_bolinao: Tawo nin mapasirayo; mataktika; mahambog; mamaka'lis; miluku-luko; mama'kit gulo.
sample_english: To strategize in order to get one's way; to trick.

meaning_english: To be put out to drain.
sample_bolinao: Taga'nan kon mapasitsitan a palaton ba'yo ko ika' sa pangwan.
sample_english: I wait for the a plate to sit out and dry before I put it out to eat from.

meaning_english: To have someone clothed in a particular thing.
sample_bolinao: Ket no mapasketan nan wanin kabista nin Dios a dudikot a isen sawanin bale' dilap ket magwa' a ipuor tamo' sa syang, kai na kasi nin ibi a isket moyo?
sample_english: And so if God can clothe with beauty like that the grasses that are there today but tomorrow might be burned in the stove, will he not perchance give what you will wear?

meaning_english: To have been chilled or stunned by the change from being hot to cold.
sample_bolinao: Mapasma kano no mapagal mi'sa nin maryo'.
sample_english: It is said that you will be sick with chills if you are exhausted and then bathe.

meaning_english: To be irritated or exasperated and short tempered.
sample_bolinao: Mapasnep rayay maistra ra no magargar sara.
sample_english: The teacher gets irritated when they are noisy.

meaning_english: To have passed and so obsolete, no longer in use and out of date.
sample_bolinao: Mapaso ana li' a  tyimpon mangga kanya' nin mabli ana.
sample_english: Later the time for mangoes will have passed and so they will be expensive.

meaning_english: To be gazing or focusing on something.
sample_bolinao: Mapastang kwa a maistra ko no mangrenge' ako kona.
sample_english: I am focusing my attention on the teacher when I listen to him.

meaning_english: To have something returned to a former state.
sample_bolinao: Mapasubli' ko a pagmatalek nan amigo ko kongko sa man-gaw'en kona.
sample_english: I am getting back my friend's trust of me through what I am doing for him.

meaning_english: The state of something returning to a previous state.
sample_bolinao: Mapasublian yan ma'mot si Juan no mabinat ya.
sample_english: Juan has recurring fevers when he has relapses of sickness.

meaning_english: To put oneself in an unprepared for situation or a predicament and so to become unwittingly involved or get enmeshed in some kind of trouble.
sample_bolinao: Pati si'kaminapasubo', ket napati naya et a sayay tawo kon lamang.
sample_english: We as well became unwittingly involved in trouble and furthermore he has killed one of my men.

meaning_english: To overdo something beyond what is good or recommended.
sample_bolinao: Napasubrawan a naibi konan tambor kanya' duka' a ingar na.
sample_english: The medicine that was given him was an overdose so that's why he feels bad.

meaning_english: Purify.
To be forced into a situation.
sample_bolinao: Kai kwa mapasuet nin mayi kongko kanya' nako akon bukod sa tindawan.
sample_english: I did not compel him to come with me to the store, so I went all alone.

meaning_english: To be able to make someone surrender.
sample_bolinao: Mapasuko' nasaran pulis a raruman kriminal.
sample_english: The police have made some criminals surrender.

meaning_english: To be able to make something to be followed.
sample_bolinao: Mapasunor nasaran maistra a iskwila na.
sample_english: The teacher has her students follow her.

meaning_english: To be made to surpass something.
sample_bolinao: Tukiden moyon maong nga'min ta ipangako' ko komoyo a kai kamo gapo nin makasrep sa Pag'adian nan Dios no kai moyo sara nin mapasurukan sa pangngawa' nin matunong a Pariseo tan saray Madudunong sa Gugan-gan.
sample_english: Thoroughly fulfill them all for I promise you that you will not at all be able to enter the Kingdom of God if you do not surpass the Pariseo and Experts in the Commands in deeds of right according to standard.

meaning_english: To be visiting places.
sample_bolinao: Mapasyar ya si Sam no mako ya sa Manila ta gulpin kwarta na.
sample_english: Sam visits and goes sightseeing when he goes to Manila since he has lots of money.

meaning_english: Was made to cry out.
sample_bolinao: Kanya'napata'wayako.
sample_english: So I happened toshout.

meaning_english: To be able to have something sharpened.
sample_bolinao: Mapatadem kwa a beneng mi ta iyasa' koya.
sample_english: I will have made our bolo sharp since I will hone it.

meaning_english: To be flat or level.
sample_bolinao: Napatag yay dalan ket kasan pisakinan.
sample_english: The path is flat and so there is nothing to trip on.

meaning_english: To be able to put someone to flight, make someone run away.
sample_bolinao: Napatakrisrasaray kukalaban ra.
sample_english: They put their enemies toflight.

meaning_english: To notified of something.
sample_bolinao: tan saraytaw saray kai et napatandaan.
sample_english: and those that have not yet come to know.

meaning_english: Discouraged, to be made to become weak.

sample_english: Maria is discouraging the drive of the one pursuing her.

meaning_english: To be made to be in an upright position.
For something to have been made tasty.

sample_english: Because of his beliefs, Mario is not to be given wine to taste.

meaning_english: To be put into a spinning motion.
sample_bolinao: Mapatbey kwa a bula sa gamet ko.
sample_english: I spun the ball in my hand.

meaning_english: For something to be stopped, such as a fire or movement of a thing or person.

sample_english: The vehicle could not be stopped.

meaning_english: To be killed or in the state of death.
sample_bolinao: Saray naitalaga nin mapati nin ispada, ket peteg a mapati sara li' nin ispada.
sample_english: Those that are destined to be killed by the sword, truly they will be killed by the sword.

meaning_english: To happen to cause something to be tough or hard.

sample_english: Water is made hard by cold.

meaning_english: To happen to make a glancing blow or a hit that was off target.

sample_english: He was hit with a glancing blow on his side.

meaning_english: To be obvious, clear and unambiguous.
sample_bolinao: Mapatnagyan ma'kit a sayay bagay.
sample_english: He can see the object unambiguously.

meaning_english: To have a blow to the head of something.
To be paired with someone.

sample_english: Each boy is paired with a girl.

meaning_english: To believe something by being convinced.

sample_english: They convinced me that studying hard was necessary.

meaning_english: To have been made straight.
Able to command obedience or make someone to obey.

sample_english: The teachers are able to make their students conform with what they want of them.

meaning_english: To have something continued.

sample_english: My support of the government is continuing.

meaning_english: To be controlled and corrected to stay within limits towards a goal.

meaning_english: To put something into rotation.
To have the proofs to show the truth of something. .
sample_bolinao: Napatutu'wan a syan talaga a nagkasalanan.
sample_english: It wasprovedthat she was really at fault.

meaning_english: To have made an impression on something.
Forlorn, deserted, left alone, neglected.
sample_bolinao: Napau-pauryanya in a anak kanya' duka' a nanganggawan na.
sample_english: That child was neglected that's why the the result of his life was bad.

meaning_english: For hair to be being made grey or white.
sample_bolinao: Ni andi' moyo usaren nin sumamba a byay moyo a bilang nin si'kamoy main nin pakauray sa sayti ta ni si sayay sabot sa ulo moyo ket kai moya nin mapauban o mapangisit.
sample_english: You should not even use your life, as if you rule over it, to make an oath, since not even one hair of your head can you make grey or make black.

meaning_english: To be neglecting or abandoning or to be giving little care and attention to something.
sample_bolinao: Mapauryanraynay dumasal no adapen ma'lek bana' sa pamantay tilibisyon.
sample_english: They areneglectingto pray before going to bed due to watching television.

meaning_english: Nipa leaves that are overlapped and bound.
A light breeze.
sample_bolinao: Makapainawaakon maong iti ta mapaya-paya tan mariga yay lugar.
sample_english: I canrestwell here because there is a light breeze and it has a happy atmosphere.

meaning_english: To have brought to completion.
sample_bolinao: Babaen kon mapayadi' katamon pag'adalen sa kulihyo.
sample_english: I will strive on my part to bring your studies in college to completion.

meaning_english: To burned to ashes.
sample_bolinao: Maputi' tin bara'mon arina; lukan a pinuuran ket napayba kanya' pino nin sabtan puti'; mabayani ti ket ikwa ra sa samat, nalbet ket mamaen; ipamarbar nin prutas a gaw'en dulsi pigaw kai maluyak.
sample_english: Lime; a powder made by burning payba shells until they become a powder. The taste is bitter and hot. It is used for mumo, the betel nut chew, and also for preserving the firmness and shape of fruit when they are cooked.

meaning_english: To be satisfied and content having the desires filled.
sample_bolinao: Mapda'yayna sawanin ta husto yayna sa matkap na.
sample_english: She is nowsatisfiedbecause she has all she needs.

meaning_english: To be able to make a depression or a pressed down place in something.
sample_bolinao: Mapdit kwa a tsiko no maluto' yayna.
sample_english: I squeeze the chico to see if it is ripe.

meaning_english: To be pressed down and compact.
sample_bolinao: Mapedped a sarban mapadalanan pedped.
sample_english: Every place a steam roller passes is flattened.

meaning_english: To be pounded on the top.
sample_bolinao: Mapekpek kwa a pasak ket sumrep yan tampor.
sample_english: I pounded the nail and so it immediately went in.

meaning_english: To be short and stout.
For something to be temporarily piled in a location such as for newly harvested rice to be stacked.

sample_english: If you're not able to do a thorough cleaning of sweeping, pile the dust in corner of the house.

meaning_english: To have close bamboo nodes.
sample_bolinao: Mapepret a bias nan kawayan.
sample_english: The divisions of the bamboo are very near each other.

meaning_english: To have an angry or disapproving look with movement of the eyes.
sample_bolinao: Maperek si Maria no miaaway sara nin kaikap na.
sample_english: Maria looks askance disapprovingly when her playmates have a quarrel.

meaning_english: For a liquid to be squeezed out of something.
sample_bolinao: Mapespes a aysing kon nalbet nin sipwak nan mutor sa taaw.
sample_english: My clothing that was wet from the ocean spray from the motorboat could be squeezed out.

meaning_english: For something to be squeezed.
To be able to go to certain places with someone.
sample_bolinao: No mikalamo' kami, abaw a mapi'kaan mi ta main ruran na.
sample_english: When we go with him there are a lot of places we can go together since he has a vehicle.

meaning_english: Immediately all at once.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' nin midadagop nin mapi'sa-pi'san rumate' kona a dya'dya'.
sample_english: Therefore the totality of the torment will arrive on her all at once.

meaning_english: To be able to determine something though differentiation.
sample_bolinao: Mapibarawes koy rabay tan kai na rabay nin Dios bana' sa Biblya.
sample_english: I can determine what God wants and does not want because of the Bible.

meaning_english: To be in pieces.
For two or more things to be differentiated.
sample_bolinao: Mapiduma ko a surat nan maistra ko tan surat ran kaklasi ko sa iskol.
sample_english: I can differentiate the writing of my teacher and the writing of my classmates at school.

meaning_english: To pay special attention to an incident or warning and learn from it.
To be joined together.
To have a noticeably beautifully shaped body.
sample_bolinao: Mapigura ya a maistra ko.
sample_english: My teacher has a great figure.

meaning_english: To be certain of something being true and correct.
sample_bolinao: Saray inmasinso sa byay ket mapiho kon main nigusyo ra tan di-adal sara.
sample_english: Those that are getting ahead in life I am certain are those that have a business and an education.

meaning_english: To be able to reside someplace.
sample_bolinao: Main nin udas a kai ako nin nangan tan naray'e-ray'epan ako ta kurang a seket ko tan kasan mapiikapan ko.
sample_english: There were times that I did not eat and I had no place to settle into.

meaning_english: To be bent.
Flexible, pliable, easily bent.
sample_bolinao: Say malago' et nin sanga, mainum'ay ninmapiklu-piklo'.
sample_english: Young branches are easyto bend back and forth.

meaning_english: To be folded close.
sample_bolinao: Mapikmi' kwan tampor a payong ko.
sample_english: I will fold up my umbrella immediately.

meaning_english: To be divided in two, usually half.
sample_bolinao: Mapiknga' ko a sayan bargin nin sina'pang no mataway a kunaen no mangan ako.
sample_english: When I eat and  the food is good, I split a platter of boiled rice.

meaning_english: For a man to have been forced to marry a woman.
meaning_filipino: Lalaki na pinilit mag'asawang isang babae.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka pirmi nin mamukud-bukod kona tamapikotraka.
sample_english: Do not always be with her alone because they mightforceyou tomarryher.

meaning_english: To be lame or have a broken leg.
sample_bolinao: Mapilay ka no maikura'bot a ayi mo sa ubot no manlumalako ka.
sample_english: You will be lame if you happen to step in a hole when you are walking.

meaning_english: To be held tightly.
sample_bolinao: Napildit yay ibot kanya' kai ya makapalayo.
sample_english: The mouse was held tightly and he couldn't run away.

meaning_english: To be chosen.
sample_bolinao: Mapili' ya sa kanen si Cindy ta masaro' yay tyan na.
sample_english: Cindy is finicky about food since her stomach is sensitive.

meaning_english: For something to be compulsory or forced to be done.
sample_bolinao: Mapilityan mako sa Amerika kanya' tinumgen yaynan mangakay.
sample_english: He iseagerto go to America, that's why he quit teaching.

meaning_english: To be forced to do something.
sample_bolinao: Bale' kai sara nin nikikumpurmi a pupangulo tamo nin Judio, kanya' nin napilitan ako nin dinawat kon iyadap akon mausisa' konan Impirador nan Roma.
sample_english: But the leaders of us Jews did not agree, therefore I was forced to request that I be interrogated before the Emperor of Rome.

meaning_english: To be twisted out of shape or twisted apart.
sample_bolinao: Napilok yay kutsara.
sample_english: The spoon is twisted out of shape.

meaning_english: Emaciated, to have lost weight and not be strong.
sample_bolinao: Mapindira lalaman na; ambo' nan bagay magtrabaho.
sample_english: His body is emaciated and he is not fitted to work.

meaning_english: For a thick object to be ripped apart.
sample_bolinao: Madali' yan mapingas a tsinilas ko.
sample_english: My slippers get ripped apart quickly.

meaning_english: To have been forcefully split or ripped off from something.
sample_bolinao: Mapingasan yay tsinilas no mada'daan rayan raruma no mangalsa nin mabyat.
sample_english: When lifting heavy objects, the slippers may get ripped if something is stepped on.

meaning_english: For a sharp object to have nicks in or damage to it.
sample_bolinao: Mapingaw yay beneng no itaga' ya sa bato.
sample_english: The bolo will get nicks in its blade if it is struck against a stone.

meaning_english: For a knife blade to be nicked or chipped.
sample_bolinao: Mapingawan yay beneng no pirmi yan ipangraros nin dikot sa luta' nin mabato.
sample_english: The bolo will get nicked if it is always used for cutting the weeds in a stony area.

meaning_english: To be cultured, refined or educated in some way, such as in speech.
sample_bolinao: Mapino ra a byas no gilingen ra.
sample_english: They powder the rice when they mill it.

meaning_english: To be painted or to color something.

sample_english: I can paint the house being just the lone painter.

meaning_english: To happen as a unit, either one by one or all at the same time.
sample_bolinao: Napipi'sa saran dimmuklos sa lamisawan.
sample_english: They as a whole forcefully moved toward the table.

meaning_english: To perceive, be aware or realize something.
sample_bolinao: Naimunawan ya si Pedro ket napipigaw na a ambo' tamo' nin taynep a sarba.
sample_english: Pedro came to his senses and realized that everything was not just a dream.

meaning_english: For something to be overused to the point of abuse.
sample_bolinao: Napipyayay kabayo nin nanguroy abaw a karga.
sample_english: The horse was abused in the pulling of so much cargo.

meaning_english: For something to be wasted.
sample_bolinao: Isada' may gripo pigaw kai mapirdi a ranom.
sample_english: Shut off the faucet so the water won't be wasted.

meaning_english: To be pardoned or forgiven of a wrong.
sample_bolinao: Mapirduna ratamo nin Dios no ambo' tamon marangas nin kiirgo kona.
sample_english: God can forgive us if we are not to arrogant to talk with him.

meaning_english: For something important to go to waste.
sample_bolinao: Mapirdyan tamon irik no maabutan nin bagyo a tanem tamo.
sample_english: Our field rice will be lost if it is affected by a typhoon.

meaning_english: For something to be manipulated or controlled.
To be permanent.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket mapirmi ya bali ra no nepnep.
sample_english: Juan always stays in the house when it is rainy out.

meaning_english: To be able to do something at the same time.
sample_bolinao: Wanin anamaet, kai moyo nin mapirngan a magsirbi konan Dios tan say umagawa kamon maningkap.
sample_english: Like that also, you cannot at the same time serve God and the ardor of making a profit.

meaning_english: To have brought injury or annoyance or a difficulty upon someone.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a napirwisyo nan bagyo nin linmabas.
sample_english: There was a lot of damage that had been done when the storm had passed.

meaning_english: For something to be split off from something such as in making slats for a fence.
sample_bolinao: Madali' mapisi' a kawayan no matadem yay beneng.
sample_english: The splitting of bamboo is easy if the bolo is sharp.

meaning_english: To be thrashing about.
For things to be separated.
To divide something into portions.
sample_bolinao: Kayadi', nibubunutan sara ta pigaw nin mapitaw'a-taw'an ray seket na, a no ani a mako sa barang nin saya.
sample_english: Right after that, they drew lots so that they could divide up his clothes, as to what would go to each person.

meaning_english: To have something happen three times in a row.
sample_bolinao: Mapitlo kwa nin matalo a amigo ko no miikap kami nin dama.
sample_english: It is a third of the winnings for my friend when we play native checkers.

meaning_english: To be in trouble, in a pinch or in a jam.
sample_bolinao: Napitpityay gamet na sa tekrean.
sample_english: His hand was crushed by the chair.

meaning_english: To be calmed down.
sample_bolinao: Sa ka'tengan, si sikritaryo nin syudad ket napittinek nasaraytaw saray nididinep, ket wana konra, <<Kalugaran ko nin taga Efeso, kasan kai nin magtanda' a naipya kontamo nin taga Efeso a pangangasikaso konan timplo na nin si sangkata'gayan a diosa tamon si Artemis tan konan masagradon imahin na nin nanabo' nangibwat sa langit.
sample_english: After a long while, the secretary of the city was able to silence those who were gathered, and he said to them, <<My fellows from Ephesus, there's no one who doesn't know that the responsibility in the temple of our highest GodArtemasand to the sacred image that fell down from heaven has been entrusted to us from Ephesus.

meaning_english: To be able to concentrate or pay close attention to something.
meaning_filipino: Paghaharap ng buong pagiisip sa isang gawain.

sample_english: She is able to concentrate her mind in her studies.

meaning_english: To be warped.

meaning_english: For something to lean at a slant or be distorted out of the normal position or shape.

sample_english: Some that have had a stroke lean to one side.

meaning_english: Feel dizzy or numbed caused by a hard blow to the head or painful words uttered.

meaning_english: For something that was lacking to be filled up.

meaning_english: For something to be refreshed.

sample_english: You feel fresh and satisfied when we drink sarsaparilla.

meaning_english: To be imprisoned.

meaning_english: To problematic.

meaning_english: Upright, morally matching an accepted standard.

meaning_english: Awakened person who was fast asleep and suddenly he was disturbed by a loud noise.

meaning_english: Ten.

sample_english: Isaac's life wassavedat that time.

meaning_english: To be blocked or hidden from view.
sample_bolinao: Say gunem,nasalimbengannay sira' nan awro.
sample_english: The rays of the sun werehiddenby the clouds.

meaning_english: To be growing offshoots on the trunk or branch of a plant or vine.
sample_bolinao: Masalingsing anay kamuti nin imula ko.
sample_english: The sweet potato that I planted has offshoots coming off it.

meaning_english: To refuge from something.
sample_bolinao: Bana' ta sungsong yay siri, nangliklik kami sa rigri-rigrig nan isla nin Cyprus nin masalipne' sa siri.
sample_english: Because the wind was against us, we passed through the part close to the shore by the island of Cyprus which was a good refuge.

meaning_english: To be able to be bought.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a masaliw nin ma'kan sa palingki.
sample_english: There are a lot of foods that can be bought in the Market.

meaning_english: To be nauseous from a sickening sight.
sample_bolinao: Masalmengako sin na'kit koy abaw a lango sa natin pusa'.
sample_english: I felt nauseated when I saw the many flies on the dead cat.

meaning_english: To be receiving something from a source that is above such a hand-me-down piece of clothing or water using a pail.
sample_bolinao: Sigunda-manoyay aysing ko ta nasalod koya et koni angkay ko.
sample_english: My dress is secondhand since I got it as a hand-me-down from my older sibling.

meaning_english: To have a sliver stuck in some part of the body.
sample_bolinao: Nasalu'suan yay ayi ko nin duwi.
sample_english: My foot has a thorn stuck in it.

meaning_english: To be slurped up into something by the movement of air.
To be a bit sweet.
To be sweet.
sample_bolinao: Masam'it ya nin bara'mon inatip mintras a iti ya et sa bebey mo.
sample_english: It will be sweet like wild honey while it is in your mouth.

meaning_english: Honey.
sample_bolinao: Gulpi nin masam'it-ngiwan no gulpin burak o prutas.
sample_english: The is a lot of honey when there are a lot of flowers or fruit.

meaning_english: Wild honey.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a nakalap min masam'it-putyukan naapon.
sample_english: A lot of honey was gotten yesterday.

meaning_english: To be filthy.
sample_bolinao: Pawagan mosaray lango ta masama' sara.
sample_english: Swat the flies off since they are dirty.

meaning_english: To be dirty because of something.
sample_bolinao: Sakban moy sina'pang ta sali'masamaan.
sample_english: Cover the rice, something might get dirt in it.

meaning_english: For something to be poisoned.
sample_bolinao: Masamal saray mangan nin butiti.
sample_english: Those that ate the globe fish were poisoned.

meaning_english: To be a barrier to hinder, restrain or block something from passing to someplace.
sample_bolinao: Masamben nan payong ko a maksaw nin siri a mako kongko.
sample_english: My umbrella blocks the strong wind that is coming at me.

meaning_english: For something to be mentioned or referenced.
sample_bolinao: Sin kapresan min mampag'irgo,nasambitmi pay ngaran na.
sample_english: When we were conversing, we mentioned her name.

meaning_english: To be able to meet a deadline or goal in order to take advantage of something,
sample_bolinao: Madali' kan lumalako pigawmasambottayay ruran.
sample_english: Walk faster so that we cancatchthe ride.

meaning_english: To be welcoming to those around.
sample_bolinao: Masamisami yay istudyanti nin kiirgo konan maistra na.
sample_english: The student greets his teach warmly in speaking with him.

meaning_english: To be able to grab, snatch or seize suddenly with the hand.
sample_bolinao: Kiten ko pa nomasampatmay bula?
sample_english: May I see if you can catch the ball?

meaning_english: For something to be snatched from something by force.
sample_bolinao: Ga'getan man maong a tinapay mo tamasamsamnayan aso.
sample_english: Hold your bread very well the dog mightgrabit.

meaning_english: To be flogged.
sample_bolinao: Masanet saray raruman magulo nin a'nak.
sample_english: Some of the unruly children are whipped.

meaning_english: To have breathed in the aroma of something.
sample_bolinao: Masanglap ko a angot nan pinapaitan a man'iluto' ko.
sample_english: I inhale the aroma of the intestinal dish that I am cooking.

meaning_english: For fruit to smell bad.
sample_bolinao: Masangor a raruman mangga no putyen ta maluto' ana.
sample_english: Some mangoes smell bad when they are pick since they are already ripe.

meaning_english: To be polite and do the culturally appropriate and respectful thing.
sample_bolinao: Masantos saray padi' tan pupastor kanya' galangen rasara nin tutawo.
sample_english: The priests and pastors are religious and so people honor them.

meaning_english: Deceitful, to be cheating using dishonest tricks.
sample_bolinao: Masaor yay katao ko.
sample_english: My co-sharer cheats.

meaning_english: To have residue in something.
sample_bolinao: Masapal a raruman pandikuko nin lako' ra sa tindawan.
sample_english: Some coconut bread they sell in the stores have fiber residue in it.

meaning_english: To be in several bunches.
To wash things that have been eaten from.
sample_bolinao: Masapat moyna Juan a nanganan tamo ta main anan ranom.
sample_english: You can now wash our dishes Juan since there is now water.

meaning_english: For something to be strained out of a liquid.
sample_bolinao: Matkap nin masapit a pinespes nin gata' ba'yo ilawok sa man'iluto'.
sample_english: The squeezed out coconut milk must be strained before it is mixed into what is being cooked.

meaning_english: Acrid, the taste of an unripe banana or fruit that leaves a rough texture in your mouth.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' mataway a batag no ambo' et maluto' ta masaple' a taway.
sample_english: A banana that is not yet ripe is not tasty since the taste is acrid.

meaning_english: For something to be woven.
sample_bolinao: Masara li' a bulong silag nin malago' ta gaw'en apay nin kinalap ko.
sample_english: Young leaves of the wicker tree will later be woven together to make a mat that I will get.

meaning_english: For something hard, crunchy and brittle such as over fried food or some kinds of wood.
sample_bolinao: Mataway a ba'yon prito nin mani ta masarangsang.
sample_english: Freshly fried peanuts are tasty since they are crunchy.

meaning_english: To be caught with a fishing net.
sample_bolinao: Abaw amasarapnin aramang sa rigrig baybay.
sample_english: There are many small shrimp that can be caught with nets along the seashore.

meaning_english: The feeling of a coarse or rough surface such as callous hands, hollow blocks or ground.
sample_bolinao: Masarapsap a liha.
sample_english: Sandpaper is rough.

meaning_english: To be able to experience something and so come to know it.
sample_bolinao: Mangdam ako nin bisiklita pigaw masari' ko nin rumuran.
sample_english: I'll borrow a bicycle so that I can try riding it.

meaning_english: To be spoken for.
To be weak of body because of low resistance to negative things such as sickness or criticism.
sample_bolinao: Masaro' si Maria no maray'ep ta madali' yan buuren.
sample_english: Maria has a weak resistance when it is cold for she gets a head cold easily.

meaning_english: For liquid or small items to be scooped out from something.
To be pointed and sharp.
meaning_filipino: Matulis; may tulis; matalim at matalas sa dulo.
sample_bolinao: Masarpityay parpar nan beneng mo.
sample_english: The tip of your bolo is sharp.

meaning_english: To be lifted back from the base, such as a fingernail being pulled up or splinters of wood.
meaning_filipino: Ang ibang bagay ay umangat mula sa pinagmulan.
sample_bolinao: Masarugi'gi' a kuko nin Pedro ta naisakin ya ket inmalsa yay parpar kuko na.
sample_english: Pedro's fingernail was lifted loose since he bumped it and the tip swelled.

meaning_english: A swift strike of something.
sample_bolinao: Masasnetyay panis no iyambak ya.
sample_english: The broom is whipped swiftly when used as a whip.

meaning_english: The event of something crashing against something.
To piercing.
sample_bolinao: Masaspita tunoy nan anak no umakis ya.
sample_english: The baby's madeasharp tiny cry.

meaning_english: To be swift in movement.
sample_bolinao: Masasweng a kutsi ran Hapon dyan Intsik.
sample_english: Japanese cars are swifter than Chinese.

meaning_english: For a flame to suddenly burst up.
sample_bolinao: Nasasyabyan bigra' a apoy sin binu'buan yan pitrulyo.
sample_english: The firesuddenly flared upwhen the petroleum was poured on.

meaning_english: For a cloth to be torn to shreds.
sample_bolinao: Nasatsatyay aysing ko.
sample_english: My dress isshredded.

meaning_english: To make into a soft mashed mixture.
sample_bolinao: Masawenmaong a limbet nin tapong pigaw midadalit a maong pigaw mainum'ay nin ata-atadwen.
sample_english: Mash the dampened flour well so that it becomes sticky so that it will be easy to slice.

meaning_english: To have been a regrettable waste in the loss or futility of something.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a masayang nin kanen no main nin pakan ta mangalap saran kanen a tutawo nin kai ra ma'pos.
sample_english: There is a lot food that goes to waste when there is a banquet for the people get food that they can not finish/consume.

meaning_english: To be grieved regarding a waste or loss of something.
sample_bolinao: Masayangan ako sa kai ra man'inumen nin tinimpla nin gatas.
sample_english: I was grieved that they were not drinking the milk mixture.

meaning_english: To be sensitive to unpleasant smells.
To be chipped.
sample_bolinao: Masbing a raruman baso no mabul'isan.
sample_english: Some glasses get chipped if they are dislodged.

meaning_english: To have been chipped by something.
sample_bolinao: Masbingan a raruman tasa sin saytaw.
sample_english: Formerly some of the cups were chipped.

meaning_english: To be redeemed or bought back by a payment being made.
sample_bolinao: Masbot kwa a kwintas nin nisanla' ko ta main swildo ko.
sample_english: I intended to redeem the necklace I hocked for I have my salary.

meaning_english: For plants to be watered.
sample_bolinao: Malanesa tanaman no kai masbuan binukla-buklas.
sample_english: Plantswitherwhen they are not watered every morning.

meaning_english: Sluggishness of body, the result of drinking water when tired.
sample_bolinao: Masdoka no minom kan mapagal.
sample_english: You will suffer a suddendepressionwhen you are so tired and drink water.

meaning_english: For a fire to be quenched with water.
sample_bolinao: Masebseban yay apoy no sumbo yay sina'pang.
sample_english: The fire will be put out if the rice boils over.

meaning_english: To be tamped down and completely full.
sample_bolinao: Kai nin masedsed a bato.
sample_english: The stone cannot be packed down.

meaning_english: To be dense or compressed into a space.
For something to be sucked in.
sample_bolinao: Kasaynan daya' nin masepsep nan ilek.
sample_english: The mosquito did not happen to suck up any blood.

meaning_english: To be in a pointed shape but not necessarily sharp.
sample_bolinao: Maserey a pwit nin kadayem.
sample_english: The tip of the needle is pointed.

meaning_english: Easily hurt, offended or affected by something.
sample_bolinao: Si tawo nin mases'ew, daite' saray amigo na.
sample_english: A person who is veryeasily hurthas few friends.

meaning_english: To be hardworking and conscientious.
sample_bolinao: Maseseg ya tan tanda' nay trabaho.
sample_english: He is diligent and he knows the work.

meaning_english: The characteristic of being irritable and furious.
sample_bolinao: Masesnep ya si Juan no kai ya napagustwan sa rabay na.
sample_english: Juan fumes when he is not pleased about what he wants.

meaning_english: To perceive or discover something coming to a conclusion.
sample_bolinao: Nasi'girko a ambo' mabista a pigagawa' na.
sample_english: Ihaveperceived that her character is not good.

meaning_english: Voracious, to be eagerly consuming large amounts of something.
sample_bolinao: Masiba'yan mangan a baboy mo kanya' mataba' ya.
sample_english: Your pig isvoraciousthat's why it's fat.

meaning_english: The state of being selfish, caring too much for oneself.
sample_bolinao: Si Cainmasibletya bale' si Abel mapami ya.
sample_english: Cain wasselfish, but Abel was giving.

meaning_english: To be whole or entire and thus genuine.
sample_bolinao: Nibi naya kongkoymasibulota ulon baboy.
sample_english: She has given me thewholehead of the pig.

meaning_english: For something to be splashed with water.
sample_bolinao: Masibuyan a ayi ko sin nambo' akon tanaman.
sample_english: My foot was splashed when I dropped the plant.

meaning_english: For anything (food, character, things, etc.) to be ruined or damaged.
sample_bolinao: Nasida'a kinatawo na bana' sa kasalanan.
sample_english: His humanity wasruinedbecause of sin.

meaning_english: Anything of which some part of it might be wrecked.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka rumuran kona siin si dyip ta sali'masidaanya.
sample_english: Do not ride on that jeep, something on it mightbreak.

meaning_english: To be clean and orderly.
sample_bolinao: Matkap nin masider a sarbay bagay mi'sa tamo nin mibwat.
sample_english: Everything needs to be clean and in order before we leave.

meaning_english: To tie things together in a knot.
sample_bolinao: Masiglaot a sipupulo' nin lastiko no miikap nin pitik.
sample_english: Ten rubber bands are looped together when playing snap-it.

meaning_english: To be moving swiftly.
sample_bolinao: Masiglatyan talaga nin malayo ta syay pirmin manalo sa lumba'.
sample_english: He is really a fast runner since he is always the winner in a race.

meaning_english: For something to be clamped.
To be certain of something.
sample_bolinao: Masigurado ko nin mabistay byay ko no gulpin nigusyo ko.
sample_english: I will be certain of a good life if I have a lot of business.

meaning_english: To be floored with something.
sample_bolinao: Masiiran na ni Sam a bali-bali na nin usar a limay putol nin kawayan nin alalaki.
sample_english: Sam will floor his shack with five large cut bamboo.

meaning_english: An old man or male animal.
sample_bolinao: Ninawa yan ararem amasiken.
sample_english: Theold manbreathed deeply.

meaning_english: A rice dessert made from a mixture of sticky rice flour or sago in a sweet dark liquid made of sesame seeds and sugar.
sample_bolinao: Mataway talagay masikoy no gulpin gata' na.
sample_english: The sesame rice dessert is truly delicious when it has a lot of coconut milk.

meaning_english: To be done secretly.

sample_english: The soldiers officers are secretive in order not to say things that are important for them to know.

meaning_english: To many scales.
sample_bolinao: Masiksik saray gumyan.
sample_english: The goat fish is scaly.

meaning_english: To make sesame rice flour dessert that is dark in color.
sample_bolinao: Masikuyen a linga tan daliket.
sample_english: Sesame rice dessert is made with sesame and sweet rice.

meaning_english: To be scraped out clean.
sample_bolinao: Masikyat ran mangan a ma'kan sa palaton ra.
sample_english: The food on the plates of those who were eating was scrapped clean.

meaning_english: To be dazzled by a bright light.
sample_bolinao: Masilaw ako no yabi sa tyo' ran masabat kon ruran.
sample_english: I am blinded at night by the lights of a vehicle coming at me.

meaning_english: To be shiny and reflecting light.
sample_bolinao: Sabtansilengnin siir ra ta linampaso nin maong.
sample_english: Their floor is veryshinybecause it was polished very well.

meaning_english: To be exchanging things with one another.
sample_bolinao: Masili ya si Juan sa sapatos tan paluka' na.
sample_english: Juan exchanges his shoes with his slippers.

meaning_english: To completely consume by fire.

sample_english: All their furniture and other belongings wereconsumedby the fire.

meaning_english: For something or someone to take the place or be exchanged with something.
sample_bolinao: Silyanmayjanitorta matamlad ya.
sample_english: Replacethe janitor; he's lazy.

meaning_english: To be yellow, the color of ripe lemons or egg yolks.
sample_bolinao: Masilyaw a kulor nan bali na ni Pedro.
sample_english: The color of Pedro's house is yellowish.

meaning_english: To have something (streets, parts of a building or house, etc.) to be made of concrete.
sample_bolinao: Nasimintoyay bali kanya' ma'get ya.
sample_english: The house is made of concrete that's why it is strong.

meaning_english: To have been dipped into and removed in small amounts.
sample_bolinao: Nasimot a luto' ko ta mataway kano.
sample_english: My cooking was devoured bit by bit for it was said to be tasty.

meaning_english: To be using things in a very careful way, frugally, not extravagantly and not wasteful.
sample_bolinao: Masimpityan tawo.
sample_english: He/She is a frugal person.

meaning_english: To be orderly, having a pleasant arrangement.
sample_bolinao: Masin'epa pamamali ra ta say agamiren iti sa lugar.
sample_english: Their household isorderlysince everything is in proper place.

meaning_english: To be translucent.
To be shining on something.
sample_bolinao: Kitap yayti si seket ko no masinagan yan awro.
sample_english: This clothing of mine sparkles when the sun shines on it.

meaning_english: Ravaged, for something to have been attacked violently and taken for food.
sample_bolinao: Si pusa' ra,masinanyan kuna'.
sample_english: Their cat devours fish.

meaning_english: To be collected.
sample_bolinao: Nami ya si Edgar nin kwartan tulong na para sa abuna konran kai ana nin nasingir sa bayad nin kanen baboy.
sample_english: Edgar gave financial aid for the payment to be made in lieu of those who failed to pay for hog feeds they took.

meaning_english: Dislocated or injured elbow.
sample_bolinao: Magwa' yan masingkol a takyay mo no mablo' ka.
sample_english: It could be that your arm would be dislocated if you have a fracture.

meaning_english: To be satiated or weary of a kind of food.
sample_bolinao: Masingla' ako sa karni nin baboy no pista.
sample_english: I am weary of pork at fiesta.

meaning_english: For something to be sniffed.
To be scalded or singed by something hot.

sample_english: Cool off the boiled rice before you put it in your mouth so that your tongue and mouth aren't scalded.

meaning_english: To be burnt by something like hot water, steel, vegetables, fever or a flame.
sample_bolinao: Si Luisa,nasinitanyan ma'mot a palansa.
sample_english: Luisa was burnt by the hot iron.

meaning_english: For something to have been chiseled through.
sample_bolinao: Kai nin masinsil a pasak nin makubpal.
sample_english: Metal that is thick cannot be chiseled through.

meaning_english: To be officially condemned as punishment for a wrong.
sample_bolinao: Masintinsyawan ya nin limay taon sa priswan bana' sa ginwa' nan pananakaw.
sample_english: He is sentenced to five years in prison because of the robberies he committed.

meaning_english: To be sensitive or touchy and so easily take offense at something.
sample_bolinao: Masintir ya ta kai koya tamo' nabyan tampor baso ket nibwat yayna.
sample_english: She issensitivebecause I was not able to just give her immediately a glass of water and so she stood and went away.

meaning_english: Any fruit of a tree which is fully developed and big.
sample_bolinao: Masinurboya bungan mangga mi sabtan anda'.
sample_english: The fruit of our mango tree are fully complete in size.

meaning_english: To be kicked.
To be pinched.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma ga'getan a ayama ta sali' masipit ka.
sample_english: Don't grab hold of a mud crab since you might be pinched.

meaning_english: To have split a bamboo off center so that there is a small portion that is removed.
sample_bolinao: Nasiplata nikapisi' na.
sample_english: His norm for splitting bamboo is off center.

meaning_english: For the wind to be strong and gusty.
sample_bolinao: Lumapsot yay rubir nan balsa nin nakataker sa anuon ta nasiplog naya nin maksaw siri a balsa.
sample_english: The rafts rope that was tied to the support post was yanked away since the the raft was being yanked back and forth by the strong gusty wind.

meaning_english: To happen to slap something.
sample_bolinao: Andi' moko pasagren tamasipratkata.
sample_english: Do not make me angry or else Iwill slapyour face.

meaning_english: To be able to suck on something in the mouth to get the juices out.
sample_bolinao: Masiptan a bungan arunggay no naluto' ana nin nilawok sa pising.
sample_english: The fruit of the drumstick tree when cooked with vegetables can be sucked on in the mouth.

meaning_english: To notice something.
sample_bolinao: Kai ko nasiputan nin nibwat ya si Pedro.
sample_english: I hadn't noticed that Pedro left.

meaning_english: To happen to splash on something.
sample_bolinao: Kumadayo' kamo sa layos pigaw kai kamo masipwakan no main dumalan nin ruran.
sample_english: Move away from the flooded area so that you don't get splashed on if there is a car that passes through.

meaning_english: That which can be seen by peeping through a small opening toward it or seen quickly.
sample_bolinao: Masir'ipko sa ubot a man-gaw'en ran mananakaw.
sample_english: I couldglimpsethrough the hole what the robbers were doing.

meaning_english: To be shined on from some light source.
sample_bolinao: Matkap masiraan nin awro a mula nin pari.
sample_english: It is necessary that the rice plants get sunshine.

meaning_english: To have light directed on something, perhaps in a momentary blinding manner.
sample_bolinao: Masirap ya si Sam konran masabat nan kutsi sa dalan no yabi.
sample_english: Sam is blinded at night by the cars he meets on the road.

meaning_english: To be useful or a person that is obedient, faithful and patient in a responsibility.
sample_bolinao: Masirbiya sa Dios.
sample_english: He isfaithfully servingGod.

meaning_english: To be windy but not terribly strong.
sample_bolinao: Kepes a bungan pari bana' ta kasan rapeg tan masiri.
sample_english: The grains of the rice plants shriveled since there was no rain and it was windy.

meaning_english: To be cunning or crafty.
sample_bolinao: Pirayo nasaran tutawo amasirib.
sample_english: People admire those who are cunning.

meaning_english: Erudite person, sage, savant: learned.
To be under a covering.
sample_bolinao: Sa masirungan nan midya agwa, ginwa' miyan silid a elekan.
sample_english: Underneath the extended shed, we made a sleeping room.

meaning_english: To be caught in a breeze and chilled or exposed to the elements.
sample_bolinao: Masam'it no kanen anan tampor, bale' no ma'teng masiryan ket kumait a taway na.
sample_english: It is sweet if it is eaten immediately, but if it is exposed for long its taste will become bitter.

meaning_english: To have a cesarean section.
sample_bolinao: Nasisaryanyay Misis ko.
sample_english: My Mrs.hada Cesarean operation.

meaning_english: The wholeness or completeness of something.
sample_bolinao: Masisibulot nin sa'san ribo a kwarta ni Juan no magswildo ya sindo nin kinsinas.
sample_english: Juan collects a whole one thousand pesos each fifteen days when he works.

meaning_english: To be able to testify about something.
sample_bolinao: Masistigusan ni Maria a nangyadi'.
sample_english: Maria is able to testify about what happened.

meaning_english: To observe or discover something bad.
sample_bolinao: Nasitana ni masiken Panyong nin antumaba' sara.
sample_english: Heobservedold man Panyong and his family getting fat.

meaning_english: Potted plants, plants in vases, ornamental plants.
sample_bolinao: Abaw amasitasko sa adapan bali mi.
sample_english: I have manypottedornamentalplantsin front of our house.

meaning_english: Was found out to have done something wrong.
sample_bolinao: Nasitawanyan talaga a syay ginumawa' kasalanan.
sample_english: He wasfound outthat he has done wrong.

meaning_english: Flower pot.
sample_bolinao: Manaliw ako panmasitirata mulawan kon tanaman.
sample_english: I'm going to buy aflower potwhere I will plant flowering plants.

meaning_english: To aggressively toss back and forth while asleep, even going from one end of the bed to the other.
sample_bolinao: Masiwarya no ma'lek ya.
sample_english: Hetossesfrom side to side while asleep.

meaning_english: Mascara or mask, a covering to hide, protect or change the appearance of the face.
sample_bolinao: Mainmaskaranan mananakaw pigaw kai raya maalilbi' a rupa na.
sample_english: The robber wears amaskso that they cannot recognize his face.

meaning_english: Muscular, a man who has a strong and robust body.
sample_bolinao: Maskuladoyan lalaki kanya' maksaw ya.
sample_english: He has a muscular body and so he is strong.

meaning_english: To be shining clearly without any obstruction.
sample_bolinao: Maslag yay bulan kanya' mapalawayan a dalan abirno yabi.
sample_english: The moon is shining clearly and so the path is lighted even though it is night.

meaning_english: For an oyster shell to be open and have the edible part removed.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket makarwa yan litro nin talaba no maslak nay sayan lata nin talaba nin main bali.
sample_english: Juan is able to get two liters of oyster meat when he works on a can of oyster in their shells.

meaning_english: Snug, to be lack in space such as a tight fit or a small size such as in a dress, shoes, etc.
sample_bolinao: Maslet yay aysing ko.
sample_english: My dress is tight fitting.

meaning_english: To meet an unexpected or unwelcome occurrence such as rain or anger or an accident.

sample_english: Tell me what time you will arrive so that we can meet.

meaning_english: To happen to meet someone on the way.
sample_bolinao: Masnaan kwa a gwardya no mako ako sa iskol.
sample_english: I happen to meet the guard as I go to school.

meaning_english: To be irritated, exasperated or annoyed.
sample_bolinao: Masnep yan pirmi si Lilia sa tawo, kasan anos na gapo.
sample_english: Lilia is always irritated with people, she has no patience at all.

meaning_english: To be irritated by something.
sample_bolinao: Si Dan ket lukwen nayan pirmi si Sam kanya' masnepan si Sam koni Dan.
sample_english: Dan is always playing tricks on Sam and so it makes Sam irritated with Dan.

meaning_english: Sledge hammer, large hammer used to break up stones and concrete.
sample_bolinao: Usaren amasosa sayay ata'gay padir a para ipamagbag.
sample_english: Thissledge hammeris used to tear down high walls.

meaning_english: To be in a state of being fragile or breakable.
sample_bolinao: Ga'getan mon maong a baso tamaspakmo.
sample_english: Hold glasses tightly for you couldbreakthem..

meaning_english: To be crashed against something.
sample_bolinao: Sin kapresan ran mansumaki, bigra' a tribunada ana, ket si baluto ra manlumdeg yaynan maspakan nin burakan.
sample_english: While they were sailing, suddenly a sudden storm began, and so the boat was becoming swamped by the crashing white caps.

meaning_english: For a larger branch of a plant to be snapped off.
sample_bolinao: Madali' maspal a sanga nin sargwilas no ulien mo.
sample_english: The branches of the Spanish plum tree are easily broken off if you climb it.

meaning_english: For a smaller plant stems or branches, wood or plastic to be bent and snapped off.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka nin kumatin sa madidintek sanga tamaspi'.
sample_english: Don't hang on the small branches for they cansnap off.

meaning_english: For a brittle object such as glass to have a small piece chipped off.
sample_bolinao: Masping yay gaga'getan nin tagayan no manabo' ya sa tayls.
sample_english: The handle of the mug could get chipped if it falls on the tiles.

meaning_english: For something to be chipped or broken off from something.
sample_bolinao: Maspingan yay ayi nan tekrean no ika' ya sa ambo' patag.
sample_english: The chair leg gets chipped when it is put on a surface that is not flat.

meaning_english: To be broken off or split open.
sample_bolinao: Maspok a rabong nin birawen maong no kalapen.
sample_english: The bamboo shoots that are pulled hard when collecting break off.

meaning_english: To be able to enter through someplace.

sample_english: The robbers wereabletoget inour house.

meaning_english: To happen to be entered by something or into something.
sample_bolinao: Si Dios a sya ket masrepan nan usisaen a kanakman.
sample_english: God is the one who can enter in to examine the inner being.

meaning_english: To be suffocating because of a blockage in the air passages or lungs, especially a liquid.
sample_bolinao: Makapiku'ko' no masu'nepan nin ranom no mampinom.
sample_english: If water is choked on while drinking it will make one cough.

meaning_english: To be perceived as uneven or irregular in feel or process, not silky or smooth.
sample_bolinao: Masu'pet yan tumursi a bikoy nan ruran ta maslet ya.
sample_english: The wheel of the vehicle turns roughly since it is too tight.

meaning_english: To be opposed by an outside force such as wind or something taking away resources.
To be working against or be in violation of something and so be disobedient.

sample_english: When a child isdisobedientto his parents instruction, he will not be blessed.

meaning_english: To divided into subdivisions.

sample_english: The bigsubdivisionisdividedinto several lots for building many houses.

meaning_english: To be returning something.
sample_bolinao: Si Rose ket masubli' ya sa binle' nan byas sa kabaraybay na.
sample_english: Rose is returning with the equivalent rice she borrowed from her neighbor.

meaning_english: To be tested so as to prove.
sample_bolinao: Miuna'no koynanasuboka say kadadasal sa Dios ket ma'batan.
sample_english: I haveprovenfor many times that prayer to God is answered.

meaning_english: For something to be done excessively.

meaning_english: To have taken over the place of something, usually as a permanent change.

sample_english: They could not replace the vehicle in the parking slot beside us since the one had not yet left.

meaning_english: To be pure and precious.

sample_english: Children are very dear to Jesus.

meaning_english: To persist in an activity in order to attain a goal.

sample_english: He persisted in his studies since he wanted to improve his life.

meaning_english: To be gambling on things.
sample_bolinao: Kasan asinso ra nin tawon masugal.
sample_english: People that are gamblers have no upward progress.

meaning_english: To be wounded accompanied by bleeding.

sample_english: You with the bolo, put it down, you might get hurt.

meaning_english: To have been injured.
sample_bolinao: No masugatan ka nin mataey nin beneng matkap mon ika' sa duktor.
sample_english: If you get a wound from a rusty bolo you need to go to the doctor with it.

meaning_english: To be motivated to do something.
sample_bolinao: Kai raya masugsog nin kilaban si Mario.
sample_english: The opponents could not persuade Mario.

meaning_english: To have control another person.

sample_english: The wife has control over her husband.

meaning_english: To be measurable.

sample_english: The title to the land is needed for them to be able to measure it.

meaning_english: For something that has been left in an orderly and secure state to be searched through.
To minutely search out something.
sample_bolinao: Sumulpot a irgo nan Dios sa sangkaararman nan kararwa tan kanakman nan tawo tan masukisok na mataman et say sangkaadiwan ana nin man'isipen tan man'apesen tamo.
sample_english: The word of God pierces through the deepest parts of the soul and inner being of a person and it can extensively search/find out even that which is the most hidden of the things we are thinking and desiring.

meaning_english: To be able to pluck something out of an opening.
A check or money order change into bills or coins.
sample_bolinao: Nasuklian rayaynay tsiki mo?
sample_english: Did theyalreadychange your check?

meaning_english: To be reluctant to do something and so hesitate or not follow through or be submissive to that which is right.
sample_bolinao: Masuknadyan paakay kanya' kai ya makaadal.
sample_english: He refused to be taught, therefore he does not know anything.

meaning_english: For something to have been pierced and caused a wound or opening.

meaning_english: To desire something strongly and be eager and enthusiastic about it.

sample_english: He is eager to go to Manila.

meaning_english: To be pulled out with great force.
sample_bolinao: Kai kwa masulnot a latok nan damulag ko.
sample_english: I cannot pull out the stake for my carabao.

meaning_english: The characteristic of playfully teasing others about their relationship with someone.
sample_bolinao: Siin a tawo ketmasulonya.
sample_english: That person is amatchmaking tease.

meaning_english: To be skewered or have a pointed object pass through.
To have passed directly through from one place to another.

meaning_english: To be ignited or burst into flames.

sample_english: Straw can be ignited easily when it's dry.

meaning_english: To be caught in something.
To be following or doing what a person likes or says.

sample_english: They do not follow what the teacher has said since they don't fully understand it.

meaning_english: For something to be fumed with smoke as a means of preservation, fumigating or stimulation.

meaning_english: To be constricted, crowded or tight due to the smallness of size.

meaning_english: Missed each other, to failed to meet each other.

meaning_english: To be wrapped or bagged.
To have hives, a swelling and rash on the body.
For something to be bagged.
To has been written.

meaning_english: To be different from what is desired or said.

meaning_english: To be pricked, punctured or pierced by something such as a needle but not causing an open wound.

sample_english: A thorn poked me in the foot.

meaning_english: To obstinate.

meaning_filipino: Nagiisip lagi ng hinala at laging nigatibo.

sample_english: Julyita is suspicious of her companion/husband because her companion is so handsome.

meaning_english: To be suspected of something.

sample_english: He wassuspectedof robbery.

meaning_english: To be nutritious giving sustenance to the body.

meaning_english: To be able to follow through with one's values or what one has said.

sample_english: Ihopeyou cankeepyour word.

meaning_english: That which composes the end of something.

meaning_english: To be designated and authorized or given a right for something.

meaning_english: To be lucky or fortunate.

sample_english: I am lucky.

meaning_english: Beyond what is desirable, proper or right.

meaning_english: To whip someone with a stick.

sample_english: Be careful I mightwhipyou.

meaning_english: The center of a boil.

meaning_english: To be viewed or looked upon as displaying a certain character or way of doing something, probably not good.

sample_english: The tax collectors were viewed as despicably by theJewsand were considered sinners and traitors to their fellowJewsbecause they were hired by the Romano and they usually extorted excess taxes.

meaning_english: To be wading in the water.

meaning_english: To be dusty.

sample_english: It's dusty when it's hot season.

meaning_english: To be in the deep sea and far from shore.

meaning_english: To be tasteless like water, lacking salt, sugar, milk., etc.

meaning_english: How something is sliced or shaped.
To lead by the hand.

sample_english: Dan leads his child by the hand since he is teaching him to walk.

meaning_english: To driven out.

meaning_english: Rusty.

The characteristic of thievery displayed by a person.

sample_english: Salome wailed because a hundred thousand pesos of hers was stolen.

meaning_english: To trick and deceive someone.

meaning_english: To be swift, fast or quick in an activity such as speech.

meaning_english: To be cautious.
To be cautious and evade or keep something from happening.
To stacked rows.

meaning_english: For an event to seldom happen.

To be trusting or have confidence in something.

meaning_english: To be caught in quicksand.

meaning_english: To be known around.

meaning_english: To be divided into groups.

To get that which was intentionally left.
Lanky, akwardly long and thin.

meaning_english: Firm, not easily moved physically or in one's convictions.

meaning_english: For something to be grasped and held tightly.

meaning_english: To be comprehending or understanding something in general.

meaning_english: To understand something specific.

meaning_english: For something to happen to a plant in an untimely manner, such as a leaf or fruit to be prematurely dry because it was ripened by heat or by placing it in the sun before it was ready and so withers or is sour.

sample_english: And so the famous city, it split into three pieces and all of the cities here on earth were destroyed.

meaning_english: A one year old thing or animal.

meaning_english: To happen to call in a commanding way.

meaning_english: To be tasty or delicious.

meaning_english: To be full of people, crowded.

meaning_english: Able to have been scattered.

meaning_english: The characteristic of slow moving and not prompt.

meaning_english: To move slowly.

meaning_english: The feeling or irritation of having a sliver in the skin as you pass a finger over it.

meaning_english: To be sewn.

meaning_english: For  tiny particles to have been skimmed off from a liquid.

meaning_english: To be reciprocated for something.

sample_english: Now, Jesus said to the Pariseo who invited him, <<If you prepare for a banquet, it is not your friends, your siblings, your relatives, and your rich neighbors that you invite, for they will able to invite you in return and so you will have been recompensed.

meaning_english: Reciprocate to someone, to pay back, to make up, To compensate for anything given.

meaning_english: For something to have evidence of growth.

meaning_english: To happen to fall down or topple over.

meaning_english: Muddy.

meaning_english: To be pushing right up close to something and perhaps bumping it.

meaning_english: To live around together.
