sample_english: It was renowned for its vast commerce, for the many kinds of religion, and sadly/incidentally/ironically because of the great number of men and women there that just lived together outside of marriage.

meaning_english: To live together without legally being married (live-in).
meaning_filipino: Kirida; kalunya; Magpisan; magsama na hindi kasal.
sample_bolinao: Mi'yansaraynan sayay bulan kai sara et nikasal.
sample_english: Theylived togetherfor one month without legally being married.

meaning_english: To have the reciprocal relationship of being the parent's of a married couple.
sample_bolinao: Kai sara et nakapi'kit amiabalayanta midayo' a kami'nan ra.
sample_english: Theparents-in-law have not yet had the opportunity to see each other because their residence are far apart.

meaning_english: To fan oneself with a foldable fan.
sample_bolinao: Miabaniko ka no ma'mot a ingar mo.
sample_english: If you're feeling hot, fan yourself.

meaning_english: To make a mistake that leads to a wrong.
sample_bolinao: Pakanda' ka ta sali' nomiabaska sa dalan mo.
sample_english: Be careful since it might be that you wouldtakethewrongpath.

meaning_english: For someone tostockor store a particular food item to subsist on for a period of time.
sample_bolinao: Miabastokaynan byas.
sample_english: You stock rice for yourfuture subsistence.

meaning_english: To sit or stand along side.
sample_bolinao: Miabay sara si Maria tan Julieta nin nakatekre' sa mutor sa taaw sin rinmuran sara.
sample_english: When they got on the motorboat, Maria an Julieta sat beside each other.

meaning_english: Therelation of two or more persons married to two or more brothers or sisters, or a brother andsister.
To wear a priest's habit.
sample_bolinao: Miabito ya si Fr. Burgos abirno mikadaw ya tamo' sa baraybay nan simbaan.
sample_english: Fr. Burgos wears a habit even when he just take a walk around the yard of the church.

meaning_english: For someone or something tocome to a point of convergence withsomeone or something (lorefmi= =an).
sample_bolinao: Miabot palayi anggan abay a gasulina moyo?
sample_english: I wonder if your gas will last till we get to the shore.

meaning_english: To embrace each other.
sample_bolinao: Miabrasasara ta sabtan tuloy iliw ran na'teng nin kai ni'kitan.
sample_english: Theyembracedeach other for they longed deeply from not seeing each other for a long time.

meaning_english: To clasp one another's arms.
sample_bolinao: Saray miamiga ket miabrasyiti sara no mibayli saran mirngan.
sample_english: The lady friends link one another's arms when they dance together.

meaning_english: For something to open to examination and use.
sample_bolinao: Awro saraynan miabri nin tindawan ra ni Pedro.
sample_english: Now is the day they will open Pedro's store.

meaning_english: To wear shawl.
sample_bolinao: Miabrigoako no maray'ep.
sample_english: Iusemyshawlwhen its cold.

meaning_english: To be sharp and frightening in front of someone.
sample_bolinao: Si Dan ket miabu-abusado ya sa adapan ran a'nak na ta pigaw mititinek saray a'nak.
sample_english: Dan is sharp in front of his children so that they will be quiet.

meaning_english: To reach some point together.
sample_bolinao: Matkap a miabutansaray mitraasawa.
sample_english: A couple should be understandingof each other.

meaning_english: To be studying something together.
sample_bolinao: Miadalan kami nin miaamigo maipa'ka' sa silpon.
sample_english: We friends studied about the cellphone together.

meaning_english: To face each other or be brought before someone.
sample_bolinao: Namugsay saraynamaet bale' niadap saran tekrean.
sample_english: They rowed again but they were facing each other on the seats.

meaning_english: To face each other out of respect for other people.
sample_bolinao: Miadapankamo pa ta pigaw maalilbi' ma.
sample_english: Faceeach other so that you can recognize him.

meaning_english: Mutually love one another.
sample_bolinao: Binibilin nasara nin ina a a'nak na ba'yo ya nin nati a miaduan sara.
sample_english: The mother admonished her children before she died to love one another.

meaning_english: To wear a decorated hair pin in the hair.
sample_bolinao: Miaguhilya ka pigaw mabistay kikit sabot mo.
sample_english: Wear a decorated hairpin so that your hair will looks nice.

meaning_english: Two people having the same names.
To trim or shave one's hair.
sample_bolinao: Miahit yan pirmi nin kiri na si Rizza.
sample_english: Rizza always trims her eyebrows.

meaning_english: For two people to cry for each other.
sample_bolinao: Miakisan sara tana a mibsat nin ulila sa pannuksa-duksa' nan magsyuman konra no kasa ya si tatay ra.
sample_english: The orphaned siblings just cry for one another over their stepmother's maltreatment of them when their father is away.

meaning_english: To haul something with oneself.
sample_bolinao: Kumayam saraytin pirmi nin miakot kanen ra sa kamainan ra.
sample_english: These are crawling things that are always hauling loads of there food to their residence.

meaning_english: To wear jewelry.
sample_bolinao: Mayaman saran talaga ta abirno mako ya tamo' mamalingki ket mialahas ya et.
sample_english: They are truly rich for even when she soes to the market she is still wearing jewelry.

meaning_english: To eat something from a common plate feeding place.
sample_bolinao: Mialem kamin ari ko no mi'sa ta kurang a palaton no mangan.
sample_english: Sometimes because we are short of plates when we eat, my younger sibling and I eat off the same plate.

meaning_english: To fit together perfectly.
sample_bolinao: Mialep maong a purta sa hamba.
sample_english: The door fits the jam well.

meaning_english: To take care of oneself.
To be getting to know each other.
sample_bolinao: Mampialilbiansara ta na'teng anan kai sara ni'kitan.
sample_english: They are getting reacquainted for it has been a long time since they have seen each other.

meaning_english: Put one's hair in a bun.
sample_bolinao: Mialipugo saray main anron sabot.
sample_english: Those who have long hair have their hair put in a bun.

meaning_english: To move itself.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya nialis a bapor ta naisadsad ya.
sample_english: The ship could notmovebecause it has run aground.

meaning_english: To apply camphorated oil.
sample_bolinao: Mampialkampurado ako ta maray'ep yaynay panaon.
sample_english: I am applying camphorated oil because the weather is becoming cooler.

meaning_english: To lay the head on a pillow.
sample_bolinao: Mialunanka no ma'lek ka.
sample_english: Use apillowwhen you sleep.

meaning_english: To accompany or go with someone on a journey to a common destination.
sample_bolinao: Mabista amialuyonkamon mako sa Ibali.
sample_english: It is good that the two of yougo togetherto Manila.

meaning_english: To whip or hit each other with a whip, etc.
sample_bolinao: Sin ua'nak kami nin madidintek no miaaway kamin mibubsat si tatay mi ibarita' nanmiambakankami.
sample_english: When we were small chilren and when we siblings fight each other our father will tell us towhipeach other.

meaning_english: To wear rope footwear.
sample_bolinao: Maikaruskosyay muli' sa ungot no kai ya miambaker.
sample_english: One who climbs a coconut will easily slip and fall if he does not tie on climbing footwear.

meaning_english: To mutually share a responsibility, as of doing a task paying, an expense, or a benefit as of food.
sample_bolinao: Miamboskamoyna sa gastos ta pigaw may'anan kamo.
sample_english: You better share in the expenses so that you will not be burdened.

meaning_english: To be friends with one another.
sample_bolinao: Saray mibsat ket miamigo saran lamang.
sample_english: The siblings nevertheless are friends.

meaning_english: To wear a suit coat, jacket or overcoat.
sample_bolinao: Maray'ep sa liwa' kanya' miamirikana akon mako sa trabaho.
sample_english: It is cold out and so I wear an overcoat to go to work.

meaning_english: For school-age girls or older to act in a childish or silly way to get attention or what they want.
sample_bolinao: Makapoy amiampa-ampangyay sayay balasang.
sample_english: It's not nice that a young unmarried woman acts in achildishway.

meaning_english: Two things or people are positioned close alongside each other.
sample_bolinao: Miampadsaray parsuniyds tan si kapilya.
sample_english: The parsonage and the church arepositioned alongsideeach other.

meaning_english: For two people to take a common side in an issue or conflict.
sample_bolinao: Miampisara a mitraama kuntra koni Pedro.
sample_english: The father and childtook sidestogether against Pedro.

meaning_english: To have the reputation for bragging.
sample_bolinao: Miampu-ampogya tanan pirmi si Danilo.
sample_english: Danilo is constantlybragging.

meaning_english: Rub liniment on oneself.
sample_bolinao: Miamris ka nin kampor pigaw kai ka maray'epan.
sample_english: Rub your body with camphor oil so that you will not feel cold.

meaning_english: To act like a child.
meaning_filipino: Kumilos o mag-isip na parang bata.
sample_bolinao: Mianak-anakya sa piaaysing na.
sample_english: She dress likeshe'sagirl.

meaning_english: To whisper or murmur together about something.
sample_bolinao: Mianasan kamo no mag'irgo kamo sa luob simbaan.
sample_english: You whisper to one another if you talk inside the church.

meaning_english: For a person to pretend to refuse but in reality want it very much.
sample_bolinao: Miandi-andi'ya nin kipangan si Juan anta gustu-gusto na.
sample_english: Juan feigned not liking to join in the meal but in fact he would like to very much.

meaning_english: To speak with nasalized twang.
To wear something such as hair long.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' para nin kusto a man'ibarita' ran makapading'ey a mianro yan sabot a sayay lalaki?
sample_english: Isn’t it correct what they say that it is shameful if a man wears long hair?

meaning_english: To be patient with each other.
sample_bolinao: Mianusan kamo kadi' ta pigaw nin matinek a byay moyon mikalamo' nin rwa.
sample_english: Please be patient with each other so that you two live in a peaceful companionship.

meaning_english: To act childishly fond of someone, usually in order to get your way.
sample_bolinao: Miapak-apak ya si Mario konan nanay na ta plano nan kidawat nin kwarta.
sample_english: Mario is buttering up his mother for his plan is to ask for money.

meaning_english: To have the same family name.
sample_bolinao: Miapilyido sara si Sam tan si Juan mataman kai sara nin pariho nin nasyon.
sample_english: Sam and Juan have the same family name even though they are not the same nationality.

meaning_english: To rub oneself with something.
sample_bolinao: Miapros akon agwardyinti sa lalaman ta pigaw nin mati saray mikrubyo.
sample_english: I'll rub my body with alcohol in order to kill germs.

meaning_english: To wear something inside out.
sample_bolinao: Miardabis yan aysing si Juan no masama' yaynay adapan nin aysing na bana' sa tupa'.
sample_english: Juan wears his clothing inside out when it gets dirty on the outside because of the mud.

meaning_english: To be making excuses and alibis and putting the blame on someone else.
sample_bolinao: Miardilan saray mibsat no mamaki' ya si nanay ra.
sample_english: The siblings make excuses when their mother sends them on an errand.

meaning_english: To kiss one another.
sample_bolinao: Main nin tutawo nin kaugalian ra a miarek no makapi'kit sara.
sample_english: There are people who have the custom to kiss one another when they meet/see each other.

meaning_english: To pretend to be somebody important.
sample_bolinao: Andi' miari-aristukrata ta kai tanda' sa adapen a awro.
sample_english: Do notpretendto be a somebody for you do not know the future.

meaning_english: For two conflicting parties to make arrangements to settle their differences in a peaceful way with the help of a mediator like a lawyer, baranggay captain, etc.
sample_bolinao: Miariglo kamo pigaw kasaynan away.
sample_english: Settle peacefully the misunderstanding so that there will be no more quarrel.

meaning_english: To arm oneself with weapons.
sample_bolinao: Miarmas kamo no makilaban kamo.
sample_english: Arm yourselves if you will be in a fight.

meaning_english: To fight using martial arts.
sample_bolinao: Miarnis ya si Juan no kilaban ya konran bartek.
sample_english: Juan uses martial arts if he fights with drunkards.

meaning_english: To hold on one's lap.
sample_bolinao: Miaruko kamon ari mo ta main keen ko.
sample_english: Hold your sister on your lap since I have somewhere to go.

meaning_english: To to scrape, grind or rub two things together to remove material.
To have sexual intercourse or coitus.
sample_bolinao: Miasawasaray mitraasawa.
sample_english: The husband and wife havesex.

meaning_english: To mutually care for each other.
sample_bolinao: Kai sara miasikaswan ta nakapisangkinian sara.
sample_english: They were not mutually looking after each other since they happened to have a disagreement.

meaning_english: To eat only salt and rice.
sample_bolinao: Miasin tanan mangan ta kasan isaliw nin kuna'.
sample_english: We eat just rice and salt for there is no money to buy fish.

meaning_english: To have something like coffee with sugar.
sample_bolinao: Miasukar ya si Dan no magkapi ya.
sample_english: When Dan has coffee he has it with sugar.

meaning_english: To be comrades.
sample_bolinao: Miatanodata li' konan siin a anak mon kalamo' mo.
sample_english: I hope we will beco-parentsby means of this child of your who is with you.

meaning_english: To argue, dispute or fight each other, verbally or physically in a noisy or angry way.
sample_bolinao: Niaway sara sin saytaw bale' nipasublian sarayna sawanin.
sample_english: They quarreled before but now they are reconciled.

meaning_english: To take care of animals for farming.
sample_bolinao: Miayep ya si Sam nin baka konra ta gulpin ipamakan na.
sample_english: Sam is caring for the cattle they have for there is a lot they are to be fed.

meaning_english: To go with.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya miayi nin mako sa Hundred Islands ta main dipirinsya nin pagrigla na.
sample_english: She cannot go with you to Hundred Islands because there is a irregularity in her monthly period.

meaning_english: Allied, to be joined together on the same side with the same goals.
sample_bolinao: Niayon saray mibsat sa diskusyon ran kabaraybay ra.
sample_english: The brothers are allied in the discussion with their neighbors.

meaning_english: To be in a good relationship.
sample_bolinao: Say risulbi mi, kusto ya kanya' sara niaayos ana.
sample_english: Our resolution was perfect and so they are now ok together.

meaning_english: Put on clothes.
sample_bolinao: Rabay koy miaysing nin batik.
sample_english: I want to wear a batik dress.

meaning_english: To make a mutual agreement about something.
sample_bolinao: Niayunan ray mako ampiknik sa mamuru-puro'.
sample_english: They agreed to have a picnic in Hundred Islands.

meaning_english: To wear or use something new.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket miba'yo yan aysing sindo bertdi na tan abidad.
sample_english: Juan puts on new clothes each birthday and Christmas.

meaning_english: Several animals fighting each other.
sample_bolinao: Nibabakbak saray aso.
sample_english: The dogs are fighting.

meaning_english: To alternately do something taking turns one after another.
sample_bolinao: Mibabale'kamon lumuob sa purta, andi' kamo mirirngan.
sample_english: Enter at the door alternately,do not go in at the same time.

meaning_english: To townmate.
To be a group in hanging out together and doing things together.
sample_bolinao: Mibabarkada saray nako nin naryo' sa ilog.
sample_english: They went as a gang to bathe in the river.

meaning_english: For many people to be intentionally throwing somethings at each other.
To raise and care for pigs.
sample_bolinao: Mibaboy ya si Sam pigaw main nin karniwen no bertdi na.
sample_english: Sam is raising a pig so that there will be meet to eat when its his birthday.

meaning_english: To have or carry a bag.
sample_bolinao: Mibag akon mako mag'adal sa iskol.
sample_english: Going to study at school, I take a bag along.

meaning_english: To come undone such as when a thread pulls out from its seam.
sample_bolinao: Mibagbaga tayi' nan aysing ta malukak.
sample_english: The stitching of the dress is coming out since it hanging loose.

meaning_english: To have a serious conflict in which someone likely gets physically hurt.
sample_bolinao: Naapon nibakal kamin bubsat.
sample_english: Yesterday we siblings had a serious conflict.

meaning_english: To look alike.
sample_bolinao: Mibakas saran maong a singin nin si Julieta tan si Tirisita.
sample_english: The twins Julieta and Tirisita look very much alike.

meaning_english: To fight, usually used on fighting animals (e.g., dogs, cat).
To fight over something.
sample_bolinao: Mita'ngalan saray aso nin mibakbakan bana' sa ma'kan.
sample_english: The dogs bit each other fighting over the food.

meaning_english: To wear wood sandals.
sample_bolinao: Mibakya' kami sa banyo.
sample_english: We wear wooden saddles in the bathroom.

meaning_english: To counter with a like attack.
meaning_filipino: Ang gawang maghiraman, magpalitan at magpahiram.
sample_bolinao: Mibal'an ta sa mutursiklo nin inawru-awro.
sample_english: The two of them reciprocate in using the motorcycle daily.

meaning_english: Ladylike, a young girl who acts and seem to be like a well mannered lady.
sample_bolinao: Mibala-balasangyayna anta anak ya et.
sample_english: She acts as if she is wellmannered ladyyet she is still young.

meaning_english: To bounce or rebound from something.
sample_bolinao: Mibalanra ya sa padir
sample_english: He bounced off the wall.

meaning_english: Carried something on shoulder or across the shoulders with pole.
sample_bolinao: Nibalatayyan rwan latan ranom nigmang sa abaya.
sample_english: He carried two cans of water on both ends of his shoulder.

meaning_english: To despise others.
sample_bolinao: Andi'mibalaw-balawta sali' si'kay mabal'an.
sample_english: Dontdespisethem you might be the one to be as they are.

meaning_english: To criticize one another.
sample_bolinao: Mibalawan saray mikaklasi no miaway sara.
sample_english: The classmates criticize each other when they fight.

meaning_english: For two or more persons to beat each other using a big piece of wood or club.
sample_bolinao: Mampibalbalansaray rwa katawo.
sample_english: The two people are clubbing each other.

meaning_english: To do something alternately.
sample_bolinao: Mibale' kamo nin manguroy konan kawayan pigaw kai kamo nin madali' nin kumagal."
sample_english: Alternate pulling the bamboo so you don't quickly become exhausted.

meaning_english: To set up house so as to live in it.
meaning_filipino: Tumira sa bahay, at gagawa ng bahay.
sample_bolinao: Mibali ako sa danin pantalan ta sa taaw a paningkapan ko.
sample_english: I have put up my house close to the dock since it is from the sea that I get my income.

meaning_english: To wear or use ornaments made of gold.
meaning_filipino: Magsuot ng alahas; isuot ang alahas.
sample_bolinao: Mibalitokya ta mako ya sa pista nin babali.
sample_english: She wears her gold jewelry because she will attend the town fiesta.

meaning_english: To change the essence of something such as fermenting or aging.
sample_bolinao: Mag'in nin suka' a tuba' no mibaliw.
sample_english: Palm juice becomes vinegar when it is fermented.

meaning_english: To do the things that show that one is in mourning such as wearing black.
sample_bolinao: Masurok anan sayan linggo a mibaliwan konran namatyan.
sample_english: It is over a week now that the mourning of the dead has been going on .

meaning_english: To take provision, such as food, on a journey.
sample_bolinao: Andi' kamo ninmibalonnin kwarta, mataman a sintimo.
sample_english: Do not take any supply of money with you, not even a centavo.

meaning_english: To exaggeratedly pretend something.
sample_bolinao: Main sara li' isen komoyo a mibalu'-balo' a tutuon mangangakay sara.
sample_english: There will be there among you those who make a pretense that they are true teachers.

meaning_english: To bump or collide with something.
sample_bolinao: Mangararay ka no mibangga' yay ruroy mon matib'ey nin bagay.
sample_english: You will feel sharp pain if your shin collides with a hard object.

meaning_english: For two to bump against each other.
sample_bolinao: Mibanggaansaraynay misna' nin dyip.
sample_english: The jeepneys will meet collide with each other.

meaning_english: To get up from resting.
sample_bolinao: Mibangonkayna sa idaan mo ta mako kayna magtrabaho.
sample_english: Get upfrom your bed, and go to work now.

meaning_english: To trip and fall because of anything.
sample_bolinao: Nibanlogya sin nasakin nayay alakin bato.
sample_english: He tripped and fell when he stubbed his feet on abigstone.

meaning_english: To well known.
sample_bolinao: Sawanin kayna magbabawi' sin nibantog kayna sa Tugi.
sample_english: Its now that you are repenting, now when you are well known in Tugi.

meaning_english: To take a sponge bath.
sample_bolinao: Mibanyos ya si Dan no ma'mot ya ta ilagen nay maryo'.
sample_english: Dan takes a sponge bath when he is hot since he avoids a bath.

meaning_english: To be neighbors of each other.
sample_bolinao: Mibaraybay kami tamo' ni Pedro kanya' ibati' moyna a surat na kongko.
sample_english: Pedro and we are neighbors and so leave his letter with me.

meaning_english: To reside someplace as neighbors.
sample_bolinao: Mibaraybay sara si Sam tan si Juan kanya' mitulungan sara.
sample_english: Sam and Juan are neighbors and so they help each other out.

meaning_english: To shave your own facial hair.
sample_bolinao: Mibarbas ya si Juan usar a bliyd sindo Linggo.
sample_english: Juan shaves his face each Sunday with a razor blade.

meaning_english: To lift weights, especially a barbell.
sample_bolinao: Mibarbil si Dan ta rabay nan umalaki a lalaman na.
sample_english: Dan lifts weights since he wants to build up his body.

meaning_english: Startle from sleep, sudden awaking and getting up from bed, To jump up from a lying position, to be jolted upright from laying position, perhaps by something falling or someone coming. Like you were asleep.
meaning_filipino: Balikwas; biglang pagbangon sa higaan; Bumalikwas.
sample_bolinao: Mibarikwas ta narnge' kon nitawag ra ngaran mo.
sample_english: You jump up from our bed because I heard your name called.

meaning_english: To wear a belt.
sample_bolinao: Matkap koy mibarkes ta ma'beng a awak ko ket manabo' a butarga ko.
sample_english: I have to wear a belt since my waist is slim and so my trousers will fall down.

meaning_english: To bind something on oneself.
sample_bolinao: Mibarkot kaynan aysing mo ta mibwat tayna.
sample_english: Put on your clothes (bundle up); we will leave now.

meaning_english: To wear a Filipino style formal shirt.
sample_bolinao: Mibarong ya si Juan no pakasal yay busat na.
sample_english: Juan wore a barong to the wedding of his grother.

meaning_english: To apply Vaseline.
sample_bolinao: Mibasilina pigaw masileng a sabot.
sample_english: Vaseline is put on so that the hair is shiny.

meaning_english: To play basketball.
sample_bolinao: Isyot kwa a bula sa ring no mibaskitbol.
sample_english: I shoot the ball through the ring when playing basketball.

meaning_english: To use a cane.
sample_bolinao: Mibaston yayna si laking nin lumalako ta makapoy anay tuod na.
sample_english: Grandfather uses a cane to walk since his knees are weak.

meaning_english: To put on a robe or a long, loose outer garment.
sample_bolinao: Ugali' na ni Carla a mibata yapo' no kayadi' na nin naryo' leg'an a mampimik'ap ya.
sample_english: It is Carla's habit to wear a robe first after taking a bath while she is putting make up on.

meaning_english: For the potency of something, usually a fragrance, to dissipate.
sample_bolinao: Kasan sirbi nan agwa nomibawbawyayna.
sample_english: The perfume is useless when itlosesits essence.

meaning_english: To do a dance either with a partner or a group.
sample_bolinao: Mibayli kami nin tinikling.
sample_english: We danced the bamboo dance together.

meaning_english: To cover a part of the body with anything such as a G-string or anything to protect the body.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket mibengbeng yan twalya no lumason ya sa mutursiklo.
sample_english: Juan covers part of the motorcycle with a towel when he has a rider.

meaning_english: To gossip.
sample_bolinao: Mibere-beresara tanan pirmi nin rwa kasa gapon gawa' ra.
sample_english: They alwaysmurmurto each other without doing anything.

meaning_english: To carry someone such as a child in the arms or around the waist.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket mibibi yan ari na no mamasyar sara sa pantalan.
sample_english: Juan carries his younger sibling when they visit the pier.

meaning_english: To play bingo together.
sample_bolinao: Saray mitraamigo ket mibibinggo sara no yabina.

sample_english: All those who were there were amazed and so they were saying to each other, <<This new teaching is really different/unique!>>

meaning_english: Resentment leading to complaining with regard to working with others.
sample_bolinao: Miiritansara nin magtrabaho ta si saya wana abaw anay nagawa' ko.
sample_english: Theyenvyeach other in working because one said, I have already finished several works, while she has not finished even one.

meaning_english: To fence with weapons.
sample_bolinao: Miiskrima sara no main kuntis.
sample_english: If there is a contest, they fence with each other.

meaning_english: To look at oneself in a mirror.
sample_bolinao: No miispiho ya si Rose ket maldi' yan palaway nan apoy nan bumbilya kanya' kai na ma'kit maong a bakas na.
sample_english: When Rose looks at herself in the mirror, the intense light of the bulb reflects and hits her and so she cannot see her image well.

meaning_english: To stick fight each other.
sample_bolinao: Mangusar kamin ispada no miistuki kami.
sample_english: We use swords of we are stick fighting.

meaning_english: To tell each other stories.
sample_bolinao: Si Rose tan si Ron ket miisturyawan sara ba'yo sara ma'lek.
sample_english: Rose and Ron tell each other stories before they go to sleep.

meaning_english: Make up, substances used to beatify the face and body.
sample_bolinao: Kurang a dismula nin mik'ap na ni Kardo kanya' nin naalilbi' rayan pulis.
sample_english: The makeup of Kardo's disguise was insufficient and so the police recognized him.

meaning_english: Us-not-you and you singular.
sample_bolinao: Tiningkap mika.
sample_english: We searched for you.

meaning_english: To go or come with someone.
sample_bolinao: Nipaibarita' na konan kaklasyan na ibarita' na konan maistro na ta kai ya mika' sa klasi na.
sample_english: He told his classmate to tell his teacher what he said since he will not go with to his class.

meaning_english: To be making out that one is clever.
sample_bolinao: Mikabat-kabatya anta kasan tanda' na.
sample_english: He ismaking out to be cleverbut he knows nothing.

meaning_english: To ride horseback.
sample_bolinao: Mikabayo nin pirmi a maksaw nin sundalo' sin nu'nan panaon.
sample_english: In the early times the great soldiers always rode a horse.

meaning_english: To be close to one another.
sample_bolinao: Mikadani sara si Maria tan si Sam sin rinmuran sara sa bas.
sample_english: Sam and Maria move close to one another when they had gotten on the bus.

meaning_english: Roaming around, perhaps to visit someone, or sell something.
sample_bolinao: Si Kalaban moyo a sya a Dimunyo ket bara'mo ya nin mabayani nin leon a mampikadaw nin maningkap nin masinan na.
sample_english: Your Enemy who is the Devil is like a ferocious lion which is roaming around searching for something to ravish.

meaning_english: To be far from each other.
sample_bolinao: Siiliw akoyna konan nanay ko ta mikadayo' kami.
sample_english: I am homesick for my mother for we are far apart from each other.

meaning_english: One to pretend to be pitiful, to act, pitiful, feeling as if pitiful, pretend to be bad off.
sample_bolinao: Mikadu'-kado'ya anta abaw kwarta na.
sample_english: She is pretending to be pitiful but she has much money.

meaning_english: Do something the whole day, from morning until nighttime.
sample_bolinao: Mikakaawroakon nagtrabaho.
sample_english: I worked thewhole day.

meaning_english: To entire morning, The whole morning.
sample_bolinao: Mikakabuklasa nangaykay akon libed bali.
sample_english: The wholemorningI swept around the yard of the house.

meaning_english: To join together in a group and act as one.
sample_bolinao: Ket si Dimunyo nin nangibarang konra, ibantak yadtaw li' sa alawang nin luong nin burung-burong nin asupri nin nangibantakan konan makapali'mon ayep tan si mampibula'-bula' a prupita, ket itaw mikakalamo' saran padya'dyaen sa awro tan yabi anggan-angga.
sample_english: And then the Dimunyo who led them astray, he will be flung there in the wide wallow of blazing sulfur where the terrifying animal and the lying prophet were cast, and so there they will be in the company of each other in torment day and night forever.

meaning_english: The whole night long.
sample_bolinao: Mikakayabinin kasan elek no main lamay.
sample_english: For thewhole night,nobody sleeps during a vigil.

meaning_english: The one's that someone is in class and studying with..
sample_bolinao: Mampi'daman saran libro a mikaklasi.
sample_english: The classmates borrow each others books.

meaning_english: Stop talking and calm down.
sample_bolinao: Mikaklek a ka'bawan no isen yaynay maistro mi.
sample_english: The whole class quiets down when our teacher is there.

meaning_english: To do something together, may imply sexually or to marry.
sample_bolinao: Nikalamo'kamin rwa anggan babali.
sample_english: We wenttogetheruntil the town.

meaning_english: To play the game of kalit.
For an animal to be in heat, sexual drives.
sample_bolinao: Mikalkal yay takong.
sample_english: The sow is in heat.

meaning_english: To walk barefoot.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka mikalla-ayi ta bangli' lumnok a ayi mo.
sample_english: Don't walk barefooted for your feet might blister.

meaning_english: To wear a sheath for a knife.
sample_bolinao: Mikaluban ya si Sam no awit nayay beneng na no mako ya nin mamukan nin kayo.
sample_english: Sam puts on a sheath when he is carrying his bolo when he goes to chop wood.

meaning_english: To chase each other.
sample_bolinao: Mikamat saray aso tan pusa' no miaway sara.
sample_english: The dog and cat chase each other when they fight.

meaning_english: To be related to each other.
sample_bolinao: Mikanayonkami bale' kai kami mitandaan.
sample_english: We arerelated to each otherbut we are not acquainted with each other.

meaning_english: To be related one with the other in a family.
sample_bolinao: Kai sara magwa' kasalen si Dan tan si Rose ta mikanayunan sara namain.
sample_english: Dan and Rose cannot marry for it was found out that they are related.

meaning_english: Mechanic, a person who is an expert in machines.
sample_bolinao: Sarba ra nin mampag'adal mikaniko, tanda' ray mamaandar nin makina.
sample_english: All of those who study mechanics know how an engine operates.

meaning_english: Ridicule or make fun of someone to see how they react.
sample_bolinao: Ampikantyawansara ta kiten ra no si'noy maong konra.
sample_english: Each one tries toteaseeach other to find out who is better among them.

meaning_english: To pretend not to know.
sample_bolinao: Mikanu-kanoyan kai na tanda'.
sample_english: Shepretendsto know nothing.

meaning_english: Put on cloak or towel.
sample_bolinao: Mikapa ka tan mayi ka kongko.
sample_english: Put on your cloak and come with me.

meaning_english: To drink coffee.
sample_bolinao: Sakitan akon tyan no mikapi ako.
sample_english: My stomach hurts when I drink coffee.

meaning_english: To be and take action on being rivals of someone.
sample_bolinao: Migulo sara mana a mikaribal nin grupo no makapi'kit sara.
sample_english: The rivaling groups will scuffle again if they happen to see each other.

meaning_english: To be sparring or strutting one's agility.
sample_bolinao: Mampikaridkidan sara si Jose tan si Dado'.
sample_english: Jose and Dado' are mutually sparring around each other.

meaning_english: To caress and court each other.
sample_bolinao: Ilis saraynan ilis a mitradamag no mikarinyo sara.
sample_english: Sweethearts giggle and giggle when the caress each other.

meaning_english: For more than two people to love one another.
To enfold one's arms around oneself or another.
sample_bolinao: Saray mampibuksing no mi'sa ket mikawel sara sa ring.
sample_english: Sometimes those that are boxing will clench one another in the ring.

meaning_english: To grasp around something tightly with the arms.
sample_bolinao: Mikawelan saray raruman tawo nin mibutsing anggan mabalda sara.
sample_english: Some boxers clasp onto the other person when they are getting exhausted.

meaning_english: For something to get tangled up on itself.
sample_bolinao: Kasabyan makalap ko nin kuna' no mangawil ket nikawing.
sample_english: Commonly, when I fish with a line, it has gotten all tangled up.

meaning_english: To walk with a limp because of an injury or pain.
sample_bolinao: No maray'ep, mikdo' yay saya bisit ko.
sample_english: When the weather is cold, one of my legs gives way in pain.

meaning_english: Noodles made from saline wheat dough.
sample_bolinao: Lawukan mon karni tan urang amikiket mataway.
sample_english: Mix meat and shrimp with miki and it will taste good.

meaning_english: To close one's eyes for a period of time.
sample_bolinao: Mikidem ya si Juan no sum'et yan kasan antipara.
sample_english: Juan closes his eyes when swimming without goggles.

meaning_english: To get together to be with each other.
sample_bolinao: Mikiki'kit atamo li' sa babali no mamalingki atamo.
sample_english: Let's all see each other later in town when we are marketing.

meaning_english: To flex an opening of the body.
sample_bolinao: Mikimo' ya a labi' ni Rose no mayadi' yan mag'irgo.
sample_english: Rose's lips pucker when she finishes speaking.

meaning_english: To put on the traditional Philippine blouse.
To pencil on eyebrows.
To shave one's hair on the head, legs, armpit and other parts of the body.
sample_bolinao: Kai na nin magwa' a mikiskis nin bukod ni Bella.
sample_english: Bella is not able to shave herself.

meaning_english: To be with each other in class.
sample_bolinao: Miklasi kami ni Lina mangibwat sa griyd wan anggan naggradwit kami sa ilimintarya.
sample_english: Lina and I were together in class from grade one until we graduated from elementary.

meaning_english: For a thing to fold itself closed.
sample_bolinao: Saray bawburakmikmi'sara no yumabina.
sample_english: The flowersclosetheir petals at night.

meaning_english: To embrace each other or clasp one another.
sample_bolinao: Mikpel saray mitraasawa ta maray'ep.
sample_english: The couple embrace tightly because its cool.

meaning_english: For something to shrivel up.
sample_bolinao: Mikpes a raruman butiti no na'teng anan naika' sa luta'.
sample_english: Some globe-fish shrivel up when they happened to be on land for a long time.

meaning_english: To have been scrunched up, empty and withered.
sample_bolinao: Nikpit yay bungan buray ta naspal yay sanga na.
sample_english: The hyacinth beans withered up since the branches were snapped off.

meaning_english: Germs or microbes.
sample_bolinao: Usaren a mikruskupyo no rabay nin kikiten saraymikrubyo.
sample_english: Use a microscope to be able to see thegerms.

meaning_english: Mercurochrome.
sample_bolinao: Kwan man mikrukrom a sugat mo pigaw madali' yan umanda'.
sample_english: Put Mercurochrome on your wound so that it will heal quickly.

meaning_english: Microphone, a device that changes sound waves into electrical impulses and usually is used for amplification or recording of sound.
sample_bolinao: Kumsaw a tunoy no mag'irgo samikrupuno.
sample_english: The sound is strengthened when we speak through themicrophone.

meaning_english: Microscope, an instrument used in seeing minute organisms not seen by our naked eyes.
sample_bolinao: No main mikruskupyo ma'kit a maong a bakas ran mikrubyo.
sample_english: When there is a microscope we can see distinctly the appearance of the microbes.

meaning_english: A hand or electric mixer for mixing foods.
To have a cough, the sudden expulsion of air normally caused by an irritation or phlegm.
sample_bolinao: Miku'ko'ya ta gumuer ya.
sample_english: Hecoughsbecause he has gotten a cold.

meaning_english: To accidentally slip or skid or lose footing on a surface.
sample_bolinao: Mikubras a tsinilas sa babato no kayadi' rapeg.
sample_english: The slippers slip on the rocky areas after a rain.

meaning_english: To work together to use as little as possible of something.
sample_bolinao: Si Rose tan si Juan ket mikudisyawan sara sa ranom tan kuryinti nin man'usaren ra sa bali ra.
sample_english: Rose and Juan skimp on their use of water and electricity at their house.

meaning_english: To scratch, to use the fingernails to scratch any part of the body.
sample_bolinao: Andi' kamikudkodnin magate' sa lalaman mo.
sample_english: Do notscratchthe itch in your body.

meaning_english: To fall and get scraped.
sample_bolinao: Nikudrasako ta madalunot a dalan.
sample_english: I fell andgot scraped upsince the road was slippery.

meaning_english: To cut one's finger or toenails.
sample_bolinao: Mikukoka ta annunroyna a kuko mo.
sample_english: Cutyour nails they are now long.

meaning_english: To plot or conspire together to do something.
sample_bolinao: Si Adi' Herodes tan si Gubirnador Poncio Pilato tan saray kalalamo' ran ambo' nin Judio, tan pati anamaet nin saray kapada min Israelita, nikukumplot sara nin patyen ya a Aripen mon nitalaga nay byay na komo, sya si Jesus, tan sya a tinudo' mo nin Cristo.
sample_english: King Herod and Governor Pontius Pilate, and their non-Jewishcompanions, and including as well our fellow Israelites, they conspired to kill your Servant who dedicated his life to you , he is Jesus, and he is the Christ whom you have appointed.

meaning_english: To agree together.
sample_bolinao: ta abirno nin abaw saray nangibarita' nin bula'-bula' nin kuntra kona ket kai anamaet nin mikukumprunta a nibarita' nin saya sa saya.
sample_english: for even though many told lies against him their testimonies did not agree with one another.

meaning_english: To cover the body with just a piece of cloth.
sample_bolinao: Saray bubayi nin Negrito,nikulibengbengsara tamo'.
sample_english: The Negrito women used only a piece of cloth tocovertheir body.

meaning_english: Several persons talking so loud at the same time.
sample_bolinao: Mikulinyamsaray abaw a tutawon mampangan sa ristawran.
sample_english: The people in the restaurant aretalking loudly atthesame time.

meaning_english: To act comically in order to make people laugh.
sample_bolinao: Si Sam ket mikumik-kumik ya sa iskol no mi'sa kanya' rabay-rabay rayan istudyanti.
sample_english: Sam sometimes acts comical in school ans so the students really like him.

meaning_english: For a man to be in a relationship of co-father with someone by means of a ceremony.
sample_bolinao: Si Sam tan si Mario ket mikumpadri sara ta nanganak sara sa kasal.
sample_english: Sam and Mario are co-fathers since they have children through the wedding ceremony.

meaning_english: To be in a reciprocal co-father relationship.
sample_bolinao: Si Dan tan si Mars mikumpari sara ta nanganak sara sa binyag nan anak nan amigo ra.
sample_english: Dan and Mars are co-fathers to one another since they were baptismal sponsors to their friend's child.

meaning_english: To compete with each other.
sample_bolinao: Mikumpitinsya saran pirmi sa atinsyon nan matua ra.
sample_english: They are always competing for their parents attention.

meaning_english: To be in agreement together.
sample_bolinao: Mikumprunta a Pammatutuo na ni Jesus tan ni Ama na.
sample_english: Jesus and His Father's Confessions are in Agreement.

meaning_english: To gargle a liquid.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a arekeek ko no mikumukumo ako.
sample_english: My gurgling is loud when I gargle.

meaning_english: To greet each other by some means.
sample_bolinao: Mipasamanwan kamon mikumustawan nin mangipa'kit nin pilalabyan moyo nin mibubsat sa pammemper kona ni Cristo.
sample_english: Shake hands in greeting to show your love for the brethren in the faith in Christ.

meaning_english: For one's feet to slip and fall down, to lose footing on an unstable (such as gravel or a mountainside) or slippery place.
sample_bolinao: Palna-palna' ka ta sabtan dalunot sali'mikundaroska.
sample_english: Walk slowly, the floor is slippery and you mightslide.

meaning_english: To compete with each other.
sample_bolinao: Mikuntis kami nin amigo ko no si'noy mu'na nin mag'abrod.
sample_english: My friends and I are having a contest to see who will be the first to go abroad.

meaning_english: To oppose each other.
sample_bolinao: Mikuntra saran pinirmi si Juan tan Pasing.
sample_english: Juan and Pasing are always contradicting one another.

meaning_english: To put on hat.
sample_bolinao: Mikya' ka ta pigaw kai ka maamugan.
sample_english: Put on a hat so that you will no be exposed to the coldness of the mist.

meaning_english: For a leg or a leg of furniture to fall into or break through a hole.
sample_bolinao: Pakanda' ka tamikura'botkadsen sa ubot.
sample_english: Be careful you mightstep intothat hole.

meaning_english: To wear a necktie.
To tie or use a cord for something.
sample_bolinao: Mikurdon ako konan ba'yon sapatos ko.
sample_english: I tie my new shoes with a cord.

meaning_english: To wear a bodice.
sample_bolinao: Mikurpinyopigaw kai suminag no isulot yay kimuna.
sample_english: Kamisaisworeso that the breast is not transparent.

meaning_english: To use spoon.
sample_bolinao: Saray Intsik kai sara mikutsara' no kai usaren ray sipit.
sample_english: The Chinese do not use spoon when eating but chopsticks.

meaning_english: With an arm over the companions shoulder.
sample_bolinao: Mikuyabasaran pirmi no lumalako sara.
sample_english: Whenever they walk, hisarmisoverhis companionsshoulder.

meaning_english: To wear a necklace.
sample_bolinao: Mikwintasya tamo' no itya sa babali na bale' no mako sa Manila kai.
sample_english: She wears her necklace only while in her own town but not in Manila.

meaning_english: Put on a dagger.
sample_bolinao: Mikya'ka.
sample_english: Take your dagger.

meaning_english: One thousand.
sample_bolinao: Si luta' ko, main sanla' nan bayinti mil.
sample_english: My land has a mortgage of twenty thousand.

meaning_english: To get snared or caught in a situation.
To fight with each other as opponents.
sample_bolinao: Saray anak,milabansara.
sample_english: The children fight with each other.

meaning_english: For someone or something to pass near by.
sample_bolinao: Nomilabasyay bagyo, mapalaway yaynay awro.
sample_english: When the typhoon is gone, the sun shone brightly.

meaning_english: To gossip, to talk about others.
sample_bolinao: Andi'milabid-labidno ambo' tutuo.
sample_english: Do not spread the talk if is not true.

meaning_english: To do twelve times.
sample_bolinao: Gumungayti nin milabinrwa sa sayay taon, mi'sa binulan-bulan.
sample_english: These bore fruit twelve times a year, once monthly.

meaning_english: Remove clothes.
sample_bolinao: Milabos a tawo no silyan a seket nin pangyupa'.
sample_english: A person gets naked when he changes his karsunsilyo.

meaning_english: To overflow from a container such as a bucket being filled.
sample_bolinao: Mampilabwa' yaynay timba' kanya' inrep kwaynay gripo.
sample_english: The bucket is overflowing and so I have shut off the faucet.

meaning_english: Miracle, wonderful happening that is above, against or independent of the known laws of nature.
sample_bolinao: Similagroa ginawa' ni Jesus, si namasubli' yan mabyay nin nati.
sample_english: Themiraclethat Jesus did, he returned the dead to life.

meaning_english: Miraculous female saint.
sample_bolinao: Babayinmilagrusa.
sample_english: Miraculouswoman.

meaning_english: To sell things to each other.
sample_bolinao: Milakuan sara a miamigo nin bagay a matkap ra.
sample_english: The friends are selling each other the things they need.

meaning_english: For more than two people to love one another.
sample_bolinao: ...kasayna angangkon matkap et nin isurat mi komoyo ta niyakay nakamoyna nin Dios ta pigaw nin milalabyan kamo.
sample_english: ...there is I assume nothing need to write you for God has already taught you in order for you to love one another.

meaning_english: Confident dependence on someone or something.
sample_bolinao: Saray ua'nak, milalo saran pirmi konran mangatua ra.
sample_english: Children constantly depend upon their parents.

meaning_english: To assure each other about something.
sample_bolinao: Si Dios a namasubli' nin mabyay kona ni Cristo tan nangipata'gay kona ta pigaw nin syan diri nin si Dios a mampagmatalkan tan mampilalwan moyo.
sample_english: It was God that brought Christ back to life and exalted him in order that it would be God himself you would be putting your trust and confidence in.

meaning_english: To use a lamp.
sample_bolinao: Milampadawan sara si Juan no kasan kuryinti.
sample_english: Juan's family uses a lamp when there is no electricity.

meaning_english: To fellowship and talk together.
sample_bolinao: Si'kamon mibaraybay ket milangenlangen kamo mataman mirwa sa sayay linggo.
sample_english: You who are neighbors, get together and enjoy each other even if its twice a week.

meaning_english: To lay something in an exposed position flat on the ground.
sample_bolinao: Nilangtadyay tawo sa rigrig baybay udino nati ya.
sample_english: Either the person is lying flat on his back on the shore or he is dead.

meaning_english: To deceitfully show off.
sample_bolinao: Milangtaw si Kardoy sa adapan nin Juan bana' ta mas alaki a lalaman na.
sample_english: Kardoy is blowing his own horn in front of Juan since he is big

meaning_english: Rolling sound produced by a bass drum, tom-tom, etc.
sample_bolinao: Marnge' koymilanibognintambor.
sample_english: I can hear therolling of drums.

meaning_english: Succession of explosion of guns or explosives.
sample_bolinao: Milanibonga tunoy palsot no ba'yon taon.
sample_english: Thesound of a barrage of gunswere heard during new year.

meaning_english: The heavy sound such as when stomping on the floor.
sample_bolinao: Milanitoga ayi ran lumalako.
sample_english: Thesoundof theirfootstepsare heavy.

meaning_english: Feeble, weak, lacking in physical strength.
sample_bolinao: Milantungeyya ta kai ya nangapon tan namuklas.
sample_english: He feelstoo weakbecause he did not have supper and breakfast.

meaning_english: To overflow something because of not being able to be contained.
sample_bolinao: Milapwas yaynay lata a nisalod ko sa gripo.
sample_english: The collection can I placed under the faucet is overflowing.

meaning_english: To ride together straddling something.
sample_bolinao: Si Dan tan si Mars ket milason sara sa mutor no mako sara sa iskol.
sample_english: Dan and Mars ride together on the motorcycle when they go to school.

meaning_english: One who talks about himself and shows pride.
sample_bolinao: Andi'milastu-lastogpigaw kai raka kursunadawen.
sample_english: Do not be too proud so that others will not hate you.

meaning_english: To have a thirst.
sample_bolinao: Mabitil ako tanmilata'ako.
sample_english: I am hungry andI need a drink.

meaning_english: Salivate, To produce saliva due to external forces.
sample_bolinao: Milawawako no maka'kit akon mampangan maalsem nin prutas.
sample_english: Isalivatewhen I see somebody eating sour fruit.

meaning_english: To mix with something.
sample_bolinao: Si kulor a milawok yay tsukulati tan kulor abunsyang.
sample_english: The color of the mix of brown and grey.

meaning_english: To use a sail to run the boat.
sample_bolinao: Milayagkami ta masiri.
sample_english: We willusethesailfor it'swindy.

meaning_english: To wrestle each other.
sample_bolinao: Milaybo tan miga'geten angga sa matumba.
sample_english: The action of fighting and struggling by grasping with the arms and tossing to and fro trying to throw the opponent to the ground, then rolling and struggling to overpower him.

meaning_english: To sink down into something soft.
sample_bolinao: Milemlem a bikoy nin trak sa kalsada no matupa'.
sample_english: If it is muddy, the wheels of a truck sink down into the road.

meaning_english: To squeeze into a tightly packed area.
sample_bolinao: Mile-letletan saray pasahiro sa dyip no napno' yayna.
sample_english: The passengers squeeze together on a jeep when it is full.

meaning_english: Milliliter.
sample_bolinao: Manaliw akon supdringk nin liman yasot a mililitro.
sample_english: I bought a five hundred milliliter soft drink.

meaning_english: To do a thing five times.
sample_bolinao: Sinyor Adi', si kwarta moyo ket nakaganansya yan milima nin ka'baw.
sample_english: Sinyor King, your money has gained five times as much.

meaning_english: Millimeter, one thousandth of a meter.
sample_bolinao: Daikleng a sukat nan milimetro.
sample_english: The millimeter is a small measurement.

meaning_english: Crepe myrtle shrub, cultivated as ornamental.
sample_bolinao: Main nin alakin tanaman amelendresa tinmubo' iti sa adapan upisina nin SIL.
sample_english: There is a bigcrepemyrtle shrub growing in front of the SIL office.

meaning_english: To clean each other.
sample_bolinao: Milinisan saran rupa a mitraina nin pusa'.
sample_english: The mother an her kittens clean each others faces.

meaning_english: To put on lipstick.

meaning_english: To give a name to someone.
sample_bolinao: Ngaranan kata ninCefas.
sample_english: I name you Cephas.

meaning_english: The sound made when eating something crisp such as lettuce or singkamas.
A good fit of something.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a ngarep nan purta sa hamba.
sample_english: It is a good fit of the door in the door jamb.

meaning_english: A controlled or restrained outburst of laughter having implications of a joke or sarcasm and may be high pitched.
sample_bolinao: Si ngarikngik na, umabot ya anggan rubari' kwarto.
sample_english: His outburst of laughter can be heard into the neighboring house.

meaning_english: The bone structure, gums and palate of the upper jaw.
sample_bolinao: Dinmalit yay tinapay sa ngaris nan aso.
sample_english: The bread stuck to the roof of the dog's mouth.

meaning_english: A large piercing bite of something, usually repeated and implying a sharp or damaging action.
sample_bolinao: Alaki a ngatngat mo kanya' ka masiba'.
sample_english: You have a big bite and so you are a voracious eater.

meaning_english: argue loudly over s/t
sample_bolinao: Ngatngatanran mitraasawa nin maksaw nin away.
sample_english: The husband and wife shouted each other in hot discussion.

meaning_english: A loud, unpleasant and disturbing noise.
Loud and empty talk.
sample_bolinao: Ngawngawanra.
sample_english: They are just talking nonsense.

meaning_english: A growl.
sample_bolinao: Tinma'way ya nin maksaw ket say busis na, bara'mo nin ngernger nin leon.
sample_english: He shouted loudly and so his voice seemed to be the growl of a lion.

meaning_english: To snarl angrily at something, with or without the sound.
sample_bolinao: Nginerngeran nakon aso ni Pedro sin nako akodtaw konra ta kai nako katanda'.
sample_english: Pedro's dog snarled at me when I went there to their place since it did not know me.

meaning_english: The cut made by a sharp object, it could be from a bite such as by a dog..
meaning_filipino: Ang pagputol sa bagay gamit ang patalim.
sample_bolinao: Ngetnget a nangyadian sin inayuma yay iskrin.
sample_english: The slice happened there when he was mending the screen.

meaning_english: Continuous sobbing out of grief and deep sorrow.
sample_bolinao: Ngeyegey nan nangibwat sa simbaan anggan simintiryo.
sample_english: She sobbed with grief from the church to the cemetery.

meaning_english: For a tooth or several teeth to be missing or broken from decaying or extraction.
sample_bolinao: Ngibelya kanya' nin ma'teng yan mangan.
sample_english: Some of her teeth are missing that's why it takes her so long to eat.

meaning_english: To take out teeth by pulling or knocking them out.
sample_bolinao: Saray raruman dintista ket ngibelen nasaray anak pigaw mabista li' a katubo' nin pirmaninti nin ngipen ra.
sample_english: Some dentists will remove children's teeth so that the permanent teeth will grow in nicely later.

meaning_english: The noise of pigs awaiting feeding time.
sample_bolinao: Say ngikngik nan baboy, umabot anggan rubari' bali.
sample_english: The grunt of the pig can be heard clear over to the neighbors.

meaning_english: A fast, normally from food.
sample_bolinao: Si ngilin, kai ya magwa' no mabitil ka.
sample_english: A fast is not possible if you are starving.

meaning_english: To observe and give respect to and do the appropriate things on special religious days such as abstaining from food, work or anything else.
sample_bolinao: Main nin manngilinen moyo layin awro, bulan, tyimpo, tan taon sa pangngipa'ka' moyo a mag'in kamon mapteg sa pangingikit nan Dios bana' sa sain!
sample_english: I believe you are having observances of fasting for days, months, seasons, and years which in your estimation will make you righteous in the sight of God because of doing those!

meaning_english: The act of bolting or a sudden leaving from someplace.
sample_bolinao: Si ngimros na, marnge' anggan rubari'.
sample_english: His bolting was heard across the street.

meaning_english: Trembling or shivering on account of fear or coldness.
sample_bolinao: Madlaw a ngingintar nin busis na sin nangansyon ya si Ella bana' sa nirbyos na.
sample_english: The trembling of Ella's voice because of nervousness when she sang was obvious.

meaning_english: Tooth.
sample_bolinao: Naglat yay sayay ngipen ni Jose sin nangan yan matib'ey nin mais.
sample_english: Jose lost a tooth when he ate the tough corn.

meaning_english: The jagged or bent out of shape edge of a sharp cutting instrument such as a saw, coconut grater or bolo.
sample_bolinao: Ngirew anay ngipen na ni Rafael sa adapan.
sample_english: Rafael's front teeth are rotting.

meaning_english: For teeth to be rotted or broken off.
sample_bolinao: Ngirewen a ngipen no pirmin mangan nin masam'it.
sample_english: When sweets are always being eaten the teeth rot off.

meaning_english: A grimace or puckering or contortion of the face as though from something sour.
sample_bolinao: Say ngirsem na, alaki no makataway yan maalsem.
sample_english: His contortions of face are great if he happens to taste something sour.

meaning_english: The action by people or animals of forming the lips into a wide grin with the teeth showing implying either a happy or a sneering face.
sample_bolinao: Makapali'mo a ngirsi' nan aso.
sample_english: A dog's showing his teeth is terrifying.

meaning_english: To open the lips with the teeth showing as in sneering at someone or a dog snarling.
sample_bolinao: Ngirsian nako nin abing no paka'lisen kwa.
sample_english: The baby smiled at me when I laughed with him.

meaning_english: The blackness of something.
sample_bolinao: Aninayngisitnin langit sawanin!
sample_english: Howblack the sky is today!

meaning_english: The cultured honey bee.
sample_bolinao: Say kanen na anamaet, dudon tan inatip nin ngiwan sa tatalon.
sample_english: His food as well was locust and honey comb of the bee from the forest.

meaning_english: The act of bumping and injuring the face or head by falling or stumbling.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' wanin a lalako mo ta madalunot, ngudngod ket abot mo.
sample_english: Don't walk like that  for it is slippery; you'll end up on your head.

meaning_english: Wail of pain by one being whip-lashed.
sample_bolinao: Ngulangolnan babayi ta pinekpek nayan asawa na sa ulo.
sample_english: The womanwailedin pain because she was hit on the head by her husband who is drunk.

meaning_english: To make a crunching sound such as when eating something crisp like lettuce or singkamas.
For piglets to squeal from hunger.
sample_bolinao: Ngumarikngika baboy ra, mabitil sara.
sample_english: Their pigs are grunting, they are hungry.

meaning_english: To become blackened or darkened.
sample_bolinao: Ngumisit a katat mo no magawgaw ka.
sample_english: If you're exposing yourself to the sun you will become black.

meaning_english: To murmur in anger with a scowl on one's face because one does not like something that was done.
meaning_filipino: Pagbulong-bulong; nagbubulong bulong; umuungol at magbulong bulongan at mainit ang ulo.
sample_bolinao: Andi' kangumuru-ngurota marnge' naka ni tatay mo.
sample_english: Do notmurmurin complaint for your father can hear you..

meaning_english: Low indistinct murmuring accompanied by a facial expression of strong disagreement usually seen in the extension of the lips.
sample_bolinao: Gulpin nguro na anamanaet no kai na nagustwan a gawa'.
sample_english: He does a lot of murmuring on the other hand when the work was not what he desired.

meaning_english: Gnawing sound made by something such as a dog or pig as they sink their teeth into something.
sample_bolinao: Main marnge' konngutngotsa duyo nan bali tepe' yabi no matinek ana.
sample_english: Every night when all is silent I often hear noise ofgnawingat the corner of the house.

meaning_english: To interweave something or tied down.
To use for a house or a place for living in.
sample_bolinao: Mabistay kupit nan bulong madrikakaw nin nibaliwan nin gigang.
sample_english: The folding together of the leaves of the broomstick tree that the spider uses for a house is beautiful.

meaning_english: Joined to something.
sample_bolinao: Alalaki nin pasak a nigaletan ran kabli pinggat kai ya mabulsot.
sample_english: The cables that are joining them are large steel ones so that it will not snap.

meaning_english: Something that is negative.
meaning_filipino: Kaisipan na hindi maganda o posibli.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' kumon nigatibo a isip mo no mako ka sa kapilya.
sample_english: You should not be thinking negative thoughts when you go to church.

meaning_english: Negritos, Term applied by the Spaniards to the small dark-skinned and kinky-haired people found throughout the Philippine Islands.
sample_bolinao: Itaw saray abaw aNigritossa talugtog nan Zambales.
sample_english: There in the Zambales mountains there are manyNegritos.

meaning_english: Black appearance person, Negro woman.
sample_bolinao: Kasabyan ra ninnigraatlita.
sample_english: Usuallyblack womenare well known athletes.

meaning_english: Merchant, one who is engage in business, One who buys and sells commodities.
sample_bolinao: Na'teng yaynannigusyantiket alaki yayna sawanin a nigusyo na.
sample_english: He's a long timemerchantand so his business has now become great.

meaning_english: Business.
sample_bolinao: Makapoy a nigusyo sawanin a panaon.
sample_english: Business is slow these days.

meaning_english: To residence.
sample_bolinao: Sumubli' akodtaw pa sa ibwatan kon niikapan.
sample_english: I should return there to the familiar place that I came from.

meaning_english: To characteristic of being Hebrew.
sample_bolinao: Ipangaya ray nika-Hebreo ra, Hebreo ako anamaet bale'.
sample_english: They vaunt that they are fully characteristic of Hebrews, I am also however.

meaning_english: Take something someplace with a purpose.
The characteristic of seeing or viewing something.
sample_bolinao: Ibari-barita' mo konran tutawo a nika'kit mo kongko sawanin tan say ipa'ki-pa'kit ko et li' komo.
sample_english: Tell around to the people what you have seen from me today and that which I will further show you later.

meaning_english: The characteristic of being open.
The qualities and characteristics of an attorney.
sample_bolinao: Nayadi' nan inadal a nikaabugado, nikakumirsyo.
sample_english: He finished his studies to be an attorney, to be a businessman.

meaning_english: The qualities and characteristics of an abusive person.
sample_bolinao: Sadtay nikaabusado ran mananakaw bana' ta main palsot ra.
sample_english: Robbers are characteristically very abusive because they have guns.

meaning_english: Characterized by recognition.
sample_bolinao: Ket saray rwa, nipapalaway ray nangyadi' sa dalan tan say nikaalilbi' ra kona sin piniknga' nay tinapay.
sample_english: And so the two, they explained the things that had happened on the road and how they had recognized him when he broke the bread into halves.

meaning_english: Childhood, the state of being a child.
sample_bolinao: Saynikaanakna ni Andres, inusar na sa pagtratrabaho ta pigaw nin mabyay ya.
sample_english: Andres spent hischildhoodin working so that he would survive.

meaning_english: The characteristic of being enslaved.
The style of architecture.
sample_bolinao: Mabistay nikaarkitikto nan siin si bali.
sample_english: The style of architecture of that house is beautiful.

meaning_english: Characterization or event of going backwards and delayed.
The characteristic of being new.
Prostitution, low womanly qualities.
The characteristics of the wrapping.
sample_bolinao: Marimpes a nikabarkot ket kai maitayak-tayak.
sample_english: The wrapping was perfectly finished off and so it did not get scattered.

meaning_english: To event or quality of baptism.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' tamo' anaod nin say nikabawtismo na sa ranom a mamatutuo, no kai pati say daya' nan tinmuro' sin nati yan nipasak sa kudos.
sample_english: It is indeed not only the event of his baptism in water that proves it but rather also his blood which flowed out when he died being nailed to the cross.

meaning_english: The quality or manner of being tied.
Characteristically stupid, simpleton, silly person, foolish.
sample_bolinao: Aninaynikabubomon page'.
sample_english: You are indeed asillyperson.

meaning_english: Footing.
The qualities and characteristics of smallness.
Divine nature, characteristic of God.
sample_bolinao: Si Jesus main nikatawo na tan nikaDios na.
sample_english: Jesus has a human and Godly existence.

meaning_english: Self esteem.
The event of discovering something.
sample_bolinao: Say nikadiskubri nin ba'yon ibidinsya nakatulong sa kaaabanti nan kaso kuntra kona ni Janet.
sample_english: The discovery of new evidences helped in the development of the case against Janet.

meaning_english: To events and manner of persecution.
sample_bolinao: Saray mammemper, nitatayak sara anaod bana' sa nikaduksa-duksa' ra nin tinmarana' sin pinati ya si Esteban, ket nipata-patanda' ray maipa'ka' kona ni Jesus bale' konran kapada ra tamo' nin Judio.
sample_english: The believers, they were indeed scattered because of the persecution they underwent which began when Esteban was murdered, then they preached and preached about Jesus but to their fellow Jews only.

meaning_english: The qualities and skills of a doctor.
sample_bolinao: Mangalap yan nikaduktor kanya' siin a prupisyon na.
sample_english: He took up being a doctor and so that is his profession.

meaning_english: The event of redemption.
The nature of punishment for something.
sample_bolinao: Saytaw nin nikadusa ra a nika' sara sa burung-burong nin apoy a kai gapo nin ma'rep ket mapalaway a pammau-pau'na ana kontamo nga'min.
sample_english: That, the nature of their punishment of being put in consuming fire that can not in any way be extinguished, it is a clear warning to each and everyone of us.

meaning_english: The characteristic of being fastened together.
A joint or place of attachment.
The way in which something is made or the expertise or workmanship of it.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya mayesyes a raot ta sabtay kubpal a nikagwa' na.
sample_english: The bamboo string could not be twisted since it had been made too thick.

meaning_english: The way something is stripped.
sample_bolinao: Magasalnin nikagisa' nan silag a sarawen apay.
sample_english: The stripping of the silag for mat weaving is rough.

meaning_english: The qualities and characteristics of something serious or severe.
sample_bolinao: Pa'noynikagrabinan sakit na?
sample_english: Howseriouswas his disease?

meaning_english: To be forcibly moved or carried off to someplace else.
sample_bolinao: Nga'mi-nga'min, mangibwat kona ni Abraham angga kona ni David, labin'a'pat a nisusunor a kapamilyawan; labin'a'pat anamaet mangibwat kona ni David anggan sa nikai'ras ran Israelita sa Babilonia, tan labin'a'pat a lamang anamaet mangibwat sin nai'ras sarayna sa Babilonia angga sin naiyanak ya a Cristo.
sample_english: All in all, from Abraham until David, there were fourteen successions of families; there were likewise fourteen from David until the carrying off of the Israelites to Babylon, and even so fourteen also from after they were carried off to Babylon until the Christ was born.

meaning_english: To have been put in bondage to something.
sample_bolinao: Nati ya anaod ta pigaw anamaet nin maglat nasara sa pa'sar nikaigalot ra sa li'mo sa patiti leleg raynan nabyay.﻿
sample_english: He indeed died in order to remove them as-well from their condition of bondage to the fear of death while they are now alive.

meaning_english: The condition of being emotionally entangled with or bound to something.
To relationship to something.
sample_bolinao: Say nikaikalamo' tamo anamaet a lamang sa barang saya tan saya ket pa'sar say nikaikalamo' nin puparti nan lalaman sa saya tan saya.
sample_english: Our relationship just the same with each other as well it is of the status/condition of the relationship of the parts of a body with each other.

meaning_english: The condition of being snagged on something because of the tether being wrapped around an object.
sample_bolinao: Balukasan ma a kanding sa nikaikerker na sa didikot ta magawgaw yayna.
sample_english: Release the goat from his snags in the grass for he is being baked in the sun.

meaning_english: The quality and characteristic of doing something sparingly.
sample_bolinao: Saray akulaw ket nikainot ran mangusar sabon no mami'pi'.
sample_english: The old ladies characteristically use the soap sparingly when doing laundry.

meaning_english: To process of being nailed.
sample_bolinao: Say nikaipasak nan Cristo ket syay Kadunungan nan Dios.
sample_english: The crucifixion of Christ that is the Wisdom of God.

meaning_english: The characteristic of being joined as one.
sample_bolinao: Siin a rabay nan Dios nin gaw'en moyo bana' sa nikaipasaya moyo konan Cristo a si Jesus.
sample_english: That is what God wants you to do because of your being in union with Christ who is Jesus.

meaning_english: The act of being included in something.
sample_bolinao: Kai kamoyna nin kabiangan nin saytin Gugan-gan ta, yupa' sa nikairanod moyo kona ni Cristo, pinag'in kamoynan nati no maipa'ka' sa sayti ta pigaw nin maipasaya kamo kona nin sya ket pinasubli' ya nin mabyay ket, gumwa' atamon say makapaririket konan Dios.
sample_english: You are no longer a claim/vested interest/concern of this Law since, by means of your having been involved/included with Christ, you have now become dead concerning this in order that you might be joined to him who he is the one that was returned to life and so , let us do what would bring joy to God.

meaning_english: To process or means of being saved.
sample_bolinao: Rabay-rabay nay sumuso ket si'kamo anamaet, sulitan moyo a mag'adal nin say minsahi nan Dios nin kasan sakalakon nailawok ta pigaw nin tumubo' kamo sa byay moyo nin syay bungan nikaisalba moyo.
sample_english: He strongly desires to nurse and so you as well, strongly desire to study the message of God without anything mixed with it in order that you would grow in your life which is the fruit of your having been saved.

meaning_english: To process or manner of returning.
sample_bolinao: Ginwa' na in yupa' sa nipangikalamo' na kontamo anamaet sa nikaisubli' na nin mabyay ni Cristo.
sample_english: He did that by means of having made us companions as well in his returning to life of Christ.

meaning_english: The way of writing something.
sample_bolinao: Sa sangka'ranan a nikaisurat nan sitin libro sa Griego, kai nin ma'kit a labinrwan masusuyot nin birsikulo.
sample_english: In the oldest way this book was written in Greek, the last 12 verses can not be seen.

meaning_english: The separation from something.
sample_bolinao: Kai yayna nin masintinsyawan nin madusa, bana' ta say nikaisyay na kona nin Dios ket napalabas ana tan mabyay yayna anggan-angga nin iti konan Dios.
sample_english: He will not be condemned to punishment, because his separation from God, it is now passed and he is now living eternally in God.

meaning_english: The manner and quality of distributing of something.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a naibarita' iti maipa'ka' sa nikaitayak na nin Mabistan Patanda'.
sample_english: There are many things stated here about the spread of the Good News.

meaning_english: The characteristic of having been put in accord or harmony with somethi
sample_bolinao: Say bilang kumayat nin apin nin ayi moyo ket say nikaituno moyo konan Dios a nangibwat konan Mabistan Patanda' na.
sample_english: What is like foot coverings that bite the ground it is your having been placed in accord with God which has come from his Good News.

meaning_english: The event of giving birth.
The quality of becoming nothing.
sample_bolinao: Andipat a nikakasa nan kabunlalakaw.
sample_english: The disappearance of the rainbow was to vanish quickly

meaning_english: The characteristic of being disorderly.
For things to have a characteristic of being scattered or in disorder.
Councillorship.
The physique or physical condition of the body.
sample_bolinao: Mabistay nikalalaman na ta pirmi yan mag'ihirsisyo.
sample_english: His physique is beautiful since he is always exercising.

meaning_english: The ability to be suspended.
sample_bolinao: Makabul'is ako sa nikalambitin ko sa kayo no mablay anay gamet ko.
sample_english: My ability to hang from a tree will let loose if my hand is cramped.

meaning_english: The characteristic of terror.
sample_bolinao: Mangingintar sara sa nikali'mwan ra.
sample_english: They were trembling from their extremely terrified.

meaning_english: To calibrate something.
sample_bolinao: Si saya instruminto radtaw saBureau of Mines, nikalibrit ya sa pyi bale'convert-enma sa sintimitro.
sample_english: One of their instruments there at the Bureau of Mines is calibrated in feet but you convert it to centimeters.

meaning_english: To have a slow fire to cook thoroughly, simmer.
sample_bolinao: Miabot nin umnoy awro nin kai mabangles a binungey no kustoy nikalinay.
sample_english: The binungey will last for several days without getting spoiled if it is left to simmer correctly.

meaning_english: To be characterized by confusion.
sample_bolinao: Sabtannikalingoko kanya' pasinsyawen mokoyna kadi'.
sample_english: I was reallyconfusedtherefore will you please forgive me.

meaning_english: For things such as mud to have the characteristic of things sinking into it.
sample_bolinao: Tutupa' pirmin madalanan kanya' sabtan nikalutlot ana.
sample_english: The area being passed through is always muddy and so it is now extremely boggy.

meaning_english: The way or manner of cooking.
sample_bolinao: Makurta a kamuti ta nalabas a nikaluto' nin nika' nin asukar.
sample_english: The sweet potato was over flavored since in the recipe for cooking too much sugar was put in.

meaning_english: The event or manner of death.
sample_bolinao: Itaw sara nikamat a aso sa papari.
sample_english: The place that dogs go to die is there among the rice plants.

meaning_english: Lifestyle or quality of righteousness in character and conduct.
sample_bolinao: Kasan kapada sanikamatunongna ni Jesus a nikikalamo' konran tutawo iti sa luta'.
sample_english: Nothing can be compared to the righteousness of Jesus in his associating among the people here on earth.

meaning_english: The quality and characteristic of being a professional mechanic.
sample_bolinao: Naggradwit yan nikamikaniko.
sample_english: He graduated as a professional mechanic.

meaning_english: The quality and characteristic of a member.
sample_bolinao: Libro a nakasuratan ngaran nikamyimbro sa sayay institusyon paka'kitan taon a nikaiyanakan, kapapa'sar na.
sample_english: The book that has the names of the membership of a certain institution that shows his year of birth and situation.

meaning_english: The nature of a structure.
sample_bolinao: Bana' kona ni Cristo, ma'get a nikapa'deng nan sitin bara'mon bali, tan siti ket mangibwat kona, mampag'in yan timplo a manepeg nin para konan Dios.
sample_english: Because of Christ, the structure of this that is like a house is firm, and this from him, is becoming a temple which is appropriate for God.

meaning_english: The characteristic of being flat or staight.
sample_bolinao: Saypakatna husto ta mabistay nikapa'nat na.
sample_english: Its position is right since its flatness is good.

meaning_english: The quality and characteristic of being moody.
sample_bolinao: Kai miya rabay kalamo' ta sabtan nikapa'sel na.
sample_english: We do not want to be with him for his moodiness is extreme.

meaning_english: The event of being healed.
sample_bolinao: Ket bana' sa nikapaanda' mo, mangida'ton ka sigon sa Gugan-gan nin nibi na ni Moises.
sample_english: And then because of your being healed offer a sacrifice in accordance with the law given by Moises.

meaning_english: The quality and characteristic of being a priest, priesthood.
sample_bolinao: Wanin bana' ta si Dios, tinudo' nayan Sangkata'gayan nin Padi' nin kapadan nikapadi' na ni Melquisedec.
sample_english: That's the case because God, he appointed him a Highest Priest as characteristic of the priesthood of Melquisedec.

meaning_english: The event of being hindered.
sample_bolinao: Sain say nikapaed moyo nin tumumbok sa tutuon akay, ambo' na nin gawa' in nin Dios a syay nanagyat komoyo.
sample_english: Your being hindered to follow the true teaching anymore, it is not the doing of God who was the one who invited/entreated you.

meaning_english: Teh event of making something clear.
sample_bolinao: Rabay ko et nin magkamain komoyo a sarban kaabigan nin mangibwat sa peteg nin nikapalawayan tan pakatanda' a si niyadi na yapo' nin Dios sin saytaw, ket si Cristo.
sample_english: I further want you to come to have all of the benefits that come from an accurate insight and a perfect knowing of him who at first in the past God had hidden, that is Christ.

meaning_english: The quality, rank and characteristic of the papacy.
sample_bolinao: Say nikapapa, syay sangkata'gayan a mangipangulo sa Iglisya Romano Catolika.
sample_english: The papacy is the highest leadership in the Roman Catholic Church.

meaning_english: The manner of being made one.
sample_bolinao: ta pigaw nin sawanin ket man'ipapalaway nayna a maipa'ka' sa nikapapasaya tamon tutawo na.
sample_english: in order that now/today he is making clear concerning the way we his people have been made one.

meaning_english: The event of cleansing.
sample_bolinao: ta pigaw nin maisadya' natamon mag'in nin maikana' kona yupa' sa nikaparinggas tamo sa nipagdisidido tamo nin pabawtismo tan sa sain a nibibilin na kontamo.
sample_english: in order to prepare us to become suitable for him by means of our cleansing by our decision to be baptized and by that which he instructed us.

meaning_english: Manner of creating something.
sample_bolinao: Mabista anikaparsanan mundo.
sample_english: The creation of the world is beautiful

meaning_english: The event of being made one.
sample_bolinao: Konan siin si bara'mon sayay baton pundasyon a pangipatukduan ko nin nikapasaya ran lapag nin tutawo ko.
sample_english: On that which is like a stone foundation is what I will have as the basis of my bringing together as one of all of my people universally.

meaning_english: The event of putting to death.

meaning_english: The quality of flatness.
The characteristic of an event of going someplace.

meaning_english: The fineness of something.

meaning_english: The event of the arrival of someone.

meaning_english: The the event of condemning something.

meaning_english: The event of meeting something on the way.

sample_english: How did you get in?

sample_english: Consequently, because of his being wounded, you have been healed.

meaning_english: The quality of being hardheaded.

meaning_english: The characteristic of how something is written.

sample_english: At that he said to them, <<I saw the Satanas falling in defeat like lightning from heaven.>>

meaning_english: The characteristic of having divisions.

meaning_english: The characteristics of growth.

meaning_english: The undergoing of circumcision.

sample_english: That is on the other hand like circumcision, but that is not a deed of people but rather it is a deed of Christ for he has removed that evil character of ours as though he had circumcised us.

meaning_english: The attribute of being twisted.

meaning_english: To get someone drunk repeatedly.

meaning_english: To visitation.
To process of deciding.

meaning_english: To commit sinful actions.

meaning_english: To implement something making it effective.
sample_bolinao: Ket no mapapteg saray tutawo sa pangingikit nan Dios mangibwat sa nipagkuri nin Gugan-gan ran saraytaw nin pupadi', kai ana kumon matkap a main et nin sakalakon klasi sa nikapadi' na ni Aaron.

meaning_english: The action of putting trust in something.
To pledged something.

meaning_english: To visited various places.

sample_english: I can say that because in my strolling around here in your city and in my observing our places of worship, I saw an altar there where it was written <To the God who is Not Known.>

meaning_english: To rebellion.

sample_english: against the leaders appointed by God is the rebelling of these people and so, certainly their ultimate end, it conforms to the punishment given to Core.

meaning_english: To gave something as a sacrifice.

meaning_english: To had something given to someone.

meaning_english: To had something brought out.

sample_english: When Pilate heard that which they were shouting over and over, he had again brought out Jesus, and then he sat at his place of judgment there in the part called the Cement Platform, which in the Hebrew language is calledGabata.

meaning_english: To revealed something.

meaning_english: To cause something to be inserted someplace.
To go to take shelter in something someone has provided.
