meaning_english: To remove all of excess from the surface such as hair from the head, or the husk from a coconut shell.
To have someone accompany someone.
sample_bolinao: Inamigo raya yapo' bale' a ingkargado sa palasyo a si Blasto tan nipalalamo' sara nin mako nin kituno konan Adi'.
sample_english: They made friends first with Blasto the one in charge in the palace and they caused him to accompany them to go reconcile with the King.

meaning_english: To repeatedly hindering.
sample_bolinao: nipamaed-paed ra komi sa pangingipatanda' konran ambo' nin Judio nin si minsahin mangibarita' no pa'no nasaran isalba nin Dios.
sample_english: their continually preventing us in the proclaiming to the nonJewsthe message that tells how God will save them.

meaning_english: To made something become something.
sample_bolinao: ta pigaw nin, mangibwat sa nipamag'in nan pubri sa kadiryan na, ket pinayaman natamo.
sample_english: in order that, by having made himself poor,he made usrich.

meaning_english: To multiplying something.
sample_bolinao: Kai ra gapo nin natarusan a pipa'kaan nin nipamaka'baw na intaw ni Jesus sa saytaw say tinapay tan kuna'.
sample_english: They did not at all understand the implications of Jesus multiplying that bread and fish.

meaning_english: The manner of careful preparation of something.
sample_bolinao: Saraytaw saray bubbayin nangaluyon kona ni Jesus nin nangibwat sa Galilea, tinumbok raya si Jose ket na'kit rayay nanabunan tan no pa'noy nipamakanda' konan bangkay na ni Jesus.
sample_english: Those women from Galilee who escorted Jesus, they followed Jose and so they saw the grave and how the corpse of Jesus was carefully prepared.

meaning_english: To cast out from someplace.
To made righteous.
sample_bolinao: Panemtemen tamo a nipamapteg kona ni Abraham.
sample_english: Let us remember how Abraham,was maderighteous.

meaning_english: To giving of a welcome upon arrival.
sample_bolinao: Man'umalaki a pammabli na ni Tito komoyo mintras nin mampanemtemen nay ruros nin nakem moyon tinmulok nin sarba sa nigan-gan nin gaw'en moyo tan say ma'mot a nipamarate' moyo kona nin awit moyoy alakin salak.
sample_english: The love of Tito for you has grown great as he remembers the willingness of you all to be obedient to the commands for you to do and the warm welcome with great apprehension you gave him .

meaning_english: To have a mark placed on something.
sample_bolinao: Kai li' gapo nin pay'anen a pangingirangep ra sa yabi tan awro bana' ta rinayo raya a makapali'mon ayep tan si imahin na, tan nipamarka sara nin ngaran nan makapali'mon ayep.
sample_english: Their undergoing suffering day and night will not at all be lightened because they have worshiped the terrifying animal and its image, and they have been marked with the name of the terrifying animal.

meaning_english: To put a mark on something.
sample_bolinao: Saray si'numan a mampangrayo konan makapali'mon ayep tan konan si ginwa' nin imahin na, tan nipamarkawan ray waleng o gamet ra nin si marka nan si makapali'mon ayep.
sample_english: Whoever those are that are worshipping the terrifying animal and the image made of him, and have had their forehead or hand marked with the mark of the terrifying animal.

meaning_english: To used for wrapping something.
sample_bolinao: Sin rinmate' yadtaw, dinmukot yan sinmir'ip ket say kalla na'kit na say mabistan abel nin nipamarkot konan bangkay.
sample_english: When he arrived there, he stooped to peep in and then the only thing he saw were pieces of beautiful cloth that was used for wrapping the corpse.

meaning_english: To make unfounded accusations.
sample_bolinao: Si Dios, pinababale' naynipamarsanan sarban bagay.
sample_english: Godcreatedall things one after another.

meaning_english: Method of bathing.
sample_bolinao: Banyos tamo' a nipamaryo' ra konan abing.
sample_english: The way they bathe a baby is only with a sponge bath.

meaning_english: To process of returning.
sample_bolinao: Maisalba nakamo yupa' sa nipamasubli' nan mabyay kona ni Jesu-Cristo.
sample_english: He isabletosave you by means of his returning JesuCristo to life.

meaning_english: To give understanding.
sample_bolinao: Sa bukod nin karabayan na ket mag'in atamon ua'nak na sa nipamataros nan minsahin maipa'ka' sa katutu'wan kontamo.
sample_english: Of his own desire/will he made us to become his children by means of his making us to understand the message concerning truth.

meaning_english: To use something to fling.
sample_bolinao: Kayo yaynipamatibatna koni Ben.
sample_english: It was wood he used tothrowat Ben.

meaning_english: The sounding of something.
To making become righteous.
sample_bolinao: yupa' sa nipamatunong na sa patitin dusa nan Dios kona.
sample_english: by means of his causing to become righteous, from death which is the punishment of God.

meaning_english: To confirmed something.
sample_bolinao: Sawanin, sayti a nipamatutuo na ni Juan.
sample_english: Now, this is what Juan confirmed.

meaning_english: To gave a warning.
sample_bolinao: Pau'na-u'nawan katamo anamanaet sawanin kapadan nipamau-pau'na koyna komoyo sin saytaw: Saray main nin wantin kabibyay, kai naya nin ipaikon konra nin Dios a Pag'adian na.
sample_english: I am warning you again now just like I warned you before: Those whose way of life is like this, God will not give as a possession his Kingdom.

meaning_english: To abandoning of something.
sample_bolinao: Anaod, no say nipamauryan na konran Judio ket nag'in nin nakakituno a abaw nin raruman tutawo konan Dios, anina li' nin anda' no akuen nasarayna a Judio nin Dios!
sample_english: Indeed, if his abandoning/rejecting/ignoring the Jews it was able to bring many other people into harmony/accord with God, oh such beauty it will be if/when God accepts theJews!

meaning_english: To bestow favor on someone.
Giving of something.
sample_bolinao: Ginawa' nayay sayay paka'kitan ninnipamina sa kapiknga' nin kayamanan ni Don.
sample_english: He performed a ceremony for Don of the giving of half of his riches.

meaning_english: To gave a blessing.
sample_bolinao: No maong saran tawo, bindisyunan nasaran Dios, bale' no ambo' saran maong nin tawo, babawien moyoy nipamindisyon moyo.
sample_english: If they are good people, God will bless them, but if they are not good people, retract the blessing you gave.

meaning_english: To brought together in unity.
sample_bolinao: Kasa gapon pangingibilang moyo sa sayti nin nipamipapasaya nan Dios ket man-gaw'en moyon mading'eyan saray mampagkurang!
sample_english: You don't have any respect at all for this which God’ has brought together as one and so you are doing things that brings shame upon those who are living in want!

meaning_english: To has given forgiveness for.
sample_bolinao: No main wadi' nin nakagwa' nin abas komoyo, pirdunawen moyo saran mangibwat sa pangangado' nin peteg nin kapadan nipamirduna na ni Cristo komoyo sa kukasalanan moyo.
sample_english: If there are pechance some who have done wrong among you, truly forgive them out of love in the same way that Christ has forgiven you of your sins.

meaning_english: To demonstrate their faith in something.
sample_bolinao: Ginwa' nayay alakin baluto ta pigaw nin malibri saran mipamilya ket yupa' sa katutulok na bana' sa pagmamatalek na ni Noe, naipa'kit a kai ra nin nipamper nin raruma.
sample_english: He made the large boat in order that his family would be spared and so by means of Noe's obedience coming from his trust, it was shown that the others did not demonstrate faith.

meaning_english: The process of releasing something.
To gave a shout at someone.
sample_bolinao: Sin sain a mampag'irgo ya et si Pablo nin pangidipinsa na sa lalaman nan diri, nipana'way naya ni Gubirnador Festo a wana, <<Nasida' anay ulo mo, Pablo!
sample_english: At the time that Pablo was speaking in defense of himself, Governor Festo shouted at him aying, <<You are out of your mind, Pablo!

meaning_english: To burial of something.
sample_bolinao: Ket si Maria a taga Magdala tan si Maria nin ina na ni Jose, na'kit ray nipanabon kona ni Jesus.
sample_english: And so Maria of Magdala and Maria the mother of Jose, saw Jesus' burial.

meaning_english: Salvation.
sample_bolinao: Saynipanalbanan Dios sa byay ni Isaac...
sample_english: Thesalvationof God in the life of Isaac...

meaning_english: To repeated questioning.
sample_bolinao: Sin kaadap nasarayna, natandaan na sa nipanepet-tepet na no ka'no rayan peteg na'kit a bituen.
sample_english: When they came before him, he came to know from his repeatedly questioning them as to when exactly they had seen the star.

meaning_english: To given birth.
sample_bolinao: Sin natandaan ran kabaraybay tan kukanayon ra a maipa'ka' sa nipangabing na ni Elisabet, nikiririket sara kona bana' sa alakin inganga'do nan Dios kona.
sample_english: When their neighbors and relatives learned about Elisabet's giving birth, they rejoiced with her because of God' great mercy to her.

meaning_english: The act of acquitting someone of an accusation.
sample_bolinao: O', ta say bunga nin nipanubag na ni Adan ket ambo' nin pariho sa bunga nin nipangabswilto nan Dios kontamo nin nangibwat sa masibulot a nakem na.
sample_english: Yes, for the result of Adam's transgression it was not the same as the result of God' acquitting of us which comes from his wholeheartedness.

meaning_english: To have been trained in or have studied a particular skill.
To endure suffering.
sample_bolinao: Anaod, ta pigaw nin kai kamo nin tumapo' tan gumurot, dalepdepen moyo a nipangagwanta na nin idap a ginwa' ra kona nin saray tutawon sikakasalanan.
sample_english: Indeed, in order that you do not become discouraged/weak and give up, contemplate how he suffered through the hardships the sinful people did to him.

meaning_english: To go through the process of giving birth to someone.
sample_bolinao: Kipada anamaet sa sain a nangyadi' sa nipanganak na ni Rebecca nin singin a sara si Jacob tan si Esau.
sample_english: Corresponding to that as well is what happened in Rebecca's birthing of the twins Jacob and Esau.

meaning_english: To put desires on something.
sample_bolinao: Man'arigen ra a gawa'-gawa' na intaw ni Balaam a anak na ni Beor, a nangwa-nangwa' yan duka' bana' sa nipangapes na sa kwarta.
sample_english: They are imitating the deeds previously done by Balaam the child of Beor, who repeatedly did what is evil because of desiring/desire for money.

meaning_english: To slavery.
sample_bolinao: Si Catawan, nilibri nasara yapo' sin saytaw a tutawo na nangibwat sa nipangaripen konra sa Egipto.
sample_english: The Divine, he initially in the past freed his people from their slavery in Egypt.

meaning_english: To have been chartered or hired out.
To have something sawn.
sample_bolinao: Alalaki nin kayo a ginarugadi' nin maimpis a gaw'en tapi' bali; agaba' nin kayo a maimpis a nipangarugadi' a ipanapi' bali.
sample_english: Lumber.

meaning_english: To shown loving kindness.
sample_bolinao: Ket magkabyay kamo nin mapangawa'nan konran saray kalalamo' moyo kapadan nipangawa'nan na kontamo ni Cristo.
sample_english: And so live showing loving kindness to your companions in conformity with how Christ has shown his loving kindness to us .

meaning_english: The manner of calling.
sample_bolinao: Mauyamo' anipangayabni Jesus konran adalan na.
sample_english: Jesus called his followers kindly and patiently.

meaning_english: The commissioning for something.
To telling of many things.
sample_bolinao: Sa nipangibari-barita' nan sayti ni Jesus konran tutawo ket nangusar yan pangingiyarig.
sample_english: In Jesus' telling these to the people he used comparisons.

meaning_english: To make a denial of something.
To give as an offering.
sample_bolinao: Saray raruman nangadal konan Biblia wanra a angangko si altar ket iritrato nay nipangida'ton ran saraytaw saray pinati bana' sa katutulok ra konan Dios.
sample_english: ﻿Some who have studied the Bible say that probably the altar, it gives a picture of the sacrifice of those who were killed because of their obedience to God.

meaning_english: To ordering of something to be done.
sample_bolinao: Nakatekre' kadsen ta pigaw nin usisaen nako nin sigon sa wana sa Gugan-gan, bale' mansubagen moy Gugan-gan sa nipangigan-gan mo a mu'muen ako.
sample_english: You are sitting there to examine me according to the Commandments, but you disobey the Commandments by ordering my mouth to be hit.

meaning_english: To made companions.
sample_bolinao: Ginwa' na in yupa' sa nipangikalamo' na kontamo anamaet sa nikaisubli' na nin mabyay ni Cristo.
sample_english: He did that by means of having made us companions as well in his returning to life of Christ.

meaning_english: To looked at various things.
sample_bolinao: Maibarita' ko a wanin bana' ta sa nipagpasya-pasyar kodti sa syudad moyo, tan sa nipangikit-kikit ko sa lulugar a pangraywan moyo, main nin na'kit kon sayay altar nin itaw ket main nin wantin nakasurat, <Para Konan Dios a Kai nin Tanda'.>
sample_english: I can say that because in my strolling around here in your city and in my observing your places of worship, I saw an altar there where it was written <To the God who is Not Known.>

meaning_english: To be making a sale of something.
sample_bolinao: Rimer a nipangilako' ni Judas koni Jesus.
sample_english: Judas selling of Jesus was done in secret.

meaning_english: The manner in which someone trusts something.
sample_bolinao: Kai nin madali' nin kumapoy a nipangimatalek ni Sam konan Catawan mataman gulpin prublima na.
sample_english: Sam's trusting in the Divine does not quickly weaken even when he has loads of problems.

meaning_english: The manner in which someone gives.
sample_bolinao: Binanta-bantayan nay nipanginabo' ran tutawo.
sample_english: He watched how the people gave.

meaning_english: To showed mercy to someone.
sample_bolinao: Sumubli' kaynadtaw komoyo ket ibarita' mo konran kabbali mo a sarban ginwa' nan Catawan komo tan no pa'noy nipanginga'do na komo.
sample_english: Return now to yours and then tell to those who are in the same house with you all that the Divine had done to you and how he had pitied you .

meaning_english: To make visible.
sample_bolinao: Sa nipangipa'kit nan saytin kamaungan na, ket man'iyakay natamo nin gurutan tamoynay pagkakabyay nin subag sa no ani a rabay na tan say duka' a man'apesen ran saray ambo' nin mammemper kona.
sample_english: In showing this goodness of his, he is teaching us to turn back from the act of living that is against what his will is and from the evil which the non believers desire are plotting.

meaning_english: To placing something upon something.
sample_bolinao: Naimatunan na ni Simon a nako ya nin miikap konran mammemper a Ispirito nan Dios bana' sa nipangipababo ran gamet ran apostoles konra.
sample_english: Simon observed that the Spirit of God went to dwell in the believers because of the laying of hands of the apostles on them.

meaning_english: To bringing something out on display.
sample_bolinao: Ket sin pinabawtismo atamo, naikitabon atamo anamaet kona ta nikiranod atamo sa patiti na ta pigaw nin kiranod atamo et sa nisubli' na nin mabyay ni Cristo yupa' sa nipangipadar nan pakayadi' nan Dios a Ama tamo.
sample_english: And so when we were baptized, we were as well buried with him since we are included in his death in order that we would also be included in Christ being returned to life by means of the displaying/use of the power of God our Father.

meaning_english: Prediction, prophesy.
To bring about the death of someone.
sample_bolinao: Ket sa nipangipapati ra kona ni Jesus, natukid rayti a nipadles ran prupita.
sample_english: And so in their having Jesus killed, they had fulfilled these that the prophets predicted/prophesied.

meaning_english: To communicated something.
sample_bolinao: Nag'in akon bara'mon ama moyo sa nikaipasaya moyo konan Cristo a si Jesus, yupa' sa nipangiparate' ko konan Mabistan Patanda' komoyo.
sample_english: I became like your father in your being united with the Christ who is Jesus, through my proclamation of the Good News to you.

meaning_english: Giving training.
To giving the proclamation of something.
sample_bolinao: Si Tito, saya yan ambo' nin Judio; nag'in ya nin mammemper kona ni Jesu-Cristo yupa' sa nipangipatanda' na ni Pablo konan Mabistan Patanda'.
sample_english: As for Tito, he was not aJews; he became a believer in Jesus Christ through Pablo's preaching of the Good News.

meaning_english: To presented something.
sample_bolinao: Siti nin Sangkata'gayan nin Padi' tamo, pini'sa-pi'sa nayna a nipangiprisinta nin masadag nin da'ton para kontamon tutawo sin nibi nan nida'ton a lalaman nan diri.
sample_english: This Highest Priest of ours, once and only once has presented a sufficient offering/sacrifice for us people when he gave his own body as a offering/sacrifice.

meaning_english: To set apart.
sample_bolinao: Isalba na yupa' sa nipangipurok na komoyo nin si Ispirito na tan say pammemper moyo sa katutu'wan.
sample_english: He gives salvation by means of setting you apart by his Spirit and your faith in the truth.

meaning_english: To having been made to undergo suffering.
sample_bolinao: Nipapanemtem na anamaet konra a manepeg nin magkabyay saran maitukoy sa karabayan nan Dios, a pusisyon ra bilang tutawon pinili' nan Dios, a paisirong sara konran saray mag'uray konra nin mantumbuken ray alimbawa' nin nipangirangep na ni Cristo, a pigagawa' ra nin man'isipen ray panaon nin susuyot, tan a dumaer sara nin pakagsen sa pammemper ra.
sample_english: Therefore he reminded them of the superb hope/confidence that comes from the death, return to life, and the return here of Jesus Christ because he knows that if their thoughts they are focused on what they are hoping for that is there in heaven, they would be able to endure suffering of the hardships. He reminds them as well of the proper way to live in accordance with the will of God, their position as God' chosen people, submitting to those who have authority over them, following Cristo's example in enduring suffering, their conduct in view of the end times, and steadfastness to remain firm in their faith.

meaning_english: To recommending of something.
sample_bolinao: Say Nipangirikuminda kona ni Demetrio.
sample_english: The Recommendation of Demetri.

meaning_english: To do sacrificially.
sample_bolinao: Gaw'en moyo in ta, sa nipangwa' na sa animan nin nipagwa' na ni Cristo, dandani ya nin nati tan nisanla' nay byay na sa nipangisakit na kongko a syay pangingisakit moyoynan lamang kongko ta kasa kamodti.
sample_english: Do that since, in his doing of whatever Christ had given him to do, he almost died and he pawned his life in his self sacrificed for me which was nonetheless your self sacrifice for me since you were not here.

meaning_english: To exalted.
sample_bolinao: Rumiga kan si'kan mampagkurang, sa nipangita'gay nan Dios komo sa kapapa'sar a bilang kona ni Cristo.
sample_english: You poor should be glad in that God exalted you in your position like Christ.

meaning_english: The way of upholding or lifting someone.
To initiated and activity.
sample_bolinao: Siti si Barrabas, mangkapriso ya bana' sa nipangitarana' nan pigugulo sa syudad nin Jerusalem tan nangmati ya.
sample_english: This Barrabas, he was imprisoned because he had began a riot in the city of Jerusalem and he had killed people.

meaning_english: The characteristics or manner of enduring.
sample_bolinao: Nipau-pau'na nayna ni Pablo konran mammemper sa Filipos a matkap nin mangitpel sara a bilang sa nipangitpel na ni Cristo tan sya nin si Pablo, a sya ket mampangitpel ya et anggan sawanin.
sample_english: Pablo warned the believers in Philipi that they must be courageous like the enduring of Christ and as Pablo had been enduring even until now.

meaning_english: To continuation of something.
sample_bolinao: Sa nipangituloy na ni Jesus nin mako sa Jerusalem, pinasyan ka'bawan ran tutawon nayi kona.
sample_english: In Jesus continuing on going to Jerusalem, there were very many people who were going along with him.

meaning_english: To intentionally pass by something.
sample_bolinao: Adti a rabay mo nin pangisadyaan min pangapunan tamo para sa Pistan Nipanglabas?
sample_english: Where do you want us to go to prepare our supper for the Festival of Passing By?

meaning_english: To have sold out someone.
sample_bolinao: Siti kano a kayo nin pinaibitayan ni Judas sin nagbabawi' ya sa nipanglako' na koni Jesu-Cristo.
sample_english: This is the tree that it is said that Judas hung himself on when he repented of having sold out Jesus Christ.

meaning_english: To netting.
To have been scraped or rubbed w/ s/t.
To trick someone.
sample_bolinao: Ket no mangyadi' a wanin mas masakit in et dyan say nu'nan nipangluko ra konran tutawo.
sample_english: And so if that were to happen, that would yet be worse than their first deception of the people.

meaning_english: To process of receiving.
sample_bolinao: Nangibwat sa sain nin pagmamatalek na ni Abel, inalilbi' nan Dios a matunong ya, a sayti ipa'kit nin nipangrisibi nan da'ton na ni Abel.
sample_english: From that trust of Abel, God acknowledged that he was righteous, which this is shown in his receiving of the offering of Abel.

meaning_english: The introducing of something.
To changed into s/t.
sample_bolinao: Say Nipanguman nin Bakas na ni Jesus.
sample_english: The Transformation of Jesus' Appearance.

meaning_english: To close or shut something so the edges come together such as a book, flower, mouth, umbrella, etc.
To have been caused to hate something.
sample_bolinao: Nipangura' koy mapanes tan malabid iti sa luob iskol.
sample_english: I have come to hate the irritations and gossip inside the school.

meaning_english: To used as instrument.
sample_bolinao: Nangibwat sa nipangusar na nin ranom, ket linumwas a luta' sa ranom.
sample_english: From his use of water, earth emerged from the water.

meaning_english: To give money as payment for something.
sample_bolinao: Si nibi ko kona a inusar nan nipangwarta sa seket na.
sample_english: What I gave him is what he used to pay for his clothing.

meaning_english: To teaching ministry.
sample_bolinao: Bana' sa nipangyakay na ni Pablo, nag'in yan tumutumbok nan Cristo si Onesimo tan sayay mablin amigo na ni Pablo.
sample_english: Because of Pablo's teaching, Onesimo became a follower of the Christ and a precious friend to him.

meaning_english: To put something in a neat way.
To be given a stimulus or motivation to do something.
sample_bolinao: Ket si Adi' David a mismo, yupa' sa nipaninreg nan Ispirito nan Dios ket nibarita' na nin wana.
sample_english: But King David himself, by the moving of the Spirit of the God, he told saying.

meaning_english: To administering discipline.
sample_bolinao: Sadag anay nipangirangep na nin nipanisiplina ra kona nin saray ka'bawan komoyo.
sample_english: It is sufficient that he has undergone the disciplining of most of you.

meaning_english: To incite or instigate a negative activity.
sample_bolinao: Binulusan nayay rabay ran bulusan, si mangkapriso bana' sa nipanugsog na konran tutawo tan nipangmati na.
sample_english: He set free the one whom they wanted to be set free, the one imprisoned because of instigating the people and his murders.

meaning_english: To following of something.
sample_bolinao: Main tamo' pan sayay bagay a rabay kon matandaan mangibwat komoyo: Narisibi moya para a Ispirito nan Dios bana' sa nipanumbok moyon sain nin Gugan-gan?
sample_english: There is only one thing that I want to know from you: Did you receive the Spirit of God by/because of following those Laws?

meaning_english: To oppose with something.
To intensely ridicule someone.
sample_bolinao: Ket abaw et a nipanuya'-tuya' ra kona.
sample_english: And then they did many more thing to ridicule him.

meaning_english: To bring on to the scene.
sample_bolinao: Wana nin Dios kona nin Adi' sa Egipto sin saytaw, <<Nipapadar katan adi' ta pigaw nin sa pananalo ko komo ket maipa'kit a pakayadi' ko, ket matandaan sa intiron mundo no si'no ako.>>
sample_english: God said to the King of Egypt in the past, <<I brought you out as king in order that in my victory over you my power might be seen, and then the entire world will be able to know who I am.>>

meaning_english: To had something prophesied.
sample_bolinao: Siti nin nibarita' na ni Caifas, kai nin nangibwat sa kaisipan na nin bukod no kai edet, bana' ta syay Sangkata'gayan nin Padi', nipapadles nan Dios kona a matkap yan mati si Jesus, ta pigaw nin saray kadayaan na nin saray Judio ket maisalba sara.
sample_english: This which Caiaphas said, it was not from his own thinking but rather, because he was the Highest Priest, God prophesied through him that it must be that Jesus would die, in order that those of his bloodline the Jews, they could be saved.

meaning_english: To confirm something, usually an agreement.
sample_bolinao: Mapalabas a panaon mayadi' sara nin nipapagket, main nin sayay yabi a saray lulalakyan nin pangulwan nan nubyo, ket mako sara sa bali ra nin nubya ta kalapen nayaynan i'ras sa bali na.
sample_english: After-sometime after they were finished confirming the agreement, there came a night when the party-of-the-groom headed by the bridegroom, (Emph) they went to the house of the bride to get her and bring her to his house.

meaning_english: To gave through explanations.
sample_bolinao: Sara tan abaw saray kalalamo' ra, niyakay-akay tan nipapala-palaway ray minsahi nin nangibwat konan Catawan itaw sa Antioquia.
sample_english: They and many of their companions taught and explained the message from the Divine also there in Antioch.

meaning_english: To have someone iron your clothes.

sample_bolinao: Pa'sekan may bangkag mo nin masakbay a parin yataben.
sample_english: Plant your plowed fields with a kind of rice that is harvested earlier than others.

meaning_english: The characteristic of being temperamental especially in children or old people and so sulking, moody and bad tempered.
sample_bolinao: Andi' kapa'selta duka' tan abara'.
sample_english: Don'tsulkfor it's bad and wastes time.

meaning_english: To make smoke.
sample_bolinao: Mibwat saray ilek no main pa'sok.
sample_english: The mosquitoes leave when they are smoked.

meaning_english: To direct smoke to something to dry or flavor it, or cause it to flower.
sample_bolinao: Pa'sukana mangga pigaw gumurak ket gumungan gulpi.
sample_english: Smokethe mango tree so that it will bear flowers and bear numerous fruit.

meaning_english: To continually have something delayed.
sample_bolinao: Kai na nin pa'te-pa'tengen nin gaw'en ti.
sample_english: He will not put-off doing this.

meaning_english: To prolong something or delay the progress.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' nin, sin saray nangiriklamo kona ket nako saradti kongko, kai koyna nin pina'teng.
sample_english: That's why, when those who filed complaints against him came here to me, I did not delay.

meaning_english: To remove some liquid from something and leave a remnant such as in cooking.
sample_bolinao: Mataway a luto' nin pinangat no pa'tyan a pangluto'.
sample_english: The fish stew dish is good when it is cooked down to a broth.

meaning_english: To remove the water from something.
sample_bolinao: Kubo a padalan nin madakep saray tilapya sa pina'tyan nin tanggal.
sample_english: Hedging-in is a method for catching the tilapia in a fishpond that the water is removed from.

meaning_english: To stop doing, using or consuming something for a period of time.
sample_bolinao: Kasan pa'wat ra sa pangusar nin kuryinti kanya' sabtay kalakyan nin bayadan.
sample_english: There is no stoppage of their using electricity and so their bill is extremely high.

meaning_english: To give a break to something such as work or wind.
sample_bolinao: No mapagal yaynay damulag nin mangadado, pa'watan ya ta pinggat maiyabot ya anggan yabina.
sample_english: When the carabao is exhausted plowing, give him a break in order that he will be able to last until the afternoon.

meaning_english: Something that is sent to a person through another person such as a message or package.
sample_bolinao: Mainpa'witmoyon ibat saArabia.
sample_english: You have aletterfrom Arabia.

meaning_english: To have something such as letters sent someplace through someone.
sample_bolinao: Pa'witanmoko li' kadi' nin kwarta ko no rumate' ka saArabia.
sample_english: Pleasesendme my money after you arrive in Arabia.

meaning_english: To flatter someone.
sample_bolinao: Pa'yukan ya si Mars ta madali' yan sumunor sa nibarita' mo.
sample_english: Flatter Mars so that he will quickly follow what you have told him.

meaning_english: Thigh, the upper part of the leg between the hip and the knee.
sample_bolinao: Alalaki apaadyan say bisit.
sample_english: Thethighsare bigger than the calf.

meaning_english: To get payment, rent or interest paid on something that is borrowed from you.
sample_bolinao: Paabang ya sa agamiren nin nipausar na.
sample_english: He gets rent on the tools he lets out for use.

meaning_english: To put something up for hire.
sample_bolinao: Mamaabang yan mapulo' a ribo si Juan ket liman yasot tamo' a abang na sa sayay bulan.
sample_english: Juan is lending ten thousand peso and the interest is just five hundred a month.

meaning_english: To have something moved forward or advanced from its present position.
sample_bolinao: Paabantiwen ma et buga' a ruran mo ta nakasalaban ya sa dalan.
sample_english: Have the vehicle moved ahead a bit further since it is blocking the road.

meaning_english: For someone to allow someone or something to cause delay.
sample_bolinao: Andi' kamo mangi'ras nin pitaka o bag o sapatos; tan andi' kamo paabara' nin kiirgo sa masnaan moyo sa dalan.
sample_english: Do not bring with you wallet or bag or shoes, and do not allow yourselves to be delayed by talking to those you meet on the road.

meaning_english: For someone or something to cause the quantity or amount of something to increase.
sample_bolinao: Matkap apaabawentamoy yatab tamon pari ta pigaw nin kai gumli anan gumli.
sample_english: We need to increase the production of rice so that the value will not keep on increasing.

meaning_english: To do something for the good of something.
sample_bolinao: Pinaabig nin idukasyon a kapapa'sar ran gindat maidap.
sample_english: Education improved the plight of those who were formerly hard up.

meaning_english: For someone to allow/let someone overtake him.
sample_bolinao: No main nin lumba' saray mampalayo sa u'na kai ra nin rabay apaabot.
sample_english: In a race, those who are ahead/leading don't let themselves to becaught up to.

meaning_english: To make someone worry.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mapaaburidwensi ina mo.
sample_english: Don't make your motherworry.

meaning_english: To have someone put forward to face something.
sample_bolinao: Ket, bana' ta saray Judio ket pinaadap raya konran tutawo siAlejandro, dinagdag rayan raruman tutawo ta pigaw nin mag'irgo ya konra.
sample_english: And so, because the Jews they put Alejandro forward before the people, some of the people prompted him so that he would speak to them.

meaning_english: To make something prosperous.
sample_bolinao: No mapami atamo, si Diospaadilantawennay byay tamo.
sample_english: If we are givers, God willprosperour lives.

meaning_english: To have a plain or flat surface made broader or enlarged.
sample_bolinao: Paagabaen raya a tekrean kanya' raya binagbag.
sample_english: They were having the chair seat enlarged and so they disassembled it.

meaning_english: To give a peppery flavor to something.
sample_bolinao: Luya nin mu'dit a mamaagas sa raruman pinyes.
sample_english: Red peppers give spice to some roasts.

meaning_english: To be made to be assiduous or enthusiastic by someone or something.
sample_bolinao: Say apes na ni Ilalo nin makasubli' anadti sa Pilipinas ket pinaagawa yan nagtrabaho tan naninep nin kwarta.
sample_english: Ilalo's desire to now come back to the Philippines made her work assiduously and save money.

meaning_english: To have someone taken advantage of.
sample_bolinao: Kasan marabay ninpaagrabyado.
sample_english: No one wants to be takenadvantageof.

meaning_english: To cause liquid to flow.
sample_bolinao: Bwalan rayay tanggal no ata'gay anay ranom na no rabay rayan paagusen a ranom.
sample_english: They will make an opening in the fishpond when its water is high if they want the water to flow out.

meaning_english: To have someone teach something.
sample_bolinao: Paakay ako nin mamilang koni nanay.
sample_english: I taught mother how to count.

meaning_english: For someone or something to make someone cry.
sample_bolinao: Namaakis yan anak si Pedro ta sutil yan talaga.
sample_english: Pedro made the child cry for he truly is one that pesters.

meaning_english: To have something make narrower or reduce the width of something such as a bed, door, table, blanket, etc.
sample_bolinao: Paakitiren moyay katri ta pigaw nin kai ya sumlet a kwarto.
sample_english: Make the bed narrower so that the room will not be crowded.

meaning_english: To give value or importance to something.
sample_bolinao: Si ina na, niyator tanpinaalagawannaytaw.
sample_english: His mother kept andvaluedthose things.

meaning_english: The state of making something grow or increase in size.
sample_bolinao: Paalaki raya si Caloy nin baying tan laking na.
sample_english: His grandparents are raising Caloy.

meaning_english: To rear or raise up an offspring.
sample_bolinao: Rabay nayan paalakyen a bali ra.
sample_english: He wants to make their house bigger.

meaning_english: To give space to something.
sample_bolinao: Paalawangen ray dalan sa isla pigaw makadalan a alalakin ruran.
sample_english: They expanded the road on the island so that large vehicles could pass through.

meaning_english: One who introduces himself or herself, to make oneself known.
sample_bolinao: Paalilbi' ka konran kakapi'sa mo ta kai raka tanda'.
sample_english: Let yourself known by your cousins because they don't know you.

meaning_english: To have someone or self moved from a location.
sample_bolinao: Rabay koyna nin paalis nin kami'nan sa trabaho ta sabtay amot sa pwisto ko.
sample_english: I want to have the place I work moved since my current place is extremely hot.

meaning_english: To have someone transfer something away to a different place.
sample_bolinao: Paalisen kwa nin tekrean si Juan ta nakasabar ya sa dalanan.
sample_english: I had Juan move to a different chair since he was blocking the pathway.

meaning_english: To put something such as a liquid with something such as medicine that is to be eaten or drunk in order to wash it down.
sample_bolinao: Pinaaluyunanna nin abugado a wana nin tistigos.
sample_english: The attorneyconfirmedthe statement of the witness.

meaning_english: To be exposed or subjected to the dew and so get wet and chilled.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka paamog ta sali' magmasakit ka.
sample_english: Don't get chilled by the dew for you might get sick.

meaning_english: For someone to put up a child for adoption.
sample_bolinao: Paampon ya si Mark ta nati yaynay ama na.
sample_english: Mark is being put up for adoption since his father has died.

meaning_english: To cast a spell on or calm someone down removing the fear.
sample_bolinao: Byan kwan kanen tan aprusen kwa a ulo nan aso no paamuen kwa.
sample_english: I give my dog food and rub his head when I calm him down.

meaning_english: To restore someone to good health.
sample_bolinao: Paandaenmosara a main masakit.
sample_english: Heal those who are sick.

meaning_english: To have someone make something to function or operate.
sample_bolinao: Paandarenraya anamana a ristawran ra.
sample_english: They will once moreoperatetheir restaurant business.

meaning_english: To make someone bawl.
sample_bolinao: Ubra nasaran paangaken ni Pablo a ari na no kasa ya si nanay ra.
sample_english: It is Pablo's job to make his younger siblings bawl when their mother is away.

meaning_english: To position something for someone to smell.
sample_bolinao: Paangutan moyan agwa-plurida ta maulaw ya.
sample_english: Have her smell smelling slats for she feels dizzy.

meaning_english: To make someone smell something.
sample_bolinao: Pinaangot raya nin amunya si Jana sin naklep ya.
sample_english: They made Jana smell ammonia water when she fainted.

meaning_english: To make something longer.
sample_bolinao: Rabay naynan mamaanro nin sabot.
sample_english: He wants to grow his hair longer.

meaning_english: To abbreviate a statement or word.
sample_bolinao: Rabay kwan paanteden a palda ko ta sabtay kaanrwan na.
sample_english: I would like to have my skirt shortened since it is extremely long.

meaning_english: To make something long.
sample_bolinao: Kitkiten ray kabyayan ran bubbayin balo, ket paanunrwen ray dasal ra nin panismula nin maraet a gawa' ra.
sample_english: They take away the livelihood of the widows and then they make their prayers long to cover up their wicked deeds.

meaning_english: To make someone or thing to move away from something.
sample_bolinao: Paanunurenmosara in pigaw nin main lugar iti sa adapan.
sample_english: Have them movebackwardso that there will be space in front.

meaning_english: Urge someone to hurry.
sample_bolinao: Aspuken naya ni tatay ko a damulag na no paapurawen nayan lumalako.
sample_english: My father whips his carabao when he goads him to walk faster.

meaning_english: To attract something.
sample_bolinao: Paaraken ko a sarba nin tawo nin paisirong sara kongko.
sample_english: I will cause all people to be attracted to place themselves under me.

meaning_english: To make something deeper or to go deeper.
sample_bolinao: Paararmen ma et in si mankalyen mo.
sample_english: Make that which you are digging still deeper.

meaning_english: Have someone or oneself kissed by someone.
sample_bolinao: Paarekka kona ni laking mo.
sample_english: Have your grandfatherkissyou.

meaning_english: To allow oneself to be made a slave.
sample_bolinao: Wanin ta say upa' nin paaripen sa kasalanan ket say patiti tan pakaisyay konan Dios...
sample_english: That's the case since the wage of slavery to sin it is death and separation from God...

meaning_english: For someone or something to cause someone or something to develop or improve.
sample_bolinao: Paarunsawen nin pagkamain nin mabistan dalan a kapapa'sar nan sayay lugar.
sample_english: Bringing about good roads improves the conditions of a certain place.

meaning_english: For a female animal to be sexually looking for a mate.
sample_bolinao: Umalipudas yay kabbayan nin damulag ta paasawa ya.
sample_english: The female carabao is restless because it's mating.

meaning_english: To have attention given to someone or self.
sample_bolinao: Rabay naypaasikasoket pa'no anamaet a gawa' ko.
sample_english: She demandsattention andso how on the other hand can I work.

meaning_english: To make someone scream.
sample_bolinao: Rabay naya nin paasisiten sa li'mo a ari na kanya' naya bantakan nin ipes sa dani na.
sample_english: He wanted his younger to scream with fear and so he threw a cockroach close to him.

meaning_english: Protect.
sample_bolinao: Saray manok nin siwsiw,paawa'sara konan ina ra.
sample_english: The chicks seek theprotectionof their mother.

meaning_english: To be attracted and influenced by something.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mo iyaburoy apaayatsa masam'it ni balikas na.
sample_english: Don't allow yourself to becarried awayby his sweet words.

meaning_english: To have someone else go along with someone.
sample_bolinao: Mampaayyen miyadsen tin busat kona ni Tito ta mampakailag kami ta pigaw nin kasa nin animan nin mairgo o isipen nin si'numan maipa'ka' sa panganga'get mi nin sayti nin malaem a tulong.
sample_english: We are sending this brother along with Tito since we are putting up a safe guard in order that there might be nothing that anyone could say or think against our handling of this abundant help.

meaning_english: To lower or move something down.
sample_bolinao: Bale' sa inugali' moyopinaayupa'moyay pubri.
sample_english: But in your actions you have degraded he who is poor.

meaning_english: To have something renewed or restored.
sample_bolinao: Ba'yon taon ana,paba'yuwentamoy kaisipan tamo kasa kumon gurang-gura'.
sample_english: It's new year, let usrenewour thoughts and there should be no more hatred.

meaning_english: To have something dropped or slammed with a hard force.
sample_bolinao: Pababnakan nako nin purta ni Maring no masnep ya.
sample_english: Maring slams the door on me when she is irritated.

meaning_english: To have things place on the surface of something.
sample_bolinao: Mataway a katiba a pababo sa binagkal.
sample_english: Coco butter on top of the rice delicacy is tasty

meaning_english: To apply something to the upper surface of something.
sample_bolinao: Main tinapay a pinababwan ran miringgi.
sample_english: There were some pieces of bread that they coated with meringue.

meaning_english: To have someone vaccinated.
sample_bolinao: Kai na rabay nin pabakuna kanya' main anan masakit na sawanin.
sample_english: Hi doesn't like to be vaccinated and so now he is sick.

meaning_english: To take action to allow others to respond to what one has done.
sample_bolinao: Mamabale' ka nin magkapitan pigaw masari' na.
sample_english: Let him have the chance to be the captain so that he will experience it.

meaning_english: To have or allow a response to something.
sample_bolinao: Pabale' ya si Dan konan kalamo' na nin mamakan konan ama na.
sample_english: Dan takes turns with his wife in feeding his father.

meaning_english: The action of doing something across the primary direction or any piece used as cross member on something.
sample_bolinao: Pabanlag a nipangartib ra konan abel.
sample_english: They cut across the fabric using a scissors.

meaning_english: To make something to go across something else.
sample_bolinao: Mamabanlag akon mida' sa katri no mi'sa ta alawang yay katri.
sample_english: Sometimes I lay crosswise on the bed since it is a wide bed.

meaning_english: To make something make a loud roaring sound.
sample_bolinao: Pabanurburen nayan kapitan a tunoy barko ba'yo ya umabay.
sample_english: The captain gunned the ships engine before he came to shore.

meaning_english: To soak in water.
sample_bolinao: Rabay koy pabarbar sa taaw.
sample_english: I like to soak in the ocean.

meaning_english: To have someone baptized.
sample_bolinao: Pabawtismo kamo no masunor moyoy adal ni Cristo.
sample_english: Have yourself baptized if you will obey the teachings of Christ.

meaning_english: To have something paid.
sample_bolinao: Pabayad sara tana a nabangga' nin Juan pigaw kasaynan kaso.
sample_english: The ones Juan collided with just paid so that there wouldn't be a court case.

meaning_english: To make something glow like hot embers.
sample_bolinao: Pabayawen ma yapo' a uring mi'sa ka mamayan kuna'.
sample_english: First get the coals hot and then roast the fish.

meaning_english: To bring sorrow on someone.
sample_bolinao: Andi' kamamaberengpigaw kai ka li' anamaet mapabereng.
sample_english: Do notmakeotherssadso that you will not also be made sad.

meaning_english: To have a child or pet carried in the arms.
sample_bolinao: Pabibi saray a'nak no napagal saraynan lumalako.
sample_english: The children have someone carry them when they get tired of walking.

meaning_english: The packing that is used to soak up the seepage in a wound.
sample_bolinao: Madta yaypabilonan lampadawan.
sample_english: Thewickof the lamp is burning brightly.

meaning_english: Canopy, a covering over something such as over a bed or a throne.
sample_bolinao: Alaki yaypabilyonsa intablado tan sadtay anda' na.
sample_english: Thecanopyof the stage is big and very beautiful.

meaning_english: To give respect through the proper social graces such as proper greetings and a serving attitude.
sample_bolinao: Pabindisyon ako konran ninong tan ninang ko no Disyembre.
sample_english: I will be blessed by my god-parents in December.

meaning_english: To take someone to be baptized with putting water on them and giving them a name.
sample_bolinao: Abaw saraymamabinyagua'nak ra no pista.
sample_english: There are many who let their children be baptized during fiesta.

meaning_english: To improve the quality and make something better.
sample_bolinao: Pabistawenmo kadi' a gawa' mo nin pirmi.
sample_english: You should always do your work better.

meaning_english: To lend or allow something to be used without payment for a period of time.
sample_bolinao: Matkap lamang isubli' no main pable' ran raruma nin tawo komo.
sample_english: You must also return something when there is someone who lends to you.

meaning_english: To lend to someone with the understanding of reciprocity of the same thing at some point.
sample_bolinao: Pableannako pan sansalop a byas mo ta silyan ko dilap.
sample_english: Will you pleaselendme one measure of rice and I will exchange it tomorrow.

meaning_english: Make precious, costly, to value something.
To value or esteem something.
sample_bolinao: No matalag a masaliw nin kuna', mamabli saray main lako'.
sample_english: If the fish that can be bought are few, those that have fish increase the price.

meaning_english: Turkey.
sample_bolinao: Main nin alila' ko nin pabo.
sample_english: I have a pet turkey.

meaning_english: To make drunk.
sample_bolinao: Pinabok nasara a tutawo sa sarban nasyon nin say bara'mon mabayanin arak.
sample_english: It had made the people of all nations drunk with that which is like its strong wine.

meaning_english: in favor
sample_bolinao: Say pabor, pirmi mon makalap bale' sawanin kai na.
sample_english: You are always collecting favors but not today.

meaning_english: Factory.
sample_bolinao: Naaksidinti ya sapabrika saCavite.
sample_english: He had an accident at thefactory inCavite.

meaning_english: To manufacture a product for sale or to accomplish a specific purpose.
sample_bolinao: Ket, kwartawan rakamo yupa' sa pinabrika ran bula'-bula' a iyakay ra komoyo.
sample_english: And so, they make money off you by fabricating lies which they teach to you.

meaning_english: To have food provided to bring about fullness, the connotation is excessive.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka pabsoy tuloy no yabi ta maidapan ka nin manunaw.
sample_english: Don't over fill yourself at night for it will be difficult for you to digest it.

meaning_english: To satiate a need with food.
sample_bolinao: Mampabsuyen nasara sa matkap ray mampagkurang.
sample_english: He is abundantly meeting the need of those who are in want.

meaning_english: Fable, a story that is made up to teach a lesson.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a mabistan maadal ran a'nak sa pabula.
sample_english: There are a lot of good things for the children to study in the fables.

meaning_english: To make something such as a tree bear fruit by spraying chemicals or other means.
sample_bolinao: Suuren ray puon mangga no paburaken ra ta pabungawen ra.
sample_english: They smoke the mango trees to bring out the flowers so that they will produce fruit.

meaning_english: To make a tree bear many flowers by spraying, smoking or fertilizing.
sample_bolinao: Paburakenmoy mangga pigaw gumungan gulpi.
sample_english: Spray chemicalstothe mango so that it will bear flowers and many fruits.

meaning_english: Cajoling someone by pleasant words or flattery so that the person will do what you are suggesting.
sample_bolinao: Andi' tamo sara paburan no abas a gawa' ra.
sample_english: We don't favor them when their deeds are wrong.

meaning_english: To be favored or preferred over others of the same kind, thing or person.
sample_bolinao: Paburito nan prutasa manggan maluto'.
sample_english: Ripe mangoes are herfavorite fruit.

meaning_english: To build a strong flame.
sample_bolinao: Maidap nin paburungen a apoy sa syang no makusep a sungroy.
sample_english: It is hard to build a strong fire when the fuel is doesn't burn well.

meaning_english: Peacock.
sample_bolinao: Alaki tan nibusyag yay ikoy nanpaburyala bara'mon abaniko.
sample_english: The tail of thepeacockis big and spread like a fan.

meaning_english: To cause someone to yell.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma paburyawen si Gwen pigaw kai ya sumakit a bukraw na.
sample_english: Don't make Gwen yell so that her throat doesn't get sore.

meaning_english: To make the flow of something rush down something.
sample_bolinao: Pabusayen may agos nin ranom sa kitikit sa tanggal.
sample_english: Let the flow of water in the canal rush down into the fishpond.

meaning_english: To go to the center or middle of something.unnecessary
sample_bolinao: Mamabutlayka pigaw kai ka manabo'.
sample_english: Goto the center so that you will not fall.

meaning_english: To allow oneself to be punched.
To give weight something to hold it in place or weight it down.
sample_bolinao: Main bato nin pabyat nan tago' sa bubon pigaw madali' yan lumdeg.
sample_english: There is a stone to weigh down the dipper in the well so that it will sink quickly.

meaning_english: To have a wight put on something.
sample_bolinao: Say ibarita' ko komoyo ket, andi' tamo sara nin pabyatan a ambo' nin Judio nin mampagmatalek konan Dios.
sample_english: What I am telling you is, let us not weigh down with that those who are non-Jewswho are trusting in God.

meaning_english: To have something made heavy, significant or valued.
sample_bolinao: Pabyaten ko a timbang ko pigaw umabot sa timbang nin kalaban ko sa buksing.
sample_english: I will put on weight so as to reach the weight of my boxing opponent.

meaning_english: To maintain or restore to health and life.
sample_bolinao: Abaw saraynay pabyay ko nin kuna'.
sample_english: There are a lot of fish that I have kept healthy.

meaning_english: To provide the things that are needed to support life.
sample_bolinao: Bilang wadi' ket mangka'kit tamoya nin mampagkasalanan a kapada tamo nin mammemper, matkap a idasalan tamoya ta pigaw nin pabyayen naya et nin Dios.
sample_english: For instance if we see our fellow believer sinning, we must pray for him in order that God will yet restore him to life.

meaning_english: For several things to have something that is equivalent in some point.
sample_bolinao: Pada ata nin alaki a awak.
sample_english: You and I have the same size waist.

meaning_english: To give an implication about something but not saying it directly, typically a disparaging remark or hint.
sample_bolinao: Narnge' ko a pada'gis na nin milata' ya kanya' nipangalap koya nin inumen na.
sample_english: I heard his implication that he was thirsty and so I went to get a drink for him.

meaning_english: To imply something about somebody to intentionally hurt them.
sample_bolinao: Pada'gisannaya bale' kai na mataros.
sample_english: He isimplying things againsthim but he does not understand the situation.

meaning_english: To hurry oneself or someone else on to accomplish something. An instrument is likely used.
sample_bolinao: Si sayay benged nin tawo kai ya nin padagdag.
sample_english: An unheeding person cannot be fired up to do something.

meaning_english: Cause something to diminish in size or volume.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mo padaiklengen a busis mo no mangansyon ka.
sample_english: Don't reduce your voice when you sing.

meaning_english: To make small or reduces something in size or volume.
sample_bolinao: Mamadaite' nin tyan a pirmin pag'ihirsisyo.
sample_english: Always exercising reduces the tummy.

meaning_english: A means or method for accomplishing something. (This may have a negative meaning of manipulation, pretext.)

meaning_english: A place for showing something, easily seen.

sample_english: It was openly and none at all hindered him from preaching and preaching about the ruling of God and Jesus Christ who is the Uunuren.

meaning_english: To have something moved forward with an external force.

sample_english: You're repeatedly accelerating that vehicle and so it has consumed the gasoline.

meaning_english: To make something move fast.

meaning_english: For something to be sloping such that it may cause slipping downward.

To attract fish with the bait.

meaning_english: are becoming.

sample_bolinao: Andi' tamopaka'ngapanno abaw a subok sa byay tamo.

meaning_english: To make someone react in wonder or be amazed at an unexpected occurrence.
sample_bolinao: Paka'ngapen kwa nanay ko yupa' sa atata'gay nin grado ko sa iskol.
sample_english: I amazed my mother by having the highest grade in school.

meaning_english: The capability of quenching or putting out a fire.
sample_bolinao: Kasan paka'rep nin lampadawan no main salaban na.
sample_english: Nothing will make the lamp go out if there is a barrier protecting it.

meaning_english: To cause something to be delayed.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka paka'teng sa keen mo ta main gaw'en ta.
sample_english: Don't delay in what you have to go do for there is something we will do.

meaning_english: Someone or something happening to constantly interrupt someone.
sample_bolinao: No si sayay tawo ket pakaaba-abara' ya kai na nin mayadi'-yadi' a gawa' na.
sample_english: If a person allows himself to be constantly interrupted he won't be able to finish his work.

meaning_english: The capability of something to distract from a goal.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya pakaabara' nin anron udas si Juan konran mangutang kona.
sample_english: Juan is not distracted for a long time by those that borrow money from him.

meaning_english: The capability or specific underlying event that results in a distraction from the primary goal such as to be busy with something on the side either intentionally or unintentionally
sample_bolinao: Miikap sa silpon a pakaabaraan na ni Juan no mayadi' a trabaho na sa upisina.
sample_english: Playing on his cellphone is time killer for Juan when he finishes his work at the office.

meaning_english: The basis for bringing about beneficial outcomes.
sample_bolinao: Mangwa' ka nin gawa' nin pakaabigan ran tawo komo.
sample_english: Go about doing deed that will bring about benefits for your people.

meaning_english: The extent or range of a activity or thing.
sample_bolinao: Anted a pakaabot ran raruman tawon kai nakapag'adal.
sample_english: The comprehension of some people that haven't been able to study is short.

meaning_english: The capability of opening something such as a function.
sample_bolinao: No sumunor a bulan a pakaabri nan ba'yon iskwilawan sa babali.
sample_english: The opening of a new school in town will be the following month.

meaning_english: Getting acquitted or absolved from charge.
sample_bolinao: Mataman nin bana' anaod sa nipagkasalanan nan saya a si Adan, ket say sarban tawo, matkap nin mati, mas et a kuri para konra anamaet nin sarban tawo a kamaungan nan Dios tan say pakaabswilto a mangibwat sa kamaungan nan si saya a si Jesu-Cristo.
sample_english: Even though indeed because of one who is Adam having been condemned as having sinned, and so all people, they must die, much more effective yet for all people as well is the goodness of God and the absolving of wrong which comes from the goodness of the one that is Jesus Christ.

meaning_english: The capability of a situation of bringing about concern or worry.
sample_bolinao: Tumgen tamo' pakaaburido ko no minakem kayna.
sample_english: My worries will only be stopped when you are mature in your thinking..

meaning_english: The capability or specific underlying cause that brings about worry about something in particular.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka mangwa' nin pakaaburidwan na ni nanay mo.
sample_english: Don't do something that will give your mother something to worry about.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for bringing about learning from something in particular.
sample_bolinao: Say kamali' tamo no mi'sa ket pakaadalan tamo no ani a kusto.
sample_english: Sometimes it is our mistakes that we learn from as to what is right.

meaning_english: The means of making an advancement.
The capability of something being done that brings about grief or hurt.
sample_bolinao: Maidap yan makuyong si Juan bana' naod sa pakaagrabyado na sin naaksidinti sara.
sample_english: It's difficult to calm Juan down especially because of how he was treated when they had their accident.

meaning_english: The capability of accepting something.
The capability of learning from something in particular.
sample_bolinao: No bantyan mon pirmi a gaw'en ran karpintiro ket pakaakayan nin maarig mo.
sample_english: If you are alway observing what the carpenters are doing, it will be something you can learn from and exemplify.

meaning_english: The capability of providing care for something in particular.
sample_bolinao: Itaw sa bali na ni Juan a pakaalilaan nan ama na.
sample_english: It is there at Juan's house that his father is being cared for.

meaning_english: The means of recognizing something.
sample_bolinao: Say pakaalilbian moyo konra ket say pigagawa' ra, kapadan pakaalilbi' moyo no maabig yay kayo o mula sa paka'kit nin bunga na.
sample_english: The way you can recognize them is by their deeds, similar to your being able to recognize if a tree or plant is good on the basis of seeing its fruit.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for bringing about the recognition of something.
sample_bolinao: Say pakaalilbian moyo konra ket say pigagawa' ra, kapadan pakaalilbi' moyo no maabig yay kayo o mula sa paka'kit nin bunga na.
sample_english: The way you can recognize them is by/on the basis of their deeds, similar to your being able to recognize if a tree or plant is good on the basis of seeing its fruit.

meaning_english: The capability of put hair in a bun style.
sample_bolinao: Pa'noy pakaalipugo nan sabot mo ket anted ya.
sample_english: How is your hair supposed to put in a bun, its short?

meaning_english: Alertness so as to respond immediately.
sample_bolinao: Matkap a pakaalisto ka pirmi no saya kan pulis.
sample_english: If you are a policeman you must always be alert.

meaning_english: The capability of being able to smell something.
sample_bolinao: Pa'noy pakaangot mo sa banglo ket mabuer ka?
sample_english: How can you be smelling the fragrance, you have a head cold?

meaning_english: The capability of drifting and being tossed.
sample_bolinao: Pakaanor kami sa daluyon sa taaw.
sample_english: We were being carried along by the waves of the sea.

meaning_english: The capability of persevering something.
sample_bolinao: Pakaanos atamo sa idap ta sumili li' a inum'ay tan inawa.
sample_english: Let us be patient in bearingdifficulties for comfort and relief will take their place.

meaning_english: The process of being aware of something.
sample_bolinao: Andi' kamo pakaaram koni tatay no yabi kamoyna nin agawid.
sample_english: Don't let father be aware of it if it is at night when you come home.

meaning_english: State of enslavement.
sample_bolinao: Na'teng lamang a pakaaripen ran Pilipino konran Kastila'.
sample_english: It was paradoxically a long time that the Filipinos were enslaved to the Spanish.

meaning_english: Development or progress.
sample_bolinao: Gulpin nigusyo a pakaarunsa nan babali tamo.
sample_english: Having many businesses brings progress to our town.

meaning_english: The capability of being able to take on a concern and fulfill it.
sample_bolinao: Ma'kit mo a pakaasikaso na ni Juan no mako ka sa bali na ta kairgwan naka tan pakanen naka.
sample_english: Observe how Juan takes care of you when you go to his house for he talks with you and feeds you.

meaning_english: The process of advancing in a particular area.
sample_bolinao: Makapoy a akay kona ta kasan pakaasinso na sa byay.
sample_english: His education is lacking based on there are no advancements in his life.

meaning_english: The characteristic of being stacked together.
sample_bolinao: Mabistay pakaatip nin atep nin rabot sa ba'lag kanya' kai nin tumuro' no rapeg.
sample_english: The stacking of the roofing grass on the hut was good and so it did not leak if it rained.

meaning_english: The capability of falling behind.
sample_bolinao: Pangibwatan pakaatrasa nin pakagawa' trabaho a pangimayanmayan.
sample_english: To be procrastinating is the source of falling behind in accomplishing a job.

meaning_english: The capability of an ability to do something which gives confidence and courage.
sample_bolinao: Anggawan anay in nin pakababa' ko say ginwa' ko para komo.
sample_english: What I have done for you, that is the extent of my capabilities.

meaning_english: Despising.
sample_bolinao: Sarban kaidapan tan pakabalaw-balaw sirayti a subuken natamon Dios.
sample_english: All of the difficulties and criticisms of those here are God's testing of us.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for something in particular to be bringing about disdain or criticism of someone.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka gumawa'pakabalawanran mangatua mo.
sample_english: Do not do things that bringsdisdainon your parents.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for a particular situation to be bringing about exhaustion.
sample_bolinao: Say mikakaawro nin piikap baskitbol a pakabaldawan ko.
sample_english: The playing of basketball the whole day is why I'm exhausted.

meaning_english: The process of going astray.
sample_bolinao: Kasan pakabarang moyo ta kabisado koy dalan.
sample_english: You won't go astray for I know the road intimately.

meaning_english: The capability or basis of being soaked in a liquid.
The capability or basis for the reading of something in particular.
sample_bolinao: Si naipaskin sa plasa a pakabasawan nin patanda' sa bakuna no Sabado.
sample_english: What was announced in the plaza was the reading of the notice of the vaccination on Saturday.

meaning_english: The capability of being baptized.
The capability of something swelling.
sample_bolinao: Say pakabaya' nin tuod na ket bana' sa rayuma.
sample_english: The swelling of his knee is because of rheumatism.

meaning_english: The capability of tying up of something.
sample_bolinao: Pa'noy pakaberber nan siin si bula ket malimpek ya?
sample_english: How can that ball be bound up, it is round?

meaning_english: The capability of being shocked.
To be able to have the baptismal ceremony done.
sample_bolinao: Karabayan ran matua a pakabinyag nan saya anak.
sample_english: It is the desire of the parents to have a child baptized.

meaning_english: The capability of wandering off away from the normal activities.
sample_bolinao: Pakabulos yay aso mi no dandani yayna nin mangabing.
sample_english: Our dog is likely to wander off when she is about to give birth.

meaning_english: The capability of smashing, exploding or shattering something by force into small pieces.
The capability or basis of being uprooted.
sample_bolinao: Say pirmin rapeg, pangibwatan pakabwal nin kayo.
sample_english: The continual rain is the cause of the uprooting or the tree.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for making a living off from something.
sample_bolinao: Wanin ta maaburuyan moyon aripenen rakamo nin sarain a tawo, o pakabyayan rakamo, o itangay ray kayadian moyo, o pag'adi-adian rakamo, o padi-pading'eyan rakamo!
sample_english: It is like that because you allow those people to make you their slaves, or get their living off from you, or carry away your riches, or lord it over you or shame you!

meaning_english: A mangrove tree, thick leaved trees growing in the brackish water along the seashore or river.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a tinmubo' nin pakad sa rigrig baybay.
sample_english: There are a lot of mangrove trees that have grown along the seashore.

meaning_english: The capability of acting in a well behaved and mannered way.
sample_bolinao: Pakad'enka ta balasang kayna.
sample_english: Act in a modest well-mannered way because you are now a young woman.

meaning_english: The capability of subjugating something.
sample_bolinao: Sawanin ana a panaon nin pakadaeg na ni Satanas a syay mampag'uray iti sa mundo.
sample_english: Now is the time for the subduing of Satan who is the one who is ruling this world.

meaning_english: The capability to move or come so as to be near or close to someone or something.
sample_bolinao: Pakadani saraynan pakadani a kalaban ran sundalo'.
sample_english: The enemies of the soldiers came closer and closer.

meaning_english: The process of allowing or having something come near and have an affect on something.
sample_bolinao: Pakadanyen mosaray a'nak kongko.
sample_english: Have the children come close to me.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for a particular dangerous situation.
The capability or basis for bringing about the gathering of something into one particular place.
sample_bolinao: Sa alog a pakadinepan nin gulpin ranom no maksaw a rapeg.
sample_english: The place where the large amount of water comes together when there is a hard rain is the valley.

meaning_english: The basis that brings about an accident or sickness.
sample_bolinao: Pakadisgrasyawan a madalunot nin dalan.
sample_english: A slippery road is apt to cause an accident.

meaning_english: The capability of being aware of something that is going on.
sample_bolinao: Matkap a main ninpakadlawnan sayay tawo sa mampangyadi' pigaw magawa' nay manepeg.
sample_english: A person should beawareof what is going on so that he can do the things that ought to be done.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for making something evident or distinguishable for a purpose.
sample_bolinao: Say pakadlawan mo kona no mampibula'-bula' ya ket kai ya makakipastang.
sample_english: Your making clear to him his lying makes it so he can't stand to look at it.

meaning_english: The capability of persecuting someone.
sample_bolinao: Pinisisyak yan pakaduksa-duksa' a dupong ran mammemper nin Judio.
sample_english: The groups ofJewishbelievers were scattered by persecution.

meaning_english: The basis for bringing about the discovery of something.
sample_bolinao: Isen sa Biblia apakadumugannin tutuon akay maipa'ka' sa Dios.
sample_english: In the Bible is where the true teaching about God is able to be discovered.

meaning_english: The capability of punishing for something.
sample_bolinao: Main pakadusa ran ampangwa' duka' sa susuyot nin awro.
sample_english: On the last day, there is punishment for those doing evil.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for bringing about the punished for something in particular.
sample_bolinao: No mamili' kan saray mag'in nin pupangulo, panemtemen mo a say duka' a gawa'-gawa' ran raruma nin tawo ket padaran ana nin ma'kit, ket sayti mapala-palaway nin pakadusawan ra li'.
sample_english: When you are choosing those who will become leaders, remember that the evil deeds of some people are clearly evident, and so this makes clear that that they will go through punishment for it.

meaning_english: The capability pulling something out of a base substance.
sample_bolinao: Say pakadutdot nin kukayo ket bana' sa peres tan layos.
sample_english: The uprooting of the trees was because of the gusts and the flooding.

meaning_english: The capability of causing shaking.
sample_bolinao: Say pakaeyeg nin luta' ket bana' sa rayon.
sample_english: The shaking of the ground is because of an earthquake.

meaning_english: The capability of acquiring something.
sample_bolinao: Wanti a man'ipatanda' na: Bana' sa nikaipasaya moyo kona ni Cristo ta namper kamo konan Mabistan Patanda', si'kamon ambo' nin Judio ket maikikalamo' kamo konran Judio sa sarban kaabigan nin kamaungan nan Dios tan sa pag'in anamaet nin pinakalalaman nan Cristo a si Jesus tan sa pakaga'mor moyo anamaet sa nipangako' nan Dios.
sample_english: This is what he is proclaiming: Because of your having been made one with Christ since you believed the Good News, you non-Jewsare able to accompany theJewsin all the benefits of the goodness of God and in becoming as well what serves as the body of Christ who is Jesus and as well in acquiring what God has promised.

meaning_english: The basis for bringing about the fastening in a place of something.
To be made from something.
sample_bolinao: Gulpin alalakin kayo intaw a pakagaw'an nin mabistan bali.
sample_english: Previously there were plenty of large trees that could be used to make a beautiful house.

meaning_english: The capability or manner of how something is done or made.
sample_bolinao: Kasaynan pakagawa' ko nin mangadado ta masiken akoyna.
sample_english: I am no longer capable of doing the plowing since I am now an old man.

meaning_english: The process and cause of being able to remove something.
sample_bolinao: Say pakaglat na sa trabaho ket bana' sa kalukwan na.
sample_english: His being removed from work was because of his fooling around.

meaning_english: The actions involved in being strong or firming up something.
sample_bolinao: Nipapanemtem na anamaet konra a dumaer sara nin pakagsen sa pammemper ra.
sample_english: Therefore he reminded them remain steadfast in their faith.

meaning_english: The capability of desiring or wanting something.
Someone who is not lacking in anything, he is perfect.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pakahusto nan kwarta na ni Juan sin nako sa Manila.
sample_english: Juan's good use of money when he goes to Manila it perfect.

meaning_english: To have something said no to, such as being voted down.
sample_bolinao: Pakai ana nin gaw'en a kumidya no lumpos nin babali tamo.
sample_english: The putting on of the play during our town festal was voted down.

meaning_english: The capability of carrying something off to another place.
sample_bolinao: Say pakai'ras nin pinalingki sa isla ket pag'idapan tepe' mapres.
sample_english: The conveying of the thing to be marketed from the island takes a lot of effort each time that it is windy.

meaning_english: The thing that motivates or reason one is sent, the mission.
sample_bolinao: Ani anakaibakianmodti?
sample_english: What is yourmission here?

meaning_english: The capability of determining a date or time to coincide for a particular purpose.
sample_bolinao: Main binipisyo no mi'sa a pakaibanaan nin bayli no main kasal.
sample_english: Sometimes there is a benefit done coinciding with the dance when there is a wedding.

meaning_english: The capability of setting up or initiating something.
sample_bolinao: Say pakaibangon nan Ba'yon Pag'adian.
sample_english: The setting up of the New Kingdom.

meaning_english: The capability of leading someone astray from something in particular.
meaning_filipino: Lugar kung saan ililigaw; kung saan maililigaw.
sample_bolinao: Andi' kamo nin mangwa' nin animan a pakaibarangan nin si'numan, Judio ya man o ambo', o tutawo nan Dios.
sample_english: Do not do anything that will be a cause for someone to be led astray, whetherJewsor nonJewsor the people of God.

meaning_english: The capability of something binding or holding something in a particular place.
sample_bolinao: Kai yamakalapsotsa nakaibaruran na.
sample_english: He cannotget awayfrom his bindings.

meaning_english: The first meaning is a sexual lust and then may be extended to other things that others have.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka pakaibeg sa main konran raruma nin tawo.
sample_english: Don't lust after what other people have.

meaning_english: The capability of giving.
The capability of pouring something out.

sample_english: None of the contents can be spilling out of a four gallon container if there is a cover.

meaning_english: Persecution, trouble or hardship for someone.

sample_english: We ask/request you, my dear siblings, to acknowledge with appreciation those who are undergoing hardship for you, those chosen by the Lord to lead and teach you.

meaning_english: The brushing against something with a medium force.
sample_bolinao: Si pakaidaragos nan baluto sa bato a mamin gasgas konan baluto.
sample_english: The brushing of the boat on the stones makes scratches on the boat.

meaning_english: The event of falling forward on to the hands and knees.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pakaidugpa' na ni Mars sin nisakin ya.
sample_english: Mars fall onto his hands and knees was hard when he tripped.

meaning_english: The event of hitting the head on the ground.
The capability which may be used in distinguishing or making someone special or unique.

sample_english: Only the haircut is what can be used to distinguish Paolo from his twin.

meaning_english: The capability of joining to something specific.
The situation of how something is bound together.
The capability of attaching or fastening to something specific.
sample_bolinao: Main nin rubir nin pakaigalutan ran baluto no dumuong sara.
sample_english: There is a rope that fastens the boat when they moor it.

meaning_english: To have happened to hit something.
sample_bolinao: Idalan may baluto sa kasan pakaigketan na nin bato pigaw kai ya mabutbot.
sample_english: Take you boat to someplace where it won't bump into stones so that it won't have holes in it.

meaning_english: The capability of moving away from s/t.
The capability of digging something out from someplace specific.
sample_bolinao: Sitaw a ubot a magwa' nin pakaikalyan ran balitok.
sample_english: That's the hole where they are able to dig the gold from.

meaning_english: The capability of fulfilling the intent of something specific.
sample_bolinao: Anaod, nisintinsya nan Dios a nag'in nin ambo' nin manepeg a nakaikanaan nin intiron pinarsa na.
sample_english: Indeed, God condemned the whole of his creation to not come to its proper intent.

meaning_english: Ownership, the process of coming to possess.
sample_bolinao: Pa'no apakaikonmo sa luta'?
sample_english: How did you come to possess the land?

meaning_english: The capability of attaching to and towing something specific such as a boat at sea that is malfunctioning.

sample_english: What was able to be attached to be used for towing the vehicle that broke down on the road was a long rope.

meaning_english: The action of putting something in something.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pakaikwa nan pakwan sa prigidir.
sample_english: It is good to put watermelon in the refrigerator.

meaning_english: The capability of putting something in something particular to keep it.
sample_bolinao: Bag a pakaikwawan nin libro tan lapis ran ua'nak.
sample_english: A bag is where the children's books and pencils are put into to keep them.

meaning_english: The capability of finishing up an event.
sample_bolinao: Ma'teng et a pakaila'pos nan siin si mampa'sekan ta alawang ya et.
sample_english: The finishing of the dry-land planting will still take a long time since the area is still expansive.

meaning_english: The capability of protecting from particular danger by defensive action.

sample_english: Do not delay your chance to be saved.

meaning_english: The capability of taking precautions to avoid something bad.
sample_bolinao: Pakailag tamo nin maalisan nin buer ran tawo nin mabuer.
sample_english: We take precautions to stay away from the head cold of people that have cold symptoms.

meaning_english: The capability of rescuing out from someplace.
sample_bolinao: Say nidasal ko ket sa pakailigyas ran tutawo nin nadalanan layos.
sample_english: The prayer that I am offering is that the people that are experiencing the flood will be brought out of it safely.

meaning_english: That which may be used in saving from danger and evil.
sample_bolinao: Tikapen moyaypakailigyasannan kararwa moyo li' sa impyirno.
sample_english: Seek for thesalvationof your soul from the everlasting fire.

meaning_english: The capability of proceeding with stretches when getting up from bed to get the body woke up.
sample_bolinao: Pakaimarmar ya yapo' ba'yo ya mibangon.
sample_english: He goes through stretches first before he gets up.

meaning_english: The capability of becoming infected.
sample_bolinao: Say pakaimpiksyon nin sugat ket bana' ta kai mangkaringgasan.
sample_english: The cause of the infection is because of not keeping it clean.

meaning_english: The process of using an ability to provide comfort for something.

sample_english: The parent's focus of their ability to provide comfort is on none other than that which brings good to their children.

meaning_english: The capability of making something felt.
sample_bolinao: Kasan pakaingar no dutduten ran dintista a ngipen ta main pammakdar.
sample_english: There is nothing that is felt when dentists pulls a tooth since there is an anesthesia.

meaning_english: The capability of displaying or revealing of something.
sample_bolinao: Si pakaipadar nin mabistan ugali', yupa' sa gawa' nan saya tawo.
sample_english: The capability of displaying a good character is by means of the deeds of a person.

meaning_english: That which may be used in the reveling of something.
sample_bolinao: Say pakaipadaran nin katutu'wan ket sa husgado.
sample_english: The justice of the court is how the truth is exposed.

meaning_english: The capability of being conveyed along by something.
sample_bolinao: Say pakaipadpad nin basura sa baybay ket bana' sa maksaw nin siri tan daluyon.
sample_english: The drifting of garbage into the seashore is because of the strong winds and waves.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for something being scrapped.
sample_bolinao: Na'kit na ni Juan a pakaipagarudgod nan tuod na sin naaksidinti ya sa bisiklita.
sample_english: Juan saw how his knee got scraped up when he had the accident on the bicycle.

meaning_english: The capability of being released or removed from a danger.

sample_english: I ask the Lord to keep us from all evil.

meaning_english: The capability of being overturned in the water.
sample_bolinao: Si pakaipalkeb nin baluto ket bana' ta mabanlayon.
sample_english: The cause of the boat being overturned was the sets of oncoming waves.

meaning_english: The capability of exercising in order to make it a habit or develop a skill.
