sample_english: He is practicing taking things that aren't his because then they will not capture him at it.

meaning_english: The capability of proclaiming something.
sample_bolinao: Imbis nin nakapaed ti kumon sa pakaipatanda' nan Mabistan Patanda' maipa'ka' kona ni Jesu-Cristo, ket mas nakapaaligwas ana edet.
sample_english: Instead of it possibly being a hindrance to the proclaiming of the Good News concerning Jesus Christ, it has certainly brought much more progress.

meaning_english: The capability of proclaiming something in particular.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pakaipatandaan nin silibrasyon nin gaw'en sa plasa.
sample_english: The way that the celebration that is happening in the plaza is being proclaimed is good.

meaning_english: The capability of giving understanding to something.
The capability of bringing something in line with a standard.
That which may bring about imprisoning someone.
sample_bolinao: Say pangmamatin kapadan tawo a gawa' nin pakaipriswan.
sample_english: The slaughtering of your fellow man is a deed that brings about imprisonment.

meaning_english: A repository of something important.
The capability of wrapping something in particular.
sample_bolinao: Ma'get yay nakaipunggsan nan barbikyo nin sinaliw na ni Juan.
sample_english: The wrapping of the barbecue that Juan sells is sturdy.

meaning_english: That which enables a person to see the difference and is distinct and significant; a sign, signal, attribute.
meaning_filipino: Anumang bagay o ginagamit para makita ang pagkakaiba.
sample_bolinao: Ani apakaipurukansa irarate' ni Jesus?
sample_english: What are thesignsin the coming of Jesus?

meaning_english: The capability of being implicated or being shown to be involved in something in particular.
sample_bolinao: Kumal'is ka konran tutawo nin mampangwa' ambo' mabista ta sali' saray pakairanudan mo.
sample_english: Get yourself away from those people that are doing what is not good for perhaps they are the ones that you will be implicated with.

meaning_english: The capability of giving praise or honor.
sample_bolinao: Say mabistan gawa' a pakairayo mo sa raruman tawo.
sample_english: The good thing to do is to praise or honor other people.

meaning_english: The capability of bringing praise to something in particular.
sample_bolinao: Say sarba nin tawo, kapada a rabot, say kaugutan makri' tan say pakairaywan ra, kapada a burak, say kaugutan mapaso.
sample_english: All people are comparable to grass, its outcome is to be dried up; and what would-be-to- their -praise is comparable to a flower, its outcome is to go into obscurity.

meaning_english: The capability ofdetermining something specific ahead of time.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pakaisaadan nin byay na ni Abraham nin mabasa sa Biblya.
sample_english: How Abraham's life, which can be read in the Bible, was determined is beautiful.

meaning_english: The capability of making someone trip on or bump something in particular.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a bato nin pakaisakinan sa dalan no kasan tyo' mo.
sample_english: There are a lot of stones in the path that can make you stumble if you don't have a light.

meaning_english: The capability of being saved from danger and freed from punishment.
sample_bolinao: Saypakaisalbapara konran tumper koni Jesus a syay manalba.
sample_english: The ability to be saved is for those who believe in Jesus who is the one that saves.

meaning_english: The capability saving from a particular danger.
sample_bolinao: Wanin a ginwa' na sin nagmatalek kamo kona ni Cristo sin narnge' moyay minsahi nin katutu'wan maipa'ka' kona, a si Mabistan Patanda' nin pakaisalbawan moyo.
sample_english: That is what he did when you trusted in Christ when you heard the message of truth concerning him, which is the Good News of your salvation.

meaning_english: The process of returning what is borrowed.
sample_bolinao: Asikaswen moypakaisubli'nan siin si indam mon libro pigaw kai sara dumara' a nangdaman mo.
sample_english: Be careful how youreturnthe book which you borrowed so that they will not refrain from lending it to you the next time.

meaning_english: The capability slipping something in particular over something or clothe something.
sample_bolinao: Gulpin pakaisulutan nan kupya' na ni Juan ta alaki ya.
sample_english: There are a lot of people that Juan's hat will slip over since it is large.

meaning_english: The capability of writing about something in particular.
sample_bolinao: Abaw et a ginwa-ginwa' na ni Jesus a no isurat nga'min, sa wangko, kai nin malaman nin intiron mundo a libro nin pakaisuratan.
sample_english: There is still much more that Jesus did such that if it was all written, I would say, the entire world would not be able to contain the books that could be written about it.

meaning_english: The capability or occurrence of being separated from something.
sample_bolinao: Say kasan anggawan a pakasida' tan pakaisyay konan Catawan tan sa sangkaandaan nin nagwa' nin pakayadi' na a dusa ra li'.
sample_english: The endless destruction and separation from the Divine and from the most beautiful/wholesome things that his power has done will be their punishment.

meaning_english: The capability of exalting someone.
sample_bolinao: Edet anaod, matkap a para sa pakaita'gay nan Dios a pangwa' moyo nin sarba nga'min, mataman nin say pangangan moyo o say pinnom moyo.
sample_english: So then indeed, it must be that it is for the lifting up of God that you do every single thing, even in your act of eating or your act of drinking.

meaning_english: The capability of doing something in layers or coatings.
The capability of burying something dead in a certain place.
sample_bolinao: Kasabyan tawon nati, sa kampusanto a pakaitabunan ran.
sample_english: It is common that the place they will bury a dead person is in the cemetery.

meaning_english: The capability to commission something to a cause, a task or a service.
sample_bolinao: Si pakaitalaga nan saya pulis sa saya istasyon ket mangibwat sa upisina.
sample_english: The commissioning of a policeman to a certain station comes from the head office.

meaning_english: The process or manner of involving something by making reference to it.
sample_bolinao: Say pakaitambay nan saya tawo ket no ampag'irgwan raya.
sample_english: When they are talking about him, it is with references to a certain person .

meaning_english: To have control.
sample_bolinao: Sigurado a pakaitawir ran beyek no marigsa yay takong.
sample_english: The potent benefits to the piglet are assured if the sow is healthy.

meaning_english: The manner or process of spreading something.
sample_bolinao: Wana, <<Say pakaitayak nin akay maipa'ka' sa pag'aadi' nan Dios ket maiyarig sa pammakbo.
sample_english: He said, <<The spreading of the teaching concerning the Reign of God is comparable to leaven.

meaning_english: The process of something, usually the head, being thumped or bumped against something.
sample_bolinao: Say pakaitutog na sa traysikel ket bana' sa duka' nin dalan.
sample_english: His being bumped on the head in the tricycle was because of the bad road.

meaning_english: The manner or process of how continuing something.
sample_bolinao: Matkap a pakaituloy nin mag'adal nin kumpyuter.
sample_english: The continual studying of the computer is necessary.

meaning_english: The capability of intentionally falling over.
sample_bolinao: Pakaitumba ya sa raranom si Juan sin itaw ya sa taaw.
sample_english: You should have seen how Juan intentionally fell into the water when he was there at sea.

meaning_english: The process or manner of sprinkling something.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pakaiwarsik nin ranom sa mula na ni Juan sa gardin na.
sample_english: The manner of sprinkle done on Juan's plants in his garden is good.

meaning_english: That which may be used in giving birth.
sample_bolinao: Si ina a namili' no adti nin uspital a pakaiyabingan nan kakan anak na.
sample_english: It was the mother who chose which hospital her firstborn will be born.

meaning_english: The capability of spreading out something over an area.
sample_bolinao: Ikumitmiyayti nin pa'deng sa pasisirbi sa pakaiyalawang nin pag'adian nan Dios konan sitin lugar.
sample_english: We commit this structure to the service of the expansion of the kingdom of God in this place.

meaning_english: The process or manner of giving birth to something.
The capability of delivering something to someplace.

sample_english: Rose is brought by her father when she goes to school.

meaning_english: The capability of storing something in something specific.
sample_bolinao: Kahon sa kamuda a pakaiyaturan nin alahas ko.
sample_english: What I store my jewelry in is a box in the clothes closet.

meaning_english: Breadnut, a tree that bears fruit which is soft and looks like bread fruit but is seedy inside like jackfruit and is used as a vegetable.
sample_bolinao: Mabista yan ipising a pakak no mabistay nikaluto' na ta mataway ya.
sample_english: If the ripeness of breadnut fruit is just right it is good for a vegetable since it is tasty.

meaning_english: The manner of sleeping.
sample_bolinao: Tumuka ana a kai mo pakaka'lek nin kumplito no yabi, pisasakit ulo.
sample_english: The result of your not having slept the whole night, its your headache.

meaning_english: To be making someone laugh.
sample_bolinao: Ubra rayan pakaka'lisen nin ners a abing ta rabay-rabay ran marnge' a kare'ke' na.
sample_english: The nurses work at making the infant laugh because they love to hear her giggle.

meaning_english: The capability of taking or getting something.
sample_bolinao: Kusto a pakakalap nan papayas ni Juan sin nitudol na ni Rose.
sample_english: Juan's taking of the papayas when Rose handed them to him was perfect.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for bringing about the obtaining of something in particular.
sample_bolinao: Say pakakalapan ran buer nin a'nak ket say maray'ep nin panaon.
sample_english: The reason that the child has a cold is that it is the cold season.

meaning_english: The basis of the falling of something.
sample_bolinao: Say pakakanabo' nin bungan madidintek ket bana' sa nikatata.
sample_english: The falling of the small fruit is because of its immaturity.

meaning_english: The process of getting involved in something, often interrupting it.

sample_english: Your getting involved in the life of those that have a life is not good.

meaning_english: The capability of causing hate and irreconcilable fighting between people.
sample_bolinao: Masakit a lalaman ko bana' sa pakakibuno' ko konran raruman pasahiro sa bas.
sample_english: My body is sore because of a hateful fight with other passengers on the bus.

meaning_english: The process of coming close to something.
sample_bolinao: Buga'-buga' a pakakidani na ni Juan konan kaklasi na sa iskol.
sample_english: Little by little Juan is getting closer to his classmates at school.

meaning_english: The capability of making a request.
The capability of fellowshipping with someone.
sample_bolinao: Idasal moyo a wanin, ta pigaw nin no karabayan nan Dios ket maririket akon makarate' isen komoyo tan, sa pakakikalamo' ko komoyo ket mainawnan atamo.
sample_english: Pray like that, in order that if it is the will of God I will be able to joyfully come to you there and, in my fellowship with you we will be refreshed.

meaning_english: The means of churning up water or a liquid.
The means of participating in something.
sample_bolinao: Ket, li' no sumubli' yayna si Cristo a syay Sangkata'gayan nin Mammastor ra nin mammemper, byan nakamo li' nin primyo nin magnayon anggan-angga a siti ket say pakakirama' moyo sa kata'gayan na.
sample_english: And so, when Christ who is the Great Shepherd of the believers returns, he will give you a prize that will last forever which this is the participating in his greatness/majesty.

meaning_english: The capability of being reconciled.
sample_bolinao: O' a, nako yadti si Cristo tan nipatandaan naya sa sarba a Mabistan Patanda' maipa'ka' sa pakakituno tamo konan Dios, mataman komoyon ambo' nin Judio nin adayo' konan Dios tan komin Judio nin adani kona.
sample_english: Ah yes, Christ came here and he proclaimed to all the Good News regarding our capability of our being reconciled with God, even for you nonJewswho are / were far from God and usJewswho are / were close to him.

meaning_english: To make a clinging or clinking sound.
sample_bolinao: Pinakakling na nin masurok a sanyasot bisis.
sample_english: He dropped it noisily one hundred times.

meaning_english: The process of expansion or enlargement of food generally because of a fermenting agent.
For something to be locked.
sample_bolinao: Pa'noy pakalak nan kandado ket sida' ya?
sample_english: How can the padlock to be used to lock, its damaged?

meaning_english: To have something taken to someplace.

sample_english: The child begins to cry when he wants to be taken to bed.

meaning_english: The capability of getting thoroughly soaked.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka pakalbet sa rapeg ta sali' magmasakit ka.
sample_english: Don't get wet in the rain for you might get sick.

meaning_english: Deception of someone regarding the truth.

sample_english: When one is occupied and thinking about many things, it leads to confusion.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for bringing about the forgetting of something.

meaning_english: The process of encouragement.

sample_english: Juan's children are giving him encouragement at his house.

meaning_english: To make something calm.
sample_bolinao: Pakalmawen ma si tatay ta sabtan sager na sali' atakyen ya.
sample_english: Calm father down because in his extreme anger he might attack him.

meaning_english: The capability or basis of mud being stirred or churned up.

sample_english: The churning of the path into a mass of mud was because of the many people that passed by even though it was muddy.

meaning_english: The process and manner of cooking.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pakaluto' nan litson no kasisyawan tamo' a baya tan amot.
sample_english: The manner of cookinglechonis good when the coals and heat are just moderate.

meaning_english: The way or method of coming to be in the possession of something.
sample_bolinao: Pakamainen na ni Juan a kwartan indam na konan busat na.
sample_english: Juan's gets the money by borrowing from his sibling.

meaning_english: To have or allow someone to run and overtake someone.

sample_english: The baby lets her father chase her first before she lets him carry her in his arms.

meaning_english: The capability or basis of bringing about death.
sample_bolinao: No kwarisma a panaon nin pakamati ran tanaman tan dikot bana' sa amot.
sample_english: When it is the hot time it is the season of the death of the plants and grass because of the heat.

meaning_english: The basis for a death occurring.
sample_bolinao: Pakamatyan in say magmaniho nin nabok.
sample_english: The reason for the death of the driver was drunkenness.

meaning_english: A feast or banquet for a special occasion with a lot of guests.
sample_bolinao: Main nin pakasal kanya' nin main alakinpakana naisadya' konran bubisitas.
sample_english: There is awedding party and so there is a big feast prepared for the guests.

meaning_english: The capability of something falling.
sample_bolinao: Say pakanabo' nin alalakin bato ibat sa talugtog a makapaed konran lumabas.
sample_english: The falling of the large stones from the mountain is the hindrance for those passing by.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for a fall happening.
sample_bolinao: Kwan moyon salaban a kinali moyon luta' ta sali' pakanabuan ran a'nak.
sample_english: Put a cover on the hole you have dug in the ground because the children might perchance happen to fall into it.

meaning_english: Eatery, restaurant.
sample_bolinao: Mainpakananitaw sa palingki, itaw tamoyna mangan.
sample_english: There is arestaurantin the market, let us go and eat there.

meaning_english: The act of happening to make something fall.
The manner of being careful to keep something the way it should be.
sample_bolinao: Pakanda'akon maong no rumipay sa dalan.
sample_english: I am verycareful when I cross the road.

meaning_english: To have something fixed and put it in proper order.

sample_english: Becarefulof how you descend the stairs for you might fall.

meaning_english: To have something fed to something.
sample_bolinao: Mamakan ako nin aso nin inawro-awro.
sample_english: I feed the dog daily.

meaning_english: Bowlegged, having the legs curved outward.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka miaysing anted nopakangka.
sample_english: Do not wear short dresses if you arebowlegged.

meaning_english: The capability or source for bringing about a specific result like having a problem or a good situation.
sample_bolinao: Saypakap'unannin sarban kadukaan ket si dila'.
sample_english: The rootcauseof all evil is the tongue.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for something specific to happen.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka nin madali' manager konran tawo ta kai mo tanda' a pakapa'nuwan mo no gumale' sara.
sample_english: Don't get angry quickly with a person since you don't know how you might be responded to if they retaliate.

meaning_english: The manner of suffering.
sample_bolinao: Andi' kamo nin mali'mo ta mangibwat sa kamaungan na ket binyan nakamon pagkanawa-nawan magmatalek kona tan anamaet, nin pagkanawa-nawan mangirangep nin pakapadya'dya' ta pigaw nin umaligwas a gagara na ni Cristo.
sample_english: Don't be afraid since out of his goodness he gave you the opportunity to trust in him and as well, the opportunity to undergo suffering in order that the purpose of Christ might progress.

meaning_english: The way or manner of hindering.
The concerned manner of caring for something.
sample_bolinao: Pa'noy pakapaga ko sa tinda ko ket sa ukupado ako.
sample_english: How I care for may store is what keeps me occupied.

meaning_english: The way or manner of suffering.
The process of going through difficulties.

sample_english: Indeed, when we were still with you we warned you that we and you would undergo difficulty.

meaning_english: The manner of doing something with much difficulty.
sample_bolinao: Pakapaidap-idap yan rumipay si Juan nin usar a balsa mataman gulpin mutor.
sample_english: Juan goes through the exertion of crossing over using a raft even though there are many motorboats.

meaning_english: The capability of causing a restful situation.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pakapainawa ra sa sirong mangga no mapaya-paya a siri.
sample_english: There taking a rest under the mango tree is good when there is a slight breeze.

meaning_english: The capability or basis of being able to distinguish and so know something.
sample_bolinao: Ma'kit a pakapaipurok nin rigalo ran mainan konran pubri.
sample_english: The distinguishing features of the gifts from those that have means from the poor can be seen.

meaning_english: The process of producing and gathering things so as to have them.
The process of remembering something through some means.
The capability or basis for remembering something in particular such as a great man.

sample_english: This house isinmemory of one who is not alive.

meaning_english: The capability of placing something within something.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pakapangwa nin prutas a ripridyiritor.
sample_english: Being able to put fruit in a refrigerator is good.

meaning_english: The capability of satisfying some longing.
sample_bolinao: Pakapapda' kaynan ma'lek sawanin mintras kasan serep mo.
sample_english: You can satisfy yourself with sleep now while you have no one coming in.

meaning_english: The method of being made upright.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' yay si magtrabaho para sa pakapapteg na, no kai edet, si sayay magmatalek kona nin Dios a sya a makapamakasa nin kasalanan ran saray sikakasalanan.
sample_english: It is not the one who works for his being made upright, but rather it is the one who trusts in God who he it is who can make to be without sin the ones who are sinful.

meaning_english: To be participating in celebration.
sample_bolinao: Abir nin sitin amigo nan nubyo ket ambo' yay makaikon konan nubya, alakin lamang a ririket na ta mangkarnge' nay pakapariga nan nubyo.
sample_english: Even this friend of the bridegroom, he is not able to possess the bride, but even so he has great joy since he is experiencing the celebration of the bridegroom.

meaning_english: The capability of making something clean or pure through rituals.
The bringing about of wholeness.
sample_bolinao: Si'kamo, akuen moyo nin silili'mo a rispunsibilidad moyo nin pangibwaten a pakapasibulot nin pakaisalba moyo.
sample_english: As for you, accept with fear your responsibility to bring wholeness to your salvation.

meaning_english: The capability of binging about death.
The basis for bringing about the death of something.
sample_bolinao: Kasan ginwa' nan siin nin tawo nin matkap nin pakapatyan o pakaipriswan na.
sample_english: That person did nothing that should cause him death nor imprisonment.

meaning_english: The situation of being satisfied and pleased.
sample_bolinao: Pakapda' yaynan miikap si Juan mintras bakasyon.
sample_english: Juan is pleased to be home while he is on vacation.

meaning_english: The manner and process of proceeding someplace.
sample_bolinao: Say paku-pako ko sa lulugar a saray tutawodtaw ket kai ra et nin narnge' a maipa'ka' kona ni Cristo a makabada' a kai ako pakapika' isen komoyo sa Roma.
sample_english: My journey to the places where people have not yet heard about Christ has hindered me so I have not gone there to you in Rome.

meaning_english: The capability of bringing forgiveness or pardon.
sample_bolinao: Pa'noy pakapirduna na komo no kai ka namet mangkidawat nin dispinsa.
sample_english: How will he be able to forgive you if you don't also request the pardon.

meaning_english: The capability of imprisoning someone or thing.
The capability of pinching something.
sample_bolinao: Pakapitpit nin animan a parti nin lalaman ket masakit.
sample_english: The pinching of any part of the body hurts.

meaning_english: To castrate a male of spade a female.
The capability of imprisoning someone.
sample_bolinao: Sintinsyawan ran uman a raruman nangmati nin tawo bale', umanted a taon nin pakapiriso ra.
sample_english: They passed the verdict on the others of the murders as well but the years of their imprisonment was shortened.

meaning_english: The manner of being aroused from sleep or unawareness.
sample_bolinao: Pag'idapan a pakapukaw kona ni Siano sawanin ta sabtay nikabok na.
sample_english: Arousing Siano today is taking a real effort since his drunkenness is so severe.

meaning_english: The capability of being confined someplace in particular.
The capability of something to deteriorate.
The process of making something become weaker.

sample_english: All the tall trees in the barrio are weakening the cellphone signal.

meaning_english: The capability or basis of longing for something.
sample_bolinao: Bubsat, wanin anay pakarabay ko a saray kapada ko nin Judio ket maisalba sara kumon.
sample_english: Siblings, like that is my longing for my fellow Jews that they might be saved.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for being knocked off or fallen off from something.
sample_bolinao: Say pakaragrag nin basura sa basurawan ket bana' ta napno' yaynan tuloy.
sample_english: The reason for things falling out of the garbage can is that it is too full.

meaning_english: The way of telling when someone is desirous of something.
sample_bolinao: Madlaw a pakararabay na ni Juan nin mag'in maistro.
sample_english: Juan's desire to become a teacher is obvious.

meaning_english: The capability of clearing obstructions or detrimental things from an area.
sample_bolinao: Para sa pakararos nan dupong ket nati sara si Ananias tan Safira.
sample_english: For the cleansing of the assembly Ananias and Safira die.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for bringing about specific amusement, pleasures, recreation or diversions.
sample_bolinao: Andi' kamo paayat sapakarigawana minumundo.
sample_english: Do not be attracted by the worldlypleasures.

meaning_english: The capability of deterioration or damage resulting from something.
sample_bolinao: Say puon ninamnisyaket say pakarindi nan utek.
sample_english: The origin ofamnesiais a deterioration of the brain.

meaning_english: The basis for bringing joy to someone.
meaning_filipino: Bigyan ng kaligayahan; kaligayahan.; Libangan; aliwan; dibersiyon.
sample_bolinao: Nanaliw ako nin siwsiw nin kulor mu'dit pigaw main pakaririktan nan anak ko.
sample_english: I bought red chicks so that there would be something to bring joy to my child.

meaning_english: The capability or riskiness in how an accident could happen.
sample_bolinao: Main nin pakarisgo ran man'et nin ararem maong sa taaw.
sample_english: There are risks for those who swim really deep underwater in the ocean.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for something in particular to bring about disaster.

sample_english: Brakes an a vehicle that are not firm is risky.

meaning_english: The capability of receiving something.

meaning_english: The capability of being able to hear something.
sample_bolinao: Malino a pakarnge' ko nin libri anay mag'adal anggan grid 12.
sample_english: It is clear that what I have been hearing that studying until grade 12 is free.

meaning_english: To have the basis or option to be able to hear something.

sample_english: There are now many today that have the option to listen to songs.

meaning_english: The capability of dealing cruelly with something.

sample_english: It cannot be even if there is difficulty, or even there are worries, or even cruelty, or even hunger, or even lack of clothing, or even danger, or even murder.

meaning_english: To be made to have a physical defect or negative behavior that disturbs the person at recurring time intervals.
sample_bolinao: Main pakarwen na ni Dan nin manuga' buksing no mapading'eyan ya.
sample_english: Dan has a customary violent reaction when he is challenged to boxing and is put to shame.

meaning_english: The manner of restraining something.

meaning_english: The capability of getting ready or preparing something.

sample_english: How will you be able to invite him to go bath in the ocean since he doesn't know how to swim.

meaning_english: To get married by having someone conduct a wedding ceremony.

sample_english: There is a way for the soul of a person to be able to be saved when he follows the will of the Father, the Lord.

meaning_english: The capability of providing experiences, often times hard.

sample_english: He really has many trials in life.

meaning_english: The capability of experiencing of something in particular.

sample_english: It is good to experience the driving of a motorcycle over time before driving a tricycle.

meaning_english: What other say about, what one say about, reputation.

sample_english: The life of Christ good talk about.

meaning_english: The manner or way of ramming something against something.

sample_english: Ramming a stiff object against the body will bruise it.

sample_english: There are a lot of sicknesses that can happen to a child.

meaning_english: The capability of sucking up something.

sample_english: The tendency of a wound to take in water and becomes infected, swollen and painful due to infection.

meaning_english: The capability of being diligent regarding something.

meaning_english: The capability or basis for bringing about the certainty of something.

sample_english: When borrowed the money, he left the papers for the land as a security against the money which he borrowed.

meaning_english: The basis for bringing about the sentencing of something.

sample_english: So then since that is the case there is nothing he has done worthy for him to be sentenced with death.

meaning_english: The capability of being able to return someplace.

meaning_english: The capability of proving something by testing.

sample_english: Sam is always pestering his younger brother and so he is drawing harassment by his father.

meaning_english: The basis for bringing about the recording of something in writing.

meaning_english: For something to be placed in the condition of being locked.

sample_english: And so possibly he will answer from inside his house, <Do not disturb me for our door is already locked.>

meaning_english: Introduction, declaration, affirmation.

sample_english: And Jesus responded to him, <<You are fortunate, Simon child of Jonas, since it is not people who have made that known to you but rather, my Father himself that is there in heaven has made this known to you .

meaning_english: The capability of dividing something into portions.

The process of tasting something.

meaning_english: The process of food swelling from fermentation.

meaning_english: To cause something to be without feeling.

meaning_english: The process of coming before and facing something or someone, often in a discussion.

meaning_english: To be conversing with someone.
An act of separation.

meaning_english: The process of reconciling with someone.

meaning_english: Drop, please.

meaning_english: The process of being made one or uniting with something.

meaning_english: Sexual relations or to be lying at rest with someone or something in a horizontal position.

sample_english: Also as well, we are further repeatedly thanking God because when you had just heard the message that we communicated to you, you accepted it.

meaning_english: Swiftlet, a sea bird, it is believed that when there is impending bad weather they come to the shore flying low almost touching the surface of the sea.
Finishing and smoothing touches of a roughly cemented work or place.
sample_bolinao: Kasa et palitada nan ringring nan bali mi.
sample_english: No finishing cement has yet been put on the walls of our house.

meaning_english: To have the finishing coat of cement applied.
sample_bolinao: Mampalitadawenray siminto nan bali mi sa tukduan.
sample_english: They areputting the final touches on the cement ofthe flooring of our house.

meaning_english: To click the tongue.
sample_bolinao: Saray bubayi tan lulaki no kayaban nasaray barkada ra, palitak-litaken ray dila' ra.
sample_english: When the boys and girls call for their friends they hang out with, they make a clicking sound with their tongues.

meaning_english: To stare or look at someone steadily and intently.
sample_bolinao: Ma'kit a sager na ni Jose sa paliteng na koni Ustong.
sample_english: Jose's anger can be seen in the stare he is giving Ustong.

meaning_english: To watch something for a long time.
sample_bolinao: Palitengen na ni Juan a baka nin nangan nin mula nan agayap.
sample_english: Juan watched for along time the cow eating the asparagus bean plants.

meaning_english: Match stick, a small stick with chemicals at the end which when struck produce a fire.
sample_bolinao: Syaypalito,itikras ma pigaw magkamain apoy.
sample_english: Here is the match stick rub it to producefire.

meaning_english: To bring something out, normally a kind of entertainment, a show, drama, movie.
sample_bolinao: Tepe' pista abaw apaliwa'sa plasa.
sample_english: Every fiesta there are many shows in the plaza.

meaning_english: To examine so as to bring out the truth.
sample_bolinao: Sin sain, pinaliwa' nasara nga'min.
sample_english: At that, he sent them all out.

meaning_english: To be turned over such as plates, glasses, etc., so that the opening is at the bottom.
sample_bolinao: Palkeb a pwisto ran baso pinggat tumuro' a ranom nin nipanguyas.
sample_english: The position of the glass is up side down so that the water that was used for washing will drain out.

meaning_english: A balcony seat or box seat.
sample_bolinao: Mabistan tumekre' sapalko.
sample_english: It's nice to be in abalconyseat.

meaning_english: A manner of running.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' anaod nin si'tamo, matkap tamon galten a sarban makabyat sa pallayo tamo laloynay kasalanan a maitumba atamo.
sample_english: Therefore indeed we, we must remove all that weighs down in our race especially sin which can topple us.

meaning_english: Leaf of palm tree.
sample_bolinao: Sin si Jesus a Catawan limuob ya sa Jerusalem saray tutawo sinumna' sara nin nangrayo kona ket nampi' saran bulongpalmaket saytaw a niwas-iwas ra a nikanta ra Hossana!
sample_english: When the Lord Jesus Christ entered Jerusalem many people came to meet Him, they snapped off the branches ofpalmtrees and rejoiced and praised Him by swaying the palms saying Hosanna!

meaning_english: Royal palm, it is used as ornamental plant for decorations on the stage.
sample_bolinao: Usaren raypalmiranin ipangarkos.
sample_english: TheRoyal plantis used for decorations.

meaning_english: Slowly and deliberately.
sample_bolinao: Palna-palna' kan lumalako ta angka'lek ya si tatay mo.
sample_english: Walk softly, your father is sleeping.

meaning_english: Do deliberately, carefully, softly, gently and slow/y.
sample_bolinao: Mamalna-palna' akon lumuob sa bali mi no main tawo nin ampa'lek.
sample_english: If there is someone sleeping I go into the house quietly.

meaning_english: To act softly and courteously or with thought and thus it may be slow.
sample_bolinao: Unon palna' na kanya' ya makadakep nin kuna'.
sample_english: He had extremely slow movement and so he was able to capture the fish.

meaning_english: A mast.
sample_bolinao: Kasisyawan a kalakyan nan palo ko sa pami'pi'.
sample_english: My paddle I use for washing clothes is moderate in size.

meaning_english: The reddish comb on the head of a chicken.

sample_english: Normally my chickens have bigger combs.

meaning_english: To make something fly.

meaning_english: To compete in doing something.
sample_bolinao: Palpaganran iskwila nin gumawa' konan sangkabistawan a bituen.
sample_english: The students compete in making the best star.

meaning_english: For something to be a failure or not be completed successfully.
sample_bolinao: Palpak a plano ra nin mako sa taaw ta kai sara nituloy.
sample_english: There plan to go out to sea failed since they did not continue it.

meaning_english: Any elongated object such as a spike, tube or pipe to be driven into something.
sample_bolinao: Ararem a palpal ko kanya' maidap yan galaten.
sample_english: My stake is deep and so it is difficult to get out.

meaning_english: To put a pointed object into something.
sample_bolinao: Mamalpalkan bislak sa libed nan mula pigaw kai ma'kan nin ayep.
sample_english: Put bamboo slates around the plant so that it will not be eaten by the animals.

meaning_english: Palpitation, heartbeat.

sample_english: Thepalpitationof your heart is loud and clear.

meaning_english: A counterfeit document, a falsification.

sample_english: The papers for my land were falsified and so I cannot mortgage it.

meaning_english: Falsifier, counterfeiter, forger.
sample_bolinao: Nangipirma yan ngaran sakalakon tawo kanya'palsipikadorya ta ambo' tutuo a ginawa' na.
sample_english: He signed a name without the consent of the person concerned, therefore he is afalsifierbecause what he did is false.

meaning_english: To be faulty or counterfeit.
sample_bolinao: Palso a nipangwa' ran plano, kanya' bangli' mayba' ya.
sample_english: The premise of their plan was faulty and so it will probably collapse.

meaning_english: A gun, a thing used to penetrate something else.
sample_bolinao: Pulis ya si Oyeng kanya' main nin palsot na.
sample_english: Oyeng is a policeman and so he has a gun.

meaning_english: A toy gun.
sample_bolinao: Palsu-palsot a ikap na ni Nonong.
sample_english: A carved gun is the Nonong's toy.

meaning_english: To shoot at something with a gun.
sample_bolinao: Namantay ako nin palsutan sa tilibisyon.
sample_english: I watched the shooting on television.

meaning_english: To shoot someone with a gun.
sample_bolinao: Mamalsot saray sundalo' konran kalaban ra.
sample_english: The soldiers shot at their enemies.

meaning_english: A failure to show up to fulfill a responsibility such as a defaulting on a loan.
sample_bolinao: Say palta na ket abaw kanya' maidap yan singiren.
sample_english: His defaults on his loan are many and so it is difficult to collect form him.

meaning_english: Testis.
sample_bolinao: Kebetyay paltak nan anak ta nali'mwan ya.
sample_english: The testis of the childretractedbecause he was frightened.

meaning_english: A thing that floats when put into a liquid such as a buoy or a leaf.
sample_bolinao: Mangusar ya si Gadong nin istayrupor nin paltaw nin eket na.
sample_english: Gadong uses Styrofoam as buoy on his fishing nets.

meaning_english: To default or fail to fulfill an obligation in doing something.
To make something float on top of a liquid.
sample_bolinao: Say pataw bilang wadi' intiryor nin bikoy dyip, paltawen yay tawon mantumangoy.
sample_english: A life saver such as an inner tube of a jeep, will make a swimmer float.

meaning_english: The action of committing something to memory.
sample_bolinao: Paltep yaynan paltep si Allan konan diskurso na.
sample_english: Allan is going over and over his speech committing it to memory.

meaning_english: Plates made of wood used by former people.
meaning_filipino: Mga pinggan na kahoy na ginamit nuong unang panahon; plato.
sample_bolinao: Si baying ko sin mabyay ya, gisgisan nan pirmi apalti'na.
sample_english: When my grandmother was still living she always scrubbed herplatesmade of wood.

meaning_english: A homemade gun or toy gun that shoots some object,.
sample_bolinao: Masakit a paltik na sa tutulyan ko.
sample_english: His snap of the rubber band against my ear hurt.

meaning_english: To strike something with a quick flicking motion such as with a finger or a rubber band.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mo paltiken a tutulyan ko nin garamay mo udinon lastiko.
sample_english: Don't flick my ear with your finger or a rubber band.

meaning_english: A caustic liquid or juice of fruit that will cause a rash or burn.
meaning_filipino: Dagta ng kasoy, papaya at iba pa.
sample_bolinao: Lumnok a katat no makwan nin paltoy bikoy maluko.
sample_english: The skin develops water blisters if the caustic fluid from the cashew fruit get on it.

meaning_english: mast.
sample_bolinao: Indam naya ni Pedro a palu-palo kanya' kai ko nakapami'pi' aysing ko.
sample_english: Pedro borrowed the laundry paddle and so I was not able to do the laundry.

meaning_english: To do something to the extent of being abusive and beyond what is desirable.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mo palu-palulbuan a kakayapan mo.
sample_english: Don't abuse your privilege of roaming around.

meaning_english: Pine, a tree from which white lumber is cut and is commonly used for making furniture.
sample_bolinao: Si paluchina may'an ya kanya' ya manlumtaw sa ranom.
sample_english: Palochina is light and so it floats in water.

meaning_english: To give place to something.
The act of cultivating or loosening the soil such as around the base of plants.

sample_english: Its dusty because of the chickens loosening up the dirt.

meaning_english: Rubber slippers,tsinelas.
sample_bolinao: Misket ka tan isulot maypaluka'mo.
sample_english: Get dressed and put on yourslippers.

meaning_english: To have a tight object or action loosened.

sample_english: Juan loosens the bolts when repairing an engine.

meaning_english: part of roof
sample_bolinao: Bale', pinau-pau'nawan nasara ni Pablo a iti sa dupong a andi' sara nin paluko!
sample_english: But Pablo has warned them in the assembly saying don't be tricked!

meaning_english: To be positioned face down.

sample_english: Juan lies face down to get his sleep.

meaning_english: To have someone jump from some place.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mosara nin palukswen a a'nak ta kayadi' ra tamo' nin nangan.

meaning_english: To make something bend over or lie face down.

sample_english: Pedro has them bend over when he whips the children that are causing trouble.

meaning_english: Palo-maria, a soft wood used in shipping boxes. A medium-sized or large tree, reaching a height of 20 meters. Leaves are leathery, shiny, elliptic to obovate-elliptic, 9 to 18 centimeters long, narrowed to a pointed base and somewhat rounded tip. Flowers are fragrant, white, 2 to 2.5 centimeters diameter, borne on axillary racemes 5 to 10 centimeters long. Fruit is round, yellow, smooth, pulpy, 3 to 4 centimeters in diameter.
sample_bolinao: May'an tan malumo yaytin kayo sipalumarya.
sample_english: Palumaryais a kind of wood which is soft and light.

meaning_english: To make a solid stand against something thus making it soft or without strength.
sample_bolinao: Mamalumo nin karni a ma'teng nin labey no mangluto'.
sample_english: Meat that has been boiled for a long time is made tender.

meaning_english: A stump or root of a plant that easily regenerates and produces volunteer shoots.
sample_bolinao: No kayadi' primiro nan rapeg sa bulan Hunyo, abaw apalungpongsa sirong alalaki nin kayo.
sample_english: After the first rain in June there are many volunteer plants growing from fallen seeds under the big tree.

meaning_english: To allow something to make its way into an enclosed space.

meaning_english: A timber producing tree of the third class.

sample_english: The timberwhoselocal name ispalusapisis found in the mountains of Zambales where many kinds of lumber are from there.

sample_bolinao: Milulumba' saray ua'nak a muli' sa ta'gay palusibo ta wa' lamang makalap rayay kwarta a kantidad tulon yasot a pisos a pinunggos tan nakakatin sa ta'gay.
sample_english: Many boys struggled to climb thegreasedpole where they might be able to get the money in the amount of three hundred pesos which is wrapped and hanged at the top.

meaning_english: To have something go downhill.
sample_bolinao: Magprino ka tapalusongyay dalan.
sample_english: Put on the brakes, the road is going downhill.

meaning_english: To have something ripened, especially fruit.

sample_english: Transfer the mangoes out to Manila for it is their that you will have them ripened.

meaning_english: To have someone come inside someplace that can be closed up.

sample_english: Ask your friend to come in the house.

meaning_english: To have something loosened.

meaning_english: A failure of something because of something done wrong.

meaning_english: To be ineffective or stop functioning properly.

meaning_english: To be dangerous or a bad situation.

meaning_english: The location or site where erection of something is taking place.

meaning_english: To make an estimation or conjecture.

sample_english: What is the assumption for what you are going on about in the life of your enemy, Juan?

meaning_english: The process of showing something.
The process of appeasing someone.

sample_english: Bread is what is used to appease the cry of the child.

meaning_english: To do dry-land farming someplace specific.

sample_english: Let's go clear the dry land area.

meaning_english: Usury, the process of exacting interest on a loan.

sample_english: The interest taken on his house is high and so he can't do anything.

meaning_english: The process of valuing something.
The process of bringing up or growing something.
sample_bolinao: Si'kamo anamaet nin mangatua, sa pamaalaki moyo konran a'nak moyo, andi' moyo sara byan puon nin manager komoyo no kai edet, iyakay tan itungtong moyo sara nin bilang sa gaw'en nan Catawan no syay matua ra.
sample_english: You parents as well, in your bringing up of your children, don't give them grounds to be angry at you but rather then, teach and direct them like the Divine would do if he were their parent.

meaning_english: The process of making something expansive.
sample_bolinao: Say pangangakay konan Biblia apamaalawangnin Pag'adian nan Dios.
sample_english: Teaching the Bible is the way towidenthe Kingdom of God.

meaning_english: An agent that brings about the raising or enlarging of something.
The process of pacifying something.

sample_english: Candy is Pedro's pacifier for his younger sibling when he is crying.

meaning_english: The process of healing someone.

sample_english: A medication is what they use to relieve their headache.

meaning_english: The process of having smoke pass over something.

meaning_english: To have someone go through the process of tying together the bamboo flooring of furniture or a house.

sample_english: There was a lot of money that Juan spent in his bamboo furniture business for hiring someone to bind the floor of the framed bed.

meaning_english: To go through the process of degrading someone else.

meaning_english: The changing of something for the better.

sample_english: It is important torenewour characteristics/attitudes and change them to nice ones.

meaning_english: To be showing high regard and importance to someone.
The process or substance that perfumes for makes something smell nice.

sample_english: I use a clothes freshener when I do the washing.

meaning_english: The process of doing something frequently.

sample_english: A lot of money is needed for frequently putting on occasions with a large number of people to feed with good food.

meaning_english: The process of beautifying something or making it attractive.

sample_english: What beautifies of the character of people are the teachings of the Bible.

sample_english: Loveof money.

meaning_english: Hair ointment for men.

sample_english: Don't use hair oil if you have dandruff.

meaning_english: Kindling, the process or thing that is used as a starter for a fire.

sample_english: It is paper that we are using for for a starter in building a fire.

meaning_english: The process of showing off and flirting.
An process of degrading, to abase, to put shame.; bringing shame on someone.

sample_english: Do not degrade somebody, you might be degraded.

meaning_english: The process of igniting a fire.
sample_bolinao: Kasapigo a pamadta ko nin kandila'.
sample_english: I light a candle with the box matches.

meaning_english: A fire pit or area for having a fire.
The process of going to the doctor for treatment.

sample_english: When the disease is incurable there are a lot of expenses for going to the doctor.

meaning_english: Hospitality, to fellowship over a meal with another person.
sample_bolinao: Mabista apamadungora sa san'ili.
sample_english: Theirhospitalityto strangers is good.

meaning_english: Treating another badly inflicting injury or torture.

sample_english: When Paul was persecuting the Christian, he discovered Jesus.

meaning_english: The process of placing something in proper position for a purpose.

sample_english: Juan's placement of the shoulder of meat that he is slicing up is good.

meaning_english: A solid and durable place for cutting or doing other things.

sample_english: When I write I need a solid base.

meaning_english: To have something become something.

sample_english: Some people are not clear about my becoming friend with Juan's family.

sample_bolinao: Sawanin ko tamo' tanda' nin asin namin a usaren ran pamag'ong.
sample_english: It was just now that I came to know that salt, to my surprise, was what was used in making fish sauce.

meaning_english: The process of making salted fish paste in something.
sample_bolinao: Pasig a pamag'ungan mi nin kuna' sin saytaw.
sample_english: What we used back when was clay pots for making our salted fish paste in.

meaning_english: The process of respecting someone by caring for them.
sample_bolinao: Matkap main pamaga-paga tamo konran matutuntawo.
sample_english: There must be respect that we are showing to our elders.

meaning_english: Giving of respect.

sample_english: The orator delivered a eulogy about the dead hero.

meaning_english: The process of wrinkling something.

meaning_english: To get strength from something.

sample_english: Some older weak men get strength from a staff.

meaning_english: A place for lodging or for placing something.
sample_bolinao: Kasaynan lugar radtaw sa balin pamagtuluyan kanya' nin itaw sara sa kami'nan ran uayep, ket niyabing nayadtaw ni Maria a kakan anak na a lalaki ya.
sample_english: There was no more place for them in the lodging house therefore they stayed at the place for animals, and so there Maria gave birth to her eldest child who was a boy.

meaning_english: The restricted area in which to move such as where an animal is staked out for grazing.
meaning_filipino: Pastulan ng hayop; panginginain ng hayop.
sample_bolinao: Na'pos anay dikot sapamagudankonran damulag.
sample_english: The grass in the area where the carabao are tied to graze was consumed.

meaning_english: The process of making something abundant.
The process of having something pulled.
sample_bolinao: Say bulog nin baka, magwa' nin usaren sa pagtatalon o pamaguroy.
sample_english: The bulls can be used for farming and pulling.

meaning_english: Continual suffering.
sample_bolinao: Say pamai-paidap kontamo nin wanin ket mabasa tamo sa Masanton Kasuratan a wana:.
sample_english: Our afflictions that are like that we can read about in the Holy Scriptures that say:.

meaning_english: The process of driving something away or making it leave.

sample_english: The sound of the firecrackers was what drove the birds away.

meaning_english: The abuse or troubling of someone.
The process of playing with something.
sample_bolinao: Asirtawen moy pamaikap mo konan ari mo no kasa ako.
sample_english: Intentionally play well with your younger brother when I am gone.

meaning_english: Welding shop.
To produce something bringing it into being or view.
sample_bolinao: Ket no gaw'en moyo in, si Dios, pamainen nay katinekan sa kabibyay moyo.
sample_english: If you do that, God will-make peace come into being in your life.

meaning_english: The process of communicating a feeling.
sample_bolinao: Impurtanti a pamaingar tamo nin pangawa'nan konran mangatua tamo.
sample_english: It is important to express our feelings of love to our parents.

meaning_english: The giving of a drink.
sample_bolinao: No abas a pamainom mo nin tambar, ma'teng ya nin umanda'.
sample_english: If the administration of the liquid medicine is wrong, he will take a long time to get well.

meaning_english: The process of making something abundant in quantity.

sample_english: Their proliferation of mangrove plants along the seashore is good.

meaning_english: The process of making someone laugh.
