sample_english: The mother's way of making the child laugh was the crossing of her eyes.

meaning_english: The process of calming down.
sample_bolinao: Main nin tambar nin niiniksyon ra kona nin  pamakalma.
sample_english: There is a medicine that they injected him with that calms him down.

meaning_english: The feeding process.
sample_bolinao: Pakandaen moy pamakan konran baboy pigaw kai ma'met a kanen ra.
sample_english: Fix the pig feeder so that their food will not be spilled.

meaning_english: The process of having someone make a repair or mend something.
sample_bolinao: Si nakasida' konan bisiklita mo a pamakandaen mo.
sample_english: What was broken on your bicycle is that you are to be repairing.

meaning_english: The process of pointing out someone's sin.
sample_bolinao: Saray raruman kaklasi mo ket pamakasalanan rakan matamlad nin mag'adal.
sample_english: Some of your classmates are pointing out that you are being lazy in your studying.

meaning_english: The process of going someplace lower.
sample_bolinao: Makapadismaya a pamakayupa' ran raruman pulitiko sa kapada ran kandidato.
sample_english: The humiliation by some politicians of their fellow candidates is disheartening.

meaning_english: The commissioning or assigning to something.
sample_bolinao: Mako ka sa pamakian ra komo.
sample_english: Go to where they have assigned you.

meaning_english: The process of making something firm.
sample_bolinao: Say kanen ket pamaksaw nin lalaman.
sample_english: Food strengthens the body.

meaning_english: The process of having something pass by.such as time or a season.
sample_bolinao: Pangmumula nin tanaman a pamalabasan ko nin udas sa bali.
sample_english: The growing of plants is my pass time in the house.

meaning_english: The seed bed for starting plants or the area for growing rice seedlings.
sample_bolinao: Sida' nin batya nin main luta' tamo' a pamalakayan ko nin tarom.
sample_english: The area I start the eggplant in is just an old laundry tub with some dirt in it.

meaning_english: Interfering in an area that is none of one's business and usurping their place.
sample_bolinao: Kai mi rinabay a pamalakbat na ni Mars sa mampalitadawen min bali.
sample_english: We didn't like Mars interfering with our putting on the finishing coat of cement on the house.

meaning_english: The process of clapping or giving applause.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pamalakpak ran tutawo no magdiskurso yay miyor nan babali.
sample_english: The people's clapping is loud when the Mayor of the town gives a speech.

meaning_english: The process of casting something out from someplace.
sample_bolinao: Say in anay pamalakwanan, say imon mo nin kai ma'pos?
sample_english: Isn't what now is to be gotten rid of, is that jealousy of yours that has not been used up?

meaning_english: The manner or principles of management or operation.
sample_bolinao: Say pamalalako na ni Juan nin pamilya na ket mabista.
sample_english: Juan manner of leading his family is good.

meaning_english: The process of making something leave someplace.
sample_bolinao: Na'teng a pamalalakwan ran arara' sa puon mangga ra ni Rose.
sample_english: The red ants have been driven from Rose's Mango tree for a long time.

meaning_english: The place wherebalanakare fished.
sample_bolinao: Abaw apamalanakansa taaw Bolinao sin saytaw, sawanin kasayna.
sample_english: There were many fishtrapsfor balanak before in the sea of Bolinao; now there are none.

meaning_english: Coarse rock salt, sun dried salt.
sample_bolinao: Alaki ninpamalaraan.
sample_english: A bigsaltbed.

meaning_english: Places, activities or thoughts that have nothing hindering them but are free and open.
sample_bolinao: Pamalasway nin dalan a panglat nin susangan kayo.
sample_english: A path that has had the tree branches removed is wide open.

meaning_english: The process of criticizing.
sample_bolinao: Say pamalaw mo sa bakas ran raruman tawo ket ambo' mabista.
sample_english: Your criticizing the way another person looks is not good.

meaning_english: To make a criticism or someone.
The activity of hanging something out.
sample_bolinao: Pa'nat a pamalaybay nin aysing pinggat madali' kumrang.
sample_english: Flatten and stretch out the clothing that is being hung out so that it will dry quickly.

meaning_english: The process of hanging things on a line.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma pamalaybayan in si rubir ta masama' ya.
sample_english: Don't hang things on that rope for it is dirty.

meaning_english: The place that is traveled on.
The rising or expanding of something by placing in water.
sample_bolinao: Say ranom, usaren ra nin pamalbag.
sample_english: They use water in the process of expansion.

meaning_english: The process of beating something with a club for various purposes.
sample_bolinao: Mangkit akon mabistanpamalbal.
sample_english: I will look for a something good forclubbing.

meaning_english: An incubator or the place where eggs are incubated.
sample_bolinao: Main ana sawanin nin masaliw nin pamalemleman nin salay.
sample_english: There are those now days that are buying incubated eggs.

meaning_english: The manner in which the words are expressed or pronounced.
sample_bolinao: Matu'rir anaypamali-balikasnan anak.
sample_english: The child'spronunciationis now clear.

meaning_english: The process of getting healthy.
sample_bolinao: Say pinnom nin tambar a pamalinpyo nin kaingaran ran main masakit.
sample_english: A means of those having a sickness to feel better is the taking of medicine.

meaning_english: The process or event of marketing.
sample_bolinao: Madali' a pamalingki na ni Juan ta kai yayna mamili'-pili' nin saliwen na.
sample_english: Juan's way of marketing is quick since he is not choosy of what he buys.

meaning_english: The process of parging, putting a thin finishing layer of cement on a cement surface.
sample_bolinao: Limay sako' nin siminto a usaren nin pamalitada.
sample_english: There were five sacks of cement that would be used for the parging.

meaning_english: The place for the bringing out of something from an enclosure.
sample_bolinao: Main banda sa pamaliwaan tepe' pista.
sample_english: Each fiesta there is a band on stage.

meaning_english: The process of deceiving something.
sample_bolinao: Saray magtatalon ket mangwa' saran istatwa sa gagawa' nin pamalo' ra konran manuk-manok.
sample_english: The farmers make a statue in their field as a deception and deterrent to the birds.

meaning_english: The place of flying from or to such as a runway or landing pad.
sample_bolinao: Itaw sa lalawak a pamalpadan ra nin burador no mapres.
sample_english: The place they fly kites when it is breezy is there in the grasslands.

meaning_english: The process of shooting a gun.
sample_bolinao: Saypamalsotmo, wanti.
sample_english: Yourshotis like this.

meaning_english: Carpenter's line marker, snap line.
sample_bolinao: Siti si lastiko a pamaltik ko sa tutulyan mo no kai ka mangrenge' kongko.
sample_english: This elastic is what I will snap your ear with if you won't listen to me.

meaning_english: The process of coiling up something.
sample_bolinao: Nabalda ya sa pamalukay na nin nangalakin rubir.
sample_english: He was exhausted from coiling up the large, heavy rope.

meaning_english: The process of having something brought into someplace.
The action of something that is accompanying something.
sample_bolinao: Saray pinuyaan nin pakababa' nin tumulong, matkap a pakaseseg sara nin tumulong mangibwat sa pamamaaluyon nan gesen nin Dios konra.
sample_english: The ones endowed with the ability of helping, it must be that they diligently help from the accompanying strength of God for them.

meaning_english: The action of beautification.
sample_bolinao: Mabistay kaaalibanto nan trabahon maipa'ka' sa pamamabistan dudalan.
sample_english: The progress on the work concerning the beautification of the roads is great.

meaning_english: A ceremony performed in the forest when the spirits are called for to help someone that has a sickness or insanity because of meeting a spirit in the forest.
The process of soothing something.
sample_bolinao: Ma'kit a pamamakpa' nan ina konan anak nan man'umakis.
sample_english: The mother's soothing of her crying child can be seen.

meaning_english: The action of criticizing.
sample_bolinao: Pirmi yan makarnge' nin pamamalaw si Mars konran kaklasi na ta duka' a ugali' na.
sample_english: Mars is always hearing criticism from his classmates since his behaviors are bad.

meaning_english: The activity done to frighten someone.
sample_bolinao: Namper saray a'nak sa pamamali'mo na ni Mars nin main lampong sa kampusanto.
sample_english: From Mars scaring them, the children believed that there were ghosts in the cemetery.

meaning_english: The action or style of shooting.
sample_bolinao: Bawal a pamamalsot nin uayep sa tatalon.
sample_english: It is prohibited to go around shooting animals in the forest.

meaning_english: The activity of refreshing the memory of something.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pamamaltep no buklas no ampag'adal et.
sample_english: When you are still studying, it is good to be reviewing from memory in the morning.

meaning_english: Remembrance of something.
sample_bolinao: Tepe' ika-30 nan Disyembre ket kasan serep ta sitaw a awro nin pammanemtem koni Jose Rizal.
sample_english: Each thirtieth of December, no one goes in to work since that is a day of remembrance for Jose Rizal.

meaning_english: The process of observing something.
sample_bolinao: Tegnan moynay pamamantay tilibisyon ta yabi anan tuloy.
sample_english: Stop your watching of television for it very late at night.

meaning_english: The action of tying or wrapping things together.
sample_bolinao: Gaw'en ray pamamarkot no triseren ray pari.
sample_english: When they have field rice threshed, they wrap it in bundles.

meaning_english: The functioning of a promenade or a walk for pleasure.
sample_bolinao: Nagbaliw nin a'pat siraynaymampamasyar.
sample_english: They became fourgoing around.

meaning_english: The manner of throwing something.
sample_bolinao: Pamamasyo nin ustu-usto taman adayo' ya.
sample_english: The manner of throwing was perfect even though it was far off.

meaning_english: To be serenading.
sample_bolinao: Narnge' na ni Rose a pamamatben na ni Dan kanya' maririket yan maong.
sample_english: Rose herd Dan's serenading and so she was very glad.

meaning_english: The barking of an animal.
sample_bolinao: Masakit sa tutulyan a pamamatok ran aso no yabi.
sample_english: The barking of the dogs at night hurts the ears.

meaning_english: Have someone follow or abide by a set of instructions.
sample_bolinao: Istrikto ya konran tawo na maipa'ka' sapamamatumboknin gawgan-gan.
sample_english: He is strict with his men aboutfollowingrules.

meaning_english: Aim or guide to a target.
sample_bolinao: Asikaswen moypamamatyo'mo konan tyo'.
sample_english: Correct youraimof the lamp.

meaning_english: The process of splitting wood with a heavy sharp instrument.
sample_bolinao: Pamamlangnin kayo yupa' konan payakor.
sample_english: The splitting of wood by means of an ax.

meaning_english: Something done in order to commemorate something.
sample_bolinao: Si Huwebes Santo, syay awron pamanemtem sa abaw a idap nan Catawan.
sample_english: Holy Thursday is a day of commemoration for the extensive suffering of the Lord.

meaning_english: The process of remembrance.
sample_bolinao: Niyator kway singsing na pigaw main pamanemteman ko konan asawa ko.
sample_english: I stored the ring of my wife so that there would be something for remembering her.

meaning_english: The process of dusting off something.
sample_bolinao: Pamanggas kwa in nin ta'pok si abel nin ga'get mo.
sample_english: I will dust off the cloth that you are holding.

meaning_english: To bring about something.
sample_bolinao: Syay mampamangibwatan nin mabistan kapapa'sar.
sample_english: He is the one that is bringing about good situations.

meaning_english: The process of throwing out or discarding something to a place.
A place where show are performed.
meaning_filipino: Lugar na pinagdarausan ng mga palabas, programa; palatuntunan o panuoran.
sample_bolinao: Alaki a tilibisyon nin pamantayan mi sa bali.
sample_english: The television that we use for watching at the house is big.

meaning_english: The process of bringing something about.
sample_bolinao: Matkap moyoynan galten a ma'ran nin kinatawo moyo nin mampanida' komoyo yupa' sa pamapain nan siti nin uapes a mangibarang komoyo.
sample_english: You must remove your old nature which has been destroying you by means of this bringing about desires that are leading you astray.

meaning_english: The manner of maneuvering or operating a piece of machinery.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pamapalayo nan nigusyo ni Sam kanya' paspas yan umasinso.
sample_english: Sam's business is operating well and so it is prospering fast.

meaning_english: The process of thickening or making something more viscous.
sample_bolinao: Si yabyaban, pamapalet yan tinambungtambong.
sample_english: The arrow plant powder is used to thicken mixed sweet desserts.

meaning_english: The process of causing somebody to be satisfied or contented.
The process of welcoming an arrival.
sample_bolinao: Saray maistra ket ala syiti imidya sa buklas a pamarate' ran  istudyanti ra sa iskol ra.
sample_english: The teachers reception of their student to school is at six thirty in the morning.

meaning_english: To bundle maguey fiber to a weight of 50 kilos.
meaning_filipino: Nagbibigkis ng magey na umaabot sa bigat na 50 kilos.
sample_bolinao: Mampamardosaran amagey a ibyahi ra.
sample_english: They arebundlingmagueyfiberfor ship to other places.

meaning_english: To flutter or tremble violently from a hit in the head.
sample_bolinao: Pinamaregpeg nayay manok sin dingket naya sa ulo.
sample_english: He made the chicken flutter all over when he hit it in the head.

meaning_english: The process of cleansing or cleaning up of something.
sample_bolinao: Tepe' Linggo a pamaringgas ran bali ra.
sample_english: Each Sunday they are cleaning up their house.

meaning_english: The process of making someone happy.
sample_bolinao: Matistigusan ko nin alaki a pakarabay ra nin mapaririket rayay Dios, bale' kai ra nin matarusan no pa'no a pamaririket kona.
sample_english: I can testify of their great desire to please God, but they do not understand how to make him happy.

meaning_english: The process of receiving something.
sample_bolinao: Si nanay ana a pamarisibyan mon surat no kai nako marate' sa bali.
sample_english: Mother will be the one to receive from you the letter at the house if it can't get it to me.

meaning_english: To make a statement to someone.
sample_bolinao: Kasa gapon lamang ni saya nin anghil a namaritaan nan Dios nin sayti e a nibarita' na konan Anak na:.
sample_english: There is none at all, not even one angel, that God communicated this here which he told to his Child:.

meaning_english: The process of bundling something together.
The process of creation.
sample_bolinao: Sabtay anda' nin pamarsa nan Catawan maipa'ka' sa langit tan luta'.
sample_english: The Lord's creation of earth and heavens is superbly beautiful.

meaning_english: The making of an accusation or charge against someone.
sample_bolinao: Mampangkit saran puon nin pamarsawan ra kona.
sample_english: They were looking for a cause to accuse him.

meaning_english: To pop the joint as a form of treatment.
sample_bolinao: Marnge' koy pamartok na sa gamet na.
sample_english: I heard a joint pop in his hand.

meaning_english: The process of bathing something.
sample_bolinao: Duka' nin etengen a pamaryo' sa abing.
sample_english: It is bad to prolong the bathing of a baby.

meaning_english: The process of exploding something.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw maong a pamasabog ran syudad sin gira.
sample_english: During the war they throughly shot up the city.

meaning_english: Anything making a person provoked, irritated or angry.
meaning_filipino: Pampagalit; anumang bagay na pampainit ng ulo.
sample_bolinao: Sarban pamasager koni nanay mo a man-gaw'en mo.
sample_english: All of your mother's irritation are from what you are doing.

meaning_english: To have the body massaged.
sample_bolinao: No pailot tan pamasahi ako ket partuken ray but'ol gurot tan garamay ko.
sample_english: When I go to have body adjustments made and for a massage, my back and finger bones pop.

meaning_english: Something that can be read or the process of reading of something.
The process of boiling.
sample_bolinao: Say pamasbo a pammakulaney nin silag nin gaw'en apay.
sample_english: It is the process of boiling that makes cabbage palm leaves flexible for making a mat.

meaning_english: The process of broadcasting or pressing seeds which will later be transplanted into the ground over an area.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket mamangkag ya sa lalawak nin pamasedsedan na.
sample_english: Juan is dry-land farming the wide open area that he is seeding.

meaning_english: The process of making something sure.
sample_bolinao: Si Dios nin diri a mampamasigurado komi tan komoyo anamaet nin nikaipasaya tamo kona ni Cristo, tan syan diri a namili' kontamo.
sample_english: It is God himself who is making us and you as well sure of our being united in Christ, and he himself was the one who chose us .

meaning_english: The process of polishing or making something shiny.
sample_bolinao: Say pamasileng ran siminto ket madaras ta mainum'ay ta say agamiren ra ket madali' usaren.
sample_english: Their polishing of the cement is fast since it is easy because of the tools they use make it quick.

meaning_english: The process of being forgiven for something.
sample_bolinao: Sarbaynan pamasinsya ginwa' ko bale' kai ya nin nanguman sa abas nin gawa' na.
sample_english: I asked forgiveness for everything I did but he has not changed his wrong actions.

meaning_english: A gift given at Christmas time.
sample_bolinao: Nanaliw ako nin pamasko ko para konran matua ko.
sample_english: I bought what I will use as a Christmas gift for my parents.

meaning_english: Cutting board, a thick board used for cutting meat.
sample_bolinao: Iwaen moy karni sapamasnaan.
sample_english: Slice the meat on thecutting board.

meaning_english: The process of observing or seeing in order to clarify something.
sample_bolinao: Makapoy anay pamastang ni Laking Juan.
sample_english: Grandfather Juan's sight is weak.

meaning_english: The herding of animals in a place.
sample_bolinao: Alawang nin luta' kumon a pamasturan nin uayep pinggat kai sara mabitilan.
sample_english: The pasture land for the animals should be wide so that they do not go hungry.

meaning_english: The process of having something followed.
The way in which you throw.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pamasyo nan atis ni Juan kanya' napagpag yay bunga.
sample_english: Juan's manner of throwing things at the custard apple was strong and so the fruit was knocked off.

meaning_english: The process of bringing something to the top of something.
sample_bolinao: Bumba a pamata'gay ra nin ranom mangibwat sa rarem luta'.
sample_english: A pump is what is used to bring up the water from deep in the ground.

meaning_english: The process of putting a sharp edge on something.
sample_bolinao: Asaan a pamatademan ko nin kutsilyo.
sample_english: I do the sharpening of my kitchen knives with a whetstone.

meaning_english: Something for flattening something.
sample_bolinao: Plansa a pamatag ko sa aysing nin kenes.
sample_english: The thing I use for pressing a dress with wrinkles is an iron.

meaning_english: The process of seasoning food.
sample_bolinao: Gulpin pamataway nin dinaang a bilang sa salumagi, asin, la'ya tan raruma et.
sample_english: There are a lot of ways of seasoning fish soup such as tamarind, salt ginger and others.

meaning_english: The process of having something stopped.
sample_bolinao: Kuyong a pamatgen kona nin umakis.
sample_english: A pacifier is what is used to make him stop crying.

meaning_english: An obvious proof that shows something beyond a doubt.
sample_bolinao: No magdiskurso ya si Juan ket say ngingintar na a pamatnagan nin nirbyos na.
sample_english: When Juan gives a speech his shaking is an obvious proof that he is nervous.

meaning_english: The process or manner of hitting the top of the head.
sample_bolinao: Pengpeng a pamatok ra sa ulo nan aso.
sample_english: Its a stick that they are beating the head of the dog with.

meaning_english: The process of straightening something out.
sample_bolinao: Mangusar ako nin peteng nin pamatu'rir sa alabat nin man'ipa'deng mi.
sample_english: I will use markers for making the fence that we are putting up straight.

meaning_english: founding something upon.
sample_bolinao: Main ga'get mi nin titulo nin pamatukduan nin sarban man'ibarita' mi.
sample_english: There is a title that we hold to support all that we are saying.

meaning_english: The process of teaching what must be complied to.
sample_bolinao: Saray maistro ket mabista a pamatukid ra nin layi sa iskwilawan.
sample_english: The teachers way of teaching the rules of the school is good.

meaning_english: The process of confirming something as true.
sample_bolinao: Matkap apamatutuonan sayan tawo pigaw maabswilto o madusa yay saya tawo.
sample_english: A confirming testimony by person must be given in order for a person to be acquitted or punished.

meaning_english: The action of climbing on something.
sample_bolinao: Kawayan nin main sanga a pamauli'nan nin sanga nin agayap.
sample_english: The method of the asparagus bean tendrils climbing are by the branches of the bamboo.

meaning_english: To use something so as to have a medical operation performed.
sample_bolinao: Si'no kadi' a pangalapan kon ilamo' sa bayadpamaupirani Gaya?
sample_english: From whom can I get the extra money for Gaya'soperation?

meaning_english: The process of abandoning something.
The toilet area.
sample_bolinao: Pamaw'asan moynan utang ko komo a swildwen ko.
sample_english: Take my debt to you from my salary.

meaning_english: The process of baptizing someplace.
sample_bolinao: Mayadi' in, sinmubli' ya si Jesus itaw sa rubari' nan Ilog Jordan, itaw sa namawtismwan na intaw ni Juan.
sample_english: After that, Jesus returned to the other side of the Jordan River, there where Juan was formerly baptizing.

meaning_english: The process of giving gifts or things in order to help someone.
sample_bolinao: Mampamayabor yan saytin pupakababa' kontamo ta pigaw nin isadya' natamon makapagsirbi konran tutawo na para kona tan ta pigaw nin si'tamon pinakalalaman na ni Cristo ket maparigsa atamo.
sample_english: He is giving as gifts these abilities to us in order that he might prepare us to be able to serve his people for him and in order that we who serve as the body of Christ would be robust/healthy.

meaning_english: The process of charging or paying a bill.
sample_bolinao: Umnoy rabay monpamayadko?
sample_english: How much do you want me to charge?

meaning_english: The collecting of a payment by a person or organization.
sample_bolinao: Ipila kwayti si risibo nan kuryinti sa pamayadan.
sample_english: I have put in order these receipts for electricity for payment to the collector.

meaning_english: For someone to be responsible for making a payment.
sample_bolinao: No wanin edet, kai sara matkap nin pamayaden a a'nak ra.
sample_english: Well, if that's it then, their children do not have to pay.

meaning_english: The process of using an ax.
sample_bolinao: Paspas a pamayakor ra nin kayo nin isungroy.
sample_english: Their splitting of the wood to use for building a fire was fast.

meaning_english: The flapping of wings.
sample_bolinao: Tepe' buklas marnge' apamayakpaknin pakpak ran manok-manok.
sample_english: Every morning I hear theflapping of wingsof the birds.

meaning_english: The process of grilling something.
sample_bolinao: Madta a uring nin pamayawan nin kuna'.
sample_english: The charcoal for broiling the fish is flaming up.

meaning_english: Small bamboo tube of inter node length used as container for the lime of the betel-nut chew.
sample_bolinao: Napno' yan lituen apamaybawan.
sample_english: Thelime containeris full of lime.

meaning_english: The process of blowing on something.
sample_bolinao: Angyob a usaren na nin pamaysep sa syang.
sample_english: What he used to build the flame in the stove was a bamboo tube.

meaning_english: A thing for blowing into.
sample_bolinao: Anyuban a pamaysepan na ni Juan no mangusar yan kayo nin isungroy.
sample_english: When Juan uses wood for starting a fire he blows through a bamboo tube to give it air.

meaning_english: Excuses for something.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a pambar nan kai mako sa iskwilawan.
sample_english: He has many excuses for not going to school.

meaning_english: An alibi, excuse.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a pambar nan kai mako sa iskwilawan.
sample_english: He has many excuses for not going to school.

meaning_english: The process of sprinkling or spraying plants.
sample_bolinao: Spriyer a usaren ra nin pambo' sa mula ta kasan rapeg.
sample_english: What is used for spraying the plants because of no rain is a sprayer.

meaning_english: The process used to redeem something.
sample_bolinao: Sanribo a pambot ni Juan sa nisanla' nan rilo.
sample_english: Juan's redeeming of his watch that he pawned took one thousand peso.

meaning_english: Something to be pressed in order to make something happen.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya miabri a apoy ta sida' yay pamditan na.
sample_english: We can't turn on the power since the switch is ruined.

meaning_english: The process of beating on a head.
sample_bolinao: Mainum'ay ya nin pamekpek nin pasak a martilyo.
sample_english: A hammer is easy to use for pounding the head of a nail.

meaning_english: The process of throbbing.
The thing that binds or ties something together.
sample_bolinao: Main awit ko nin pamember kon sabot ko tepe' mako ako sa iskilawan.
sample_english: I have something to tie my hair with that I take each time I go to school.

meaning_english: The process of squeezing something out.
sample_bolinao: Dinarekdek naya tan nangali yan ubot sa sayay bato ta pigaw nin pamespesan yan ubas.
sample_english: He fenced it around and he dug a hole on a stone for use in squeezing juice of the grapes.

meaning_english: The process of shaking of the head to the sides.
The process of washing cloth or fibers to clean it.
sample_bolinao: Asirtawen mo a pamimi'pi' mo nin aysing nin maputi' pigaw mimu'kat.
sample_english: Pay attention to how you wash those white clothes so as to remove the dirty stains.

meaning_english: The place where the process of laundering clothes takes place.
sample_bolinao: Sa danin bubon a pami'pian mi pinggat madali' manago'.
sample_english: Our laundry area is close to the well so that it easy to get water.

meaning_english: The process of cooking with a dual heat source, above and below.
sample_bolinao: Dinepen moy bunot ta pamibingka' ko li'.
sample_english: Gather some coconut husks for I will make rice cakes later.

meaning_english: The process of differentiating things.
sample_bolinao: Kasan pamiduma-duma anamaet ta, mangibwat lamang sa kamaungan na, ikwinta nayan mapteg nin Dios a sayay tawo.
sample_english: There is as well no differentiation by him since, from his goodness, God, nonetheless, appraises a person as upright.

meaning_english: The process of reconciliation.
sample_bolinao: Kasan pangyadian nin sain nin pamidunong konra ta pariho saran mabayani.
sample_english: There will be no good outcome of the reconciliation process for them since they are equally aggressive.

meaning_english: Long pieces of bamboo for fastening down grass roofing.
sample_bolinao: Mampangayas akonpamikolbali mi.
sample_english: Iamstripping pieces ofbambootousetoholdgrass shingles of our house roofing.

meaning_english: The process of counting in a place.
sample_bolinao: Sa lamisawan a pamilangan ra nin kwarta pigaw mabilang maong.
sample_english: They are doing the counting of the money on the table so that the counting will be done well.

meaning_english: The process of mixing ingredients.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pamilawok nan pising na ni Rose sa man'iluto' nan pinakbet.
sample_english: Rose's mixture of vegetables in the vegetable dish she is cooking is good.

meaning_english: The process of making a choice from options.
sample_bolinao: Ket nangirikuminda sara nin rwa ran lulalaki nin pamilian ra.
sample_english: And they recommended two men to choose from.

meaning_english: The process of controlling or driving a vehicle.
sample_bolinao: Kusto a pamiluto na ni Juan konan bapor nin alaki.
sample_english: Juan's piloting of the large ship is perfect.

meaning_english: Normally a nuclear family, sometimes including others.
sample_bolinao: Sapamilya, main ama, ina tan ua'nak a mitutumbok.
sample_english: In a family there is a father and a mother and successive children.

meaning_english: Familiar, well known, intimate.
sample_bolinao: Pamilyarana kongko a rumipay sa baybay.
sample_english: To cross the channel in the sea isfamiliarto me.

meaning_english: Provide, The process of giving.
sample_bolinao: Sinalba naya nin Dios yupa' sapamimina nin sayay karniro.
sample_english: God saved him by providing a sheep.

meaning_english: The process of counting something.
sample_bolinao: Inasirta ran maong a pamimilang ran butos.
sample_english: They were very conscientious in the process of counting the votes.

meaning_english: A mixture of things.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pamimilawok na ni Rose sa rikado nin manlutuen na nin tinambutambong.
sample_english: Rose does a good job of mix the right seasonings in the mixed sweet desert she regularly cooks.

meaning_english: Go fishing with a hook and line.
sample_bolinao: Mabista apamimilwitno sa buklas ta mabitil saray kuna'.
sample_english: It is good to do hook and linefishingin the morning because the fish are hungry.

meaning_english: Forgiveness, giving pardon for something.
sample_bolinao: Mainpamimirdunana, abriyan a purta.
sample_english: There will be apardoningand she will open the door.

meaning_english: The process of signing something.
sample_bolinao: Si rabay saritaen nin pamimirma mo konan siin nin dukuminto ket umaburoy ka sa nakasurat.
sample_english: What your signing of that document means is that you approve of what was written.

meaning_english: The process of splitting things apart.
sample_bolinao: Madaras a pamimisi' nin pakwan ta matadem yay kutsilyo.
sample_english: The splitting up of the watermelon is fast since the knife is sharp.

meaning_english: The manner of holding a little part of anything by the hand and let it hang.
sample_bolinao: Pakandaen moypamimitbitmon sain say kuna' sali' no ta'ngalen ran aso.
sample_english: Be careful how youholdthat fish hanging in your hand, the dog might catch it with its mouth.

meaning_english: The process of crushing something.
sample_bolinao: Kusto a pamimitpit nan binayan maluko ni Juan.
sample_english: Juan's crushing of the roasted cashews was perfect.

meaning_english: Benediction, to pronounce the blessing.
sample_bolinao: Si ministro syay mamin pamindisyon konran tutawo.
sample_english: The minister is the one to pronoucebenedictionto the people.

meaning_english: Black pepper.
sample_bolinao: Abaw anay mampimula ninpamintasa Bolinao.
sample_english: Many are now plantingblack pepperhere in Bolinao.

meaning_english: The process of painting using a specific item.
sample_bolinao: Say pamintawan mo ket say mabistan matiryalis pigaw umteng yay ritrato.
sample_english: What is used in doing your painting is to be good materials so that the picture will last a long time.

meaning_english: The process of baptism in which a name is often given.
sample_bolinao: Saypaminyag, syay sayay paka'kitan pangrisibi koni Cristo.
sample_english: Baptism is a sign of receiving Christ.

meaning_english: Combining of things into one.
The process of separating out and showing favoritism.
sample_bolinao: Nagsikabarang nin tima a nisurat nadti ni Santiago konan sitin surat a bilang say maipa'ka' sa pakasubok tan pakatukso, pamipuruk-purok, pammemper tan mabistan gawa'.
sample_english: Santiago wrote here about various subjects in this letter such as trials and temptations, favoritism, faith and good deeds.

meaning_english: The process of taking a hold of something and forcing it in a certain direction.
sample_bolinao: Sabtay kasaw nin pamira ra sa rubir nan baluto sin madaluyon.
sample_english: Their lugging of the boat was so strong when the waves acting on it.

meaning_english: The process of making two things touch.
Process of forgiving.
sample_bolinao: Nipatukdo' a pammirduna sa kaayupaan nin nakem.
sample_english: Forgiveness is based on humbleness of mind.

meaning_english: The process of wasting something.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mo nin pamirdyan nin udas a kidiskusyon maipa'ka' sa akay a kasan kakanaan maipa'ka' konan Dios tan istu-isturyan mangibwat sin nu'nan panaon nin kai mangikadani konran tutawo konan Dios.
sample_english: Do not waste the time on arguing about teachings that have no value concerning God and myths from long ago that do not bring people close to God.

meaning_english: The event or being imprisoned in something.
The process of frying using something.
sample_bolinao: Si alakin kawali' a pamiritwan mo ta pigaw mainum'ay.
sample_english: It is the large wok you are to use for frying so that it will be easy.

meaning_english: The thing used for vegetables.
sample_bolinao: Talyasi a pamisingan ko ta gulpi a iluto' ko.
sample_english: What I will use for doing the vegetables is the large iron pan since their are a lot that I will cook for.

meaning_english: The process of splicing things together.
sample_bolinao: Asirtawen moyoy pamisuldong nin kawayan pigaw makakalawit tamo nin nin ungot.
sample_english: Pay careful attention to how you splice the bamboo so that we will be able to hook off the coconut.

meaning_english: Extension - pipe, room, etc. Anything used to extend the length.
sample_bolinao: Si anron taytay a namisuldungan nan Bolinao tan Anda.
sample_english: Its a long bridge that connects Bolinao and Anda.

meaning_english: The process of staking things together.
A carrying hanger, that which an item is carried by in a hanging manner.
sample_bolinao: Kwan taya nin pamitbitan a baldi ta nasida' yay awiwis na.
sample_english: Let's you and I put the hanger on the pail since it's strap is broken.

meaning_english: A game shooting rubber bands.
sample_bolinao: Pamitik nan puso' sa kakikimey na.
sample_english: His heartbeats in time with his actions.

meaning_english: The deceptive forcing of an outcome by bombarding someone with reasons, threats and arguments.
sample_bolinao: Pamitpityan ismay a maso.
sample_english: A ball-peen hammer is used in shaping lead.

meaning_english: The activity of throwing something round against a similar object such as a coconut against another coconut.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pamitupak na ni Dan sa ungot kanya' nadali' nin naspak.
sample_english: I am always the one he is borrowing rice from when he has none to boil.

meaning_english: The process of borrowing a consumable as a temporary measure.
sample_bolinao: Siko pirmi a pamlean na nin byas no kasan isa'pang na.
sample_english: I am always the one he is borrowing rice from when he has none to boil.

meaning_english: The process of forming bamboo with heat.
sample_bolinao: Palna-palna' a pamlok ra sa bayog pigaw kai mabari'.
sample_english: Be careful and steady with your shaping of the solid bamboo so that it doesn't happen to break.

meaning_english: The process of bringing an increase to something.
sample_bolinao: Nakatulong sa pamma'baw nin barangen a pangngiyawa' nin mamadas no bulan nin Marso o Abril.
sample_english: The prohibition of catching rabbitfish fries in the month of March or April has helped in increasing the number of rabbit fish.

meaning_english: The process of or establishing something such as an organization.
sample_bolinao: Matkap a plano sa pamma'deng nin bali.
sample_english: A plan is need for the construction of a house.

meaning_english: The process of making something firm or ratifying it.
The process of showing something or a sign of something.
sample_bolinao: Saya et, pinili' ya nin dudupong nin mammemper iti nin kalamo' mi sa pagbibyahi mi leleg a man'asikaswen mi ti nin pangungulikta nin pakairaywan nan Catawan tan pamma'kit mi nin ruros nin nakem min tumulong.
sample_english: One more thing, he was chosen by the assemblies of believers here to be our companion on our journeys while we give attention to this act of collecting which brings praise to the Divine and act of showing our willingness of heart to help.

meaning_english: The process of flattening something.
sample_bolinao: Say pamma'nat ra nin alamri ket maidap ta sabtay kina'bwan nin tiko' na.
sample_english: Their flattening of the wire was difficult since it had so many kinks in it.

meaning_english: The action of extinguishing something, generally a flame.
The process of assigning a value to something.
sample_bolinao: Napukaw a pammaalaga ran tutawo konan irgo ra sin naasikaso ran mangka'met yayna.
sample_english: The people's valuing their language was awakened when they realized it is now being lost.

meaning_english: For a man to engage in sexual acts with a married woman.
sample_bolinao: Nasida' a pamilya na ni Pancho bana' sa pammabayi na.
sample_english: Pancho's family is broken because of his commiting adultery.

meaning_english: Preciousness of something.
sample_bolinao: Pasublien koyayna komo si Onesimo ket bana' sa pammabli kon tuloy kona, bara'mo anan lamang nin man'ipa'wit koyay puso' ko.
sample_english: I am having Onesemis returned to you, and so because he is dear to me, it is like I am sending my heart as well.

meaning_english: Flattering.
sample_bolinao: O' tanda' moyon peteg a kai kami nin nangagamir nin pammabur-pabor tan kasan apes min kwartawan kamo.
sample_english: You know well that we we were not resorting/using to flattery and we had no intention to take advantage of you.

meaning_english: The process of talking against a person indirectly.
sample_bolinao: Pirmi a pammada'gis ra kongko tepe' ma'kit ra ko.
sample_english: Each time they see me they always insinuate something.

meaning_english: The process of putting someone to shame.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a ginwa' ra nin pammading'ey kongko.
sample_english: They did a lot of things to shame me.

meaning_english: Fore telling or prophesying.
Discrediting, speaking evil of someone.
sample_bolinao: Say pammaduka' nin kapadan tawo ket duka' nin gawa'.
sample_english: The discrediting of a fellow human being is an evil deed.

meaning_english: The actions of afflicting harm on something.
sample_bolinao: Kai ko nin maanusan nin pastangen a pammadya'dya' ra konan aso ra.
sample_english: I cannot bear to stand by and watch them afflict harm on their dog.

meaning_english: The process of preventing or restricting something.
sample_bolinao: Bale' sitaw si magmamadyik a si Elimas, ginwa' nay magwa' nan pammaed nin mamper yay gubirnador.
sample_english: But the one who was doing magic who was Elimas, he did everything to hinder the governor from believing.

meaning_english: To go through the process of studying.
sample_bolinao: Nipabalatay ran matua na ni Virgilio kona a pammag'adal konran ari na sa kulihyo.
sample_english: Virgilio's parents made it his responsibility to send his younger siblings to college.

meaning_english: The action of becoming something.
The process of making salted fish sauce.
sample_bolinao: Maringgas pammag'ong ran padas kanya' iti ako mampanaliw.
sample_english: Their making of salted fish sauce of rabbit fish is clean and so here is where I am buying it.

meaning_english: The action of caring respectfully for something
sample_bolinao: Asirtawen mo a pammaga konan ari mo no kasa kami.
sample_english: Take conscientious action in caring for your younger brother when we are not around.

meaning_english: The act of regarding someone highly.
sample_bolinao: Kasa tananpammagabagana sa kapada nan tawo.
sample_english: He has norespecttowards others.

meaning_english: Greetings.
sample_bolinao: Ibi tamo a pammagalang nin manepeg sa Mayor tamo.
sample_english: We give proper honor to our Mayor.

meaning_english: The action of strengthening something.
sample_bolinao: Wanin man mas alaki et nin adayo' a kakanaan nin pammagsen tamon say pagkakabyay nin maikana' konan Dios, ta siti a makatulong sa byay tamo sa kapresan tan mataman et sa byay tamo li' sa adapen.
sample_english: Nevertheless the strengthening our manner of life to be worthy of God is of much great value by far, for this is what can help our lives at the present time and even further our lives in the future.

meaning_english: The action of welcoming someone to stay a while.
sample_bolinao: Pinagtuloy rakoyna edet a bara'mon sa pammagtuloy moyo sa sayay anghil nan Dios, o bara'mon sa pammagtuloy moyo konan Cristo a si Jesus a mismo.
sample_english: You welcomed/received me in your homes instead like your welcoming/receiving in your homes an angel of God, or it is like your welcoming Christ Jesus himself.

meaning_english: The process of pulling something.
sample_bolinao: Say bulog nin baka, magwa' nin usaren sa pagtatalon o pammaguroy.
sample_english: The bulls can be used in farming or for pulling.

meaning_english: The action of pleasing someone.
sample_bolinao: Sain nin nibarita' ko ket ambo' nin pammagusto sa tawo.
sample_english: Those things which I said are not to please men.

meaning_english: The process of making or doing something.
sample_bolinao: Mabli a pammagwa' nin mabistan lamisawan tan tekrean.
sample_english: The making of beautiful tables and chairs is expensive.

meaning_english: The act of giving out punishment.
sample_bolinao: Say pammaidap ko komo, andi' mo gaw'en sa raruman tawo.
sample_english: Don't take out my punishment of you onto others.

meaning_english: The process of making something drowsy or anesthetizing.
sample_bolinao: Painumen raya kumon si Jesus nin arak a linawukan nin bagay a pinasyan pait a pammaka'lek.
sample_english: They were going to have Jesus drink some wine that was mixed with stuff that was very bitter which makes people drowsy.

meaning_english: A feeding vessel.
sample_bolinao: Lalabangan a pammakanan nin baboy sin kasa et nin batya.
sample_english: Troughs were the feeding vessels for pigs when there no wash basins yet.

meaning_english: The process of improving or repairing.
sample_bolinao: Kai nin man'umabanti a pruyikto ran pammakanda' nin dalan sa baranggay.
sample_english: Their project of improving baranggay roads is not making progress.

meaning_english: Yeast or a substance that makes something expand because of fermentation such as small amount ofputoleft in the bowl after mixing which is used for a starter for the next batch.
sample_bolinao: Say daite' tamo' nin pammakbo, pakbwen nay intiron minasa.
sample_english: A little bit of leaven causes the whole thing that was made into dough to swell.

meaning_english: Anesthesia or a numbing agent.
sample_bolinao: Sayti a pammakdar ran dintista no manutdot saran ngipen.
sample_english: This is a numbing agent of the dentists when they remove a tooth.

meaning_english: The process of giving a mandate or commission to do something.
sample_bolinao: Say pammaki' mo kona, andi' sa mabirngas nin irgo.
sample_english: Your giving of a mandate to him should not be with brash speech.

meaning_english: The process of strengthening something.
sample_bolinao: Say bitamina usaren ra nin pammaksaw nin risistinsya.
sample_english: The vitamins are what they use for the strengthening of one's resistance.

meaning_english: Act or agent of making something stiff.
sample_bolinao: Manguyat-uyat yayna si Mark sa pammaksir na.
sample_english: Mark's veins bulge from stiffening his body.

meaning_english: The process of making something flexible and weak.
sample_bolinao: Say pamasbo a pammakulaney nin silag nin gaw'en apay.
sample_english: It is the process of boiling that makes cabbage palm leaves flexible for making a mat.

meaning_english: Greetings given to someone, usually involving well wishes or blessings.
sample_bolinao: Say dudupong ran mammemper iti sa prubinsyan Asia, iparate' ray pammakumusta ra komoyo.
sample_english: The assemblies of believers here in the province of Asia extend their greetings to you.

meaning_english: The process of making something leave.
sample_bolinao: a pammalakwan kona.
sample_english: that it can be driven out.

meaning_english: The process of flicking something.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pammalantik nan la'wan ni Dan sa tatalon.
sample_english: The snaring mechanism of Dan's trap in the forest is strong.

meaning_english: The process of positioning something.
sample_bolinao: Inasirta ra a pammalasta nin halublak sin nangasinta sara.
sample_english: They were careful in their positioning of the hollowblocks when they laid them.

meaning_english: The process of rendering vengeance, revenge or punishment in return for a wrong.
sample_bolinao: Wanan Dios, «Si'koy makauray sapamamale'.»
sample_english: The Lord said, «Vengeanceis mine.»

meaning_english: Home, the house and the things contained in it that make it function, including people.
sample_bolinao: Mampittinek ya tamo' sa pammali ra si Blenda.
sample_english: The household of Blenda lives a quiet life.

meaning_english: The process of embalming.
sample_bolinao: Inasirta ran maong a pammalsamo ra konan bangkay.
sample_english: They were very conscientious in their embalming of the corpse.

meaning_english: The process of shooting a gun.
sample_bolinao: Say pammalsot mo, wanti e!
sample_english: To shoot, it's like this, ah!

meaning_english: The process of loosening something.
sample_bolinao: Pammalukak in nin ruskas say langis no mairot ya.
sample_english: A lubricant is used in loosening that bolt that is tight.

meaning_english: Duster.
sample_bolinao: Lupot a pammanggas na ni Juan sa babon lamisawan.
sample_english: Juan's duster for the table top was a rag.

meaning_english: The act of sweeping something.
sample_bolinao: Pirwawen moy pammanis ta kasama' mana.
sample_english: Do the sweeping twice for it is dirty again.

meaning_english: The action of bringing about death of something.
sample_bolinao: Ket linmiwa' saran tampor a Pariseo tan nako sara nin nikitarusan konran tutawo na ni Adi' Herodes no pa'non pammapati ra kona ni Jesus.
sample_english: And so the Pharisees went out immediately and they went to come to an understanding together with the men of King Herod as to how they will have Jesus killed.

meaning_english: The action of satiating something.
sample_bolinao: Nagkabyay kamodti sa babon luta' sa pipariga tan pammapda' sa kaririktan nan lalaman.
sample_english: You have lived here on the earth in partying and satiating the desires of the body.

meaning_english: The process of making something correct or someone righteous.
sample_bolinao: Mapteg yay Dios sa Pammapteg na sa Tawo Yupa' sa Pagmamatalek.
sample_english: God is Just in His Making People Upright by Means of Faith.

meaning_english: Reception.
sample_bolinao: Say pammarate' ra nin irgo nin ambo' tutuo a namiaway komi.
sample_english: The cause of our quarrel was an untruth they were spreading.

meaning_english: The breaking of something by bending it.
sample_bolinao: kapadan kai na nin pammari' nin liso konan dayamin naspok.
sample_english: characteristically the same as a rice straw that has been whipped in the wind but he will not be completely broken.

meaning_english: A celebration.
sample_bolinao: Pammariga sa a'nak a ikap.
sample_english: The toy is a fun thing for children.

meaning_english: The manner of saying something.
sample_bolinao: Makapasakit nakem a pammarita' nan irgo kongko.
sample_english: They way he spoke to me makes me irritated.

meaning_english: The act of nailing something.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pammasak na sa siir kanya' nin naspak.
sample_english: His pounding of the flooring was hard and so it shattered.

meaning_english: A substance used to polish something.
Forbearance with something that could be aggravating.
sample_bolinao: Paanrwen moyo pammasinsya moyo konran masisiken tan akukulaw no kerker sara.
sample_english: Extend your patience with the old men and women when they get mixed up.

meaning_english: An irritation.
sample_bolinao: Say pammasnep ra koni Juan, ipapanemtem ray utang na.
sample_english: Their reminders of his debt is what is irritating  Juan.

meaning_english: The activity of dragnet fishing.
sample_bolinao: Pammasnig a tingkapan ra ni Loding
sample_english: Loding's livelihood is dragnet fishing.

meaning_english: One's way of seeing or vision.
sample_bolinao: Duling a pammastang ko kanya' kasan marabay kongko.
sample_english: My sight is cross-eyed and so no one likes me.

meaning_english: Pasture lands for grazing animals on.
sample_bolinao: Say pammasturan ra nin kanding ket lugar nin abaw a dikot.
sample_english: The pasture land for goats is the place where there is a lot of grass/weeds.

meaning_english: The action of returning something to a previous position.
sample_bolinao: Main bada'nan ra nin pammasubli' kona.
sample_english: Those that are returning it to him have an excuse.

meaning_english: The process of something rising.
sample_bolinao: Mangyadi' in li' sa awron isusubli' na ta pigaw nin risibyen nay pammagalang ran saray nipurok nan tutawo na tan say pammata'gay ran sarba ran nagmatalek kona.
sample_english: That will happen on the day of his returning in order that he will receive the honor of those whom he had set apart as his people and the admiration of all those who have trusted in him.

meaning_english: A precautionary alert to a problem that could be avoided.
sample_bolinao: Bale' si Pablo, kai nasarayti makunsinti nin myimbro, tan nami yayna nin pammatalad konran mammemper.
sample_english: But as for Pablo, he could not sanctioned these members for he had given the believers a precautionary alert.

meaning_english: Seasoning used to make food flavorful.
sample_bolinao: Gulpi anay masaliw sa palingki nin pammataway nin kilawen.
sample_english: There are many things that can be bought in the market to make fresh meat tasty.

meaning_english: Something that makes something hard.
sample_bolinao: Pammatib'ey nin siminto a panglebet nin sayti.
sample_english: The hardener of cement is the wetting of the cement.

meaning_english: What is being gained or the interest on money.
sample_bolinao: Napauryan ray pammatubo' konan siin a anak ra.
sample_english: They neglected theupbringingof their child.

meaning_english: The base or the thing that something rests upon.
sample_bolinao: Lamisawan a pammatukduan kon papil no manurat ako.
sample_english: The table is the base for the paper when I write.

meaning_english: The process of bringing about compliance.
sample_bolinao: Sawanin, mayin a man'ikwa moya sa sayan panunubok a Dios bana' sa pammatukid moyo konran tumutumbok kona ni Jesus nin sain say gugan-gan nin pinasyan idap nin tukiden?
sample_english: Now, why do you put God to a test by having the followers of Jesus fulfill those commandments which are very difficult to fulfill?

meaning_english: Guidance or tutelage.
sample_bolinao: Anaod, mipaayupa' kamon paisirong sa pammatunong nan Dios nin makapangyayadi' sa sarba, ta pigaw nin ipata'gay nakamo li' sa awro nin nitalaga na.
sample_english: Indeed, humble your selves putting yourselves under the guidance of God who is most powerful of all, in order that he will raise you up on the day he has ordained.

meaning_english: Leaking or flowing, the process of a liquid passing out from a container either intentionally or unintentionally.
sample_bolinao: Wanin anamaet a say kalla padalan nin pakapirduna nin kukasalanan tamo nin tutawo ket say pammaturo' nin daya'.
sample_english: It's the case as well that the only way for the forgiveness of the sins of us people, it is the shedding of blood.

meaning_english: Repeated confirmations.
sample_bolinao: Napiriso ya bana' sa pammatutuo ran sistigos.
sample_english: He was imprisoned because of the testimony of the witnesses.

meaning_english: The giving of a warning for preparation so people can avoid bad consequences, precautionary advice.
sample_bolinao: Si abiso ran kukapitan ket pammau-pau'na nin magkamain nin pista sa babali tamo.
sample_english: The advice of the baranggay captains was for the prepares that would make our town fiesta happen.

meaning_english: Revenge.
sample_bolinao: Masakit a pammawi' na sa garaw.
sample_english: His revenge for the prank was severe.

meaning_english: The action of baptizing.
sample_bolinao: Say Pammawtismo kona ni Jesus.
sample_english: The Baptism of Jesus.

meaning_english: The process of making a payment on a bill.
sample_bolinao: Si Tepet Maipa'ka' sa Pammayad nin Buis.
sample_english: The Question Concerning the Payment of Taxes.

meaning_english: The place or person where a payment for something due will be made.
sample_bolinao: Ket ni'sa sin manlumalako ya, na'kit naya si Levi a anak na niAlfeonin nakatekre' itaw sa upisinan pammayadan nin buis.
sample_english: And then when he was walking along, he saw Levi the son of Alfeo, sitting in the office where taxes are paid.

meaning_english: The action of blowing something.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pammaysep nan kandila' sin bertdi na.
sample_english: His blowing out of the candles on his birthday was strong.

meaning_english: The body of beliefs of a faith or religion; one's belief or mental assertion of something.
sample_bolinao: Sinubok na tamo' nin Dios no pa'noy gesen pammemper ni Abraham.
sample_english: God only proved how strong thefaithof Abraham was.

meaning_english: The process or manner of binding something together.
sample_bolinao: Kurang sa irot a pammerber ran dayami ni Goden.
sample_english: Goden's bindings on the rice stalks is lacking tightness.

meaning_english: The action of squeezing something.
sample_bolinao: Mairot a pammespes ra nin ules pigaw maglat a ranom.
sample_english: Their squeezing of the blanket to get the water out was tight.

meaning_english: The place of squeezing something.
sample_bolinao: Mi'sa saytaw say inagod na ket nibuntok nadtaw konan si pa'sar ubot a pammespesan a say rabay nin ipatarusan ket say pangingirangep nin alakin sager nan Dios.
sample_english: Then that which he harvested with the sickle he threw into what was a hole for pressing which is meant to be understood as the undergoing of the great anger of God.

meaning_english: The process of giving something.
sample_bolinao: Say pamimi ran miryinda ket tepe' alas tris.
sample_english: The offering of merienda is each three o'clock.

meaning_english: The activity of carrying something in the arms.
sample_bolinao: Mapalna' a pammibi na sa abing nin mangka'lek.
sample_english: His carrying of the sleeping baby was very gentile.

meaning_english: Instructions.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mo lingwanan apamibilinko komo.
sample_english: Don't ignore theinstructionsI gave you.

meaning_english: The manner of something happening suddenly or the unexpectedness of it.
sample_bolinao: Say pammigra' nan siri nan bagyo a natumba nin abaw nin pupuon.
sample_english: There were a lot of trees knocked down because of the suddenness of the wind from the storm.

meaning_english: The aim or manner of a hit by an object or words.
sample_bolinao: Bana' sa pammikas na, nakaka'lek ya sin manpilaban sara.
sample_english: Because of the way he was hit, he was knocked out when they were fighting.

meaning_english: The process of making a decision.
The act of putting tension on something to stretch it out.
sample_bolinao: Say pamminat nin anro konan lastiko a maksaw nin pitik.
sample_english: The stretching of elastic to a long length makes the snap intense.

meaning_english: The process of painting.
sample_bolinao: Say pamminta ra konan bali ket sambutan ta rumate' saraynay main ikon.
sample_english: Their painting of the house was hurried to beat the arrival of the owners.

meaning_english: The act of visiting someplace.
The act of pouring out something.
sample_bolinao: Dya'dya' ra sa pammu'bo' nin saya dram nin ranom ta pinasyan byat na.
sample_english: They struggled pouring out the drum of water for it's weight was to much.

meaning_english: The act of gorging oneself.
sample_bolinao: Sabtay bitil nan aso kanya' sabtay daras nin pammuag na.
sample_english: The dog was extremely hungry and so it gorged itself extremely fast.

meaning_english: The process of making something flow forcefully.
sample_bolinao: Sipitiknan puso', syay pammugso nin daya' sa intiron lalaman.
sample_english: The beat of the heart, it is the forcing of blood to all parts of the body.

meaning_english: The act of eating breakfast.
sample_bolinao: Kasa et naluto' ra ket udas anan pammuklas.
sample_english: They haven't cooked anything yet and it is time for breakfast.

meaning_english: The act of using dynamite to fish.
sample_bolinao: Idalit moyayti si pau'na kuntra sa pammumbong.
sample_english: Post this warning against dynamite fishing.

meaning_english: The act or manner of wiping something.
sample_bolinao: Paspas a pammunas ra nin lamisawan ta abaw saray rumate' nin mangan sa karindirya.
sample_english: Their wiping down the tables at the eatery is very fast for there are a lot that are arriving to eat.

meaning_english: The act of pouring out of something.
sample_bolinao: Pinasyan dali' a pammusbos na nin ranom sa lalaman na no maryo' ya ket maray'ep.
sample_english: His pouring of water on his body when he bathes is extremely quick and so it is cold.

meaning_english: The place for burning something.
sample_bolinao: Ket kapingmatan main anan sayay anghil nan Dios a naka'deng sa pawanan nan altar nin pammuuran nin insinso a pina'kit kona ni Zacarias.
sample_english: And so suddenly there was an angel of God standing at the right side of the altar for burning incense that showed himself to him.

meaning_english: A harlot, or whore.
sample_bolinao: Saray pampam, mako saradtaw pirmi konra mangalap kwarta.
sample_english: The harlots always go there to them to get money.

meaning_english: A public passenger vehicle.
sample_bolinao: Mugot-sumaka sara a pampasahiro nin dyip sindo Birnis.
sample_english: The public jeeps go back and forth each Friday.

meaning_english: The process of acting in the belief of something.
sample_bolinao: Saykaipamper sa Dios, syay puon nin paka'metan nan tawo.
sample_english: No belief in God, is the cause of great lose among people.

meaning_english: The act of believing something.
sample_bolinao: Syaypamperanmo ta syaynay nakasari'.
sample_english: He is the one you are tobelievefor he is experienced.

meaning_english: The process of snapping or picking something from a plant.
sample_bolinao: Mainum'ay a pampi' ran madidintek nin sangan arunggay ta marames.
sample_english: It is easy to snap the small branches of the drumstick tree since it is weak.

meaning_english: The process of breaking or pinching something off.
sample_bolinao: Pampien ma nin arunggay si Juan nin ilawok sa tinula.
sample_english: Have Juan go pinch off a twig from the drumstick tree to mix in the chicken soup.

meaning_english: The process of protecting something.
sample_bolinao: Say pamrutikta na nin upa sa siwsiw na ket makapaka'ngap.
sample_english: The protection of a hen of her chicks is a wonder.

meaning_english: The process or manner of pouring something out.
sample_bolinao: Kusto a pamu'bo' na ni Juan nin irik sa sako' kanya' kasan na'met.
sample_english: Juan's pouring of the field rice into the sack was perfect and so nothing was lost.

meaning_english: To make something cheaper or lower the price.
sample_bolinao: Pamudawen nay lako' na pigaw madali' nin ma'pos.
sample_english: He is making what he was selling cheaper so that it will be gone quickly.

meaning_english: The process of beating a person or thing.
sample_bolinao: Ayi tan gamet a pamugbog na sa kalaban na.
sample_english: He is using his feet and hands to beat on his opponent.

meaning_english: The area for staking out an animal.
sample_bolinao: Itaw ma itaker a damulag sa pamugedan ra.
sample_english: It is there in the staking area that you are to tether the carabao.

meaning_english: The process of spraying.
To be making a payment of taxes.
sample_bolinao: Saray uadi' iti sa luta', si'noy pamuisen ra, saray a'nak ra o saray sakalakon tawo?
sample_english: The kings here on earth, who pays them taxes, their children or other people?

meaning_english: An area where the chopping of something is done.
sample_bolinao: Itaw sa luta' mi sa Anda a pamukanan ran kawayan nin babalsawen.
sample_english: There on our land in Anda is where they chop down the bamboo for making rafts.

meaning_english: The process of bringing a person to alertness.
sample_bolinao: Kinudit naya sa riking sapamukawna.
sample_english: He touched him on the side toarousehim.

meaning_english: The food to be eaten for breakfast.
sample_bolinao: Saypamuklasanmi dilap ket tinurtyas a salay tan sinanglay.
sample_english: Our breakfast tomorrow will be scrambled eggs and fried rice.

meaning_english: To have one's breasts grow especially on teenage girls.
sample_bolinao: Pamuklwenyayna ta labintuloy taon nayna.
sample_english: Her breast are now bulging out because she is now thirteen years old.

meaning_english: Hair cutting.
sample_bolinao: Matkap ket matadem yay kartib nin pamukris ko sa sabot mo.
sample_english: Sharp scissors for my cutting of your hair are a necessity.

meaning_english: A barber shop, the place where hair cutting is done.
sample_bolinao: Adayo' a pamukrisan itaw komi kanya' kai ako nakapapukris.
sample_english: The hair cutting place was there a long ways from us and so I was not able to have my hair cut.

meaning_english: A confinement to restrict the movement of a person or animal.
sample_bolinao: Main sawsundalo' sa purta nanpamukukan.
sample_english: There were soldiers at the door of thejail.

meaning_english: The process of releasing something.
sample_bolinao: Pakanda' ka sa pamul'is mon sarita'.
sample_english: Be careful of how you express your words.

meaning_english: A place to move something to or is available for doing something.
sample_bolinao: Siti apamul'isanmon pini'pian mo.
sample_english: This is theplacefor putting your laundered items.

meaning_english: Eraser, paint remover, wiper, scrapper.
sample_bolinao: Dandani yayna ma'pos a pamulak nan lapis ni Mars.
sample_english: The eraser of Mars pencil is almost used up.

meaning_english: To be communicating in Bolinao.
sample_bolinao: No mako ako sa isla nin Santiago ket pamulinawen a linggwahi mi.
sample_english: When I go to the island of Santiago, our language that we are speaking is Bolinao.

meaning_english: The process of releasing or freeing of something.
sample_bolinao: Say pamulos ran similya nin bangos sa tanggal ket no buklas.
sample_english: The releasing of the milkfish embryos in the fishpond is tomorrow.

meaning_english: Stethoscope, instrument for taking the pulse.
sample_bolinao: Mabista yay pamulsuwan nan duktor mi ta maksaw yan makakalap nin pulso.
sample_english: Our doctor's stethoscope is good for it get a pulse strongly.

meaning_english: To be convulsing.
sample_bolinao: Si ispiriton duka' ket pinamuluk-pulok nayay tawo, inmagsit yan maksaw mi'sa linmakwan yayna kona.
sample_english: The evil spirit made the man convulse, he screamed loudly and then went out of him.

meaning_english: To moving freely within a specified area.
sample_bolinao: Pukuken miyay luta' mi ta pamulusan miyan baka.
sample_english: We enclosed our land for our cow to run loose in.

meaning_english: Eat a side food while drinking an alcoholic beverage.
sample_bolinao: Saray nidudupong a lulakimain pamulutanran karnin aso.
sample_english: Thosemenin the group are drinking intoxicating drinks with dog's meat.

meaning_english: The process of watering plants
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pamumbo' ran mulan pakwan kanya' alalaki a bunga.
sample_english: Their way of watering the watermelon plants is good and so the fruit is bigger than usual.

meaning_english: The act of releasing something heavy or active.
The process of burning something.
sample_bolinao: Say pamumuor nin bulong sa sirong kakawayan a nangibwatan nin puor.
sample_english: The burning of the leaves under the bamboo patch was the source of the wildfire.

meaning_english: The testing of something in a trial run (e.g., as of an equipment).
sample_bolinao: Matkap apamumurbakonan sayay byay.
sample_english: It is necessary that a life goes through times of proving.

meaning_english: The process of picking fruit by plucking.
sample_bolinao: Paspas a pamumuti ran mangga ta dandani yayna tumuro' a rapeg.
sample_english: They did the picking of the mangoes fast since it was almost starting to rain.

meaning_english: The activity of chopping wood.
sample_bolinao: Pamumutol nin kayo a pangipapasan nan senep na ni Ori konan asawa na.
sample_english: Ori takes out his irritation with his wife by chopping wood.

meaning_english: The process of voting.
sample_bolinao: Say pamumutos, gaw'en ran tutawo no iliksyon.
sample_english: The casting of votes is what is people do when there is an election.

meaning_english: The process of wiping something.
sample_bolinao: Pamunas kwaytin saynget ko si panyo'.
sample_english: I wipe this sweat of mine with the handkerchief.

meaning_english: Wiping on something specific.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mo nin pamunasan nin gamet mo nin lebet a aysing mo.
sample_english: Don't wipe your wet hands on your clothing.

meaning_english: To put something in a holding position someplace.
sample_bolinao: Si pamundwan ra nin alakin baluto ket iti sa danin pantalan.
sample_english: Their anchoring of the big boat was here close to the pier.

meaning_english: The process of dynamiting for something, especially for fishing.
sample_bolinao: Say pamungbong ra sa kuna' ket makasida' nin taaw.
sample_english: Their dynamiting for fish destroys the ocean.

meaning_english: The place of making bamboo rice.
sample_bolinao: Mamadta akon pamungeyan no yabina.
sample_english: I'll build up the fire for making bamboo rice this afternoon.

meaning_english: A dish of food that is ready to be used if needed.
sample_bolinao: Gulpin pamungga no mangan tamo.
sample_english: we have loads of food on reserve when we eat.

meaning_english: The process of covering or wrapping something.
sample_bolinao: Papil a pamunggos mi nin baso pigaw kai maspak no ibyahi.
sample_english: What we used for wrapping the glass was paper so that it would not get broke in the journey.

meaning_english: Wrapping something in something specific with a covering.
sample_bolinao: Aysing na a inusar na nin pamunggusan nin bayawas ta kasan pangwan ra.
sample_english: What he used as a wrapping for the guavas was his clothing since they had nothing to put it in.

meaning_english: The process of aiming at a target.
Target range, a place exclusively for target practice.
meaning_filipino: Lugar na pagsanayan ng pagpuntirya - baril; pana.
sample_bolinao: Itaw sa ba'yon risort a pamuntiryawan ran pulis.
sample_english: The target range for the police is there at the new resort.

meaning_english: The action of throwing something in a specific place.
sample_bolinao: Main bubon nin pamuntukan ran barya mi'sa ra nin isipen a rabay ra kumon nin mangyadi'.
sample_english: There is a well that they throw coins into and then they think about what they wish would happen.

meaning_english: An eraser for blackboard  pencil or ball-pen.
sample_bolinao: Syaypamupos, usaren ma no malingo ka.
sample_english: Here is theeraser, use it when you made a mistake.

meaning_english: The process of putting something in the open position.
sample_bolinao: Mapalna' a pamurwang nan purta ni Juan pigaw kai nin magargar.
sample_english: Juan's opening of the door was gently done so that it would not be noisy.

meaning_english: The process of dumping out a container.
sample_bolinao: Say ranom sa baldi a pamusbos ko sa banyo.
sample_english: What I use to dump into the toilet is the water in the pail.

meaning_english: The process of exposing the inside of something by turning it out.
sample_bolinao: Gaw'en ray pamuslig nin pait baboy no ringgasan ra.
sample_english: They turn the pig intestines inside out when the clean it.

meaning_english: To put special effort into something.
sample_bolinao: Pamuspusan na ni Pedro a maningkap ta adani yayna mangabing a kalamo' na.
sample_english: Pedro made a special effort for building his earnings since his wife was now close to having their baby.

meaning_english: A device that is used to make holes.
sample_bolinao: Kutsilyo a pamutbot ra konan lata nin gatas.
sample_english: They used a knife to punch a hole in the can of milk.

meaning_english: The process of putting in the bamboo trunks for posts in a nipa hut.
The process of cutting or chopping something.
sample_bolinao: Paspas nin pamutol a beneng sa tagintin.
sample_english: The bolos cutting of the bamboo branches is fast.

meaning_english: The sound of a small rubber bulbed horn.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw apamumutpotran bapor sa pagpundwan.
sample_english: Thesoundingof thehornsof large ships that are at anchor is loud.

meaning_english: The process of removing or plucking something from the stalk.
sample_bolinao: Andi' moya nin pamutyan taw si puon mangga sa danin bubon ta malago' et a bunga na.
sample_english: Don't pluck the fruit from that mango tree close to the well since its fruit is still young.

meaning_english: That which has been burned.
sample_bolinao: Adayo' sa bali a pamuuran mi nin dikot ta ma'sok.
sample_english: Our place for burning weeds is far from the house because it is smoky.

meaning_english: The action of giving something to someone.
sample_bolinao: Si pamyan ko konan siti si tinapay a man'isawit ko, sya.
sample_english: The one to whom I am giving this bread which I am dipping, it is he.

meaning_english: An area to be staked out for grazing.
sample_bolinao: Kasabyan nin ayi nin manok a pan'eran ra.
sample_english: Commonly it is the foot of the chicken that they stake to something.

meaning_english: A bow and arrow.
sample_bolinao: Maong ta main ninpana'ko.
sample_english: It's good, for I have my fish gun.

meaning_english: Hook, Something hanging as by a peg.
sample_bolinao: Main nin pasak nin nika' ra nin magwa' ran pana'bitan nin payong.
sample_english: They took a nail to make a hook from for the umbrella.

meaning_english: The black sea urchin that has sharp pin-like spines more than two inches long.
sample_bolinao: Mairab yay ayi ko ta nakada'da' ako nin pana'pana'.
sample_english: My foot is stinging since I happened to step on a black sea urchin.

meaning_english: The act of shouting out something.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pana'way na ni Juan konran bubsat na kanya' narnge' raya.
sample_english: Juan's calling of his brothers was loud and so they heard him.

meaning_english: The process of cooking fish in a sour broth.
sample_bolinao: Kasabyan usaren ran tutawo nin panaangan ket si kasirula.
sample_english: What people commonly use for cooking sour fish is a casserole pan.

meaning_english: The process of shaping something from something.
sample_bolinao: Alaki yay abel nin panabasan mi nin gaw'en butarga.
sample_english: The piece of cloth that we cut to shape to make the trousers was big.

meaning_english: Manner of eating with large mouthfuls.
A tomb or grave.
sample_bolinao: Abaw saray tawo nin nako sa panabunan ni Dante.
sample_english: There were a lot of people that went to the burial of Dante.

meaning_english: A rice dessert made of string or mung beans cooked in sugar wrapped withdaliketflour mixed with sugar then fried until brown.
sample_bolinao: Rabay-rabay kon kanen apanada.
sample_english: I very much liketoeat rice and bean dessert.

meaning_english: The process of closing something.
sample_bolinao: Palna-palna' tamo' a panada' mon dudungawan ta madali' maspak a sarming na.
sample_english: Your closing of the window is to just be very gently since its glass is easily broken.

meaning_english: Baker, the man who bakes breads.
sample_bolinao: Matkap a sipanadiromimata yan masakbay.
sample_english: Abakermust wake up very early.

meaning_english: Bakery or bake shop.
sample_bolinao: Tepe' parbangon abaw anay tawo a mako sapanadiryamanaliw tinapay.
sample_english: Every morning at dawn many people go to thebakeryto buy bread.

meaning_english: The process of preparing for something.
sample_bolinao: Mana'pang kan gulpi ta panadya' konran bubisita tamo.
sample_english: Boil plenty of rice so as to prepare for our visitors.

meaning_english: Preparedness for something.
sample_bolinao: Kasal na ni Juan a panadyaan na konan sitin taon.
sample_english: Juan's wedding is what he is preparing for this year.

meaning_english: The process of restraining something with something such as strips of bamboo placed on the ridge of a roof to press cogongrass roofing into position.
sample_bolinao: Main nika' ka nin panaeg nin kayo pigaw mapasak rayan maong a ayi nan tekrean.
sample_english: There was a wood restraint you put on the chair legs so that they would be nailed solid.

meaning_english: To shoot something with an arrow, probably with a fish gun.
sample_bolinao: Panaen yay baboy tatalon.
sample_english: The wild pig is speared.

meaning_english: Harvest time.
sample_bolinao: Mangngirik si Mario no bulan nin Oktubre o Nobyembre no panag'apit.
sample_english: Mario is the thresher in October and November when it is harvest.

meaning_english: The process of waiting for something with anticipation.
sample_bolinao: Imula moy in say kamuti pigaw main panaga'nan mo nin magwa' mo li' nin kalyen no lumaman.
sample_english: Plant that sweet potato so that there will be something for you to look forward to that you can later dig up when it produces tubers.

meaning_english: The process of prodding or urging movement.
sample_bolinao: Main awit ra nin bislak nin usaren ra nin panagdag konran kanding.
sample_english: There was a bamboo slat that they carried to use for prodding the goats along.

meaning_english: The action of expressing anger in words or actions.
sample_bolinao: Sawanin anaod edet, gurutan moyoynay sarban duka' a gawa'-gawa' bilang sa pananager, pangungura' moyo sa kapada moyon tawo, paninida' nin kapadan tawo, pag'iirgon mabyat sa kapadan tawo tan pag'iirgon duka'.
sample_english: Now, then indeed, turn your back on all evil deeds like anger, hateful deeds to your fellow man, destroying your fellow man, harsh speech to your fellow man and evil speech.

meaning_english: The process of drawing water from someplace.
Process of drawing water from someplace such as a well or river.
sample_bolinao: Adayo' bubon nin panaguan ranom iti.
sample_english: The well for drawing water here is far.

meaning_english: The process of fetching water.
sample_bolinao: Panaguen ma si Juan.
sample_english: Have Juan do the fetching of the water.

meaning_english: The process of inviting someone to something.
sample_bolinao: Saya awro ba'yo a kasal a panagyat ra konran bubisitas.
sample_english: They will do the inviting of the guest the day before the wedding.

meaning_english: To appeal to someone.
sample_bolinao: Kai ako nayi konra ta adayo' a panagyatan ra nin mikadaw.
sample_english: I didn't go with them since it was far away that they were inviting me to roam around with them.

meaning_english: To use something to sharpen or put a point on a pencil.
sample_bolinao: Kasa nin awit nan tahar kanya' kutsilyo a panahar na konan lapis na.
sample_english: He did not bring a pencil sharpener ans so it was a knife that he used to sharpen his pencil.

meaning_english: The process of covering over something.
sample_bolinao: Sa dikot nin sabaten ra a panakeb mi nin uring.
sample_english: A layer of weeds and grass is what we are covering the charcoal with.

meaning_english: The process used tocapture something.
sample_bolinao: Tapigo a panakep ra nin kuna' sa pasabing.
sample_english: Its a small frame net that they use for capturing fish in a fish corral.

meaning_english: The process of binding something together or tethering something so it doesn't escape.
The process of tethering something someplace.
sample_bolinao: Alakin kayo a panakeran na konan damulag na no yabina.
sample_english: The large tree is where he is tying his carabao at night.

meaning_english: The process of having a bowel movement in a certain place.
sample_bolinao: Siti purta nan pait a alaki a liwaan takli'; si panaklian nan sayay tawo udino uayep; liwaan sarban nikasama' a ibat sa pait.
sample_english: Rectum; anus.

meaning_english: For something in particular to be blocking something.
sample_bolinao: Ragaw tamo' a panalaban ra sa dalan ran kanding kanya' makalabas sara et lamang.
sample_english: It was just a barrier of thorns on the road that was blocking the goats and so they were still able to get around it anyway.

meaning_english: Divination.
sample_bolinao: Napaka'ngap na sira yupa' sapanalamangkana.
sample_english: He amazed them by hisdivination.

meaning_english: The process of catching something with the hand.
The process of narration or communication.
The process of saving or rescuing someone from something bad.
sample_bolinao: No mabyay ako et bana' sapinanalbamo kongko...
sample_english: If I still live because of yoursavingme...

meaning_english: To be doing something with momentum.
Cushion for kneeling on.
sample_bolinao: Maringgas a panalimukudan ran Muslim saMosque.
sample_english: The kneeling pad of the Muslim in a Mosque is clean.

meaning_english: The process of gluing something to repair it..
sample_bolinao: Panalitnin libro.
sample_english: Repairof a book.

meaning_english: The process of buying something with money.
sample_bolinao: Tiningi' tamo' a panaliw ko nin byas ta kasan panaliw ko nin saya sako'.
sample_english: My way of buying rice is only retail since there was no way I had for buying a sack.

meaning_english: The process of beating the rice stalks with a pestle in order to thresh out the grain.
sample_bolinao: Say panaltag ra sa irik ket maksaw.
sample_english: Their beating of the field rice is hard.

The process of giving protective care by being along side someone.
