sample_english: He did those two in order that we who have gone to take shelter in his protective care, we might rejoice well because of him since we have been strengthened in our confidence of what he promised.

meaning_english: The process of preparing a diluted dye solution in something so as to soak something to change its color.
sample_bolinao: Alakin kardiro a pangampitsiwan ra pigaw abaw a makuluran nin silag.
sample_english: It was a large cooking pot that they were preparing the dye in so that a lot of cabbage palm could be colored.

meaning_english: A receptacle for heating liquid or food.
sample_bolinao: Kwan man ranom apangamutan.
sample_english: Put water in thepanfor heating.

meaning_english: A commanding of something, imperative sentence.
sample_bolinao: Saya nin pangan-gan no ibaki' ya a sayay tawo.
sample_english: Whenone sends a person, somewhere, it is to command him.

meaning_english: The process of giving birth.
sample_bolinao: Matkap sa uspital anay panganak ran tawon babayi sawanin a panaon.
sample_english: In these times, a woman needs to be in the hospital for giving birth.

meaning_english: To eat from a place where there is food.
sample_bolinao: Kasabyan lusa a panganan sin anak ako et.
sample_english: When I was still a child, we commonly ate from an enamel plate.

meaning_english: The process of showing favor or love, to a person in need from someone of a more favored situation.
sample_bolinao: Nikidawat akonpanganga'do.
sample_english: I request favor.

meaning_english: The process of sleeping.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a panganga'lek na ni Juan nayabi ta matinek a libed na.
sample_english: Juan's sleep last night was good since his surroundings were calm.

meaning_english: The process of labor and delivery in the birth of a child.
sample_bolinao: Adani anaypangangabingna ni Gaya.
sample_english: Gaya's moment of givingbirthwill be soon.

meaning_english: The act of allowing or giving consent or permission.
sample_bolinao: Wanin ta, yupa' sa dasal tan say pangangaburoy na nin Dios, say sarba ket maikana' ana.
sample_english: That's the case since, by means of prayer and the consent of God, all of it is now appropriate.

meaning_english: The act of loving someone or thing.
sample_bolinao: Kai masukat gapo a pangangado' nan Catawan kontamo nin pinarsa na.
sample_english: The love of the Divine for us whom he created is completely immeasurable.

meaning_english: Something for use in hiding something.
sample_bolinao: Pangangadyan nayan kwarta na ni inay a baol na.
sample_english: Mother used her trunk as place to hide her money.

meaning_english: The action of caring for something in a serving manner.
sample_bolinao: Say pangangalila' ket pangipa'kit nin pangawa'nan.
sample_english: The action of serving someone demonstrates loving care.

meaning_english: The action of lifting and moving something.
sample_bolinao: Pangangalsan mabyat nin awit ran pasairo a tingkapan ni Jose.
sample_english: Carrying the heavy baggage that passengers bring is Jose's living.

meaning_english: The act of whipping.
sample_bolinao: Buga' a pangangambak na ni Juan konan anak na.
sample_english: Juan's whipping of his children is seldom.

meaning_english: The act of swallowing something.
sample_bolinao: Palna-palna' a pangngamil nan ma'kan ni Juan.
sample_english: Juan's swallowing of what he eats is very deliberate.

meaning_english: The act of cursing someone through the use of witchcraft.
sample_bolinao: pangrarayon dios-dios, pangangamod, piguguraan tan pilalaban, imon tan sager, nagsi-nagsi, pigugrupu-grupo.
sample_english: worshiping idols, witchcraft, being enemies of each other and opposing/fighting each other, jealousy and anger, ignoring expected responsibilities, factions.

meaning_english: The act of rubbing something, usually from a plant, on an area for medicinal purposes.
sample_bolinao: Say gawa' na ni baying nin pangangamris ket makapami nin inum'ay sa lalaman.
sample_english: The action of grandmother applying lotion is able to give relief to the body.

meaning_english: The process of eating.
sample_bolinao: Tepe' ugtiawro syay udas pangangan mi.
sample_english: Every noon time is the time we eat.

meaning_english: The process of delivering a child.
sample_bolinao: Saypanganganaknan sayay babayi sangkaidapan a tuloy.
sample_english: A woman's birthing process is extremely difficult.

meaning_english: The process of bringing something to an end.
The support or backing of something..
sample_bolinao: Mandawaten ko..., ket paksawen na kumon nin main nin pakayadi' a kukanakman moyo sa pangangantabay nan Ispirito na.
sample_english: I am requesting..., he might powerfully encourage your inner persons by the support of his Spirit.

meaning_english: The process of desiring, wishing.
sample_bolinao: Main talagan pangangapes na ni Juan nin makayadi' sa kulihyo.
sample_english: Juan really has strong desires to be able to finish college.

meaning_english: The process of expressing appreciation of something.
sample_bolinao: Maririket a pangangaprisya ran tawo konan rinmate' nin kapitan.
sample_english: The peoples expression of appreciation at the arrival of the captain was joyful.

meaning_english: The tender rubbing or stroking of something.
sample_bolinao: Saray bulangiro kai ra gapo nin lingatan a pangangapros konran manok ran ibubulang tepe' buklas.
sample_english: Those that engage in cockfighting never miss massaging or stroking tenderly their fighting cocks every morning.

meaning_english: The act of loading something.
sample_bolinao: Asirtawen moyo a pangangarga nin buyangin sa sako' pigaw kai nin ma'met-ma'met.
sample_english: Be conscientious about how the sand is loaded so that it will not be lost along the way.

meaning_english: The act of imitating someone or copying something.
sample_bolinao: Say pangangarig sa ubat nan kadani no iksamin ket duka'.
sample_english: The copying of the answer from the person next to you is bad.

meaning_english: The attentive care given to something valued.
sample_bolinao: Subray pangangasikaso na konran a'nak na.
sample_english: His attentiveness to his children is overboard.

meaning_english: The process of quarreling with someone.
sample_bolinao: Itgen moy in say pangangaway mo konran kaklasi mo ta duka' in.
sample_english: Bring a halt to that quarreling of yours with your classmates for it is ugly.

meaning_english: Eating lunch or the midday meal.
sample_bolinao: Atrasado anay pangangawro ran pamilyan mamurot nin basura ta mirwa sara tamo' nin mangan sa sayay awro.
sample_english: The eating of lunch of a family of scavengers of garbage is delayed/late for they eat two times only a day.

meaning_english: The act of summoning someone.
The process of ending something.
sample_bolinao: Kai tamo tanda' no ka'noypanganggawannan mundo.
sample_english: We do not know when will be the end of the word.

meaning_english: Process of removal.
sample_bolinao: Si'kay makauray sapanganglatdikot sa plasa.
sample_english: You are responsible for the removal of garbage in the plaza.

meaning_english: The act of eating something, not rice.
sample_bolinao: Bana' sa pangangna' na nin tiblon, nabelbelan ya.
sample_english: Because of his eating milkfish, a bone got caught in his throat.

meaning_english: The process of doing or making something.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pangangwa' ko nin gardin ko sa iskol.
sample_english: What I accomplished in making the garden at school is good.

meaning_english: The place where something is put.
sample_bolinao: Bag a pangangwan kon matkap ko sa iskol.
sample_english: The placement of the things I need for school is the bag.

meaning_english: The middle finger or toe.
sample_bolinao: Nablo' yay panganro ko kanya' ya nabaya'.
sample_english: My middle finger was dislocated and so it swelled up.

meaning_english: The process or manner of singing.
sample_bolinao: Kulaot anan pirmi a pangansyon ran nabok.
sample_english: The singing of the drunkards is always loud.

meaning_english: The activity of singing.
sample_bolinao: Kikiten yan maong akumpasnan kunduktor no magkanta pigaw mabistay panganta.
sample_english: Watch carefully the rhythm of the conductor while singing so that the song will flow nicely.

meaning_english: The place in which singing is done.
sample_bolinao: Itaw sa kapilya a pangantawan ra ni Rose tan si Mars.
sample_english: Rose and Mars' place of singing is there in the church.

meaning_english: The forth finger or toe, second from smallest.
sample_bolinao: Si panganted ko tamo' a kasan usar tuloy sa garamay ko.
sample_english: Of my fingers it is only my little finger that is not used very much.

meaning_english: For fruit to be in the process of ripening but still slightly green.
sample_bolinao: Panganyantamo' et in say mangga kanya' maalsem et in.
sample_english: Those mangoes arenotfullyripe, therefore they are still sour.

meaning_english: The process of styling the hair usually with the application of something and a fluffing action.
sample_bolinao: Sabtay anda' nin pangaploy na konan sabot ta ba'yon pukris ya.
sample_english: The styling of his hair is very nice since it is freshly cut.

meaning_english: The process of forcing or impacting something.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw nin apoy a pangaprita ra sa manlutuen ra.
sample_english: Their means of speeding up their cooking is to intensify the flame.

meaning_english: The process of rubbing.
sample_bolinao: Mapalna' a pangapros na ni Annie sa kerep nan abing.
sample_english: Annie's rubbing of the newborn's chest is gentle.

meaning_english: The laying out of something in such away as they are not aware of what is going on around them.
sample_bolinao: Pangapsayen naka nin kalaban mo no kai mo mailagan a telep na.
sample_english: Your opponent will lay you out cold if you are not avoiding his punches.

meaning_english: The act of caressing  something.
sample_bolinao: Napaamo' nayay aso bana' sa pangapuap na sa ulo na.
sample_english: The dog has been gentled because of the caressing of his head.

meaning_english: The food to be eaten for supper, the evening meal.
sample_bolinao: Ket nisadya' raynay pangapunan ra sa pista.
sample_english: And so they prepared their supper for the festival.

meaning_english: The process of naming someone or something.
sample_bolinao: Pinangaranan naya ni Jose nin Jesus.
sample_english: Joseph gave him the name Jesus.

meaning_english: The process of joking around in order to get laughs.
sample_bolinao: Say pangaraw-garaw mo a namases'ew kona.
sample_english: Your joking around is what caused his hurt feelings.

meaning_english: The process of scratching with the foot.
sample_bolinao: Si ayi nan manok a usaren na nin pangaraykay no mangkit yan kanen na.
sample_english: When a chicken sees food it is its foot that it uses for scratching for it.

meaning_english: The process of tickling someone.
sample_bolinao: Sabot manok a usaren ra nin pangarete' sa dapa na ni Juan.
sample_english: They used feathers to tickle the bottom of Juan's foot.

meaning_english: The act of loading something into something.
sample_bolinao: Galon a pangargawan mi nin ranom no mangakot kami.
sample_english: When we transport water we put it in a five gallon can.

meaning_english: The process of doing business using a pushcart.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a matingkapan nan kwarta sapangari-garitonna.
sample_english: He can earn a lot of money in hispushcart business.

meaning_english: basis
sample_bolinao: Si Jesus a mabistan pangarigan nin pitatawo.
sample_english: Jesus is a beautiful model for a person's character.

meaning_english: The feeling of apprehension about something that something bad might happen.
sample_bolinao: Pangaringapngapan ako tepe' lumalako akon bukod no yabi.
sample_english: I am apprehensive each time I walk alone at night.

meaning_english: The process of caressing a person or thing.
The process of preserving something using cane sugar or other sweet substance.
sample_bolinao: Mabista intaw a pangarnibal ran raruman tawo no tyimpon gulpin tubo.
sample_english: Some people's process of preserving it when there was plenty of sugar cane back then was good.

meaning_english: The process of cutting something specific in a certain manner with a scissors.
sample_bolinao: Main nin abel nin magwa' nin pangartiban nin gagaw'en aysing.
sample_english: There is cloth that can be cut up to make various clothing.

meaning_english: For the process of sawing boards to be taking place in a particular place.
sample_bolinao: Nako ya si tatay ko sa pangarugadian ra nin ungot.
sample_english: Father went to the place they are making sawn coconut boards.

meaning_english: The process of sharpening something.
sample_bolinao: Kai ya magwa' nin pangasaan nin kutsilyo a bato ta kai ya nin makapamatadem.
sample_english: The stone is not able to hone a knife since it is not able to be used for sharpening.

meaning_english: The process of attending to needs of something with a good attitude and cultural appropriateness.
sample_bolinao: Tinawayan nan si mampangasikason bansal ket, arak ana.
sample_english: The one in orchestrating the wedding feast tasted it, and it was now wine.

meaning_english: Container or the place where fish paste is made.
meaning_filipino: Pangangwan o kami'nan no adti mangasin o mangwa' nin inasin.
sample_bolinao: Batya apangasinanran padas sa Tagapuro'.
sample_english: A washtub is used in making padas fish paste in Tagapuro'.

meaning_english: The process of slapping for punishment or prodding along.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pangaspok na ni Juan konan kaaway na sa iskol.
sample_english: Juan's punishment of his enemies at school is harsh.

meaning_english: The expenditures for something.
sample_bolinao: Gulpin pangastusan ko sa pag'aadal ko sa syudad.
sample_english: I had loads of expenditures for studying in the city.

meaning_english: A recipe where the fish is placed in the pot with salt, vinegar, garlic and pepper are added and then let to boil until a small amount of broth is left.
sample_bolinao: Mataway ay pangat nan barangen ni baying.
sample_english: Grandmother's fish stew is tasty.

meaning_english: Process of attacking something.
sample_bolinao: Pa'noypangatakitamo konra.
sample_english: How should weattackthem.

meaning_english: The process of priming a pump or other mechanism.
sample_bolinao: Mangi'ras ya si Juan nin rway litro nin ranom nin pangatal na sa gripo no manago' ya.
sample_english: Juan puts in two liters of water to prime the pump when he gets water.

meaning_english: The manner of hanging something on something.
sample_bolinao: Pasak nin kinmawet a pangatinan ran baskit ni Juan sa kusina' ra.
sample_english: What Juan uses to hang their basket on in the kitchen is a curved nail.

meaning_english: The process of biting into something to cause damage.
sample_bolinao: Ngipen ran aso sa adapan a pangatngat ran kanen ran karni.
sample_english: What dogs use for ripping up the meat they eat is their front teeth.

meaning_english: The process of storing something.
sample_bolinao: Matkap kusto a pangator ran kuna' pigaw kai nin masida'.
sample_english: Their method of storing fish must be right so that it doesn't go bad.

meaning_english: The process of pickling something, especially fruit.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pangatsara ra sa rabong kanya' kai tampor nin nasida'.
sample_english: Their process for pickling bamboo shoots is good and so they are not quickly ruined.

meaning_english: The process of storing something within someplace.
sample_bolinao: Itaw a pangaturan ran kwarta sa rarem kwarto ra.
sample_english: There storage place for their money is there in their room.

meaning_english: Stocks, The wooden frame with holes for the hands and/or feet and was used to punish an offender especially during the Spanish times.
sample_bolinao: Matalag raynan usaren apangawsawanin.
sample_english: Thestocksis seldom used today.

meaning_english: The giving of love and affection with a full commitment to that person or thing.
sample_bolinao: Alaki a pangawa'nan ran mangatua sa a'nak ra.
sample_english: The love of parents for their children is great.

meaning_english: The area or rack for sun drying.
sample_bolinao: Say siminto sa rigrig dalan a pangawgawan ra nin irik.
sample_english: Their drying place for the field rice is the cement along the edge of the road.

meaning_english: The manner or process of carrying.
sample_bolinao: Abas a pangawit na kanya' madali' mablay a abaya na.
sample_english: His manner of carrying is incorrect and so his shoulders will get tired.

meaning_english: Carrying something.
sample_bolinao: Adayo' a pangawitan ra konran pusa' no ibarang nasara pigaw kai sarayna nin makasubli'.
sample_english: If it is to get cats lost so they don't return, their removal is to be far away,

meaning_english: Lunch, the noon meal.
sample_bolinao: Tinepet nako ni tatay no ani a pangawrwan mi.
sample_english: Father asked me where we would have lunch.

meaning_english: The process of summoning someone.
The process of summoning someone to something.
sample_bolinao: Sain a nangayaban nan Dios komoyo yupa' konan Mabistan Patanda' nin niparate' mi komoyo, kinayaban nakamo ta pigaw nin kirama' kamo sa kata'gayan na ni Uunuren tamon Jesu-Cristo.
sample_english: That is what God summoned you for through the Good News that we brought to you, he summoned you in order that you may share in the greatness of our Lord Jesus Christ.

meaning_english: The process of arranging and tying together of bamboo slates for a surface such as a floor or bed.
sample_bolinao: Mabistay pangayakir ko sa siir nan katri ko.
sample_english: My tying together of the bamboo slats for my bed is great.

meaning_english: To make something convulse.
sample_bolinao: Pinangayegkegnakon masyadon ray'ep nan panaon.
sample_english: The very cold season made meshiver.

meaning_english: The process of grating something into thin stripes.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pangayos na ni Juan sa laman ungot nin gaw'en ran salad.
sample_english: Juan's finely grating of the coconut meat for making salad is good.

meaning_english: The activity of patching a net.
sample_bolinao: Naadal na ni inay Eding a gawa' nin pangayuma bana' ta mannilay yay asawa na.
sample_english: The mother ofEdingstudied the work of net patching because here husband is a fisherman.

meaning_english: The place where pounding is done.
sample_bolinao: Ma'get yay pangbaywan na ni Juan ta gawa' ya sa siminto tan bato.
sample_english: Juan's place for pounding is durable since it is made of cement and stones.

meaning_english: The process of borrowing something from someone.
sample_bolinao: Asikaswen moypakaisubli'nan siin si indam mon libro pigaw kai sara dumara' a nangdaman mo.
sample_english: Be careful how youreturnthe book which you borrowed so that they will not refrain from lending it to you the next time.

meaning_english: The process of weaving or mending nets.
sample_bolinao: Iyakay moko pa no pa'non pangeket mo?
sample_english: Will you teach me on how to weave nets?

meaning_english: Experiencing a groin pain.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a sugat na sa ayi kanya' ya nin pangel'elen.
sample_english: He has a lot of cuts on his foot and so he is having pain in his groin area.

meaning_english: A swarm, flock, or school of small animals like fish, pigs, birds or bees that are normally found grouped together in this manner.
sample_bolinao: Say pangen ra nin kuna' nin barangen, alaki.
sample_english: The school of rabbit fish in the fishpond is big.

meaning_english: The act of sleeping.
sample_bolinao: Si Dios, pinaka'lek nayan a rarem apangngaleksi tawo.
sample_english: God put the man into a deepsleep.

meaning_english: A temporary relief or protection of a wound.
The process of drawing a sharp object across something in order to slice it.
sample_bolinao: Madali' yan nati a manok no matadem a kutsilyo nin panger'er ra.
sample_english: The chicken dies quickly if they use a sharp knife to slit its throat.

meaning_english: The process of humming a song.
sample_bolinao: Saray raruman akukulaw ket gulpin pangeteet ra no mamaka'lek saran apo ra.
sample_english: There are some old ladies that do a lot of humming when they are putting their grandchildren to sleep.

meaning_english: The process of shaking something.
The act of dusting.
sample_bolinao: Say panggas a matkap no mata'pok yay pantalon mo.
sample_english: Dusting is what is needed when your trousers are dusty.

meaning_english: To brush something off from something such as furniture.
sample_bolinao: Panggasan moy kabinit ta mata'pok.
sample_english: Dust off the cabinet for it is all dusty.

meaning_english: To brush dirt off from something.
sample_bolinao: Panggasen mo pa a nikasama' sa aysing mo.
sample_english: You may want to brush the dirt off your dress.

meaning_english: A persons goal or ambition for something.
sample_bolinao: Mangwa' kami nin pispin bale' say panggep mi, sakalako ta makakalap ka ninpermitmo sa pispin.
sample_english: We constructed the fish pen but our purpose was different since you were the one that was able to get the permit for the fish pen.

meaning_english: To decide or purpose to do something.
sample_bolinao: Na'teng naynanmampanggepena mag'in ya kumon maong nin pianista bale' anggan sawanin kai na et narate'.
sample_english: It was long timeambitionof his to be a good pianist but until now he has not yet realized his ambition.

meaning_english: Old-time card game using playing cards of the Spanish era and normally played by women.
meaning_filipino: Pangnginggi; isang uri ng sugal mula sa mga Kastila; sakla.
sample_bolinao: Si nanay ko, mako ya sa pangginggi no kasan raruman sugal.
sample_english: My mother goes to play Spanish cards when there is no other kind of gambling around.

meaning_english: The process of discarding a liquid.
sample_bolinao: Linumwa' saray bulati bana' sa pangi'met ra nin ranom nin main sabon sa luta'.
sample_english: The worms came out of the ground because of their discarding the soapy water there.

meaning_english: The manner or process of placing or moving something to a surface.
sample_bolinao: Kusto a pangibabo na ni Juan nin ma'kan sa lamisawan.
sample_english: Juan's way of setting the food for the table is just right.

meaning_english: The process of sending on a mission.
sample_bolinao: Kai mabista a pangibaki' na kanya' kai raya sunuren nin tutawo.
sample_english: His commissioning them was not good and so the people did not follow through.

meaning_english: The commissioning of someone to be sent on a certain mission or role.
sample_bolinao: Matkap raka ta main pangibakian ra komo.
sample_english: They need you for they have mission for you to do.

meaning_english: The process or manner of hanging something over something to dry.
sample_bolinao: Asirtawen moyoy pangibalaybay moyo nin ules pigaw madali' nin kumrang.
sample_english: Be careful of how you hang out the blanket so that it will dry quickly.

meaning_english: The process of pronouncing words.
sample_bolinao: Mabista apangibalikasmo nin susarita' sin namasa ka.
sample_english: You have a good way of pronouncing when you read.

meaning_english: For something to be being housed in or attached as a unit to something.
sample_bolinao: Kurtin trayanggulo a kawayan nin nangibalyan nin eket a ipangalap aramang.
sample_english: A triangular shaped bamboo housing a net is used for catching shrimp.

meaning_english: The process of casting something away from oneself to get rid of it.
sample_bolinao: Matkap kusto a pangibantak mon insikto nin ginmalet komo.
sample_english: Knocking off an insect that is clinging to you must be done correctly.

meaning_english: Throwing out something to someplace.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma pangibantakan nin plastik a ubot ta para ya tamo' sa maumok nin basura.
sample_english: Don't be throwing plastic into the hole for it is only for decomposable garbage.

meaning_english: Soaking something in something.
The process of declaring something in public.
sample_bolinao: Say pangibarita' ra nin rabay ra ket mapalna'.
sample_english: Their way of communicating what they wanted to say was careful.

meaning_english: The basis, foundation.
meaning_filipino: Batayan; basihan; saligan; simulain; pamantayan; pamantungan; tuntunin' alituntunin.

meaning_english: The process of hurling things around.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pangibasyo na ni Juan nin bato konran aso sin kinamat raya.
sample_english: Juan's hurling of the rocks when the dogs that had bitten him was hard.

meaning_english: To be throwing something specific someplace.
sample_bolinao: Andi' moya nin pangibasyuwan nin basura a kali sa luta' mi.
sample_english: Don't be throwing the waste from your excavations on my land.

meaning_english: The leaving of something with someone or someplace for safe keeping.
The process or manner of giving something.
sample_bolinao: Mabistay pangibi ni Juan ninbatonsa kaaluyon nan malayo.
sample_english: Juan's giving of the baton to the one that was running with him was good.

meaning_english: The action of respectfully responding to something.
sample_bolinao: Main kumonpangibilangmoyo sa matua moyo.
sample_english: You should haverespectful obediencefor your parents.

meaning_english: The place for hanging something.
sample_bolinao: Pasak a pangibitinan na ni Juan nin baskit sa kusina'.
sample_english: The place for Juan to hang the basket in the kitchen is a nail.

meaning_english: The process or manner of pouring something onto or into something.
sample_bolinao: Palna-palna' a pangibu'bo' moyo nin buyangin pigaw kai nin mitayak.
sample_english: Do your pouring of the sand carefully so that it is not scattered around.

meaning_english: The process of denying something.
sample_bolinao: Nipau-pau'na nayna ni Jesus a pangingibudi' ra kona.
sample_english: Jesus forewarns of their denial of him.

meaning_english: The process of releasing something physically or vocally.
sample_bolinao: Matkap palna-palna' a pangibul'is mo konan abing a mangka'lek.

meaning_english: The process of doing something not specified.
sample_bolinao: Karam-aram, sin nayadi', nayadi' yayna nin si panginin.
sample_english: Andthen, when finished, he was already finished with doing whatever it was.

meaning_english: The manner of insulting someone.
sample_bolinao: Saya klasi nin panginsulto a sunuren nin punasan a dakat nan san'ili o bisita nin sinumrep sa rarem bali.
sample_english: One kind of insulting is to follow after a guest or visitor wiping up their tracks entering into the house.

meaning_english: The process of drinking from something.
sample_bolinao: Sitin baso, main ramat na kanya' andi' ma panginuman.
sample_english: This glass has a crack and so don't use it to drink from.

meaning_english: The process of constructing or building or putting up of something, especially a structure.
sample_bolinao: Bana' sa pangipa'deng ra konan taytay matkap ran tumbawen a abaw nin kukayo.
sample_english: Because of their putting up of the bridge they will need to fell a lot of trees.

meaning_english: The speculation or surmising about something.
sample_bolinao: Abaw in saypangipa'ka'ra kona.
sample_english: There is muchspeculationabout her.

meaning_english: The process of reasoning or assuming something regarding something.
sample_bolinao: Saypangipa'kaanna konan tawo a na'kit san'ili ya.
sample_english: The assumptions he is making regarding the person show that he is a stranger.

meaning_english: The process of displaying something.
sample_bolinao: No mabistay pangipa'kit seseg mag'adal ket maririket saray mampag'adal.
sample_english: When the diligence of study is well displayed those teaching are pleased.

meaning_english: The extending out flat of something.
sample_bolinao: Say pangipa'nat nin tuod nin nablo' ket masakit.
sample_english: The extending of a knee that is dislocated is painful.

meaning_english: The process of placing something on a surface.
sample_bolinao: Pakandaen moy pangipababo mo nin tanaman sa balkon.
sample_english: Be careful how you place the plants on the porch.

meaning_english: The action of placing something upon something specific.
sample_bolinao: Byan rako pa anamaet nin wanin nin pakayadi' ta pigaw nin si si'numan a pangipababwan ko nin gamet ko ket mako ya nin miikap kona a Ispirito nan Dios.
sample_english: Give me also that power so that whoever I lay my hands on the Spirit of God will go to dwell in him.

meaning_english: The process of passing over or along s/t.
To use something as a means to a specific goal.
sample_bolinao: Bale' sa siti nin susuyot nin panaon, si nangipadalanan nan Dios nin kiirgo kontamo ket, anak naya.
sample_english: But at this end time, the one that God has used as the means to talk with us, it is his child.

meaning_english: The process of displaying or revealing something.
sample_bolinao: Ama ko, sisisibulot a nakem kon usaren nako sa pangipadar mon mabistan gawa' mo.
sample_english: My Father, my inner being is whole for you/him to use me to reveal your good works.

meaning_english: The action of revealing something to someone specific.
sample_bolinao: O', si'ko a si anak na tan si Ama ko tamo' a mitandaan nin peteg, pati sara et a pilien kon pangipadaran kona.
sample_english: Yes, I who am his child and my Father only are the ones who know one another fully/completely, including those ones I choose to make him known to.

meaning_english: A comparison of something to something else.
sample_bolinao: Ani a pangipadawan ko komoyo nin tutawo konan sitin panaon? A'nak.
sample_english: What is my comparison of you the people of this time? It is children.

meaning_english: The action of laying something down in a particular place.
sample_bolinao: Siti e a lugar nin nangipaidaan kona.
sample_english: This here was the place where he was laid.

meaning_english: The process of the appropriate use of something.
sample_bolinao: Kasabyan ran saray iti sa uray ket manbuswen ray pangipakana' nin pakayadi' ra.
sample_english: Normally those who are in power are abusing the rightful exercise of their authority.

meaning_english: A redirection of an appropriate action to something else.
sample_bolinao: Sayti say man'alilaen nan baka na ni Juan ket pangipakanaan no kasal na.
sample_english: This cow of Juan's that is being cared for is being re-purposed for his wedding.

meaning_english: The process of making something low or putting something down.
sample_bolinao: Saray trabahador sa kunstraksyon ket kusto a pangipakayupa' ran matiryalis nin man'usaren.
sample_english: The construction workers, lay the materials they are using down just right.

meaning_english: The process of administering or guiding.
sample_bolinao: Sa pangipalalako na kontamon pinakalalaman na, unungen nasaray parti na tan sustintwen na ta napasaya saran nigagalet.
sample_english: In/ By his administration of us who represent his body, its parts are put in orderly arrangement and he sustains it because its joints are unified.

meaning_english: The process of postponing or delaying.
sample_bolinao: Main namana nin pangipali' na ni Rose sa pi'pian na.
sample_english: Rose is again delaying the doing of her laundry.

meaning_english: The process of memorization.
sample_bolinao: Maong ya sapangipaltepnin diskurso.
sample_english: He is good in thememorizationof recitations.

meaning_english: The process of leading.
sample_bolinao: Bana' sa mabistan pangipangulo ran kukapitanis kanya' matinek a kabibyay ran tawo.
sample_english: Because of the good way the baranggay captains lead, the people's lives are peaceful.

meaning_english: The process of enlightening or giving an explanation for something.
sample_bolinao: Ituloy mo in bungat apangipapalawaymo.
sample_english: Just continue on with your explaining.

meaning_english: A period of remembrance.
sample_bolinao: No Disyembre 25 a pangipapanemtem nin nikaanak ni Jesu-Cristo.
sample_english: When it is December 25 it is the time for the remembrance of the birth of Jesus Christ.

meaning_english: The relieving of a stress or to calm down by doing something else.
sample_bolinao: Pamumutol nin kayo a pangipapasan nan senep na ni Ori konan asawa na.
sample_english: Ori takes out his irritation with his wife by chopping wood.

meaning_english: Process of forcing something on someone.
sample_bolinao: Kai magawa' apangipapilitnin sayay bagay konan sayay tawo.
sample_english: It is not right toforcesomething on someone.

meaning_english: The process of communicating something.
The activity of boasting.
sample_bolinao: Say pangiparayo ran raruman main mutor ket mamadaras saran paspas tan maksaw a tambutso.
sample_english: What some who have motorcycles are boasting about is that they go fast and have loud exhausts.

meaning_english: The process of making the situation the same.
sample_bolinao: No manaliw yan paluka' si Juan ket main ta main nin pangipariho na sa padis nin paluka'.
sample_english: When Juan buys slippers it is just those that are like the pairs that he has.

meaning_english: Exercise, training to become expert.
sample_bolinao: Main nin kakanaan nin pangiparmaw tamon ihirsisyuwen a lalaman tamo ta mapagsen ya.
sample_english: There is value in disciplining our bodies with exercise to strengthen it.

meaning_english: The nailing of something in a particular place.
sample_bolinao: Ket abaw saray Judio nin nakabasa konan siti bana' ta naisurat yayti sa sarita' nin Hebreo, Latin tan Griego, tan si lugar nin nangipasakan ra sa kudos kona ni Jesus ket adani ya tamo' sa syudad nin Jerusalem.
sample_english: And so there were many Jews that read this because it was written in the Hebrew, Latin and Griego language, and the place where they had nailed Jesus on a cross it was very close to the city of Jerusalem.

meaning_english: The process of the training of a skill through practice.
sample_bolinao: Saypangipasalsyay pag'in li' nin maong.
sample_english: Practicemakes perfect.

meaning_english: The act of putting something under something or its authority.
sample_bolinao: Page' a gindat ket aripen kamon duka' a gugawa' moyo, bale' kisalamatan koyay Dios ta sawanin ket mansunuren moyo nin intiron kukapusuan moyo a kukatutu'wan nin nangipasirungan na komoyo nin Dios.
sample_english: Definitely in the past you were slaves of your evil deeds, but I thank God since now you are following with all your hearts the truth that God has put you under.

meaning_english: The process of speeding up a person or animal with threats.
sample_bolinao: Gulpi anay mausar nin makina sawanin nin pangipaspas sa pruduksyon o trabaho.
sample_english: There are many these days that use a machine to speed up production or work.

meaning_english: The act of insisting on something.
sample_bolinao: Mali'mo ya konran saraytin mammemper nin Judio nin mampangipasuet a saray mammemper nin ambo' nin Judio ket matkap saran paturi'.
sample_english: He was afraid of these Jewish believers who were insisting that the non-Jewish believers had to be circumcised.

meaning_english: The process of giving a proclamation.
sample_bolinao: Wanin man, sarain saray mampangipatanda' nin maipa'ka' kona ni Cristo, abas man o matunong a gagara ra, kasa nin kwinta kongko dapot no maipatandaan a maipa'ka' kona ni Jesu-Cristo.
sample_english: In spite of that, those who are proclaiming concerning Christ, whether their intentions are wrong or right, it is of no significance to me providing the proclamation is being made concerning Jesus Christ.

meaning_english: The proclamation of something in some particular place.
sample_bolinao: Ibarita' koyti komoyo a kai moyo et li' nin nakka' nin nangipatandaan a sarban bubabali nan Israel, si'kon si Pinaitawo ket sumubli' akoyna.
sample_english: I tell you this that you will not have yet gone to proclaim in all the towns of Israel, before I who am the One Conceived as a Person will return.

meaning_english: The process of translation or making something understood.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' malino a pangipataros nin ginwa' sa libro.
sample_english: The translation done on the book is not clear.

meaning_english: The process of disciplining or correcting.
sample_bolinao: Si'kamo anamaet nin mangatua, andi' moyon tuloy nin labasen a pangipatunong konran a'nak moyo ta pigaw nin kai nin tumapo' ana edet a nakem ra.
sample_english: You parents on the other hand, don't excessively overdo your correcting of your children in order that they would not then become discouraged.

meaning_english: The process of confessing or professing something as true often in the confiding of one's sins, faults or responsibilities to someone.
sample_bolinao: Saray raruman istudyanti ket main pangipatutuo ran maong yan mangyakay a maistro ra.
sample_english: Some students have a strong profession of how good their teachers are.

meaning_english: The act of illuminating or directing something to something.
sample_bolinao: Ket bana' ta si Ispirito nan Dios, binyan natamon ba'yon klasi nin byay, matkap a tumulok atamo kona sa pangipatyuan na kontamo.
sample_english: And so because the Spirit of God, he has given us a new kind of life, we must obey him in his directing/leading/pointing the way to us.

meaning_english: The process of fanning something.
sample_bolinao: Paray'epen nay kaingaran yupa'pangipaypayta pamainen nay siri sa lalaman.
sample_english: He cooled down the feeling by the process of fanning for it makes a breeze on the body.

meaning_english: The process of compressing something down to a flat state.
sample_bolinao: Kusto a pangipedped na ni Juan konan tamtaks.
sample_english: Juan's pressing the thumbtacks flat is correct.

meaning_english: The process of making of a plan.
sample_bolinao: Ket nagsitepetan sara no si'no kadi' konra a mampangiplanon siin.
sample_english: And so they asked each other who it could be among themselves that might be planning that.

meaning_english: The process of presenting something to someone.
sample_bolinao: Ket bana' anaod ta malingo ya anamaet a lamang, matkap nay mangiprisinta nin da'ton para sa pakapirduna nin kukasalanan nan diri bilang anamaet a lamang sa pangiprisinta nan da'ton para konran tutawo.
sample_english: And so because indeed he nonetheless might err as well, he must present offerings for forgiveness of his own sins just as he nonetheless is presenting as well offerings for the people.

meaning_english: The process of preserving food by boiling or using such things as salt, sugar, or vinegar.
sample_bolinao: Mabanglo a tiblon ninbonelessno iluto' ta mabistay pangiprisirba ra.
sample_english: When boneless milkfish are cooked it is a fragrant smell since they preserve well.

meaning_english: Having the responsibility of something,in-charge.
sample_bolinao: Si kaka nin anak a lalaki, syaypangipudirannin sarban main sa pamilya.
sample_english: The eldest son is in charge of all the properties of the family.

meaning_english: The process of spewing out something.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pangipugso nan ranom a makina ran bumbiro.
sample_english: The spewing of water of the firemen's engine is strong.

meaning_english: To be showing favoritism -in one's choices.
sample_bolinao: Yupa' sapangipurokmo nin parti nan kwarta a naglaku'nan mo.
sample_english: By keeping back part of your money from selling.

meaning_english: The process of separating out to a similar grouping from something.
sample_bolinao: Itaw sa rubari' a pangipurukan mon maata' nin mangga.
sample_english: There on the other side is the place to put aside the unripe mangoes.

meaning_english: The process of entrusting something to someone.
sample_bolinao: Pangipya nin sayan tawo konan Dios.
sample_english: A person is to be entrusting himself to God.

meaning_english: The act of entrusting someone with something of value.
sample_bolinao: Si maistra a pangipyawan ran mangatua konran a'nak ra sa iskol.
sample_english: It is the teacher that the parents entrust their children at school to.

meaning_english: To roast food in a particular place.
sample_bolinao: Itaw sa syang a pangira'pugan na ni Juan nin tiblon.
sample_english: It is there on the stove that Juan roasts milkfish.

meaning_english: The experience of undergoing suffering.
sample_bolinao: Manambar konranmampangirangepsa nagsikabarang a kikit nan sakit.
sample_english: Healed those who wereafflictedwith different kinds of sickness.

meaning_english: The process of undergoing suffering.
sample_bolinao: Kai kosara rabay nin pangirangepen nin idap a a'nak ko.
sample_english: I don't want my children to undergo difficulties.

meaning_english: The process of putting something someplace to heat it.
The muscular exertion accompanied with sound to remove something from the body.
sample_bolinao: Kurang a pangiray'es nan ina kanya' nin kai ya lumwa' a abing.
sample_english: The hard pushing of the mother was insufficient and so the baby didn't come out.

meaning_english: The threshing area or tools.
sample_bolinao: Ringgasan nayan maong a pangirikan mi'sa pipuruken nay apa tan irik.
sample_english: He is will clean well the threshing area and then he will separate into groups the chaff and the straw-less grain.

meaning_english: The process of giving respect.
sample_bolinao: Arkan yay gamet ran mangatuntawo a paka'kitan nin pangirispito.
sample_english: Kiss the hand of an older person as a sign of giving respect.

meaning_english: The process of binding something with a rope.
The vehicle for carrying something in.
sample_bolinao: Traysikel a pangiruranan kon sayti say lako' ko.
sample_english: The tricycle is the vehicle I use to carry these things I will sell.

meaning_english: A device for tightening something.
For two or more things to be unpaired from a normal set.
sample_bolinao: Pangis a sinilas nan anak, si saya mu'dit ya, si saya et asol ya.
sample_english: The child's slippers are unmatched, one is red and the other is blue.

meaning_english: The process of tethering something to something.
sample_bolinao: Abas a pangis'er mo sa rubir nan baka kanya' ya nakabulos.
sample_english: Your tethering of the cow's rope was incorrect and so it was able to get loose.

meaning_english: The tethering of something to something.
An instrument made of wood with steel blades through whichburileaves are drawn to be used in making mats.
sample_bolinao: Say pangisa' silag ni baying ko ket ma'teng yan kumusmol ta sadtay tadem na.
sample_english: The palm leaf stripper of my grandmother takes a long time to become dull since it is exceedingly sharp.

meaning_english: The process of draping of a something around the neck area or over something.
sample_bolinao: Saray mamalingki ket mabistay pangisa'lay ran bangkwang.
sample_english: It is nice for those that are shopping to sling their woven bags over their shoulders.

meaning_english: The process of putting a large amount of something in the mouth.
sample_bolinao: Umalaki a bebey bana' sa alaki nin pangisa'mel.
sample_english: The mouth is made big because of the large bite being put in the mouth.

meaning_english: The process of scattering something over a wide area.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pangisabwag ko nin gwano sa pa'sek mi.
sample_english: The fertilizer I am spreading on our dry land crops is strong.

meaning_english: The preparing of something for something.
sample_bolinao: Naigagara ana in nin lugar konran napili' nan Dios nin pangisadyaan.
sample_english: Those places have been purposely assigned and prepared for those chosen by God.

meaning_english: To have something prepared.
sample_bolinao: Abaw saran tuloy a tutawo kanya' nin pinangisadya' nasara ni Jesus nin ruranan nan baluto a tumutumbok na ta sali' no piraramu'yukan rayan saraytin abaw a tutawo.
sample_english: There were very many people, therefore Jesus told his disciples to prepare a boat for him to ride in if perchance this many people were to crowd around him.

meaning_english: The process of inserting something.
The process of blocking of something.
sample_bolinao: Payong a pangisalaban ran istudyanti sa reges nan rapeg.
sample_english: What the students use to block the downpour of rain is an umbrella.

meaning_english: For the use of draping something over.
The process of analyzing, narrating and communicating facts.
sample_bolinao: Mapalaway a pangisalaysay na ni Juan konan disgrasya sa kalsada.
sample_english: Juan's narration of the accident on the highway is clear.

meaning_english: The process of saving or rescuing something.
sample_bolinao: Nipurok natamo nin Dios ambo' nin ta pigaw nin dusawen na no kai edet, ta pigaw nin ila'pos nay pangisalba na kontamo yupa' kona ni Uunuren tamon Jesu-Cristo.
sample_english: God set us apart not in order for him to punish us but instead in order to complete his saving of us through our Lord Jesus Christ.

meaning_english: The process of sheltering something from something.
sample_bolinao: Payong a pangisalimbeng na ni Juan konan sira' nan awro no ugtiawro.
sample_english: What Juan uses for protection from the rays of the sun at mid-day is an umbrella.

meaning_english: The placing of something in a protective enclosure.
The process of requesting evil to come upon someone.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mo gaw'en apangisambasa kapada mon tawo ta kai na rabay Dios.
sample_english: Do not make acurseon your fellow people because God does not like that.

meaning_english: Exchange item.
The process of whipping something.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pangisanet nan rubir na ni Juan konan damulag na no mangadado ya.
sample_english: Juan's whipping of the carabao with the rope is hard when it is plowing.

meaning_english: The process or manner of putting together or expressing words.
sample_bolinao: Kusto a pangisarita' na ni Juan nin pammagalang konan kapitan.
sample_english: Juan's way of speaking giving honor to the captain is right.

meaning_english: The sautéing of something in a particular place.
A celebration of something.
sample_bolinao: Rabay ra a mariga nin pangisilibra nin kasal kanya' namabayli sara.
sample_english: They wanted the wedding celebration to be joyful  so they put on a dance.

meaning_english: The putting on of a celebration in a particular place.
sample_bolinao: Itaw sa plasa a pangisilibrawan nin kurunasyon ran kandidata.
sample_english: It is there in the plaza that the celebration of the coronation of the candidates will take place.

meaning_english: The thing to be exchanged for something.
The process of thinking.
To be thinking about something.
sample_bolinao: Pangisip-isipan na ni Juan no anin talagay kurso a adalen na sa kulihyo.
sample_english: Juan is continually thinking about what area of study he should really take in college.

meaning_english: The faculty by which we think.
sample_bolinao: ket inaribungbungan rayan Judio tan wanra kona, <<Anggan ka'no rakami nin pangisipen et?
sample_english: and so the Jews curiously gathered around him and said to him, <<Until when will you keep us mulling over this?

meaning_english: The process of slapping something to change its state by removing something or making something move.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pangisiprat nin rubir sa kabayo no rabay moy paspas.
sample_english: The slapping of the rope on the horse is to be hard if you want it to go fast.

meaning_english: Process of shaving.
sample_bolinao: Kusto a pangiskis na ni Juan sa barbas na.
sample_english: Juan's shaving of his beard is perfect.

meaning_english: The action of returning something.
sample_bolinao: Wantaw lamang a pangisubli' mo konan libro no pa'no ma kinalap.
sample_english: The condition in which you got it, that is also how you are to return the book.

meaning_english: The process of putting something in the mouth.
The process of cutting or ripping flesh.
The process of putting something in a fitted covering.
The process of inserting something into something.
sample_bolinao: Impurtanti a pangisulot nin hilmit tan sapatos no magmutursiklo.
sample_english: It is important to wear a helmet and shoes when riding a motorcycle.

meaning_english: The place where something  such as a thread is snagged or entangled.
The process or manner of writing something.
sample_bolinao: Madlaw tan mabista a pangisurat nan maistra ni Rose sa blakbord.
sample_english: What teacher Rose is writing on the blackboard is both good and clear.

meaning_english: The process of something rising so that it is taller or higher.
sample_bolinao: Nirirngan a pangita'gay ran gamet nin a'nak ta tanda' ray ubat sa tepet nan maistra.
sample_english: The children's hands all came up together since they knew the answer to the teachers question.

meaning_english: The process of swinging something in a back and forth motion.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pangita'yon sa undayon.
sample_english: The swinging of the hammock was hard.

meaning_english: The area where burials are done.
The process of slashing or hooking something.
The entrusting of something to something specific.
sample_bolinao: Busat na ni Juan a pangitalkan nan ruran nan mabati' no mako ya sa America.
sample_english: The one being entrusted with his vehicle that is left behind when he goes to America is the brother of Juan.

meaning_english: The process of discarding something.
The process of making known something that has been set to occur.
sample_bolinao: No Disyembre a pangitanda' nin miting nin kabaranggayan maipa'ka' sa pista nan Baranggay.
sample_english: The meeting of the baranggay concerning the Baranggay Fiesta is being announced for December.

meaning_english: The process of endorsing or supporting something..
sample_bolinao: Kusto a pangitandudo' ran mammemper konan ngaran nan Catawan.
sample_english: For the believers to be lifting up the name of the Lord is right.

meaning_english: The process of planting seeds in the ground.
sample_bolinao: Paspas anay pangitanem nin pari sawanin ta main anan makina.
sample_english: The process of planting rice these days is now fast since there is now a machine.

meaning_english: The process of introducing or beginning.
sample_bolinao: Say pangitarana' nin mabistan piamigwan ket say marigan ukasyon.
sample_english: The beginning of a good friendship is a joyful occasion.

meaning_english: The applying of a name to something.
sample_bolinao: Daikleng anay lod na ni Juan nin pangitawag na sa silpon na.
sample_english: Juan's load for calling on his cellphone is minuscule.

meaning_english: The process of distributing or spreading out things.
sample_bolinao: Matkap a pangitayak nin bato ba'yo ra taranaan a paniminto konan dalan.
sample_english: They need to spread a base of rocks before they begin the process of cementing a road.

meaning_english: To be persevering through a hardship.
sample_bolinao: Na'teng a pangitpel nan ray'ep ni Juan sin nalbet ya sa dalan.
sample_english: It was a long time that Juan persevered the cold when he got wet on the path.

meaning_english: The process of collecting something left over for use later.
The process of pouring something into a tube.
sample_bolinao: Alkansya a pangitubungan ko nin kwarta ko.
sample_english: The place where I am depositing my money is a piggy-bank.

meaning_english: The act of pointing out something.
sample_bolinao: Si tamudo' a pangitudo' sa tawo, bagay o ayep.
sample_english: The index finger is used for pointing out people things or animals.

meaning_english: The process of extending something such as help to someone.
sample_bolinao: Bana' sa pangitudol nan sina'pang na ni Madel, kai nayna matkap umdeng nin Noemi.
sample_english: Because of Madel's passing the rice to her, Noemi did not need to stand up.

meaning_english: The action of placing something on something specific as a base.
sample_bolinao: Napno' yaynan niluto' a lamisawan, kasaynan pangitukduan ko konan ga'get ko.
sample_english: The table was full of food, I had no place to put what I held.

meaning_english: The process of kicking something.
sample_bolinao: Natumba ya si Juan bana' sa maksaw nin pangituldak na ni Josing kona.
sample_english: Juan was knocked down because of the strong delivery of Josing's kick to him.

meaning_english: Continuing in the process of something.
The process of pushing something to make it move.
sample_bolinao: Kwan mon pwirsa a pangituror mo sa ruran.
sample_english: Put your force into the pushing of the vehicle.

meaning_english: The process of slicing something.
sample_bolinao: Kusto a pangiwa' na ni Rose nin karnin baka.
sample_english: Rose's slicing of the beef is perfect.

meaning_english: The process of spreading the news of something, gossip openly.
The process of mixing or stirring something.
sample_bolinao: Kutsara' a pangiwar kon gatas ko.
sample_english: A spoon is what I stir my milk with.

meaning_english: The process of swinging something in a controlled motion.

meaning_english: The putting of something first in place of something else.

sample_english: He said, <<That which he has said is usurping God!>>

sample_english: The rudder pole is what the pilot holds on to to be able to make his boat go where he wants it to.

meaning_english: The process of judging.

meaning_english: The process of bleaching something in the sun.

meaning_english: Stern area of a boat.

meaning_english: The activity of getting food when it is not time to eat and eating it.

meaning_english: The process of repeating something that had once been done, often because something is lacking.

meaning_english: The process of pulling something straight.

meaning_english: The action of scrutinizing or examining something.

meaning_english: A judgment or verdict passed by a judge.

meaning_english: The process of disciplining.

meaning_english: To be accustomed or skilled in doing something through practice or training.
