sample_english: Patar is close to Abrac.

meaning_english: To make someone firm.
sample_bolinao: Ket si Dios nin diri, mayadi' a anted a panaon nin pangingirangep moyon wanti, ket pasublien nay mabistan kapapa'sar moyo; paksawen nay nakem moyo; pagsenen nakamo; tan patarig'enen nakamon tutawo na.
sample_english: And so God himself, after a short time of your suffering like this, he will return your good situation; firm up your mind; strengthen you; and he will make firm your being his people.

meaning_english: Equal, the same.
sample_bolinao: Patasa bakas tan sukat.
sample_english: They are both thesamein size and shape.

meaning_english: Potato.
sample_bolinao: Matataway a karni no sambungan nin patatas.
sample_english: Meat is tasty when added to potatoes.

meaning_english: To hit the area from the back of the head down to the upper shoulders of a person with the closed fist or karate chop.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka miluku-luko kongko ta patatngean kata ket sa teen.
sample_english: Don't tease me or I'll clobber you on the back of the neck.

meaning_english: To have someone go down someplace
sample_bolinao: Patauyenyan talin-udong a lalaki ta maidap yan mangabing a asawa na.
sample_english: Have he husband go down the ladder with head down because his wife is having difficulty in delivering the child.

meaning_english: A float, anything that holds up something else in the water such as a piece of bamboo or inflated inner tube.
sample_bolinao: Main pataw nan taba' ni Enyong sa taaw.
sample_english: Enyong's seine net out at sea has floats.

meaning_english: To have something called something.
sample_bolinao: Si'kamo bale', andi' kamo patawag nin <Maistro> ta pari-parihoy butang moyo, mibubsat kamo tan sayan-saya ya tamo' a Maistro moyo.
sample_english: You however, don't have yourselves called <Maistro> since your rank is all exactly the same, you are brothers and there is one and only one Teacher that you have.

meaning_english: To make something float.
sample_bolinao: Patawan nan galon ni Juan a parpar nan taba' na.
sample_english: Juan uses a gallon container for a float for the tip of his seine net.

meaning_english: To have the taste of something tested.
sample_bolinao: Mamatawayka pan linuto' mon kanen-kanen.
sample_english: Will youletme taste the cake you cooked?

meaning_english: To add flavoring to food to make it more tasty.
sample_bolinao: Patawayen mo pay luto' mo pigaw abaw a ma'kan ko.
sample_english: You could add more flavor to your cooking so that I will eat a lot.

meaning_english: To have an inheritance or benefit given to someone.
sample_bolinao: Iti kamoyna sa dupong ran naiduman pinatawiran a a'nak nan Dios a say ngaran ra ket nailista anadtaw sa langit.
sample_english: You are now here in the assembly of the children of God who are uniquely privileged to be given and inheritance whose names are now listed there in heaven.

meaning_english: To enter or be brought into service to someone as a maid, or servant for pay.
sample_bolinao: Mabistay patawo sa palasyo ta mataway pirmi a kanen.
sample_english: It is good to serve in a palace since the food is always delicious.

meaning_english: For a person to be sluggish or lethargic such as in their work.
sample_bolinao: Matalag saray mangalap konan sayay patay-patay nin trabahador.
sample_english: Few will hire a sluggish worker.

meaning_english: An echo, reverberation.
sample_bolinao: Narnge' a patbang nin tunoy nin palsot anggan Sibarbar.
sample_english: The reverberation of the sound of gun fire was heard as far as Sibarbar.

meaning_english: To reciprocate equally or to match something.
sample_bolinao: Patbangan na ni Dan a sanribo nin nibi nan busat na nin gastusen sa anibirsaryo nan kapilya ra.
sample_english: Dan matched the thousand that his brother gave for the anniversary expenses of their church.

meaning_english: To make something prominent.
sample_bolinao: Patbawen na ni Rose a busis na no mayi yan mangansyon sa kapilya.
sample_english: Rose makes her voice stand out when she joins with the singing in the church.

meaning_english: To have someone sing, or serenade a young girl.
sample_bolinao: Saray tububa'yo rabay rayanpatbenana mabistan balasang.
sample_english: The young men liketo serenadethe beautiful girl.

meaning_english: To make something spin.
sample_bolinao: Rabay nayan patbeyen nin anak a bulak bale' kai na et nin mababa'.
sample_english: The child wants to make the top spin but he is not yet able.

meaning_english: To have someone or thing take a sitting position.
sample_bolinao: Patekre' raya nin inalsa ta kai naya nin mapa'nat bisit na.
sample_english: They sat him up when they lifted him out since he is not able to stretch out his legs.

meaning_english: To have someone seated.
sample_bolinao: Patekreen mosaran mu'na a mangatuntawo pigaw kai sara mablay.
sample_english: Seat the older people first as they come so that they don't get fatigued.

meaning_english: To cause deafness.
sample_bolinao: Si'kan ispiriton mamatelek tan mamaumel, lumakwan kayna kona tan andi' moyna umanen et a sumrep kona!
sample_english: You spirit that causes to be deaf and to be mute, go away from him now and don't enter him again!

meaning_english: A straight continuous crease dividing the palm of the hand.
sample_bolinao: Alalaki a pater na sa karni kanya' maidap nin lutuen.
sample_english: His chunks of cut up meat are large and so it is difficult to cook.

meaning_english: To cut meat across the grain into smaller pieces.
sample_bolinao: Pateren moy karnin manok ta iprito ko.
sample_english: Cut up the chicken for I will fry it.

meaning_english: To have something stopped.
sample_bolinao: Anro a pila nin ruran sa ripay bana' sa patgen ran pulis.
sample_english: The line of vehicles at the crossing is long because of the police stopping them.

meaning_english: To make something stop where there is a flow such as a radio, motor, crying, or water.
sample_bolinao: Pinatgen naya ni Jesus a maksaw nin tribunada.
sample_english: Jesus stopped the strong sudden storm.

meaning_english: To harden or stiffen something making it difficult to destroy.
sample_bolinao: Patib'eyenmon maong a yilo pigaw ma'teng kai matunaw.
sample_english: Hardenthe ice so that it will not easily melt.

meaning_english: For something to have been made bent.
sample_bolinao: Matkap ambo' paspas no kumurba sa patiko' nin dalan.
sample_english: It must be that it is not fast when transversing a curve in a bend in the road.

meaning_english: To make something deviate from being straight, have it bent.
sample_bolinao: Sarain saray mampamatiko' konan Mabistan Patanda', bara'mon rabay ran tuloy nin paririketen rakamo ta pigaw nin mayi kamo konra bale' si apes ra ket ambo' nin para sa kaabigan moyo.
sample_english: Those who are distorting the Good News, it's as if they greatly desire to please you so that you will agree with them, but their desire is not for your good.

meaning_english: Sideburns.
sample_bolinao: Anro yay patilya na ni Elvis.
sample_english: Elvis' sideburns are long.

meaning_english: To cause to swell with a gas.
sample_bolinao: Patimbaruken nga'min a salbabida ko.
sample_english: Every one of my life-vests are inflatable.

meaning_english: To pacify or make something calm.
sample_bolinao: Naka'ngap saray adalan ta si Jesus magawa' nay mamatinek nin maksaw a bagyo.
sample_english: The disciples were surprised because Jesus was able to calm the strong typhoon.

meaning_english: Partial advance payment.
sample_bolinao: Liman yasot a nibi ran patinga para konran beyek.
sample_english: What they gave as a down payment for the piglets was five hundred pesos.

meaning_english: Fish sauce.
sample_bolinao: Say iyusar min ipamag'ong ket patis.
sample_english: What we use as salted fish paste is fish sauce.

meaning_english: Death.
sample_bolinao: Patitiin, say mako kigira nin kasan palsot.
sample_english: To go into a war without a gun issuicide.

meaning_english: To have a sound made.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a patnoy nan ripiri sa paswit na.
sample_english: The sound made by the referee's whistle was loud.

meaning_english: Something that give direction or guidance.
sample_bolinao: Matkap mi a patnugot no kai mi tanda' a dalan.
sample_english: We need a guide if we don't know the way.

meaning_english: To speak to someone.
sample_bolinao: Andi' kamo mamatnoy ribintador ta sali' masasakit kamo.
sample_english: Don't sound off firecrackers for you might hurt yourself.

meaning_english: Duck.
sample_bolinao: Saray pato ko, mangan sara nin kakayat.
sample_english: My ducks gnaw at their food.

meaning_english: A hit to the head or top of something with something such as the stroke of a hammer on a nail.
sample_bolinao: Masakit a patok nan kabaw nin masiken kanya' nin kaday'an koya.
sample_english: The blow to the head by the senile old man hurts and so I stay away from him.

meaning_english: Extra interest imposed upon overdue, loss or account.
sample_bolinao: Abaw anaypatongna ta na'teng nan kai nabayadan.
sample_english: Theinterestis much now because it has been a long time account.

meaning_english: Dusk, the time when chickens roost.
sample_bolinao: Mainsanan nopatpaapon.
sample_english: Later atdusk.

meaning_english: To be in pairs opposite each other.
To give strength and encouragement to someone.
sample_bolinao: Si kaaluyon ko a mamatpel kongko no lumalako ako sa danin kampusanto.
sample_english: My escort is the one that gives encouragement to me when I walk close to a cemetery.

meaning_english: A piece of board with objects attached to act as hammers. It is rotated back and forth to cause atak-taksound. It's used during Holy Week.
sample_bolinao: No lumibot saray tutawo no mabli awro, kasan tunoy nin kampana no kai saypatrakatamo'.
sample_english: While the procession goes around arattling soundis heard not a bell.

meaning_english: A guard to provide security.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a patrol kanya' kai kami nakalusot.
sample_english: There were a lot of guards and so we were not able to pass through.

meaning_english: Protector or patron saint of a town.
sample_bolinao: Si santo apatronnin Bolinao, si Sinyor Santiago de Galecia.
sample_english: ThePatronSaint of Bolinao is Senior Santiago de Galecia.

meaning_english: A patch over a hole on a tire, hose, kettle or basin.
sample_bolinao: Kasan patsi nan bisiklita na kanya' kai naya maiyusar.
sample_english: He has no tire patch for his bicycle and so he is unable to use it.

meaning_english: To patch something.
sample_bolinao: Patsiwankoyay ubot lata pigaw kai ya tumuro'.
sample_english: I willput a patchthe hole in the can so that it will not leak.

meaning_english: To have been made straight or flat.
sample_bolinao: Mayadi' yay kurbada nin dalan ket patu'rir anamana a dalan.
sample_english: After a curvature in the road it straightens out again.

meaning_english: Make something straight and flat.
sample_bolinao: Patu'riren moyoy dalanan na.
sample_english: Make straight his path.

meaning_english: To make something become fully ripe.
sample_bolinao: Patuawen na ni Juan a bungan mangga ba'yo na nin kalapen.
sample_english: Juan allows the mango fruit to fully ripe before he gets it.

meaning_english: To bring up or raise someone, as a child.
sample_bolinao: Si awro, tumulong yanmamatubo'tanaman.
sample_english: The sun helps plants togrow.

meaning_english: To turn on an audio device such as a radio to play music.
meaning_filipino: Magtutog ang radyo; tumogtug ang radyo.
sample_bolinao: Mamatugtog ya si Juan nin paburito nan kansyon sindo buklas.
sample_english: Juan turns the radio on to his favorite songs every morning.

meaning_english: To hit the top of something with a solid object.
sample_bolinao: Patukenma in si aso nin kayo no duklusen naka.
sample_english: Hitthat dog with a piece of wood if he would bite you.

meaning_english: Herbaceous vine bearing elongated many angled fruit.
sample_bolinao: No mamisingpatula,sambungan nin urang pigaw mataway.
sample_english: When Chinese okra is cooked, add shrimp to make it delicious.

meaning_english: To have someone help.
sample_bolinao: Main anamaet itaw nin sayay babayin balo nin pirmin mako kona ta patulong ya maipa'ka' sa kaso na konan kakuntra na.
sample_english: There was also a widow there who would always go to him to ask help concerning her case/lawsuit against her opponent.

meaning_english: To make someone obedient or dominate them.
sample_bolinao: Si sayay tawo a patuluken nayay sayay tawo a sumuko' kona.
sample_english: The person that surrender to another is made to obey him.

meaning_english: To give continued support, usually meaning putting up or caring for a visitor for several days.
To cause medicine to be given.
To seek advise or counsel.
meaning_filipino: Sumunod siya sa anumang ipayo; susunod sa payo.
sample_bolinao: Maong tapatumbalakya, no kai kumon, duka' nangyadi' kona.
sample_english: Its good that she seeks out advice, if not something bad would have happened to her.

meaning_english: To have something follow something.
sample_bolinao: Kanya' anaod nin nitampal yayna tan saray uanghil nin patumbok na iti sa luta'.
sample_english: Therefore indeed he and the angels that followed him were cast to the earth.

meaning_english: To have something followed by another.
sample_bolinao: Patumbukenkamo ta pagbaliwen takamon mangalap tutawo wani Jesus.
sample_english: Come follow for I will change you into catching men, Jesus said.

meaning_english: Floor or ceiling joist.
sample_bolinao: Kai gapo anagen a patungsoy bali ko ta ibat sa kayo nin mabulo.
sample_english: The floor joists of my house will not at all be eaten by termites since they are from the velvet apple tree.

meaning_english: Rice dessert wrapped in wovenburior coconut leaves mixed with coconut milk and dropped into boiling sugar until cooked.
sample_bolinao: Mataway apatupat.
sample_english: The wrapped ricedessert is tasty.

meaning_english: To have someone circumcised.
sample_bolinao: Itaw ya nin paturi' a ari ko saCenter.
sample_english: It will be there at the Center that my younger brother will be circumcised.

meaning_english: To have something spun.
sample_bolinao: Patursi yaynan patursi nin bikoy bisiklita si Juan ta kiten nan maong no kusto a linya nin rayos na.
sample_english: Juan repeatedly spins the wheel of the bicycle in order to see that the spoke alignment is correct.

meaning_english: To make something turn.
sample_bolinao: Si isprakit nin daikleng a mamatursi nin maong sa bisiklita ko.
sample_english: The small sprocket is what makes my bicycle wheel turn really well.

meaning_english: To make something leak out or drain slowly from a container or surface.
sample_bolinao: Ginwa' nakamoynan amigo na bana' sa daya' na ni Cristo nin pinaturo' na.
sample_english: He has made you his friends because of the blood of Christ which he drained out.

meaning_english: To confirm or testify to something.
sample_bolinao: O' anaod, pinatutu'wan nan Dios a si Jesus ket Anak naya.
sample_english: Yes indeed, God proved that Jesus is his Son.

meaning_english: To testify or confirm the truthfulness of something.
sample_bolinao: Patutu'wenko a tutuon nangyadi'.
sample_english: I cantestifyas to what truly happened.

meaning_english: To kill someone.
sample_bolinao: Kasayna kumon nin pinatyan nin tawo pigaw matinek anay byay.
sample_english: We hope that there will no longer be killing of each other so life will be peaceful.

meaning_english: To kill something by taking away its life, such as that of an animal, plant, engine, light bulb, etc.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma patyen in si pusa' ta kuda'dwan ya.
sample_english: Do notkillthe cat, it is pitiful.

meaning_english: Court-yard, the area around the entrance of the church.
sample_bolinao: Tumgen saray tutawo sapatyo.
sample_english: The people stopped at thecourtyard.

meaning_english: The aiming of something such as a gun or fist at something.
sample_bolinao: Sipatyo'nan palsot, adap ya kona kanya' nalayo ya.
sample_english: Theaimof the gun was pointed at him and so he ran.

meaning_english: To target or take aim at something in order to hit it or threaten such as shaking the fist at someone.
sample_bolinao: Si pulis,pinatyuannayan palsot a mananakaw.
sample_english: The policemanpointedthe gun at the robber.

meaning_english: A first installment, partial payment, down payment.
sample_bolinao: Mangwa' kamon pau'na nin ipatanda' a gaw'en ninmedical missioniti.
sample_english: Make a notice announcing the medical mission to be done here.

meaning_english: May range in meaning from simple notification of something to be watched for or guarded against to admonition or threats of violence or notifying well in advance of impending danger or peril.
sample_bolinao: Nami yan pau'na-u'na si Miyor a saray madakep nin mamungbong ket kai sara nin pirdunawen.
sample_english: The Mayor issued a warning that those who will be caught dynamite fishing will not be forgiven.

meaning_english: To warn someone ahead of something.
sample_bolinao: Si Sam ket mamau'na yan sanribo nin bayad na sa utang na.
sample_english: Sam gave one thousand peso for his first payment on his debt.

meaning_english: To send someone ahead of others.
sample_bolinao: Mamau'na akoyna yapo' ta no sumunor ana li' a raruma.
sample_english: I will initially go ahead since the others will later follow.

meaning_english: To allow fruit to ripen and turn yellow or red.
sample_bolinao: Pauditenray labi' ran bubalasang.
sample_english: The young women have their lips colored red.

meaning_english: To force someone to say yes.
To send someone home.
sample_bolinao: Sin sain, nipababo nay gamet na ni Jesus konan lalaki ket inmanda' ya, mi'sa pinaugot nayayna sa bali ra.
sample_english: At that point, Jesus put his hands on the man and so he was healed, then he sent him back to his house.

meaning_english: To be confused by something and not make a good judgment.
sample_bolinao: Ket andi' kamo nin paulaw sa si'numan nin mangi'deng a ambo' kanon kasalanan in a gawa'-gawa', ta si Dios gura' na in tan dusawen nasara li' a mansumubag kona.
sample_english: And so don't be deceived by anyone who puts forth that those deeds are supposedly not sin, since God hates that deeds and he will punish those who are opposing him.

meaning_english: To have something move up a structure.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan ket pauli' ya sa ta'gay bali  konran kaikap na.
sample_english: Juan takes the top of the house of those he is staying with.

meaning_english: To make something climb or go up something.
sample_bolinao: Say asok,mamauli'a maong no malteng ket kasan siri.
sample_english: Smokerisesstraight up when it is calm and no wind is blowing.

meaning_english: A title or heading such as of the news or a movie.
sample_bolinao: Saypaulonan isturya wana «Say ado' nan Sayay Ina».
sample_english: Thetitleof the story is «The Love of a Mother».

meaning_english: To allow oneself to be given less than the proper share.
sample_bolinao: Maong ana a paumli dyan si mangumli.
sample_english: It is better to allow oneself to be taken advantage of than to take advantage of others.

meaning_english: The main long beam of an object.
sample_bolinao: Paundoy yan nida' si Juan sa siir nan ba'lag na.
sample_english: Juan lays himself lengthwise on the floor slats in his hut.

meaning_english: To have a medical procedure done.
Have something moved over or down a little.
sample_bolinao: Pagawan na ni Mark nin paus'os no nakaida' ya.
sample_english: Mark takes care to move over a little when he lies down.

meaning_english: To have money or something lent out from what one has.
sample_bolinao: Gulpin pautang na ni Juan konran kabaraybay na ta gulpin kwarta na.
sample_english: Juan is asked by his neighbors to lend them money since he has a lot.

meaning_english: To give credit or lend money for something.
sample_bolinao: Maningir saran utang a namautang tepe' tanda' ran nagswildo anay pinautangan ra.
sample_english: The lenders will collect the debt each time they know that the the ones they gave credit to get their salaries.

meaning_english: To have something in particular washed  with a liquid.
sample_bolinao: Gulpin pauyasan nin palaton no gulpin nangan sa palaton.
sample_english: There are a lot of plates to wash if there are a lot that eat on plates.

meaning_english: To go in the same direction or the length of something.
sample_bolinao: Pauyon a pangigad nan tiblon ni Rose.
sample_english: Rose's way of slicing of the milkfish was lengthwise.

meaning_english: A back and forth action of something such as a fly swatter or the action of a turtles flippers.
sample_bolinao: Main pawag na kanya' kai sara makadpa' a lango sa lako' na.
sample_english: She had a swatter and so the flies were not able to land on what she was selling.

meaning_english: The action of repeatedly swatting similar to the swimming action of a sea turtle.
sample_bolinao: Pawag-pawag ya si Dan no mangan sara ta main lango nin kumadani sa ma'kan.
sample_english: When they eat, Dan swats and swats because of flies that come near the food.

meaning_english: To wave something over an area or object to chase away something such as flies off the rice.
sample_bolinao: Pawagan mosaray lango ta masama' sara.
sample_english: Shoo the flies off since they are dirty.

meaning_english: To swat at or drive something away such as a mosquito with a flat object like a flyswatter.
sample_bolinao: Mamawag ka ta abaw saray lango.
sample_english: Swat them for there are a lot of flies.

meaning_english: To be to the right side of something.
sample_bolinao: Sipawanana gamet mo a manga'get plato.
sample_english: Hold the plate with yourright hand.

meaning_english: The sea turtle limbs that are used as paddles.
sample_bolinao: A'pat raypawarnan pawikan.
sample_english: The sea turtle has four paddles.

meaning_english: For the feet to be turned toes in as a person walks, pigeon-toed.
sample_bolinao: Pawedya si Mateo.
sample_english: Mateo ispigeon-toed.

meaning_english: The palm leaves bound together used for roofing.
sample_bolinao: Si pawer mi ket mabista kanya' mamagwa' saran abaw.
sample_english: Our bound leaf roofing is good and so there are many that are having us do it.

meaning_english: To bind something in two overlapping nipa leaves about 1.5 feet long. Usually used of split bamboo such as in a floor.
Sea turtle.
sample_bolinao: Alalaki saraypawikandyan pag'ong.
sample_english: Thesea turtlesare bigger than the land turtles.

meaning_english: To use the left hand to do something.
sample_bolinao: Lumalako ya sapawiri.
sample_english: He walked on theleft side.

meaning_english: A flat bottom motorized boat without outriggers.
sample_bolinao: Sin mako kami saBataanmanaliw nin ayama, say rinuranan mi ket pawis.
sample_english: When we go to Bataan to buy crabs, what we ride on is a small boat with no outriggers.

meaning_english: To be made to seem light in weight.
sample_bolinao: Pay'an ya si Juan no tumangoy ya sa taaw.
sample_english: When Juan swims in the ocean, he is high in the water.

meaning_english: To make something specific easy or lighter.
sample_bolinao: Kai ko nin apes nin pay'anan saray raruma tan pabyatan kamo no kai si pada-pada kumon nin mabista a kapapa'sar moyo.
sample_english: I do not desire to make it easy for others and burden you but instead that you all equally might have a good situation.

meaning_english: To make something easier or lighter to do.
sample_bolinao: Kai li' gapo nin pay'anen a pangingirangep ra sa yabi tan awro bana' ta rinayo raya a makapali'mon ayep tan si imahin na, tan nipamarka sara nin ngaran nan makapali'mon ayep.
sample_english: Their undergoing suffering day and night will not at all be lightened because they have worshiped the terrifying animal and its image, and they have been marked with the name of the terrifying animal.

meaning_english: Security, the protective care to someone or something.
sample_bolinao: Say paya', impurtanti sa tawo.
sample_english: Security is important to a person.

meaning_english: A gift freely given to meet a need.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a payabor nin narisibi ran maidap sin pasko.
sample_english: There were a lot of gifts that the poor received at Christmas.

meaning_english: To grant something or to bless with something favorable.
sample_bolinao: Anak ko,payaburanmoko pa?
sample_english: My child, pleasegiveme something.

meaning_english: To have something completed.
sample_bolinao: Payadien na ni Juan a angkay nan mampanago' ranom mi'sa ya kibale' nin manago'.
sample_english: Juan had his older sibling finish drawing water and the he took up drawing water.

meaning_english: An ax.
sample_bolinao: Payakor a usaren ko no mamlang ako nin kayo.
sample_english: It's an ax I use when I split wood.

meaning_english: Frightful, one who easily gets afraid, one who is easily frightened.
sample_bolinao: Ambo' mabista a pigagawa' nan sayay tawonpayakot.
sample_english: It is not good for a person to befrightful.

meaning_english: Flapping of wings.
sample_bolinao: Say payakpak ran kalapati maksaw no mampatyen raya.
sample_english: The wing flapping of the doves is strong when it is being killed.

meaning_english: To chop something up, normally with an ax..
sample_bolinao: Payakuren a alalakin kayo nin gaw'en sungroy.
sample_english: Chop up the large pieces of wood to make it into firewood.

meaning_english: To make someone rich.
sample_bolinao: Payamanen nakon nigusyo ko ta mabistay tikap na.
sample_english: My business made me rich for it has a good earnings.

meaning_english: The position of having the thighs and legs spread.
sample_bolinao: Payangka' yan ma'lek a aso ko.
sample_english: My dog sleeps with its legs spread apart.

meaning_english: A small red crab that is found along the seashore and walks with its big pincers waving in the air.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a lumiwa' ninpayapayno ugto yay awro.
sample_english: Many small crabs called payapay comes out from their holes at noontime to dry them selves.

meaning_english: Mantis.
sample_bolinao: Mitupi'-tupi' yay insikto nin payakor no painawa ya.
sample_english: The mantis folds it self up when it rests.

meaning_english: To wave the hands back and forth to signal someone or as a form of greeting or to say goodbye.
sample_bolinao: Payapayan na ni Rose a amiga na no lumabas ya sa bali ra.
sample_english: Rose waves to her friend when she passes her house.

meaning_english: The act of wandering and not having a secure job.
sample_bolinao: Si payawas ra ket pirmi kanya' kai ra maadap a ua'nak ra.
sample_english: Their wandering is permanent and so they don't see their children.

meaning_english: The process of burning clam shells in the ground until they turn to ashes and form a lime-like substance after several days.
sample_bolinao: Mako kami mangwa' nin payba ta ilako' mi.
sample_english: Let's go process lime in order to sell it.

meaning_english: To bake pottery or other things in the ground or burn clam shells with minimal oxygen in the ground until after several days they turn to ashes and form a lime-like substance.
sample_bolinao: Paybawen na ni Rose a ginwa' nan kuden tan paya.
sample_english: Rose bakes them in the ground when she makes cooking pots and clay jars.

meaning_english: The action of a body shaking or trembling.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a payegpeg nan manok sin nagket yan tadi' sa kerep.
sample_english: The trembling of the chicken was intense when it was hit in the chest by the metal spur.

meaning_english: The rough skin of thepagiwhich is used to scrape root crops to make flour.
sample_bolinao: Saypayi, usaren nin ipangagap.
sample_english: The stingray scalesare used to scrape root crops into flour.

meaning_english: Umbrella.
sample_bolinao: Nangiduna ya nin payong a busat ko sinalumni homecomingra.
sample_english: My sibling donated umbrellas during their alumni homecoming.

meaning_english: Folding fan.
sample_bolinao: Saray tawo, manaliw saran paypay nin usaren ra ta ma'mot.
sample_english: The people will buy a fan to use since it is hot.

meaning_english: To fan something with a hand fan.
sample_bolinao: Paypayan moyay pasyinti ta ma'pusan ya.
sample_english: Fan the patient because he has an insufficient supply of oxygen.

meaning_english: Pipe-like fold of a material with which edges or seams are trimmed.
sample_bolinao: Mainpaypingnan leey nan aysing na.
sample_english: The neck hole of her dress haspiping.

meaning_english: The directed expulsion of air.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a paysep na sa trumpita kanya' marnge' raya.
sample_english: His blowing of the trumpet was hard and so they heard it.

meaning_english: To blow on something through the mouth.
To strongly blow something with the mouth or some other source.
sample_bolinao: Mainum'ay anay mamaya nin gulpi ta paysepen nan bintilador.
sample_english: It is now easy to broil a lot of things since the fan is blowing.

meaning_english: To cover someone or thing with an umbrella.
sample_bolinao: Payungan nako pa ta sabtay amot nan awro.
sample_english: Could you cover me with your umbrella since the heat of the sun is excruciating.

meaning_english: To scrape a root crop with the scales of the stingray or other rough material.
The month of February.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a matingkapan ran maglako' burak tepe' Pebrero ta abaw manaliw burak nin ibi ra sa inado' ra.
sample_english: The flower merchants are expecting to earn a lot each February since there are many that will buy flowers to give to their lovers.

meaning_english: The pulsating sound of the heart, throb.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw apedegnan puso' no pasyawen a malayo.
sample_english: The heartbeat is hard when running with passion.

meaning_english: The throbbing of something.
sample_bolinao: Pedeg-pedeg yay puso' ni Rose sin mantaga'nan nan anunsyo nin nanalon prisidinti sa iliksyon.
sample_english: Rose's heart throbbed when she was waiting for the announcement of the winner of the election for the presidency.

meaning_english: Eyelashes, the protective hairs on the eyelids.
sample_bolinao: Anununro a pedek na ni Linda.
sample_english: Linda's eyelashes are so long.

meaning_english: A compactor, either done manually or by a machine that is used to compress and level surfaces such as roads and fields.
sample_bolinao: Mabyat yaypedpedkanya' mapatag nan maong a dalan.
sample_english: The steamroller is heavy that's why it can level out the road well.

meaning_english: To apply weight or pressure on something to flatten, compress or make it level such as a road.
sample_bolinao: Pedpedenyaynay dalan.
sample_english: The road will now beflattened.

meaning_english: A club, a piece of wood, stone, hammer or like object for hitting the head or the top of something.
sample_bolinao: Alaki yay pekpek ko kanya' sara mali'mo.
sample_english: My club was big and so they were afraid.

meaning_english: To pound on something.
sample_bolinao: Pekpekan ma ulo nan pasak sa tekrean ta sumudit ya ket makasida' yan butarga.
sample_english: Pound in the head of the nail in the chair for it is working up and can run the trousers.

meaning_english: To club something on the head with a hard object.
sample_bolinao: Pinekpeknako sa ulo nin alakin kayo.
sample_english: Hehitme on the head with a big piece of wood.

meaning_english: The action of flopping around.
sample_bolinao: Peleg yaynan peleg a kuna' kanya' dandani ya makabulos.
sample_english: The fish flopped and flopped and so almost got away.

meaning_english: To be short and stout.
sample_bolinao: Pengkekyay abing.
sample_english: The baby isshortandstout.

meaning_english: A short stick of bamboo or wood about 1/2 to 1 meter long that can be easily carried around for various uses.
sample_bolinao: Byan mokon saypengpengnin kawayan.
sample_english: Give me thetubesof bamboo.

meaning_english: A temporary pile of something such as a stack of newly harvested or threshed rice straw.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a penpen nin nadinep ipamakan baka.
sample_english: There are a lot of stacks of straw that have been gathered for feeding the cattle.

meaning_english: To gather things together to one side of a container or area.
A covering to go over the eyes to block the vision.
sample_bolinao: Mairot a pepet nan a'rong ni Jing pigaw kai na masanglap a sengaw asido.
sample_english: Jing closed his nose tight so that he would not breathe in the acid vapors.

meaning_english: To cover or block a specific opening on the body, such as an air entrance.
sample_bolinao: Pepetan na ni Juan a tutulyan na no mamattrak yan alalakin labintador.
sample_english: Juan cover his ears when he explodes bigger firecrackers.

meaning_english: To cover an opening in the head (mouth, nose, eyes, ears) with the hand or an object.
sample_bolinao: Pepeten koy tutulyan mo no palbangen koyay labintador.
sample_english: I'll cover your ears when I explode a 5 star.

meaning_english: An askance or angry and scornful look or glare.
sample_bolinao: Ma'kit nin masager ya si Angging sa perek na.
sample_english: It can be seen that Angging is angry by her scornful look.

meaning_english: To look askance at something, squinting and scowling with an angry glare, commonly with movement of the eyes to or away from them.
sample_bolinao: Perekan nakon pirmi nin angkay nan mampadamagan ko.
sample_english: The older sibling of the one I am courting is always looking askance at me.

meaning_english: The act of closing the eyes or blocking the vision over a period of time.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka pereng nin lumalako ta pinggat ma'kit may dalan mo.
sample_english: Don't walk with your eyes closed so you can see your path.

meaning_english: Concurrently with some process, usually used with something of short or recurring duration.
sample_bolinao: Grabi aperesnan siri nayabi.
sample_english: The gusts of the wind last night were terrible.

meaning_english: For the growth of something to be hindered by something.
sample_bolinao: Perperya a tarom ta inurer a yamot na.
sample_english: The eggplant's growth is hindered since there are worms that have eaten its roots.

meaning_english: To squeeze the juice out of something with the hands.
sample_bolinao: Persan man kalamansi a kinilaw nin talaba.
sample_english: Squeeze kalamansi onto the raw oyster for eating.

meaning_english: Perspective.
To open and close the eyes repeatedly and frown to show distaste and indifference to their situation.
sample_bolinao: Matkap kasan peseg no ibaki' raka.
sample_english: There must be no show of dissatisfaction when they send you.

meaning_english: A binding to hold things together.
sample_bolinao: Madali' nan itanem ni Dan a peset nin pasedsed ta paspas ya.
sample_english: Dan quickly binds the plants for transplanting for he is fast.

meaning_english: The act of squeezing or wringing something out.
sample_bolinao: Abaw anay pespes konan gata' kanya' kasaynan makalap.
sample_english: There has been a lot of squeezings for coconut milk and so there is no more to be gotten.

meaning_english: Squeeze something out of something.
sample_bolinao: Pespesan mon maong a aysing pigaw madali' nin kumrang.
sample_english: Squeeze out the clothing well so that it will dry quickly.

meaning_english: To apply pressure or squeeze, normally with a twisting motion to remove a liquid from a soaked item.
sample_bolinao: Pespesen moy yinadyad nin ungot ta matkap koy gata'.
sample_english: Squeeze out the coconut gratings for I need the milk.

meaning_english: True, to be perfect in relation to what is real.
sample_bolinao: Petegyan mapagpyawan.
sample_english: She istrulytrustworthy.

meaning_english: The guide or finish line to know where the goal is.
sample_bolinao: Say malayo, mainpetengna.
sample_english: In a race, there's afinishline.

meaning_english: Writhing, to turn the body as if to die or in a convulsion, to shirk.
sample_bolinao: Anggawan byay na, kasa yay peyed na.
sample_english: At the end of his life he had no tremors.

meaning_english: The act of shaking the head from side to side to show disapproval.
sample_bolinao: Sabtay peyeng ra sin natalo sara sa ikap.
sample_english: She shook her head hard when they lost the game.

meaning_english: To run away quickly and fast.
sample_bolinao: Peyepeynan pusa' ta isen yaynay aso.
sample_english: The catfledfor the dog was there.

meaning_english: To twist around or back and forth.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw siri kanya' peyes a nagwa' nan baluto mi.
sample_english: The wind is strong and so our boat is twisting back and forth.

meaning_english: Argumentation, an exchange of heated words.
sample_bolinao: Mainpi'batanran miamigo ta kai sara makapitarusan.
sample_english: There was an exchange of words because they couldn't come to an understanding.

meaning_english: To go with something or one to do something.
sample_bolinao: Say mabista, mibunutan atamo no si'no a pi'kaan na.
sample_english: What's best is, we will draw lots to see who it will go with.

meaning_english: To have somebody to go someplace.
sample_bolinao: Pi'kaenmayna pigaw kasan maibarita' na.
sample_english: Allow her now to go so that she will not say anything.

meaning_english: The fourth time relating to frequency.
sample_bolinao: Pi'patnaynan mag'iksamin saNursing Board Examinationni Roslyn.
sample_english: This is the fourthtime for Roslyn to take the Nursing Board Examination.

meaning_english: To divide into four pieces.
sample_bolinao: Pi'paten may in si tinapay pigaw mabyan kamon a'pat.
sample_english: Divide that bread into four pieces so that it can be given to you four.

meaning_english: The act of laundering clothing, bedding, shoes, rugs or bags.
sample_bolinao: Si pi'pi' ko, mabista ya dyan pi'pi' mo.
sample_english: My laundering is better that your laundering.

meaning_english: To wash clothes, rugs and bags.
sample_bolinao: Pi'pian koynay seket mo pigaw makatulong ako komo.
sample_english: I will wash your clothes in order to help you.

meaning_english: The process of being one more step along.
sample_bolinao: Pi'sa na tamo' nin nag'iksamin ni Ana sa maistra ket naisapat nan tampor.
sample_english: Ana had just one step when she was examined to be a teacher and so she passed inspection immediately.

meaning_english: To do once and only once.
sample_bolinao: Siti nin Sangkata'gayan nin Padi' tamo, pini'sa-pi'sa nayna a nipangiprisinta nin masadag nin da'ton para kontamon tutawo sin nibi nan nida'ton a lalaman nan diri.
sample_english: This Highest Priest of ours, once and only once has presented a sufficient offering/sacrifice for us people when he gave his own body as a offering/sacrifice.

meaning_english: Step aside or move something over a little bit.
sample_bolinao: Piisen kadsen ta patekreen yay sayay tawo.
sample_english: Movea little bit and let the man be seated.

meaning_english: Move there.
sample_bolinao: Pi'tawkadsen ta main tumekre'.
sample_english: Movethere a little bit because somebody will sit.

meaning_english: The act or occasion of a claim on something.
sample_bolinao: Nakapangan yan makasamal nin kuna' kanya' angol a piaabot na.
sample_english: He happened to eat some poisonous fish and so the curse of death reached out to him.

meaning_english: An appointment or presentation before someone.
sample_bolinao: Nangitanda' yan awro nin piaadap ra a adi'.
sample_english: The king set a day for their meeting.

meaning_english: The act of reconciling by talking face to face in good faith.
sample_bolinao: Piaadapenmosarayna pigaw maglat anay pigugura' ra.
sample_english: Let themtalkface to face so that their hatred for each other will be removed.

meaning_english: The act of having love for each other.
sample_bolinao: Mapaga akon wanin bana' ta rabay kon umget a pammemper moyo konan Dios mangibwat sa adanin tuloy a pikakalamo' moyo bana' sa piaaduan moyo sa saya tan saya.
sample_english: I am worried like that because I want your faith in God to be strong out of your very close relationship because of your love with one another.

meaning_english: The act of wearing of jewelry.
sample_bolinao: Say kabistawan moyo ket matkap a kai nin naipatukdo' sa kabistawan nin bakas; ambo' nin bana' sa pammabista nin sabot, o bana' sa piaalahas o bana' sa pisisket.
sample_english: Your beauty it must not be based on a beauty of appearance; not because of beautifying of the hair, or because of the putting on of jewelry or because of the putting on of clothing.

meaning_english: The act of taking something such as food from a common place as a group.
Friendship.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a piaamigo ra ni Juan tan si Dan ta makapitarusan saran maong sa gaw'en ra.
sample_english: Juan and Dan have a great friendship since for they are able to come to a good understanding of what they are to do.

meaning_english: The act of grinding something together sharpening each other.
Alliance, a union formed by agreement.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a piaayon ran lider nan Pilipinas tan Amerika.
sample_english: The alliance of the leaders of the the Philippines and America is good.

meaning_english: The coordination and appropriateness of style of clothing.
sample_bolinao: Maalilbi' yay sayay tawo yupa' sa piaaysing na.
sample_english: A person can be recognized by his style of dressing.

meaning_english: To put things next to each other.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mosara piabayen a manok ta mibulang sara.
sample_english: Don't put the chickens next to one anther for they will fight.

meaning_english: To face each other in a particular place.
sample_bolinao: Sa danin purta a piadapan ran misisna' nin dumalan.
sample_english: They met face to face close to the door they were going through.

meaning_english: To have two people or groups meet face to face and talk to each other.
sample_bolinao: Piadapenmosara pigaw makapituno sara.
sample_english: Have themmeetface to face so they can be reconciled.

meaning_english: A love affair between two or more people, especially between a man and a woman.
sample_bolinao: Kai ra rabay nin matua na ni Andres a piaduan ra ni Juana.
sample_english: Andre's parents do not approve of his love affair with Juana.

meaning_english: The process of trimming one's hair or shaving.
sample_bolinao: Marimpes a piahit nan barbas ni Juan ta matadem yan maong a bliyd nin inusar na.
sample_english: Juan's trimming of his beard is neat since the blade he used is very sharp.

meaning_english: To do something particular together as a group.
To fit together two objects so they coincide exactly in all their parts.
sample_bolinao: Pialepen mo a rwa nin pakasyat pinggat mag'in yan masibulot.
sample_english: Put the two raw sugar halves together so that it becomes a whole.

meaning_english: The relationship of accompanying something to support.
sample_bolinao: Mabistay pialuyon ra ni Dan tan si Juan sa dalan nin mako sa iskol.
sample_english: Dan an Juan's relationship on the road as they go to school is good.

meaning_english: To accompany each other.
To ally with someone against something.
sample_bolinao: Andi' moya piambunan a ari moyo ta kai ya makalaban.
sample_english: Don't ally against your younger sibling for he is not your opponent.

meaning_english: For a suit to be worn by someone.
sample_bolinao: Piamirikanawen kwa si Dave no kasal mi.
sample_english: I will have Dave wear a suit on our wedding.

meaning_english: Active friendship between people.
sample_bolinao: Say piamiga ra ni Lina tan Letecia, tinmarana' sin a'nak sara et.
sample_english: Lina and Leticia's friendship started when they were still young.

meaning_english: To put two persons or things alongside each other.
sample_bolinao: Piampadenmoyo saran umdeng a nubyo tan nubya.
sample_english: Putthe groom and the bride standing beside each other.

meaning_english: To intensely take part in something.
sample_bolinao: Niampitangan raya a kaaway na ni nanay na.
sample_english: They ganged up on the enemy of his mother.

meaning_english: The womb.
sample_bolinao: Ginlat yaynaypianakanna ni Bebing kanya' nin kai ya manganak.
sample_english: Bebing'swombwas removed so she cannot bear children.

meaning_english: To whisper together.
sample_bolinao: Marnge' na ni Juan a pianas ran kadani na sa tekrean sa dyip.
sample_english: Juan heard them whispering to each other close to him on the seat in the jeep.

meaning_english: The activity of whispering to each other about something specific.
sample_bolinao: Pianasan ran gulpin mikakadani nin tawo a rumate' nin mamin ayuda konra.
sample_english: The crowds of people were whispering to one another about the coming of the help being given them.

meaning_english: The act of settlement of a dispute or misunderstanding between people, reconciliation.
sample_bolinao: Nigan-gan na ni miyor a piariglo ran saray nidimandawan.
sample_english: The mayor ordered the amicable settlement of those that have a lawsuit against each other.

meaning_english: The manner of sitting on someone's lap.
sample_bolinao: Kusto a piaruko ran mitraina sin rinmuran sara sa dyip.
sample_english: The sitting of the daughter on the mother's lap when they rode on the jeep was right and good.

meaning_english: Friction between two objects.
sample_bolinao: Wanran matuntawo, say piaasa' ran abing nin ayi ra ket sinyalis nin mabayani sara li'.
sample_english: Old people say that a baby rubbing its feet together is a sign that they will be aggressive.

meaning_english: To rub objects against each other so as to put an edge on them.
sample_bolinao: Piasaen a rwa nin beneng pinggat tumadem.
sample_english: Rub the two bolos against each other so  as to sharpen them.

meaning_english: To make animals mate together.
sample_bolinao: Main nin mikakanayon nin piasawnen rasaray a'nak ra ta pigaw nin kai nin mairaruma a kayamanan ra.
sample_english: There are those who are relatives that make their children marry each other so that their wealth will not go to others.

meaning_english: The giving of attention to the concerns and care of something.
sample_bolinao: Piasikaso ran tawo koni Mayor sin rinmate' ya.
sample_english: The people looked after the concerns for the Mayor when he arrived.

meaning_english: To place close to one another such as floor tiles or blocks in rows or a pattern.
sample_bolinao: Piatipen na ni Juan a bulong nipa nin ika' na sa ba'lag na.
sample_english: Juan carefully stacks the palm leaves that he brings for his hut in an orderly manner.

meaning_english: To be quarreling with someone either in words or blows or with a weapon.
sample_bolinao: Say piaway ran mitraasawa ket marnge' sa baraybay.
sample_english: The couples quarreling was heard in the surrounding neighborhood.

meaning_english: To quarrel or fight about something.
sample_bolinao: Piawayan rayan a'nak a napurot ran kwarta.
sample_english: The children are quarreling over the money that they picked up.

meaning_english: To quarrel over something.
sample_bolinao: Say pammarate' ra nin irgo nin ambo' tutuo a namiaway komi.
sample_english: The communicating of untruths is what has caused quarreling among us.

meaning_english: A place where cattle are grazed or animals are taken care of.
sample_bolinao: Alawang a piayepan ran mayaman nin tutawo.
sample_english: The animal farms of the rich are expansive.

meaning_english: To join in an alliance.
sample_bolinao: Marnge' a piayon ran mibsat no main kaaway ra.
sample_english: It is heard that the siblings form an alliance if they have an enemy.

meaning_english: To ally and help each other against something else.
sample_bolinao: Piayunan ran kanit a raruman insikto nin mas alaki konra.
sample_english: The ants ally to gether against other insects that are much bigger than they are.

meaning_english: To act humbly.
sample_bolinao: Piayupa' a umbat nin mapalna'.
sample_english: A soft answer is humble.

meaning_english: To use a group of things one after another and rotate back through.
sample_bolinao: Mampibabal'enna a sapatos na ta abaw.
sample_english: She use her shoes one by one after the other because she has many.

meaning_english: To be laying on the surface of something else.
sample_bolinao: Madlaw a pibabo nan tapi' sa saya et nin tapi'.
sample_english: It is clear that one plank is laying on top of another.

meaning_english: Acting like an effeminate.
sample_bolinao: Inadak'akan ran mampamantay a pibakla-bakla' na ni Dolphy.
sample_english: The audience laughed boisterously at Dolphy's antics as a gay.

meaning_english: To take revenge for something done but in some other form.
sample_bolinao: Pibal'an ran mibsat a pangusar konan bisiklita ta sayan-saya na tamo'.
sample_english: The siblings alternate their use of the bicycle since there is only one.

meaning_english: To alternate the use of two or more things.
sample_bolinao: Rwa a tilipuno ko kanya' pibal'en kosaran usaren.
sample_english: There are two telephones that I have and so I rotate using them.

meaning_english: A pole carried over the shoulders used for carrying loads such as buckets of water at each end.
meaning_filipino: Pisi ng kawayan o kahoy nakung saan nililagay ang bagay na bubuhatin sa mga dulo nito tsaka bubuhatin.
sample_bolinao: Si pibalataynan na intaw nin bayengyeng ni tatay ket bayog ya.
sample_english: What my father used as a carrying pole for bamboo water containers was a kind of bamboo called bayog.

meaning_english: The process of fermenting or going through a change of its essence.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a pibaliw nin suka' nin tubo ta mabanglo.
sample_english: The fermenting process of the coconut vinegar is going well since it is fragrant.

meaning_english: For something to undergo a change in its essence, often a fermenting process .
A lunch box.
sample_bolinao: Kasaynan laman nan pibalunan ko ta nangan akoyna.
sample_english: There is nothing left in my lunch box since I ate it.

meaning_english: To make provision for something.
sample_bolinao: Sin nibaki' katamon mangyakay nin kai katamo nin pinibalon nin kwarta, bag tan apin nin ayi, nagkurang kamo para?
sample_english: When I sent you to teach without having you bring provision of money, bag and footwear, were you lacking?

meaning_english: To house something someplace.
To differentiate.
sample_bolinao: Pibarawesenmo pay dudu'ngan saPacific Farms?
sample_english: Can youreckonthe course to the shores of Pacific Farms?

meaning_english: To soak oneself someplace.
sample_bolinao: Sayan dram ranom a pibarbaran ran raruman a'nak no maryo' sara.
sample_english: Some children, when they take a bath they soak in a drum of water.

meaning_english: Removing one's facial hair using a tweezers, safety razor or a straight razor.
sample_bolinao: Si sayay barbon nin lalaki matkap nin inawru-awro a pibarbas na.
sample_english: A thick haired person needs to shave everyday.

meaning_english: To put on a dance for a special occasion.
sample_bolinao: No main binipisyo tan pista ket main pibayliwan ran magbayli.
sample_english: When there is benefit and fiesta  there is a dance floor for those that have dancing as a hobby.

meaning_english: To be made to dance together.
sample_bolinao: Pibayliwen saray nikasal no dalit-dalit no kasal ra.
sample_english: The couple that were married will be made to dance when the pinning ceremony is when they are married.

meaning_english: Rice container, normally closed.
sample_bolinao: Kasaynan laman nan pibbyasan kanya' kargawan ana.
sample_english: The rice container is empty and so fill it.

meaning_english: To tie two things together through a connection.
sample_bolinao: Piberberen na ni Juan a rubir nin amagey tan rubir nin nasaliw na sa babali.

meaning_english: That which is drunk.

sample_english: Close to the shore at neap tide the boat scrapes on the rocky area.

meaning_english: Being angry with each other.
sample_bolinao: Si wanin a tawo, masakit nayna a ki'batan tan kiaway maipa'ka' sa sari-sarita', a sayti ket pangibwatan nin piiimbelan, pisasageran, pisisidaan tan pagsususpitsan duka' konran raruma.
sample_english: A person like that, it has been his habit/practice to engage in arguing and quarreling about words, which these are a source of envying, being angry with each other, speaking destructive things against one another and being suspicious of evil in others.

meaning_english: Toscatter things around.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mopisakantaenin say papil.
sample_english: Don'tdisarrangethe papers.

meaning_english: To trip over something.

sample_english: They sometimes trip over the floor where it is swollen.

meaning_english: The place where egg-layers such as birds or fish lay eggs.

sample_english: The nest is the place chickens lay eggs.

meaning_english: The part or parts where two bones are joined to one another.
sample_bolinao: Masakit a pisalsuan nan ngalwa-ngalwan nan wanan nin gamet ko ta nayesyes ya.
sample_english: The joint of the wrist of my right hand hurts because it got twisted.

meaning_english: To get a sliver lodged in a specific part of the skin.

sample_english: When Mars grasped the broken floor board, it was his index finger that got a sliver.

meaning_english: To mix things together especially when cooking.
sample_bolinao: Andi' mo pisambungen a mapait tan maalsem ta duka' a taway.

meaning_english: To try to seize the best of something for oneself before someone else.

sample_english: The sellers are in a dispute for they are vying for the place of their stalls.

meaning_english: The point in the family tree where there are interrelations of people.

sample_english: They stopped at the intersection of the road.

meaning_english: To block each other from something.
To be in conflict with someone regarding something usually involving a parting of the ways.

sample_english: Envy is commonly a parting of the ways between siblings.

meaning_english: To argue divisively.

sample_english: The argument between the classmates near our room at school could be clearly heard.

meaning_english: To hypocritically pose as being holy.

sample_english: That acting in a holier than thou is bad.

meaning_english: The wearing of shoes.

sample_english: My younger brother is unconcerned bout whether he is wearing shoes or not.

meaning_english: Blackboard.

meaning_english: To ready to do something together.
sample_bolinao: Niparate' na komi a alaki nin apes moyon maka'kit kongko, tan say pagbababawi' moyo nin pinabereng rako tan say pisasadya' moyon mangisakit kongko.
sample_english: He related to us your great desire to see me, and your repentance of causing me to be sorrowful and your readiness to defend me.

meaning_english: To be still, without moving or making noise.
sample_bolinao: Mampisasaetnga'min a tawo ket sa tinek, marnge' a tunoy aspili nin manabo'.
sample_english: Everyone of the people are being sostillthat in the stillness the sound of a pin that is dropped can be heard.

meaning_english: The act of silencing something.

sample_english: Subdue the chaos of you younger sibling when the classes start at school.

meaning_english: The process or ingredient that brings pain.

meaning_english: To mix or cook together several ingredients in a meal or dish.

sample_english: To flavor sweet and sour fish, mix together salt and sugar in vinegar.

meaning_english: A fish gun which is used to shoot arrow like spears at fish.

meaning_english: A kind of seashell where the meat is good for food. Its shape is like a sphere that has been cut in half.

sample_english: The meat of shellfish is tasty, only that it is very small.

sample_english: Mars split the slats he picked up.

sample_english: Sliceup the squash.

meaning_english: The thrashing action of fish or birds when they are caught.

sample_english: The thrashing of the milkfish was strong since he was big.

meaning_english: The action of making an exchange with something.
To exchange clothing.

sample_english: I bring a change of clothes when we bathe in the ocean.

meaning_english: To be in harmony with one another.

sample_english: When it is town fiesta of Bolinao it is good that those from Anda and Bolinao do it together since it will be easy to agree together.

meaning_english: Vegetable, a part of a plant used for food and usually needs to be cooked.
sample_bolinao: Saya yan klasin pising a kalubasa.
sample_english: Orange Squash is a king of vegetable.

meaning_english: To cook vegetables or the main dishes for a meal.

sample_english: She just gets enough to fix for vegetables.

meaning_english: The action acting on self interest.
sample_bolinao: Ket no wanin, kai moyo li' anamaet nin rabayen a pananager ko no wadi' a main nin marate' ko nin piaaway, piimbelan, pisasageran, pisisibletan, pisisidaan, pitsitsismisan, pipapata'gayan, tan kasan uksoy.
sample_english: And so if that's the case, you as well will not like my rebuking if perchance I will find there is quarreling, jealousy, animosity, self interest, verbal subversion, gossiping, rivalry, and disharmony.

meaning_english: The action of destroying each other.

sample_english: Don't do something that is destructive to you all.

meaning_english: Harmonious relationship with someone.

sample_english: He will bring back good harmonious relationships between parents and children.

meaning_english: To dress in a certain manner.
sample_bolinao: Maongpisisket na ta tanda' nan ibagay a aysing na.
sample_english: She iswell dressedbecause she knows how to adjust her clothing to herself.

meaning_english: A meeting or a gathering by chance.

meaning_english: An agreed upon meeting place.

meaning_english: To move in different directions.

meaning_english: The departures from a common base.

sample_english: A division point between Muslim and Christians is their beliefs.

meaning_english: Twenty centavos.

sample_english: There is aplagueamong the chickens.

The opposing points of a conflict.

meaning_english: The act of separating oneself from something or to break up a relationship.

meaning_english: To separate from something.
sample_bolinao: Ket wanra, <<Niyaburoy na ni Moises nin isyay nayan sayay lalaki a asawa na mayadi' naya byan nin kasuratan nin pisyayan ra.>>
sample_english: And then they said, <<Moises permitted man to divorce his wife after he has given her a written document of their divorce.>>

meaning_english: To remain with something.

sample_english: The are looking now for a place for them to stay in Bolinao.

meaning_english: To work together to come to an agreement on something.

meaning_english: To make a deal or agree together on something.

meaning_english: To make a firm agreement regarding something.

meaning_english: One's character as it interacts with its surroundings.

meaning_english: To share with each other.

meaning_english: For something to be spreading out.

meaning_english: To be asking each other.

sample_english: They were asking each other, <<Who is that?>>

meaning_english: To ask one another about something in particular.
sample_bolinao: Kai ma'pos nin isipen nin barang saya a mampangyadi' ket kai nin mabulsu-bulsot a pittepetan ran wanra, <<Ani kadi' a pipa'kaan nin sayti?>>
sample_english: Each could hardly believe what was happening that there was no stoppage to their asking one another saying, <<What do these mean?>>

meaning_english: The slap of a carpenter's snap line.

sample_english: The beat of the heart is the forcing of blood to all parts of the body.

meaning_english: Flick a finger from the thumb against a body, marbles, etc.

meaning_english: A petticoat which is worn under a dress.

To be in a dilemma. To be suffering the consequences of grave decisions.

meaning_english: Seven.

sample_english: I am the one who is holding the seven stars in my right hand.

meaning_english: To force the movement of someone that is in a tight place.

meaning_english: To date something like a letter.

meaning_english: A vegetable with wide green leaves used for making salads or garnishing pancit.
sample_bolinao: Mabli a pitsay no tyimpon rapeg.

meaning_english: Limited in time or space.

meaning_english: A dessert made from cassava covered with grated coconut.

meaning_english: To be gossiping about something with someone.

meaning_english: Breast of fowl.

meaning_english: To waiting expectantly for something.

meaning_english: Seven parts to seven parts.

meaning_english: To imagine with fervent desire.

meaning_english: Sexual activities.
To be twisted out of alignment or warped out of shape such as the rim of a plastic bottle from heat or a winnowing basket rim made of soft material.
