sample_bolinao: Pu'letanmain si ubot pigaw kai raka masir'ip tawo.
sample_english: Put aplugin the hole so that the people cannot peep through it.

meaning_english: To go down the wrong throat, the event of a foreign object such as water or powdery food going into the lungs.
sample_bolinao: Si pu'rok na ket bana' ta nakaka'lis ya nin mampinom.
sample_english: His gagging was because he was made to laugh while he was drinking.

meaning_english: The downtown district of a provincial town as distinguished from its barrios.
sample_bolinao: Mampiikap kami sapublasyon.
sample_english: We are living in thetown proper.

meaning_english: The act of printing materials such as newspapers, books, magazines.
sample_bolinao: Kasan masaliw nin matiryalis para sa publikasyon nin libro sa Bolinao.
sample_english: None of the materials for publishing the book in Bolinao have been bought.

meaning_english: The public, the people in general.
sample_bolinao: Saraypubliko,sabtan anos ran rumnge' sa diskurso ni miyor.
sample_english: Thepublicis very patient to listen to the speech of the mayor.

meaning_english: Poor people, the less fortunate.
sample_bolinao: Saray pubri, no mi'sa kai sara makapangan sa udas.
sample_english: The poor sometimes are not able to eat at eating times.

meaning_english: An area of responsibility or care.
sample_bolinao: Ibati' koya kadi' a aso kodti sapudirmo?
sample_english: Can I leave my dogunderyourcare?

meaning_english: The act of  spraying or spewing water out of the mouth.
sample_bolinao: Say pudrak na no mangumukumo ya ket maksaw.
sample_english: The gush out of his mouth when he is gargling is strong.

meaning_english: To spew liquid from the mouth onto something.
sample_bolinao: Pudrakan na ni Sam a luta' no mangumukumo ya.
sample_english: Sam spews it onto the ground when he gargles.

meaning_english: Spool, small cylinder of wood on which thread is wound.
sample_bolinao: Iyator main sapudunanta pangerkeran yan suy'ot.
sample_english: Keep thatspoolit will used to wind thread.

meaning_english: A scolding of someone for a perceived wrong.
sample_bolinao: Say puet na ni nanay ko kongko ket masakit.
sample_english: My mother's scolding of me was hurtful.

meaning_english: The action of suddenly being awakened by something.
sample_bolinao: Bana' sa pugad ra kongko sin mangka'lek ako sinmakit yay ulo ko.
sample_english: Because of their jarring me awake when I was sleeping I got a headache.

meaning_english: To be suddenly aroused from sleep.
sample_bolinao: Pinugadnakon tunoy nin palsot.
sample_english: I was awakened by the sound of the gun.

meaning_english: Nest of birds or animals.
sample_bolinao: Alaki yay pugar nan manok.
sample_english: The nest of the chicken is big.

meaning_english: To be staked to a solid object.
sample_bolinao: Puged saray baka ko pigaw kai sara makasida' nin mula.
sample_english: Our cows are staked out so that they are not able to ruin our plants.

meaning_english: Bulge, funnel shaped, cone shaped.
sample_bolinao: Main anan pugkok nan lata nin sardinas kanya' nitampal miyayna.
sample_english: The sardine can has a bulge and so we threw it out.

meaning_english: A cement or steel oven commonly used for baking bread.
sample_bolinao: Iluto' ray tinapay sa pugon.
sample_english: They bake bread in an oven.

meaning_english: For the mouth of a sack to be tied shut.
sample_bolinao: Mairot a pugong ni Juan sa sako' nin byas.
sample_english: Juan's tying of the mouth of a sack of rice closed is tight.

meaning_english: A large spirit being with long hair that lives in trees, they smell and people tolerate them.
sample_bolinao: Si bali nin kasan tawo ket main pugot na.
sample_english: The unoccupied house has a ghost.

meaning_english: Bank a fire, the action of covering burning charcoal with ashes so that it keeps on burning.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw et a apoy nan baya ta pugpog yan pugpog si Juan.
sample_english: The fire in the embers is still very hot since Juan covered it well with ashes.

meaning_english: To dig up the surface around a plant to aerate the soil and perhaps mix in fertilizer.
sample_bolinao: Pugpuganmay kayo nin main deta pigaw kai ya ma'rep.
sample_english: Coverthe burningwoodwith ashes so that it will not go out.

meaning_english: A sprayer for applying a spray to something.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pugsit nan lumwa' sa bebey nan kurita'.
sample_english: The spray that comes out of the mouth of an octopus is strong.

meaning_english: To spray something.
sample_bolinao: Si Sam ket manigudo yan gulpi a matao nan bungan mangga ta namugsit yan mangga.
sample_english: Sam is certain that his share of the mango crop will be prolific since he sprayed the tree.

meaning_english: A forceful outflow of liquid or solid from an opening.
sample_bolinao: Si ulay nin alaki, maksaw a pugso na.
sample_english: The large snake's spiting is strong.

meaning_english: To spit liquid or solid at something.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ma kadanyan a kubra ta bangli'pugswannaka.
sample_english: Don't get near the cobra for it mightspit poisonat you.

meaning_english: An unsubstantiated statement, a guess.
sample_bolinao: Abas a pugta' mo, sakalako a nanalo sa baskitbol.
sample_english: Your guess was wrong, someone else won the basketball game.

meaning_english: The act of igniting something flammable, usually a pile, on fire with another flame.
sample_bolinao: Napuuran sarban aday bana' sa pugto nan saya palito nin main duta.
sample_english: All of the rice straw was burned up because of a burning match igniting it.

meaning_english: To ignite something with another source of fire.
sample_bolinao: Pugtwan koy nadinep nin ragaw tan bulong kawayan pigaw maringgas.
sample_english: I ignited the pile of thorns and bamboo leaves in order to clean things up.

meaning_english: To tie together the mouth of the sack with rope or string.
sample_bolinao: Pugungenmay langgutsi pigaw kai ma'met a byas.
sample_english: Tie togetherthe mouth of the sack so that the rice grains will not be spilled.

meaning_english: A bid for something.
sample_bolinao: Say puhar mi, alaki kanya' si'kami a mamayli.
sample_english: Our bid was large and so we were the ones to dance.

meaning_english: To submit a bid for something as a whole - lot, set, wholesale.
sample_bolinao: Pinuharannayan sayay inhinyiro a alakin taytay a para kuntratas trabaho.
sample_english: A certain engineerbidfor the contract for the construction of a big bridge.

meaning_english: Udder, The portion that holds the mother's milk in the breast of human being or animal.
sample_bolinao: Saray takong, anro a pukal ra.
sample_english: Sows have a long udder.

meaning_english: The act of chopping something off.
sample_bolinao: Anted a pukan ra nin putek.
sample_english: They chopped off the bamboo trunk short.

meaning_english: Chop down an object at its base or place where it is bound to, usually with an ax or bolo.
sample_bolinao: Pukanena sanga a kai gumunga.
sample_english: Cutoff the branches that do not bear fruit.

meaning_english: The act or method for bringing about alertness in someone.
sample_bolinao: Pasesegen saray tutawo nin pukaw nin idap nin byay.
sample_english: The people were motivated by the wake-up call of the difficulties of life.

meaning_english: To reduce something stiff to a liquid or flowable state, such as lard, so it actively spreads.
sample_bolinao: Mamukaw yay nanay ni Sam sindo ala sais nin buklas.
sample_english: Sam's mother gets him up each morning at six o'clock.

meaning_english: The action of scratching in the dirt.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a pukay ran manok ba'yo sara maka'kit nin kanen ra.
sample_english: A chicken does a lot of scratching before they find their food.

meaning_english: To scratch out the ground  with the fingers, stick or feet looking for something, especially food.
sample_bolinao: Si manok,mamukayyan luta' sa puon tanaman.
sample_english: The chickenis the one that scratches the ground at the base of the plants.

meaning_english: A group of plants, bushes, or trees that are growing in an open area. They are used for shade for workers in the field.
sample_bolinao: Nidudupong saray tutawo sapukdongnin kayo.
sample_english: The men are gathered together under the shade ofgroveof trees.

meaning_english: Groin or pubic area where the legs come together.
sample_bolinao: Madlaw yaypuklona ta maimpis yay aysing na.
sample_english: Her pubic region is distinct because her dress is very thin.

meaning_english: An area enclosed by a fence or rocks or some border.
sample_bolinao: Nakaliwa' saray kanding sa pukok mi kanya' idap mi nin manakep.
sample_english: Our goats were able to get out of the pen so it was difficult for us to round them up.

meaning_english: Short pants that extend down to the knee.
sample_bolinao: Pukolyay sayay gamet na ta nagket yan dinamita.
sample_english: One of his hands is maimed since he was struck by dynamite.

meaning_english: Restraints placed on physical things.
sample_bolinao: Abir pa'noy pukpok ko komo no talagan rabay moy mibwat, isuet mo.
sample_english: Whatever restraints I have on you, if you truly want to leave, you will force your way.

meaning_english: To restrain or limit something with force or boundaries.
sample_bolinao: Pukpukanmay anak pigaw kai ya manabo'.
sample_english: Restrainthe child so he can't fall.

meaning_english: Green algae, a seaweed growing on rocky and sandy places in Ilocos Norte and La Union provinces, eaten raw as salad, after washing and mixed with chopped tomatoes.
sample_bolinao: Abaw apukpuklosa rigrig baybay nan Bolinao sa bandan panrupan.
sample_english: We find seaweed calledpukpukloalong the shores in the Western part of Bolinao.

meaning_english: Paddock, an enclosed area where animals stay and eat or pasture.
sample_bolinao: Sipukridora, nalibed yan adubi nin bato.
sample_english: Theircorralis surrounded with brick stones.

meaning_english: The act of cutting the hair.
sample_bolinao: Bagay nay pukris nan sabot na.
sample_english: The cut of his hair is fitting/suitable.

meaning_english: To trim the hair, grass or a bush to shape and beautify it.
sample_bolinao: Maong yan mamukris siAndy.
sample_english: Andy is good at cutting hair.

meaning_english: To confine or restrict something to an area.
sample_bolinao: Pukukan rayan ranom a tanggal mi'sa raya nin pamulusan nin kuna' nin alilaen ra.
sample_english: They fence off the water in the fish pond and then they release the fish that they are caring for into it.

meaning_english: To enclose or fence in an area.
sample_bolinao: Pukuken mosaray siwsiw.
sample_english: Cage the chicks.

meaning_english: The glare of something that can temporarily blind someone from seeing something.
sample_bolinao: Say pulag nan awro, masakit sa mata.
sample_english: The glare of the sun hurts the eyes.

meaning_english: An erasure or removal of writing or drawing from a surface.
sample_bolinao: Say pulak na, intiro kai ma'kit.
sample_english: His erasure was complete; it could not be seen.

meaning_english: To erase something.
sample_bolinao: Pulakenmoy surat sa pisara.
sample_english: Erasethe writing on the blackboard.

meaning_english: The exchange of money or something of equal value as a payment for something else that was obtained on a private basis, not a retail sale.
sample_bolinao: Say pulang mo kongko, kai mo et nasilyan.
sample_english: You have not yet given your payment for what you got from me.

meaning_english: To restock something.
sample_bolinao: Pulanganmo pay ubot a kasan timmubo' nin pari.
sample_english: Replantthe holes where no rice has sprouted.

meaning_english: A sudden movement in an attempt to escape.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw a pulansit nan igat sin gina'getan kwa.
sample_english: The eel's sudden attempt to escape was strong when I grabbed it.

meaning_english: The dike of a rice paddy.
sample_bolinao: Sa pulapil, ako dumalan no iti ako sa gagawa'.
sample_english: It's the dike that I pass on to get here to the field.

meaning_english: To build or repair a dike to hold water.
meaning_filipino: Gumawà ng dikke; gumawà ng hapila; gumawa ng sapled.
sample_bolinao: Mamulapilya si tatay ko ta nabwang a pulapil gagawa' mi.
sample_english: My father willrepairthedikesof our field because they have eroded.

meaning_english: To smear something on something.
sample_bolinao: Pinulapudan nan tupa' a mata ko; mi'sa ako nako nin nagra'mos; ket sawanin, maka'kit akoyna.
sample_english: He smeared mud on my eyes; then I went and washed my face; and then now, I am able to now see.

meaning_english: Powder box, powder container.
sample_bolinao: Matkap a sipulbiramain ispungha na.
sample_english: Apowder boxmust have a powder sponge.

meaning_english: Facial or body powder.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a klasi ninpulbos.
sample_english: There are many kinds of facialpowder.

meaning_english: Compressed grainy treats made of starch grit (of rice or other cereals) with sugar, milk or butter.
sample_bolinao: Abaw saray ua'nak a marabay manaliw ninpulburonta mataway.
sample_english: Many children that like tobuypulburonbecause it tastes good.

meaning_english: To apply powder to something usually the face and body.
sample_bolinao: Pulbusan ran matua a abing ra pinggat mabista a kaingaran na no ma'lek.
sample_english: The parents powder their baby so that he will feel good when asleep.

meaning_english: For something to be done in an expert way.
sample_bolinao: Pulido a nikagwa' nan baluto mi kanya' ma'get ya.
sample_english: It was fine workmanship that was done on our boat and so it is sturdy.

meaning_english: Polished, neat, finely made, smooth.
sample_bolinao: Pulidon-pulidoa nipangwa' na konan lamisawan.
sample_english: The table isfinelymade.

meaning_english: A foreign body that is in the eye such as a speck of dirt, sand, etc.
sample_bolinao: Kai nin maglat apulingko.
sample_english: Theforeignbody in my eye cannot be removed.

meaning_english: A naturally small sized coconut.
sample_bolinao: Pulipugenya in, kai yayna umalaki.
sample_english: That is naturally asmallcoconut, it will not become any bigger.

meaning_english: A policeman.
sample_bolinao: Si Juan a mangngiksamin nin nadisgrasya sa dalan ta pulis ya.
sample_english: Juan is the investigator of an accident on the road since he is a policeman.

meaning_english: Members of the the police force.
sample_bolinao: Matkap saraypulisyaa mamatinek babali.
sample_english: Policeman are necessary to maintain peace & order in the community.

meaning_english: Politics, the activities of debating and taking advantage of situations in an organized manner especially in relation to governance.
sample_bolinao: Matkap adalen mon maong a layi mi'sa ka sumrep sa pulitika.
sample_english: You need to study the law well before entering politics.

meaning_english: A politician.
sample_bolinao: Main kanayon kon pulitiko.
sample_english: I have a relative that's a politician.

meaning_english: The sap from a palm or sugar cane that has been cooked down to a condensed sweet and sticky syrup.
sample_bolinao: Madaliketa pulitipot.
sample_english: Caramel issticky.

meaning_english: Handle.
sample_bolinao: Si pulon nan beneng ko, maidap yan ga'getan ta marames yayna.
sample_english: The handle of my bolo is hard to hang on to since it is flimsy.

meaning_english: To be without exception, absolutely or totally.
sample_bolinao: Pulosnga'min maata' a mangga.
sample_english: Absolutely every one of the mangoes is unripe.

meaning_english: Pulpit, the place where the priest or minister preaches their sermon in front of the congregation.
sample_bolinao: Mako ko sa pulpito no mami akon minsahi sa busat ko.
sample_english: I go to the pulpit if I am giving a message to my church brothers.

meaning_english: Pulse or throb of the heartbeat.
sample_bolinao: Maksaw apulsona.
sample_english: Hispulseis strong.

meaning_english: To take someone's pulse.
sample_bolinao: Pulswan ma pa no mabyay ya et.
sample_english: Take his pulse to see if he's still alive.

meaning_english: Native styled short sleeve shirt, informal.
sample_bolinao: Si pulu-barong mo, anted ya kanya' silyan man raruma.
sample_english: Your beautiful short sleeved shirt is too short so change it with another.

meaning_english: The act of rolling on the ground.
sample_bolinao: Puluk-pulok saray aso sa ta'pok no miikap sara.
sample_english: The dogs roll in the dust when they are playing.

meaning_english: Short sleeve sport shirt.
sample_bolinao: Saray mampag'adal iti sa hayskol pulusirt a iyusar ra.
sample_english: Those that go to high school use a polo shirt.

meaning_english: Food eaten while drinking hard beverages. Traditionally, raw meat or fish soaked in vinegar and other spices.
sample_bolinao: Kinilaw nin kanding a pulutan nin lako' sa pakanan na ni Enciong.
sample_english: Goat meat cut into small pieces soaked in vinegar, tempered with salt, onion, pepper and other condiments is sold at Enciong's eatery.

meaning_english: To make a crackling sound such as in splitting open a bamboo.
sample_bolinao: Pumarakpak a tsinilas no miikap saray a'nak nin piaway.
sample_english: When the children are fighting the slippers snap.

meaning_english: The same numbers such as 4-4 or 5-5-5.
sample_bolinao: Pumpyangyay numiro mo.
sample_english: Your number is thesame.

meaning_english: To make a quick or sudden movement to escape from a grip.
To fill something out or make up for something.
sample_bolinao: Pun'ankoy kasalanan nin nagwa' na komo ni Edwin.
sample_english: I will make restitution for the wrong Edwin did you.

meaning_english: To fill up something.
sample_bolinao: Pun'en moyo nin ranom in say pasig.
sample_english: Fill up those jars with water.

meaning_english: A cloth used for wiping, cleaning and drying such as a dish cloth, rag or duster.
sample_bolinao: Si punas ko, alaki ya kanya' maringgasan sarban dalanan na.
sample_english: My cleaning cloth is large and so it is able to clean all that it passes over.

meaning_english: To dust or to wipe a surface with a rag perhaps to dry it.
sample_bolinao: Punasanmay lamisawan ta nalbet ya.
sample_english: Wipethe table off since it is wet.

meaning_english: To wipe up something usually with a dry cloth to dry something.
sample_bolinao: Mamunas kan saynget mo.
sample_english: Wipe your sweat off.

meaning_english: A pillowcase.
sample_bolinao: Silyan kwa a punda nan alunan ko ba'yo ako ma'lek.
sample_english: I will change the case on the pillow before I go to sleep.

meaning_english: Founder, first to organized.
sample_bolinao: Sipundadornin SIL sa Bolinao tan Anda si Mr. & Mrs. Gary Persons.
sample_english: Thefounderof SIL in Bolinao & Anda are Mr. & Mrs. Gary Persons.

meaning_english: The act of acquiring something.
sample_bolinao: Si pundar ko sa luta', magwa' yan ipama'deng bali.
sample_english: My acquisition of land makes it possible to put up a house.

meaning_english: Foundation, base, establishment.
sample_bolinao: Si pundasyon nan bali mi ket ma'get ya ta naabot a bato nin alaki a pamatukduan na.
sample_english: The foundation of our house is firm since its base is on a large stone.

meaning_english: To put on a pillow case.
sample_bolinao: Pundawana alunan ta pigaw kai masamaan.
sample_english: Encase a pillow so that it does not get stained.

meaning_english: A down payment or money set aside for a particular purpose.
sample_bolinao: Naglat yay pundo mi kanya' ako naanor sa taaw.
sample_english: Our anchor came loose and so I drifted into the sea.

meaning_english: To finance or provide funding for something.
sample_bolinao: Pundwan yaynay mutor ta ibursok yayna li'.
sample_english: The motorboat now has the anchor on it since it will be rolled into the water later.

meaning_english: For an electric bulb to be burnt out.
sample_bolinao: Pundyi yaynay bumbilya kanya' raya sinilyan.
sample_english: The bulb was burnt out and so they changed it.

meaning_english: Blunted point.
sample_bolinao: Pung'olyay beneng na. Kai ya makataga' a parpar na.
sample_english: His bolo is blunt. Its tip can not cut.

meaning_english: A single trunk plant that grows in damp places and has a very large flower that smells putrid and the root is used to feed pigs.
sample_bolinao: Say lamanpungapongpara kanen baboy.
sample_english: The rootcropis used to feed pigs.

meaning_english: A twinkling of the eyes.
sample_bolinao: Si pungay nan mata mo, makaayat yan babayi.
sample_english: The twinkle in your eyes draws women.

meaning_english: That which is used as a covering or wrapping.
sample_bolinao: Main awit ko nin saya punggos nin bayawas.
sample_english: I carried a bag of guavas.

meaning_english: To wrap, generally food, in something for protection, with or without securing the ends.
sample_bolinao: Punggusen maynay awit mo pinggat awiten ma tana li'.
sample_english: Wrap-up what you're taking so that you can just carry it later.

meaning_english: A bound unit of a cluster of things such as a wrist sized bundle of rice stalks.
sample_bolinao: Sayay pungo nin pari a a'nem ray ping'ey na.
sample_english: A sheaf of rice is made up of six bundles.

meaning_english: A tied bundle of something to hold it together or to be sold or used as a group.
sample_bolinao: Saya pungon nin amagey a sinaliw nin laking Juan.
sample_english: What grandfather Juan sold was on bundle of Century plant.

meaning_english: Cut off at the top or tip, lopped off such as the tip of the ears or a cock's comb.
sample_bolinao: Si palong nan manok napungosya.
sample_english: The rooster's comb iscut off.

meaning_english: For something to be burned down or worn away to a stub or partial consumed such as a rotting tooth.
sample_bolinao: Si kandila',pungpongyayna.
sample_english: The candle is a stub.

meaning_english: Mounds of dirt such as ant hills or termite mounds about one to four-foot high that are thought to be indwelt by spirits.
sample_bolinao: Wanran matuntawo a iti kano sapungsomain kaybaan.
sample_english: Our old people say that in a termitehillthere are dwarfs.

meaning_english: Ankle or wrist, the connection between the hand and the arm and the connection between the leg and the foot.
meaning_filipino: Pinagdugtungan ng kamay at pinagdugtungan ng binti at paa.
sample_bolinao: Nagblo' yay pungwa-pungwan ayi na.
sample_english: Hisanklewas fractured.

meaning_english: To bind the hands, ankles or things together so that they do not separate.
sample_bolinao: Pinungoray gamet na.
sample_english: Theytiedhis hands.

meaning_english: Funeral dirge, funeral music.
sample_bolinao: Main marnge' kon tugtogpunibri.
sample_english: I hear afuneral dirge.

meaning_english: Funeral parlor.
sample_bolinao: Itaw yay nati sapunirarya.
sample_english: The dead is in thefuneral parlor.

meaning_english: The closing or plugging up of an opening.
sample_bolinao: Si buyangin, maglat yay punit na no tyimpon rapeg.
sample_english: The blockage of the porosity of the sand is removed when it is rainy season.

meaning_english: Fist fighting.
sample_bolinao: Duka' manurong nin puniti.
sample_english: It's bad to challenge someone to a fist fight.

meaning_english: To punch someone with the fists.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka kumadani tapunityennaka.
sample_english: Don't go near him for he'll punchyou.

meaning_english: A function or feast given as a celebration for some event such as a wedding.
sample_bolinao: Main keen tan punsya ta sinagyat ratamo.
sample_english: There is function that we will go to since they invited us.

meaning_english: To have a reception or feast for something.
sample_bolinao: Rabay-rabay ray tumekre' sa tekrean para konran impurtantin tutawo sa sinaguga tan sa punsyawan.
sample_english: They covet sitting in the seats that are for the important people at the synagogue and the receptions.

meaning_english: The orientation or direction of heading.
sample_bolinao: Abas anay punta nan baluto ta nipalak yayna.
sample_english: The heading of the boat is wrong since it was twisted around by the current.

meaning_english: Lace or the work of making lace, the finely made decorations for dresses.
sample_bolinao: Mabista a puntas nan sitaw si babayi.
sample_english: The lacework of that woman is good.

meaning_english: To decorate something with lace.
sample_bolinao: Pinuntasanyay aysing nan pakasal.
sample_english: The dress of the bride isdecoratedwith lacework.

meaning_english: Move to where the attention is directed.
sample_bolinao: Si'koy man puntawan ra no kasa ya si Pedro ta mali'mo ko konra.
sample_english: I am going where they are going when Pedro is not here since I am afraid of them.

meaning_english: Bound for an objective.
sample_bolinao: Si puntawen ko ket itaw sa baytan konra ni baying Saling.
sample_english: Where I am heading is there to Grandmother Saling east of here.

meaning_english: A twin-masted ocean schooner.
sample_bolinao: Kusto a punting ko sa ulo nan manok kanya' main karniwen.
sample_english: My aim on the head of the chicken was right and so I have something for a meat dish.

meaning_english: To aim and hit something.
sample_bolinao: Puntingen na ni Mars a ulo nan pabo no tiraduren naya.
sample_english: Mars aims hitting the head of the turkey when he shoots his slingshot at it.

meaning_english: The target of something such as words, life, or a gun.
sample_bolinao: Si ata'gay pirmi apuntiryapigaw maga'muran a rabay sa byay.
sample_english: Alwaysaimhigh to fulfill your dreams in life.

meaning_english: To take careful aim at doing something.

meaning_english: Money for bail.

meaning_english: To give bail to temporarily release a person from prison until the trial.

sample_english: If I am in prison he will bail me out.

meaning_english: Cucumber tree, the fruit of a tree which looks like pickles, is sour and is often used in cooking fish or meat.

meaning_english: To trust and rely on someone with something.

sample_english: I have confidence in you and so you are here with me.

meaning_english: A clump of eggs, usually fish, that are held together by a mucous like substance.

meaning_english: For fish to be pregnant and ready to lay their eggs.
sample_bolinao: Main nin tyimpo nin pyayan saray barangen.
sample_english: There is a season that the milkfish are pregnant with their eggs.

meaning_english: To roast something such as a whole pig on a rotisserie by turning.

sample_english: That pig will be roasted three months from now when it is my birthday.

meaning_english: The fibrous core of the midrib of theburiplant after it has been pounded. It's used for making rope.

meaning_english: A foot measure, 12 inches.

meaning_english: Bolt of cloth.

meaning_english: The small round playing piece that is moved in Filipino checkers or the piece used in Filipino pool to knock others into the hole to score.

sample_english: The unskilled laborer is thehelperfor the carpenter.

meaning_english: Fuse or fuse box, an electrical safety device that cuts the current during an overload.

meaning_english: Pyorrhea, Disease of the gums, Riggs' disease, a chronic form of periodontists.

sample_english: Pyorrheais a disease of the gums of the teeth.

meaning_english: They, them or their, grammatically possessive or non-focused base form.

sample_english: Where is it they are going?

meaning_english: The act of washing the face.

meaning_english: The act of roasting by placing the food directly on the embers.
To roast something such as fish or cassava, not meat, directly in the coals of a fire.

sample_english: I sometimes roast rabbitfish.

meaning_english: The act of lapping up by a cat or dog of a liquid.

sample_english: He has a bigjowl.

meaning_english: To lap up something with the tongue.
meaning_filipino: Gawa' ran ayep nin miduman ran dildilan a ranom no minom sara bilang wadi' aso, pusa tan raruma et.

sample_english: The dogs will lap up water in the bucket if you don't cover it.

meaning_english: The activity of rustling animals.
sample_bolinao: Say rabak ra sa baka ket abaw no mangarni sara.
sample_english: The rustling of cattle is widespread when they butcher them.

meaning_english: Cattle and carabao rustling and subsequent butchering in an out of the way place.

sample_english: They did cattle rustling on our land.

meaning_english: Soursop, a tropical fruit and tree with a yellow green fruit covered with soft spikes. The flesh is white in color with black seeds.

sample_english: Custard apple taste sweet and a bit sour.

meaning_english: Wanting or liking something.

sample_english: Helikesto keep on eating unripe mangoes.

meaning_english: To be comfortable or pleased.

meaning_english: To want or long for something.

meaning_english: The disease of rabies which is passed on through the saliva of a bite.

meaning_english: Yank, a forceful pull of a rooted object such as a plant or hair.

sample_english: It is only a forceful pull that will be able to get this plant out.

meaning_english: To grab and forcefully yank something from someplace (weeds, bag by a thief).

sample_english: Don't yank out what I have planted.

meaning_english: Bamboo shoots.

meaning_english: A generic word for grass, specifically cogon grass.

meaning_english: For a liquid to be dilute or lacking in the expected fullness of ingredients.

sample_english: Snatch that jewelry she has on and then run.

sample_english: The second hand blanket had a large rip in it and so I didn't buy it.

meaning_english: To tear something forcefully and roughly such as skin, clothing or roofing, generally done in anger but could be done such as by snagging clothing.

sample_english: If Ekang is angry, he rips open his clothing.

meaning_english: Radish, a small crisp root used as a relish.

meaning_english: A radio.

sample_english: Will you tune in the radio to some music?

meaning_english: To be depraved.

sample_english: He's depraved and so that's why he did that.

meaning_english: The branches and leaves of overgrown plants or a thicket that are untrimmed or not pruned and become entangled with one another.

sample_english: The short route/way to our house is impassible due to the thickness of the tangled branches of bamboo that block it.

meaning_english: The material that binds a barrier or item together as one.

To detach something off from something.

meaning_english: To be aligned, touching side by side.

meaning_english: Them and you sg.

meaning_english: The jaggedness of something.

meaning_english: Them (non-focused) and you plural (Focused). Also used as an honorific.

sample_english: Run, they are coming after you all.

meaning_english: To be loosely packed, not pressed together.

meaning_english: Rocket, sky rockets, fireworks.

meaning_english: The heat that is felt being given off by something other than the sun.

meaning_english: Implicated, to be indirectly involved in something, usually bad.

meaning_english: Water, a clear, colorless, odorless, and tasteless liquid that is needed for life.

meaning_english: A ranch, a wide track of land used to raised cattle.

meaning_english: The tendency of something (fruit, fontanel of babies, blister, flooring that moves up and down, etc) to become very soft so that even the finger prints are left on it.

sample_english: The papaya is over ripe and verysoftto hold.

meaning_english: To be watered down.

meaning_english: A strip of a kind of bamboo calledbayogthat is used for tying rice stalks, nipa thatch, etc.

meaning_english: A line on the palm of the hand that indicates that a person is courageous.

meaning_english: A.wishing or anticipating for something to happen, generally bad or unfortunate.

meaning_english: Rain.

sample_english: It israiningnow.

meaning_english: A raffle.

meaning_english: A slap, usually to one's bottom.

meaning_english: To spank or slap something with the hand or fingers.

sample_english: Rose slaps the arm of her child if there is a mosquito biting her.

meaning_english: The young branch that has just come out, sucker.
An area dominated by grass, probably Cogon grass.

meaning_english: An area of thorns or branches often as a protection for something.

meaning_english: A mass or body of water.

meaning_english: A kind of small spider.

sample_english: There arepilesofdead leavesunder the tree.

meaning_english: To sleep together side by side, sexual relations may be implied.

meaning_english: To be praiseworthy.
Kerplop, the sound that is heard when a heavy object is dropped into  deep water.

sample_english: Kerplop was the sound that was heard.

meaning_english: The act of degrading or pushing them down on the social ladder.

sample_english: Curdis delicious when sugar is added.

meaning_english: Within, to be deep inside and surrounded by something.

meaning_english: To be driven from within to do something.

meaning_english: The act of clearing of an area, especially land, of undesirable things.

sample_english: He cleaned and cleaned around his house.

meaning_english: Other or some, a group or item separate from another or a separate portion of the same group or item.

meaning_english: To clear an area of undesirable objects.

meaning_english: For something to appear seemingly without any particular source.

meaning_english: To be coarse or rough in texture.
Them & them.

meaning_english: Scratches caused by something moved over the surface.

meaning_english: To become watery or melt.

meaning_english: To rain.

meaning_english: To give a reason or an excuse for something.

meaning_english: To arrive.

meaning_english: To make the sound of wind blowing such as of leaves being rustling by the wind.

meaning_english: To become cold or chilly.

meaning_english: To develop in form, as of the fetus inside the womb.

sample_english: Theangelsaid to Mary, «A child will be formed in your womb.»

meaning_english: Course of action or travel.

meaning_english: To become shrunken.
To show signs in the face of feeling sad or grieving.

sample_english: But when he heard that which Jesus said, he became gloomy, and he went away very sorrowful.

meaning_english: To protrude or blister such as a fruit bud to just be protruding from the flower.

meaning_english: Cruel treatment.

meaning_english: To move to the sides or edge.

meaning_english: To become cloudy or for something to become uneven in its function.

meaning_english: To become happy.

meaning_english: A potted plant with long leaves. Use as a medicinal plant.

meaning_english: To burst and make a popping or cracking sound.

Ride a vehicle, get in.

meaning_english: To solve or identify the answer to a riddle or a puzzle.

meaning_english: To soap something up.

meaning_english: To be full of hairs.
The area where hair is found.
The act of evenly spreading something by hand over an area.

sample_english: Juan spread the fertilizer over the whole field.

meaning_english: To scatter small particles over a wide area such as broadcast seeding or sprinkling.

sample_english: Shut the door.

meaning_english: Anger.

meaning_english: To brag about one's expertise.

meaning_english: Root crop like cassava which is long and its skin color is grayish-white with seed hairs and is in layers that can be peeled off. It can be eaten raw and tastes a bit like uncooked corn and is made into balls inhalu-halo. The leaves are long and narrow and it has small white flowers.
sample_bolinao: Si sago, iluto' ya no kasaynan ma'kan.

meaning_english: Different or various kinds of something, normally referring to things.

sample_english: I think that wood that burns the brightest is expensive.

meaning_english: Worst, bad or evil in the highest degree.

meaning_english: The most wise.

sample_english: He is anenlightenedone, because he has riches.

meaning_english: The highest honor of all.

sample_english: And then following, he went and sat down in the place of highest honor at the right side of God.

meaning_english: The strongest of all.

sample_english: The one that was strongest of all of the former Israelites was Samson.

meaning_english: Most difficult, the hardest, something hard to bear.

meaning_english: Something that is the most unique and different from all else.

sample_english: And then, the Most Holy Place, it was filled with smoke displaying the power and most unique/special anger of God.

meaning_english: The most important of all.

sample_english: It is the one that God has made the most important stone that is needed in construction.

meaning_english: For something to be the very easiest thing to do.

sample_english: Lying comes very easy in a denial.

meaning_english: The most painful of all.

sample_english: It is very painful when punctured by the fins of a catfish.

meaning_english: The strictest.

meaning_english: The most lacking of all.

The strongest one.

sample_english: And so the one that is the strongest of the fighting is the winner.

meaning_english: The most pitiful of all.

sample_english: And so if everything that we who are in Christ hope for/expect it reaches only to our life here on the earth, there is now no one else that is the most pitiable other than us because of our having been deceived.

meaning_english: The most dreadful of all.

sample_english: Evil; Satan's power.

meaning_english: The softest part of something.

meaning_english: The most respected.
The most sacred of all.

sample_english: What you are to do is pray from the moving/stimulation of the Spirit of God of you; each one of you is to also build your life on the most sacred foundation, this is the truth that we are believing; and like that as well, confidently wait for that which our Lord Jesus Christ will give to us in the end out of his mercy which will end in eternal life with God.

meaning_english: earliest.
sample_bolinao: Sangkasakbayanya nga'min nin diligado a rimmate'!

meaning_english: The sweetest.

meaning_english: The most holy of all.

meaning_english: The language or words which one commonly speaks.

sample_english: The word for branch in Bolinao is also the same as the word for branch in Tagalog.

meaning_english: To speak about something with either good or bad words.
sample_bolinao: No magdwadwa kamo no ani rabay nan saritaen nin sayay sarita', kumikit kamo sa diksyunaryo.
sample_english: If you doubt the meaning of any word you want to say, look for it in the dictionary.

meaning_english: A sizzling sound such as is made when frying food.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a saritsit no mangluto' akon baboy.
sample_english: There is a lot of sizzling when I fry pork.

meaning_english: Threatening gestures or uncontrolled outbursts indicating unwillingness, frustration, aggression and refusal such as stomping the feet, violence and screaming.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a sarked nan anak ko no ibaki' koya.
sample_english: My child puts up a lot of tantrums when I send him on an errand.

meaning_english: To attack or threaten someone with violent actions.
sample_bolinao: Sinarkedan naya ni Dino a kagura' na sin na'kit naya sa teben bali ra.
sample_english: Dino violently threatened his hated opponent when he saw him under his house.

meaning_english: A pair of glasses or goggles to improve or protect the eyesight.
sample_bolinao: No maimpis yay sarming, madali' yan maspak.
sample_english: If the glass is thin it breaks easily.

meaning_english: To put on glasses or put glass in a window.
sample_bolinao: Mibakas kamo angko nin anak mo no sarmingan ma.
sample_english: I think you're a look alike of your son when you put on your glasses.

meaning_english: For a plant or animal to be easily damaged by sickness or other things.
sample_bolinao: Sabtay saro' nan anak ko ta main masakit na.
sample_english: My child cries easily since he is sick.

meaning_english: Anything that is used to scoop up liquid or things in mass.
sample_bolinao: Madali' a mamungton nin buyangin no pala a usaren nin sarok.
sample_english: Piling up sand is easy when a shovel is used for the scoop.

meaning_english: Shoe leather, patented leather shoes.
meaning_filipino: Sapatos na sarol; balat na sapatos.
sample_bolinao: Mabistan kikiten a sapatos asarol.
sample_english: Patent leathershoes are very nice to look at.

meaning_english: A plague or an epidemic, a very dangerous disease that spreads rapidly and often causes death.
sample_bolinao: Kasaynansarotsawanin ta abaw anay klasi nin tambar.
sample_english: There is no plague now because there are now lots of medicines.

meaning_english: The sewn edge of a garment such as a shirt or dress, hem or cuff.
sample_bolinao: Si saroy nan seket mo, nasida' yayna.
sample_english: The edge of your garment is frayed.

meaning_english: For something to be thin and pointed in shape.
sample_bolinao: Unon sarpit nan siti si ginwa' kon putan lwag.
sample_english: This ladle handle that I made is very pointed.

meaning_english: Sauce or gravy for roasted pork made of a mixture of sugar, vinegar, black pepper and flour.
sample_bolinao: Mataway a sarsa no kusto yay rikado na.
sample_english: The gravy is taste if it is seasoned the correctly.

meaning_english: A soft drink made from the vine sarsaparilla.
sample_bolinao: Mapriskwan a kaingaran no makainom ninsarsaparila.
sample_english: One feels fresh and satisfied when he drinkssarsaparilla.

meaning_english: To put a grave or sauce on something.
sample_bolinao: Mataway a piniriton kuna' no sarsawan ya.
sample_english: Fried fish is delicious when you put sauce on it.

meaning_english: To scoop up small items that flow such as grain or water.
sample_bolinao: Sarukenmoy irik ta ikarga mo sa sako'.
sample_english: Scoopup the rice grain so as to put it in the sack.

meaning_english: The hairlike growth on a crustacean.
sample_bolinao: Say kuna' nin main sarumasim ket mataway ya.
sample_english: A fish that has hairs on it is tasty.

meaning_english: Barnacles, the young or spats of oysters and other sea shells that latch onto a ship or boat.
meaning_filipino: Kabibe na kumapit sa mga sasakyang dagat.
sample_bolinao: Sarumasiman yaynay kasko nan baluto mi.
sample_english: The keel of our boat has barnacles.

meaning_english: Loud laughing.
sample_bolinao: Abaw a sarungakngak na no mangwa' yan kalukwan.
sample_english: He does a lot of loud laughing when he is able to fool someone.

meaning_english: The act of ramming the lower part of something with the legs or feet.
sample_bolinao: Bana' sa sarupang na sa maserey nin bato, nasugat yay bisit na.
sample_english: Because of his ramming it against a sharp stone, his lower leg was wounded.

meaning_english: A sash or strip of cloth across the body from shoulder to waist to show honor.
sample_bolinao: Mainsasnan anro tan agaba'.
sample_english: She has a long widesash.

meaning_english: To repeatedly hurt.
sample_bolinao: Main taw say pinadi-pading'eyan tan sinasa-sasakit kamo sa adapan nin tutawo, tan main taw anamaet say nikidamay kamo konran saray ginwa-ginwaan nin wanin.
sample_english: There was at that time repeated shaming and repeated harming of you in front of people, and there was at that time as well your helping in sympathy those that like that was repeatedly being done to.

meaning_english: Hook, that which a hanging item is attached to.
sample_bolinao: Nabari' yay sasa'bitan kon bag sa ka'bwan laman na.
sample_english: The hook for hanging my bag on broke because of the abundance of its contents.

meaning_english: To batter or beat someone repeatedly so as to inflict pain.
sample_bolinao: Andi' masasakitena anak mo!
sample_english: Don'tbatteryour child!

meaning_english: Commodities or things that are made to be bought.
sample_bolinao: Abaho nga'min a prisyo nin sasaliwen.
sample_english: All prices of commodities have gone down.

meaning_english: The place where evaporation is taking place.
Dishes to be washed.
sample_bolinao: Abaw et asasapaten.
sample_english: There are still a lot ofdishes to be washed.

meaning_english: A sieve, or filter or strainer.
Priest, clergyman.
sample_bolinao: Saraysasirduti,saray magsirbi nin maipa'ka' sa Dios.
sample_english: Thepriestsand clergymen are serving the concerns of God.

meaning_english: A whiplike force of something because of speed causing a disturbance.
sample_bolinao: Say sasnet ran ruran no yabi, makapugad konran mampa'lek.
sample_english: The forceful speed of the vehicles at night, can jar awake those who are sleeping.

meaning_english: For a fast moving object such as a whip to have a swishing, piercing sound.
sample_bolinao: Saspit yayti si ruran ko no ilumba' koya.
sample_english: If I put this car of mine in a race it is fast.

meaning_english: Tailor.
sample_bolinao: Sa babali tamo main nin sastri.
sample_english: In our town there is a tailor.

meaning_english: Swiftness of something, especially associated with flying and usually with an associated sound.
sample_bolinao: Unon sasweng nan iruplano nin naruranan mi.
sample_english: The airplane we rode in was the swiftest of all.

meaning_english: A huge burst of flame that may be accompanied by a sound almost like an explosion.
sample_bolinao: Nasinit yan sasyab nan apoy ta bigra' yan kimmadani.
sample_english: The burst of flame singed him since it suddenly came at him.

meaning_english: To be devil like.
sample_bolinao: SiSatanastukswen nayay tawo pigaw gumawa' yan duka'.
sample_english: Satantempts a person to do evil things.

meaning_english: Satin, an expensive cloth.
sample_bolinao: Kasabyan nin seket nin rinasatina abel ta sabtan sileng tan mabli ti nin seket.
sample_english: Normally all attires of the queens is made ofsatin clothbecause this is durable and expensive.

meaning_english: Cheat many people.
sample_bolinao: Uunuren, wanti e: Say kapiknga' nin kayamanan ko ket ibi ko konran pubri, tan isubli' koynamaet nin mi'pat nin ka'baw konran sinaur-saor ko a sinaor ko konra.
sample_english: Lord , it's like this: One half of my riches I will give to the poor and I will also return four times as much to those that I have cheated of that which I have cheated them of.

meaning_english: Deceive or cheat, take advantage of someone in a situation where it is not easily known.
sample_bolinao: Duka' a manaor nin kapadan tawo.
sample_english: It is evil to cheat your fellow man.

meaning_english: The feeling of being overfull or fed-up with an experience so that it becomes boring or one loses his desire for it.
sample_bolinao: Kasan sawa' nan padamag kongko.
sample_english: My suitor doesn't lose his desire for me.

meaning_english: To weary doing something.
sample_bolinao: Sayay awro, niyakay nasaraynaet ni Jesus a tumutumbok na yupa' sa sayay pangingiyarig a matkap nin pirmi saran dumasal konan Dios tan andi' ra nin sawaan ti nin gaw'en.
sample_english: One day, Jesus again taught his followers by means of a parable that they need to always pray to God and to not grow tired doing this.

meaning_english: Woven flattened bamboo strips, used for walling, etc.
sample_bolinao: Say sawali' sawanin, mabistay nipangwa' ra.
sample_english: It is good workmanship on the woven bamboo these days.

meaning_english: A highlight marker to draw attention to a fact such as a new situation or consequence or summary.
sample_bolinao: Magulo anay mundosawanina panaon.
sample_english: The world is in chaos during these current times.

meaning_english: The act of partially or wholly dipping something such as food, fabric or metal into a liquid, powder or other substance.
sample_bolinao: Kurang a sawit nan litson sa sarsa kanya' nin kasan taway na.
sample_english: The piece of roasted pig was not immersed long enough in the gravy and so it is tasteless.

meaning_english: Fish, meat, shrimp, crab, vegetables, etc. included in the dish to be cooked.
sample_bolinao: Mataway a pansit no kiri' nin kurita' a sawog.
sample_english: Pansit tastes good when dried octopus is an ingredient.

meaning_english: The action of dipping something, especially food, into a liquid or thick sauce.
sample_bolinao: Sawsaw tamo' buga' a pangika' nin kuna' sa suka'.
sample_english: Dip the fish putting it just a little into the vinegar.

meaning_english: The sauce in which something is dipped.
Add or mix something as an ingredient in a dish.
sample_bolinao: Andi' nin sawugan nin maalsem a parya' ta lalon kumait.
sample_english: Don't mix something that tastes sour with bittermelon for it will taste more bitter.

meaning_english: Marks a group of things or events as a whole or in mass.
sample_bolinao: Saybyay, saya ya nin bara'mon alupaop.
sample_english: Life is a thing that is like a fog.

meaning_english: Specific but unspecified, a certain one.
sample_bolinao: Sayatamo' a anak ra.
sample_english: They have only one child.

meaning_english: To be done one by one or individually.
sample_bolinao: Si mangipa'ka' a saya-saya ya, manluku-lukwen na tamo' a lalaman na ta say katutu'wan ket kasa nin mairangas na.
sample_english: The one who considers himself to be somebody, is only fooling himself for the truth is there's nothing for him to boast about.

meaning_english: The act of cuddling and warmth of an embrace or hug.
sample_bolinao: Kurang a sayakob mo kanya' ako maray'ep.
sample_english: Your cuddling is lacking and so I am cold.

meaning_english: A covering or embrace placed for protection and warmth.
sample_bolinao: Kurang a sayakop mo kanya' ako maray'ep.
sample_english: Your covering was lacking and so I am cold.

meaning_english: To welcome something or someone with open arms, to embrace.
The fragrance of a strong and good aroma.
sample_bolinao: Si sayamusom nan siti si luto' ko ket maangot ya anggan rikor.
sample_english: The aroma of this recipe I'm making  is wafting even outside.

meaning_english: To be one and only one item.
sample_bolinao: Sayan-saya tamo' a beyek a kai nalako'.
sample_english: There was just only one piglet that did not get sold.

meaning_english: An expression of regret over the loss or waste of something, what a pity, what a waste, that's too bad.
sample_bolinao: Sayang! Na'met kway tikit ko sa swipstik kanya' nin kai koya makalap a tinalo kon sayay milyon.
sample_english: Too bad! I lost my sweepstakes ticket so I cannot claim the one million that I won.

meaning_english: Waste.
sample_bolinao: Kai ko rabaymanayangudas.
sample_english: I do not like towastetime.

meaning_english: Anything used in skimming off the top of something.
sample_bolinao: Mangusar kami nin sayap no manakep kami nin madidintek nin tiblon.
sample_english: We use a skimmer when we gather small milkfish.

meaning_english: To skim off the top portion.
sample_bolinao: Sinayapna a taba' sa supas.
sample_english: Sheskimmedthe fat from the soup.

meaning_english: Braid of hair.
sample_bolinao: Si sayapir nan siti si sabot ko mabista ya.
sample_english: This hair braid of mine is nice.

meaning_english: To braid something that is long such as hair.
sample_bolinao: Mabistan kikiten a sabot nan sayay babayi nosinayapirnaya.
sample_english: It's nice to look at a woman who has abraidedher hair.

meaning_english: To flirt in a seductive way.
To be sensitive to a bad odor or dirty things.
sample_bolinao: Bana' sa sayna sa bali, pirmi yan mangringgas.
sample_english: Because of sensitiveness to the house she is always cleaning.

meaning_english: Sweat or perspiration for cooling the body.
sample_bolinao: Say saynget mo, kai tumgen no mapagal ka.
sample_english: Your sweat doesn't stop if you are exhausted.

meaning_english: To earn or possess something by means of difficulties and perspiration.
sample_bolinao: Sinayngetan ko a aysing ko sin nibaskitbol ako naon kanya' silyan kwa.
sample_english: I got my clothes all sweaty when I played basketball earlier and so I changed them.

meaning_english: Pus that is coming from an infected area of the skin.
sample_bolinao: Ringgasan yan maong a sugat pigaw kai ya magkamain sayo.
sample_english: A wound is to be cleaned well so that it does not become infected with pus.

meaning_english: Sixty.
sample_bolinao: Nakarisibi ya ninsaysintaa yasot pisos.
sample_english: He has receivedsixtyhundred pesos.

meaning_english: Those in mass far from speaker or current context.
sample_bolinao: Saytawa luta' mi.
sample_english: Thoseare our land properties.

meaning_english: These, viewed in mass close to the current context.
sample_bolinao: Sayti say nakalista a matkap mon saliwen.
sample_english: These that have been listed are what you need to buy.

meaning_english: Small fishing net used at night mounted on poles that form anX, a push net, used for catching fish and shrimp.
sample_bolinao: Itaw sa Lipong no mangalap akon urang iyusar ko ket sayudsod.
sample_english: When I am catching shrimp there in Lipong what is use is a push net.

meaning_english: Chayote, pear-shaped fruit of the vine with a large seed inside. It grows very well in a cool place. Its young tops are nutritious vegetables.
sample_bolinao: Abaw asayutisa Baguio ta maray'ep itaw.
sample_english: We find a wide plantation of achayotein Baguio because the climate there is cool.

meaning_english: That which has taken the place of another and functions in that position.

meaning_english: To replace something in a particular place or position.
The act of insisting on something.

sample_english: No matter what you insist that you will do, they won't let you go out at night.

meaning_english: A ban or restriction on something.

sample_english: Don't block me if I am angry.

meaning_english: The act of quenching a fire with water.

sample_english: The fire instantly became big so they didn't stop repeatedly dumping water on it.

meaning_english: To extinguish or quench a fire with water.
sample_bolinao: Manebsebyan abaw uring sawanin.
sample_english: He is going toquenchhis pile of charcoal today.

meaning_english: The condition of being pressed down.
sample_bolinao: Sedsed a abo sa sako' kanya' subra anay timbang na.
sample_english: The bran in the sack was pressed down and so it was over weight.

meaning_english: To pack down a container by tamping or pressing it down.
sample_bolinao: Anaod, no pa'no kamon mami sa kapada moyon tawo, wanin kamo anamaet nin tubaleen; malaem, sinedsed tan pinno' anggan milapwas.
sample_english: Indeed, the extent of how you give to your fellow man, likewise that is how it will be reciprocate to you; abundantly, pressed down and filled until it overflows.

meaning_english: The rope or tether restraining an animal attached to a stationary object to allow limited movement.
sample_bolinao: Si seer nan siin si manok ko, nawarwar ya kanya' ya nakabulos.
sample_english: The cord restraining that chicken of mine came undone and so it got loose.

meaning_english: A chicken with feathers that curl.
sample_bolinao: Saray manok misegewa sabot ra.
sample_english: Our chicken havecurly feathers.

meaning_english: A set of clothing or a covering over for a particular purpose.
sample_bolinao: Nisulot nayseketprinsipi.
sample_english: He wore theclothesof a prince.

meaning_english: Things that are compacted or squeezed into someplace with many other things.

sample_english: The sink was clogged since there were a lot of food scrapes compacted together into its drain.

meaning_english: To forcefully push or thrust a thing or people hard into a place.
sample_bolinao: Seksekana tawo nin lumuob sa sinyan.
sample_english: The people arejammedinside the movie house.

meaning_english: To get a full measure by compacting something.
sample_bolinao: Maneksek akon talaba sa sayay sako'.
sample_english: I stuffed the oysters into one sack.

meaning_english: Tight fitting, used of an alley, room, shoes, etc.
sample_bolinao: Sabtay selet nan butarga ko, dandani ko nin kai makainawa.
sample_english: My trousers are extremely tight, it is almost that that I am not able to breathe.

meaning_english: Something that is stuffed into a space.

sample_english: He has bread stuffed in his mouth and so he cannot reply.

meaning_english: The act of sucking something.
sample_bolinao: Say seltep na sa maata nin salay ket main tunoy.
sample_english: There was noise with his sucking of the raw eggs.

meaning_english: To suck something up with the mouth.
sample_bolinao: Si Dan ket maneltep yan salay sindo buklas sin daikleng tanay kanen nan sina'pang.
sample_english: Dan sucks out an egg each morning when there is only a little bit of rice to be eaten.

meaning_english: The cells of the body.
An irritation.

sample_english: I was terribly irritated by my neighbors since they were being noisy.

meaning_english: A leak, air escaping from an enclosed pressurized vessel.

sample_english: Life is like avaporthat appears for a short time and then suddenly disappears.

meaning_english: An exit for vapor or smoke from something.

sample_english: They made a exit for the the smoke from the kitchen.

meaning_english: The act of fitting things into tight spaces.

sample_english: It takes a lot of fitting things together so that you can get it full.

meaning_english: To compress or compact something such as the contents of a sack or jar.

sample_english: Compress the contents of your suitcase/trunk so that a lot of things can be put in it.

meaning_english: A person manipulating to place himself into favor with someone by flattering or trying to please them.
sample_bolinao: Sepsep yan minom nin ranom si Ron.
sample_english: Ron is sipping the water to drink it.

meaning_english: To suck or absorb something in.
sample_bolinao: Sepsepenmaycokemo sa istro.
sample_english: Drink your coke with a straw.

meaning_english: Sir, a term of address to a male manager, teacher or employer.

sample_english: My instructor is lazy at making his lesson plans.

meaning_english: Phlegm coming out from the throat.
sample_bolinao: Mabista no mailiwa' a ser'ak pigaw umanda' yay ku'ko'.
sample_english: It is good whenphlegmcomes out so that coughing will stop.

meaning_english: To tie the neck or leg of an animal with a rope and the other end to an immovable object.
sample_bolinao: Ser'enmay baboy ta kanen nay bulong kamuti.
sample_english: Tetherthe pig because it will eat the camote leaves.

meaning_english: To enter and be in attendance in a place such as school or work.

sample_english: His entering into the room was slow and soft since the baby was asleep.

meaning_english: The act of crushing something between the thumbnails.
sample_bolinao: Si seret nan lies ko ket tumnoy ya.
sample_english: The bursting of my nits makes a noise.

meaning_english: The point or tapering end of something.
sample_bolinao: Si serey nan darekdek ko, magwa' yan ipalpal anggan ararem.
sample_english: The point on my fence posts can be driven in deeply.

meaning_english: To sharpen a point on something.
A mole, a skin blemish on the body that is gray or black in color.
sample_bolinao: Si balasang mainseringnan mangisit sa pispis.
sample_english: The lady has a blackmoleon her cheek.

meaning_english: To enter into a state of something such as a business.

sample_english: When they were near at the entrance to the town, they saw people going-to-bury-the-dead.

meaning_english: To enter or go inside something.

sample_english: Always close your door for some people might enter your house.

meaning_english: To crush lice or other small swollen things, such as ticks using the nails of the thumbs to kill them.

sample_english: Burst this hair lice of mine so that he will be no more.

meaning_english: Sulking, a feeling of being hurt and carrying it on in a moody fashion.

sample_english: The grudge of this friend of mine lasts for an extremely long time.

meaning_english: The trait of working hard to accomplish something.

sample_english: I have noticed your hard work.

meaning_english: To diligent about something.

sample_english: Most certainly, they are to be more diligent in their service because those who are benefited by their services are their brothers in the faith and they are dear to God.

meaning_english: The attitude of finding fault with something.

sample_english: All of the blame is on me because I was the one that was with him when he fell.

meaning_english: To incriminate or lay blame on someone.

sample_english: Do notincriminateothers.

meaning_english: To dive or swim underwater for a purpose.

sample_english: I submerged my watch in the water in the depths of the shore.

meaning_english: Scepter, a symbol of authority of the the King which is hold by his hands.

sample_english: The queens sceptur has a precious stones.

meaning_english: The month of September.
sample_bolinao: Marapeg et saSetyembre.
sample_english: It is still rainy inSeptember.

meaning_english: The perception or impression that something is true based on observation.

sample_english: I perceive that he is the one stealing the eggs in the nest.

meaning_english: To observe and perceive the reality of something.

sample_english: Could you verify Pedro's character because I will get him as my trusted assistant.

meaning_english: Topicalized you singular.
sample_bolinao: Andi' ka nin mangikapuet nin masiken dyan si'ka, no kai edet, kairgwen mosara nin mabista nin bilang nin ama mo.
sample_english: Do not scold an older male than you, instead talk respectfully to them as though they were your father.

meaning_english: We-not-you. Topicalized form, found clause initial.
sample_bolinao: Si'kamia tumutumbok ni Jesus.
sample_english: Weare the followers of Jesus.

meaning_english: You all fronted or topicalized.

meaning_english: You all privately.

meaning_english: A reference for completed work.

meaning_english: Acrobatics.

meaning_english: A dust broom made from reed grass.

Laziness or indolence.

meaning_english: Puts the focus or emphasis on the full extent of the component it is referring to by limiting any other references.

meaning_english: The act of discarding or throwing away something.

Even if., Even if.
For something to occur right away without further passing of time or hindrance.

sample_english: And then the governors of the world that had relationships with her and have been satiated along with her, they will be extremely sorrowful and they will cry while they look from afar at the smoke of the burning city.

meaning_english: And, linking two or more equal things that occur at the same time and in the same context.

meaning_english: A bound bundle of rice stalks.

meaning_english: Something by which something is known, symbol.

sample_english: Tot's upward swing of the hammer is high because his arm is long.

meaning_english: Engages in idle or foolish talk.

meaning_english: A female that is acting like a male and taking male roles.
